fullDes: Palang is such a sweetheart. She loves her people very much and likes getting loved on. She can be shy at first. She came from Afghanistan so we aren’t sure of her breed. She is partially deaf. She does have a bite history, so will need a home with no children and visitors. She also prefers taller and slender people. Age: 4 Years

Brooke has an unusual past.  She was rescued from Afghanistan as a puppy and made her way to the US to our sanctuary!  She is a sight-hound mix and has all the wonderful attributes that they possess.  If you would like a dog that can run like the wind then she is the dog for you!  An ancient breed, they were the hunting dogs and Brooke certainly thinks she should be queen!This speed and the unusual ability to see far into the distance necessitates a fenced in yard or a place that is fenced where she can stretch those long legs of hers!  She walks well on leash but likes to be able to feel the wind in her fur!We have asked Brooke what she would like in her very own home and she feels she would like an adult home who have dog experience.   She also requests that she be the only animal in the home!   The fenced in yard is a plus, lots of toys to enjoy and destuff, her very own bed, and people who love her sensitive side!To learn more about this absolutely gorgeous gal, call Our Companions Animal Rescue at 242-9999 or e-mail daryl@ourcompanions.org~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~All of the pets promoted by Our Companions Animal Rescue are located in CT.  As such we wish to adopt animals into homes in the greater CT area.  Pets are in various locations so we request that an appointment is made to meet with a specific pet we are advertising. Contact the person listed on the pet’s profile to find out more about our adoption process for a specific pet or e-mail Helpline@ourcompanions.org for general inquiries.

Sparky is a sweet, playful, loving and affectionate, drop-dead gorgeous husky mix.He'sabout 52 pounds and2 years old; we gave him a guesstimated bd of 2/14/2017 (lucky Valentines day boy!).He needs a .... super active family, secure 6' fence and yard with plenty of room to run and play, hopefully someone who works from home and/or can take him to work.Sparky is having a great time with his Colorado foster Mom and her pack, playing in the yard, at dog parks and doggie day care. Did we mention he LOVES water?? Sparky came to us from Alabama and is learning how to socialize with dogs who aren't quite as active as he is. He would benefit from a furever family who is familiar with the unique qualities of husky dogs and has the patience to provide him with some additional training. In return, he will love on you all day and night! Interestedin this special boy? Put in an application at www.eapl.com

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Frampton comes to rescue from Alabama with demodex mange. He is currently 4 months old and approximately 17 pounds. Frampton is up to date on vaccines and has been neutered. Darling Frampton would love a home where he can play and run around like a puppy. He is great with people of all ages and with other dogs. If you would like to adopt Frampton, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Jovi is a pup to LaBelle, a terrier blend who comes to rescue from a shelter in Alabama. He is about 3 months old and 10 pounds. We do not know what he is blended with, but if we were to guess we would say maybe a terrier/lab blend. We DO know he is very cute! Jovi is up to date on vaccines (age appropriate) and will be neutered prior to placement in his forever home. He is great with people of all ages and with other dogs. If you would like to adopt Jovi, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Halen comes to rescue as a pup to LaBelle and is from Alabama. He is about 3 months old and 10 pounds. Halen is a terrier blend, we don't know what he is blended with but appears to possibly be lab. He is up to date on vaccines, will be neutered prior to placement in his forever home, is great with people of all ages and with other dogs. If you would like to adopt sweet Halen, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Roxette is a pup to LaBelle and is a terrier blend female. She comes to rescue from an Alabama shelter. She is currently 3 months old and about 10 pounds. Roxette is up to date on vaccines (age appropriate) and will be spayed prior to placement in her forever home. She is great with people of all ages, and with other dogs. If you would like to adopt Roxette, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

**Please note: Due to strict import and quarantine laws, we are unable to adopt to residents of Massachusetts.**Meet Dez! This sweet pup is joining us from Alabama. He's an owner surrender.Poor Dez hadn'tbeen fixed & was marking in the house, so his family brought him to the shelter. He has since been neutered & is working on indoor manners. With a little patience, he'll be just fine! Dez is about a year old. He's neutered, heartworm negative, on preventative,and on flea/tick preventative. He's a fun loving puppy who loves dogs, adults, and kids! He's untested around cats.If you are interested in Dex,please apply online at yappytails.org/adoption-process/. Our adoption fee is $450.00.

[Meet me in Ellington CT]I am cute, scruffy, and precious.  Well actually all of us are.  We are a litter of 7 that were rescued from Alabama and are now ready to find families we can call ours.  We look to be terrier / heeler mixes but only a DNA test will reveal what we really are.  The PawSafe folks guess that we will be medium sized when all grown up.

**Please note: Due to strict import and quarantine laws, we are unable to adopt to Massachusetts residents.**Please welcome Penelope to the Yappy Tails Family. Penelope joins us from Alabama. She is 12 weeks old and is spayed, UTD on all age-appropriate shots; she is also on heartworm and flea and tick preventative.This sweet girl has had a tough beginning, but despite that, she is as sweet as can be. Penelope & her sisters were dumped in the arms of an animal-loving Good Samaritan in Alabama, who found a rescue in NY that committed to take these puppies.When the girls were brought to the vet, it was discovered that sweet Penelope has a condition called Cerebellar Hypoplasia, which is a congenital disorder with no cure. She is developmentally delayed, however her condition will and has improved as she's gotten older. Despite this, she's the sweetest & happiest little girl. PLEASE NOTE: SHE REQUIRES NO MEDICATION. Penelope simply is developing at her own pace.Upon hearing of her condition, the NY rescue REFUSED to take her!! Can you imagine?! Poor Penelope was left behind and we decided to welcome her to the YTAR family.Please consider making this sweet girl part of your family. To apply, visithttps://yappytails.org/adoption-process. Our adoption fee is $450.00.

**Please note: Due to strict import and quarantine laws, we are unable to adopt to Massachusetts residents.**Friends, meet Gracie!!Gracie is a 1-2 year old Border Collie mix. She joins us from Alabama. She is an absolutely wonderful girl & a delight to be around. She is housebroken, good with dogs, kids, and adults. Gracie weighs about 52 lbs.She is spayed, heartworm negative, and UTD on all shots. She is on flea and tick preventative and heartworm preventative.To make Gracie part of your family, please apply online at yappytails.org/adoption-process/. Our adoption fee is $450.00.

Please go to happylifeanimalrescue.org and fill out a pre adoption form prior to event or appointment. Priority goes to pre approved applications. Henry is a fun guy who just came into foster and got along beautifully with the other dogs. He would make a great addition to your family . Henry is from Alabama.

Ava (24lbs.) is a 14 week old, mixed breed that came into the rescue from rural Alabama. While Ava's ancestry is a mystery, we can tell you that this chunky monkey has an incredibly sweet disposition. She loves to be pet and will almost always curl up in your arms. Ava enjoys tossing around her toys and romping around in the yard. She has been well-socialized with other animals and would likely do well in a home with respectful children.If you are interested in meeting and/or potentially adopting this rescue pet, please complete our online application at www.arrus.org. You will be notified via email of your application status prior to our next upcoming event. If you do not receive a response within this timeframe, please send a follow-up email to arrusadopt@gmail.com. Additional information and/or medical records for this rescue pet are available and will be reviewed in person should we choose to move forward in scheduling a meet n’ greet. In the meantime, please feel free to follow us on follow us on Instagram (animal_rescue_r_us) and visit our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/arrusadopt for more pictures and posts from his/her foster family. HELP US, HELP THEM! Animal Rescue R Us is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. We do not receive county, state or federal funding and rely solely on donations. These donations help offset the cost of routine veterinary care, medical expenses, and other necessities while the rescue animal is in our care. To make a secure donation, please visit www.arrus.org/donate . Alternatively, you may visit our Amazon Wishlist (http://www.amazon.com/registry/wishlist/C36VRV500R85) for a current list of needed supplies! All donations are tax-deductible and all are greatly appreciated. Thank you for your support!

Meet Maggie! Maggie is a 4 year old lab from Alabama. Maggie and her partner in crime Lilly were rescued from the streets down there. No one was out looking for her so our partner rescue took them on. Maggie is a sweet heart. She loves kids. Gets along well with other dogs and has been around cats. Her foster moms does a lot of cat rescue so she encountered  quite a few. Maggie would chase them a little bit but not in an aggressive way. Maggie will be available for adoption come Wednesday June 19th at 10am!

Adoption Fee: $450 Transport Fee: $160 . Our adoption fee includes the spay/neuter, up to date vaccines, microchip, Interstate Health Certificate, and the transport service to get the new family pet to you.  All pets are delivered by a licensed transporter. COMPLETED APPLICATIONS TAKE PRECEDENCE OVER INQUIRIES! If you are interested in adopting, the FIRST step is to complete an application! Please copy and paste the following URL for our adoption application: https://fs29.formsite.com/pickenscountypartnersforpets/form1/index.html Please be advised that our volunteers are busy rescuing, transporting, and caring for our animals. We will respond to your application as soon as possible. Upon review of your application, the rescue in Alabama will contact you, so you can ask any specific questions that you may have.  Note: All dogs are located in foster homes in Alabama and will be transported North after adoption.  If there is more than one decision maker in the home, all of them should be in agreement. We do not adopt to anyone under the age of 21.

These adorable puppies were abandoned in a ladies yard in rural Alabama when they were only one week old.  Luckily, she was a kind-hearted lady who even with small children took on bottle feeding 9 orphan puppies.  They are now ready for their homes and they are fantastic much loved puppies.  We received a call from a rural kill shelter in Alabama in regards to these sweet puppies.  The mom was pregnant and gave birth in the shelter.  They are truly gorgeous little bullies that deserve the best homes ever! COMPLETED APPLICATIONS TAKE PRECEDENCE OVER INQUIRIES! IF you are interested in adopting, the FIRST step is to complete an application! Please email for an Application or copy and paste the following URL: https://fs26.formsite.com/nogreaterlove/form2/index.html Upon receipt of your application, the rescuer and foster in AL will contact you so you can ask any specific questions you may have! If there is more than one decision maker in the home, all of them should be in agreement! Thank you for your understanding and consideration and for helping the dogs and puppies in need! Adoption Donation: Unless otherwise stated in the pet's bio, our standard adoption fee is $495 which covers age appropriate vaccines (DHPP vax) and (Rabies vax if 12 weeks and older), utd on flea/tick prevention and heartworm prevention, worming, heartworm test @ age 6 months or older, microchip, fostering costs and health certificate. Puppy will be adopted on a spay/neuter contract due to size. Within 6 months of adoption up to $100.00 will be refunded when paperwork is sent in showing puppy has been spayed or neutered. We do not adopt to anyone under the age of 21

**Please note: Due to strict import and quarantine laws, we are unable to adopt to residents of Massachusetts.**Friends, meet Mila! Mila is a 1-2 year old lab mix who is joining us from Alabama. Mila is a bit reserved, but open to playing with other dogs and is indifferent towards cats.She wants to cuddle up close, but needs a second to trust someone. Once she does trust, she loves to give kisses!What a precious sweetheart she is. Although Mila lacks some confidence right now, she is starting to open up.She would love to be in a home with another dog as a playmate and would enjoy a fenced in backyard.Mila is learning her indoor manners and is doing well with housetraining. She loves to play with her fellow foster dogs, loves kids and adults. She just needs someone with patience to allow her to open up. She does have some separation anxiety, however she is not destructive, she just prefers to be with her people.She is spayed, heartworm negative, and UTD on all shots. She is on flea and tick preventative and heartworm preventative.If you are interested in Mila,please apply online at yappytails.org/adoption-process/. Our adoption fee is $450.00.

This sweet mom and her puppies came to us from an irresponsible owner in Alabama.  She called us and told us that she had to move because of her job and could not take her dogs with her.  We agreed to help her out and take them.  The next week we saw her trying to get another dog on Facebook.  It appears she just did not want the dogs that she had.  We cannot understand why.  The mom is sweet as she can be and the puppies are adorable!  I'm just glad that now we can find them a place where they can be loved and cherished forever! We received a call from a rural kill shelter in Alabama in regards to these sweet puppies.  The owner had brought in all 5 at one week old and turned them in without the mom.  The shelter director told her that without the mom they would have to euthanize the babies.  They told her they understood and walked away.  Thankfully, the director reached out to us and we immediately took on these little angels.   They come prespoiled.  They opened their eyes looking into our faces so they do not understand that they are dogs.  They are truly gorgeous little ones that deserve the best homes ever! We were contacted by a local resident who adopted two puppies from an Alabama high kill shelter.  It has taken her only a month to decide to not keep either puppy.  Sadly, we hear this all the time down here but at least she reached out to rescue instead of dumping them back at the kill shelter.  Duke loves belly rubs and snuggles and likes to be around his human as much as possible and sits at attention patiently awaiting his treats. He is puppy pad trained.COMPLETED APPLICATIONS TAKE PRECEDENCE OVER INQUIRIES! IF you are interested in adopting, the FIRST step is to complete an application! We do not adopt to anyone under the age of 21

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Nina comes to rescue from Alabama at 1 year old, 18 pounds and pregnant! Nina is a Chihuahua blend with lab. She is up to date on vaccinations and will be spayed after her pups are old enough and prior to placement in her forever home. She is great with people of all ages and with other dogs. Nina is a very sweet girl, loveable and shy. If you would like to adopt Nina once her pups are born and 8 weeks old, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

Addison came to us from a shelter in Alabama with her 3 adorable little puppies! They've all since been adopted but she's still looking for a home to call her own. She lives to please and loves her people, but she'd like to be your own and only four-legged gal. She's an energetic girl that responds quickly to commands and would do best in a somewhat active household. Come by Animal Haven to meet her!

Gabe was thrown out in a parking lot to starve ! He is about 7 months old very sweet and a cuddle bug. He is very smart. Needs work on leash and create trading but he is a quick learner.                     Adoption Fee: $300 Transport Fee: $160 . Trek (35.2lbs.) is a 8 month old, mixed breed that came into the rescue from rural Alabama with a horrific case of Puppy Strangles. Although the condition resolved with aggressive treatment, it left Trek with permanent scars around his eyes and nose. Fortunately, this cosmetic difference hasn't slowed him down one bit! In fact, Trek loves to run and play in the yard. With basic training and leash work, Trek would be a great hiking or running partner. Trek does best with dogs that are comparable to his size and energy level and prefers a home without cats.If you are interested in meeting and/or potentially adopting this rescue pet, please complete our online application at www.arrus.org. You will be notified via email of your application status prior to our next upcoming event. If you do not receive a response within this timeframe, please send a follow-up email to arrusadopt@gmail.com. Additional information and/or medical records for this rescue pet are available and will be reviewed in person should we choose to move forward in scheduling a meet n’ greet. In the meantime, please feel free to follow us on follow us on Instagram (animal_rescue_r_us) and visit our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/arrusadopt for more pictures and posts from his/her foster family. HELP US, HELP THEM! Animal Rescue R Us is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. We do not receive county, state or federal funding and rely solely on donations. These donations help offset the cost of routine veterinary care, medical expenses, and other necessities while the rescue animal is in our care. To make a secure donation, please visit www.arrus.org/donate . Alternatively, you may visit our Amazon Wishlist (http://www.amazon.com/registry/wishlist/C36VRV500R85) for a current list of needed supplies! All donations are tax-deductible and all are greatly appreciated. Thank you for your support!

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Thor came to rescue with two siblings from a shelter in Alabama. He is a Dachshund blend male, 2 years old. Shy at first with new people, Thor will warm up and fit right in! Thor would do best in a quiet home in the suburbs, with a fenced-in yard where he can relax, and without a lot of people in and out: a quiet place where he can just be your cuddle buddy! Thor loves his people, cuddling on the couch with a good movie, belly rubs and can even sit and stand on his hind legs!!! He is good with other dogs with slow intros as he gets to know his new furry siblings. Thor is up to date on vaccines and has been neutered. If you would like to adopt Thor, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Harmony (formerly known as Hannah) is thought to be an Australian Shepard blend who comes to rescue with her siblings from Alabama. Running and playing are her favorite things to do! If you would like to adopt Harmony, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

What a handsome man! Luke here is a three year old large mixed breed who came to Bideawee in late September from Alabama. Luke has that classic mixed-breed look with a soft fur coat, white patches on his chest and nose, and a big old grin on his face! But Luke has a special characteristic that sets him apart from his canine companions  Luke only has three legs! This unique difference doesnt slow him down at all. Hes still active, playful, and enjoys his daily strolls. In fact, being outside is one of his favorite activities. He loves the fresh air, and hell start to really relax after a long walk or an energetic game of fetch. Luke is very sweet with people and enjoys snuggling, and all the better doggy-human pastimes. Luke is pickier about his animal counterparts, though, and so he'd flourish being with an adult-only family, where he can be the only four-legged family member. This handsome devil is 45 pounds and fully grown. If he has struck your fancy, the please come and meet him today!

Arnold is a sweet senior lab mix, who still has a lot of spunk. He enjoys walks, playtime in the yard, giving kisses, and SNUGGLING. We pulled Arnold from a shelter in Alabama with a benign tumor on his leg. He gained some, weight, had the tumor removed, and now Arnold is ready for his forever home. Arnold is an easy going guy that would fit in easily with just about any family; however he is not a fan of cats. If you have another dog, we would recommend a meet and greet and slow introductions.Pleaseapply to adopt this amazing loveable guy and give him the home he deserves.Please note: While some of our dogs have lived in a home environment, we cannot guarantee that they are housetrained.Interested in fostering or adopting? Need more info on this dog? The first step in the process is filling out an application on our website. Ernie is a one year-old Hound mix who came to us from Alabama. He is friendly and ready for anything. If interested,  please text Gizela at 201-655-5059. Adoption fees vary but include: clean bill of health, spay/neuter, vaccinations, heart worm testing, 1 year supply of heart worm preventative and micro-chipping.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Isabella was rescued from and Alabama shelter in obvious medical distress. She is with our veterinary partners now receiving a full work up to determine her medical needs. We dont know much right now other than the obvious, emaciated, neglected, parasitic and some open wounds. She is 2 years old and 26 pounds and will be up to date on shots and spayed prior to placement in a forever home. Please join in our prayers for Isabella, and if you think you might like to adopt her when she becomes available, why not put your application in now and get the process started? If you determine she is not the right fit for you after more information is known, you can always have that discussion with the processor. Thank you! 1/28/18 8:45 AM

Meredith was rescued from a high-kill shelter in Alabama. Being a black dog, she had very little chance of being adopted down south. She was another dog that was in trouble and was in danger of being euthanized the next day. So, of course, I couldn't let that happen. She was fully vetted, spayed, and spent about 2 weeks in a foster home in AL with a shepherd X, who became her good friend. When she came to NY, she went to a friend who fostered her, who has an older hound X and 4 cats. When the foster mom brought her young nieces home for a weekend, Merri, as her foster mom likes to call her, was wonderful with them! There have been no problems with Merri with either the cats, the dog or with anyone new that she meets. Merri is 2 yrs. old, weighs 59 lbs, is fully housebroken, sits, and walks well on leash. She is a special girl, looking for that special home. If you feel that Merri is the dog for you. please call Sindee. 914-299-3700.

If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out our dog adoption questionnaire and e-mail it to lauren.baird.htar@gmail.com.PLEASE VISIT THIS WEBSITE TO FIND THE ADOPTION QUESTIONNAIRE: http://www.homewardtrails.org/adopt-a-pet/adoption-forms/Nugget came to us from Russell County and is currently in a foster home. He is a sweet, playful puppy!Adoption Coordinator: Lauren BairdBreed Estimate: Chihuahua/Retriever MixGender: MaleApproximate weight: 12 poundsApproximate age: 4 months on 6/26 Location: Foster homeCratetrained: working on it! Coat Type: MediumPersonality: Sweet, playful pup!*Please note puppies are in foster homes- not at our adoption center!The adoption fee for this dog is $375. This fee DOES NOT INCLUDE spay/neuter and microchip. If the animal you are adopting is not already spayed/neutered, you will be required to sign a contract legally obligating you to have the animal altered. Please contact your HT rep to learn about exclusive low-cost spay/neuter options made available only to HT adopters!Every adopted Homeward Trails animal comes with 30 days of free pet health insurance. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals.Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter.We also provide a 30-minute phone consult with a professional dog trainer at Fur-Get Me Not within the first 30 days of adopting - just for HT adopters in the Arlington/Alexandria area. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE!You can save animals like this one by becoming a foster! Fosters are like way stations between high kill shelters and forever homes. We need fosters so that we can save dogs before they are euthanized at the shelters. If you are interested in becoming a foster, please check out our information about fostering by visiting http://www.homewardtrails.org/foster-a-pet/dog-and-cat-foster-program/

*Meet Macey.. this baby is so sweet. She loves getting attention. She is full of life, and so ready to be loved. She is very loving, loves to play, and is good with my cat. This is Rusty, a young and lively puppy from an Alabama Shelter. At 4 months he is 16 inches at his shoulders with big ol’ feet and ears to grow into. We don’t know his story but stairs and even being inside a house definitely seemed new to him, so his new life is all about learning and adventure and he relishes every moment of it. Rusty adores affection and makes sure he is in the middle of any cuddle session. He’s been great with his foster family including the 11 and 13 year old kids. And has let all the neighborhood kids come and love on him as well. Rusty shares his foster home with an adult dog from the same Alabama shelter and loves to play with him and learn from him. He is doing great on a leash, doesn’t have accidents in his crate, and is doing fantastic with house training. Rusty is a super cool dog and is going to bring so many laughs and kisses and snuggles to his new family - not to mention he’s quite the handsome boy.Accuracy is not guaranteed; however, information provided is accurate to the best of our knowledge.For more information on the pet, please send an email to info@aforeverhome.org

Peaches is a sweet, calm lab mix. She came all the way from Alabama, where she had a broken leg in a crowded shelter, but she is now happy and healthy in her Virginia foster home. Peaches found her dog bed right away and is happy to lie in it surrounded by all her toys. However, she LOVES being pet by humans, will follow you around and gladly roll over for a belly rub. Peaches is smart and picked up the sit command really quickly (for a delicious treat of course!). She is also doing great on potty training. Peaches loves and wants to say hit to every dog or person she sees. If you have room in your heart and home for a puppy that's going to grow into a big ol' pile of love, than Peaches may be your gal Accuracy is not guaranteed; however, information provided is accurate to the best of our knowledge.For more information on the pet, please send an email to info@aforeverhome.org

Little Paisley came to us from a shelter in Alabama along with her mother Buffy. Paisley is currently about 10 weeks old and about 5 pounds. We expect her to grow to be about the same size as her mom which is about 13 pounds. Her mom looks like a Brussels mix and Paisley looks like she is getting a little bit of a wirey coat too but we also feel that she probably has some Chihuahua and probably some other small breeds in her. Paisley was just spayedand has two sets of vaccines in her now and she is microchipped and is now ready for her forever home. Paisley's adoption fee is $400.00. If you are interested in adopting Paisley, please visit our websitewww.LHARinc.orggo to Adopt and complete the dog adoption application.

COME MEET ADOPTABLE DOGS EVERY SATURDAY AND SUNDAY from 10AM - 4PM at the Homeward Trails Adoption Center- 11116 Fairfax Station Road, Fairfax Station VA 22039! **Note that puppies are in foster homes, not at the Adoption Center.In an effort to save more lives, HT is allowing expedited adoptions for certain animals if applicants bring required paperwork. You can bring your new family member home more quickly by bringing your current pets' vet records, a copy of your lease or landlord letter stating you are permitted to have pets, and photos of your home. This fee INCLUDES spay/neuter and microchip. If the animal you are adopting is not already spayed/neutered, you will be required to sign a contract legally obligating you to have the animal altered. Please contact your HT rep to learn about exclusive low-cost spay/neuter options made available only to HT adopters!Every adopted Homeward Trails animal comes with 30 days of free pet health insurance. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals.Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter.We also provide a 30-minute phone consult with a professional dog trainer at Fur-Get Me Not within the first 30 days of adopting - just for HT adopters in the Arlington/Alexandria area. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE!You can save animals like this one by becoming a foster! Fosters are like way stations between high kill shelters and forever homes. We need fosters so that we can save dogs before they are euthanized at the shelters. If you are interested in becoming a foster, please check out our information about fostering by visiting http://www.homewardtrails.org/foster-a-pet/dog-and-cat-foster-program/

Meet Nellie #2! (Or as her foster calls her just Nellie :) ) Nellie is 2 to 3 years old and weighs approximately 60 pounds. She is a gorgeous yellow girl who hails from Alabama! Nellie is good with other dogs and super friendly with people. She's a happy, friendly active girl! More to come as we get to know her!Disclaimer: Please know this is a recently rescued dog that is still transitioning into a new home environment. Training, and even personality and energy levels are constantly evolving as the dog starts to feel better emotionally and physically. Your new dog will take days or even weeks to fully settle into his or her true self. What you read in this bio is a snapshot of this dog’s evolving personality. Additionally, the age listed is an estimate provided by the shelter and/or veterinarian. Different vets can provide different age estimates. So always consider the lab you are adopting to be within an age range of a couple of years of what is listed. Also remember, while we are a lab rescue, we do not have papers on these dogs, we cannot confirm any breed specific claims, and many of these dogs may be mixed with other breeds.IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN ADOPTING ONE OF OUR DOGS... please visit us at www.luslabs.org and fill out an adoption application.  Once submitted, one of our Adoption Coordinators will be in touch!

*Tarzen/16wks/14 lbsThis precious boy came into rescue with horrible mange, he barely had any fur and underdeveloped ligaments in both front legs. Rescue had to rig up braces for him to even walk and play. He's completely better now, hasn't had any leg issues in weeks and fur is wonder. He is very calm, not a barker. He loves to cuddle! Open your heart up to this special guy. He was created for you! He is fully vetted and ready for his home. If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out our dog adoption questionnaire and e-mail it to lauren.baird.htar@gmail.com.PLEASE VISIT THIS WEBSITE TO FIND THE ADOPTION QUESTIONNAIRE: http://www.homewardtrails.org/adopt-a-pet/adoption-forms/Lana came to us from Russell County and is a sweet puppy! At this time she  is medium energy and very smart!  You only have to teach her once, whether she applies what you teach her ) is another story (stubborn boxer personality).  She’s almost house and crate trained, we’re making lots of progress with both.  When she initially goes in the crate, she whines for a short period and then goes to sleep.  She sleeps through the night in the crate with no accidents.  She walks nicely on the leash and sits when you stop.  Loves attention, kisses, to cuddle and toys!   We’re working on the crate training to make it a positive experience. She is a sweetheart and the pictures do not do her justice! Butterscotch came to us from a shelter in Alabama because her time was up. She is a very sweet girl and she loves to cuddle. She was microchipped and they did actually contact the owners and they did not come for her even after several weeks. Butterscotch gets along very well with other dogs and is housebroken. She did test positive for heartworm and is getting her treatment on June 13, 2019. Please speak with your veterinarian about adopting a previously heartworm positive dog. She is getting two injections of Diroban 24 hours apart and that is the treatment protocol that our veterinarian follows. Butterscotch does seem to be a pointer or bird dog mix about 5-7 years old and about 60 pounds. She is super laid back and just loves to cuddle. Her adoption fee is $300.00. If you are interested in adopting Butterscotch, please visit our website www.LHARinc.org go to Adopt and complete the dog adoption application.

Buffy came to us from a shelter in Alabama with just one puppy. She is a very friendly and social little girl and she gets along great with other dogs. Buffy is working on housebreaking in her foster home and will probably need to continue that training with an adopter. She is currently in a foster that has a fenced in yard, so that maybe best for her. It maybe more a challenge to potty train her if you do not have a fenced yard. She looks to be a Brussells mix and she is 13 pounds and we think about 2 years old. Buffy will available for a new home once she has been spayed. She is up to date with vaccines, microchipped and heartworm negative. Her adoption fee is $300.00. If you are interested in adopting Buffy, please visit our website www.LHARinc.org go to Adopt and complete the dog adoption application.

Hansel is an 8-year-old Chihuahua mix who came to us from a hoarding situation in which one person had over 50 Chihuahuas.  You can imagine how little attention any one of them received.  Each had to compete for it.  So, when we brought Hansel into our rescue, it took him a while to realize that all the attention we were giving him was actually for him!  Hansel also came to us with a cherry eye, a minor problem that our vet corrected.  He weighs only 13 pounds and would probably do best in a quieter home without small children.  He’s a love of boy who deserves a fine home. A quiet natured little girl, one-year-old Arya is an 11 pound mix of Chihuahua and Dachshund, also known as a Chiweenie.  Her short black and tan coat glistens in the sunlight as her round eyes scan the yard looking for you.  She loves people and, more than anything in the world, she wants to be in your lap.  If she can’t find you, though, she will settle for playing with the other dogs.  Arya is a good, good girl.  Why not find out for yourself? Bailey’s foster accidently took him in because, although he was the neighbor’s dog, Bailey decided he preferred him over his original owners.  He kept getting away from them and coming to the foster’s house.  The neighbors said he could stay.  And the foster would happily keep him; he’s a good dog.  However, this one-year-old German Shepherd mix goes after cats and doesn’t really like the foster’s other dog.  Never having been aggressive towards people, he likes people in general as he has had successful visits to the vet and other places.  We don’t know for sure about children.  He is an intelligent fella who needs some training; his foster feels that he hasn’t been trained prior to living with him.  He needs to be reminded not to jump on people when he happily greets them; he forgets that he weighs 50 pounds.  Bailey might do best in a home with not other pets, and a fenced backyard would be great! According to her foster, Pancake is a sweetheart.  She’s a one-year old Jack Russell mix weighing only 12 pounds.  Her short coat is brown and white and soft to the touch. We call her a Special Needs dog because she has a heart murmur, but it’s a grade 1 which is the least serious of them all.  (The scale is 1 to 6.)  She isn’t on any meds for this because she’s doing so well.  Although the murmur hasn’t slowed her down a bit, we’d like to see her go to a calm house.  Since she weighs only 12 pounds, we would prefer no small children.  We pulled her from the high kill shelter when she was very pregnant and proved to be a wonderful Mama!  She loves people, does very well with other dogs, and is an all-around dynamite dog!  You’ll see! If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out our dog adoption questionnaire and e-mail it to lauren.baird.htar@gmail.com.PLEASE VISIT THIS WEBSITE TO FIND THE ADOPTION QUESTIONNAIRE: http://www.homewardtrails.org/adopt-a-pet/adoption-forms/Bugsy is coming to us from Russell County. She is a sweet girl and is good with smaller dogs and cats! She loves to play fetch and snuggle on the cough. Fill out an adoption questionnaire to meet her!Adoption Coordinator: Lauren BairdBreed Estimate: St. Bernard MixGender: FemaleApproximate weight: 50 pounds @ 5 monthsApproximate age: 5 months on 6/14Location: Foster HomeCratetrained: YesCoat Type: medium*Please note puppies are in foster homes- not at our adoption center!The adoption fee for this dog is $375. This fee DOES NOT INCLUDE spay/neuter and microchip. If the animal you are adopting is not already spayed/neutered, you will be required to sign a contract legally obligating you to have the animal altered. Please contact your HT rep to learn about exclusive low-cost spay/neuter options made available only to HT adopters!Every adopted Homeward Trails animal comes with 30 days of free pet health insurance. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals.Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter.We also provide a 30-minute phone consult with a professional dog trainer at Fur-Get Me Not within the first 30 days of adopting - just for HT adopters in the Arlington/Alexandria area. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE!You can save animals like this one by becoming a foster! Fosters are like way stations between high kill shelters and forever homes. We need fosters so that we can save dogs before they are euthanized at the shelters. If you are interested in becoming a foster, please check out our information about fostering by visiting http://www.homewardtrails.org/foster-a-pet/dog-and-cat-foster-program/

Goldie came to us from a shelter in Alabama with 7 puppies. Her puppies are now weaned and she is looking for her forever home. Goldie appears to have mostly Husky, maybe Catahoula, and some kind of Retriever in her. She is about 50 pounds and about 2 years. She is a very friendly and social girl. Goldie is housebroken and gets along well with other dogs. She does also seem to do well with children. Goldie is scheduled to be spayed on May 10, 2019 and will then be ready for her forever home. She is up to date with vaccines, microchipped and heartworm negative. Her adoption fee is $300.00. If you are interested in adopting Goldie, please visit our website www.LHARinc.org go to Adopt and complete the dog adoption application.

Romeo is a handsome, 2-year-old Lab mix with a wonderful personality which is especially nice since he weighs in at 60 pounds, the very top of medium in dog size.  He loves to have fun with other dogs and is more than happy to spend time play with people, too!  Nothing makes him happier than having a toy to play with or to simply carry around in his mouth.  He’s also quite a good looking fellow with his short, black coat which is complemented by clean white.  Romeo’s foster says that he is a happy dog!  (especially when he’s surrounded by toys!). Sophie came to us from a shelter in Alabama. She is a very sweet and social little girl. Sophie loves to cuddle and wiggles her whole body when she see you. Sophie is being treated for a urinary tract infection and crystals in her urine. She isalso heartworm positive and is beingtreated for that as well as getting spayed on February 19, 2019. Please talk to your veterinarian about adopting a dog that was treated for heartworm as we do find that every veterinarian has a different opinion about heartworm.Sophie gets along well with other dogs and does well with the children in her previousfoster home. She is still working on housebreaking and that maybe a work in progress as it looks like she had an untreated urinary tract infection for quite a long time. We are estimating her to be about 5 years old and she weighs about 13 pounds. She looks like Norwich Terrier maybe mixed with Yorkie. Sophie does need to stay on a prescription diet for her urinary healthand is doing well on her diet and medications. Her adoption fee is $200.00. If you are interested in adopting Sophie, please visit our website www.LHARinc.org go to Adopt and complete the dog adoption application.

Margo came to us from a shelter in Alabama with two other siblings. They were found abandoned without a mom. They had a very rough start in the shelter and did even survive parvo despite being very underweight and full of worms. It took a couple of months for them to get healthy, but all are doing great now and ready for forever home. They all seem to be total mix breed dogs. Margo looks like she has maybe some pit, and either heeler or border collie in her. We estimate their date of birth to be around 1/1/2019. Margo is about 25 pounds at about 3 months old. She is very friendly and does well with her brother and sister. Margo is now spayed, microchipped and all up to date with vaccines. Her adoption fee is $350.00. If you are interested in adopting Margo, please visit our website www.LHARinc.org go to Adopt and complete the dog adoption application.

Meet Piper. She is about 1-2 years old and about 35 pounds. She came to us from a shelter in Alabama with her mom, Teddie. Piper was a little scared at first, but she is doing great in her foster home. She will do best with an active family and loves to go running with her foster mom. Piper will do best in a home with at least one other friendly dog for her to play with and a fenced in yard. Piper is doing very well with housebreaking too. Piper is now spayed, up to date with vaccines, microchipped and heartworm negative. Her adoption fee is $300.00. If you are interested in adopting Piper, please visit our website www.LHARinc.org go to Adopt and complete the dog adoption application.

This pretty, pretty girl is named Daisy, a nice, old fashioned name!  She’s a mix of Plott Hound and Lab, and, at 3 years old she weighs 62 pounds.  Her foster describes Daisy as “one of the most gentle, loving dogs she’s ever known.”  Daisy has a great temperament, getting along well with people and other dogs.  She’s also quite lovely on the outside.  Her short, sleek, brindle brown and black coat is quite fetching and her eyes are gentle reflecting her overall as a fine girl. Chloe has adjusted well in a home with an active, but submissive dog and loves to play! She's quite the boss babe! She has also done well with social cats but definitely wants to play, play, play! Lydia came to us from a shelter in Alabama in with a litter of puppies. Lydia is a super sweet girl that loves attention. She is about 45 pounds and is probably about 2 years old. Lydia did come in very underweight and full of parasites as well as nursing puppies. About a week after her arrival, she prolapsed her rectum and had to have surgery a total of three times over a month. The finally surgery was a special surgery to remove part of her rectum. While she may still have some trouble with it popping out in the future, it will go right back in on it's own. We are looking for a special home for this sweet girl. She gets along very well with other dogs, but she does need a home without cats. She does need to stay on a GI diet and has done well with rectum since being on that diet. She is scheduled to be spayed on May 28, 2019 and will also have another procedure to help insure that she does not prolapse anymore. Lydia's adoption fee is $200.00.She is up to date with vaccines, microchipped and is heartworm negative. If you are intersested in adopting Lydia or doing foster to adopt, please visit our website www.LHARInc.org go to Adopt and complete the dog adoption application.

Ginger came to us from a shelter in Alabama with her brother and sister . All of the puppies look different. We are guessing that Ginger has some lab and hound in her. Ginger is doing great with housebreaking and walks well on a leash. She is in a foster home with cats and does very well with them.She is a very friendly and social little girl. She is currently about 32 pounds. We estimate her date of birth to be around 12/24/18. She is now spayed, up to date with vaccinesand microchipped. Her adoption fee is $350.00. If you are interested in adopting Ginger, please visit our website www.LHARinc.org go to Adopt and complete the dog adoption application.

Update on Beau. After consulting with a trainer, it does appear that Beau is mostly if not all Anatolian Shepherd. He is going to need a home that has experience with livestock guarding breeds and room for him to run. He does get along well with other dogs and cats too. He will not do well with small children as he does not like when small children are loud and jumpy. He can also be protective of his home when his family is not home. He does get very attached to his family and will do best in a home without a lot of traffic and is willing to put him away when they have visitors. While he is very friendly with everyone outside the home, he is an Anatolian and bred to guard his home. Knowledge of this breed is best for this boy. Beau is pretty much a big teddy bear with his family and is very well behaved in the house. His lumps are just fatty lipomas according to the cytology and our vet says they do not need any further treatment.Beau came to us from a shelter in Alabama. He was found as a stray and no one came to claim him. He is a very big and sweet boy. He is 103 pounds and appears to be a lab, hound with maybe something else in him too. Beau has definitely lived in a home before. He is housebroken and even gets along very well with cats. He really does seem to like being with cats and he does also seem to get along very well with other dogs. We think he is about 5-7 years old and he is very much a gentle giant. He does have some weird lumps that we have the vet checking out and all his bloodwork has come back normal. So we think this maybe normal for him. He is neutered, up to date with vaccines, microchipped and heartworm and Lyme negtive. His adoption fee is $200.00. If you are interested in adopting Beau, please visit our website www.LHARinc.org go to Adopt and complete the dog adoption application.

I would like to introduce you to Polar, a 3-year-old mix of Chihuahua and Dachshund, called by some a Chiweenie.   He weighs just under 10 pounds, and his medium coat is a beautiful white/blond color.  This boy needs some extra TLC in the form of patience and understanding.  He is extremely loving and gentle, but he is very uncertain of anyone until he gets to know them.  And once that trust occurs, this sweetheart of a boy will be glued to your side.  Polar needs a home with no small children.  He would do better in a calm home with not a lot of activity.  Perhaps a home with an older person would be best of all for him.  He’s so sweet! Bella came to us from an Alabama shelter very pregnant. She was originally from a hoarding household before she came to the shelter. Bella is at least a couple of years old and weighs about 60 pounds. She had her puppies and they have been adopted so now we need to find her a forever home. We think that Bella will do best in a home with another friendly, social dog her size and a securely fenced in yard. Bella did also test positive for heartworm, so she has been treated for her heartworm and now spayed. Please check with your vet about adopting a dog that was previously heartworm positive. Bella is still scared and insecure, but she does not have a mean bone in her body. She is very low energy and still needs to learn how to be a dog. She is a very sweet girl, but does seem to have had some abuse in the past, so a calm quiet home would be best for her. If you would like to give Bella a forever home, please visit our website www.LHARinc.org go to Adopt and complete the dog adoption application. Her adoption fee is $200.00.

CHARLIE:Hey y’all, I’m Charlie. I’m a good ol’ boy from Alabama. I never got the biscuits and gravy since I have lived my entire life in a kennel for no fault of my own. When I lived in Alabama, I was in a rural shelter and not much traffic goes through those doors. I’m a ~6-year lab mix of pure and innocent love. I’m a gentleman at heart. I have treated my lady canine friends very sweet. I have a ton of volunteer friends too, and they all love me because I’m such a nice all-around, good-looking guy. Many refer to me as “Cheerful Charlie.” I am an even-tempered, patient guy too.  I patiently sit while waiting my turn for one-on-one time with the volunteers. I am the most patient one in the kennel, but I do get so excited when someone talks to me, my face lights up with excitement. I may not have to worry about tracking my stock market performance, but I do worry most about when my family will take me home . . .  forever. I am looking for a loveable home who believes in commitment and wants a soulmate for life to include in their daily life, whether it be fun adventures or cuddling on the coach. I do best with my female canine friends, and I request NO cats in my home please. I have a big personality for a mid-sized boy, but an even bigger heart. Please don't forget to watch my video!Can you change my fate of living all my life alone in a kennel?! Email lamancharescue@comcast.net.- 6 years old- Lab mix- Female Dog friendlyNeutered, UTD vaccinations, wormed.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.All of the animals posted on our site have been temperament tested. While not all are in the immediate area, once we have processed and approved your application, we will move the dog to our adoptive area for you to meet, greet and hopefully adopt. Sometimes we will have more than one application on a dog. That does not mean it automatically goes to another family but you should be aware of the fact that until you are approved and set up for the meet/greet.. the dog could get adopted by another applicant.NOTE: BAILEE IS LISTED AS A COURTESY TO ANOTHER RESCUE. PLEASE SEE CONTACT INFO BELOW.Bailee is a 5 yr old, 64lb sweetheart, we believeshe is a shepherd mix. Bailee is crate and house trained, knows basiccommands, and will sit and wait for her meals. Ms. Bailee is spayed, upto dates on vaccines, and microchipped. Bailee was a Rescue from aterrible situation in Alabama and she tested positive for heartworms but is heartworm free now! Bailee’s favorite hobbies are chasing the ball andFrisbee, taking long walks, and car rides. She doesn’t care whereshe’s going- she just likes to go. Bailee has been in foster care fora year now. She loves her foster family but really wants her ownfamily. Great with kids but she would be best as an only pet. NO CATSplease. If you would like to know more about Bailee contact herfoster mom Denise at Ray68a@netscape.net or Debbie at janrose@swva.net.

Francesca came to us from an Alabama shelter. She was originally a pregnant stray that was taken in by a good samaritan to have her puppies. She has had a rough life on the streets and at some point had part of her hind leg amputated. She is very shy, but starting to warm up in her foster home. She does feel very secure in her crate. She looks to be a total mix breed with some shepherd and hounds. She is about 4 years old and about 47 pounds. We have had Francesca spayed, but we do need to get her treatment for heartworms and then she will be ready for a new home. She is up to date with vaccines and microchipped. Her adoption fee is $200.00. If you are interested in adopting Francesca, please visit our website www.LHARinc.org go to Adopt and complete the dog adoption application.

www.huskyrescueteam.orgIf you have additional questions please email info@huskyrescueteam.orgCalli & Keanu are two very different dogs, from very different backgrounds who are the best of friends in their foster home. We would like to see these two find a forever home together where they can live out all of their days together.... OR...find a home with another young, active playmate. Calli would be find with either male or female, but Keanu prefers female dogs.Calli is just as sweet as she is gorgeous! Calli was saved from a kill shelter in Alabama and we are thrilled to have her. She is 2 years old and is a white husky with amber eyes, which is very unusual in the white huskies. She is house trained and crate trained. The best thing about Calli is she is good with everyone and everything she meets! She's good with kids, good with cats, and good with other dogs! And, she has a precious pink nose to go with all this awesome personality!Keanu is an estimated 2 year old Malinois mix that came to us from a small SC kill shelter. He is very friendly, very goofy & very clumsy- a typical fun pup! He is crate trained & has had no accidents in the house, but isn’t left alone for long periods of time. He loves to get out & run/play with all the other dogs & absolutely loves water (his favorite is attacking the hose while his foster Mom is trying to water flowers). Keanu is looking for a household without young children and hustle & bustle. He will not do well living in the city of apartment - only suburb living for this guy. Keanu is neutered and up to date on his vaccines.The both would benefit from a home who has a securely fenced yard. They are in a foster home in NC and can be transported to NJ or MD for an approved adopter. ~~Husky Education And Rescue Team is a foster based rescue. Our dogs are in our foster homes all up and down the east coast. We do not have a facility in which you can visit. We find this a huge benefit because we learn our dogs and are able to educate our adopters on what it’s like to have them live in your home. Part of our process, once pre-approved, is to speak with the foster for the dog you’re interested in. If you’re still interested in adopting from our rescue the first step is to complete our adoption application online at www.huskyrescueteam.org/applyIf you have additional questions please email info@huskyrescueteam.org 6/28/19 11:26 AM

She was taken to the shelter, and, although confused at first, when we brought her out of the shelter and into rescue, she adjusted well to the changes. Athol is a Scottish name meaning quiet, cooperative, adaptable, and sometimes shy. Our Athol, a mix of Lab and Shepherd, was surrendered by his owner to Crossing Paths.  He is 5 months old and a survivor of parvo which killed his 5 siblings.  He is a true fighter. A wonderful and playful dog, he presently weighs about 22 pounds and will mature to the high end of middle size. Rock joined our rescue on 6/7/19 from a high kill shelter in Alabama where he was found as a stray.  We have no idea of his parents and are simply guessing on his breeds.  Our thoughts are  that he is a mix of boxer and most likely some hound.  His coat is a beautiful dark brindle and is medium in length.  He has the boxer underbite along with the cutest face ever :-)!Rock is around 5 1/2 to 6 months old and currently weighs 37 lbs.  He will probably end up being around 60ish lbs when full grown.  He has very long legs and on the lean side.  This sweet pup is very friendly and gets along well with other dogs and cats.  House training is going very well; he walks well on a leash and knows how to sit.  We believe Rock would do best in a home with another dog and/or a family that is home often.  Rock is neutered, microchipped, up to date on vaccines (rabies, distemper & bordatella), dewormed,  and current on flea/tick/heartworm preventative.  His adoption fee is $375.  If you are interested in this sweet boy, please submit an application on our website at https://worthytails.rescuegroups.org.  For any questions you may have about him, please send an email to his foster mom, Jessie at jessie.wilson@comcast.net.

Howard and his brothers joined our rescue on May 31st from a high kill shelter in Alabama and are in search of their forever homes.  This litter of puppies were found as strays, therefore, we have no idea of the parents and are simply guessing on their breeds and ages.We believe this litter of puppies are mostly likely a mix of hound and labrador retriever.  They were examined by our vet and she believes they are somewhere between 10 and 11 weeks.Howard is a beautiful puppy that has very unique markings!  His back has a black stripe going down it and his sides are two toned.  He seems to be more hound than labrador retriever, but has markings of a doberman pinscher.  Howard is one of the smallest puppies and will most likely grow to be a large dog (or a large medium sized dog).  He is a sweet puppy and enjoys romping with his littermates and being loved on by his humans.  Howard has received his first two parvo/distemper vaccines, dewormed multiple times and current on his flea/tick and heartworm preventatives.  His adoption fee is $350.If you are interested in this precious puppy, please submit an application on our website at https://worthytails.rescuegroups.org.  For any questions you may have about Howard, please send an email to worthytailsrescue@comcast.net.Thank you for your interest in a rescue puppy!

Hansel is an 8-year-old Chihuahua mix who came to us from a hoarding situation in which one person had over 50 Chihuahuas.  You can imagine how little attention any one of them received.  Each had to compete for it.  So, when we brought Hansel into our rescue, it took him a while to realize that all the attention we were giving him was actually for him!  Hansel also came to us with a cherry eye, a minor problem that our vet corrected.  He weighs only 13 pounds and would probably do best in a quieter home without small children.  He’s a love of boy who deserves a fine home. Bailey’s foster accidently took him in because, although he was the neighbor’s dog, Bailey decided he preferred him over his original owners.  He kept getting away from them and coming to the foster’s house.  The neighbors said he could stay.  And the foster would happily keep him; he’s a good dog.  However, this one-year-old German Shepherd mix goes after cats and doesn’t really like the foster’s other dog.  Never having been aggressive towards people, he likes people in general as he has had successful visits to the vet and other places.  We don’t know for sure about children.  He is an intelligent fella who needs some training; his foster feels that he hasn’t been trained prior to living with him.  He needs to be reminded not to jump on people when he happily greets them; he forgets that he weighs 50 pounds.  Bailey might do best in a home with not other pets, and a fenced backyard would be great! According to her foster, Pancake is a sweetheart.  She’s a one-year old Jack Russell mix weighing only 12 pounds.  Her short coat is brown and white and soft to the touch. We call her a Special Needs dog because she has a heart murmur, but it’s a grade 1 which is the least serious of them all.  (The scale is 1 to 6.)  She isn’t on any meds for this because she’s doing so well.  Although the murmur hasn’t slowed her down a bit, we’d like to see her go to a calm house.  Since she weighs only 12 pounds, we would prefer no small children.  We pulled her from the high kill shelter when she was very pregnant and proved to be a wonderful Mama!  She loves people, does very well with other dogs, and is an all-around dynamite dog!  You’ll see! Sweet Beau joined our rescue on May 17th and is in search of his forever home.  He joins us from a kill shelter in Alabama where he was found as a stray, so we don't know anything about his beginnings.Beau is around 4 1/2 months old and currently weighs 27 lbs.  We believe he is a mix of doberman pinscher and possibly some type of terrier.  He is currently being fostered with another dog and 2 cats and does well with all of them.  However, he loves his humans best and is just such a sweet pup!  His happiest times are snuggling up with people and getting belly rubs :-).    Beau does great in the crate, but still needs work on his house training.  He is also pretty good on the leash.Beau does have a mild issue with his gait in regards to his back legs.  We noticed that his gait was slightly off and seems to favor his back right leg.  We took him to our vets and did bloodwork and had x-rays done on his legs and pelvis which were sent off to a radiologist for review.  Bloodwork was completely fine and the radiologist found nothing unusual in the x-rays.  There are no indications of genetic mutations or neurological disease.  Both the radiologist and vet believe this is possibly an injury that was sustained as a young puppy involving his tendons and ligaments that have healed, however, not properly.  Beau is not in pain and may always have an \"off\" gait.  He could be taken to a orthopedic specialist to do further testing, but it would not be necessary.  Beau is a very happy puppy and runs around and plays with the other dogs and doesn't seem to notice any difference :-)!  We hope this won't deter someone from wanting to adopt him as he is truly such a sweet, loveable puppy.Beau is current on vaccines, flea/tick/heartworm preventative and dewormings.  His adoption fee is $350.  If you are interested in the adorable puppy, please submit an application on our website at https://worthytails.rescuegroups.org.  For any questions you have about him, please send an email to jessie.wilson@comcast.net

I would like to introduce you to Polar, a 3-year-old mix of Chihuahua and Dachshund, called by some a Chiweenie. Who needs a little Catahoula mix girl with one blue eye? Mya is one very pretty girl in medium package. She weighs about 55 pounds, loves to ride in the car and go for walks. She does pull a little on leash,and with gentle correction she stops and walks like the lady she is.Mya came to us from a shelter in Alabama where the people there work very hard to save as many dogs as possible from euthanasia. She was here 5 days and gave birth to her litter of puppies. She raised her babies and is now waiting for her happy ever after.Mya would most likely do well with another dog with proper introductions. There are 2 chihuahuas that live in her foster home, she has not tried to hurt them. She will chase the cat in the house and anything small she sees outside. So we are reccomending no small animals or cats at this time.This girl has a very sweet personality and just wants to please and be told she is a good girl. She loves people. If you tell her it is ok, she will gently rise up on her two hind legs and put her two front paws on you and give you kisses.Mya is also a snuggler who is good at her job!Mya is heartworm negative, on preventative, house broken, crate trained, up to date on all vaccines, micro chipped and spayed.If you have qusetions or would like an adoption application for Mya please email njcatahoulas@verizon.net . Or call 908.578.4172.

Winnie is described by her foster mom as “perfect.” She is a very sweet and loving girl. She seeks out attention and opportunities to exchange affection. You will never feel lonely with this girl by your side. Winnie loves to play and likes toys. She enjoys spending time in the yard playing with both her canine and human foster siblings. Winnie would love a home that enjoyed going for walks or car rides. She is the perfect partner for your trips around town. Winnie has excellent manners around the house and is house trained.Winnie and her three babies were rescued from a high kill shelter in Alabama where they were scheduled for euthanasia. **Please read Lolly's entire profile, which includes a link to the adoption application. Thank you!**Lolly is an approximately 9 week old, 10 pound, Black Lab/Border Collie Mix pup.   Lolly and her brother cash were rescued from the euthanasia list at a tiny Alabama shelter and brought to rescue in Georgia.These pups are absolutely adorable!   They are happy and sweet and love to play and wrestle with each other.   They haven't been loose with cats but there are cats in their room and they seem to do fine.  They love other dogs.   While there aren't children in the foster home these pups seem to love everyone they meet and are young enough to adapt to any situation.   They will make a great addition to any family willing to train and love them!Lolly is up to date on vaccinations and will be spayed prior to adoption.   To adopt or learn more about Lolly, you must fill out an adoption application. To find the application, copy and paste this URL into your browser: WWW.GDRNE.COM/ADOPTION-APPLICATION [Adoption Fee: $495]  **  PLEASE READ: If a dog is listed, then s/he is currently available for adoption. Their information is correct to the best of our abilities and the information we have been given as of the day of posting. Please note, GDRNE does not guarantee the breed of any dog or puppy unless stated that we have run DNA. All breeds listed are educated estimates. Our dogs are rescued from various situations. It is most likely that both their parents were strays and even if not, mixes of some sort and that their grandparents were mixes as well. The dog may have some genetic material of an American Staffordshire Terrier (pit bull). The dogs are usually mixes of many breeds, making them a breed all their own - a True and adorable American MUTT. If you are interested in this dog, you must submit an application. Great Dog is not a shelter so there is no building you can visit. Our dogs live in private foster homes until adopted. To learn more about our *shelterless* rescue, adoption fees, and procedures, review the list of Frequently Asked Questions on our website at WWW.GDRNE.COM.

**Please read Panda's entire profile, which includes a link to the adoption application. Thank you!** Meet Panda - a 6 month old, 30 pound, beagle mix gal.Panda is a beautiful, sweet, happy, energetic young gal.   She was rescued from a rural Alabama shelter just in time as she was on the euthanasia list with our Georgia partner saw the plea to save her and drove to get her and 8 others.She loves to play and wrestle.   She seems to be friendly an outgoing with everyone she meets.   We don't know of her experience with children but her temperament seems like she would do well with them - but we suggest slightly older children due to her energy level.   As an active pup she would do best in a family that likes to spend time outdoors in the yard or walking/hiking.   We think she would also do well with another energetic pup.   Like any young dog she will need patience, love and professional training to make her the best she can be.   But who wouldn't want to hug this cuddly Panda and do whatever it took to give her a wonderful life.  Panda is up to date on vaccinations and will be spayed prior to adoption.To adopt or learn more about Panda, you must fill out an adoption application. This little girl is going to make a family very happy.After being rescued from an overcrowded shelter in Alabama to raising a small family of her own, Joplin's kids have all been adopted and she is still searching for a home of her own.Joplin loves children, other dogs, cats, you name it. She has a lot of affection to give, has a glowing personality, and can't wait to show her forever family what true love is.Joplin weighs about 10-15 pounds and is approximately 3 years old.To adopt, visit our website for an applicationwww.thegratefuldoganimalrescue.com

Libby is such a sweet and deserving girl. She came from living in an overgrown, undersized fenced in area in the heat of Alabama with no fresh food or water, or love and care. She has shown us she is resilient, and proves to love everyone she meets regardless of her past. Libby is friendly with other dogs, and cats. She would enjoy going for walks and adventures with her humans, swimming, and just hanging back and relaxing. Libby is sure to make her new family complete with all the loyalty you could ask for. To adopt,Visit our website for an application Www.thegratefuldoganimalrescue.com

Michelle is a sweet 4-5 month old terrier mix with the sweetest face. She has an underbite and would be best suited in a home with other dogs. Michelle came north with her sister Romy from Alabama. Their best friend is a kitten and the enjoy the company of other dogs very much. Michelle loves to go for walks and play at the dog park. She is not bonded with her sister, but would not mind being able to stay in the same home as her. Full grown, Michelle will likely be about 40 pounds max. To adopt, visit our website for an application:www.thegratefuldoganimalrescue.com

Romy is a sweet 4-5 month old terrier mix with the sweetest face. She has an underbite and would be best suited in a home with other dogs. Romy came north with her sister Michelle from Alabama. Their best friend is a kitten and the enjoy the company of other dogs very much. Romy loves to go for walks and play at the dog park. Sunny is a boisterous and loving little pocket pit who is eager to love. We rescued this girl from an overcrowded shelter in Alabama, about to go into labor. We got her to Maine on time where she gave birth to 6 beautiful babies, all of which are healthy and now ready for their forever homes. Sunny is an amazing girl who has a fun and goofy personality. She loves to play with her humans, loves stuffy toys, bones, and ropes. She enjoys going for walks and helping her human around with house work. She is friendly with most dogs as long as she is properly introduced, but should live in a home without cats as she has presented to be a little too interested. Sunny would do great living in a home with children. She weighs only about 40 pounds and would be the perfect compact little addition to a great family.To adopt, apply on our website:www.thergratefuldoganimalrescue.com

Meet Bundy! He is a 5 year old, 9.5 lb chihuahua/dachshund mix who made the journey all the way from Alabama to find his forever home here in Michigan!Bundy can take some time to warm up to new people. Once he is comfortable, he is your shadow. He is playful especially with squeaker toys and will steal all of them and hide them in his crate. He will gently place his mouth around your hand but it is not a bite, he's just asking for you to pet or play with him. But mainly he just really loves to curl up in your lap and snooze. Bundy can be a bit jealous of his foster dog siblings and hasn’t been tested with cats.Although he is well behaved, Bundy would do well in a home willing to provide him with some basic training. Fortunately, Bundy LOVES to eat and is treat-motivated so basic training should be easy! He is neutered and up-to-date on vaccines. Only homes with children over 10 since Bundy is so small.Bundy is available for adoption through Pet Tales Rescue in Grand Rapids, MI. Please go to www.pettalesrescue.com and fill out an application. His adoption fee is $235 plus $15 for the microchip for a total of $250 payable by cash or card through the rescue's website.* Pet Tales Rescue does not have a physical shelter location as all of our pets are in foster homes. To meet Bundy or one of our other fosters, you will need to fill out an application. After your application is reviewed, one of our volunteers will contact you to set up a time to meet him. Thank you for adopting, not shopping!

Meet Benny! Benny is a small dog with lots of personality. He is a 4 year old, 10 lb chihuahua/dachshund mix who made the journey all the way from Alabama to Michigan to find his forever home! Like many chihuahuas, Benny can take some time to warm up to new people. Once he is comfortable, he can be playful and very funny but mostly just really loves to curl up in a lap and take a snooze. He is very loving and has soulful eyes that he flashes at your readily to show how much he adores you. Benny can be a bit jealous of his foster dog siblings and hasn’t been tested with cats. Although he is very well behaved, Benny would do well in a home willing to provide him with some basic training. Fortunately, Benny LOVES to eat and is very treat-motivated so basic training should be quite easy! He is neutered and up-to-date on vaccines. Only homes with children over 10 since Benny is small.Benny is available for adoption through Pet Tales Rescue in Grand Rapids, MI. Please go to www.pettalesrescue.com and fill out an application. His adoption fee is $235 plus $15 for the microchip for a total of $250 payable by cash or card through the rescue's website.* Pet Tales Rescue does not have a physical shelter location as all of our pets are in foster homes. To meet Benny or one of our other fosters, you will need to fill out an application. After your application is reviewed, one of our volunteers will contact you to set up a time to meet him. Thank you for adopting, not shopping!

Meet Tibby (Harriet Tubman)! She is likely part Beagle and part something else - maybe terrier? - and is 12 weeks old. Just like her namesake, Tibby was born into adversity. This little girl came up with her siblings from Alabama after being orphaned. She is ready to play and eager to please with already liking some agility course options-(both the tunnel and a version of the ring). Pad trained and working on potty training, this little girl will make a great addition to an active family/person. She is also crate trained for naps. Since she’s with her siblings in the crate, it may take a little while to get used to the crate in her new home. Tibby is the tiniest of her sibling group, but she doesn’t let that stop her! ` Full of love and spunk with a willingness to learn, she is excited to find her forever home.Tibby has been spayed, vaccinated, microchipped, and is ready to find her forever family!Tibby is available for adoption through Pet Tales Rescue in Grand Rapids, MI. Please go to www.pettalesrescue.com and fill out an application. Her adoption fee is $265 plus $15 for the microchip for a total of $280 payable by cash or card through the rescue's website.* Pet Tales Rescue does not have a physical shelter location as all of our pets are in foster homes. To meet Tibby or one of our other fosters, you will need to fill out an application. After your application is reviewed, one of our volunteers will contact you to set up a time to meet her. Thank you for adopting, not shopping!

IN NEED OF LOCAL FOSTER OR ADOPTER/ AVAILABLE FOR FOSTER TO ADOPT FOR LOCAL ADOPTERSMeet Chevy! I AM ALLERGIC TO IVERMECTIN (all Heartworm preventatives except Sentinel). Here is Chevy's video from the day he left the shelter:https://youtu.be/lXq1JFX5JbUChevy is approx. 5 years old (approx. DOB 1-12-14), male, 30 lbs., vetted, is or will be neutered, and micro-chipped. Chevy is a verysweet southern boy from Alabama! He gets along with all dogs he has come across, loves to play, talks to you (if you make a siren noise he will sing), LOVES to cuddle on your lap, loves to sleep with you, and is just generally happy all the way around! He is potty trained, exhibits a prey drive (so no cats please), and would do best with older predictable children. Stay tuned for more information as Chevy is a new rescue!If you are interested in fostering or adopting Chevy please fill out an Application at www.Passion-4-Paws.org (please make sure you have the Vermont site) thanks!Check out his Facebook page (please \"Like\" us while you are there): https://tinyurl.com/y3hvcb25Please note Fosters have 1st option of Adoption.Disclosure:Breed labels are often incorrect: we rarely know the genetic lineage of the dogs we rescue. Many shelters and rescues specify breeds based on appearance; however, research has shown that less than 2% of a dog’s DNA determines appearance!Passion 4 Paws does not practice the use of labels pertaining to compatibility with others or dog breed. Labels such as “dog friendly” and “child friendly” should be used with caution as they often over-simplify the personalities and behavior of dogs.
