Hi! I'm Willow and I'm what you'd call a true rescue story.... CFP brought me all the way from Alabama where I was in a high-kill shelter. It was pretty scary so I'm still working on building self-confidence and forgetting those days of my life!! I'm about 1.5 years old and am hoping to find a fur-home to love me! I am pretty timid away from my foster home -- but when I'm in my element, I will snuggle and help you load the dishwasher (I'm a great pre-rinse agent) .... and I am a CHAMP at tug-of-war. Because I'm such a homebody, I would really love a fence. If you have another dog looking for a playmate, that helps me, too!! My foster sister helps my self-confidence when we are out walking. Here's me in action: https://youtu.be/Ed2uVlKJDb8https://youtu.be/1C79KSJV3cUTo meet me, please apply at cfp-nc.org/adopt and my foster mom can tell you even more wonderful things about me!If you are interested in this animal please start by filling out an adoption application at CFP-NC.org/adopt and we will get in touch with you.

Boots is an awesome dog that was rescued from a high kill shelter in Alabama with her buddy Bits. They are a bonded pair and would like to find them a home together. They are both wonderful dogs and will make a great addition to your family. Boots' adoption fee is $150

Bits was rescued from a high kill shelter in Alabama along with her buddy Boots. These two are bonded and would like to find a home for them together. They are great dogs and would make great companions for your family. Bits' adoption fee is $150

*****  Corey has been with us longer than we would like and is a member of our Lonely Hearts Club.  Corey's adopters will receive a certificate for a free training class. *****Hi, there! My name is Corey and I just got here all the way from Alabama to find my new forever home. I'm quite a high energy young pup, so I need a family who is dedicated to giving me lots of exercise and teaching me puppy manners. My over the top enthusiasm for life may be too much for young children so I would do best in an adults only home.   If you are looking for a cute, athletic doggie, look no further!  I am ready to amuse you with my antics and accompany you on all of life's adventures.  Ask for more information about me at the adoption center. My adoption fee is $400.

THE FIRST STEP IN THE PROCESS IS SUBMITTING AN APPLICATION. WE CANNOT ANSWER EMAILS ASKING ABOUT A DOG'S AVAILABILITY. IF IT IS LISTED WITHOUT THE WORD \"PENDING\" IT MEANS IT IS AVAILABLE.PLEASE COPY AND PASTE THIS LINK TO OUR APPLICATION:https://tlps.wufoo.com/forms/zd92n5v01oyydt/Chocoholics . . . meet Choco! If you are a Chocolate Lover, we guarantee this boy is going to melt in your hands AND your heart!! He's an EXTREMELY friendly and EXTREMELY affectionate boy who LOVES people of all ages. Choco is your typical Lab, with more than his share of goofiness and slobbering - - but Lab Lovers expect that! He was pulled on his last day from a high-kill shelter in Arkansas where he was brought in as a stray and never claimed. Now he's at a shelter we like to call \"The Group Home\" with visiting kids, dogs of all ages and sizes and we haven't found anything Choco doesn't love!! And if boating, swimming, and picnics at the beach rank at the top of your activity list, then be sure to bring Choco - - he will be the first one into the water every time! He loves to play fetch, he's getting a little better on the leash, and he's active in a Labby way. He knows some basic obedience and he's smart enough to pick up on it quickly. He loves to ride in the car, too -- the perfect sidekick! He's just a very happy boy . . . and has the constantly-wagging tail to prove it!We think Choco might be under a year old because he still acts very puppy-ish, and he weighs about 55 pounds with more to grow. We don't know his true mix, but we think he's part Lab, part Bull in a China Shop!! He's still blowing out his puppy coat and with great food and a little time, his whole coat will be a spectacular gleaming milk chocolate. Give him a chance and he'll make a chocolate lover out of anyone!! If you want Choco's smile greeting you at the door, please visit www.pinkshelter.org for more information about the adoption process. Full vetting AND neuter included in his $425 adoption fee. Transport fee is additional $140. IF YOU HAVE AOL or YAHOO PLEASE CHECK YOUR SPAM FILE FOR OUR RESPONSE

Captain D \"Cappy\" and his mom and 8 siblings came from a rural Arkansas shelter. He's one of the tallest of the litter,He's a lover not a fighter and a big momma's boy.Cappy would do well in a quieter foster home. He's a bit afraid of new things and will hid or run to me when scared. I think he would do well with other dogs to play with and does well with cats. I think he might do well with older children only because of his fear of sudden movements and such. Cappy does well in his crate and goes in willingly with a treat. He sleeps in it overnight and stays in while I'm at work. He does yet anxious to come out when hears someone come home.Cappy is a sweet momma's boy. He loves to be with his person and sit with you and snuggle. He's calm and quiet for a puppy and is a happy boy. He will make someone a great lap buddy.Age: 13 weeksWeight: 8lbsPlease Note: All dogs are posted until they are officially adopted. This dog may have other interested adopters in line. If you are interested in adopting, please fill out an application on our website at http://www.lasthopek9.org/Questions? Please email adoptions@lasthopek9.org. For more photos, or information on upcoming adoption events where you can meet her, please go to www.lasthopek9.org or go to our Facebook page. Thank you for your interest in saving a life!

Meet Emma!This girl is just beautiful. She is the sweetest soul too! Sadly, Miss Emma was adopted some time ago from a shelter in Arkansas. Her family needs to return her due to separation anxiety. She will need a \"heavy crate\" or someone who is home most of the time; a home where someone is home is ideal for her. She is dog and kid approved. Emma is also fully vetted! If you would like to meet/adopt Emma, please complete an application on our website:www.NewEnglandHumaneSociety.com       Adoption Fee: $500.00

THE FIRST STEP IN THE PROCESS IS SUBMITTING AN APPLICATION. WE CANNOT ANSWER EMAILS ASKING ABOUT A DOG'S AVAILABILITY. IF IT IS LISTED WITHOUT THE WORD \"PENDING\" IT MEANS IT IS AVAILABLE.PLEASE COPY AND PASTE THIS LINK TO OUR APPLICATION:https://tlps.wufoo.com/forms/zd92n5v01oyydt/Chocoholics . . . meet Dr. Pepper! If you are a Chocolate Lover, we guarantee this boy is going to melt in your hands AND your heart!! He's an \"Extreme Chocolate\": extremely friendly and extremely affectionate - - in fact, he was named Dr. Pepper because of his extremely bubbly personality!! Dr. Pepper is your typical Lab, with his share of goofiness and slobbering, but he'll make a Chocolate lover out of anyone! He was pulled on his last day from a high-kill shelter in Arkansas where he was brought in as a stray and never claimed. Now he's being fostered in a family with other dogs and we haven't found anything Dr. Pepper doesn't love!! He LOVES to play fetch, he LOVES playing with other dogs, and he LOVES to go on walks (but he still pulls because he LOVES to get where he's going!). He loves playing with other dogs so much, we think he will do best in a home with a kindred dog spirit. True to his Lab-heritage, he's still puppy-active, he destroys tennis balls, and he's a complete Chowhound. He knows some basic obedience (but he needs to learn to stop jumping up) and he's smart enough to pick up on it quickly. He loves to ride in the car, too -- the perfect sidekick! He's just a VERY happy boy . . . and has the constantly-wagging tail to prove it! And, of course, that smile!!Dr. Pepper is about 5 years old, he weighs about 75 pounds and he's a very healthy and obviously happy boy.   Give him a chance and he'll make a chocolate lover out of anyone!! If you want Dr. Pepper's smile greeting you at the door every day, please visit www.pinkshelter.org for more information about the adoption process. Full vetting, microchip and neuter included in his $375 adoption fee. Transport fee is additional $160. IF YOU HAVE AOL or YAHOO PLEASE CHECK YOUR SPAM FILE FOR OUR RESPONSE

Please contact Sandra (sandralamb@comcast.net) for more information about this pet.Check out our website: http://fohari.orgAdoption Application: http://fohari.org/aaAdoption Donation$499Located: in New EnglandAge: approx 3 years oldWeight: 6 lbsHey friends my name is Jake I am the cutest little six pound chi you will ever meet! I traveled all the way up from Arkansas to start a new life here in New England & so far it’s been great! My first few years were not happy ones and I ended up in a shelter. I also am missing part of my back leg but that doesn’t stop me from running circles around the other dogs here. I love to play I could playfor hours with my friends tanner and Brody. I get along with everyone at my foster home even the giant dog Bentley. I love to sleep near my foster mommy and share the blanket with her and Bonnie (bonnie can be selfish though and not share but that’s ok I back off). I am doing a very good job going outside to the bathroom too! My foster mommy said she will find me the bestest home with someone who will spoil me rotten! I would love to find a home with another young dog that likes to play with me and because I am so tiny a home with no little humans is needed! So if you are looking for a cute, cuddly, loves to give kisses guy then you definitely want to meet mehugs JakeIf you are interested in adopting me, please fill out an application on our website www.fohari.org and email my foster parent for more information:sandralamb@comcast.net,Please check out our website for how to Adopt, Adoptions events, Fostering and more!www.fohari.orgNormally we do not process applications unless a specific dog is selected, along with submitting a deposit of $200 using our Paypal Donate link. Please understand we are all volunteers with limited resources - your deposit tells us you are serious.Click here to complete our online adoption application!If this link isnt working please go to our website www.fohari.org and click on adoption application.Once we have your deposit we will hold the dog for you while we process your application. If you are not approved to adopt or we can not provide the dog you are interested in, your deposit is refunded. If you are approved, the deposit is applied toward the total donation of the dog.If the dog is not a good match, we will work with you to find another dog, but the deposit is NOT refundable. We want you to be certain that this is a decision your have thought through thoroughly & not just a whim soif YOU change your mind for ANY reason, your deposit isNOT REFUNDABLE!If you would like toHELPany of our special rescued dogs by making a donation orIf you would like to place aDEPOSITfor a dog while we process your application, you can use this secure & safe site on Paypal - please click on symbol below:Transport costs are normally included in the donation unless otherwise noted.If you wish to call us, please call between the hours of 10 AM and 7PM at 401-234-4499.If you leave a message, a volunteer will return your call ASAP.If you would rather email us, please email: friendsoha@yahoo.comEnter the dogs name in the subject line. Thank you!FRIENDS of HOMELESS ANIMALS, INC. is a RHODE ISLAND NON PROFIT 501 (C)(3) RESCUE

SILLY GOOSE! Goose is a handsome and cuddly 1 year old pointer mix (we think with Golden), originally from Arkansas. He, along with his mother and his siblings were living outside an abandoned home, and needed rescue quickly to keep them safe. We are not certain who his dad was, but because of his looks, his dad sure was a handsome gent!Goose is very sweet, and loves to give full body hugs. Goose is good with dog and cats, and is a total lovebug. He is working on his leash manners, as he is a little uncertain with loud city noises. Goosey is goofy and sweet, snuggly and handsome.Some notes from his foster home:Goose is a typical young dog who needs exercise and stimulation.  He is also a big boy (around 75 lbs) and he would do best with another dog (or 2!) who is willing to run and play with him in the yard to burn off some energy.  He is willing to entertain himself (see the video here: Goose Entertains Himself with Gymnastics!).  He is fascinated with birds and butterflies, and squirrels are possibly the most exciting thing ever!Perhaps due to his time abandoned, he does show some resource guarding.  He eats in his crate at his foster home, and high-value treats like knucklebones need to be closely monitored with other dogs around.  He freely exchanges anything he has for a cookie with his foster parents.  He is very food motivated and knows sit and down, but his recall is still a work in progress.  His leash walking is improving, but if he sees a squirrel, all bets are off!If you are interested in fostering for us, please complete a PRO Volunteer Form: http://www.pointerrescue.org/volunteer.htmlWant to help but not ready to foster or adopt? PRO is a 501(c)(3) non-profit group; we use donations to pay for all expenses related to caring for the Pointers in our care. Please consider making a donation to help us help dogs like this one! Donations of any size graciously accepted by mail or PayPal, see details here: http://www.pointerrescue.org/donation.htm�

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.HI, I’m Tilly. I’m about 5-6 years old. I originally came from an over-crowded shelter in Arkansas. I’m very loving and loyal. I bond closely with my humans and sometimes I can be a little over protective. I get along well with other dogs. I’m living now in a foster home with two other large dogs. I’m a little nervous about cats and children under the age of ten. I love to cuddle and sit in your lap if you let me, although I’m a little too big to be a lap dog. I love to go on long walks with my family and play with the other dogs in my house. I also really enjoy car rides. I’m potty trained and kennel trained. I know some commands like sit and come. I learn very quickly when I get rewarded with treats. I’m looking for a loving, forever homeIf you are interested in adopting Tilly, please fill out the adoption application located at http://www.adopthope.org/log-adoption-application/Last Hope requires that all animals be kept as indoor pets only, altered and current on vaccinations and preventatives. Our adoption process includes reference and background checks, a vet check and a home visit. The adoption fee includes: spay/neuter, microchip and vaccinations.

Hi there, they call me Grace. Or Gracie Lee. Or Pretty Girl. Or Big Head. Or Smooch! I have lots of nicknames because my foster mom really, really loves me. I'm a 60# Black Mouth Cur. I originally came from Arkansas and I'm 2 years old.    I love to run! When I get the zoomies in the yard, I run figure eights around the trees and it makes my mom laugh every time. I also love other dogs and would really like to have a brother or sister.    Mom says I'm very good at entertaining myself. Bones are my favorite, but I like chew toys, ropes and large outside fetch toys. Inside, I love to unstuff all the little toys, then watch mom stuff it back in, so I can rip it up again. Great fun! Ha ha!    When mom has to be away, I run right in my kennel and wait for her to come back. When she does, I do my happy dance! I can kennel at night also, but mom lets me sleep in her bed, where I snuggle under the covers and don't move until she gets up. I like to be toasty warm! I'm also an experienced couch potato, mom gives me 5 stars.    I had a very difficult start to life. I was not treated kindly and not socialized at all with people or animals. I have since learned a lot about dogs but have not met cats. I am still working on people skills. Because of the way I was treated in the past, I'm scared of people I don't know and I bark at them. I can look scary, but I'm really just unsure. Once I get to know someone, I practically drown them in kisses. I'm just slow to trust, and I get a little nervous in new situations, but I have come so, so far already and I really want to like everybody. I'm smart too. I know around 25 commands and words.    If you are the kind of person who has the love and patience to continue helping me with my social skills, I'll walk, run, play as often as you like, chill when you want to chill, and I'll love you forever. No cats, no young kids.\"Courtesy posting\"CONTACT:  lichele.werner@gmail.com

Meet Benny! Benny is dog and cat friendly senior boy (between 12-14), who was rescued from rural Arkansas. Benny was pulled off the street matted, dirty, blind with two infected eyes, and covered in parasites and worms. Benny has since been vetted, and has made a full recovery minus regaining his vision, (which everyone knows is not a priority for an amazing dog here at Anarchy!) Benny has been monitored closely by a very experienced foster home the last few months, and has been doing great. Benny does require daily inexpensive eye drops, and some periodic eye cleaning to keep him comfortable. Benny's favorite past times according to his foster mom are meal time, and soaking up the sun when the weather is nice. Benny is a quiet senior boy who would love to live out his remaining days in a peaceful home, with lots of affection that allows him to enjoy some fresh air from time to time. If interested in adopting this sweet senior boy, email info@anarchyanimalrescue.org for an adoption application. 6/25/19 9:43 AM

This lovely little girl is 3-4 years old and 38lbs. She came to us from Arkansas where she was found nearly starved and very sick with heartworm. She has since gained weight and recovered, and recently made the journey to Rochester to find her forever home! She is full of love, kisses, and snuggles, and would love a nice family to call her own.Honor likes to play, but she likes to snuggle even more. She would prefer to be a lap dog and potato on the couch most of the day. She is not super active but she loves sunbathing and relaxing outside. She gets along well with other dogs and wouldn't mind a playmate, so long as they don't play too rough and respect her space when she's tired. No cats for this girl!Honor is crate-trained and potty trained. She has not had any accidents at her foster home and has been fine being left for a regular workday, but her medication makes her need to go potty a bit more frequently than most dogs, so a family who works shorter shifts or is available to let her out for a potty break mid-day would be ideal for her.She can be nervous around her food, so she prefers to eat alone in her crate. She is fine taking treats, even with other dogs, as long as she understands clearly who each piece is meant for. As soon as she sees dinner coming she runs to her crate and dances while she waits.Honor is a gem of a dog and will make someone very happy. Her foster parents would be keeping her if she didn't chase their cats! They say she is wonderful, affectionate, just an all-around good girl. If you would like to meet her, please submit the adoption application at K9Orphans.org !!

Maisy is not technically a Circle of Hope dog.  She is what we refer to as a \"courtesy post.\"  Volunteers with our group are sometimes contacted by friends or family who need help re-homing a dog.   That is what is going on with Maisy.  She is currently living with a family in upstate NY who is friends with a long time volunteer of Circle of Hope.  This family adopted Maisy from a rescue group in Arkansas just over ago  when she was 10 weeks old.  This family has young children and the bottom line is that she is not a good fit with them and we will not place her in a home with them. The energy level and unpredictable activities of little kids can get Maisy nervous and we aren't sure we can trust her with that.  We won't describe her as aggressive, and the best trainer in our area agrees and has said several times that she is not an aggressive dog.   She is great with teenagers and adults and loves to meet them all the time.  She also seems to love to play with other dogs. The doggie day camp she goes to says she never has had any issues.  She is energetic and brings that energy to doggie games, so maybe a home with an older dog would not be a good fit.  She also would not be good in a home with cats.Maisy is very smart, active and playful.  She would love a home with lots of activity and maybe even where she could be taught how to do a job on a farm.  She is looking for frequent engagement.  She isn't a dog who likes to hang out alone.  When left alone for a long period of time she gets nervous and bored. She really likes a routine and adult companionship that is task oriented.   She loves to play in the snow, shallow water (although not really a swimmer), tug of war and chase balls.  She is great in the car and always up for walks, jogs and hikes.  She is good on a leash, is crate trained, house broken and up to date with all of her vet care.  She is truly loved by this family she has been with, but they know their home is not the best match for her due to their young children.  If you think you have what Masiy needs and could give her that perfect home please let us know.  All interested adopters please email Cari at carilifluke@gmail.com.  I will send you an application to fill out once I hear from you.

Hope is a female, 9.6 lb, tan Chihuahua. Hope's estimated date of birth is May, 2012. She was rescued from Arkansas. She is a sweet and friendly girl. You can meet Hope at South Memorial Animal Hospital. Call 918-664-8690 for an appointment. Hope has a $150.00 adoption fee plus the cost of 6 months of heartworm prevention. Toby is an adorable 18 pound, red and white Basenji mix with very distinctive ears. His estimated date of birth is October 2016. He came to ARF from a shelter in Fort Smith after being rescued as an unclaimed stray. This sweet guy had a tough time coping with anxiety, and spent time in the medical unit because he was so scared. He is doing extremely well in a foster home after being given a chance to adjust at his own pace. He is housetrained, with a few accidents here and there. He is crate trained at night, and rests quietly when his crate is covered. Toby loves being around other dogs. He is energetic and playful, but also submissive. The two dogs in his foster home have helped his adjustment immensely. He does okay with older kids, but may not be a good fit around younger ones. He chases the cat living in his foster home, but hasn't tried to hurt her. As he has been adjusting to his foster home, he has growled and barked at the members of his foster family. However, he responds well to verbal correction, and this behavior is declining in frequency as he becomes more comfortable.Toby is very companionable and likes being around people. He follows his foster mom around the house keeping her company in various rooms. His only really bad habit is that he likes to chew, with a particular affinity for shoes and cords. This can be easily managed by providing bones and toys, and keeping human things picked up. Toby shows his Basenji heritage with unusual vocalizations in addition to little barks and growls.Toby's ideal forever home would be with a family who is patient enough to allow him to acclimate at his own pace. The perfect home for Toby will have at least one other dog, and no young kids. They will also have the ability to tolerate toileting accidents, and to remember to pick up things he's likely to chew. Toby is a smart, resilient little guy, who will be a wonderful addition to his forever family.Toby has a $150.00 adoption fee plus the cost of 6 months of heartworm prevention. Our sole purpose is to find the best possible home for the animals that fall under our care. We do not ship our animals. All adopters are expected to come to Tulsa if approved.For details on how to adopt please visit http://www.arftulsa.org/adopt

Cloris is a good dog but has work to do on leash walking. She is a snuggle sweetheart, she loves other dogs and is getting along great with cats. Hooplah! What a fun name, huh? Well I am a fun guy… so the fun name suits me! In mid- May I was transferred with a couple other dogs to DCHS from a humane society in the state of Arkansas. Talk about a long road trip! I’m estimated to be about three and a half years old, and weight about 35lbs. I arrived with some cysts on my head that needed to be removed, and I am a little self-conscious about the scars. My fur is growing back, but I wasn’t comfortable having my photo taken, so I decided to wear a pumpkin hat in any photos until my fur grows back. I’m a pretty cute lil’ punkin… aren’t I?! I tend to be a ‘nervous nelly’ and will give you an awkward smile when I am excited but nervous. I usually warm up to new people rather quickly, but I do tend to feel more comfortable around men. I am very active and spunky, and can be quite playful when I am comfortable and at ease. I would like to find a home with another dog, preferably a fun loving, well socialized, outgoing dog who can teach me how to be a little less socially awkward. I’m basically a work in progress… but when it comes right down to it… aren’t we all?!Placement Recommendations: Owner Experience Level: Some ExperienceCats: Maybe/ Maybe NotDogs: YesKids: Middle School +Want to know more? Please call us! We've found that back and forth via email regarding a specific animal is not always effective and quick because our email is not monitored on a regular basis. So, for specific information regarding this wonderful pet, please contact one of our adoption counselors at (715) 232-9790. They are available between the hours of 8 am and 7 pm (7 days a week, excluding holidays). Thanks for your interest!

In honor of Flag Day, now through July 15th, our Red, White and Woo Hoo Adoption Promotion has returned! My adoption fee will be waived with a donation of 50# or more of Purina Puppy Chow.Hi, my name is Quatro! I am a Lab mix that came up to Wisconsin from Arkansas! I was born around 10/7/2018. Please be aware that my breed and age listing are estimates. The staff at both shelters do the best they can with that. I have a history of being good with other dogs and really like to play!  Obedience classes for adult dogs and puppies can be incredibly helpful for both animals and humans. It helps you understand what makes me tick and will give me a better idea of what you want me to do. It’s a win/win and it will also strengthen the bond between us! Apply for me today!My adoption fee is $200.00. Adoption applications can be filled out at CCHS or online through our website, www.cchs-petshelter.org. Applications are not first come, first served. All applications will be reviewed by the adoption committee and the home chosen will be the one considered to be the best match. All dogs and puppies have been vaccinated for Distemper and Bordetella, dewormed and microchipped. If old enough, they will be vaccinated for Rabies and blood tested for Heartworm, Lymes, Anaplasmosis and Erlichiosis. Dogs and puppies will be spayed or neutered before adoption.CCHS is proud to be a No-Kill Humane Society. As a private, non-profit charity, our work depends on donations and volunteers to keep going. We are committed to helping the animals that enter our doors and finding each the best possible forever home. CCHS has been inspected and licensed by the Department of Animal Health - DATCP. Our license is #268235-DS

We dare you to watch this video and look at our new pics of these two amazing dogs and not immediately apply to make them your own - you just can't do it, it's not possible.https://youtu.be/QPuUDmV2aH0If you are interested in learning more about Thunder and Sunshine please email gottalovdogs@yahoo.comSweet sweet and very bonded siblings who come from the streets of Aruba and have made their way to the safety and comfort of their foster family in Western Massachusetts.  Sunshine and her brother Thunder were found living under a car in Aruba - Thunder has a mobility issue where his hind legs are weak and he isn't able to work - his sister Sunshine stuck by him and no doubt protected him when needed. Thunder was lucky enough to land with a foster who has been working very hard to see what mobility he may be able to get back - so far we have learned that he is NOT paralyzed - his bladder and bowel function is perfectly normal.  He's been to a neurologist who was encouraging about his ability to perhaps walk again but a formal diagnoses remains out of reach.  He's been attending physical therapy twice a week hoping to strengthen his legs but thus far it appears he will not be walking on his own.  BUT, he doesn't know any better and thus his life will go on.   He will be fitted for wheels shortly which will make a huge improvement in his mobility although as you can see from this video, he gets around just fine and loves playing with his sister.Thunder and Sunshine must be adopted together - their bond is quite strong but they also love the humans caring for them and being part of a family.  Their adjustment to living inside and not on the street fending for themselves has been going quite well.  House training is still a work in progress but is going great!! The love playing with each other and the other dogs in their foster home - they've learned that mom's whistle means come in OR even better, it's time for dinner!!Thunder can negotiate small stairs - ideally living on a ground floor with easy access in/out maybe using a ramp would perfect.Name: Thunder & SunshineBreed: Shepherd/Beagle mixesAge: 1 - 1 1/2 years Weight:  23 lbsSpayed/Neutered: YesVaccinations: Up to dateHeartworm: Negative at last testingMicrochipped: YesBASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: Good with Children: UnknownGood with Dogs:  YesGood with Cats: UnknownIMPORTANT INFORMATION:Interested in a specific dog, please fill out an application if you are interested in a dog. The number of individual inquiries is overwhelming and we are finding it difficult to respond to each one. We cannot guarantee you will receive a timely response.Paws New England is a rescue, not a shelter, and as such we do not have our dogs housed in one location - they are in foster homes both in New England and in our southern foster homes.   If you're interested in a specific dog, please complete a short online application and you will receive a reply within 48 hours so you can ask questions.At present, if a dog is listed on our website, the dog is considered still available HOWEVER, may have applications that have come in before yours but it's still too early to know if any are a good match; therefore we encourage you to apply.NOTICE WITH REGARD TO LOCATION OF DOGS:  Please note: Paws New England is a foster-based rescue. We do not have a brick and mortar building to house the dogs we rescue. We have found that dogs in foster homes are much more adoptable because they have been observed in a home setting. Dogs listed with Paws New England typically reside in various locations throughout the south (primarily Tennessee, Texas, and Arkansas) and New England (not necessarily in the state of Rhode Island). You will be notified by the adoption coordinator of the location of the dog you are interested in so you have the ability to decide whether to pursue adoption or not.Dogs transported to New England are done so at a fee of $150.00 paid directly to the transporting company by Paws New England; no additional transport costs are responsibility of adopter. This fee is included in the adoption donation.Adoption donations cover pre-adoption vet costs (including vaccinations, spay/neuter when age appropriate, and heartworm testing/treatment when necessary), a microchip, and transportation to New England if necessary.Donations for our young, healthy puppies and dogs support their fellow canines of advanced age or suffering from injuries and abuse whose donations are reduced but whose veterinary costs are typically much higher. We appreciate your understanding that your dog will help others in need.All known information about the animal is listed above. We do our best to give accurate information, but most of our dogs are rescues and do not come with a known history.Paws New England abides by the dog importation regulations set forth in the states of MA, CT, NH and RI.Paws New England abides by the dog importation regulations set forth in the states of MA, CT, NH and RI.

El Niño ♥ If you are wanting to add a bit of the tropics to your life...  here is the perfect way!   Love on wheels!El Niño is a 3-1/2 year old street dog from Aruba.  He was rescued by 9 Lives Aruba and they cared for him after he was found in the street after being hit by a car.  He has spinal issues and is paralyzed in the hind end.  He is high energy and wants to go..go..GO!  He self mutilated his penis and had surgery to relocate his ureter to the area where a female dog's is.  He has to have a cushion of sorts on his wheelchair and pants are worn to keep that sensitive area protected.  It is prone to irritation otherwise.  He does require his bladder to be expelled and he is incontinent of both urine and stool.  He does eat prescription food for bladder support and takes cranberry extract daily.  He came with multiple drag sores that are healing.  He was in boarding prior to his flight to the US and did poorly in that setting.  He is friendly with people and animals.  He always wants to play...  He is about 30-35 pounds.  He is alert, smart, and loving.  The Mia Foundation agreed to take him in when his loving foster home in Aruba became ill and could not continue to care for him.  They were not successful in finding a special needs foster home and reached out for help.  That is how he came to the Mia Foundation ?   If interested and have the time and love to commit...  he would be a wonderful addition.   Until then, he will stay here and play and heal with his many friends!  He is current on all shots, heart worm negative, and neutered.Please email us for information at loveformia2012@yahoo.com and include your PHONE #.A PHONE # MUST be provided in order to contact you.If you do not provide a PHONE #, you will not be contacted.Please note ~ ONLY inquire if you are 100% sure that you are ready for the responsibility of adopting one of these babies! These babies require a commitment (more than your average pet). Thank you for understanding our concerns. ~

Lenny (and Louie) came to Underdog Rescue of Florida from the Bahamas.They were rescued from a life of neglect; tied outside on chains, no overhead shelter, and no grooming or vetting.  A good soul saw their predicament and made arrangements to have them flown to Florida.  They were not rescued together so are not a bonded pair.Lenny is about a 2 year old  darling and is only 13 lbs.... vetted, groomed and is so soft and white....with light beige ears and muzzle.  He loves to cuddle and play. He has a pink nose that might be from sunburn; he is on an antibiotic for 30 days. Adoption fee $400All UnderDogs are spayed/neutered, heartworm checked, microchipped, up to date on vaccines and heartworm/flea/tick preventatives.  For consideration for one or more dogs, we require that an on-line application is filled out.  TO ADOPT THIS DOG PLEASE FILL OUT AN APPLICATION AT https://underdogrescueofflorida.com/. Sorry, we do not adopt outside of Florida.  Applicants are subject to a home visit, and veterinary references will be checked. Please include a vet reference (including phone number) when applying online.Our application process:FIRST, an application must be approved for adoption from our rescue.SECOND, we determine whether the dog that has been applied for is a \"good match\" for the household that wants to adopt him/her.  We take into consideration the dog's activity level, compatibility with other members of the household (human and other pets), etc.If your application has been approved, but the dog you applied for is no longer available, please take the time and look over our adoptable dogs again.  We will make every effort to find the right dog for an approved applicant.We hope you agree and understand that our goal to find the best forever home is our #1 priority! Please fill out an Adoption Application at https://underdogrescueofflorida.com/

Nilla is a 3 year old Saluki cross (likely with a labrador) from Bahrain.  She’s a wiggle worm and a grinner!! She likes nothing better than to curl up on the couch with her human!!  Nilla would be best in a home as the only dog. Nilla's adoption fee is $300 and she is fostered in Pennsylvania. While we prefer that adopters pick up their dogs from their foster homes, we adopt to families across the US and Canada. If you need assistance transporting your dog home, we will help make the arrangements but you will be responsible for the actual costs, which are usually $300-600. If you're interested in adding this dog to your pack, the first step is to fill out an application at http://sighthoundunderground.com.NOTE: Please do not click the ADOPT ME button on this page. If you are interested in adopting a dog from SHUG you must go to our website and fill out our application at http://sighthoundunderground.com. We will not reply to your email until you have taken the time to fill out our application. We apologize for the inconvenience but we are an all volunteer organization with limited resources. This is the best way we have found to make the best use of our time. There are a lot of people who just want to ask questions but will never adopt and unfortunately we just don't have time to chat.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Name: OliverAge: ~9/1/2017Gender: MaleBreed: Lab / TerrierWeight: 34 lbsDog friendly: Yes, would do best with a canine companionCat friendly: TBDKid friendly: Yes, 10+ considerate children onlyHouse Trained: YesCrate Trained: YesEnergy level: ModerateHistory: Owner surrender from BelizeAdoption Fee: $400From the Foster:Oliver is a sweet and loving boy who LOVES other dogs. He is potty and crate trained but he usually is fine left out with our resident dog during the day and night. Like most dogs, he does best meeting dogs in a neutral environment (off leash and open). He has children in his foster home who he loves and adores. When he was first settling in, he didn’t communicate in the best way, but is learning and will definitely continue to do so! Older children might be best, but with patient and knowledgeable grown-ups, Oliver could be fine w/ littler ones. Oliver loves to go on walks and has been doing better not pulling! He does have a moderate energy level so he does need exercise daily. Currently, he enjoys the fenced in yard with his foster family and resident dog. Once he notices that his people are getting tired he will settle down and curl into a tight ball either on top or right next to you. Before coming to his foster he traveled all the way from Belize! He was a stray and was severely malnourished and starving but a nice lady took him in as her own. He came to his fosters in great health, a little skinny, but a handsome fun-loving dude. Overall, little Oliver just wants a family who can give him love, snuggles, and a chance to learn all about life for a dog in America!

Axle is a Central Asian Shepherd, imported from Bosnia. He comes with his own passport! Axle needs a home with a VERY large secure fenced yard or acreage. No other male dogs, gets along great with females big and small. Great with Kids. This is very rare breed in the USA.To apply for adoption, go to www.caninepetrescue.com and fill out our online adoption application. You will see answers to many of your questions in the introductory information.

Tommie Girl is a very sweet and curious pup that loves to play. She enjoys chasing balls around the yard and sniffing anything she can get her nose into. She knows basic commands and is a wonderful jogging or adventure partner. She would love a fenced yard to run around in! Tommie Girl will also snuggle with you on lazy days on the couch. Tommie Girl was rescued from the British Virgin Islands after the Hurricanes in 2017.  She has not lived in a house before but she is learning and making improvements every day in her foster home. She is house trained and walks well on leash. She gets very excited when she sees other dogs and would do well with an experienced owner. Tommie Girl would do best as the only dog in the house so she can get all the attention and training she needs.Estimated DOB 7/20/2016To meet Tommie Girl at an adoption event, please e-mail her foster at Melodythechamp@gmail.comPlease check our website at www.lostdogrescue.org to find out if I am still available.

My name is Maya, I am about 3 years old and I am from California. I was really sick and these really cool people from AZ came and saved my life. I had tick fever and even though its easily treated, the people in California were going to end me. I mean, seriously! Rude!I took a bunch of drugs and I'm all good. I have a lot of energy and love to play. I consider myself a rare and exotic beauty. You can totally tell in my pictures that I have beautiful hair and take care of myself. I expect the same from my adopter (at least the taking care of yourself - I don't really care about your hair).You know that feeling you get when you eat ice cream too fast? That really hurts doesn't it? But then you feel that relief and you realize that ice cream is just SO good. I LOVE ice cream. Oh yeah, back to my point...I want to feel that relief part. I want out of here. I need my very own human.I would love for you to come get me and take me home to get to know me. You can brush my beautiful hair and even give me a bath if you want. I'm smart and confident. I'm mild tempered and well mannered. I'm sure we could explore AZ together. I hear there are some pretty cool lakes here.If you can give Maya an indoor forever home, please fill out our online application on our website at http://www.savingpawsrescueaz.com/adoption-form/   We will only schedule meet and greets with an approved application. We are an all-volunteer organization.  It may take a couple of days to process an application and complete reference checks.Thank you for your interest in saving the life of a dog.

Toby is a handsome 2 year old cocker (mix?) He's a little afraid at first.  Toby is neutered.   He's up-to-date on his shots:  Rabies, Parvo/ Distemper, and Bordetella.  Toby has his microchip.  Toby came from a hoarding situation in California where there were 10 dogs in poor condition being kept outside.  Toby was fearful, running when he saw a human coming toward him.  Thanks to our wonderful foster in CA, Toby now walks well on a leash, is house-trained, and is well on his way to being a wonderful cuddler!!  He just wants to be loved!!  If you are interested in meeting or possibly adopting Toby, please contact Carla AFTER 12 NOON, Mon through Friday, by texting her at 480-993-5238.  It would also help us if you would email us at AdorableDogRescue@yahoo.com to let us know why your home would be terrific for this doggie.   Toby's adoption fee is $325.  His profile will be taken down the day that his adoption is done.  We can't wait to get this sweetie into a wonderful forever home!!

Waiting for my home sweet home! Hi My name is JACK and I am a TWO YEAR OLD MALE SHIHTZU, with a beautiful white and chocolate coat. I weigh 15 pounds FULL GROWN, so am small but sturdy. My breed is known to be great for people with ALLERGIES.I only have one eye that was injured so removed before  I came ot the rescue  but I get around fine and can see any treats coming my way as I love those  I am originally from California from a place they called a puppy mill  I don’t really know what that means, but I do know that I am feeling very Posh since arriving her in NY! I am very sweet and love people.  I’m used to living with other DOGS and am also good with CATS.    I promise you I’m willing and excited to have a wonderful life with a loving family of my very own. Come meet me soon; you’ll be so glad you did and so will I! Neutered with all my updated shots Please fill out this application by copying and pasting link into your browserhttps://poshpetsrescueny.org/dog-application/

Snuggle me and I am as happy as can be!I am Good, albeit submissive, with other DOGS as I truly get along with and love everyone. My name is KYA and I stunning FOUR YEAR old purebred FEMALE POMERANIAN with gorgeous golden hair. I weigh 12 pounds FULL GROWN. I was rescued from a puppy mill in California and am so happy to be in New york now so I can find a loving home of my own. I am shy at first, but am very sweet so please give me a chance to get to know you. You’ll be so glad you did. I have never walked on a leash before, so I am in the process of learning now. I am great with other DOGS and so far I’m not bothered by the CATS I’ve met. I cant wait to have my very own home and maybe a comfy dog bed just for me! Playful, sweetheart excited to find my forever family! Hi my name is OREO .  I am a handsome, fun loving TWO YEAR OLD MALE LABRADOR RETRIEVER mix weighing 75 pounds. I love children and would be great with all age  CHILDREN  I triy  climb in the children  that come to visit me as i think i am tiny Neutered with all my shots and microchip Housetrained Please fill out this application by copying and pasting link into your browserhttps://poshpetsrescueny.org/dog-application/

Hi My name is VALENTINO and I am a stunning, laid back and sweet,  ONE year old male AMERICAN STAFFORDSHIRE/BOXER  MIX weighing only 55 pounds. I have a beautiful shiny, lush dark chocolate coat and really, who doesn’t love chocolate?! When you come meet me, you will notice that I am smaller than I appear in photos. You’ll also notice that I am a calm, gentle boy who, despite my past, really just wants to know what it means to be loved, spoken to softly and held! I can be a little shy at first, but I truly love other DOGS and people. I am so grateful to have been rescued from California, to be given a chance to have a loving family.  Neutered with all my shots and microchip  Please fill in this applicationhttps://poshpetsrescueny.org/dog-application/

Golden girl Eleanor here and I’ve been told by many that I’m an absolute gem!  I’m a delightful 8 YEAR old MASTIFF mix weighing about 75lbs. My expressive hazel eyes will melt your heart and you’ll want to caress my softest, tawny fur. I’m a sweet, gentle giant with a heart of gold that brings a smile to the faces of all who meet me. I originally hailed from California, was brought into the LA shelter as a stray and then was scooped right up to come to NYC and become POSH! I’m Currently in a foster home on Long Island, where I love to romp around with five of my dog buddies! I’m a playful and loving girl who get along with just about everyone that she meets. I’m also very easy-going and am perfectly content to snuggle up with my people on the couch, or going on a nice leisurely walk. I love the company of other large dogs and humans of all ages!I can’t wait to have a forever home. Could you be the family that I have been waiting for? Fill out an application to meet her!Please fill out application on this linkhttps://poshpetsrescueny.org/dog-application/

DOGS, CATS AND OLDER CHILDREN FRIENDLYHi My name is KAISER and I am the gentlest, sweetest FOUR YEAR old male AMERICAN STAFFORDSHIRE MIX weighing 60 pounds. I’m a wonderful guy  with a whole lot of love to give to everyone I meet!  I can’t wait to find my forever home and promise you won’t be able to resist my smile! I didn’t mind at all; I love to socialize with DOGS of all sizes and with CATS.My foster mom tells me that I am extremely well behaved in the home and I am proud to say I am completely HOUSE TRAINED too. Some of my favorite past times are going on walks and swimming in a little pool.  As perfect as I am, I can be protective of my food and toys, so a home with young children that try to take my stuff, isn’t the best fit for me. until i get to know them Neutered and have all my shots and microchip Please fill out this application by copying and pasting link into your browserhttps://poshpetsrescueny.org/dog-application/

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Hi, my name is Kaia, and I came all the way from California. While the west coast has all the sunshine, I wanted to see how the mid-west farmers daughters lived. All the dog volunteers at Last Hope say I am the sweetest little girl, I love to snuggle, and give tons of kisses. I love to ride in the car and go for walks and I am super good at both! I am a very strong girl and need someone equally as strong. I am a princess and love all the attention so I will need to be the only pet in the house. I also need a home that has a privacy fence in case the neighbors have pets. So if you always wished they all could be California girls and wanted one of your own, then I am your girl.....Kaia’s adoption fee is $250 and includes her spay, micro chip and current vaccinations. Last Hope requires that all of our animals be kept on year round heart worm preventative and as indoor dogs only. Our adoption process includes a background check, personal and vet reference checks as well as a home visit.

Rocky came to us a couple of months ago from California. He is a very handsome and athletic guy! Look at that face! Rocky loves to play and is an active boy. He is tall and leggy! He also enjoys the company of other dogs. Rocky LOVES women, and is a bit leery of men. He has met some men he trusts and likes, but women are definitely his bag. We would love to find this wonderful guy the right home. He is currently in training with our friends at Kompletely K-9 Dog Training and Rehabilitation, so he knows all kinds of commands, so whoever adopts Rocky is getting a TRAINED dog!!!! That is a big deal! Rocky is housebroken and crate trained too! No kitties, though.Isn't there someone out there with a loving home for him? If you are an active home looking for a devoted companion, please fill out our online application to get the approval process started. We will not schedule meet and greets without an approved app on file. Here’s the link: www.miraclegsdmaine.org Please note that we will call your vet to ensure all current and prior dogs have been kept up to date on rabies and distemper at a minimum as well as annual heartworm test and a minimum of 6 mos heartworm preventative purchased per year. Any current animals must be spayed/neutered

Saweetie came to us from a high kill shelter in California.  She is approximately 3 years old, and super sweet.  When Saweetie was in CA she hurt her tail by wagging it too hard and it became infected, so we had it amputated.  She has the cutest little nub tail, now - it is adorable as is she.  Saweetie is quite small - only around 45-50 lbs.  She craves affection.  Saweetie has been with our trainer for a few weeks, and walks nicely on a leash, and knows several commands.  Saweetie is crate trained.  She is a little anxious so she will need a patient adopter - she craves attention and needs to gain some confidence.  She couldn't be more sweet.  Saweetie is good with other dogs upon proper intro.

**Courtesy Listing- please contact the owner directly**Cujo is a 4 year old, neutered male. He was a pound rescue at 4 months old, so we are unsure of his breed(s), but our best guess is lab/border collie. He is in need of a loving home that has no other pets and would be willing to put in the time and effort to rehabilitate him, as he is aggressive towards other dogs (the name is fitting, but wasn’t intended that way). Due to changes in our living situation and our dogs’ inability to get along, we are looking to re-home. He LOVES people and is very cuddly and sweet in the home... it’s just other dogs that are the issue with him, unfortunately. We hope to find him a new owner that can bring out the best in him and provide him with the most stress-free home possible. He is currently located in Alturas, California and we will be willing to transport him to his new owner. If you are interested in finding out more detail about him and his personality/current situation, please reach out to me (his owner, Samantha) via text or phone call at (805) 602-7332. Rehoming fee is $200.THIS IS A COURTESY LISTING. HUNAH IS NOT PLACING THIS DOG. PLEASE CONTACT THE OWNER DIRECTLY.

WEIGHT: 42.0 LBMeet BRADFORD! Bradford arrived at BrightSide from an overcrowded shelter in California with two other pups. Bradford is ready to start searching for a home of his own. Please read below to learn what Bradford needs. Bradford is a special needs adoption at this time. All three dogs came to us very under-socialized and fearful of humans. They are starting to make great progress on leash and working on their trust with humans. Bradford is starting to gain confidence on the leash but is still working on walks around the shelter. Bradford is the least trusting of humans out of the bunch and isn't seeking out attention yet. Bradford loves playing with the other pups and really relaxes and opens up around them. We think having another balanced dog will help Bradford a lot. Although Bradford is fearful, he has never tried to bite or showed any aggression whatsoever. And generally speaking he has handled everything we have needed to do with him well. However he will bolt to try to avoid humans still. He is a project dog that will require lots of training, confidence building, rehab, and patience from his new owner. It could be that Bradford will always be a bit unique but it really depends.We recommend researching what it takes to work with fearful/feral dogs. We have a couple local dog trainers in the area that we could refer anybody interested in adopting Bradford to that have some experience with dogs like him!Of course Bradford has no basic obedience training, is likely not potty trained, and will need to learn how to be brave in the big world. We hope that Bradford will continue to make progress at the shelter but are ready for him to start meeting new faces and making that perfect connection. We know it is a big commitment to adopt Bradford but he says \"I'm ready!\" to grow and learn with his forever person. It will be a rewarding experience for his future human to learn and grow with him. If you'd like to meet Bradford, please come to the shelter and talk with us. Adoption applications are available (1) online- www.brightsideanimals.org, or (2) BrightSide Animal Center in Redmond, OR. Adoption fee includes spay/neuter, current vaccinations, microchip, free veterinary wellness visit the first week and one month of free pet insurance.

Meet GERNSEY! Gernsey arrived at BrightSide from an overcrowded shelter in California with two other pups. Gernsey is ready to start searching for a home of her own. Biscuit (8 year-old Pug/Beagle) and Zoey (9 year-old Chihuahua) are life-long friends coming to CAWS from a loving home in California when their mom got sick. Both pups are housebroken, crate trained, good eaters, and good with dogs. Biscuit is happy-go-lucky and loves all humans. She weighs 21 pounds, but should be around 17. Biscuit has recently been diagnosed with Cushing’s Disease, which requires daily medication for the rest of her life. Zoey is feisty and a little stand-offish at first, but warms up with time. She is really tiny at just 4 pounds. Zoey recently underwent a dental cleaning and is doing great. Zoey is not a fan of being picked up or held, but tolerates it. She enjoys lying next to you and being petted. Biscuit requires sleeping with her human (and FYI she does snore). These two pups are both precious and love each other very much. CAWS will consider separating them, but feel we first need to give them a chance to find their forever home together. If you are interested in adopting a CAWS pet, please fill out an online application at http://caws.org/adoption-application

Tucker is the happiest little Min Pin with a wagging tail that wont quit! His tail is wagging so fast when he meets you there will be no need for air conditioning this summer! He is probably so happy to be getting a new chance at a forever home! He just arrived with his pup buddies from an overcrowded California shelter.  He has a slick black and brown coat that is just gorgeous! He likely knows he is good looking since he just prances thru the yard with his buddies. Tucker is very alert and so smart! He is going to excel at whatever training he receives to be the best of family members.  Please come and meet this happy little guy soon!  Tucker's DOB is 6/22/16 and he weighs 10.10 lbs.Dog adoption fee is $239. This includes the spay or neuter surgery, age appropriate current vaccines (distemper and rabies), microchip, and preventative flea treatment. Please stop by to see our adoptable dogs between 1pm-5pm Tuesday-Friday and 12pm-3pm on Saturdays. You are also welcome to contact us via email at emanimalhosp@aol.com. We hope to see you soon! These are rescue dogs, and we do not have any further information regarding behavior, training or past experiences. For the safety of the dogs, we need to verify residency for all adopters. Renters, please bring a copy of the lease showing that you are allowed to own a dog. Homeowners, please bring a copy of a mortgage statement proving you own your own home. We also require a copy of a utility bill with your name and address for all adopters. We encourage you to meet the pet you are applying for before submitting the application. Your application will not be approved until after you meet the pet. If you would like to print and fill out the application to bring with you to our shelter, visit our website at http://sunnyskysshelter.org/page9.html. *PLEASE NOTE - EMAILED APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED.*

Come and meet Link!  He is a bouncing and fun 7 month old Terrier mix puppy. He has an alert and energetic personality and is ready for anything! Link loves to play with the other small dogs. * Female Dachshund mix* Approximately 5 years old* Approximately 18.8 pounds* House trained* Crate trained* Okay with other dogs, not sureabout cats* Dog respectful children 8 and older* Adoption fee: $350All dogs with PUP are in private foster homes so we can provide our potential adopters the most current information available.Health: Sadie has been spayed and microchipped. She is current on her DHPP, Bordetella, and Rabies. She has been wormed and flea treated, and tested negative for heartworm.History: Sadie comes from an overcrowded shelter in California. PUP was asked to help and we are so glad we did. All dogs PUP pulls from California come with health certificates, as required by Washington state.Notes from Sadie's Foster Home:Sadie is very sweet and affectionate. She is also very playful. She loves running around the yard and playing chase. She loves her walks and is very good on leash. She’s also crate trained and will sleep in her crate at night and go in on her own when she wants her own space.She is potty trained. We keep her on a schedule and she will not potty in the house. Sadie is friendly and receptive to new people, environments, and dogs. She will let other dogs know when they’ve crossed her boundaries, encroached on her space, or are too close to her toys or treats. When we have a dog such as Sadie we make sure any high value items are not left on the floor to fight over and we also make sure she has an advocate in us. Oftentimes, dogs like Sadie think they have to fend for themselves. Knowing she has a leader that is fair and diligent, she is comfortable.We do not allow raw hide chews as even dogs who don’t fight over treats or toys will fight over raw hides. She is very polite at feeding time, sitting and waiting until given the okay to eat her food.Sadie is the sweetest little dog, with a huge personality. She is playful with good energy, but will mellow and relax when time for bed. She loves belly rubs, pets and scratches on her back and behind her ears. Believe it or not, she actually loves getting a bath; she has an affinity for the water. When on walks by the river, she will dive under the water if her foster mom doesn’t keep her away from the river’s edge.Sadie is a sweet, silly, bundle of love and a joy to have around. She is a great friend and companion. We’re looking for a home for Sadie that will step up and be a leader for her and show her she doesn’t have to fight her own battles. That she has an advocate. To teach her she doesn’t have to live on the offensive. A home that will show Sadie the love she desires and deserves.Note: The above description reflects the behavior we have observed in the dog's foster home. Although PUP provides adopters up to the minute information on our dogs, we cannot guarantee they will behave in the same manner in a different environment with new owners.ADOPTION: If you think you have room in your home and heart for this dog and you reside within Washington State, please go to our Adoption Information page, or copy and paste this link https://www.pupdogrescue.org/adopt.html in your browser. There you will find more information and be able to fill out an adoption application.EVENTS: To attend our next PUP adoption event, please check out our Facebook page, or copy and paste this link https://www.facebook.com/pg/puprescue/events/?ref=page_internal in your browser.Can you help save more dogs by Fostering?Become our fan on Facebook! Or follow us on Twitter!

He enjoys playing with other dogs (big or small) and he LOVES to carry around a fuzzy toy. Because of his fondness of having a dog buddy, we’re hoping to find him a home that has a resident dog already.Since he has been in our home he has become quite the little gentleman. He goes in his crate at night willingly and sleeps quietly all night long. He also eats in his crate. His energy level is in the medium range. We spend a fair amount of time outdoors but after a good romp, he is more than happy to settle in to a chair next to one of his people and snooze. Angus does enjoy barking at our cats but other than that he is pretty quiet. He’s just an all-around nice dog.Our trainer loves this little dude and has recommended a dog-savvy owner that won’t allow Angus to wrap you around his cute little paws. We had adopted him to someone who was more of a nurturer and he took total advantage of that, as dogs will sometimes do, and dictated when his walk ended by sitting down. We’re requiring our trainer speak with approved applicants so we ensure Angus has a forever home next time.Note: The above description reflects the behavior we have observed in the dog's foster home. I'M CALI MEYER! I'm honestly quite stunning! I could be a canine model due to my coloring, my smile, and my uniqueness! I'm a loving female Pit Bull Terrier /Dalamation mix who was recently saved from a California shelter. I am now waiting for my forever home. My rescuers are still learning more about me, but so far I've been sweet, friendly, and happy to be out of the shelter! I'm quite the beauty and photogenic, and I am 3 years old and weigh only 52 lbs. Can you foster or adopt me? My adoption fee of $400 covers spay, DA2PP shots, rabies, bordetella, heartworm test, microchip, health certificate, and transport cost from California to Seattle. The adoption fee helps cover the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals and more. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our veterinary bills. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501c3 organization.Pleaseemail for an adoption application.

* Please apply online at www.6dogrees.com by doing so you will get a response quicker.Meet Missy. A small 10 pound, 2-year old female Dachshund/Chihuahua mix. Her adoption fee is $475.Missy is very shy and takes time to warm up to people, but once comfortable she is loyal and loving.  Missy loves dogs and enjoys spending time with her four-legged friends. She has beautiful tan smooth coat and is low-shedding. She is potty trained and crated trained. Missy will require:-	A patient home that is willing to work to build her trust with people.-	A grain-free diet. This will help keep her healthy and her coat beautiful.  -	Grooming.  Missy is a “wash and wear” dog (very little grooming needed).-	A fully fenced yard.  Fences help protect rescue dogs and establish boundaries.  Missy is a rescue dog, and like all living creatures, she requires routine and stability. Please be prepared for a lifelong commitment before applying.  Ideally, dogs should be pottied every 4 to 5 hours. Dogs cannot be left alone for 8 hours per day. Home check and plan must be carefully thought out and presented at time of interview. Missy is fostered in North Seattle, and if interested please submit an online adoption application at www.6dogrees.com and we will review and get back to you promptly. An adoption application must be filled out for all inquiries and prior to a meet and greet. We will review and respond to applications, not all applications will necessarily be approved for a meet and greet. Home check prior to adoption approval. Adoption fee include: Neuter, microchip, current vaccines (DA2PP, rabies, Bordetella) de-worming, flea treatment, and heart worm testing.  We also include a 15-minute training consultation with a certified behaviorist trainer and 30-day pet insurance. 6dogrees Rescue is a small passionate Seattle based 501c3 non-profit charitable organization that focuses on saving the lives of urgent dogs on their last hours at high kill shelters  from the State of California where pet overpopulation is at epidemic levels and kill shelters are the norm. 100% of all fees collected are spent on the dogs, we “Save it forward”; so each time a dog is adopted we are allowed to save another. Adoption fees are non-negotiable and are in place to allow thorough care for the dogs. 6dogrees adoptions are limited to residents of Washington State.

Animal Profile: Zissou is an estimated 2-year-old, 67 lb neutered male German Shepherd mix who was just rescued from a shelter in San Bernardino. He was originally picked up as a stray and adopted, but returned when he got out of the yard he was left in. Zissou is settling in well into his foster home and his one heck of a study. He has all the right characteristics, food and praise motivated, smart and eager to to learn. He gets along well with the resident dog and loves all people. He hasn't meet toddlers but does well with children. He already knows a good amount of commands (sit, down, stay, come and shake) and does well on leash. He can also be stubborn and will do best with a handler who is familiar with his breed and can provide him the mental and physical stimulation required to be balanced pup. Zissou will be a great candidate for obedience or agility. He's also working on his fetch game and his foster is teaching him to catch a frisbee. He's not a huge fan of being left home alone just yet (his foster mom is working on that) and he isn't a good candidate for apartment living.Adoption Info:Adoption fee is $475, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: Zissou was picked up as a stray and brought to a high kill shelter in San Bernadino. He was adopted and returned for escaping from the yard. He is arriving to Seattle on Sunday June 16th and will be available for adoption in the Seattle Area after evaluation in a foster home.

*PLEASE NOTE PUPPIES  WILL BE AT THE SHELTER Tuesday JUNE 25TH AND Wednesday JUNE 26TH **Moe, Moo, Minnie, Mazy, and Mickey are our newest litter of roly polly playful puppies! Their mama Millie is a terrier mix who arrived from an overcrowded California shelter ready to give birth any day. She was fostered by one of our amazing volunteers and had 5 beautiful puppies! All are sweet and loving pups!  And Mama Millie has been the best little mama ever!They have been introduced to young understanding children, patient kitties, and other dogs too.  These are the cutest pups are will all make a wonderful addition to their new forever families.  Moe along with his siblings will need lots of puppy training to be the best of family members.  Per Moe's foster family Moe is the greeter of the litter and so fun loving! Come and meet the \"team\" soon!  Their DOB is 4/25/19.Puppy adoption fee is $360 plus a refundable deposit of $50 to be returned at the assigned date of spay surgery. This includes the spay or neuter surgery, age appropriate current vaccines (distemper and rabies), microchip, and preventative flea treatment.  Please stop by to see our adoptable dogs between 1pm-5pm Tuesday-Friday and 12pm-3pm on Saturdays. You are also welcome to contact us via email at emanimalhosp@aol.com. We hope to see you soon! These are rescue dogs, and we do not have any further information regarding behavior, training or past experiences. For the safety of the dogs, we need to verify residency for all adopters. Renters, please bring a copy of the lease showing that you are allowed to own a dog. Homeowners, please bring a copy of a mortgage statement proving you own your own home. We also require a copy of a utility bill with your name and address for all adopters. We encourage you to meet the pet you are applying for before submitting the application. Your application will not be approved until after you meet the pet. If you would like to print and fill out the application to bring with you to our shelter, visit our website at http://sunnyskysshelter.org/page9.html. *PLEASE NOTE - EMAILED APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED

* Male Chihuahua mix* Approximately 2 years old* Approximately 9 pounds* House trained* Crate trained* Okay with other dogs, not sureabout cats* Dog respectful children 8 and older* Adoption fee: $285All dogs with PUP are in private foster homes so we can provide our potential adopters the most current information available.Health: Earl has been neutered and microchipped. He is current on his DHPP, Bordetella, and Rabies. He has been wormed, flea treated, and tested negative for heartworm.History: Earl comes from an overcrowded shelter in California. PUP was asked to help and we are so glad we did. All dogs PUP pulls from California come with health certificates, as required by Washington state.Notes from Earl's Foster Home: We like Earl so much that we'd like to keep all his good qualities a secret so we can enjoy fostering him for longer, but that's not really fair to Earl, so it's time to share all about him so that the fantastic family that he deserves can find him soon!Earl gets along so easily with all the people and dogs in our home and has been an easy pup to fold into our household. He's just as likely to cuddle up in a dog bed with any one of our dogs as he is to find a little spot to cuddle in next to us adults or our teen kids.Though he would honestly prefer to sleep on someone's bed each night, he does sleep quietly in his crate once he's been given the chance to snuggle up with us on the bed first and thereafter he hops into his crate and enjoys a few bites of kibble as a treat before we put a blanket over his crate and tell him goodnight.Earl has also learned to be in his crate for shorter periods in the daytime; he may fuss a bit in his crate if he knows we are home, but typically settles down in a few minutes (especially if we cover his crate). He also rides quietly crated in the car when we go for walks further from home or take him to pet-friendly places to help him see more of the world.Earl's chihuahua side comes out when he gets the chance to sun himself in the fenced backyard on a sunny day - he really loves just hanging out in the sun (or sleeping in a dog bed in a sunspot)! He is good about not barking when he sees or hears the neighbors and is overall a quiet dog.Earl enjoys taking walks alongside the other dogs in our house but is less confident when walking by himself and/or in new areas we haven't explored before. He can be shy initially in new situations but often warms up to new places and new people if he's given some time to acclimate and also given the courtesy of being able to approach new people rather than have them want to approach and pet him immediately. He has been appropriate with visitors to our home and willing to befriend people so long as we are respectful of his need to have some choice in how quickly he approaches new people. We have not seen Earl around young children or cats, so cannot say how he would behave in those situations.In case it's not already apparent, we adore Earl and his easy-going, easy to live with, snuggly ways! If you think Earl might be the sort of family member you would pick to share your life with, please let us know by filling out an application with PUP so that you can meet Earl soon.Note: The above description reflects the behavior we have observed in the dog's foster home. Although PUP provides adopters up to the minute information on our dogs, we cannot guarantee they will behave in the same manner in a different environment with new owners.ADOPTION: If you think you have room in your home and heart for this dog and you reside within Washington State, please go to our Adoption Information page, or copy and paste this link https://www.pupdogrescue.org/adopt.html in your browser. There you will find more information and be able to fill out an adoption application.EVENTS: To attend our next PUP adoption event, please check out our Facebook page, or copy and paste this link https://www.facebook.com/pg/puprescue/events/?ref=page_internal in your browser.Can you help save more dogs by Fostering?Become our fan on Facebook! Or follow us on Twitter!

My name is Grizzly Bear Fox from California and I am a wonderful 8 week old Male Brussels Griffon Mix who was from a high-kill shelter in California where no one wanted me. I am a happy dog at only 6 lbs! Take me on car rides, walks in the park and I will become your very best friend. I get along great with people of all ages, gentle kids, with other dogs but have not been around cats before. I am a great dog that will do best in a home with a loving family that can give me lots of exercise, love and affection! Our pet rescue dog trainer would be happy to come to your home and help train with your new dog for only $75. and this is highly recommended. We are pre-adopting and I will be ready in 30 more days. My adoption fee of $1495. That covers when puppy is ready for Spay/Neuter, and all puppy shots up until dog is adopted , Bordetella, Deworm, Grooming, Microchip, Boarding Fees, Health Certificate, and transport cost from CALIFORNIA to SEATTLE. The adoption fee is firm and will go directly to Greenwood Vet ~ the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals and more. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501 C 3 Organization. Please email for an adoption application.

* Male Maltese mix* Approximately 2 years old* Approximately 17.5 pounds* House trained* Working on crate training* Okay with other dogs* Not good with cats* Dog respectful children 8 and older* Adoption fee: $500All dogs with PUP are in private foster homes so we can provide our potential adopters the most current information available.Health: Jacob has been neutered and microchipped. He is current on his DHPP, Bordetella, and Rabies. He has been wormed, flea treated, and tested negative for heartworm.History: Jacob comes from an overcrowded shelter in California. PUP was asked to help and we are so glad we did. All dogs PUP pulls from California come with health certificates, as required by Washington state.Notes from Jacob's Foster Home: This tall, lanky lad is such a sweet dog! Jacob LOVES his people and how can you help but melt into those sweet eyes of his?! He is very willing to please and make connections, often flooding you with lots of kisses. He already knows a few basic commands and is learning and benefiting from boundaries. That said, he is well-behaved and quick to follow direction. He hasn’t had much experience with kids and is still learning how to interact with cats. He likes other dogs and will occasionally play.Jacob has had a few accidents in his foster home but is proving to be housetrained. He doesn’t like the crate and will whine a bit but does eventually stop and hasn’t had any accidents in the crate. He rarely barks except when he needs to go outside. He likes walks and does fairly well on them with little to no training. He prefers to take care of his business during walks.Jacob has been known to get mischievous and would benefit from basic house rules and continued training. He would do well in a variety of families as he is easy-going and low energy with a few spurts of energy. He loves to snuggle inside and explore outside and, like most dogs, would do well with continued socialization. He is such a sweet and loving dog and will make a great addition to his new home.Note: The above description reflects the behavior we have observed in the dog's foster home. Sam came north from California after hearing stories about the abundance of comfy beds and fleece-covered people looking for a snuggle buddy. The road, being a tempting and tempestuous mistress, has left our sweet boy rather nervous of people and his lack of confidence is a thing he’ll need help nurturing. Though clearly bred for finer things like hot dog bits and overstuffed couches, Sam yearns for affection and stability even more than fine cutlery and an evening at the opera. A good fit for Sam would be a quiet home without kids. We think he would also really enjoy (and thrive) with another canine companion and we’d love to find a family whose heart is big enough to adopt both Sam and his devoted sidekick, Dexter. Echo Glen Children's Center is a youth correctional facility located approximately 40 minutes east of Seattle. Canine Connections is a program that pairs the at-risk youth at Echo Glen with dogs that have not yet found successful placements. In this program the youth are taught how to train the dogs in basic obedience through a reward based system. Since Sam is still quite fearful of his environment, our primary goal is improving his comfort around people. He has been exhibitiing less stress around strangers with each day. .   Please note that our adoption fee is $300.Please E-mail canineconnectionsrescue@gmail.com (preferred) or call 425-831-2578 for additional information and to schedule an opportunity to meet our awesome dogs.Thanks for considering a rescue dog!  It's wonderful gift to yourself and your new best friend.
