Animal Profile:Chica is an estimated 2 to 3-year-old 12 lb spayed female Terrier Miniature Schnauzer mix who arrived to our rescue on June 2 from San Bernardino. She was surrendered by an owner who had an overcrowded house of dogs (cited by animal control). Chica is reportedly house trained and does well with other dogs. Stay tuned for more information as we get to know her.Seattle Foster Updates:Chica is still very timid and not accustomed to the leash or baths! She did great having her face groomed. She is doing wonderful with crate training (no accidents). She seems scared of big dogs -- when she sees them from a distance she's ready to run. She is still adjusting and we will be working on building her trust and confidence. We can't wait to see Chica blossom!Adoption Info:Adoption fee is $475, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: Chica was relinquished by an individual who was cited for animal hoarding in San Bernadino and will arrived to Seattle on Sunday June 2nd. She will be available for adoption after evaluation in a Seattle area foster home.

Animal Profile:Mamuska is an estimated 4-year-old, 11 lb spayed female Terrier Miniature Schnauzer mix who just arrived to our rescue from San Bernardino and is now in a Seattle area foster home. She was surrendered by an owner who had an overcrowded house of dogs and was cited by animal control. Mamuska is still pretty timid in her new surroundings, but she's starting to come out of her shell and is enjoying exploring the house and yard. She is avoiding the cat in the home that is twice her size, but she doesn't seem afraid of it. She does well with other dogs. She's working on learning to walk on leash, and her really cute \"party trick\" is walking/hopping on her hind legs when she wants food! We'll post more information as we get to know her.Seattle Foster Update: Mamuska is doing great and settling in well. She could care less about cats, is mostly housebroken, knows sit and aims to please. She is okay on leash but will need some training after she gets used to all the outside sounds and activity. She is close to being ready for her furever home, and will do best in a home with teens or adults.Adoption Info:Adoption fee is $475, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: Mamuska was relinquished by an individual who was cited for animal hoarding in San Bernardino. She will be available for adoption after evaluation in a Seattle area foster home.

*Please submit a online adoption application to receive a response.We are a small  all volunteer rescue with full time jobs. We do not have enough hours in the day to answer questions without a application. Before applying please note we require fully structured fenced yard.Meet \"Freeman\" He is a 6 mo.old  20 pound Rescue Breed. Possibly a mix of Golden Retriever - Cocker Spaniel Shepherd. Freeman is current on all vaccines, altered, and Microchipped. Adoption fee 550.00 includes all current vetting, and 30 days free pet insurance. We do not know Freeman's past history as he was saved from a high kill shelter in CA on his last hour. In his foster home he is flourowand is enrolled  in doggy daycare for socialization. Freeman likes stuffed toys, belly scratches and playing. His energy is puppy -medium energy and will require s home with a fully structured fenced yard. Freeman will thrive in puppy classes and is required to help him build confidence and bonding with his humans. A home with a fully structured secure fenced yard is required.Freeman is a little people cautious but warms up quickly. A experienced past dog home with puppy patience, and positive reward base training will help him trust and love. Freeman is a puppy that shows signs of not really being around people much and hes learning people are ok. Freeman  must never be let off leash outside the home.He is a puppy and puppies will chew - he will need plenty of chew toys and stimulation to guide his success. Dedication and positive reinforcement is a must. He would be fine solo or with another dog close in age. A dog his speed would be a bonus. Freeman will require a owner who is dedicated to training him. He is a love bug, fast learner and will make a great addition to the right  home. Freeman lives inside the home and not to be left unattended in a yard. If away from the home longer than 4 hrs a doggy day care or dog walker must be in place. If interested please submit an adoption application at www.6dogrees.com  The adoption fee is $550.00. Fee's are not negotiable. The fee is needed in order for us to \"save it forward\" for the next dog.The fee covers spay/neuter, DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordatella, deworming, flea treatment, Heart-worm testing, microchip, microchip, boarding, grooming, health certificates, and transport cost from California to Seattle. This adoption fee will also go towards helping many of our rescued dogs who are in desperate need of surgeries, dental and teeth extractions, hernias, cherry eye removals, medications and boarding fees. Freeman s fostered North of Seattle.WA State adoption only.

Animal Profile: Frisco is a 1- to 2-year old, 55 lb male Lab/Shepherd mix who was rescued from a high kill shelter in California. He is a stunning boy with black and brindle mottling and perfectly white teeth that suggest that he's young. Frisco is happy, wiggly, easygoing, smart as a whip, and wants to greet everyone. He's just an all-around great dog, and gorgeous too! He is house trained and crate trained and currently being fostered with other dogs and a cat and gets along with everyone. We will consider a home with a dog-savvy cat, but no skittish kitties. Frisco does have a lot of energy but knows how to settle as well.Foster Highlights:\"Get up and go\" type of dog but after physical/mental activity will settle in for a nap or to chew on a boneCurrently lives with 5 dogs and plays well with othersWorking on tendency to jump upAffectionate and likes to be near his personLoves to go for walks - can be whiny passing barky/reactive dogs but otherwise well behavedStill has a lot of puppy energyAdoption Info: Adoption fee is $475, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.org

WONDERFUL HAPPY-GO-LUCKY FAMILY DOG!!!Animal Profile: Banner is a sweet and mellow male German Shepherd/Retriever mix who is about 5 years old. He was rescued from a high-kill shelter in California after being picked up as a stray (but we know he had a home because he was quite \"fluffy\") and is now in a Seattle area foster home. He is described as a \"soft soul\"-- a calm and peaceful guy. He knows basic commands and is non-reactive to other dogs. Stay tuned for more information as we get to know him!Seattle Foster Update: Banner is settling in super well in our full house. He is on a little diet to lose a few pounds. He is such a gem of a dog and deserves the best family. He is house-trained and dog-door trained; we have not been using the crate. He gets along well with all of our dogs and wants to play. He is curious about the cats but respectful without a fuss when we tell him to \"leave it.\" Just in the last day or so he has started to play with toys and chew on bones. He will likely do great with a kid for a buddy and will be an all-around great family dog.Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $475, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: This dog was rescued from euthanasia at a high-kill shelter in California and will be available for adoption in Seattle, once evaluated in a loving foster home in the greater Seattle area.

* Male Terrier mix* Approximately 3.5 year old* Approximately 10 pounds* House trained on a schedule* Crate trained* Okay with other dogs, not sureabout cats* Dog respectful children 8 and older* Adoption fee: $485All dogs with PUP are in private foster homes so we can provide our potential adopters the most current information available.Health: Scott has been neutered and microchipped. He is current on his DHPP, Bordetella, and Rabies. He has been wormed, flea treated, and tested negative for heartworm.Scott has had FHO (Femoral Head Osteotomy) surgery at some point, according to our vet, specialist, and x-rays, but as far as when he had it… that can’t be determined based on what they saw. Our vet is happy to talk with anyone scheduled to meet him, to answer all questions and set Scott up for success. We have been asked to treat him like a patient at four weeks after FHO surgery and walk Scott slowly on leash so he places that back leg on the ground and uses it, instead of lifting it up when he moves faster. Our vet team also suggest that he “swim” in a bathtub to build up those back leg muscles. He is not in any pain.History:Scottcomes from an overcrowded shelter in California. PUP was asked to help and we are so glad we did. All dogs PUP pulls from California come with health certificates, as required by Washington state.Notes fromScott's Foster Home: Scott is truly a diamond in the rough! He’s the kind of dog with a well-meaning heart that needs (and enjoys) training and boundaries. When he first got into his foster home, he was a little timid but quickly learned he was in a safe space and was comfortable.Although he doesn’t prefer his crate, he is very good in it and doesn’t have accidents or whine. He hasn’t had any accidents in the house but he did try to mark when he first got into the home and didn’t know the space. He should be monitored and worked with in any new situations.Scott also enjoys going on walks and seeing all there is to see. He is working on leash training but does really well with correction. At times, he really likes all fun things like crows or possibly other dogs, but he responds well to correction and quickly only has eyes for you. Like with most dogs, he would excel with continued socialization and training. He enjoys being outside and relaxing in the sun but really likes to be with his humans.Scott has done well with the other dogs in his foster home and should continue to be great with proper introductions. His behavior around cats or dogs is unknown. He has a medium to low energy – he is happy to go on new adventures but also enjoys relaxing with his humans in front of a good movie. He can’t wait to find his forever home soon.Note: The above description reflects the behavior we have observed in the dog's foster home. Although PUP provides adopters up to the minute information on our dogs, we cannot guarantee they will behave in the same manner in a different environment with new owners.ADOPTION: If you think you have room in your home and heart for this dog and you reside within Washington State, please go to our Adoption Information page, or copy and paste this link https://www.pupdogrescue.org/adopt.html in your browser. Hi! My name is Beau! I was rescued from the euth list in CA and am looking to find my perfect match in WA. I am a 2.5-year-old pittie mix looking for my forever home! I am about 60 lbs and very active. I get along well with my canine friends but kitties are a no no for me. My family wish list would be: loving, adventurous, and fun! I am fully vaccinated, neutered, and microchipped. If you would like me to meet me please email Ashley at pnwpack@gmail.comThis is not a Hello Pitty Rescue dog; we urge you to do your own evaluation.

Animal Profile: Lucas is an 11-month-old, 40 lb neutered male black and tan Shepherd mix who just joined us from California. He loves people and other dogs and loves to play with the resident dog in his foster home. He likes toys -- and especially loves squeaky toys. Lucas is working on not jumping, sit and wait. He does well on the leash -- he doesn't heel just yet but he's smart and will learn in no time. He will do best with an active family that is committed to continuing his training and exercise. We will add more information as we get to know him.Adoption Info:Adoption fee is $475, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: Lucas was picked up as a stray and brought to a high kill shelter in California. He was rescued by a kennel based group in California and they've had trouble placing him due to lack of interest, so we have agreed to take him in. He is available for adoption in the Seattle area.

My name is Odie BB and I am a wonderful super sweet 6 year old Male Poodle who was just saved from a high-kill shelter in California where no one wanted me. I am a happy dog at 10 lbs. Take me on car rides, walks in the park and I will become your very best friend. I get along great with people of all ages, gentle kids, other dogs but have not been around cats before. I am a great dog that will do best in a home where I am the ONLY dog and with a loving family that can give me lots of exercise, love, and affection! My adoption fee of $650. covers Spay/Neuter, DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordetella, Deworm, Advantage Flea Treatment, Heart Worm Test, Grooming, Microchip, Boarding Fees, Health Certificate, and transport cost on ALASKA AIRLINES from CALIFORNIA to SEATTLE. The adoption fee is firm and helps cover the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals, and more. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501 C 3 Organization. Please email for an adoption application

Animal Profile: Theo is an adorable 6-month-old, 5 lb teacup Chihuahua mix who was rescued from a high kill shelter in California. He is settling into his foster home in Seattle and doing wonderfully. His foster mom says: \"Theo is such a fun little guy! He has lots of playful puppy energy when it comes to toys, but he does calm down and likes to snuggle on the couch or curl up in his crate. He's working on his crate training and house training. He's doing well at sleeping through the night, and doesn't whine or bark while in the crate. He hasn't really shown any interest in my cats, and he met my mom's young doxie and did well with her. Theo barks at other dogs and strangers, but it's an alert bark or two and he stops when we correct him. And he walks well on leash once we get going. He's a really sweet guy!\" We will share more info as we get to know him.Seattle Foster Update: \"Theo is so freaking cute!!! Loves to play, getting better at sitting and waiting for treats (when you’re firm), house trained on a schedule, only really barks when he is startled or excited and wants to say hi or play but is very quiet otherwise, calms down and gets very chill, loves to snuggle... he’s such an adorable little guy! He has met and done well with respectful dogs big and small. It will be hard to let Theo go, but he deserves a forever family of his own!\"Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $475, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: This dog was picked up as a stray in San Bernadino and brought to high-kill San Bernadino City Shelter. We rescued him and he will be available for adoption once evaluated in a loving foster home in the greater Seattle area.

Animal Profile:Nettie (rolls off the tongue better than 'Nadine') is an estimated 3-year-old, 59 lb spayed female German Shepherd who we just saved from a high-kill shelter in California. She is cautious but friendly meeting people and is friendly with large and small dogs with proper introductions. She is house trained, crate trained, food motivated, playful, loyal, and - true to her breed - loves to be with her person. She is responsive to correction, sensitive and intelligent. Nettie will benefit from a dog-savvy, experienced Shepherd owner who can help build her confidence so she can become the best dog she can be.Adoption Info:Adoption fee is $475, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. She has been transferred to our rescue and will be going to a foster home. She will be available for adoption once evaluated in a Seattle area foster home.About Foster to Adopt Program:Fosters provide a safe landing spot for dogs transitioning from the shelter environment and help prepare the dogs for adoption. You provide the love and structure, and we take care of everything else! We cover all vet care, and drive the adoption process. Average length of foster is 2-3 weeks. Fosters do get first consideration for adoption, if desired.Apply to foster online at www.doggoneseattle.org/foster-application

Animal Profile: Dorothy is a 3-year-old female American Bully mix who is a real hoot! She absolutely loves all people, loves to snuggle and hang out on the couch, and enjoys leisurely walks through the neighborhood. She just loves to meet new people, get pets, and play in the yard. She is house trained, and her foster mom reports that she is super quiet and calm in her crate. Dorothy is currently being fostered by a dog trainer, so she is getting a great head start on her basic manners and commands. She will do best with a dog-savvy family who will provide her with structure and continued training. Dorothy is so sweet and well-behaved when out and about. She is non-reactive to other dogs on leash, but she is not a dog that will enjoy going to the dog park or meeting unfamiliar dogs on the street. She lives in a house with other dogs now and is doing great, but she needs a slow introduction to new doggy friends. If you are looking for a sweet, spunky snuggle buddy, Dorothy is your girl!Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $450, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. WOOF! I'm Zoey Meyer and I have the best smile! I was recently saved from a California shelter and what an experience that was! The shelter staff loved me so much they worked hard to get me out. I was used forbreeding and then discarded, but now those days are long over. I'm ready for a home, a family, a place to take naps, and receive lots of love and some good food. I am currently kenneled and would be soappreciative if someone could foster or adopt me. I tested well with other dogs at the shelter - and in fact, I was such a good girl that they used me to test other dogs. I am a 3 year old female pit bull terrier and weigh about 63 lbs.Can you please give me a chance at a great home? I'm a wonderful girl. My adoption fee of $400 covers spay, DA2PP shots, rabies, bordetella, heartworm test, microchip, and other costs. The adoption fee alsohelps cover the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501c3 organization.Pleaseemail for an adoption application. * Please apply online at www.6dogrees.com by doing so you will get a response quicker.Meet Brienne. A small 8-pound, 1 yr old -female, spayed Terrier/Pekinese mix.  I am microchipped and current with all vaccines my adoption fee is $550.Brienne is an adorable little girl with a silly personality.  She is very smart snd as great listener! Brienne loves to play with her stuffed toys and nd her favorite is playing fetch with a tennis ball.Once comfortable with her people she is very playful and entertaining. She loves to run and play with other dogs and enjoys a game of chase with the pack. Brienne would be a wonderful addition for a family looking for second (or third) dog.Brienne is potty-trained  - she is a super smart girl who will flourishin basic obedience training.  Brienne is potty trained and sleeps quickly through the night (9 PM – 6 AM).  She is good riding in the car and likes to be with her people.Brienne is a very sweet special  girl who deserves the best forever home.Brienne is seeking a semi active home with plenty of toy toss and hands on interaction. 2 daily walks at minimum. I est grain free kibble and wet food mixed together 2x per day.Requirements:-	A fully secured fenced yard (physical fence, invisible fences are not permitted)-	A family with no children under 12-years of age.Brienne is a rescue dog and will require routine and stability. Please be prepared for a lifelong commitment before applying.  Ideally, they should be pottied every 4 to 5 hours. Dogs cannot be left alone for 8 hours per day. Home check and plan must be carefully thought out and presented at time of interview. Brienne is fostered in North Seattle,  If interested please submit an online adoption application at: www.6dogrees.com and we will review and get back to you promptly. An adoption application must be filled out for all inquiries and prior to a meet and greet. We will review and respond to applications, not all applications will necessarily be approved for a meet and greet. Home check prior to adoption approval. Adoption fee include: Spay, microchip, recent dental, current vaccines (DA2PP, rabies, bordatella) de-worming, flea treatment, and heart worm testing.  Adoption includes 30-days of pet insurance. 6dogrees Rescue is a small passionate Seattle based 501c3 non-profit charitable organization that focuses on saving the lives of urgent dogs on their last hours at high kill shelters  from the State of California where pet overpopulation is at epidemic levels and kill shelters are the norm. 100% of all fees collected are spent on the dogs, we “Save it forward”; so each time a dog is adopted we are allowed to save another. Adoption fees are non-negotiable and are in place to allow thorough care for the dogs. 6dogrees adoptions are limited to residents of Washington State.

* Female German Shepard Dog mix* Approximately 6 months old*Approximately 22 pounds* House trained on a schedule* Working on crate training* Okay with other dogs, not sureabout cats* Dog respectful children 8 and older* Adoption fee: $500All dogs with PUP are in private foster homes so we can provide our potential adopters the most current information available.Raising a puppy requires a lot of work and is a commitment! Vivienne will be an awesome addition to a family that can give her the attention, exercise, training and affection she deserves.Due to the fact that this is a mixed breed puppy, we, nor our vets, cannot guarantee the size that your dog will be.Health: Vivienne has been spayed and microchipped. She is current on her DHPP, Bordetella, and Rabies. She has been wormed, flea treated, and tested negative for heartworm.History: Vivienne comes from an overcrowded shelter in California. PUP was asked to help and we are so glad we did. All dogs PUP pulls from California come with health certificates, as required by Washington state.Notes from Vivienne's Foster Home: Vivienne is a very smart little girl. She is coming along well with her house and crate training and seems to pick up on things quickly. She is extremely lovable and enjoys playing with her other foster pups but will also sit quietly at your feet and is always up for a good belly rub. Vivienne will be a wonderful addition to a family that has the time to give her the love, structure and exercise she will need.Note: The above description reflects the behavior we have observed in the dog's foster home. Although PUP provides adopters up to the minute information on our dogs, we cannot guarantee they will behave in the same manner in a different environment with new owners.ADOPTION: If you think you have room in your home and heart for this dog and you reside within Washington State, please go to our Adoption Information page, or copy and paste this link https://www.pupdogrescue.org/adopt.html in your browser. Or follow us on Twitter!

My name is Lacey from California and I am a wonderful 2 year old Female Shepherd and Pit Bull Mix who was just saved from a high-kill shelter inCaliforniawhere no one wanted me. I am a happy dog at 78 lbs. and a nice lap dog where I would love to cuddle with you. Take me on car rides, walks in the park and I will become your very best friend. I get along great with people of all ages, gentle kids, with other dogs but have not been around cats before. I am a great dog that will do best in a home with a loving family that can give me lots of exercise, love and affection!Our pet rescue dog trainer would be happy to come to your home and help train with your new dog for only $75. and this is highly recommended.My adoption fee of $550. covers Spay/Neuter, DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordetella, Deworm, Advantage Flea Treatment, Heart Worm Test, Grooming, Microchip, Boarding Fees, Health Certificate, and transport cost from CALIFORNIA to SEATTLE. The adoption fee is firm and helps cover the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals and more. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501 C 3 Organization.

Animal Profile: Sidney is a 2-year-old, 17 lb male terrier mix who joined us from a high-kill shelter in California. He was afraid of everything when he got here, but through the care, love and patience of foster families he is really coming out of his shell! Sidney has learned how to walk on a secure leash/harness, and will do best in a home with a fully fenced yard. He really opened up when he was moved to a foster home with other dogs, so we are looking for a family with another canine companion for him to bond with. Sidney takes a lot of social cues from the dogs in his pack, and is much more confident with another dog around. He likes to snuggle, and becomes a human shadow when he bonds with someone, so you never have to fear being alone with Sidney around!Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $475, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: This dog was rescued from euthanasia at a high-kill shelter in California and will be available for adoption in Seattle, once evaluated in a loving foster home in the greater Seattle area.

Jasmine currently weighs approx 6 pounds and may be in the 10-pound range as an adult. She will do best with a dog savvy person who really knows little dogs and has a soft approach. Jasmine likes to sleep in bed at nite and tuck in close for warmth. she will wake you in the morning by touching her nose to your nose very gently.Jasmine is a darling little girl who will make someone very happy. I can see her as a teenagers therapy dog, if there are other dogs in the home . She must have other dogs for mentoring and companionship. We tried to adopt her as an only dog with a cat companion and she was miserable. Jazzy has been in a pack of dogs since she was 5 weeks old and she loves it! she will make a great addition to your small dog pack.Jasmine has an adoption fee of $550.00. Animal Profile: Keegan is a sweet, smart 2-year-old male mixed breed weighing 51 lbs. The shelter called him a pitbull but he looks more like a Rhodesian Ridgeback/Black Mouth Cur mix to us. He is a friendly and playful boy with people and respectful with both male and female dogs when he was temperament testing at the shelter. He has also played well with a male German Shepherd in foster care and is currently being fostered with a large breed female dog without any issues. He briefly met a dog-savvy cat face to face and showed zero interest or aggression. He’s good on leash and is doing great at potty training (no accidents in his foster home). He’s also good in the car. He’s pretty high energy and will be a good fit for an active family—and a good jogging/running partner. He has an insatiable appetite for companionship, so a home where his family is around a lot will be best. He’d like a fenced yard, or at least a home where he gets outside on leash a lot. We will share more information about him as we get to know him.Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $475, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: This dog was rescued from euthanasia at a high-kill shelter in California and will be available for adoption in Seattle, once evaluated in a loving foster home in the greater Seattle area.

Animal Profile: Widget is a sweet 3-year-old, 11 lb neutered male terrier mix who was surrendered (along with several other dogs) from a hoarding situation in San Bernardino. He is now settling into foster care in Seattle and doing great! He is truly coming out of his shell, and showing his sweet, affectionate and playful side. His foster mom says: \"Widget is truly a sweetheart and is so easy to have around. He is great with kids and ignores our cat. He does well in his crate and hasn't shown a vocal side. Widget would be great at work with his person. He loves to lounge near me while I work and rarely makes a sound. I think he'd like to have a canine companion in his forever home. When my husband gets home he picks him up and carries him around the house, which Widget loves. While Widget's a little shy, he has a super sweet temperament.\"Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $475, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: This dog was surrendered to our rescue from a hoarding situation in the San Bernardino area. This dog will be available for adoption in Seattle, once evaluated in a loving foster home in the greater Seattle area.About Foster to Adopt Program: Fosters provide a safe landing spot for dogs transitioning from the shelter environment and help prepare the dogs for adoption. You provide the love and structure, and we take care of everything else! We cover all vet care, and drive the adoption process. Average length of foster is 2-3 weeks. Fosters do get first consideration for adoption, if desired.Apply to foster online at www.doggoneseattle.org/foster-application

Lila is trying to understand and adapt to her move from California to Washington.  She arrived from an overcrowded California shelter for a chance at a forever family! Lila is a sweet 3 year old Chi/Cattle dog mix who will take a treat gently but is looking at us with questions in her eyes.  Every day we see a delightful happiness in her as she realizes she is loved. Lila is treat oriented and will sit sweetly when asked.  She is so smart and with kind words and patience we are seeing what a wonderful little girl she is!  Lila would do best in a home with a person with small dog experience.  Lila is a lovely very intelligent little pup you need to meet! Her DOB is 4/10/16 and she weighs 19 lbs.Dog adoption fee is $239. This includes the spay or neuter surgery, age appropriate current vaccines (distemper and rabies), microchip, and preventative flea treatment. Please stop by to see our adoptable dogs between 1pm-5pm Tuesday-Friday and 12pm-3pm on Saturdays. You are also welcome to contact us via email at emanimalhosp@aol.com. We hope to see you soon! These are rescue dogs, and we do not have any further information regarding behavior, training or past experiences. For the safety of the dogs, we need to verify residency for all adopters. Renters, please bring a copy of the lease showing that you are allowed to own a dog. Homeowners, please bring a copy of a mortgage statement proving you own your own home. We also require a copy of a utility bill with your name and address for all adopters. We encourage you to meet the pet you are applying for before submitting the application. Your application will not be approved until after you meet the pet. If you would like to print and fill out the application to bring with you to our shelter, visit our website at http://sunnyskysshelter.org/page9.html. *PLEASE NOTE - EMAILED APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED

HI - I'M DOMINIC MEYER! I'm so lucky to have been saved from a scary California shelter! You will find my sweet face and personality hard to resist. I have a patch over one eye and adorable floppy and speckled ears. But my best trait isn't my dashing good looks, but my loving and easy-going personality. I am dog friendly and love people, too! I'd make a wonderful walking and hiking companion, and a lovable bed snuggler! I'd enjoy hanging out, simply watching TV or maybe going to the beach? I'm loyal to a fault and will be your best friend. I'm a medium-sized 3 year old male pit mix, possibly part pointer or hound, and I weigh about 50 lbs. I'm a bit skinny now but will put on weight now that I'm getting the care I need. Can you foster or adopt me?My adoption fee is covers neuter, DA2PP shots, rabies, bordetella, heartworm test, microchip, and other costs. The adoption fee also helps cover the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501c3 organization.Pleaseemail for an adoption application.

Animal Profile: Sadie is an 18-month-old, 8 lb female terrier mix who was saved from a high kill shelter in California. Sadie is looking for a dog savvy family that includes a small companion canine in the home. Here’s what her foster mom has to say about sweet Sadie:Sadie first came to Seattle terrified and shut down. It took her some time to come out of her shell, but two months later she is a completely different dog. She is still shy around new people, but has become a fun-loving and energetic little dog. She is sweet, intelligent and loves to be with her people. Sadie loves to play with both humans and other dogs and enjoys walks and cuddling. Animal Profile: Mojo is a stunning 3-year-old male that came from a high-kill shelter in California. While he was initially listed as a mastiff mix, we had our doubts and decided to do a doggy DNA test. Turns out this big boy is a mix of American Staffordshire, German Shepherd Dog, Shar Pei and several other mixed Asian breeds. What a combination!Mojo is a smart and sensitive boy who will do best in a home with large breed experience and a fenced in yard. He gets along with the large breed dogs in his foster home after introductions but will do best in a home without small dogs or cats.Mojo is food motivated and so eager to please! He is fully trained: potty trained, crate trained, heels and auto-sits on walks, likes going for car rides, knows the\"place\" command as well as other general obedience. He even gets his workouts on the treadmill every morning! Mojo really enjoys hiking and exploring local outdoor parks. Mojo has had extensive training in his foster homes and will make an excellent canine companion.Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $475, which includes spay/neuter, current core vaccinations - Rabies, DAPPV, Bordetella, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. * Male Chihuahua mix* Approximately 1 year old* Approximately 12 pounds* House trained* Crate trained* Okay with other dogs, not sureabout cats* Dog respectful children 12 and older* Adoption fee: $285All dogs with PUP are in private foster homes so we can provide our potential adopters the most current information available.Raising a puppy requires a lot of work and is a commitment! Frisco will be an awesome addition to a family that can give him the attention, exercise, training and affection he deserves.Due to the fact that this is a mixed breed puppy, we, nor our vets, cannot guarantee the size that your dog will be.Health: Frisco has been neutered and microchipped. He is current on his DHPP, Bordetella, and Rabies. He has been wormed and flea treated.History: Frisco was born June 2, 2018. His Mom was pregnant when rescued from a shelter in Merced, CA. Frisco and his siblings were born while in the care of their foster moms. Because he is a mixed breed we are unable to determine how big he will be once full grown.Notes from Frisco's Foster Home: Frisco is a sweet, young boy with a heart of gold. He does, however, have difficulty in new situations and takes time to build up trust with people he is unfamiliar with. Once he trusts you, he shows his playful, goofy side. Frisco gets along well with other dogs and delights in playing with them, particularly enjoying running in the yard or playing tug of war. Although he has a fairly high energy level, he has a definite quiet side and loves to sit on your lap or right beside you. He is crate trained (and willingly goes into his crate and sleeps through the night without a peep) and is housetrained on a schedule. Perhaps because of his age, he can be a chewer, so nylabones and durable toys are recommended for him. Frisco loves going on walks and does well on leash. Frisco will need an adopter who understands his need to take it slow in warming up and that will be patient with him. He would greatly benefit from being with a person or family that is active and will continue to expose him to new situations in a controlled way so that he can become comfortable with change. Because of his trust issues, we do not recommend that Frisco go to a home with children under the age of 12. In the right environment, Frisco will blossom and become a wonderful companionNote: The above description reflects the behavior weow.have observed in the dog's foster home. Although PUP provides adopters up to the minute information on our dogs, we cannot guarantee they will behave in the same manner in a different environment with new owners.Adoption: If you think you have room in your home and heart for this dog and you reside within Washington State, please go to ourAdoption Informationpage. KID-FRIENDLY SWEETIE.Animal Profile: Brigid is a 4- to 5-year-old female Boxer/Pit/German Shepherd mix (we had her DNA done) who was rescued in California. She is our rescue's longest resident and we don't know how we haven't found her family. She loves all people and is amazing with even very young children. She doesn't bat an eye at crazy antics or rough handling by toddlers, and is not mouthy whatsoever. All she wants in life is to be next to her people. Snuggling and following you around are her favorite activities. Brigid is crate trained and can be left crated for 8 hours without issue in a secure crate. She's house trained and knows sit, down and \"kennel up.\" She's not mouthy or food/toy possessive, and she takes treats gently. Brigid is very anxious and reactive in the outside world, and doesn't do well meeting new dogs outside the house. She is leash reactive except when managed by an experienced handler, and will never be a dog-park dog. But she loves playing and cuddling with dogs of all genders and sizes in her own pack and will be fine living with other dogs after a slow introduction. (She needs to understand they are part of her pack before she accepts them.) Brigid doesn't need or want to go for walks for exercise but she does need a secure fenced yard to go potty. Bonus skill: She is treadmill trained!Brigid's Story: Brigid was a stray in San Bernardino and ended up at high-kill shelter. She was put on the euthanasia list when she came down with kennel cough, so we rescued her in September 2016! She was not spayed due to her upper respiratory infection and when she arrived we quickly saw she was very pregnant! After giving birth she ended up with a very serious infection that required separating her from pups so she could get the veterinary care she needed. She had to have her mammary gland removed and was in intensive medical care for some time. This was likely traumatic for her and may explain some of her separation anxiety and excited/reactive behavior around other dogs. Since then, Brigid had an injury which required surgery (TPLO) and has since recovered. She has also had an extensive board and train so she is well trained. We are eager to find Brigid a wonderful home she can call her own. She has been through a lot so she will need a patient, loving and supportive family.Adoption Info: Brigid's adoption fee of $150 includes her spay, all vaccinations (Rabies, DPPV, Bordetella) deworming, microchipping and transport from California to Seattle. Brigid's adoption will also include a home training session for her new adopters. Brigid's actual rescue costs are close to $10,000 so any donations to her care are greatly appreciated.About Foster to Adopt Program:Fosters provide a safe landing spot for dogs transitioning from the shelter environment and help prepare the dogs for adoption. You provide the love and structure, and we take care of everything else! We cover all vet care, and drive the adoption process. Average length of foster is 2-3 weeks. Fosters do get first consideration for adoption, if desired.Apply to foster online at www.doggoneseattle.org/foster-application

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.TamiTami is a sweet if shy Rat Terrier-Jack Russell mix.Tami loves attention and laps. She loves her daily walks and will jump in the car to go with you on an adventure for a walk on the beach or a nice park.We are seeking a quieter home for her without children and with small dog savvy folks, who have the time to give her. Perhaps a work from home person, or retired. Tami will also do well with another small breed, dog-friendly dog. Tami is currently in a foster home where she has had a professional trainer work with her to help her through her fears. She has become more self-confident and is a happy little girl.If you have patience and love to spare, and want a sweet girl who will warm up with trust and love and be a loyal BFF, this is your girlHealthy dogs: As a rescue saving dogs from starvation, Neglect and Emaciation, RPR focus's on feeding each rescued animal the healthiest dog food made of Human Grade ingredients to help them recover from their stress and starvation. We share this with our adopters and encourage them to keep their new pet on the same foods for optimal health and a long life.Adoption FeesAdoption fee is 495.00. This covers transport from California to Washington, to the rescue facility, adoption and medical such as certain vaccines, worming, parasite, and flea/tick control, health certificate and wellness exam, microchip and any extra medical attention a dog may require such as dental, anal gland expression, emergency medical care. Also, we don't receive any grants so we rely solely on adoption fees and donations to fund all of our rescue efforts. Finally, we take on \"Special Needs\" dogs with high vet costs and pay for their procedures with 'leftover' funds from adoption fees for healthier dogs.A dopting a Dog requires a lot of work and is a commitment! Tami will be an awesome addition to a family that can give him the attention, exercise, training, and affection he deserves.OUR REQUIREMENTS FOR ADOPTION:1) These dogs are not livestock dogs. They must be family pets that are allowed inside the home.2) We give preference to applicants with prior small breed knowledge/ experiences.3) Secure visible fencing required.Health: Tami has been fixed, microchipped, current on DHPP, Bordetella, and Rabies. she has been wormed and flea treated, tested negative for heartworm.History: Tami was pregnant and out of time at the shelter, Rompin Paws Rescue was asked to help and we are so glad we did. All dogs RPR pulls from California come with health certificates, as required by Washington State Law.Adoption: If you think you have room in your home and heart for Tami, please go to our website: http://rompinpawsrescue.rescuegroups.org/There you will find more information and be able to fill out an adoption application.About Rompin Paws RescueRompin Paws Rescue is a licensed, non-profit organization working towards our 501C3, specializing in rescuing moms to be, moms with puppies, puppies without moms and other Death Row dogs. We are located in Western Washington State. Our passion is to bring people and pets together.Come Meet Our Pets...We have a home based operation on Acreage in Arlington and Our dogs are placed in foster homes around the greater Seattle/I-5 Corridor North to Arlington area where they receive socialization and training while they await adoption.Our Adoption Process...Since we have a small facility on gated acreage, we are unable to stay open to anyone who wishes to come visit. To facilitate successful adoptions we ask interested people and families to fill out an application for the dog or dogs they may be interested in. We screen the applications and then speak with the interested party by phone. If it looks like a good match can be made, we pre-approve the applicant and set an appointment for a meet and greet with the dogs at out facility or with the fosters who have the dogs in their care. we continue the interview in person and make sure the dog and family are a good fit. http://rompinpawsrescue.rescuegroups.org/6/28/19 1:30 AM

I will be a loyal and faithful companion. A quiet and loving home would suit me well. I tend to bond to one person and quickly! Can you foster or adopt me?I have been spayed, am up-to-date on my shots, and ready for a home. A quiet and loving home would suit me well - I am beautiful!My adoption fee of $500 covers spay/neuter, DA2PP shots, rabies, bordetella, heartworm test, microchip, health certificate, and transport cost from California to Seattle. The adoption fee helps cover the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals and more. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our veterinary bills. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501c3 organization. Please email for an adoption application.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hH3sHBPPPag&list=UUSwXyPtu51QxdDsLPBiqLHg&index=7

My name is Felicity Meyer and I am a wonderful 2 year old Female Red and White Pit Bull Terrier who was just saved from a high-kill shelter in California where no one wanted me. I am a happy dog at 50 lbs. and so excited to find my forever home soon. Take me on car rides, walks in the park and I will become your very best friend. I get along great with people of all ages, gentle kids, with other dogs but have not been around cats before. I am a great dog that will do best in a home with a loving family that can give me lots of exercise, love and affection! My adoption fee of $495. covers Spay/Neuter, DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordetella, Deworm, Advantage Flea Treatment, Heart Worm Test, Grooming, Microchip, Boarding Fees, Health Certificate, and transport cost from CALIFORNIA to SEATTLE. The adoption fee is firm and helps cover the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals and more. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501 C 3 Organization. Please email for an adoption application.

Jackson is a wonderful 9 year old Blue Heeler Mix Boy and 25 lbs. Jackson needs another dog to play with as he loves doggy company. He needs a fenced in yard to play in. He is very healthy and would love to go on long walks or runs..He got saved out of a nerve-wracking stint on Death Row at a local high kill shelter in California. His personality is blossoming and he is so lucky to embark on a new and exciting adventure finding his own wonderful forever home in Seattle thanks to Ginger's Pet Rescue.His adoption fee of $ 295. covers his Spay, DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordatella, Deworm, Advantage Flea Treated, Heart worm Test, Grooming, Microchip, Boarding Fees, Health Certificate and transport cost on ALASKA AIRLINES from California to Seattle.This adoption fee will also go towards helping many of our rescued dogs who are in desperate need of orthopedic surgery, dental and teeth extractions, hernias, cherry eye removals and boarding fees. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down ur huge vet bills which now runs over $ 22,000.This adoption fee is firm as the pet rescue needs to recoup the money they spent in order to save the next dog in need. We have a huge vet bill and donations are appreciated as well We are a non profit 501 C 3 Organization Please email for an application so we can meet6/27/19 10:52 PM

Would you like to help us transport rescue dogs from a shelter to a foster home?  We shuttle dogs locally as well as between eastern and western Washington and up and down the I-5 corridor from southern California to Seattle.  If you would like to be a transport volunteer, please visit our website and send us an email today!http://www.washingtongsd.org/Are you following us on Facebook?  Our Facebook account is updated daily with information about our rescue dogs and volunteer opportunities!https://www.facebook.com/WashingtonGermanShepherdRescue

Originally rescued from China, Blizzard is a 1.5 year old, Jindo mix that has found himself in need of a home after his owner could no longer care for him. Characteristic of his breed description, Blizzard is alert and has a strong pack mentality. He has an unmatched loyalty to his humans and is friendly with new people. Blizzard is highly intelligent and loves to play with his purple ball. He is an active dog that has a knack for tricks and would likely do well with agility training. Blizzard is used to regular daily exercise in the fenced yard and enjoys long walks on lead. He loves the company of puppies, but has not been formally tested with cats. Blizzard would do best in a home with an active couple or a family with older children (12+).If you are interested in meeting and/or potentially adopting this rescue pet, please complete our online application at www.arrus.org. You will be notified via email of your application status prior to our next upcoming event. If you do not receive a response within this timeframe, please send a follow-up email to arrusadopt@gmail.com. Additional information and/or medical records for this rescue pet are available and will be reviewed in person should we choose to move forward in scheduling a meet n’ greet. In the meantime, please feel free to follow us on follow us on Instagram (animal_rescue_r_us) and visit our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/arrusadopt for more pictures and posts from his/her foster family. HELP US, HELP THEM! Animal Rescue R Us is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. We do not receive county, state or federal funding and rely solely on donations. These donations help offset the cost of routine veterinary care, medical expenses, and other necessities while the rescue animal is in our care. To make a secure donation, please visit www.arrus.org/donate . Alternatively, you may visit our Amazon Wishlist (http://www.amazon.com/registry/wishlist/C36VRV500R85) for a current list of needed supplies! All donations are tax-deductible and all are greatly appreciated. Thank you for your support!

Hi, everyone, I'm Percy!They say \"nice guys finish last\" but I know that can't be true. I'm as nice as they come, and look how well my life is going! I was rescued from the meat market in China, then I lived with some silly whippets at the vet while we were getting all our shots to travel. They were so entertaining - the one named Blu would climb right on top of me! And I didn't mind one bit because I'm such an easy going guy.Every day is a great day for me. And the best parts are when my new friends come by to pet me, which seems to happen quite a lot. See, everybody likes a nice guy like me!* Interested in adopting? Fill out an application at www.helpinggreyhounds.org/adopt-a-greyhound *

Hello, America, I'm Ruben!I've recently arrived from China, and as you can see from my smile, I'm loving my new life! I have a fluffy bed, toys, and the best food I've ever tasted. But, best of all, I have so many friends. I'm in a kennel on the end of a row, and I just love my special spot. Everyone stops to pet me when they're walking by, and I always get up to say hello. Sometimes my friends are in a hurry, but I don't mind. Even a quick \"Hi, Ruben!\" makes me happy. Although I'll gladly stand there all day getting pets and scratches!My friends tell me my new life will get even better soon, when someone chooses me to be their very own and I go home. It's hard for me to imagine being happier, but having a friend or two or three all to myself sounds just like Heaven!* Interested in adopting? Fill out an application at www.helpinggreyhounds.org/adopt-a-greyhound *

Mario is a staff favorite! He has been her for quite some time. Mario is a little different than most of our dogs. We rescued him from the Yulin Festival in China. Since Mario has had a rough past, it takes him a little while to trust new faces. He has shown so much progress. He loves going for his walks, and even playing with the other dogs. He truly is such a good boy. He will need a family who is willing to spend the time to make him trust you before going to his home!Interested in Mario? Make an appointment to meet him today!

Martha (65lbs.) is a 5+ year old, German Shepherd that found herself in need of a home after she was rescued from China. Sadly, this little lady has probably experienced a little more life than most. As a banned breed, she lived her life in a small cage and lacked basic veterinary care. Although she looked a little rough at first, Apoquel and daily supplements have helped Martha tremendously in looking and feeling her best. In fact, she is now ready to start looking for her FURever family.Characteristic of her breed description, Martha is loyal to her humans. She bonds quickly and loves going for walks. Martha is well-behaved on leash and knows commands like sit, come, and stay. She accepts treats gently and enjoys squeaky toys. Martha is crate-trained and housebroken. She is currently fostered in a home with children and would likely do well with another low-key dog. Martha would prefer a home with breed experience and a fenced yard.If you are interested in meeting and/or potentially adopting this rescue pet, please complete our online application at www.arrus.org. You will be notified via email of your application status prior to our next upcoming event. If you do not receive a response within this timeframe, please send a follow-up email to arrusadopt@gmail.com. Additional information and/or medical records for this rescue pet are available and will be reviewed in person should we choose to move forward in scheduling a meet n’ greet. In the meantime, please feel free to follow us on follow us on Instagram (animal_rescue_r_us) and visit our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/arrusadopt for more pictures and posts from his/her foster family. HELP US, HELP THEM! Animal Rescue R Us is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. We do not receive county, state or federal funding and rely solely on donations. These donations help offset the cost of routine veterinary care, medical expenses, and other necessities while the rescue animal is in our care. To make a secure donation, please visit www.arrus.org/donate . Alternatively, you may visit our Amazon Wishlist (http://www.amazon.com/registry/wishlist/C36VRV500R85) for a current list of needed supplies! All donations are tax-deductible and all are greatly appreciated. Thank you for your support!

Hello, I'm Blake.As you may guess from my scars, I've had a tough life up until now. I came from China, where I was used to catch other, smaller dogs. Then, one day ... well, I won't go into the details, but some people hurt me. Very badly. Both my front legs were broken, as well as several ribs and my shoulder blade. I also had a collapsed lung and internal bleeding.I was given up to Candy Cane Rescue, and my life immediately got so much better!I spent three months at the vets healing from my injuries. I had several surgeries, but am back on my feet now. As soon as I was healthy enough, my friends at Candy Cane arranged for me to come here to Fast Friends, so I could find my forever home.I love my new friends here! They're always telling me, \"Blake, there's nothing wrong with your tail!\" because I'm always wagging it! I get so excited when it's my turn for playtime or a walk, but I'm very well behaved on my lead. I just want you to know how happy I am to see you, and to be starting my new life!* Interested in adopting? Fill out an application at www.helpinggreyhounds.org/adopt-a-greyhound *

Long Island: China is a 4 year old itty bitty pittie (short but solid!) mix that was left tied to a fire hydrant and abandoned in Queens. Luckily for China a Good Samaritan was able to watch over her and advocate for her so that she made it out of the kill shelter alive. China at first appeared to be terrified and confused by her sudden stroke of bad luck, one can imagine that being left for dead on the side of the road can be devastating to anyone. China is currently in our boarding facility where she had the chance to chill out and just relax after the whole terrible ordeal of being abandoned then hitting the euth list where she would’ve likely died if we didn’t step in. What we learned from China over the past few months is that she is pretty pawsome! China loves to take long drives, she’s fantastic in the car. China is also a world class ball player/chaser.   We noticed China hates the crate, so no biggie she doesn’t have to go in one if it makes her uncomfortable. China definitely came out of her shell and shown us her potential. We are seeking an experienced foster for China, a home with no other dogs or cats.  If you would like to foster China please email rhdrdogs@gmail.com to find out more about her. If you are sure that China is the dog you want to help please fill out our application below, making sure to answer all questions, answering n/a for those that are irrelevant or it won’t submit. Thank you for your interest in helping China. In my experience, the dogs that require some work are always so worth it!

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Noel is an absolutely lovable boy who was rescued by Plush Bear and Candy Cane Rescue from the meat trade in China. We are so fortunate to be able to bring this sweet boy to the safety of our GFNJ family. Noel is a friendly, happy boy who loves to be petted. We brushed him a great deal and he just about melted with euphoria. This is a very special and sweet boy who deserves the very best. Although he loves people, no cats, please. He is 8 years old--a senior boy rescued from a terrible fate. The adoption fee to adopt Noel is $300 as he is a senior China dog.

Shyla is coming to us as a Chinese refuge after being saved from a meat truck in China. She is a sweet girl who is 1-2 years old and 22 lbs. She'll be arriving 5/11 and we'll have additional info once she gets into her foster home.Please stop by an upcoming Meet & Greet to find out if Shyla is the right one for you! (Local adoptions preferred — Philadelphia and tri-state area [South Jersey and northern Delaware] only.)PLEASE READ BEFORE CONTACTING US!We are NOT a shelter: All of our dogs live in private homes with foster families. Come and meet the Almost Home dogs and their fosters at our Meet & Greet events, where you can learn more about our wonderful dogs from the people who live with them, find out which dogs are on their way and when they’ll arrive, and fill out an application to adopt or foster.We cannot adopt to homes where electric-shock fencing systems or training collars are used. For more information on the dangers of electric-shock collars, please visit banshockcollars.ca/studies.php and http://www.hollysden.com/say_no_to_shock.htm (scroll down and click on the \"Invisible Fencing Systems\" link).We do not have an online adoption application; to request an application, e-mail us at AlmostHome4Dogs@yahoo.com. To speed e-mail processing time, be sure to note the name of the dog you are inquiring about in the Subject line. For Meet & Greet times and locations, visit our home page, where you also will find information on our adoption process and fees.FOSTER FAMILIES ARE LIFESAVERS!! Can you open your heart and home for a few weeks to homeless shelter dog? Remember, by fostering a dog, you save TWO lives — that of your foster dog, and that of the dog who takes his place in the shelter! Come to a Meet & Greet and find out if fostering is for you — there's no reward quite like the feeling that you've saved a life ... or two!

Hey! New family! There you are- you found me!! My name is KitKat and I’m just as sweet as candy. I came all the way from CHINA to find you! I was rescued from the Yulin meat festival where I was pulled off of a slaughter truck. Now I’m sooo lucky to be spending my days with my foster parents and their pup while they teach me what it’s like to be loved and act like a real dog! I am house and crate trained and good with other dogs. Because of my past, I’m understandably a bit shy and can be nervous. That’s just because I’m waiting for my perfect humans to love! Is that you?? Because I'm shy foster mom says it would be great if I found my forever home with another dog to teach me the ropes and a patient, loving family with no little kids because they might not understand the patience I’ll need! I just really want to be loved, and find my humans to love back. I’ve come such a long way and now I’m ready to settle down! Please come meet me and love me forever! I am looking for you, family!! Foster mom says we all deserve to be loved, I guess that means I do too... so I know you are out there somewhere new family. I’ll be here, waiting for you. KitKat’s adoption fee is $350. Apply for her today!Home at Last Dog Rescue is a foster-based organization located in suburban Philadelphia, PA. We don’t have a facility; all our dogs stay in the homes of volunteers. To be considered for adoption of this dog, an adoption application must be completed via our website (http://www.homeatlastdogrescue.com). An applicant must be willing to pick up the dog in our area if selected as the adopter.Home At Last Dog Rescue needs fosters and volunteers! You can make a difference in a homeless dog’s life! If you live in the suburban Philadelphia, PA area and would like to hear about all our volunteer opportunities please email homeatlastdogrescue@yahoo.com.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Stevie is a little boy who was rescued by Plush Bear and Candy Cane Rescue from the meat trade in China. We are so fortunate to be able to bring this sweet boy to the safety of our GFNJ family. Stevie is a friendly, happy boy who loves toys and will enjoy a nice play time. Stevie is affectionate, gives kisses and is a snuggle-bug. He will enjoy the company of another greyhound. Stevie will be 2 years old in March. Although he loves people, no cats, please. The adoption fee to adopt Stevie is $500 due to the high cost of bringing the China dogs to the USA. We are happy to be able to save this sweet boy along with the other 4 dogs from China.

Ace was rescued from China. The Tibetan Spanielhas been known for over 2,000 years. Bred and owned by Buddhist monks and lamas, \"Tibbies\" were never sold. They left the monasteries only as treasured gifts to esteemed friends. Unfortunately many dogs are stolen in china and sold toslaughterhouses. Ace was rescued before he became a victim..Heis 25 lbs. and 4 years old. He is asurvivor of the dog meat trade. He is a very calm , happy , confident and loveable boy. He loves all people but he does have his issues and needs a special home. He gets along well with other dogs for the most part, but he is the alpha and will protect his food and bones.He also will protect his toys, food and bones around children. Therefore because of his resource guarding we are looking for a home without kids or other pets. He would do best in a home where someone is home more... Because of his issues we will provide thebehavioral training he needs after he goes on a trial adoption . The training will be done with a certified trainer on a intake basis . Ace will be at their facility for 2 weeks or longer.Behavioral training is only successful if Ace has a home to go back to that is willing to implement the training that he has learned.. Despite his issues he is a loveable, well behaved and trainable dog. He walks well on a leash and is housebroken.He is neutered , up to date on vaccinations and micro chipped. He needs a fenced in yard. His adoption fee is $150

I am is 20lbs and 1 year old. I was rescued from China. I am a survivor of the dog meat trade. I amspayed , up to date on vaccinations and microchipped. I need a home where someone is home more and a fenced in yard. I am a happy girl that loves to give kisses once I know you. I am being trained to walk on a leash . I am not wellsocialized, so I may be afraid of strangers at first, but I warm up quickly...Just give me a treat. Since I can beskittish and we are looking for homes with children over the age of 5. Adoption fee is $150

Woody is 35lbs and 1 1/2 years old. Shewas rescued from China. I am a survivor of the dog meat trade. She is a sweet girl but shy and skittish at first. She appears to be a Norrbottenspets Spitz mix.She isspayed , up to date on vaccinations and microchipped. Woody needs a home where someone is home more and a fenced in yard. I need leash training and I am not well socialized, so I may be afraid of strangers at first, but I warm up quickly...Just give me a treat. Since I can beskittish and we are looking for homes with children over the age of 5. Adoption fee is $150

I am is 35lbs and 1 1/2 years old. I was rescued from China. I am a survivor of the dog meat trade. I amspayed , up to date on vaccinations and microchipped. I will give lots of love for a treat. I am housebroken and do well with other dogs. I walk well on a leash.. I warm up quickly...Just give me a treat. I can beskittish with new places , sounds and new people. I need a home withchildren over the age of 5 since I can be skittish. I also need a fenced in yard. I am being fostered in Mishawaka, Indiana Adoption fee is $150

Please contact Jenny Cope (giveadogahome@live.com) for more information about this pet.DA-HUI was saved from the legal meat trade in China in the Beijing area. He, his 10 siblings and mother were saved by a wonderful rescue lady in China and together we are working on getting them all to the safety of GaDaH-CHINA in Sebec, Maine. We pay to get these dogs vetted, tested, quarantined and all other requirements to import them to the safety of the rescue in Sebec, Maine. The adoption fee's vary slightly depending on the weight and size of the dogs. DA-HUI adoption fee is US $550 and covers the costs we incur to save these precious souls.DA-HUI has been through the export and import quarantine requirements from China to the US. He has his rabies, core vaccines/lepto, heartworm, tick-disease and screw worm tested negative. He has been de-wormed, micro chipped and received any necessary monthly preventatives. He has an estimated date of birth of 2 January 2018 and he weighs around 19.6 pounds. His mother we believe is a Belgian Shepherd and so he is most likely a Belgian Shepherd Dog Mix, we have no idea what breed the father is. It is up to you to look at him and decide what breed you think he could be. He arrived in the United States on 23rd August 2018, landing at JFK and then was driven up to the rescue in Sebec, Maine. We are looking for families with knowledge of experience of working breed needs to ensure they get a good balance of mental and physical exercise.DA-HUI is a cautious boy, but once he has gained trust and feels safe he is very affectionate and loving. He likes to climb on your knee, or snuggle up on the bed, but has always been with his siblings. He will need time to get used to new people and new places, but once trust has been gained he is a great all round boy.WE DO NOT HAVE CATS OR LIVESTOCK AT THE RESCUE SO ARE UNABLE TO COMMENT ON HOW HE WILL ACT NEAR OR AROUND THEM.He does use the dog door to get in and out and does go outside to do his business. I do not know if he would let you know he needs to go out since he has 24/7 access to the outside, but he is extremely smart and do not think it would take long to learn, so a few initial accidents in his new home whilst he adjusts and gets used to his new routine and has his family teach him to let them know he wants to go outside should be expected. Until arriving at GaDaH, he had never been an inside dog.He would benefit from a family who understands the importance of mental stimulation as well as physical exercise. As with all rescue's he needs guidance and training and we recommend families go through at least the basics of training with him themselves so that boundaries, personalities and body language can be learned from each other. He rides good in the car, but has only been with his siblings, never has he been alone. He gets on good with other dogs and would benefit from the companionship in his transition, so a family with another dog would be great, however, if that is not the case, then play-dates with other dogs would be extremely beneficial for him.He needs an active family and one that will keep his mind stimulated and challenged. Lots of hikes and adventures, training tricks, or agility, dock diving or other fun, active, stimulating activities would be perfect for this boy when his confidence and trust has been gained. Although I have not seen him with children, given time and space his demeanor and personality I have no doubt that he would be great with them and I am sure they could keep each other entertained for many hours.Throughout all that this beautiful soul has been through, he has not once shown any kind of aggression.DA-HUI is available for adoption from Give a Dog a Home, German Shepherd Dog Rescue which is located in Sebec, Maine, for an adoption fee of $1,200. This fee is not negotiable and is used to cover the extensive costs of vetting, quarantine requirements, documentation, flights and such to get him from China to Sebec, Maine.We post in other states and in Canada to ensure our saved dogs get as much exposure as possible and the perfect families are found. Canadian adopters need to know that customs charge 15% taxes when entering into Canada.Adoptive families MUST travel to the rescue in Sebec, Maine to meet and dog they are interested in adopting and if all goes well, take him/her home with them to start their new wonderful life.Give a Dog a Home, German Shepherd Dog Rescue187 Downs Road, Sebec, Maine, 04481giveadogahome@live.comAll pets adopted will be spay/neutered, micro-chipped, de-wormed,heartworm tested, rabies and relevant vaccinations.NO DOG WILL BE ADOPTED TO BE AN OUTSIDE DOG!If you would like to start the adoption our process is below:Submit Application with two personal references and a vet reference.If you have never had pets and do not have a vet, we will need THREE personal references.Ensure references are people who know you and your lifestyle well.Applicant MUST inform vet and references that someone from GaDaH will be calling.As long as we are able to contact your vet and references, it takes just 1-3 days to process and hopefully approve applications.If you rent we will need an approval letter for the breed of dog you are wanting to adopt from your landlord on official letterhead paper or email.Rescue processes and hopefully approves applications.Once approved, rescue invites applicant to come to the rescue to meet your chosen dog/s, spend time with him/herand then hopefully take him/her home.We do NOT hold dogs so if you are unable to come within a week or so of submitting your application the dog will still be available for adoption to other families.For Canadian adopters, all that is needed to get them across the border into Canada is a current rabies certificate and proof of adoption, which is the adoption contract. Both of which are included in the medical file you will get when you adopt. (https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/pet-travel/by-country/pettravel-canada)Ensure ALL Fields are filled in, if something is relevant, then put n/a or something in so it recognizes an entry.We do not recommend using a phone or ipad since these applications for some reason don't tend to come through and you will have spent a lot of time on the application for nothing as it will need to be re-done.Once we have you approved we can schedule an appointment for you to come to meethim/her at the rescue in Sebec, Mane and then hopefully take them home to start your new life.I just have to work on an appointment basis as I run a boarding/day care business and the rescue and so am really busy, but by planning ahead of time I can be pretty flexible.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.org/adoption-application.htmlSubmit Application with two personal references and a vet reference.If you have never had pets and do not have a vet, we will need THREE personal references.Ensure references are people who know you and your lifestyle well.Applicant MUST inform vet and references that someone from GaDaH will be calling.As long as we are able to contact your vet and references, it takes just 1-3 days to process and hopefully approve applications.If you rent we will need an approval letter for the breed of dog you are wanting to adopt from your landlord on official letterhead paper or email.Rescue processes and hopefully approves applications.Once approved, rescue invites applicant to come to the rescue to meet your chosen dog/s, spend time with him/herand then hopefully take him/her home.We do NOT hold dogs so if you are unable to come within a week or so of submitting your application the dog will still be available for adoption to other families.For Canadian adopters, all that is needed to get them across the border into Canada is a current rabies certificate and proof of adoption, which is the adoption contract. Both of which are included in the medical file you will get when you adopt. (https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/pet-travel/by-country/pettravel-canada)Ensure ALL Fields are filled in, if something is relevant, then put n/a or something in so it recognizes an entry.We do not recommend using a phone or ipad since these applications for some reason don't tend to come through and you will have spent a lot of time on the application for nothing as it will need to be re-done.Once we have you approved we can schedule an appointment for you to come to meethim/her at the rescue in Sebec, Mane and then hopefully take them home to start your new life.I just have to work on an appointment basis as I run a boarding/day care business and the rescue and so am really busy, but by planning ahead of time I can be pretty flexible.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.org/adoption-application.html

Although I have not seen him with children, given time and space his demeanor and personality I have no doubt that he would be great with them and I am sure they could keep each other entertained for many hours.Throughout all that this beautiful soul has been through, he has not once shown any kind of aggression.HUA-HUA is available for adoption from Give a Dog a Home, German Shepherd Dog Rescue which is located in Sebec, Maine, for an adoption fee of $1,200. This fee is not negotiable and is used to cover the extensive costs of vetting, quarantine requirements, documentation, flights and such to get him from China to Sebec, Maine.We post in other states and in Canada to ensure our saved dogs get as much exposure as possible and the perfect families are found. Canadian adopters need to know that customs charge 15% taxes when entering into Canada.Adoptive families MUST travel to the rescue in Sebec, Maine to meet and dog they are interested in adopting and if all goes well, take him/her home with them to start their new wonderful life.Give a Dog a Home, German Shepherd Dog Rescue187 Downs Road, Sebec, Maine, 04481giveadogahome@live.comAll pets adopted will be spay/neutered, micro-chipped, de-wormed,heartworm tested, rabies and relevant vaccinations.NO DOG WILL BE ADOPTED TO BE AN OUTSIDE DOG!If you would like to start the adoption our process is below:Submit Application with two personal references and a vet reference.If you have never had pets and do not have a vet, we will need THREE personal references.Ensure references are people who know you and your lifestyle well.Applicant MUST inform vet and references that someone from GaDaH will be calling.As long as we are able to contact your vet and references, it takes just 1-3 days to process and hopefully approve applications.If you rent we will need an approval letter for the breed of dog you are wanting to adopt from your landlord on official letterhead paper or email.Rescue processes and hopefully approves applications.Once approved, rescue invites applicant to come to the rescue to meet your chosen dog/s, spend time with him/herand then hopefully take him/her home.We do NOT hold dogs so if you are unable to come within a week or so of submitting your application the dog will still be available for adoption to other families.For Canadian adopters, all that is needed to get them across the border into Canada is a current rabies certificate and proof of adoption, which is the adoption contract.
