Please contact Jenny Cope (giveadogahome@live.com) for more information about this pet.XIAO-HEI was saved from the legal meat trade in China in the Beijing area. She, her 10 siblings and mother were saved by a wonderful rescue lady in China and together we are working on getting them all to the safety of GaDaH-CHINA in Sebec, Maine. We pay to get these dogs vetted, tested, quarantined and all other requirements to import them to the safety of the rescue in Sebec, Maine. The adoption fee's vary slightly depending on the weight and size of the dogs. XIAO-HEI adoption fee is US $550 and covers the costs we incur to save this precious souls.Xiao-Hei has been through the export and import quarantine requirements from China to the US. She has her rabies, core vaccines/lepto, heartworm, tick-disease and screw worm tested negative. She has been de-wormed, micro chipped and received any necessary monthly preventatives. She has an estimated date of birth of 2 January 2018 and she weighs around 24.3 pounds. Her mother we believe is a Belgian Shepherd and so she is most likely a Belgian Shepherd Dog Mix, we have no idea what breed the father is. It is up to you to look at her and decide what breed you think she could be. She arrived in the United States on 23rd August 2018, landing at JFK and then was driven up to the rescue in Sebec, Maine. We are looking for families with knowledge of experience of working breed needs to ensure they get a good balance of mental and physical exercise.Xiao-Hei is a super friendly, loving and affectionate girl. Out of her 10 siblings that came to the US, she was the first to become friendly and trust. She can be cautious, but trust is gained more quickly than her siblings..WE DO NOT HAVE CATS OR LIVESTOCK AT THE RESCUE SO ARE UNABLE TO COMMENT ON HOW SHE WILL ACT NEAR OR AROUND THEM.She does use the dog door to get in and out and does go outside to do her business. I do not know if she would let you know she needs to go out since she has 24/7 access to the outside, but she is extremely smart and do not think it would take long to learn, so a few initial accidents in her new home whilst she adjusts and gets used to her new routine and has her family teach her to let them know she wants to go outside should be expected. Until arriving at GaDaH, she had never been an inside dog.She would benefit from a family who understands the importance of mental stimulation as well as physical exercise. As with all rescue's she needs guidance and training and we recommend families go through at least the basics of training with her themselves so that boundaries, personalities and body language can be learned from each other. She rides good in the car, but has only been with her siblings, never has she been alone. She gets on good with other dogs and would benefit from the companionship in her transition, so a family with another dog would be great, however, if that is not the case, then play-dates with other dogs would be extremely beneficial for her.She needs an active family and one that will keep her mind stimulated and challenged. Lots of hikes and adventures, training tricks, or agility, dock diving or other fun, active, stimulating activities would be perfect for this girl when her confidence and trust has been gained. Once familiar with her humans she is friendly and loving, and although I have not seen her with children, given time and space her demeanor and personality I have no doubt that she would be great with them and I am sure they could keep each other entertained for many hours.Throughout all that this beautiful soul has been through, she has not once shown any kind of aggression.We post in other states and in Canada to ensure our saved dogs get as much exposure as possible and the perfect families are found. You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Name: TillyAge: 6 yearsGender: FemaleBreed: Pekingese mixWeight: 19 lbsDog friendly:Tolerates other calm dogs, but would prefer to be your one and only!Cat friendly: TBDKid friendly: Older (13+) considerate children onlyHouse Trained: Yes on a scheduleCrate Trained: YesEnergy level: ModerateHistory: From a shelter in BeijingAdoption Fee: $350From the Foster:Tilly is a silly, lovable teddy bear of a dog who is finally getting to experience the good things in life! Saved from the dog meat trade in China, she has come a long way since arriving in MN. This one-eyed cutie LOVES to lay on the window sill and look out at the world. We have a storage bench against a window with dog stairs leading up to it so that is her spot to hang out. (She needs dog stairs to get up on the couch, bed, etc.) This is her absolute favorite thing to do, lay on her sill.Tilly gets free reign with our other dogs during the work day. She doesn't have accidents and is happy to lay in her spot at the window. She will bark if a delivery person brings something to our door or sees someone outside. She sleeps in her kennel next to our bed at night with the door open so she can come and go. She loves having her little den to snuggle in. She doesn't need to be kenneled, but since she likes it for sleeping we have one for her, but we never close the door. She has recently started sleeping in our bed with us some nights.Tilly is tolerant of other dogs her size that are calm and don't necessarily need a play buddy. She is scared of big dogs and will growl/bark at them. Recently she has become a bit more comfortable with our lab, but she would do best as an only dog or with another small dog who is respectful of her personal space. She will occasionally try to play with our small dog and is sometimes happy to sit by our large dog, but other times growls and snaps at him. Tilly's main love in life is her people. It took her about 3 weeks to get totally comfortable with us, but now she gets so excited when we get home, wants to cuddle, and loves giving kisses. She needs some time to warm up, but then she has so much love and affection to offer.Tilly is a long-haired dog that will require regular grooming and brushing. She's not a big fan of getting groomed (she has only experienced this once in her life!) or going to the vet yet (she's a biter in these situations), so her family will need to be understanding of this until she gets more used to being poked and prodded.Tilly had a couple accidents when she first arrived at our house, but now that she is on a schedule she is doing great. She loves to go outside. You need to keep an eye on opening the door and closing it all the way because she will try to dash out to enjoy the outdoors. She loves riding in the car too. Though she likes being outside for short periods, she's not a huge fan of walks when it's warm out. She gets hot so easily. She will lay down in the road in protest sometimes. It's pretty funny. This girl definitely loves her air conditioning.Due to missing several teeth, Tilly only eats canned dog food. However, she LOVES it and gets super excited at meal times. Even though she doesn't have that many teeth, she loves chewing on small rawhide bones and they last her a long time.Overall, she is a fluffy pup who is getting more snuggly by the day. She now enjoys being lifted onto the couch to sit on our laps and cuddle. She has also started playing with toys for the first time as well, which is so adorable to watch her try to figure it out. She's a special dog that is going to make a lucky family very happy.Tilly has a collapsing trachea which restricts her in a couple ways:-She must only use a harness (no collars connected to the leash)-She does not like hot, humid weather and her activity should be limited to short walks to go to the bathroom in the summer. She also needs air conditioning.-She coughs/hacks when she gets excited or has too much activity. Her family will need to limit over stimulation so she doesn't go into a coughing fit.-There is no treatment for this condition, you just have to manage it. Basically she is more of a couch potato dog and is not up for lots of exercise. She still enjoys walks in appropriate weather, playing with toys, and gets excited for treats.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Name: Ray RayAge: 6 yearsGender: MaleBreed: Pekingese mixWeight: 21 lbsDog friendly: YesCat friendly: Yes, shows some interest in themKid friendly: Older respectful children onlyHouse Trained: No, wears a belly bandCrate Trained: TBDEnergy level: ModerateHistory: From a shelter in BeijingAdoption Fee: $350From the Foster:Hi, my name is Ray Ray, and I made the long journey from a meat truck in China, to a rescue in China, and finally to Secondhand Hounds to live the good life! You’d never guess what I have experienced if you weren’t told. My foster mom and dad say I’m a happy go lucky little guy who loves nothing more than laying on a Serta orthopedic dog bed. They say I have a happy little tail wag and a huge smile.I adored the snow that was here when I arrived, and I'm bummed out that it's gone. I do enjoy the beautiful weather here, but I can get warm easily because I have a thick coat. I've learned how to play with other dogs since I've arrived, but play has to be on my terms. Sometimes I like to initiate the play and other times I'll join in. My foster mom and dad love watching me play. They say I butt bump the Cairn Terriers that I live with. I have even learned to play like them and spar up on my hind legs with the youngest one. My foster mom and dad always supervise the play to make sure the others are careful around my one eye that I have left.I'm not a food motivated guy. In fact, my mom says I'm kind of a picky eater, but hey, I know what I like. I have a favorite brand of food, and I'll hold out for it until I get it. I do have favorite treats though! Hot dogs, cheese, and Reddi Whip are my favorites! I can be doing my thing around the house, but if I hear the fridge open I'll be next to you before you know it.I'm mostly potty trained, especially if I'm taken out on a schedule. My foster parents make me wear a belly band because I have a tendency to lift my leg to mark my territory. They think I may need to wear it for quite awhile, potentially the rest of my life. I think they are pretty stylish though, and I stand still to let my foster mom put them on me. Pads to line them will be a requirement. I go through a bag about every month and a half or two.I'm gonna turn it over to my foster mom now to tell you a little bit more about me.Hi, Ray Ray's foster mom here. Ray Ray is a sweetheart who has decided that the good life means living life on his terms. He is not a cuddly little lap dog. He likes people, but he likes attention on his terms. For him that can mean walking over to you and brushing up against your legs asking for some pets. Other times it can mean that he wants to be near you just keeping his eye on you.Ray Ray is a long-haired dog who will require regular grooming and combing. He doesn't seem to mind it too much. He is definitely a dog who sheds so if you are lucky enough to add this gem to your family, you will definitely become best friends with your vacuum cleaner!Ray Ray may not look like he'd be fast and agile, but he is! Due to this, he we consider him to be a flight risk. If he even thinks we are headed to the door to go somewhere, he's down our stairs and by the door before we're even ready to open it! We only exit our house through our garage because of this. That way, if he gets out the first door he's still in the garage and not chasing a bird or a bunny.Ray Ray is food and treat possessive. He has nipped at both my husband and me on a few occasions, but he has never broken skin. These nips seemed to be warnings, and we listened. This is also one of the reasons that we feel Ray Ray would be best in a home with older, respectful children or no children.Ray Ray also has front legs that rotate out even when he's standing still. The SHH vet told us there is no surgical treatment for this condition. Ray Ray has never known anything else so he just deals with it. The two vets we've seen with him have both said that he will be VERY likely to develop severe arthritis as he ages. He does receive a supplement to support his joint health. He will need a family who is prepared to support and treat this probable condition. This is also another reason we Ray Ray would do best in a home with older, respectful children or no children.Despite Ray Ray's quirks that we've mentioned, we adore the little man and are jealous of the lucky people who will be his forever family. Could that be you?

Wolf is an adorable medium sized mixed breed lady! She came to us on our rescue mission to help end and free animals from the dog meat trade. These 5 amazing dogs came to us from China and Taiwan and are learning love, positive humane interactions, and adjusting to their new life in America! These sweet babes are available for foster or adopter and we know with contnued love and support they will flourish and have an amazing fur-ever story! All 5 are up to date on all vaccines, spayed/neutered, microchipped, received their USD clearance, and have been started on prevention. These sweet pups are going to make wonderful additions to their fur-ever homes!

Animal Profile: Yuan is an estimated 2-year-old, 22 lb Shih Tzu Maltese mix who is settling in to his foster home where he is doing very well with the adults and other dogs, learning crate and leash training and basic obedience. As he feels more comfortable we're seeing his goofy personality emerge! We will share more information about him as we get to know him.Seattle Foster Update:New foster fluff, Yuan, is settling in. He loves ladies but is a bit hand shy around men and not comfortable with children, so he's looking for a forever family without kids. He walks well on a leash and gets along with other dogs. We are working on building trust and teaching basic commands.Animal History: Yuan was surrendered to our rescue shortly after being adopted from China when the family discovered he wasn't a good fit with the small children in their home. They couldn't very well send him back to China so they reached out to various rescues and we agreed to take him.Adoption Info: Yuan's adoption fee is $400 which includes his neuter, core vaccinations (Rabies/DPPV/Bordetella vaccinations), microchip, health certificate, and recent veterinary examination. All adoption fees are donations to Washington non-profit corporation and 501c3 and go to benefit all the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.doggoneseattle.org

•	Breed: Pug/Spaniel mix•	Age/Sex: 8 months / neutered male•	Weight: 11 lbs•	Special Considerations: Ernie has no medical concerns.Meet Ernie, this spunky little boy came to Seattle all the way from the Yulin dog meat festival. Ernie is a super sweet and active pup who needs a family who are dedicated to training and socializing him. He and his siblings had to be protected while in China, so they have never been on a leash and are a little uneasy in new environments. Ernie does well with other friendly dogs. He would be OK in an apartment and children should be 6+ with dog experience. Do you have room in your home, heart and lap for Ernie?Ernie is current on vaccines, neutered and microchipped. Please call 206.557.4661 for more information about Ernie!

Hi folks! We have a new resident at ARC.Say hi to Sally!Sally has been with us for about a week now and she sure would love for you to come and visit her. Sally is approx 5yrs old beagle mix who came to us from Meade co. She's a little bit anxious with other dogs but loves to snuggle up on a lap. She's a bit unsure of why her people no longer wanted her as part of the family and hopes to find a new home soon. She is spending her days running in the yard with her bff, June Bug who will be going to her forever home soon so we sure hope Sally won't be too far behind. Adoption Fees:  $85 for DogsAll our pets are spayed, neutered, and up-to-date on all shots. Our dogs have been tested and are presently on Heartworm prevention.  The Animal Refuge Center has these and many more pets waiting for a good home. Before you apply to adopt a pet, please first visit http://animalrefugecenter.org/adoption-policies/ If you are interested in adoption, click ASK ABOUT on the page of the pet you are interested in, or just fill out our handy Adoption Application right here at http://animalrefugecenter.org/adoption-application/If you cannot adopt a pet but would still like to help, see our Sponsor Program information at http://animalrefugecenter.org/services/sponsor-program/

Oh Heeeey it's me Leroy!I am just 1 year old and I am very affectionate and mushy and I love to play with my toys.I have survived hard times and come out sweet on the other side. Get A Bull has been taking me weekly to see a great trainer who is helping to socialize me. I am crate-trained, neutered and vetted. I am so smart and eager to learn. I need a foster home or adopter ideally with kids 15+ where I am an only pet. I need someone that I can bond to and count on. Be my hero!! I will give you sooo many kisses. I am located in CT and available to adopters in surrounding states (closer for foster). Contact getabullrescue@gmail.com for info on me.

What a bundle of fun and cuteness! Meet Jax. He was rescued from poor conditions in Costa Rica and we are so happy to have him here with us in the U.S. to have his rightful life with a loving family.He is so sweet and funny. He is well behaved and friendly with everyone. He is five, small, just 15 lbs or so, so is a jack russell mixed with something smaller. Jax has a mild deformity on his lower jaw, which does not bother him one bit. It just makes him more adorable.Button adorable. Likes dogs. Not sure he has ever met a cat.He is now updated on all shots, neutered and will be chipped! His adopt fee is $395.We cover the medical to prepare the pet for adoption and the adopt donations go directly to cover those costs and range from $295-$495. Thank you for stepping up to save a life!To expedite to meet with this dog, please go to our site at www.savinggreatanimals.org and fill out an application. We look at the first applications to arrive, so we hope to hear from you soon!

On a cold, snowy night in December of 2012, a PFPO foster family was walking their dogs when they found a sweet black pitbull with an old rope tied to her collar. It was apparent this dog had been tied out and had broken loose. The family took the dog to the shelter to give the owners a chance to claim her. No one came for her.The family called the shelter everyday to check on her. When it became clear that no one was coming to claim the dog, they asked PFPO to accept her into the foster program. The family called the dog Shiloh.From the moment Shiloh came to live with her foster family, they knew that she was a sweet and special girl. Shiloh was only about 8 months old and full of energy! Shiloh loved to go on walks, play in the snow, and take catnaps in the sun. Shiloh loved people, but she didn’t understand other dogs. So, Shiloh’s foster family worked very hard to find her the perfect home and perfect family to love her and her quirks.Just 6 weeks after she entered her foster family’s home, Shiloh had an adoption application from a nice retired man who lived in Delaware. After several visits and overnight stays (including an “accident” on the carpet during her first meeting and eating a loaf of bread off the kitchen counter), Shiloh’s foster family knew that this was Shiloh’s perfect forever family. But, sometimes in life, sad things happen to good dogs.Shiloh lived with this nice old man for 5 years until he got sick and passed away. Suddenly, Shiloh was without her perfect family. Staying true to the rescue’s promise of always taking back its own, Shiloh is now back with PFPO. She is still sweet. She is still loves adult people (and kids over 10). And, she still doesn’t understand other dogs. She needs a new perfect family to love her. Could that be you?Shiloh's adoption fee is $100. She is spayed UTD on vaccines, micro-chipped, heartworm negative and on heartworm/flea/tick prevention.***WE DO NOT DO OUT OF STATE ADOPTIONS***If you would like to learn more information about me, or to even adopt me please contact Peace for Paws Ohio at: adopt@peaceforpawsohio.org.Because we will not do on-the-spot adoptions, we ask that you fill out an adoption application prior to inquiring about meeting any of our pets. Please give us at least 48 hours excluding weekends and holidays to get in touch with you once your application has been submitted.Fill out an adoption application: http://peaceforpawsohio.org/adopt/adoption-application/Have a question about a foster dog? Please email us at: adopt@peaceforpawsohio.org

CHARLIE GIRL is a 6-month-old stunner who hitched a ride into our #OneLuckyPup program all the way from Ecuador, where her life was at risk! This sweet stunner LOVES other dogs and people and enjoys just being a dog. She will be an excellent family dog and is currently hanging with her foster family in CT where she enjoys two other resident dogs and tons of people. To apply to adopt this blonde girl, who will be spayed June 5 and who is already vaccinated and microchipped, please complete her application at www.mrbonesandco.org/adopt For questions please email elli@mrbonesandco.orgThank you!

This super sweet, affectionate girl is Karma. She loves belly rubs and rolling around in the grass. Karma is a Baladi dog who came to us from Egypt where she lost her legs at the hands of a cruel human being. She has since had both legs properly amputated.  She is also incontinent.  She has a wheelchair, but moves along perfectly without one.  This Egyptian princess is pure love!  If you, or someone you know, are interested in adopting or fostering, please visit our site at www.maydaypitbullrescue.org or send us an email at info@maydaypitbullrescue.org

Come and meet Bao in person this Sunday May 5th at Kings Supermarket in Morristown from 10 - 1:30 for our Margaritas for the Mutts event !Meet our little Ewok, Bao! Bao is one cute little guy. He is about 2 years old and we're really not sure what breed he is. He was rescued from Egypt along with his buddy Frosty. Bao gets along well with other dogs and walks nicely on a leash. He is housetrained.

Soka is an eight month-old Labrador Retriever/Greyhound mix rescued from Egypt. Children threw her off a rooftop at three months of age causing damage to her front legs. Although physically deformed, it doesn't slow her down.  She is incredibly sweet and beginning to understand her new environment. Kera is our special rescue from Egypt!  She has had a rough start in life, arriving to the United States with 2 broken legs.  They have healed, limiting her mobility, but that doesn't slow her down much!  She loves to play with her foster brothers and enjoys meeting people.  Kera has a wonderful, happy, playful attitude despite her injuries.  We are meeting with surgeons to see if anything can be done to help this beautiful girl.    Kera likes dogs, cats and people in  her foster home. She is a happy content girl that his thriving and loving life.Kera is looking for her forever family.

Turner arrived in the US from Egypt. This handsome doggy is great with other dogs. He gets along with cats with the proper introduction. He is trained in Arabic and is making English translations. He has webbed feet for walking in sand, a great beach and dune walker. He is looking for a foster or forever home, if you want to meet him, please contact adoptions@foranimalsinc.com.His story: Turner was rescued as a puppy from a kid who tried to strangle him with a very tight rope around his neck. He was shivering because of the trauma and confusion. After waiting a long time to find an escort parent, he arrived in the US in the fall of 2018. He is adjusting well in his foster home.

Yateem, which means “Orphan” in Egyptian and came to us all the way from Egypt.  I rescued Yateem on New Year’s Day, 2018, from the streets of Cairo.  He was all alone.  He had no mother, no sisters and no brothers.  All he did have were the kids who were throwing stones at him while he was trying to survive as best he could. ? Yateem is still very much a puppy, but he is house and crate trained and he’s a very quick learner (something Canaan dogs are known for, especially since this is their only means of survival).  If you would like to know more about my sweet Yateem or if you’re interested in giving Yateem that loving home he so longs for and deserves, please contact me (Patricia) at:  siems@bellsouth.net  OR  text me at 770-714-2880.  Thank you!

Bata came to us from the streets of Cairo, Egypt....YES, Cairo, Egypt!  Bata is very outgoing, very curious and loves to explore everything he sees.  He is shy with new people and in new surroundings, so he would do very well with someone who has patience and understands his shyness, someone who will work with him and show him all those things the world has to offer, things he has never known before in his short, sad existence.  Bata is extremely affectionate and loves to be near you, especially when it’s time for bed.  He wants so much to be near you all night long. ? Bata would greatly benefit from the companionship of another self-confident dog who could show Bata the ropes and help introduce him to all those new, exciting things he’ll experience in his brand new, loving home!  We are currently working on Bata’s leash training  at the moment.  Bata really is such a sweet, precious boy.  If you’re interested in giving Bata that loving home he so longs for and deserves, please email me (Patricia) at:  siems@bellsouth.net  OR text me at 770-714-2880.  Thank you

Sweet, precious Aziza longs for a home of her own. ?  Aziza is an Egyptian Baladi or Canaan dog who came to us all the way from the streets of Cairo, Egypt.  Her right, rear leg was either deliberately hacked off or she lost it in an accident.  But, missing one of her legs doesn’t seem to bother Aziza in the least.  She was pregnant, delivered her babies and was the perfect, loving Mama!  But now it’s Aziza’s turn to have a loving home of her very own.  Aziza seems to like being the only dog, but in my home, she’s just one of so many others.  However, this also tells me that she certainly can be with other dogs.  I just feel Aziza would be happiest with an older, retired couple or person. She’s had such a hard start in her short life, I just think she’d really adore having all that love and attention she’d receive in a nice, quiet home of her own with someone she could love in return.    If you’re interested in giving Aziza that perfect home she so longs for and deserves, please email me (Patricia) at:  siems@bellsouth.net  OR text me at 770-715-2880.  Thank you!

Bondok (meaning Hazelnut - for his color of his fur) came all the way from Cairo, Egypt in the hope for a better live. He was badly injured when he was hit by a car as a puppy and left on the street to die. No one stopped for him and took care of him until someone from ESMA - Egyptian Society for Mercy to Animals - ; saw him. His concussion was so bad that he was unable to walk for a long time. He still has a funny walk but it does not bother him on bit. He also has trouble seeing since his eyesight was damaged too. He needs guidance with stairs, so a house with lots and long stairs would not be good for him. For the fact that his eyesight is limited he does get around very well with no assistance. HE IS NOT A DOG THAT WILL WALK ON A LEASH - HE NEEDS A YARD.He is a funny little guy with a lot of spark and lots of live in him. He would do best with one more dog or alone. He loves human attention and if you are looking for a dog to hang out with he would be it.....Dogs and cats that get hit by cars in Cairo, Egypt get no help at all. No one will stop and check on them or bring them to the vet. They lay on or in the street until the are dead. So ESMA has devoted their efforts in saving them but with not home for injured animals they will end up in big shelters or back on the streets. So Mona - my friend - ask me if I could help and we brought Bondok to the US.  If you are interest in meeting Bondok , please contact me - Patricia at siems@bellsouth.net or 770-714-2880

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Hi! I am Barclay. I traveled all the way from Egypt to find my forever home in Iowa. I like it here, everyone is very nice to me. I am about 3 years old. I had a pretty rough time before I came to Iowa. I am missing some hair on my body because of some very bad people. But no worries now. I am all healed up and really want a home were I can love on all my people. I will need on going care for my skin so I don't get sores. I know lots of commands too. I can sit, down, shake and I am crate trained. I love to play with toys too! I like playing with other dogs but I need a home with no kids. Everyone says I am a very handsome boy. I would love to meet you!Barclay will need an owner who has previous experience with dogs who have behavioral issues.

Owners Died in Motorcycle Crash!Mom and Dad went to work and never came back!2 dogs cared for by neighbors and then brought to animal control.Very sad story.  Barney and Tig (there was a third dog but the original rescue took the dog back) were left homeless.  The friends of the owners called me from Florida and gave me the names of the dogs and reflected on what a horrible situation these dogs were put in.  The owners would never had wanted their babies to go through this.Anyway, they are safe, but they need forever homes.  Barney is 6, a bit of a larger boy, probably 60 pounds, and Tig, 4 years old and about 45 pounds.Both are well mannered, they need work on a leash, most likely because they are great off leash dogs and didn't have to wear a leash very often.Both kids are and have been well cared for..Please come give these great dogs a real forever home, they really deserve to be in a home.We will split them up.  They are not as bonded as previously thought.They are located in South East Arizona but the foster mom makes trips to Tucson usually on the weekends and occasional trips to Phoenix.602-316-8919 (no texts please)

This champagne-coated beauty is a sight to see. Nancy Wheeler comes to us from Florida. Just like her namesake in Stranger Things, Nancy is a strong badass lady with a sweet side, ready to be a part of your family. To adopt or foster: bit.ly/BadassApp

Hi, my name is Miami Max and I came to Animal Haven from Miami. My story is pretty intense, but I don't let it get me down! Some amazing rescuers saved my life after I was dragged behind a car, severely injuring my legs and side. It's taken lots of medical treatment to get me on the mend, but I am healing really well! And despite such severe cruelty, I could not be sweeter. I would do best in an adults-only home as the only dog, because I want to be the star. My favorite pastime is giving out kisses and wagging my whole body to tell you I love you. Meet me at Animal Haven!

Meet Chop! Chop is a great boy that has stolen all of our hearts here! This ray of sunshine is always happy, he loves people, and wants nothing more than a home that will love, snuggle, and play with him! He has had quite the journey to get to Sarl so he can find his furever home. If you would like to read about Chop's heartwarming journey from Florida to New Hampshire please check out the link below to read his story. You will need to copy and paste the link as a new web address. https://www.eagletribune.com/news/new_hampshire/saved-from-death/article_d869edbc-522b-5b80-a539-94e2433ed8a7.htmlChop loves to play and is a very energetic and enthusiastic player, so he should go with children aged 10 and up who are not easily knocked down. Chop could potentially go with children as young as 8 years old as long as the family is dog savvy and understands he may jump up and become mouthy. Additionally, the adopter of Chop should recognize that Chop is partially blind due to retinal atrophy and can become spooked if he can't see someone walking towards him. Usually calling his name and talking to him does the trick. Once he hears his name and your voice he will look for you. Once he finds you, watch out! He will bombard you will lots of slobbery kisses and will try to sit in your lap! :) He just has so much love to give and really needs a family to share it with.This boy will make an amazing addition to his new family! If you would like to meet this sweet boy, come down to Salem Animal Rescue League during adoption hours! www.salemanimalrescueleague.org or contact laurelsilvia@comcast.net. Chop is currently in Salem NH.

Kain is a sweet fun loving approximately 5 year old low rider American Bulldog that is ready for his forever home. Kain is good with kids, good with other dogs after a slow introduction and no cats, he is neutered, up to date on his shots, house trained and micro chipped, he weighs about 55 pounds. For more info about adopting Kain or to set up a meet and greet contact his foster mom Vicky call/text 386-848-0449 Kain is located in Deltona, Florida.

Gorgeous Lily simply leaves us breathless! This gorgeous, Alpha Diva Husky mix will make Northern breed lovers weak in the knees, but she needs seasoned Husky folks willing to focus on her ongoing training, and rein in her chutzpah. Lily came to us last year from a Florida rescue, who asked for our help in solving some behavior quirks that they thought stemmed from some physical abuse in her former home. Lily was slow to trust stangers and very hand shy. She recoiled to human touch and seemed skittish.Often we find that a Husky's beauty is his or her downfall. These stunning dogs attract a wide array of adopters ranging from extremely savvy, to those novices bewitched with his or her \"wolf-like\" appearance. We believe wholeheartedly that a Husky, regardless of individual temperment, requires dog handling ability that is well above average. Time and time again, we have known Huskies who have foiled the best laid intentions of their novice adopters.At the age of four, Lily is a formidable presence. She is a Husky mix (possibly part German Shepherd), and weighs in at a very solid 60 pounds. She is tall and leggy, and extremely athletic. While Lily has a generally friendly demeanor and seems to enjoy the attentions of strangers, she also has a very well entrenched Alpha Diva vibe, and requires some serious handling chops and command presence in an adopter. Lily would be the ideal companion for very serious Husky folks, who are comfortable establishing rules and boundaries with Huskies, or other large breeds, so that Lily knows exactly where she stands. A loosey-goosey home structure will allow her to assert herself in ways that are not optimal for a human-canine living arrangement! The key to success with Lily is a sufficient amount of exercise, and ongoing obedience training to maintain leadership. She is a high-energy dog who needs a couple brisk leash walks each day and, preferably, an active outdoor lifestyle, with a Husky savvy single or couple. She would be the ideal running or walking companion, and would love to accompany her adopters on hiking or camping adventures. She loves the outdoors, and needs to be in a active home, in which she can be integrated into a lifestyle, not relegated to a backyard.Lily would be best-suited to an only dog environment, or perhaps with one other compatible male. While Lily can be bossy and demanding in the Dog Pack, we certainly wouldn't rule out the right dog chemistry, but we would have to test this carefully at adoption. She seems to have some buddies in her canine playgroup, but then also seems to bully some dogs of lesser stature. We don't think that she would be suitable for a home with cats or small children. Lily has decent house manners, that will continue to improve under her adopter's patient, knowledgeable leadership. She is house trained and crate trained, although adopters should expect an accident or two during her transition to a new home. Lily is in excellent health, and has been spayed, and is up to date on routine shots and has tested negative for heartworm and tick borne disease. If you are interested in Lily, please call or text Denise at 860-908-9738, or email Denise@eskiesonline.com for an adoption application.About us: We are an active multi-breed dog rescue local to New England, situated in Canterbury, Connecticut. Our 21 year history is reflected in our website EskiesOnline.com, and on our Facebook page: Eskies Online.

In 'A Midsummer Night's Dream', Shakespeare writes of Hermia: \"And though she be but little, she is fierce\". We could not think of a more apt quote to describe our quite small but mighty friend Raven! Raven may be short in stature but she has an infectious personality and spirit that endears her to everyone at our shelter. She has many quirks, such as she gets a little \"foamy\" around the mouth when playing with a favorite toy, but it's all of her quirks that make Raven into such a fascinating dog. Raven came to us from our rescue partner that helps transport dogs from Miami to the Northeast and from day one we knew we had a special dog on our hands. It was not just Raven's looks, but also physically how she walked and moved. Raven does have arthritis, and has been having regular acupuncture appointments to help with her condition. She is an incredibly special soul that lights up whenever she is around her friends (both human and stuffed toys) and is waiting for her very own family to come along and see just how incredible she really is!Please contact us at (914) 273-1674 or adoptions@adoptadog.org to learn more about Raven.

Please call in advance before coming to meet Princess Leia as she is currently in a foster home! Everyone, please allow me to introduce you to Princess Leia. She is a stunning Shepherd mix, who boasts an ebony and rust colored coat, and a heart of gold. A gentle girl, who is a friend to everyone, there are few that Princess Leia cannot charm and win over! Sadly, this gorgeous lady hasn't had the easiest life prior to arriving. She was originally rescued from Florida after surviving Hurricane Irma. When saw upon her intake screening that this sweet lady also came into us positive for heartworm. Bideawee will cover the cost of her treatments, as long as they are done at our Animal Hospital, for the family that has room in their heart and home for this sweet girl. In turn, you can expect a lifetime of affection, faithfulness, and friendship! If Princess Leia sounds like the one for you, then please ask about adopting her today!

Imagine your typical Monday-Friday week: by Wednesday, most of us are slogging through the paces, dreaming of when the clock will chime 5 PM and we are one day closer Friday afternoon. What if I told you that by adopting a certain dog, every day would give you that Friday at 5 PM feeling? I know, it sounds too good to be true! But by adopting this Wednesday you are guaranteed to be happy every single day of the week.Wednesday is quite possibly one of the most gorgeous dogs we have met. She has a gorgeous brindle coat and eyes that are striking. Now, I'm not saying that her beauty is what will tide you over until the weekend but rather her personality. Wednesday is the definition of a loyal companion. She is the dog in posters that is sitting by her family's feet, content to just be around them. She is a super-smart and sociable dog that thrives off the attention of her human friends. Wednesday is just as amiable with her dog friends, although sometimes she can come on a bit strong (she's just trying to hang). With her energy and activity level, we can see Wednesday doing incredible in a home with older kids that can take her on long walks or runs or a game of fetch in the yard. When left to her own devices, Wednesday is a master at puzzle toys and wobblers and can figure out where the treats are faster than you can put them in. She is a dog that has come a long way (from Miami!) and has been thriving ever since. Let's find her her very own family to enjoy all that life has to offer!If you'd like to make every day Wednesday, fill out the online application below!If you are interested in adopting Wednesday or any of our other adoptable dogs, please fill out our online application here: https://goo.gl/6jE77F

Nova is a 6-7 yr old,77 lb, mastiff mix rescued from Miami approximately 2 years ago. Unfortunately Nova is not a highly adoptable dog because she needs to be an only pet.  Although Nova is well behaved in the presence of other dogs, she has been aggressive when introduced to other dogs. Nova has absolutely no issues with people. She is submissive and extremely sweet.  She is also one of the most laid back dogs you will ever meet. Nova is a go with flow kinda girl and nothing stresses her out. She has met children at adoption events and she really seems to enjoy their attention. She is house trained and crate trained. If you own your home, have a fenced in yard (or live in the country) and do not have any other pets, please submit an application.

Our names are Ruby and Opal and we're two cuties from Florida who have made our way to Virginia and hope to find our furever home together.  We are a bonded pair and love running in the dog park.  We don’t always come when we are called,  because as typical pointers, we think what's on the other side of the fence is so much more interesting.  We are also snugglers and will take over the couch in a heartbeat.  We're crate trained and sleep peacefully through the night in our safe place.  We're friendly with people and other dogs.  We are also good with children.  So far here in Virginia we haven't encountered any cats, so unsure of our likes and dislikes in that department.  Our foster Momma calls us her sweet pups and we totally agree with her. Interested in fostering? Hello there - my name is Trixie! I am currently a member of the Providence Animal Center adoptable doggy crew after making my life saving journey to Pennsylvania from an overcrowded facility in Florida. While I wait for my perfect forever home, I am currently residing in a wonderful foster home! My foster mom says I'm pretty special and wanted to share a bit about me to help convince you that I'm an awesome dog you should consider meeting! First, I am approximately 5-6 months old and currently weigh around 30lbs. I love other dogs and my foster mom feels that I would really enjoy living with another dog as they help build my confidence and let me know that new people are pretty cool too. I've been respectful of the children that I've been around so far and I also didn't mind being around a kitty cat before I came to hang out with my foster family. I'm working on remembering to ask to go outside when I have to potty, but my foster mom says I'm nearly fully house trained - go me! I also really enjoy my crate and will go in on my own if it is open. I also love going on walks and am told I walk very nicely for such a young puppy... man, I'm really a super star, huh?! Oh yeah, I also love to give kisses and snuggle up for cuddles! Clearly I am the perfect package - already spayed, up to date on vaccinations, and micro-chipped what else could you ask for!? If rental, we must receive a letter from themanagement company or owner on their letter head approving the breed listed of the dog they areinquiring about. If the background check has any discrepancies or the current animals in the home arenot current on vaccinations we will void the application.We do a home inspection. Often times we will do a meet and greet in the home with the dog and thefamily if they are in the Tampa Bay area and have another animal in the home.If all is approved then the adopters will complete a final contract form and the donation is made atwhich time the health records and all shot records are turned over to the new owner.

Please contact Jonnie (404) 518-9807 for more information about this pet.BamBam is neutered, microchipped, heartworm negative, and up-to-date on vaccinations. He is able to climb 6 ft fences.  He is a real lover boy and only wants lots of love, attention and gets along with other dogs.  He came from a bad hoarding situation in Florida after he was sent there when a boarding facility closed down.

Crissy is an 8 year old Cattledog/Hound mix while Molly is a 10 year old lab mix. These girls have been through a lot together and we would like them to live their lives out together in the perfect home. Crissy and Molly lived with one owner most of their adult lives. He passed away roughly 8 months ago and a family friend agreed to take the two girls to avoid them being sent to the shelter. Their previous owner lived in Florida so the girls were transported from Florida to Kentucky to settle in with the family friend. Unfortunately, just as these girls were settling and really starting to get comfortable again the new owner accepted a new position  with her job and was transferred to Texas and did not plan to take the two senior girls with her so they were surrendered to our facility. These girls are very easy going, Molly is very sweet and happy to see everyone, Crissy can be a bit shy at first but will quickly approach for attention, Crissy just isn't as excitable as Molly. Both are very mild mannered and are fine with other animals. As far as we know they are housebroke, Molly had a lipoma (fatty growth) removed from her leg when she was spayed but there is no need for any additional treatment. Crissy had a large wart taken off her ear when she was spayed but again, there is no need for additional treatment. These girls have been given a clean bill of health and are just looking for the perfect family to love them and give them the stability they are desperate for.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.COURTESY LISTINGTHIS IS NOT A BULLY PAWS DOG. COURTESY LISTINGS ARE LISTED BY THEIR CURRENT OWNERS OR RESCUERS AND HAVE NOT BEEN EVALUATED BY BULLY PAWS.IF THIS DOG IS CURRENTLY IN A RESCUE OR FOSTER HOME, YOU WILL SEE THE CONTACT INFORMATION BELOW. IF THERE IS NO CONTACT INFORMATION LISTED, PLEASE CONTACT OUR REHOMING COORDINATOR AT STEPHANIE@BULLYPAWS.ORG. Frankie was adopted from the Pasco County, FL shelter, where she was taken as a stray. Since day 1 she showed to be perfectly potty trained and loved to snuggle. About a year ago, we moved from semi-rural Florida to busy Washington DC and while Frankie has tried her best to work out her shyness with new people and animals, we don't think she is really enjoying the big city. She loves the outdoors and has been a great hiking buddy. She also loves to pass out on the couch and work on her basic training commands for tasty treats. Due to her lack of socialization in her early years, she is wonderful at home with just her owners, but struggles with new people and new situations; that's why she needs a calm home and minimal exposure to strangers.

Rufus - in Maine - updated June 2019Rufus has had a rough start to life. He is an approx. 3 year old pitbull mix originally from Florida. Rufus was adopted from a shelter and then used as a fighting dog. He is currently in foster care here in Maine. He is a big goof with a heart of gold. Rufus is very well behaved and loves people. He is energetic and loves to keep busy. Rufus is crate trained. He would do well in a home without small dogs and cats as he has a strong prey drive. Rufus can live with other dogs but is selective. At this time, we are unsure about children as he has no exposure to kids.Rufus is not a Lucky Pup dog, if interested please contact Magda directly at magdarosol@yahoo.com or phone (text/call) 413-522-4492Thank you for considering rescue!

Baby Blue is a recent arrival from Florida. She is currently at a foster home learning to live with cats. She did well but would need a refresher before being adopted to someone with cats. Baby has learned a new behavior ... cock roaching! See the evidence above. Baby loves her people and has been good with the other foster dogs. She does get a bit excited when seeing other dogs on walks.  Baby does like car rides, but will sometimes have an accident in the car. P\lease contact us if you would like to meet Baby.

Zeus is a 9 month old who came to us all the way from Florida! He is friendly, mellow and oh-so-sweet. Ace is dog-social and would do best with a pup who isn't too high energy - he loves to play, but can be a bit shy at first. He is a bit more brave then his brother, but still likes to take it slow. He needs to be adopted separate from his brother Ace, but they are quite bonded so the transition to a new home will require lots of TLC as he adjusts - we would love to see him go to a home with another pup. He adores people and spent some of his youngest days in foster care, so he has previously spent time in a home prior to him coming to Homeward Bound. Ace and his brother Zeus are quite the pair and will absolutely steal your heart!

Hi, I'm Mercedes!I'm a 2 year old petite pittie mix that was rescued from a shelter in Florida. I am very smart, athletic, and know my basic commands. I'm not always comfortable meeting new people, so I need a special person to come and spend time with me to gain my trust. Could that person be you?

Please go to www.peanutsplacerescue.org to fill out the online adoption application and to read the Important information page for fees.   Please like us on Facebook to see current dogs as soon as they arrive.   #9 on the list is Coyotl. Coyotl is a rare coated xoloitzcuintli. Don’t worry if you don’t know what that is, most people don’t!   They’re a very ancient Aztec breed known as xolos (pronounced show low). Usually they are hairless but having hair is not a desirable trait in the breeding world and we rescued six of them from a Breeder in Florida when her building was destroyed in a hurricane.  They were extremely feral when rescued as they only were ever handled by one person if at all.  We had them for many months now working on handling and walking on a leash.  Coyotl is about 6 yrs old and 18lbs and is the tallest of the ones we have.  He is also the shyest with handling.  All are sweet once you get them to relax in your lap.  Coyotl needs a secure fenced yard and a dedicated loving patient owner to bring out his best personality.  He’s absolutely gorgeous and is good with dogs and cats but doesn’t really play with them.  He’s more of the loner in the bunch. He is very quiet and crate trained.  He is stunning looking and that face just melts your heart.  Please go to www.peanutsplacerescue.org to foster or adopt and read the important information page for fees and text 7046509653 with questions or to say you’ve applied.Please like and follow us on Facebook for updates on their rescue and recovery.Visit us at www.Peanutsplacerescue.org to read the IMPORTANT IMFORMATION and adoption fees

Wally is a 1 year old, Chihuahua mix that came into the rescue from rural Georgia. Characteristic of his breed description, Wally has a friendly and loving disposition. If you are interested in meeting and/or potentially adopting this rescue pet, please complete our online application at www.arrus.org. You will be notified via email of your application status prior to our next upcoming event. If you do not receive a response within this timeframe, please send a follow-up email to arrusadopt@gmail.com. Additional information and/or medical records for this rescue pet are available and will be reviewed in person should we choose to move forward in scheduling a meet n’ greet. In the meantime, please feel free to follow us on follow us on Instagram (animal_rescue_r_us) and visit our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/arrusadopt for more pictures and posts from his/her foster family. HELP US, HELP THEM! Animal Rescue R Us is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. We do not receive county, state or federal funding and rely solely on donations. These donations help offset the cost of routine veterinary care, medical expenses, and other necessities while the rescue animal is in our care. To make a secure donation, please visit www.arrus.org/donate . Alternatively, you may visit our Amazon Wishlist (http://www.amazon.com/registry/wishlist/C36VRV500R85) for a current list of needed supplies! All donations are tax-deductible and all are greatly appreciated. Thank you for your support!

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Savannah comes to rescue from animal control in Georgia. She is 3 years old and 45 pounds. We received the plea for help when she had been spayed at the shelter, and had somehow managed to break her spay stitches. This allowed her intestines to come through the incision site, and she was in critical, emergency need for repair. Savannah was rushed to our veterinary partner where she is now doing well. She is up to date on vaccines, has been altered, and does well with people. Savannah does not do well with groups of dogs, and does not do well with any dog when she is in her kennel (crated). She has escaped her kennel at the vet when other dogs were around, and its recommended that she not be crated so that she does not injure herself while trying to escape the crate. She seems to be okay on leash when there is one other dog around. She will need a family who is experienced with slow introductions, and where she will not need to be crated. It is not recommended to bring her to dog parks as she becomes overwhelmed easily when there are groups of dogs around. If you can provide a stable, experienced home for Savannah and would like to adopt her, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

Meet Punkin! Punkin is 8 month old Labrador retriever mix from Georgia! Punkin and her siblings were an \"oopsy\" litter! Punkin mom was not spayed on time and got pregnant on \"accident\". She was born on Halloween! Punkin is your typical goofy, playful, full of fun energy! Punkin gets along well with other but doesn't care for cats! Punkin loves kids, but still being a pup we prefer ones that are up and stable walking!

Name: SelimaApproximate Age: 3.5yrsBreed: BaladiSex: FemaleSpecial Needs: ParalyzedAdoption Fee: $200Up to date on vaccinations/preventatives. Spayed. Microchipped.Where I come from people are very unkind to my breed and I was very close to not making it out alive. I was born in Egypt where baladis are considered trash & many people there go out of their way to hurt us. I was born with a hem vertebra and as a very young puppy; a very traumatic injury took away my ability to walk. Some awful individual shot me, rendering me paralyzed. As if that wasnt cruel enough, I was then tossed into a cemetery where I was left to die. Thankfully, not everyone in Egypt is cruel. I was noticed by a person visiting a loved one at the cemetery & was brought to a local rescue for medical care. I however was one of the lucky ones. After seeing pictures of how hurt I was, SNARR took me and flew me to the USA to get medical treatment. That was in June 2015. The bullet was removed from my spine and because of the extent of my injuries, my back legs needed to be removed. Today, I am a new dog. Even though I dont have any legs, I can cruise around the house just as fast as my four legged siblings. My foster mom has tried to keep diapers on me, but I dont like them so Im not wearing them. I finally trained her, so she just expresses me now & lets me be a naked baby. I love playtime with my other siblings, playing dress up for the holidays, snuggling with my foster mom and racing around the house like a maniac. There are some things though that make me nervous. Children can be too rambunctious and fast, men can be too big and their voice scares me. My wheelchair? I hate it and would rather be on the ground moving myself. Ive never been around a cat before so Im not sure how I would do with them; I guess they do have the luxury of being able to jump if they want to get away from me though. My ideal home would be with a woman or if there happens to be a man with a soft manner and a ton of patience.*Transport can be arranged to any approved adopter within the US at no additional charge.Currently Selima is located in Lawrenceville, Georgia.Please visit SNARRANIMALRESCUE.org to fill out an adoption application and our adoption requirements/process can also be found there!

Current on heart worm and flea/tick prevention.SUPER FUN, FRIENDLY and OUTGOING, PLAYFUL and VERY SWEET! This fee DOES NOT INCLUDE spay/neuter but does include microchip. If the animal you are adopting is not already spayed/neutered, you will be required to sign a contract legally obligating you to have the animal altered. Please contact your HT rep to learn about exclusive low-cost spay/neuter options made available only to HT adopters!Every adopted Homeward Trails animal comes with 30 days of free pet health insurance. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE!You can save animals like this one by becoming a foster! Fosters are like way stations between high kill shelters and forever homes. We need fosters so that we can save dogs before they are euthanized at the shelters. If you are interested in becoming a foster, please check out our information about fostering by visiting http://www.homewardtrails.org/foster-a-pet/dog-and-cat-foster-program/

www.huskyrescueteam.orgIf you have additional questions please email info@huskyrescueteam.orgOur little Nellie is waiting for her forever home!Nellie is a two year old Boykin Spaniel who we rescued from Georgia. Nellie was found as a stray without a microchip and her owners never came for her. Nellie is such a smart, sweet girl! She's fun, active, seems to be good with other dogs. She is crate trained, knows sit and down, and a few tricks. We're working on stay and recall. It's recommended Nellie goes to an active family, especially if they like hiking, jogging and the like. Nellie is a big time snuggle bug and needs a family who will allow her in their bed and furniture. Her favorite spot is the back of the couch like a cat!Nellie can be a bit timid in new situations but does great with reassurance. She's terrified of storms and will need someone understanding who can coach her through them. Nellie is also a bit of an escape artists and often tests her foster's fence. She'll need a home with a fully secure yard or someone who will take her out for lots of walks and exercise.Nellie is being fostered in Maryland. ~~Husky Education And Rescue Team is a foster based rescue. Our dogs are in our foster homes all up and down the east coast. We do not have a facility in which you can visit. We find this a huge benefit because we learn our dogs and are able to educate our adopters on what it’s like to have them live in your home. Part of our process, once pre-approved, is to speak with the foster for the dog you’re interested in. If you’re still interested in adopting from our rescue the first step is to complete our adoption application online at www.huskyrescueteam.org/applyIf you have additional questions please email info@huskyrescueteam.org

My name is Ashton, but foster mom and dad have been calling me Cooper. I'm a 9-month-old, exceptionally handsome Pointer pup who just moved from Georgia to North Carolina. I grew up outside on plantation, and before I moved in with my foster family, I had never been on walks, played with toys or even seen stairs. But it didn't take me long to adjust to this new, comfy lifestyle, and I'm learning new things every day. I now know how to sit, come when I’m called (usually), and my leash manners are improving. I can go up and down stairs, and I even have a few favorite squeaky toys. Technically I borrowed/stole them from my roommate, Toby. He’s teaching me how to share. I love frisking and frolicking with dogs of all shapes and sizes at the dog park. My roommate, Toby, a 12 lb Dachshund, is my favorite playmate. Cuddling with mom and dad on the couch after a long romp at the park is one of my favorite things. A big backyard to play in would be a dream come true for me in my furever home!I do drink a lot of water and have to go #1 every few hours; I'm a puppy with a small, shy bladder. And although I don’t love my crate—there are too many fun and interesting things to do in the house—I know sometimes it is the safest place for me, and I am very good and quiet when I am in there.I'm a super friendly and sometimes get excited and want to jump on you. Remember, I’m an exuberant puppy! So probably no small children in my furever family.During my recent vet appt, Dr. told me that I weigh 47lbs and its ok to gain and another3-5 lbs (yes! more snacks please!!). Other than that, I’m a perfectly healthy canine citizen!So, which lucky family would like to be my forever home? Interested in fostering? Fill out our volunteer application here: http:// www.pointerrescue.org/ helpus.htmlTRANSPORT AVAILABLE TO APPROVED HOMES! (Generally, within 1500 miles)Can't foster right now, but want to help?Consider sponsoring a dog by making a donation to help with vetting costs. PRO is 501c3 non-profit and is fully funded by donations, your tax-deductible gift would be greatly appreciated! http:// www.pointerrescue.org/ donation.html

“Hi everyone!  My name is Joy, can you guess where I got my name?  That’s right; The shelter I came from in GA felt I was such a Joy to be around they gave me this beautiful name! ??I sure do love meeting new humans, especially when they give me food!  My Foster Mom loves to use food to teach me manners, she has been teaching me how to walk on a leash, how to wait for my dinner & how to sit nicely.  I’m so used to living independently outside, I had no idea inside was so comfy! It’s been fun!  My Foster Mom gave me a room of my own, kinda like my own little den; all of my toys are in there and I get fed in there too, she calls it a crate but whatever it is, I LOVE IT!  Sometimes I choose to just lay in there rather than snuggle with my people.  I hope you will take the time to come meet me!  My foster mom says, I’m the perfect age and size!  Being only 50lbs & 5 years old I’ve grown past all those silly puppy stages but still have a lot of years of love to give.”You must be over 21 and a home owner to adopt me. Please visit www.pittiesandpurrs.org to fill out an application.  For further information contact adoptpitties@gmail.com

This fee INCLUDES spay/neuter and microchip. If the animal you are adopting is not already spayed/neutered, you will be required to sign a contract legally obligating you to have the animal altered. Please contact your HT rep to learn about exclusive low-cost spay/neuter options made available only to HT adopters!Every adopted Homeward Trails animal comes with 30 days of free pet health insurance. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals.Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter.We also provide a 30-minute phone consult with a professional dog trainer at Fur-Get Me Not within the first 30 days of adopting - just for HT adopters in the Arlington/Alexandria area. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE!You can save animals like this one by becoming a foster! Fosters are like way stations between high kill shelters and forever homes. We need fosters so that we can save dogs before they are euthanized at the shelters. If you are interested in becoming a foster, please check out our information about fostering by visiting http://www.homewardtrails.org/foster-a-pet/dog-and-cat-foster-program/

Hi, I'm Stella! I am a two-year-old high energy and ready to go pup who is looking for her new forever human! My friends here at the SPCA partnered with another shelter from Georgia so not too much is known about my history. So far my time here at the shelter I have proved to be a very active and smart girl who lacked a bit of impulse control. The behavior department has been working with me and now I can wait at doorways, I am working on my sits, leave its, I am walking on a loose leash (most of the time) and I learned my name! I would love a human who is willing to continue my training to help me be the best puppy I can be. I am so smart and very food motivated! Do I sound like the perfect girl for you? Stop on by today to meet me and be sure to bring the whole family to make sure I am the right pup for you!

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Online Adoption ApplicationAJ and his sister Snickers where rescued from rural Georgia. These puppies were found is bad shape (Thin hair, wounds, covered in fleas,etc). We agreed to help them. Orginally they thought they where Jack russel terrier mixes but these two have long thin legs and long thin faces. They are about 10lbs now at only 6 months so might be between 25-30lbs. We aren't sure exactly what breed they are but they are cute and loving!AJ is such a sweetie. He is able to entertain himself but loves playing with his foster siblings. He likes to be the big brother and keep everyone in line. He is very active so would love to have a family that was as active as he is or even another dog to play with. When he plays he loves to use his paws to try to catch whatever object he is playing with. He gets really excited and loves to zoom around the room always coming back to you.

Leo arrived to the ARC from another rescue within the community; he was pulled from a high intake shelter in the Atlanta region where time was not favorable for him.  Leo is a great dog, he is 3 years old, 50 lbs and a gorgeous red color.  He is very attentive when you are with him and wants to please. He does want to jump at times, yet easily stops when corrected.  He does pull while on walks and shows no attention to the cats as he passes by, a little bit of training will work wonders for him.  He loves treats, doesn't show food aggression and would be a wonderful addition to the family.Adoption Fees:  $85 for DogsAll our pets are spayed, neutered, and up-to-date on all shots. Our dogs have been tested and are presently on Heartworm prevention.  The Animal Refuge Center has these and many more pets waiting for a good home. Before you apply to adopt a pet, please first visit http://animalrefugecenter.org/adoption-policies/ If you are interested in adoption, click ASK ABOUT on the page of the pet you are interested in, or just fill out our handy Adoption Application right here at http://animalrefugecenter.org/adoption-application/If you cannot adopt a pet but would still like to help, see our Sponsor Program information at http://animalrefugecenter.org/services/sponsor-program/

Two year old American bulldog cross. Very sweet and loves every human she meets. Would do best as an only pet. Monica is fairly low maintenance, she really just wants a human to hang out with. She does not need a lot of attention, she just really appreciates your companionship. She came from a horrible situation and Georgia, and is just looking for a nice peaceful existence.Love Shack Dog RescueChantilly, VA 20152Call, Text, Sabrina at 703-505-3758 Email is sdroescher@yahoo.com These are all good loving dogs who need a forever home, Help us Save them

I can’t say enough good things about Joey. At three years old, he just has the best demeanor and most chill personality. While  he does like to pull on the leash a bit, with the proper collar or harness,he is perfectly manageable. He spends all of his time living with another female dog right now, and they do great together. While  he did well as the perfect couch potato in his several foster situations, here he loves to just hang out outside and just quietly sit and watch the world go by. I often find him perched upon a dog house,just watching nature. If not there, he sitting on the stairs, doing the same thing. He’s really not in a hurry to do anything, except eat that is ?Sent from my iPhoneJoey is from Fayette County Georgia and came to us with his friend Chandler.  He’s very good natured and loves a good bath.  He'd like to know “How you doin?” Love Shack Dog RescueChantilly, VA 20152Call, Text, Sabrina at 703-505-3758 Email is sdroescher@yahoo.com These are all good loving dogs who need a forever home, Help us Save them

Looking for a snuggle bug?  Bella is such a lover. Once she was rescued from Coweta Georgia she was so happy to get a bath, she just had to give out some hugsLove Shack Dog RescueChantilly, VA 20152Call, Text, Sabrina at 703-505-3758 Email is sdroescher@yahoo.com These are all good loving dogs who need a forever home, Help us Save them

Luke is a sweet little 3 year old guy.  His one picture was taken at the vets and he was a little scared to be there.   He will sit up for treats and loves being with you.  He has just made a long trip from a high kill shelter in Georgia to his new foster family here in Maryland and is waiting for his new family.  He would like a quiet home.  He is good with dogs.

Macy came to Midcoast Humane on a rescue mission from Georgia along with her three puppies. She would do best as an only pet as previous interactions with other dogs have not always been the best. She has no experience with cats and would need a slow introduction if there were cats in the home. It has also been noted that she would do best with with children 13 and older because she can overstumulate during play and become a bit mouthy. Otherwise she is a sweet girl who loves to play and go on long walks.

Georgia (formerly Thelma) made her way into our shelter on our last transport from Georgia. Prior to her transport, Georgia was found under a porch with her daughter, Louise. Both had multiple litters of pups who came up to Maine and have since been adopted.  Now it is their turn!  Due to her shy nature we recommend that Georgia go to a home with only adults or older children.  We also recommend a meet and greet with any potential dog siblings.  She loves tummy rubs and cuddling once she warms up to her people.  In a loving home with consistent expectations and surroundings, her sweet, loving behavior will continue to come out! If you want to know more feel free to call us at 449-1366 and set up an appointment to meet her today!

This incredibly sweet 10 year old boy is Jackson, and he recently made the long trek from Georgia to Maine in search of a loving forever home after 2 long years in a shelter. He is in a foster home, and his foster mom says he is affectionate, smart, loving and sweet. Jackson crawls up onto the recliner with her to snuggle and get love, and has bonded very quickly. He has been very well behaved in the house, and is house trained and is not destructive at all. Jackson loves his walks and is good with other dogs, but would do best in a kitty free home. But best of all he has the most adorable face you’ve ever seen with this little crooked underbite and toupee. He’s just so sweet! We recently learned that Jackson has a mast cell tumor, but he also had a serious heart murmur so he won't be a candidate for surgery. We are getting him started on some holistic treatments, but at this point he is considered hospice, although he could live for a while and is quite active and energetic at this point.

My adoption fee has been SPONSORED entirely by a gracious donor.The adoption floor can be quite stressful for me, so please ask a staff member to meet me.Shasha traveled all the way to our shelter on a transport from a rescue in Georgia. Shasha is a nervous girl who uses her bark to intimidate new people, but don't let her fool you, she loves snuggling and butt scratches. She doesn't show well in her kennel, but when she meets new people outside she tends to warm up quickly. This girl LOVES her snacks- give her just a few treats and she will open up; she is super affectionate, playful, and cuddly!  Shasha would benefit from continued basic obedience, and impulse control training to help her to solidify basic commands and strengthen her bond with her people. We think because of her size, and her wariness of new people that she would blossom to her fullest potential in an adult only home. Kids are small, loud and move fast, and that can be very overwhelming for a shy girl like Shasha.  We would recommend a meet & greet with any potential dog housemates before sending Shasha home. Shasha is not confident with cats and would likely prefer to live without them. If you are looking for an older girl that would love to enjoy Netflix and snacks with you all day, this is your lady. Patience, treats, and lots and lots of love will make her one very happy dog!  Please give us a call at 449-1366.This animal’s adoption fee is $0 because they need a very special home! They may have medical or behavioral needs that will require their new owners to invest in them, or they may have been waiting a really long time for just the right person! Ask a team member for details, or visit midcoasthumane.org/adopt/adoptionfaqs to learn more. We recommend a donation to help support all of our animals as no animal is ever really “free”.I am a part of Midcoast Humane's No Paw Left Behind initiative. This means that I have been available for adoption for over 30 days. You may see me online or on the new No Paw Left Behind facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/MHNoPawLeftBehind/) to help me find my forever home!

Cylene is a sweet girl who loves belly rubs and came to Maine from Georgia to find her forever home.  Cylene may do okay with other dogs, but we recommend a meet and great.  She does not like to share her belongings (toys, food, rawhides) so she should not be left unsupervised with those items around other pets or kids. Cylene knows many commands such as sit, stay, lay down and sometimes she'll even roll over for you!  She is very food motivated and is eager to learn new commands.  Cylene is a very goofy, fun loving girl and would do best with a patient family who is willing to work on her resource guarding.  You can meet Cylene by appointment only, please give the shelter a call at 449-1366 ext 302 to schedule an appointment if you are interested! Be sure to learn more about her on our No Paw Left Behind Facebook page!This animal’s adoption fee is $0 because they need a very special home! Ask a team member for details, or visit midcoasthumane.org/adopt/adoptionfaqs to learn more. We recommend a donation to help support all of our animals as no animal is ever really “free”. I am a part of Midcoast Humane's No Paw Left Behind initiative. This means that I have been available for adoption for over 30 days. You may see me online or on the new No Paw Left Behind facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/MHNoPawLeftBehind/) to help me find my forever home!

Wile E. is looking for his own family to love! Wile E. is a sweet 3 year old cattle dog mix, who was found as a stray in Georgia. Since making the move North from Georgia to his foster home in Vermont, Wile E. has acquired 4 foster dog siblings and a foster infant baby, all who he gets along with. Wile E. loves to give cuddles and just wants to sit with his people all day. Wile E. does not have any formal training; he has been house trained, has learned the commands sit and laydown. Slow introductions are very important with Wile E. —meeting dogs and people too fast creates a reactive situation for Wile E. Wile E. is a medium energy doggo, who enjoys walks but needs more leash training. Wile E. sleeps on the couch at night but while his foster parents are at work he snoozes in his crate. Wile E. is around 45 pounds, up-to-date on vaccines, neutered, microchipped and heart worm negative. Wile E. is being fostered in Waterford, VT. For questions, please contact Lemieux.racing@gmail.com.Complete an Application:http://www.acdra.org/adoption-application

Meet Brodie! This handsome fella is a 1.5-year-old Shepherd/Australian Cattle Dog mix. Brodie is fully grown at about 50 pounds and was saved from a high kill shelter in Emmanual County, Georgia. Brodie is a very affectionate boy, but due to his rough start to life, can take some time to warm up to new people. He is primarily housebroken, crate trained, and is working on his leash walking skills. Brodie cannot wait to find his forever home!Brodie is neutered, up to date on vaccinations, and microchipped. Home for Good Dog Rescue (HFGDR) is a 100 percent foster-based rescue located in Summit with offices in Berkeley Heights, NJ. All of our dogs live in loving local foster homes until they find forever families of their own. Our fosters begin basic training, housebreaking, and leash walking skills to help pair you with the perfect pup for life! We update Petfinder and our website multiple times daily, so if a dog is available on Petfinder and our website they are still available for adoption. We process all our applications in the order we receive them, and for that reason sometimes the dog or dogs in whom you are interested in may be adopted before your own processing concludes. In order to apply for adoption and set up an individual meet and greet with one of our dogs, please visit us at www.HomeforGoodDogs.org. Find us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/HomeForGoodDogRescue.

Meet Izzy! This adorable girl is a 8-month-old purebred Chihuahua with a stunning merle coat. She currently weighs just 5 pounds and will remain a small dog when fully grown. Izzy was saved from a high kill shelter in Vidalia, Georgia. She is a sweet and submissive girl who, because of her rough start to life, can be a little timid when meeting new people. She is working in her foster home on being more confident around people and making great progress every day. According to her foster: She is really the cutest! Izzy sleeps very nicely in her crate at night and is making great progress working on house training. She would do just about anything for a lick of peanut butter! Izzy would love to be in a home with another dog. She loves to play wrestle with our dog and run after a ball in the backyard. She also loves plush toys.
