Meet Tara! This girl is an 8-year-old Labrador Retriever/ Pit Bull Terrier mix. She is fully grown at 70 pounds. Tara is from Helping Hands Humane Society, a no-kill shelter in Crawfordville, Georgia. Because the adoptions there are so very rare, HFGDR has partnered with them to help get Tara adopted! Before being saved by HHHS, Tara had 3 different owners, who all treated her horribly. Her first owner wanted to train her as a fighting dog. Because she's too friendly, he tried abusing her to get her to fight. Nonetheless, she was still too friendly despite the horrid abuse she endured. Tara's 2nd owner used her for breeding in hopes of making a profit, and her 3rd owner kept her chained with no food, shelter, or water. HHHS convinced the 3rd owner to surrender her, so she could have a chance of living a life with a family to call her own. Tara was quite shut down when she got to the shelter, and understandably so. She was aloof and self-contained, as she had learned that people were not to be trusted. She was never aggressive or even defensive, she was just stoic. It took some time but she learned that good people do exist, and began to show how wonderful and loving she is. Tara now seeks attention, she plays…her whole personality is lighter and happier. She has been through so much bad and has patiently waited to find a home to shower her with love and affection. This sweet girl truly deserves to be spoiled and treated like a princess. Tara cannot wait to find a forever home of her very own!Tara is spayed, up to date with vaccinations, and microchipped. Meet Capricorn! This cutie is a 4-month-old Catahoula Leopard Dog/Labrador Retriver mix, currently weighing in at around 20 pounds. Capricorn will likely be a medium-large sized dog when fully grown. Capricorn and his 10 littermates were all named after Astrological and Celestial signs. They were saved from Vidalia, Georgia. Capricorn has the most stunning light Merle coat with blue and green eyes. Capricorn is a sweet and playful pup who gets along well with everyone he meets, including kids, cats, and other dogs. He is crate trained and making wonderful progress in his foster home on his housebreaking and leash walking skills. According to Capricorn's foster mom, \"Capricorn is a sweet and funny puppy. He loves to play with toys and other dogs. He is always happy to see everyone. Capricorn likes balls, stuffed toys, and running around in our fenced in yard. He also enjoys walks and rides in the car. He sleeps well at night and is good in the crate. Capricorn also has the cutest little grunts to say \"hello\" in the morning or when you come in after being out.\" Sweet Capricorn cannot wait to find a forever home of his very own!Capricorn is neutered, up-to-date on vaccinations, and microchipped.Home for Good Dog Rescue (HFGDR) is a 100 percent foster-based rescue located in Summit with offices in Berkeley Heights, NJ. All of our dogs live in loving local foster homes until they find forever families of their own. Our fosters begin basic training, housebreaking, and leash walking skills to help pair you with the perfect pup for life! In order to apply for adoption and set up an individual meet and greet with one of our dogs, please visit us at www.HomeforGoodDogs.org. Find us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/HomeForGoodDogRescue.

Hogan is a super sweet boy and a favorite of our staff and volunteers!! He seems to greet his human friends with a smile, and they can’t help but smile back when they see that happy face. Hogan is a black lab/retriever mix around 3 years old that weighs about 45 lbs. He came to us from one of the worst animal shelters in the rural mountains of Georgia. A rescue person saw his picture, went to meet him there, and decided this boy needed to be saved.Hogan’s very favorite thing to do is PLAY! Perhaps that’s because he came from a place where he sat alone in a run with nothing to do all day. :( But whether it be Fetch or tug of war, Hogan loves his toys! He’s also been going to Agility with a volunteer friend and he does great on the course! He’ll even swim when given the chance! Hogan is a smart boy and knows some basic commands like sit, stay, drop and down. He is housebroken, crate trained, and good with most dogs.Unfortunately, Hogan was recently returned after being adopted for about 8 months because he became very protective of his home. Hogan needs a strong owner who has experience with protective/territorial dogs. Although he was very loving with his family, we feel that Hogan would do best in a home with no children because of his protectiveness. Hogan does get along with other dogs but has gotten into a few scuffles at doggie day camp.If you’d like to meet Hogan for yourself, just fill out an application at www.ehrdogs.org and be sure to mention his name!! Hogan SCAS!!

Meet our darling Maggie with the most beautiful blue eyes!!  Maggie is just about over a year old and weighs around 30-40 pounds.  We rescued Maggie from a very rural shelter in Georgia.  She had a very bad injury as a stray and needed her leg amputated.  But that hasn’t stopped this adorable tri-pod from getting around.  She loves to run, play and cuddle up next to her human. Maggie is EXTREMELY loving and loves to be with her person. She gets a long great with other dogs, is housebroken and is good in a crate. Maggie loves to run and would do best in a home with a yard, she is a very active pup :).  Her foster is working on basic obedience training and Maggie is a rockstar! She would love a family that either has experience with training or willing to continue her training. She would be great in a home with an active family, as she is a playful fun pup. Maggie would also do best in a home where she is not left alone all day, as she truly loves to be around her people.  Maggie is up to date on her vaccinations, micro-chipped and spayed.If a dog is listed on Petfinder, they are still available. We do not go on a first come first serve basis, but on best fit for the family and most importantly, the dog.  We are taking our best guess on breed and size when fully grown, based on the puppy's physical appearance.  Our adoption fee is $375.   If you are interested in adopting Maggie, please fill out an application at www.snarrnortheast.org.

.Margo is a total cutie pie who is sweet as can be and the kind of dog you can't help but feel happy around because her personality is so joyful.  She is about 3 years old and weighs 50 pounds.  She has been here for a more than a year and would love a home of her own with people that would love her for the rest of her life. She was found as a lost doggie.  She is a hound with beautiful markings.  Margo is spayed, housebroken, up to date with her vaccinations, micro-chipped, and heartworm negative.  She knows the commands of sit, stay, and lay down and walks nicely on a leash.Margo came from a high kill shelter in Georgia where.her time was almost up.  She is a high energy dog who loves to play and run around in the yard with the other dogs.  She is wonderful with people or dogs.  We don't know how she is with cats.  She has shown no aggression since coming here and only seems to have a loving, sweet nature for anyone who comes her way.  We think she would be fine with older children but because of her energy level may accidentally knock young children down.  Margo loves to play with her toys, including balls, tugs and hard bones; which she loves to bite on.  Because Margo is a high energy dog a fenced yard would be a must so she would be able to run around and be safe and secure.  If u think Margo might fit in your family, please call Judi at (908) 510-8721 or send me an application for her. Just click on the Application Button and return it to Save Us Dog Rescue at fries3@aol.com

Layla is one of the most beautiful dogs we have ever had in our rescue.  She is a female Labrador Retriever mix and is 3 1/2 years old.  She is approx 48 pounds.  Layla is spayed, housebroken, heartworm negative, up to date on her vaccinations, and micro-chipped.  She walks well on a leash and would make a good running partner. Layla knows the commands of sit and stay. she also knows how to give her paw and to down when asked. Her favorite thing to do is sit on your lap and go to sleep. Layla also loves to give kisses and cuddle. She has been here for more than two years and no one has shown much interest in her. Layla has come into rescue from a kill shelter in Georgia where her time was almost up.  She is doing well since coming into rescue and loves to give kisses and would love nothing more than to sit on your lap and snuggle. Her eyes are the most gorgeous color and seem to penetrate through you as she looks at you. She takes her treats very gently from your hand.  We believe Layla would do well with children but care should be taken with very young children who could be knocked over by accident through play.Layla loves to play with her toys, including a ball and hard bones, which she loves to bite on.  She enjoys the company of other dogs and loves to play together with them in  the yard.  A fenced yard is a must for this dog so she would be able to run free and safely.  Layla is a high energy dog who loves to play with human or dog.If u think she might be a match for your family, please email Save Us Dog Rescue at fries3@aol.com or call Judi at (908) 510-8721.

Beautiful, sweet, loving, well behaved, gorgeous Buffy.  She is a white, female, pointer/shepherd mix dog with brown spots on her ears and very pale brown spots on her fur.  She is a very unique looking dog.  Buffy is 3 and a half years old, 50 pounds, housebroken, up to date on her vaccinations, spayed, micro-chipped and heartworm negative.  She also has the most gorgeous white eye lashes. She knows how to sit and will do so when asked.  She is a little shy but loves giving and getting love. She is so sweet and loving. Buffy came from a kill shelter in Georgia where her time was almost up.  Since coming into rescue she has shown no aggression but only sweetness.  She is a high energy dog who loves to play with her toys, including balls and hard bones which she loves to bite on.  She takes her treats very gently.  We believe that she would be great with children, but care should be taken with  young children who could be knocked over by accident through play.  Buffy is fine and friendly with other dogs and enjoys running around and playing with them here.  A secure fenced yard would be a must for this dog so she could run safely free.  We don't know how she is with cats.  Buffy is so loving and sweet and is so deserving of a loving home. Please give her a chance. If u think Buffy might be a good match for your family,  please send me an application to Save Us Dog Rescue at fries3@aol.com   Buffy is so deserving of a forever, loving home. If u would like to talk to me about her, please call Judi at (908) 510-8721.

DONNA’S 4 PUPS: These 4 Lab mixes are currently around 11 weeks old and weigh between 12 and 15 lbs! Their family asked for help from the community in Georgia and our rescue group asked if they could keep them until they were ready to head up North. The family agreed and continued to take care of them while the rescue group vetted them, gave them their age appropriate shots and got them vet checked! They are extremely loving, very playful and will make a good addition to any family looking for a Lab mix pup! Come and meet them when they arrive on Friday, June 28th! They have their age appropriate shots, their health certificates, have been dewormed, had flea control administered, had their first month of heartworm preventative, have been vet checked, bathed, and more! For inquiries about adoption please give us a call at 518-654-6220! Thank you for your interest in Adirondack Save-A-Stray!

Shelby is a 7 year old Yellow Labrador mix from Georgia. She can be a bit nervous when she meets new dogs for the first time but with some patience and slow introduction, she quickly warms up and enjoys running and playing and games with them. Shelby is housebroken and friendly with all people she meets.  Her smile is truly contagious!

Ophelia is a beautiful brindle babe!  Hailing from Georgia, she is a young shepherd mix who is super sweet.  Ophelia can be a little nervous at first but once she warms up, she is ready to play!  She is also good with other dogs.
Filburt is a super sweet and smart Black Lab from Georgia.  He is about 2-3 years old and is great with other dogs.

Meet sweet little Partin!  This 9 month old Lab mix came all the way from Georgia and is looking for a family to keep him warm with lots of snuggles this winter!  Partin gets along with dogs and cats and loves to play with dogs. He is crate trained and most completely housetrained.  Sweet with children but can be shy of men. Walks well on leash...smart little dude!

IF NOT CLAIMED BY OWNER AVAILABLE WEDNESDAY, JUNE 26Dabs was picked up from Church House Road in the Oakdale area of Glouster.  Dabs is thought to be between 2 and 3 years old. We have been told that he is not good with cats.The shelter is putting a new procedure into place.  If you are interested in adopting a dog the day that it becomes available you must visit and meet the dog before the dogs availability date.  If you have other animals and/or children at home you must bring them in for a meet and greet to see if they are compatible. Support the Athens County Dog Shelter by walking your dog or yourself!  It won't cost you a cent!  Download the app \"Walk For a Dog\" from http://wooftrax.com to your phone and select Athens County Dog Shelter and then take a walk!  It's great for you and your pooches plus it benefits the homeless dogs at the shelter.  Use the app each time you grab the leash.  You, your dog and the shelter will all benefit.Please visit  http://www.amazon.com/gp/registry/wishlist/U0RLUOCMT7KI to see the wishlist of items that the Shelter is in need of.  Thank You!

Hi! My name is Blessing! I traveled to Ohio all the way from a hard working shelter in Atlanta, GA.  You see, I was heartworm positive, and needed a quiet, safe place to receive my treatment.  I am now free from the preventable parasite and have figured out that life is SO much fun!  I am happy, playful, energetic and just adore people! I am fine with other dogs and am looking for a family who will take me on adventures!  ADOPTION FEE: $200 (All MVPC dogs are heartworm-tested, completely vetted, spayed/neutered, microchipped, crate-trained and house-trained)ADOPTER: Dog experienceBIRTHDAY: estimated 2 yearsFENCE: Required (an electric fence is not an acceptable form of containment)DOGS: YesCATS: No, will give chaseCHILDREN: YesINQUIRIES: ALL inquiries begin with a submitted adoption application, which is found on our website, www.miamivalleypitcrew.com. We do not adopt to individuals under the age of 25. We prefer male/female pairings unless both already reside in the home. DO NOT: USE THE PETFINDER CONTACT/ADOPT BUTTONS--we are unable to monitor those and you will not receive a response. PLEASE NOTE: We are volunteer based and a home visit is required; we have a two-hour adoption radius from Kettering, OH for our adult dogs and 75 miles for our puppies. Exceptions for our ADULT dogs only, though rare, may be made on a case-by-case basis but we must be able to do a home visit. Thank you for your understanding!Professional photos courtesy of the talented Gwen Estep Photography Inc. https://www.facebook.com/GwenEstepPhotography/

Meet Poppy!  Poppy is a delightfully friendly girl, about 2-3 years of age, who was found as a stray in GA and ended up in a shelter.  Poppy was overfed in her former life, and is on a weight loss program in foster care.   Her adopter will need to be fully committed to continuing this until she reaches a healthy weight.  She’s already gone from becoming out of breath on a five minute walk, to walking a little over a mile twice daily at a brisk pace.  With continued portion control and a slowly increasing level of exercise, she’ll regain a trim figure.  This will potentially take several months, but you’ll be rewarded with a wonderful lifelong companion.  She currently weighs 55 lbs. but her eventual  weight should be closer to 35-40 lbs..Poppy is the friendliest cattle dog I’ve met.  She loves everyone and wants nothing more than to greet everyone she sees.  She walks beautifully on leash on a flat collar or harness, and exhibits no reactivity towards other dogs, cars, etc. encountered on walks.   Poppy tested well at the shelter with both small and large male and female dogs.   She currently lives with two older foster cattle dog sisters, and gets along fine with them.  Poppy does have a tendency to resource guard her person from other dogs in the home, but is easily redirected.  Her adopter will need to understand how to work through that should they have other dogs.  She would do best with a laid back or more submissive canine sibling, such as those in her foster home.   She would also be fine as an only dog.Training will be a breeze with this smart girl.   She’s food motivated and takes treats gently.   Poppy is a medium energy girl, but I suspect that as she trims down her energy level will increase.    She does settle  down well in the home as long as her exercise needs are met.   Poppy is spayed, housebroken, crate trained, and rides well in the car.  She can be left loose in the home without fear of her chewing or otherwise destroying property.  She has no separation anxiety and rarely barks.    She is microchipped, heartworm and Lyme negative, and is on heartworm and flea/tick preventatives, as well as being current on vaccinations.Poppy did not test well with cats at the shelter, and I’ve observed a strong prey drive towards cats in the neighborhood as well as wildlife, so she should go to a home without cats or other small pets.  Poppy hasn’t been tested with children, although she’s exhibited her normal happy attitude when passing by kids.  Because she does get excited and sometimes mouthy, she could potentially knock a young child over, therefore, older dog-savvy children only.  Poppy is a confident, well adjusted dog, who will make a devoted companion.  If you’re patient and willing to work on her weight issue, she could be the dog for you.   An active home is a must for this girl. Questions?  Poppy is located in South Williamsport, PA. Email Poppy’s foster home at loftus0828@gmail.com.COMPLETE AN APPLICATIONhttp://www.acdra.org/adoption-application

Charzard is an adult male pit bull who found himself in a high-kill shelter. He is a loving boy and energetic. He gets along with other dogs. We are still learning more about his personality as he is still awaiting transport from Georgia. Charlie is in need of a foster or forever home!Please apply at www.adarrahbullbullyrescue.webs.com if you would like to adopt or foster Charlie.

Ralphie was rescued from a high kill rural shelter in Rome, Georgia. When he came in, his ears had been cut off by either scissors or a knife. He got bandaged up and has healed wonderfully. Even though someone hurt him, you would never know by his personality. He is fun loving, playful and loves to get attention. Doesn't he deserve a great family and his own home??????? Contact adopt@doggieharmony.org to learn more about Ralphie!Age: 3.5 yearsWeight: 50 lbsVetting: Spay/neutered, vaccinated and heartworm negativeTemperament: good with dogs and kids (he needs to be with older kids cause of his rough playful nature); hasn't been around cats yet!Training: working on both house and crate training

BonnieLab mixFemale, spayed, 60 lbs, 5-6 years old, fully vaccinatedBonnie was rescued from a high kill shelter in Monroe, GA and transported to Hampton Roads where she now seeks a forever home. She has an incredibly sweet disposition and is very intuitive and affectionate with her humans. If you need comforting, Bonnie will put her head in your lap or on your shoulder. She gets along well with other dogs, cats and children, having lived with a two-year- old. She is gentle and calm, walks well on a leash, is house-trained and crate trained but is not at all destructive, so she really doesn't need a crate. Bonnie will be your best friend and needs a really special home. Please email littlepups2017@gmail.com or call 757-630-6181 if you are interested in adopting Bonnie.

In honor of Flag Day, now through July 15th, our Red, White and Woo Hoo Adoption Promotion has returned! Animal Profile:Opal is a 3-year-old, 23 lb female Hawaiian muttley (possibly hound or whippet mix) who is quite shy but sweet and dog friendly. She will do best in a home with another playful canine companion that can help teach her that the PNW is not just a scary city. Opal is attached to her foster brother's side, and looks to him for guidance and reassurance. Her foster mom also reports that Opal can be quite vocal when left alone, so apartment homes might not be a good fit for her. We will post more info as we get to know her!Seattle Foster Update: \"This crazy butt is not too sure about humans yet, but boy oh boy does she love dogs! She arrived Friday, 6/21 and would not come out of her crate after the flight. I lured her out once we got home but it wasn't until I introduced her to my resident dog that she started to relax. I took them up to the dog run on my roof and she was doing zoomies around him and wanting to play! She's not afraid of his much bigger size, and she loves to sit under him when she’s afraid. She does well in the crate, is learning her name and is almost house trained!\"Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $500, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: This dog was rescued from euthanasia at a high-kill shelter in Hawaii and joined us from Kauai Humane Society rescue partner. This dog will be available for adoption in Seattle once evaluated.About Foster to Adopt Program:Fosters provide a safe landing spot for dogs transitioning from the shelter environment and help prepare the dogs for adoption. You provide the love and structure, and we take care of everything else! We cover all vet care, and drive the adoption process. Average length of foster is 2-3 weeks. Fosters do get first consideration for adoption, if desired.Apply to foster online at www.doggoneseattle.org/foster-application

Animal Profile: Mia (fka Laramie) is an 18-month-old, 33 lb Hound mix who we rescued from Hawaii. She loves dogs and is starting to realize how awesome people are as well. Mia loves to go on walks and will happily wag her tail the whole walk. She enjoys playing outside with her resident brother but will be chill inside. Mia is learning to walk on a leash and is responding well to verbal corrections and affection. She's good in her crate, and doing amazing with potty training on a set schedule. Her foster mom is already noticing a huge improvement in her demeanor, and the way she responds well to direction. Mia is still a bit shy and we would love seeing her go to a home with another dog.Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $500, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: This dog was rescued from euthanasia at a high-kill shelter in Hawaii and joined us from Kauai Humane Society rescue partner. This dog is available for adoption in the Seattle area.

Animal Profile: Bernie a 1-year-old neutered male mixed (possibly hound and terrier) who currently weighs about 27 lbs. He is shy but sweet and friendly with other dogs. He was transferred from Kauai Humane Society and joined us in Seattle at the end of May. Bernie is settling in well at his foster home with dogs of many ages, breeds and sizes. Bernie would love to have a playmate in his forever home!Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $500, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: This dog was transferred from a high-kill shelter in Hawaii where he was brought in as a stray by a good samaritan. This dog will be available for adoption in Seattle once evaluated in a foster home.

Animal Profile: Mariette is a 2-year-old spayed female Hound mix who joined us from Hawaii. She came to us pretty shy and skittish, but she's coming out of her shell in her Seattle area foster home. She even accompanied her foster mom on a 5K charity walk (she did really well) and will be a great running, hiking, and adventure buddy for an active family. Her foster mom reports that Mariette is a real wiggle butt and wants to follow her everywhere she goes! She is very sweet and trusts her foster mom completely, but is still a bit fearful overall. Mariette does much better with other dogs around, and will do best in a home with a confident canine companion. She is respectful of the two older dogs in her foster home, but also loves to play with the younger dog in the home. In other words, she is great at matching the energy level and play style of the dogs she is around. She loves to play fetch in the yard and is so cute with her big soccer ball! She is crate trained and fully potty trained. Mariette's ideal home will be with a patient, dog-savvy family that has a fenced yard and another dog to help her continue to flourish and gain confidence. Stay tuned for more info on this adorable sweetie pie!Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $500, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: This dog was rescued from euthanasia at a high-kill shelter in Hawaii and joined us from a Texas rescue partner. This dog will be available for adoption in Seattle once evaluated.

THIS IS A COURTESY LISTING. HUNAH IS NOT PLACING THIS DOG. PLEASE CONTACT THE OWNER DIRECTLY.**Courtesy Listing- please contact them directly**Name: DapperRescue: Mikey’s Chance Canine RescueLocation: Kennewick, WA Breed: Border collie/German Shepherd mixDescription:Dapper is a handsome boy who’s looking for an active family to call his own! He is a very sweet, large (75 lbs), 2 year old male border collie/German shepherd mix.  Dapper was pulled by Mikey’s Chance Rescue from a high kill shelter in Idaho. Dapper has never met a dog or person he doesn’t like! Good with children of all ages, but due to his prey drive he’s not recommended to a home with cats or other small animals. He knows basic commands (sit, lay down, stay). He is fully vaccinated, fixed, and microchipped. Dapper needs a fully fenced yard to run and play in. Dapper has excellent recall and he would make a great hiking or running buddy! If you have questions, please contact Mikey’s Chance! (Can be found on FB or at www.mikeyschance.com)

Beautiful RUSTY was rescued from Waukegan Animal Control in Illinois after being found hit by a car!  He had suffered some bruises and a hairline pelvic fracture. He is doing really well now and is all healed up and ready for his new home!! Rusty is a loving cuddly boy who loves to sit in your lap and be held! He will bring love and loyalty to his new family!!If you are interested in RUSYT please contact us at:  info@lichirescue.org for an applicationOr download our app here: http://www.lichirescue.org/foster-adoption-app.html

RYDER isn't from Chicago and doesn't play baseball, but he must be a White Sox fan cuz he's wearing them!. This adorable fella is just a year old, 40 pounds. He loves other dogs and loves spending time with his humans even more. He will sit in your lap all day if you let him! No dugout for him. He wants to be in the mix. He is as sweet as sugar, fun, playful. Would be great with kids; cats unknown. RYDER is currently in a foster home in South Carolina, but we plan to transport him up to the Phila. area in a couple of weeks. He is a lab mix, neutered and up to date on shots. RYDER is ready to play ball, run the bases, and snuggle up with you, All batters up, please contact Patti at psquare828@comcast.net

Winston, a happy 50# young adult about 2 1/2 years, is looking for his forever home.  His owner moved from Illinois to Georgia and couldn't keep him.  Rescued and doing well, has more manners and more training from his foster home..it's a great thing!He is neutered, uptodate on his shots, on Heartworm and flea preventative.He should not go with cats - way too interested in them on leash outside and shouldn't live inside with them either.  He should be fine with kids older than 6 yrs. and doing great in his crate.  He's a ball player, stick, football, throw anything and he'll go get it...now bringing it back is another story!For more information:  Julie cell 770-329-4742 or email for application:  jachambers4806@yahoo.comPet Adoptions Sat- 2-6 pm - call ahead for location and attendance.

Gizmo is a rock star.  Gizmo was rescued from Chicago animal shelter as part of the Safe Humane Chicago program. Gizmo has life time support of any training that is needed.  Comments from SHCHe loves other dogs and helps to test new dogs in playgroup. He's enthusiastic about everything! He loves playing with his toys independently and is super fun to watch. He settles down and just chills once he gets his ya-ya's out. He has amazing bunny ears! Foster mom:This is my sweet Gizmo. He waited over 100 days in the safe arms of Safe Humane Chicago for The Four Legged Ranch to break him out of doggie jail!!! Every day is the best day of his life!! He is the happiest guy and so sweet!! Did I also mention adoptable!!!??? Experience a new day every day with this super friendly, never met a stranger little dude!!! Contact me or The Four Legged Ranch if you would like to meet Gizmo!!More info soonVery Affectionate , food and toy motivated so a great candidate for training and the sky is the limit.Loves other dogs and fetch is his favorite game

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Dizzy is a sweet 11 year old shih tzu/poodle mix that made her way from a shelter in Illinois to Iowa. Dizzy is very low key and independent. Her favorite spot is her soft pink bed. She would like a home where her people are home all day or at least aren't gone too long. Being an older girl she needs more frequent potty breaks. She does fine with her foster dog siblings but is totally fine with being the only one. At her age dealing with young ones, two or four legged, is too much work so older kids and older or calm, laid back dogs would be best. Dizzy hasn't been cat tested but as long as they are respectful of her, they should do fine.Dizzy is crate trained and walks well on a leash but moves pretty slowly and likes to take her time. Her favorite time of day is breakfast and dinner and anything in between involving food! She will wiggle her little tail and looks like she is smiling because she is so excited. Dizzy does have food allergies but we were able to find both canned and dry food and treats that are inexpensive and won't bother her. Other than that, she's a healthy girl.If you are looking for an easy to love girl, Dizzy might be the one for you!Dizzy's adoption fee is $200 and includes her spay, microchip and current vaccinations. Last Hope's adoption process includes contacting references, vet(s), and landlord (if applicable), as well as a home visit. Last Hope requires all dogs are to be kept indoors and on heartworm preventatives year round.

Eyja was rescued with her brother (our dog, Nighteyes) from Chicago at 2mo, but after they were 4mo old, they started fighting very badly so we immediately found a home for her. She is VERY active, likes to run and play, a very high energy dog and very sweet and loving! She also has heterochromia- 2 different colored eyes! One blue and one brown. The people who had her couldn't giver her what she needed so she's back here instead of the pound. They didn't spay her and we currently have 38 cats and this was an unexpected surprise to get her back, as well as still unspayed. We just want her to go to a wonderful loving home. She does great with kids, has been accustomed to an electric fence and does know a few commands.

Hey guys it's Gidget!!! I am about 10 years old and I weigh about 12 pounds.  I'm one of the 7 they rescued from a puppy mill in Illinois.  I'm spayed, up to date on all my shots, heart worm negative and I have a micro chip.I'm pretty quiet and laid back.  I love snuggling up with you and being held. But I also love to lay on your bed or comfy blanket.  And I try to sneak treats from you.  I love treats!!I am a Cushing pup and require my medication once a day and to see a veterinarian ever 6 to 12 months out of the year to make sure my medication are regulated properly I'm still working on being potty trained, but do like to go out with everyone else out in the yard. I tend to use the indoor puppy pads a lot. I am crate trained to sleep in my crate at night.  I do well with other dogs, big and small and even cats.  But I do enjoy my humans the most to follow them around and be in the same room as them.I enjoy being outside when it nice out.  I'm a pretty healthy girl.  I've had a dental and unfortunately they had to take all my teeth but that doesn't bother me and doesn't stop me from eating my food. I love my dry kibble and soft treats!!Come out to one of the events and meet me and my friends!!$400 adoption fee.Please visit our website at http://GroovyPawsRescue.com to see all of our adoptable dogs and for more information on our rescue.

Tom was rescued from the streets of India and is still getting familiar with the streets of New York. He's very shy when meeting new people but does really well with other dogs, which helps him be more confident. Tom will need continued training and would do best in a home with another confident dog he can play with. Please come by during the week to meet him!

Rani arrived at Animal Haven all the way from India. She was hit by a car as a puppy and did not receive the immediate treatment she needed to recover full use of her hind legs. Although she is semi-paralyzed, she is very sweet and seems to get around pretty well despite her condition. She will hopefully be starting water therapy and rehabilitation soon! Until then, come by Animal Haven to meet this special girl.

ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8261Say hello to Mia, a seven month old female Desi dog (a local term for street dog) from India. Mia has quite a rescue story her mom, Furry, was living on the streets of New Delhi with Mia and her three siblings when they were very young, but their mother was unable to feed them due to illness. Mom and pups were taken into Kannan Animal Welfare, a rescue group in New Delhi, and brought back to health. Furry has already been adopted here in the US, and now Mia is the first of her siblings to come in search of a home! Because Mia grew up in a rescue facility, life in a home is very new for her. That being said, theres plenty about it she loves! Walks, couches, grassy open spaces, and toys (even sticks will do!), have all been big hits. When Mia is comfortable she is a funny, happy, and athletic girl whos happy to spend a few minutes wrestling or racing with the other Desi dog in her foster home, and then a few more minutes snuggling with her foster mom. Mia thrives on routine and attaches very deeply to her household members. Although she would benefit from ongoing exposure to new situations and people, she would probably be happiest in a low-key household with one or two people, who can help her develop a sense of security and confidence. Those people will find in Mia a dog who is endlessly entertaining, unbelievably charming, and absolutely devoted! To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org Operation Paws for Homes, Inc. (OPH) rescues dogs of all breeds and ages from high-kill shelters in NC, VA, MD, and SC, reducing the numbers being euthanized. With limited resources, the shelters are forced to put down 50-90% of the animals that come in the front door. OPH provides pet adoption services to families located in VA, DC, MD, PA and neighboring states. OPH is a 501(c)(3) organization and is 100% donor funded. OPH does not operate a shelter or have a physical location. We rely on foster families who open their homes to give love and attention to each dog before finding a forever home.

Molly is a female Indian Pariah dog rescued from the streets of New Delhi India as a orphaned pup. Molly and her siblings were moved to a shelter as little pups when their Mother got hit by a car and died. Sadly the street dogs have little to no chance at finding someone to adopt locally in India so our rescue was contacted to find sweet Molly a loving home in the U.S. Molly is a sweet, playful and outgoing pup who loves everyone she meets. She likes playing with other dogs so will be a good companion for your dog. She is being crate and leash trained and doing well on her house breaking training. Molly is around 5 months old. She is a fully vaccinated, has a blood and stool test report and an International health certificate. She is microchiped but too young to be spayed. If you have it in your heart to give this sweet dog a chance of having a good life please email Rescuewithoutborders@gmail.com for an adoption application. We are also offering foster to adopt option for Molly. Information on the Indian Native Dog breed:IN (Indian Native), Desi (Local) or Pariah Dog is a pure, ancient, indigenous dog of India that abounds the Indian streets. A long time ago, thousands of years before the arrival of modern pure breeds, a race of dogs much like this one inhabited the Indian subcontinent. These were the very first domesticated dogs and Man's earliest animal companions. It has evolved entirely through natural selection without human intervention of any kind resulting into a very hardy, extremely intelligent, alert and independent thinking dog.This is a natural breed of dog that is pure in a true sense and how nature intended a dog to be; hence they are way superior to the artificially developed man made breeds that we call pure breeds today. Its origin dates back 12,000 to 15,000 years – older than any other breed. This is a natural primitive breed which is a direct descendant of the early domesticated dogs. These dogs are found to be genetically healthy with no known genetic diseases and a very strong immune system. They are perfectly adapted for survival; a free-roaming life on the street for these dogs is always difficult and often hostile and hence requires high order of intelligence, quick and independent thinking to survive. On the streets it is the survival of the fittest, usually out of a litter some will get run over by cars while others will succumb to hunger and malnutrition. Only the most hardiest and intelligent ones will survive to produce off springs. When this survivor is adopted as a Pet, their owners are often awe struck with their beauty, grace, intelligence, loyalty and hardiness.They are highly adaptable, quick learners and versatile and are known to be even smarter and definitely calmer than the intelligent Border Collies. They are very agile and excel at many dog sports such as agility and also make great jogging/running companions and can be even faster than Grey Hounds. While active outdoors, they are usually very calm and quiet indoors. They have tremendous stamina and hence need an active family who will take them for a daily brisk walks or a run.IN Dogs are sensitive by nature and do not respond well to harsh training methods and hence need an even tempered, gentle but firm and loving owner who knows how to calmly and consistently communicate the rules of the house.These dogs love children and are known to have a calm and gentle demeanor around them. They bond strongly with their people and make an excellent family pet that is very loving, loyal and intelligent. These dogs do not bark much but are always alert; they are friendly yet wary of strangers and make good watch dogs.IN Dogs are low maintenance dog as they are generally very healthy and like to stay clean; they hardly shed and have virtually no doggy odor. Their smooth, fine short hair coat is easy to groom. They have an all-weather coat that allows them to easily adapt to different weather conditions.A well-looked after pet IN dog will rarely need to see a vet and may live a healthy life of up to the age of 12 – 18 years.This is a medium size dog with an average height of 20-25 inches (51-64 cms) at the shoulder and generally weigh about 28-55 pounds (12 – 22 kgs).They are found in all colors and variation with erect or floppy ears; however, a typical IN Dog usually will have erect ears, a wedge-shaped head and a tail that curls over its back. Most IN Dogs are similar in appearance to other prehistoric dogs like the Australian Dingos.In the last few years, we have successfully rescued, rehabilitated and found homes over 500 pariah dogs throughout the Northeast United States and the West Coast.Please visit our Face book page to see the IN dogs adopted through our rescue.http://www.facebook.com/RescueWithoutBorders

Lucy is a female Indian Pariah Dog rescued from the streets of India when she followed a kind man home when he protected her from being attacked by other dogs. Lucy was a little puppy and probably got separated from her pack and immediately got attached to this human who saved her. Since she was so sweet and trusting little pup he decided to foster her until a good home would be found. Sadly the street dogs have little to no chance at finding someone to adopt locally in India so our rescue was contacted to find sweet Lucy loving home in the U.S. Lucy is a happy, loving, outgoing dog who is social and greets everyone with a wagging tail. She loves to go on long walks and run/play with her other dog friends or children in a fenced yard. She is crate and leash trained and fully house broken. Lucy is 2 years old. She is a fully vaccinated, has a blood and stool test report and an International health certificate. She is also spayed and microchiped. Nawab means 'King' in Hindi. Nawab is certainly a King of hearts! His loving personality won the hearts of the people caring for him at the shelter in India who reached out to our rescue to find Nawab a loving home in the US.Nawab is a male IN Dog rescued from the streets of India when he was hit by a car. Unfortunately his right front leg needed to be amputated. However Nawab has adjusted beautifully on three legs. He loves to go on long walks and run/play with his dog friends. Nawab is an active and very friendly dog who wants to make friends with everyone he meets.  He is crate and leash trained. He is good with other dogs and loves all people he meets. Nawab is a little over a year old. He is fully vaccinated, has a blood and stool test report and an International health certificate. In India Nawab had no chance at adoption so we flew in to New Jersey. If you have it in your heart to give this sweet dog a chance at living a good life please email Rescuewithoutborders@gmail.com for an adoption application. A long time ago, thousands of years before the arrival of modern pure breeds, a race of dogs much like this one inhabited the Indian subcontinent. These were the very first domesticated dogs and Man's earliest animal companions. It has evolved entirely through natural selection without human intervention of any kind resulting into a very hardy, extremely intelligent, alert and independent thinking dog.This is a natural breed of dog that is pure in a true sense and how nature intended a dog to be; hence they are way superior to the artificially developed man made breeds that we call pure breeds today. Its origin dates back 12,000 to 15,000 years – older than any other breed. This is a natural primitive breed which is a direct descendant of the early domesticated dogs. These dogs are found to be genetically healthy with no known genetic diseases and a very strong immune system. They are perfectly adapted for survival; a free-roaming life on the street for these dogs is always difficult and often hostile and hence requires high order of intelligence, quick and independent thinking to survive. On the streets it is the survival of the fittest, usually out of a litter some will get run over by cars while others will succumb to hunger and malnutrition. Only the most hardiest and intelligent ones will survive to produce off springs. When this survivor is adopted as a Pet, their owners are often awe struck with their beauty, grace, intelligence, loyalty and hardiness.They are highly adaptable, quick learners and versatile and are known to be even smarter and definitely calmer than the intelligent Border Collies. They are very agile and excel at many dog sports such as agility and also make great jogging/running companions and can be even faster than Grey Hounds. While active outdoors, they are usually very calm and quiet indoors. They have tremendous stamina and hence need an active family who will take them for a daily brisk walks or a run.IN Dogs are sensitive by nature and do not respond well to harsh training methods and hence need an even tempered, gentle but firm and loving owner who knows how to calmly and consistently communicate the rules of the house.These dogs love children and are known to have a calm and gentle demeanor around them. They bond strongly with their people and make an excellent family pet that is very loving, loyal and intelligent. These dogs do not bark much but are always alert; they are friendly yet wary of strangers and make good watch dogs.IN Dogs are low maintenance dog as they are generally very healthy and like to stay clean; they hardly shed and have virtually no doggy odor. Their smooth, fine short hair coat is easy to groom. They have an all-weather coat that allows them to easily adapt to different weather conditions.A well-looked after pet IN dog will rarely need to see a vet and may live a healthy life of up to the age of 12 – 18 years.This is a medium size dog with an average height of 20-25 inches (51-64 cms) at the shoulder and generally weigh about 28-55 pounds (12 – 22 kgs).They are found in all colors and variation with erect or floppy ears; however, a typical IN Dog usually will have erect ears, a wedge-shaped head and a tail that curls over its back. Most IN Dogs are similar in appearance to other prehistoric dogs like the Australian Dingos.In the last few years, we have successfully rescued, rehabilitated and found homes over 500 pariah dogs throughout the Northeast United States and the West Coast.Please visit our Face book page to see the IN dogs adopted through our rescue.http://www.facebook.com/RescueWithoutBorders

Bupi is a Indian Pariah dog aka Indian Native/Desi dog who was rescued from the streets of India and flown to the U.S. for a chance at adoption. Please scroll at the bottom to get details on this breed.Bupi is a happy, playful and loving pup who loves everyone he meets. He was rescued from the streets as he was all skin and bones with a bad case of mange. He wouldn't have made it much longer on his own as he starving and living in a high traffic area. With good food and medical attention Bupi  blossomed into a handsome dog with gorgeous coat. Bupi is now around 8 months old and weighs around 35 pounds. He is a healthy dog who is fully vaccinated, neutered and micro-chipped. He has a blood and stool test report and an International Health Certificate. Bupi is a very playful and sweet dog who craves for your love and attention.  He loves to gives kisses and get belly rubs. He is a social dog who gets along well with other dogs. He is a smart dog who is crate and leash trained and learning basic commands. Bupi would make a great addition to a family looking for a energetic and social dog.If you want to give Bupi a loving home please email Rescuewithoutborders@gmail.com. Bupi is being fostered in Monmouth Junction, New Jersey. Please note that the pups that you see in these pictures have been adopted. However we regularly rescue pups like these from India who are available for adoption in the US. We are looking for fosters or volunteers in New Jersey for our IN pups/dogs rescued from the streets of India. We need committed foster homes for our pups who will take care of them when they are in the U.S. till a forever home is found.We are also looking for volunteers who is willing to fly with the dogs. It is extremely expensive to fly the dogs solo from India to the U.S; however it is lot cheaper if you are flying with the dogs. If you are visiting Delhi (where we have foster homes) or surrounding cities in India and would like to help us rescue a pup or two from the streets by flying them with you back home to the U.S. please contact us. Please email Rescuewithoutborders@gmail.com for more information.More Information:Desi (Local) or IN (Indian Native) or Pariah Dog is a natural primitive breed which is a direct descendant of the early domesticated dogs. Its truly a pure breed whose origin dates back 12,000 to 15,000 years – older than any other breed We are very proud to be a Rescue without borders. So, what does it mean to be a rescue without borders? In the last 18 months we were able to rescue, rehabilitate and find homes for over 90 IN dogs in the U.S. and Canada. We rescue and adopt within the U.S. irrespective of state borders, but now you may be wondering, why India? Typically in India, dogs that are born on the streets are not kept as family pets. Most people cannot afford to keep a dog as a pet and those who do prefer a western breed as a status symbol. So these street dogs spend their entire lives on the streets in deplorable conditions. Most of the pups that are born on the streets will get killed by passing cars, or die of starvation or malnutrition. These dogs/ pups often become victims of cruelty as some people resort to cruel measures to get rid of them from their streets. The average life span of a dog living on the streets of India is 3 years during which time they continue to live starving miserable life full of abuse and suffering; however when these same dogs when given a chance to live in a home as family pets will live a healthy life of up to 16-18 years. That is why we rescue these dogs to give them an opportunity to be a part of a family and to live their life in a comfort and safety of a loving home. Please email Rescuewithoutborders@gmail.com for more information.Check out our Rescue's Face book page to see our IN Dogs adopted all over North America. http://www.facebook.com/RescueWithoutBordersMore Info on this breed --- Desi (Local) or IN (Indian Native) or Pariah Dog is a pure, ancient, indigenous dog of India that abounds the Indian streets. A long time ago, and thousands of years before the arrival of modern pure breeds, a race of dogs much like this one inhabited the Indian subcontinent. These were the very first domestic dogs and Man's earliest animal companions. It has evolved entirely through natural selection without human intervention of any kind resulting into a very hardy, extremely intelligent, alert and independent thinking dog. This is a natural primitive breed which is a direct descendant of the early domesticated dogs. These dogs are found to be genetically healthy with no known genetic diseases and a very strong immune system. This is a natural breed of dog that is pure in a true sense and is how nature intended a dog to be; hence they are way superior to the artificially developed man made breeds that we call pure breeds today. Its origin dates back 12,000 to 15,000 years – older than any other breed. They are perfectly adapted for survival; a free-roaming life on the street for these dogs is always difficult and often hostile and hence requires high order of intelligence, quick and independent thinking to survive. On the streets it is the survival of the fittest, usually out of a litter some will get run over by cars while others will succumb to hunger and malnutrition. Only the most hardiest and intelligent ones will survive to produce off springs. When this survivor is adopted as a Pet, their owners are often awe struck with their beauty, grace, intelligence, loyalty and hardiness. They are highly adaptable, quick learners and versatile and are known to be even smarter and definitely calmer than the intelligent Border Collies. They are very agile and excel at many dog sports such as agility and also make great jogging/running companions and can be even faster than Grey Hounds. While active outdoors, they are usually very calm and quiet indoors. They have tremendous stamina and hence need an active family who will take them for a daily brisk walks or a run. INDogs dogs are sensitive by nature and do not respond well to harsh training methods and hence need an even tempered, gentle but firm and loving owner who knows how to calmly and consistently communicate the rules of the house.  These dogs love children and are known to have a calm and gentle demeanor around them. They bond strongly with their people and make an excellent family pet that is very loving, loyal and intelligent. These dogs do not bark much but are always alert; they are friendly yet wary of strangers and make good watch dogs. Desi dogs are low maintenance dog as they are generally very healthy and like to stay clean; they hardly shed and have virtually no doggy odor. Their smooth, fine short hair coat is easy to groom. They have an all weather coat that allows them to easily adapt to different weather conditions.  A well-looked after pet IN dog will rarely need to see a vet and may live a healthy life of up to the age of 12 – 16 years. This is a medium size dog with an average height of 20-25 inches (51-64 cms) at the shoulder and generally weight about 28-50 pounds (12 – 22 kgs). With pointed ears, a wedge-shaped head and a tail that curls over its back, an IN Dog is similar in appearance to other prehistoric dogs like the Australian dingo.Please visit the following website to get more info on this breed- http://indog.co.in/ http://indianpariahdog.blogspot.in/search/label/aboriginal%20dogs http://www.dogbreedinfo.com/pariahdog.htm

The love and hope in Hazel's eyes is almost indescribable! She is a true survivor looking for her second chance at a wonderful life! She came to us from an amazing organization Delhi the Street Dog Foundation. Hazel came from India. She was hit by a car, paralyzed, and her family threw her out into the streets.  The pain was so severe she chewed off her rear foot! And yet she survived scrounging and competing for food with other street dogs. This wonderful organization took her in, gave her medical help, and sent her to us! We feel blessed to be able to help Hazel and give her a better chance at life.  She is a shy and sweet pup who everyday gives us back more love and affection than we can imagine.  She has the most beautiful blue eyes that just speak to you! We are looking for a special forever home for Hazel where she can blossom and become everything we know she can be.   Please come and meet Hazel soon!  Her DOB is 2/01/18.Dog adoption fee is $239. This includes the spay or neuter surgery, age appropriate current vaccines (distemper and rabies), microchip, and preventative flea treatment. Please stop by to see our adoptable dogs between 1pm-5pm Tuesday-Friday and 12pm-3pm on Saturdays. You are also welcome to contact us via email at emanimalhosp@aol.com. We hope to see you soon! These are rescue dogs, and we do not have any further information regarding behavior, training or past experiences. For the safety of the dogs, we need to verify residency for all adopters. Renters, please bring a copy of the lease showing that you are allowed to own a dog. Homeowners, please bring a copy of a mortgage statement proving you own your own home. We also require a copy of a utility bill with your name and address for all adopters. We encourage you to meet the pet you are applying for before submitting the application. Your application will not be approved until after you meet the pet. If you would like to print and fill out the application to bring with you to our shelter, visit our website at http://sunnyskysshelter.org/page9.html. *PLEASE NOTE - EMAILED APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED.*

age: 4 yearsAVAILABLE IN THE MIDWEST AND NEW ENGLAND REGIONS...Chance!!!Chance is a dog who has truly lived up to his name.  Rescued from a high kill shelter in Indiana, we took in Chance, hoping that he would receive his second CHANCE at life.  Chance was adopted to what he thought would be his forever home.  Sadly, Chance’s owner learned that he is in the early stages of kidney disease and he was not willing to provide the care that Chance would need.  He was returned to us and is searching, yet again, for his CHANCE at a forever home.  Despite having a kidney condition, the care that he will require is quite simple.  Chance will need to be on daily antacids and senior dog food.  Although he is nowhere close to a senior, the food has less proteins for his kidneys to process.  Chance is around four years old and, as you can see, absolutely gorgeous!  Chance is a smaller lab mix, weighing around 55 pounds.  This makes him just the right size for a family who doesn’t want to be plowed into all the time.  (No offense, huge lab lovers!).  Chance can be a little shy at first but he warms up quickly and LOVES people.  Chance is great with other dogs and always plays nicely.  This poor guy has known nothing but people giving up on him.  All he is asking for his one last CHANCE to live out his days as the pampered prince he deserves to be!Chance is neutered, up to date on vaccinations, microchipped, and kept on monthly preventatives.  If you are interested in adopting, please apply at www.luckylabrescue.com and indicate “Chance”  in the notes section.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Please contact stephodellfcr@hotmail.com for more information about this pet.Noah is an active 5 year old smooth coat male BC. He and his brothers came from Central Indiana and are being fostered in Plymouth, Indiana. If you would like additional information on Noah, contact Stephany at stephodellfcr@hotmail.com. For additional information on adopting Noah or any of the other CBBCR foster dogs, go to the CBBCR website at www.comebyebcrescue.org. Update January 18, 2016Ty and NoahThese two handsome boys are brothers and are now about 4 1/2 years of age. It isn’t required that they be adopted together but they would sure love that possibility. These boys are very sweet and affectionate boys. Ty and Noah need to be placed in a home without children.They are initially a bit suspicious of people they don’t know, Ty more so than Noah, but given a little bit of time to become familiar they are both loves. They are both good with other dogs and regularly interact with other dogs. They both love to chase along after my Border Collie when we are playing fetch.Noah likes to stalk kitties and Ty could care less about them. They both enjoy riding in the vehicle but both are nervous when they are in an unfamiliar environment. They are both good in the house but are still crated when I am not home. Their crate behavior is much better now compared to when they were youngsters but still need the opportunity to go out for potty breaks often and shouldn’t be left for more than about 4 hours at a time.Their idea of a perfect home setting would be a quiet, country setting with a large fenced yard for them to play and have fun with their people and to have at least one stay at home parent. They would be best as home bodies and to go along places for ride alongs but are not the type of dogs that will enjoy going EVERYWHERE and being around lot of “strangers” on a regular basis. If they are not adopted together they would do best in a home with another dog because they do seem to feel safer when they are in the presence of other dogs.Noah has been introduced to some agility obstacles and even though he is hesitant at first, when he is given a little time to get the obstacle figured out he seems to have fun learning how to maneuver the obstacle. These boys are looking for a patient person to provide them with a forever home. Someone who will love them for the soft, sensitive boys that they are and allow them to live in a quiet and predictable home.*******************************************Noah - This guy is a sweet boy that is typically very comfortable meeting new people when they come here for meet and greets. He likes toys but will shred soft, squeaky toys. He is foodie and enjoys learning. He did get to go to an agility open class once and very quickly found out how much fun it is to put his paws up on things ;) He is a very cuddly and affectionate guy. He does tend to have times in his crate where he salivates and has anxiety – but it is not all the time and seems to happen randomly…not because of one thing or another. He is good in the car, reasonable on leash. Good for bathing and nail trimming. I really like Noah and think he has the potential to be a nice companion level pooch for the right person. He gets a bit worried in new environments and is a soft, sensitive young guy…that also will need a patient and understanding human. (9/24/14) *******************************************************Oh, baby Noah.....he is sooooooooooooooooo cute and also a tennis ball junky! He loves, loves, loves tennis balls!!! He takes a bit longer than Spense and Jude to warm up to new people and a new evironment....he and his brother Ty are the most 'soft' of this litter born on September 16, 2013. He is a foodie puppy, and lots of ball drive, and once comfortable in his environment is such a fun boy. He very much enjoys playing with other dogs....was a barker at my kitties at first but now they are old news....he is very good in his crate...it is a rare day that he would have an accident in his crate....which again is awesome compared to how we started. I believe Noah will blossom into a wonderful companion level dog in the right home, that is patient and gentle and knows how to keep him safe and satisfied in his day to day adventures!! (3/28/14)
