Update January 18, 2016Ty and NoahThese two handsome boys are brothers and are now about 4 1/2 years of age. It isn’t required that they be adopted together but they would sure love that possibility. These boys are very sweet and affectionate boys. Ty and Noah need to be placed in a home without children.They are initially a bit suspicious of people they don’t know, Ty more so than Noah, but given a little bit of time to become familiar they are both loves. They are both good with other dogs and regularly interact with other dogs. They both love to chase along after my Border Collie when we are playing fetch.Noah likes to stalk kitties and Ty could care less about them. They both enjoy riding in the vehicle but both are nervous when they are in an unfamiliar environment. They are both good in the house but are still crated when I am not home. Their crate behavior is much better now compared to when they were youngsters but still need the opportunity to go out for potty breaks often and shouldn’t be left for more than about 4 hours at a time.Their idea of a perfect home setting would be a quiet, country setting with a large fenced yard for them to play and have fun with their people and to have at least one stay at home parent. They would be best as home bodies and to go along places for ride alongs but are not the type of dogs that will enjoy going EVERYWHERE and being around lot of “strangers” on a regular basis. If they are not adopted together they would do best in a home with another dog because they do seem to feel safer when they are in the presence of other dogs.Noah has been introduced to some agility obstacles and even though he is hesitant at first, when he is given a little time to get the obstacle figured out he seems to have fun learning how to maneuver the obstacle. These boys are looking for a patient person to provide them with a forever home. Someone who will love them for the soft, sensitive boys that they are and allow them to live in a quiet and predictable home.**************************************************************** Ty has come a long way from where he was at 5 months of age. He is now a sweet and cuddly boy that is very comfortable in his familiar environment. He is excellent with other dogs and fine with cats. He is typically a bit suspicious of unfamiliar people but if given a little space and time he warms up fairly quickly. Ty is a very soft and sensitive boy that is very effected by a change in his environment or routine. He is looking for a home with humans that are very patient and understanding and realize that he will need adequate time to become familiar with them and his new home….this will not happen in 1 week, or two weeks and likely not even 6 weeks. He is a wonderful doggie but wasn’t allowed to have the best start in life and had no exposure to novel stimuli and very little interactions with humans until he was rescued by CBBCR at 5 months of age.He needs a forever home where he won’t have to be crated for more than about 2-3 hours at a time…and a home that will give him plenty of opportunity to go outside for potty breaks…..or someone that would have access to a doggy daycare where he could go daily while his humans are at work away from home. (12/6/14)*******Ty is a very calm BC. One of the most, calm pups I’ve ever been around. He is an observer and likes to lay and watch what is going on and takes it all in…. He enjoys lounging in the baby pool on hot days….he LOVES squeaky toys but will shred them. He also like to have a good chew on a hard bone while he is sunning himself in the yard. He doesn’t like to chase the water hose but loves to chase other dogs while he is chasing the water hose. He is an affectionate and cuddly guy. Good for bathing and nail trimming and acts reasonable on leash. Again, a softie and is worried when out of his familiar environment. He is the biggest of his brothers but is still in the 40# range. He is a sweetie pie but is soft and will also need a very patient and understanding human in his life. When meeting new people, he is typically stand-off-ish…..but is quiet. He does not bark at people he doesn’t know and will warm up much more quickly than his brother. (9/24/14)********************************* Ty is the biggest pup of the litter and is just as sweet as he is big! Born on September 16, 2013, he is one of the softest pups of the bunch and takes a little longer to warm up to new people and new environments than his brothers...but once he does is very much a joy to be around. He also loves squeaky toys and if left to his own with them, will shred them.... He loves playing with other doggies and is good with the kitties. He is VERY foodie and will be a fun boy to train due to his intense food drive! Again, I believe he will blossom into a wonderful companion level boy in the right home, that is patient and gentle and knows how to keep him feeling safe and satified in his new adventures!!(updated 3/28/14)

Charlie joined the American Lurcher Project team three weeks ago.  He hails from a shelter in Indiana.  Charlie is one-half greyhound and one-half coonhound.     He loves to play and run and will need a fenced in yard.  Charlie was tested with a cat and failed his cat test.  He is currently boarding at a pet center in Celina, Ohio.  He is a really great guy who is looking for his retirement couch and a new family.  He would not best children over 10 years of age.  Charlie is neutered and just had a dental. He is Heartworm negative and up to date on his vaccinations.  He LOVES people.  He is not very demanding, but would appreciate walks and play time and a soft couch.

This lucky boy came to us from Iowa during the spring floods. This disaster actually improved his life, as he was badly in need of rescue long before the waters came. He is still quite young and appears to be about 8 months old. Admiral lived in a filthy horse trailer most his young life .His fur was badly matted and covered in all kinds of filth. And then help came! Now he is dry, clean, has a new haircut and a name. Admiral needs a little time to catch up with all that has happened recently. While still quite shy, he is starting to realize that being petted feels pretty good; we have actually witnessed tail wags. This boy has a long way to go, but his prospects are good!If you would like more information about Admiral, or would like to schedule a time to meet him, please contact us at 920-293-8885 or wooflodge@yahoo.com. A fenced yard is usually required to adopt a dog from GPRW. All of our dogs are current on vaccinations and are

Is there anything cuter than a Pyr puppy? Jonah sets the bar pretty high in the cuteness department! This healthy five-month old pup recently traveled to us from Iowa with the help of some wonderful Pyr people. He is a little timid at first, as a great deal has happened in his young life. He gets past it quite quickly, though, and warms up to his visitors. Jonah gets along well with other dogs and is friendly to cats. He walks fairly well on a leash. He has learned some basic commands .What he really needs now is a family to love him and continue to socialize him to the rest of the world. If you would like more information about Jonah, or would like to schedule a time to meet him, please contact us at 920-293-8885 or wooflodge@yahoo.com. A fenced yard is usually required to adopt a dog from GPRW. All of our dogs are current on vaccinations and are spayed or neutered.

www.huskyrescueteam.orgIf you have additional questions please email info@huskyrescueteam.orgIntroducing Coco!Coco is a 1 year old Labrador (possibly Flat Coat) Retriever in need of a new home. Coco was a stray dog and will be arriving to our program from Iran the beginning of May. Coco is said to be EVERYTHING friendly - kids, dogs and cats. Here are some photos and videos of her interacting with other friends. Because Coco is a young dog we'd feel she'd do best in a home with no small children, maybe ages 8 and up. We also think she'd love a playmate.Coco is spayed, current on her vaccines and healthy!Coco has not yet lived with one of our fosters so we're offering a foster to adopt situation. It's almost like a trial run! You agree to foster and she joins your home. After a few weeks if you fall in love, she stays or if she's not the 100% right fit you continue to foster her until an approved adopter comes along.Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dGI1ISLio9UInterested? Get started today...www.huskyrescueteam.org/apply~~Husky Education And Rescue Team is a foster based rescue. Our dogs are in our foster homes all up and down the east coast. We do not have a facility in which you can visit. We find this a huge benefit because we learn our dogs and are able to educate our adopters on what it’s like to have them live in your home. Part of our process, once pre-approved, is to speak with the foster for the dog you’re interested in. If you’re still interested in adopting from our rescue the first step is to complete our adoption application online at www.huskyrescueteam.org/applyIf you have additional questions please email info@huskyrescueteam.org

Kourtney is a very special young girl who has come all the way from Jamaica to find her forever home. She brings a sweet & compassionate energy to her foster home where she has made friends over the last year. Becoming accustomed to life not on the streets has been hard for Kourtney, but she is making progress every day. A life of routine & patience is what Kourtney is looking for in her forever family. She will do best in a positive minded home with older children (teens) & a fenced in back yard to chase tennis balls in the sunshine. Kourtney's foster family says she establishes great companionship with other confident dogs which help her open up once she feels comfortable. Letting Kourtney just be a dog & not forcing her to be anything more than what she is safe with is the key to winning her trust. Kourtney is a treat & food driven hound. High value treats seem to give her enough encouragement to approach & possibly even paw for attention. She is smart, playful & entertaining to have around the house especially if you already have a dog who needs some friendship. Kourtney will attach to their hip & pick up on the daily life activities quickly.To help Kourtney with a successful transition to her home, she will require a fenced yard (she is not quite ready for walking on a leash with a new family yet), and another dog to help her continue to gain confidence. Kourtney is currently in a foster home, if you are interested in learning more about this special gal, please email adopt@baypathhumane.org. We look forward to hearing from you!

CUBA is a 2 1/2 year old Terrier mix originally removed from his home on 6/16/17 with Jamaica. Both were extremely emaciated. Very suave and sophisticated, Cuba is a nice guy who sits happily for treats and walks well! He may even be a Mambo King, but you'll have to stop in and meet him to find out! His adoption fee is $125. Cuba is neutered, current on shots, has been wormed, is microchipped and treated with monthly flea, tick and heart worm preventive. Adopted on 7/11/17, Cuba was returned 2/26/19 because he doesn't get along with other dogs. Cuba will fare best in a home with an experienced owner and as the only pet.
Sweet 10 week old boy just saved from a shelter in Kansas. He loves to play with other dogs and loves people including kids.

Paddington came to us from a shelter in Kansas where the chaotic environment was making him very nervous. This big beautiful boy is very excited about everything!  His manners are a bit lacking through no fault of his own – it is clear that no one has taken the time to teach him, he is very smart and is picking up on everything we are showing him to do!  He is learning how to walk on a leash, and is very treat motivated.  he does best when his people are with him.Paddington is currently on an evaluation hold, as we want to give him time to decompress.  He is also starting treatment for heart worms.If you are interested in adopting Paddington, please fill out an application at www.gotdrool.orgThe Colorado Saint Bernard Rescue cannot adopt outside of Colorado

Hi! My name is Simon and I am a spunky ten pound chihuahua/dachshund mix! I am about three years old and have had a ruff time of it so far. I came to Underdogs from Kansas with a shattered pelvis. Underdogs has taken amazing care of me and I'm all fixed up! I just have a little hitch in my gait and like to go on some shorter walks. :)I currently live with two dog siblings and like having them around when they are calm, but would be ok with a home to myself too. I like to meet new friends slowly, but as long as they're chillwe can become besties! I LOVE to cuddle with my human friends! I like to keep myself busy throughout the day with naps, chewing a good bone, people watching out the window and playing with some of my stuffed toys. I'm not at mybest in apartments as there are too many noises for me to be able to relax!I am completely toilet and crate trained! Come meet me today so we can become best friends :)If you're interested in adopting Simon, please fill out an adoption application here:https://underdogsrescue.org/adopt-form/Underdogs is a small volunteer-based animal rescue and we unfortunately do not have the resources to respond to phone and email inquires about our adoptable animals at this time. If you're interested in learning more or setting up a meeting with one of our animals, please complete an adoption application first. It may take up to two weeks for application review and one of our coordinators will reach out to you as soon as we are through the intitial review process. We appreciate your patience and understanding! Thank you!Our Underdogs adult dog adoption fee is $300, which includes spay/neuter, microchip, and up-to-date vaccinations.Our Underdogs puppy adoption fee is $350, which includes spay/neuter, microchip, and up-to-date vaccinations.Our Underdogs senior dog adoption fee is $175 which includes spay/neuter, microchip, and up-to-date vaccinations.

Onyx is a shy little black terrier mix who came from rural Kansas loving home. She and her sister Pearl were 2 year old left-overs to a backyard breeder, but to us they are sweet little girls learning to be house dogs and developing their self confidence. They are learning that people can be nice and bring treats and toys and give belly rubs. They still tend to form a puppy pile when they don’t know what to do, which is often, but they like being held and cuddled. They are learning to potty outside. They need a patient experienced owner who will give them a little time and training. They do not have to be adopted together, but both would benefit from a home with a confident companion dog to teach them the “ropes.”Onyx is spayed, she is up to date on her vaccinations (rabies, distemper and kennel cough), vet checked, heartworm tested negative and on preventative while in rescue, and microchipped. Onyx weighs just over 15 pounds and could stand to gain a little weight. If you would like to meet Onyx, go to www.cominischnauzerrescue.com and complete the on-line adoption application. We suggest that you print a copy of the application before you hit the \"submit\" button, just in case! We will give you a call to set up a time to bring Onyx for a visit.

Name: BaltoApproximate Age: Approx. 1.5yrs (Born Feb. 2017)Breed: Bull terrier mixSex: MaleSpecial Needs: NoneAdoption fee: $325Up to date on vaccinations/preventatives. Neutered. MicrochippedMy sister (Pebbles) and I came to the rescue suffering with mange. Now that were both fully in remission with a clean bill of health, its time to find a forever home! I may be little in stature but Im a tank, for sure! Sometimes I need to be reminded that I am a strong dog as I can get carried away and play too rough. I love other dogs too so another dog who can handle my type of play would be best. I have lived with cats previously, but not in about a year.Transport to any approved home within the US can be provided at no additional feeCurrently Balto is located in Quinter, KansasPlease visit SNARRANIMALRESCUE.org to fill out an adoption application and our adoption requirements/process can also be found there!

WE ARE NOT A SHELTER. WE ARE A NO-KILL 501-C-3 NON-PROFIT RESCUE: To see an animal, you must fill out an application first and then once approved, we can set up for you to meet the animal you are interested in.Here is the Dog Application that you can copy and paste into a browser: https://fs17.formsite.com/waverlypetrescue/form028182466/index.htmlHank was a stray and his time was up in a kill shelter in Kansas. A WPR volunteer was adopting a dog from this shelter in Kansas, and decided to take Hank too so that he would not be put down the next day. They knew Hank could be a WPR dog. They just couldn't leave him knowing he would be put down. So Hank is now a Waverly Pet Rescue dog. He is living in a foster home. He is up to date on shots, tested heartworm negative, and neutered.Hank is about 3 years old as of May 2019. We have had him for a couple of weeks now and he is doing well! He has not been around cats or children yet.5/17/19: So we picked up Hank last night.  He is such a sweet boy, but very timid.  Unsure of everything.  But, he has already made great improvements in the 24 hours we have had him.  It will just take some time to make him understand that he is in a safe place and everything is okay.  I think he will be a great dog.  He is very loving.  No aggression at all.  He is eating good too.  And getting along great with our dog.  In fact, I think it helped having our dog.  She kind of shows him the ropes sometimes.  He has done great with the kennel as well, and so far seems as though he is housebroke.5/26/19: My daughter is interning at a vet clinic this summer so she showed some pictures of Hank to another employee and they think that he is a boxer/pit bull mix.  When I googled brindle boxer pit mix I got some pictures that do look a lot like Hank.  He unofficially weighs 52 lbs.  We weighed him here at home.  Here are a few words of how I would describe Hank.  Hank is a sweet boy and loves everyone.  He's shy with new experiences but with patience he comes around.  Gets along great with other dogs.  Likes to go for walks.  Housebroke.  He goes in his kennel great at night, but not so much in the morning for the day.  He has been destructive with cushions and blankets in his kennel during the day, but outside of his kennel he's pretty good.  He really likes being around people and seems to be so happy.  He's a pretty cool dog overall.  6/18/19 UPDATE: I had him briefly around a 3 yr old child and he did fine. Was a little startled by the child’s quick movements but I think children a little older would understand better. I can play with his feet and tail and he doesn’t care. I lay on him when we snuggle and play and he loves it.  He has never shown any aggression at all. I think he would probably do just fine with the kids.  He loves attention. Will someone please adopt Hank and give him a forever home? $175.00 adoption fee.WE ARE A NO-KILL 501-C-3 NON-PROFIT RESCUE. All donations are tax deductible. We do not have a shelter. All pets live in foster homes. We only adopt to indoor homes. To see an animal, you must fill out an application first and then once approved, we can set up for you to meet the animal you are interested in. We do background checks on all applicants. If you have assault, domestic abuse, or drug charges please do not apply. If you have questions, please send an email to waverlypetrescue@mchsi.comAll animals see a vet for shots and normal exams. If they appear healthy and there are no obvious health concerns, then extensive testing is not done. This is normal procedure for pet rescues and shelters.Waverly Pet Rescue puts a lot of money into medical care for each dog and cat we take in. $300 is the average cost for basic care. This does not include if the animal had an injury, required extra flea / ear mite treatments, or needed extra days at the vet office.

*Provided byPBRC Courtesy Dog Listings**Please Note - Dogs Available Nationwide - * check (state) before applying.Access the adoption application included with this listing.The easiest way to begin the communication and adoption process is by filling out an adoption application.*****************************************Location: California (Newbury Park) 91320Contact: Johnny AguliaEmail Address: j.agulia@yahoo.comAdoption Fee: $99Adoption Application: http://www.emailmeform.com/builder/form/4k11me3IX134VtfabuDescription: Luna is a very high energy dog, very excited to greet all people she encounters. I rescued her from the Lawrence Humane Society in Lawrence, Kansas where I went to school at KU. Fortunately, the humane society there fortunately saves pit bull mixes from other shelters in the area that can't hold onto the breed. Even though they didn't know her parents, she is easily identified as a pit bull mix, with a softer stature than brawny pits. Luna was 4 months old (2 1/2 yrs old now) and was the only puppy they had, let alone one of the only dogs who greeted me with a wagging tail with her head down and ears back. It was much easier to let Luna run around when I had a yard at my house near school. She loves playing with other dogs, but not cats. She is potty trained and is comfortable in her own crate, especially after having just played fetch for half an hour. She is up to date on shots, spayed, microchipped, and is regularly taking flea/tick & heartworm medication.Please consider a donation to PBRC. Your donations make a difference to countless dogs through spay/neuter, educating the public, promoting a positive image and finding them permanent homes. Donate : http://www.pbrc.net/donate.html

Meet Teejay, available for immediate adoption through Fur the Love of PAWS Rescue!? HERE'S THE SCOOPEvery once in awhile, when are are able, we like to help Euth listed shelter dogs in different areas. Teejay here was on the Euthansia list for \"medical\" At Witchita Animal Shelter - for his eye. We fell in love when we saw his picture and even more in love with him when he arrived here ?? Teejay had eye Entropion, which he had surgery for here after he arrived from Kansas. He's all healed up and he won't have anymore issues there. Absolutely no reason to end his life and we were so glad to be able to pull him off that E list.? FAMILY GOALS! To know Teejay is to love him! He's a big squishy loveug! Loves to cuddle and loves car rides. Loves to go on walks. He listen's very well! He knows sit, shake, and allllmost rollover. Lol. He has a slight 'jumping up on new people' issue, but his foster Mom, Cindi Hill, (Thanks Cindi Hill! ,) has been working diligently with him on this and his new family will need to also continue working with him on it. He gets a little exited with new people but calms down quickly. He also has a little \"talky growl\" when meeting new people but then in about 10 SECONDS, he's your best friend.He's actually a pretty chill dog in his foster home.  ?? Older kids. If you have kids, we are looking for a home with older respectful kids, no rough housing because he can get overly amped up, which can lead to really bad unwanted behavior. Little kids, toddlers and baby's we are unsure on. We have none to test him with. He could definitely could knock a toddler over, and he has an extra long whipping tail that could bonk a little one. ? Good with dogs. We just have to find the right match. Teejay could be fine being the only dog. His love for people is stronger than love from a dog friend. He's been in his foster home with his temp brother Duke for over two weeks and has done fine. Duke is a super social, love every dog, dog park friendly dog. Duke is also laid back and kind of, shall I say, \"whatever dude\" with other dogs. ? If you have other dogs, that personality type is what will be the best fit for Teejay. Teejay is not a dog park dog. He also gets to amped up when he see's other dogs, just because he doesn't know if they want to be friend or foe. ? No cats for Teejay.Here comes the semi complicated part.... Teejay has allergies, as many of this breed typically do. We can't keep him in foster forever until we 100% know what's going to work for him best, because it will take some trial and error to determine. We are working to determine if the allergies are environmental, food or both. And that takes some time.Right now, we are trying different things - a high quality specialty food and he's on Apoquil. Over time, we will do some tweaking to pinpoint what exactly the allergy is. Here's the plus side! We are here for our dogs for life, Always and forever. When we find his approved home (we are hoping is one that knows about allergies and this breed), we will help financially until we can figure out with the help of his new family, what's going to work best for him. We just need to find him the perfect home, and we will work alongside that family to solve his allergy issues, together! Please don't shy away from him because of this. He is such a good boy!??House trained and crate trained but he is also fine to be left free roam.??Teejay doesn't require alot of exercise but he does love his walks and a fenced yard to run around and sniff in.??A fenced yard is required. He is in a 6 foot wood fence now. If you have a short chain link sharing with neighbors with dogs, that's not going to work unless the neighboring dogs could care less about other dogs, as he would probably fence fight. ??He would do best in a quieter home with few visitors. ??New family must be able to afford vet care such as future vaccinations, heartworm/flea tick prevention and whatever else comes up  his entire life. HEALTH STATS!?Approx. 2 years old?American Bulldog Blend?68 lbs ?Neutered male?Current on Vaccines?Heart Worm Negative?On Flea/Tick/Heartworm prevention. ?Fecal Negative?Micro ChippedHOW TO ADOPT:?Stable, established homes required. ?Message the page for our simple adoption app.?An approved adoption application needed before a meet and greet.?? Two week trial home and then the adoption agreements are signed.? Teejay's adoption fee is $100.00? He is located in North Platte NE, but non local adoptions are possible.? If you would like more info, call Jessica Sprague @ 308-539-0277.If you're unable to adopt, please share so we can find the home of Teejay's dreams

Little Charlie is only 2 years old and was turned into our shelter because his owner was scared of him. After having him 2 years, Charlie started grumbling and wanting to wrestle when picked up. The lady had a small child and was scared he would bite her.We have had him a week, he is a very loving, playful dog that just wants to be held. When you wrestle around with him he growls and fusses but that's his way of playing. We've had youth as young as 10 play with him and he just loves to be held. With not knowing the background, we would probably not recommend small children.Charlie is located in Kentucky and will have transfer up north the weekend of the 6th.If you are interested, first please fill out the online application and someone will call you to answer questions about the process.Charlie's adoption fee is $450.00 which includes transport. He has been neutered, vaccinated, heart worm tested, put on 3 month flea/tick preventive/ de-wormed and will come with heath certificates and medical records.

Forever Home Dog Rescue consists of all volunteer’s   The ONLY time to meet our dog’s is during our adoption event on Sunday’s from 11:00 am-1:45 pm at PetsMart, 161 Washington Ave. Ext., Albany, NY 12210.  We do not have a facility, all dogs are fostered in our homes.  We are only accepting applications within a 50 mile radius of the Albany, NY International Airport.  Our minimum adoption donation is $280.00.  ****Please visit our website at www.foreverhomedogrescue.com for our complete adoption process and on-line application.  Thank you for your interest in a rescue dog, they are the best!!  We look forward to meeting you on Sunday!!****If you are viewing me as an adoptable dog, I am available for adoption.--DO NOT send inquiries through petfinder, we are not receiving them.--Hi my name is Duke.  I'm about 2 years old and under 15 pounds.  I'm originally from Kentucky where I lived with two other dogs until our owner couldn't afford to care for us any more.  I've been in my foster home since Jan. 2019.   As you can see from my pictures, I love to be on a lap, it  doesn't matter whose, as long as I can be close to someone.  I am really a people dog.   I have quite the personality.  I'm a lover, a snuggler, a kisser, a hoarder of toys/bones, a thief of toys/bones from the other dogs and a bit of a napoleon.  I'm not a fan of big dogs....there's that napoleon complex, or submissive dogs because I like to be the big cheese.  If another dog puts me in my place when I try to be bossy, I will typically be their friend unless toys are involved and then I'm going to steal them.  My foster mom noticed my back legs would sometimes kick out, like they slipped out of the socket.  The doctor examined me and noticed I didn't have knee sockets in my back legs.  I had a successful surgery.  I hated being confined and not being able to run and play with my fosters, but I survived the healing period and have been release by the doctor.  Since I never had the stability in my legs I was not able to jump.  Now that my legs are fixed, I can jump, but my brain doesn't know that.  If you have a cat, it must like to play and be chased.  I know there is someone out there looking for a little lovable goofball like me...I just wish they would hurry up and meet me on Sunday from 11:00 - 1:45 pm at PetsMart.

Gentle, laid back Ranger is in need of a loving home. I pulled him from a high kill shelter in Kentucky where he was on the euthanasia list, as are all who end up there find themselves. He is so easy, sweet, low key and loving that it seems to me he would make the idea family pet. He is issue free except for not liking cats much and even gets along with small dogs. Please help me find this boy a foster or forever home. He has never had a lick of love in his life according to the shelter staff, having spent his life on the end of a chain outdoors. Then when his owners moved, the surrendered him to the kill shelter!  In the shelter environment where he is not tied up and not exposed to the outdoor elements, he is likely more content than he has ever been. So very sad. He is the EASIEST dog I have ever seen, is not needy or demanding. He is goofy and playful without being frenetic Please help me give Ranger the life he is so deserving of.  I have spent time with him in my home and he is the easiest dog ever!!! I am a trainer and integrated into my house with my dogs instantaneously and without a problem.

Savannah is 2 years old and came from a shelter in KY.  Gentle, very socialized, great with children and other dogs, likes to spend time with you and play with toys. Good choice for a family with children. Are you looking for an ACD who is willing to go higher, further, faster? Then look no further than Captain Marvel !Marvel is approximately a 2 y old female ACD who was dumped at a rural shelter full of puppies. Now she has had her babies and they have found their homes and it is her turn! Marvel is a fun, affectionate and loving dog. She enjoys lots of activity but will also snuggle in the couch once she's tired. She will chase birds and cars, so her new home should have a fenced yard as well as be prepared to work through these drives with her. Marvel does fine with other dogs but will resource guard food or food storage areas from other dogs so any home with doggy siblings needs to have a plan for this ! She loves being outdoors with her person so her ideal home will have lots space or lotsa adventuring ! Marvel is up to date on vaccines, spayed and microchipped. She is currently located in Maysville, KY but transport can be arranged within our coverage area. Please email any questions to julia.kellen.manning@gmail.com.COMPLETE AN APPLICATIONhttp://www.acdra.org/adoption-application

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Velvet's Meet your Match designation is:Wallflower - Shy yet charming canine searching for patient owner with a relaxed lifestyle. Looking for gentle guidance to help me come out of my shell. Treat me sweet and kind and I’ll blossom. (Internally motivated)If you love Huskies but think maybe a smaller one would best – Velvet is the girl for you. She’s about 1 ½ year old & very petite at only 35 lbs. She came to us from KY where she had been picked up wandering all alone for some time.We named her Velvet because coats feel like velvet. She is so pretty, so delicate, so very ladylike, she’s just wonderful. 'V' is very gentle & laid back. She does seem aloof from some dogs. She must get to “know” them on her terms. She is being fostered with about 8 dogs & I think that is just too overwhelming for her. Yet, we have puppy Erica & she plays with her endlessly. Once she’s comfortable with the other dogs – she’s fine. She has had basic training, has perfect manners & walks very well on a leash. MORGAN NEEDS A FOSTER OR LOVING FOREVER HOME!!! This is a courtesy post. Morgan is not available through Dogs XL. Please contact the Animal Welfare League of Arlington.Name:  MorganBreed: Cane CorsoApproximate Age: 5 years Approximate Weight: Currently Living at: Local Foster HomeMeet Morgan, a gorgeous, spayed 5 year old Cane Corso who found her way to the Animal Welfare League of Arlington from a shelter in Kentucky. Morgan is a sweet girl who needs a little extra TLC to thrive - Morgan has shown some fear reactivity to strangers in the past but has made great strides with the help of her dedicated foster and the Training and Behavior Team at AWLA, and we know she'll only improve in a loving adoptive home. As long as Morgan is allowed to meet new friends on her own terms, she warms up and becomes playful, soft, and affectionate! Morgan does very well with other dogs and thrives in playgroups - other dogs help boost her confidence, especially around strangers, when they show her that humans can be wonderful friends and are nothing to be afraid of! Morgan's foster and trainers have been working on conditioning her to use a basket muzzle as an extra precaution though Morgan is more of a \"flighter\" than a \"fighter\" and generally avoids people she doesn't know, so as long as she's granted sufficient space to retreat, she does very well on walks and in other situations with people she doesn't know. To adopt or foster Morgan, please contact the Animal Welfare League of Arlington by telephone at 703-931-9241, email at mail@awla.org or visit their website at https://www.awla.org/Morgan needs a foster or a loving forever home to lavish love and attention on her. Please open your heart and home to Morgan!

Harley originally came from Kentucky. He was adopted out as a puppy (5/26/15) but was returned due to his humans developing bad allergies. He is good with dogs and loves to play with everyone (from Great Dane to puppy Flynn ). Harley wants to be pals with that cat, but she doesn't want to be friends. He did live with a cat before and in his foster home, but no guarantee he will be good with all cats. This sweet boy knows no strangers! He wants to meet everyone on walks (dogs and people). Harley is housebroken and crate trained. He is a cuddly and Kissy boy and LOVES to sleep on his foster mom's feet. He hates squirrels and wants them out of HIS YARD, but he seems to like the little humans (lived with an 11 and 18-year-old) and really just loves to play. He is a big fan of Football and Soccer, although he does prefer HIS football. This guy is just a Loving, Happy, Sweet, Goofy BOY! Really the perfect dog!Accuracy is not guaranteed; however, information provided is accurate to the best of our knowledge.For more information on the pet, please send an email to info@aforeverhome.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.*** Be sure to watch Erica's video below***Erica is SO sweet, gentle, extremely affectionate puppy & very, very smart! What a little love-bug this baby, she just wants to sit with you & be close to you.Erica came from a shelter in Kentucky where she was dumped by her previous owner. They just dropped her & she became “unwanted” thru no fault of her.Clearly, she has German Shepherd in her, but I don’t know what else she is might she might be. She appears white in some photos, but she is several shades of a cream color with yellow trim. She is a lovely puppy.In watching her interact with her foster siblings I'm getting to see just how smart she is. They have a \"chase me game\" where one starts -- usually Scottie -- running at top speed around the shed & make it around the whole yard several times. I just watched Erica figure out the game much faster then most. She started to chase after Scottie but noting it was unlikely to catch her --- since she is so much bigger -- I watched her DETOUR & took a short-cut & met Scottie when she came around. Usually, as they mature they learn that's the only way to catch a dog but she figured it out immediately proving just how smart she is. In my experience, GSD's are always so very smart. That is why they are used as service dogs with Police.She loves people & adores all the dogs here & just wants to run & chase around like a little nut. My guess is she could go as high as 60-65 lbs. full grown. She is doing very well with her puppy training & crate training. When she has to potty, she lets us know.If you have been looking to adopt a constant companion who will just want to be you and love to you & go everywhere you do – please consider adopting my adorable baby girl.In the best interest of our rescued puppies, we pick parents who work from home or part-time. Young puppies, under 6-months, require having new parents who have the time to \"raise them'.We also require that to adopt any of our puppies – 2-months to 11-months you must have personally raised a puppy as an adult --- We cannot adopt puppies into homes with children under 10-years old.LNF does require that adopters of puppies must have experience raising a puppy as an adult & I would not want to put her in with small children under 10-years old. As with all LNF pups/dogs, she has all her shots, spayed & microchipped.We do accept PayPal & credit cards for the adoption fee.All LnF pups/dogs have been temperament tested & live in foster homes ~ All pups and dogs have been housebroken (puppies are paper trained) & crated trained ~ All pups/dogs have been Microchipped ~ Tested for Heartworm, Ehrlichia & Lyme ~ Each dog is on Heartworm Medication year-round while in our care ~ Up to date with Rabies ~ Distemper, Parvo & Leptospirosis vaccines ~ Free of worms.Our adoption fee includes (30) days of FREE pet insurance with an option to purchase, but it's your choice. We strive to provide the BEST medical care available so that YOU are assured all our pups/dogs are healthy, up-to-date on all necessary shots, spayed or neutered by our rescue.Adoption Requirements: *A minimum physical 4-foot high fence or is higher is always mandatory and must be installed. Some dogs may need a 6-foot wood or vinyl fence & if so, it's noted on their profile. We will not consider any applications that does not have an installed fence. We do NOT accept any type of electric fence, no exceptions.Click here to watch a video of Erica.

Those of you who live north of the Mason-Dixon Line have probably never heard of a Redbone Coonhound, so let me introduce myself. They call me Hal & I’m a good ole boy who hails from Kentucky. I belonged to a hunter whose love for me lasted only as long as my hunting prowess. He complained that I was bringing home nothing but “disgusting varmints”, & the next thing I knew, I was abandoned along the roadside with so many of my fellow coonhounds who were also failed hunters. Unfortunately, this is the plight of many coonhounds in the South. To tell you the truth, I was pretty fed up with hunting anyway. Hauling around those smelly old carcasses…for what???  So when I heard that Southern Transport was sending a bunch of us up to Yankee territory, I jumped at the opportunity & found myself at MLAR. With my deeply furrowed & foldy head, & my “awe shucks”, laid back personality, I immediately worked my Southern charm on the volunteers. One volunteer in particular figured out that what I do best is cuddle, & I could see that when she kissed my snoot she was in absolute heaven. And so was I! I would be fine with kids of all ages because I greet people with all 4 paws on the ground. Like most Southerners, I like to have long conversations with you, & I can be quite vocal about some issues. My beautiful sonorous bay can be heard across the meadow, so I guess I wouldn’t be suited for life in a twin or a townhouse. Just a modest home with a nice fenced yard would do as I love to amble & explore new scents. I love meeting other dogs & approach them all with a wagging tail & good spirits. But no cats, please! (Don’t even get me started on that subject!)  Oh, & my brains! When I was in the Home School Room & introduced to those puzzles in which food was hidden, I discovered that if I stood there long enough & licked the volunteer, I would get the food without having to solve the puzzle. Pretty smart, eh? My best trick is that I am unerringly housebroken. A few weeks ago, I had to be crated overnight for 12 hours. I slept quietly & kept my crate clean. Now that’s perfection! My stay at MLAR has made me realize that I was never really cut out to be a hunter, but rather a hearthside hound. So…goodbye to Dixie, goodbye to Stars & Bars. I am now a Yankee Doodle Dandy, ready to enrich your life with love, warmth, cuddling, fun & games, & just plain lazing around.If you are interested in meeting any of our adoptable dogs, please fill out an application at http://www.mlar.org/adopt/adoption-processE-mails regarding adoption are not considered an application. Out-of-state applicants will not be considered, unless there are special circumstances. Main Line Animal Rescue does local adoptions to families with excellent vet references and an installed fenced yard. You must have a secure traditional fence OR a professionally installed underground electric fenced area in which a dog can safely play without getting out). The fence must be securely attached to your house, dog pens, dog runs and a tie outs are not approved. Please visit our web site for more detailed information on the animals in our care, our educational campaigns, and for helpful tips on adoption.  www.MLAR.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website. **Be sure to watch Scottie training videos & playtime below. She is doing really well with her training & eager to learn. She has proven to be a 'Bona-Fide Kid Lover & love kitties too -- video below**Scottie's Meet Your Match Designation is Busy Bee I’m a naturally playful, curious, and trusting canine. Take me for a big walk every day; give me something to do. After my job’s done, I’ll curl up in front of the fire with you in the evenings.Scottie is such a great girl. She's beautiful, tall, lanky, very affectionate as you can see. She just wants to sit next to you & hold hands! She has the whole package -- loves people, loves kids & thinks cats are very interesting.Her name fits her perfectly because her patches are exactly the color of butterscotch! Now that she’s been professionally groomed --- under all the dirt from her former home in KY -- we found she has a soft, lovely shiny white.We have a professional dog trainer who comes twice a week & she works with all the dogs to teach basic training & leash manners. I’m told she is doing very well. When she is out walking in the neighborhood people remark how pretty she is & that is very true. She has also been trained to walk well on a leash so she won't drag you down the street!Winter is not my favorite season to be sure but Scottie loves it. We have numerous large water bowls out back & I when I have to break up the ice she goes crazy with joy. She runs around with her ice chunks as if they are a true treasure!Scottie is an odd combo of breeds, she seems to have some Lab, Hound & a touch of Bloodhound due to her droopy eyes but I think her primary breed is an English Coonhound.She also has a delightful personality, very playful, sweet & loves people & especially loves other dogs. She can amuse herself all day playing with all her foster siblings.There is a video below showing her playing with her favorite toy a rope. You can see she is trying to get the other dogs to engage with a good tug-of-war game but if they don't feel like it -- I've seen her just play with her ropes alone. Since ropes & tug-of-war are her favorite thing to do, hoping she can be adopted into a home with another young dog so they play together. There is also a video of her playing with one of her foster siblings Sapphire.Her legs are still gangly & she still kind of trips over them but as she matures I’m sure she’ll a very graceful young dog. She's a big girl, long, tall & lean and she should be about 60 lbs full grown. So, if you love big beautiful dogs maybe Scottie is the girl for you.If she sounds like the kind of large young girl you would love to bring into your life, be sure to read our adoption requirements on the left side of our website & if you can meet or exceed them you can apply online, also on the left side.We accept or credit cards & PayPal for the adoption fee~ All LnF pups/dogs have been temperament tested & live in a foster home. ~ All pups and dogs have been housebroken (puppies are paper trained) & crate-trained and have had basic training ~ All pups/dogs have been Microchipped ~ Tested for Heartworm, Ehrlichia & Lyme ~ Each dog is on Heartworm Medication & Flea/Tick year-round while in our care ~ Up to date with Rabies ~ Distemper, Parvo & Leptospirosis vaccines ~ de-wormed.Our adoption fee includes (30) days of FREE pet insurance with an option to purchase -- but it's your choice. We strive to provide the BEST medical care available so that YOU are assured all our pups/dogs are healthy, up-to-date on all necessary shots, spayed or neutered by our rescue.Click here to watch a video of Butterscotch (Scottie).

Hi, my name is Peanut Butter and I'm about 9 months old. Me and my litter mate, Reese, were rescued by Bond County Humane Society from a shelter that was out of space in Kentucky. I am friendly, playful and easy going. I am the submissive one of the two of us. Reese bosses me and I usually take it. I am good with other dogs. I will play and run with them, but sometimes I just go off by myself. I am working on my manners with a trainer. I listen well. I walk nice on leash with the help of a harness. I am crate trained. I am available for immediate adoption. I am neutered, UTD on vaccinations, heartworm tested, treated for internal and external parasites and microchipped. My adoption fee is $225.00. If you are interested in making me a member of your family please complete an Adoption Profile in person or on-line at www.bondcohs.petfinder.com. Email the completed profile to the address provided. A copy of our policy regarding warranties, refunds and returns is available upon request.

Dozer is the happiest, sweetest boy,who loves dogs, cats, kids, and people! This dog is never sad and spreads cheer everywhere he goes.Poor Dozer was hit by a car, fractured his spine in two places,and is paralyzed from the waist down.He was left with no pain meds or care on a shelter floor for two weeks. We were able to save him 30 minutes before euthanasia, and get him from KY up to our vetsin IL. We took him to the University of Illinois Vet School neurologists and it's been determined surgery is not an option. He exhibits spinal walking and can stand and walk brieflybut will always need a wheelchair or be carried to get around if outside. He does a very good job scooting around the house when out of a chair and has his own wagon as well as wheelchair. These items will go with him when he is adopted.Any potential adopters should be able to lift and carry a 50 lb dog that is likely to get 60 lbs. Dozer is currently in acupuncture and physical therapy and will need to continue to do so for several more months. He is incontinent and wears belly bands. After learning some things about his care, he's easy to have as a pet with minor adjustments to the household. His sweetness and puppy playfulness will bring you joy a laughs for many years to come.Please contact his foster mom eden@gfrpets.org for more information on his care.

Lucy here and I am an 8 month old, 40 pound bundle of pure LOVE. I came from Kentucky as a stray and am learning what it's like being a house dog and getting spoiled, let me tell you.......I LOVE it! I am quick to learn that we are supposed to potty outside and my foster doggie siblings are helping to teach me that. I love to wrestle and we go racing around the yard like the Dogtona 500! I love everyone I meet and as long as you have patience to continue teach me how to be the best girl I can be, we will be perfect together! Please fill out an application and meet me soon! www.mobilemuttsrescue.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Duffy,McDuff 'Duffy' came to us as an owner relinquishment from Kentucky. Duffy is about 6 months old, heartworm negative & quite reliably housebroken. He is neutered and has recently been treated for roundworms. He currently weighs 21 pounds.Duffy is looking for a home that will allow him lots of outdoor time, exercise and mental stimulation. Duffy REQUIRES A FENCED IN YARD, as he is high energy. Duffy is a quick learner and runs super fast. He would likely excel at a sport such as fly ball or agility.Duffy is fearless for such a young boy. He wants to meet everyone adults or children. He gets along very well with the two bigger dogs he lives with and is not intimidated by being smaller. He has done well with all the other dogs he has had playtime with at other homes. Duffy truly makes himself at home wherever he visits. At a recent exhibition event he went up to other dogs big or small and had no issues.Duffy loves his toys and often carries them around the house or outside to play. He will play tug with humans or other dogs. He is learning to catch a ball by watching the other dogs. Duffy is affectionate but he isn't a lap dog and doesn't sit still for long.Duffy does know how to kennel, however as he is such a people person he does not like the separation. He is only kenneled when no one is at home, for brief periods.Duffy likes a wide variety of treats and is food motivated in his training. He has ridden well in the car and is learning to walk on a leash nicely.Duffy is being fostered in Springfield, Illinois. Please contact the fosterer, Lynn at: riccwat@aol.com if you have additional questions about Duffy.

Misty came to us from a high kill shelter in KY. She was very afraid and has did remarkable since being here at Lucky Pups! Most. She is spayed and UTD  on all her vaccines.  Misty’s adopt fee is $150. Pls email or text us at 317-443-2918 email us for an application.

E.D.O.B. 12/27/15 Weight 69 pounds Before Bullwinkle was transported to the League from a shelter in Kentucky, it was said that he was a very nice dog. He has definitely lived up to that claim. Bullwinkle is a big boy with a large, beautiful head. He has a great personality and enjoys attention from anyone. Because of his size and build, he is very strong. He will need an adopter who will take on a leadership role in teaching him basic manners and obedience. Part Rottweiler, Bullwinkle will need several exercise sessions a day and would love to have his owner included. We have discovered that he loves to run and is even proficient with some agility activities. Rottweilers are very loyal and dedicated to their people so it will be important to socialize him beyond home. With appropriate supervision, Bullwinkle could live in a home with older children. This friendly boy will make a wonderful pet for an adopter looking for a larger dog. Puppy adoptions (6 months and younger) are $200. The puppy fee includes a wellness check and a follow-up set of vaccines at the League. Dog adoptions are $125. All our dogs have been vet checked, spayed or neutered, vaccinated, heartworm tested, and microchipped.

Beautiful Aretha has the stunning markings of a Catahoula Leopard Dog, gorgeous amber eyes, and undeniable charisma. She’s just 2 years old (est. birthdate 4/17) and weighs a healthy 60 pounds. Aretha has travelled a long, rough road. She came to STAF from an overcrowded, high-kill county shelter in Kentucky. Upon arrival, we discovered that she had a microchip registered in Tennessee. We reached out to her family of record, who told us that they’d given her away and did not want her back. To add insult to injury (literally!) a paw injury required Aretha to spend five weeks on restricted exercise and in an e-collar. Aretha likes rubs and pets as much as the next dog, but she is happiest with vigorous exercise and hard workouts. The Catahoula in her needs a purpose in life … retrieving tennis balls, brisk walks and running are her favorites.  She also shows great potential on agility courses. If there is a doggy-version of a triathlon, we’ve no doubt Aretha would rock that, too. Sufficiently exercised, she is a undemanding, affectionate girl. Thanks to a weekly training class and special attention from The Pet Spot trainers (thank you, Eric & Lee!), Aretha has a great obedience-foundation and is happy to work for treats and praise. And speaking of praise, here’s some from Aretha’s favorite volunteer and standing Thursday-night training date: “Aretha is one of the smartest dogs I have been around. She is very trainable, and would be a great Frisbee dog. Properly presented, Aretha will accept new tasks and training very well. I keep treats in my pocket, and Aretha will paw at my pocket asking for a treat. Her vision is incredible, and she can spot people, dogs, birds at amazing distances. Aretha will bond quickly with her new family. I think in a day or two, with some play and treats and pets, she will be a great dog for an active lifestyle family.”• All of our animals are spayed/neutered and current on shots.• We do not do same-day adoptions; we ask that you return for a follow-up visit before taking an animal home.• You must be 21 years or older to adopt from STAF.• We require a 4-foot-tall physical fence for homes with children under the age of 11. We also may require a physical fence for specific dogs on a case-by-case basis, depending on each dog’s behavior and exercise needs.• Invisible fences: Due in part to increasing coyote activity/incidents in the area and the difficulty of predicting how a dog will respond to invisible fence training, we cannot adopt to homes with invisible fences unless otherwise noted in a dog’s profile.• We do request vet and personal references.• We can facilitate adoptions within a 75-mile radius of our Cincinnati-based shelter.Please visit www.STAF.org for visiting hours, a downloadable application, and additional information.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Nikko is a female Staffordshire terrier mix about 8 years old. She is good with older children and people. She prefers to be with calm well behaved dogs her size or smaller. Nikko is house broken, crate trained and rides well in a car (she prefers a window seat so she can see everything). She walks well on a leash and enjoys easy walks. Cats do not bother her. As is common with many white furred dogs with pink skin, she has food allergies and needs to be on limited ingredient dog food and treats (she loves frozen green beans and baked sweet potatoes). In the summertime, she needs to limit her exposure to the sun so she doesn't receive a sunburn.Our adoption fee includes the dog's spay/neuter surgery, parvo/distemper shots and rabies shots (for dogs over 6 months), deworming, microchipping, flea and tick protection, heartworm testing (for dogs over 6 months), and monthly heartworm protection until the dog gets adopted.If you are interested in this dog, fill out an application athttp://www.dreamhouserescue.org. Would like a private meet and greet to introduce this dog to your current pets?Call or text Sue at 513-484-9840 or Bonnie at 513-967-0007.Not sure?Ask about our Foster to Adopt program.Sweet Dream House Rescue is holding adoption events this Saturday from (12-5 pm) at the Newport Petsmart (156 Pavilion Parkway, Newport, KY) and (12-4 pm) at the Eastgate Petsmart (650 Eastgate South Dr., Cincinnati, OH).

Dalton is a sweet boy. He is approx 2 years old and has had a rough life. His body is riddled with scars. You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Name: Anna BelleAge: 8-9 yearsGender: FemaleBreed: BeagleWeight: 29 lbsDog friendly: YesCat friendly: TBDKid friendly: TBDHouse Trained: In progressCrate Trained: YesEnergy level: ModerateHistory: From a shelter in KentuckyAdoption Fee: $250From the Foster:Anna Belle is a sweet little Beagle coming to us from Kentucky where she was found as a stray. It is unknown how long she was left on her own, but she loves human contact. While she tolerates females, her preference is males. Unlike most Beagles, Anna Belle is very quiet. I have only heard a very soft howl once. She likes to be held and loved on, but when she's had enough, she goes to her crate. Loud noises and sudden movements can also send her to the safety of her crate.She goes outside to potty most of the time and we are working on being accident free. She does well in her crate during work hours.Anna Belle likes to eat and drink in private, near her crate where she feels safe. She loves being outside, especially if her person is within sight.Anna Belle would most likely do well with an older gentleman who has time for walks and cuddles. She would love a fenced yard where her she could run, nose to the ground, smelling all the things Beagles love.This senior girl is so deserving of a loving home and a safe place to be for the final years of her life. One look in those trusting eyes and you are going to love her.

March 31, 2019 Loki arrives in MN.  He is a big, strong, powerful German Shepherd who will need obedience training and a fenced 6' yard.  He is very sweet but needs to be a home either alone or with a mild mannered female dog.Loki comes to rescue as a stray from KY.  He was saved from a High Kill Shelter where he was turned in.  His DOB 08.10.17. He is neutered, vaccinated and has a microchip.  He is a sweet dog and solid black in color.Loki should be placed in a home with older children around 12 years or older.  He is very high energy so needs an active home.  He is a young, energetic dog that needs someone to love him and show him the ropes. Loki needs obedience training.His adoption fee is $350.00.  We do not allow our dogs to be tied, tethered or chained. We require they live indoors and not be confined in a yard that has an Electonic underground fence system.  to apply for him, www.faerielandrescue.org under serices on the home page.

Max Sr, March 30, 2019 update.  He has attended a workshop for German Shepherds. Max Sr was calm, relaxed and did all that was asked of him. He does not act out towards other dogs and allowed everyone to pet him. He was totally calm and relaxed around 20 other German Shepherds.  He would make an awesome therapy dog or Emotional Support Animal.  He can be an only dog or be matched with a mild mannered female.Max Sr  was an owner surrender for chasing cattle on the farm property that he lived adjacent to.  The neighbor threated to shoot him if not rehomed.  He is very smart and obedient. He was trained in GERMAN.  If you know German commands, he would be a great dog for you.  His DOB is 1.25.09.  He is vaccinated, neutered and has a microchip.  He was transported from KY to MN and every person that met him said how gentle he was.He is a big boy at about 75 # but is very thin.  He easily could weigh in around 96#.   He is friendly and seems to get along with most other dogs.  We do not recommend very small children like toddlers because of his size.  He has no medical issues that we are aware of.  He needs obedience training.His adoption fee is $200.00. We do not allow our dogs to lie outside or be tied, tethered or chained.  If you are interested in applying go to www.faerielandrescue.org under services on the home page.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Name: MouseyDOB: 6/17/17Weight: 43.8 PoundsAdoption Fee: $350Hi there my name is Mousey but my foster family calls me Libby! My foster parents say I’m the sweetest but they really hope I will learn to trust others too so others can see just how sweet I am. They say if you take one look at my piercing eyes you can see into my soul. I came to Minnesota from Kentucky and was in a shelter for some time and I was so scared I would spend my days hiding under a pile of blankets. I didn’t find comfort in any humans until my foster parents and since learning to trust them I’m still struggling with new people. My foster parents say that a dog savvy owner will be very beneficial to help instill confidence in me and continue to work on my training. When I see new people I bark and growl and I can look really mean but I’m doing it because I’m scared. It would be best for me to be in a home that doesn’t have a lot of visitors and to have a bit of space outside because I have a hard time having fun outside when I’m making sure the neighbors are staying put. I stay in the crate during the day and I keep my crate clean and I’m going potty on a schedule!I love going on walks and my interaction with all dogs has been great. I really look to other dogs to know that everything is okay. Since my initial reaction to new people can be quite aggressive it may take me some time to trust you but once I know I’m safe with you, I will love you more than you can imagine.I would really love to go to a home that has another dog and a family that will love me unconditionally and continue to teach me that I can trust. I am a great cuddle buddy; I do great in car rides and just really can’t get enough love! Please fill out an application if you would like to meet me or learn more about me!An adoption application is the best way to show your interest in an animal. Once we receive your application, a placement coordinator will be in contact with you as soon as possible.Please check out our website, www.ruffstartrescue.org for more details and additional pictures on any of our animals!All Ruff Start dogs and cats are spayed/neutered, up to date on age appropriate vaccines, microchipped, dewormed, and on monthly flea/tick and heartworm prevention (dogs) as well as heartworm tested (dogs).Ruff Start Rescue is a foster based rescue. Animals are located in homes throughout Minnesota. We do not have a facility where animals are kept.Ruff Start Rescue Adoption Policies: http://www.ruffstartrescue.org/info/display?PageID=11744

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Adopt me!*Annie needs a foster home, would love another dog that is her size or medium sized to play with!*Annie is a 3-5year old (1 vet said 5, another vet said 3-5 and the most recent vet guessed her to be 3), 50-55 lb Walker Coonhound. She was rescued from a Kentucky pound, where it looked like she had been neglected by a previous owner as she was very underweight. Annie is now in great health and waiting for her forever home in Minnesota. She is a very sweet affectionate dog, good with other dogs (loves to play) and people. Annie would love an adoptive home with a fenced in yard so she can move and explore and sniff to her heart's content. Hounds are fun dogs to take to fenced in dog parks, their love of discovery and activity is a great way to help you get out there and have some fun in nature too! Annie is house trained (although the first week in a new place may have a few accidents) and crate trained, is very treat motivated which makes training fun and is very loving to her people.Annie has some anxiety, and she is comforted in her crate. In her foster home, the crate is available to her with the door open when people are home, and closed when they leave.She'd make a nice family dog, or a companion for a single person or couple who would be able to take her out for walks, and wants a buddy to cuddle with at home. Annie is a little bit skittish, she's jumpy when she hears loud sudden noises.She would love to join an active family who can take her out on walks a lot, dog parks, obedience training, things to keep her stimulated. If she gets bored, she will pace throughout the house looking for something to do.She seems to be especially nervous around large bald men (maybe her previous owner was a large bald man and didn't treat her so nice). Sometimes when a new person comes in the door she'll get nervous and howl and pace, but she calms down after you let her know the person is ok or take her to another room where she feels safe.We haven't tested Annie with cats yet.She loves to give hugs :) Tiny kids may be too much for her (because she gets startled easily), but she's been good with the older kids (6, 7 and 12) in her foster home.If you'd love a sweet dog who needs some extra love, attention, patience, understanding and some training to teach her what it's like to be loved and part of a home, Annie just may be your girl. Take her in and give her a month or two of patience and training and she'll reward you with love the rest of her life.If you're interested in adopting Annie, or foster to adopt, please fill out the form below: redemptionroadrescue.rescuegroups.org/forms In order to foster, you must reside within 40 miles of Minneapolis, MN. If you are not within this radius but are interested in adopting, please fill out the pre adoption form and we can connect you with the foster home when the dog is here and ready to meet families. Thanks! Adoption fees range from $300-$600 (young puppies usually on the higher end, seniors on the low end, all others somewhere in between) redemptionroadrescue@q.com http://redemptionroadrescue.rescuegroups.org 612-978-1284 All dogs fully vetted: Spayed or Neutered Rabies vaccine DHPP vaccine Heartworm test or 4DX test (over 6- 8 mos old) Microchipped Dewormed Flea/tick prevention

Drake is a tiny 11 pounds and 3 months old! This big eared tiny pup has been turning heads ever since he arrived in NYC from a Kentucky shelter. For the most part he’s got a calm demeanor and likes to chill out with his head rested on your shoulder or lap- but he is always ready to play with his foster sister and with humans as wellHe is getting lots of cuddles and love in his foster home and would do great in any home that continues to keep him socialized including one with other dogs or children. Raven & her sister Raina came from KY. The person who had them agreed that they had waaay too many dogs that they could not care for any longer. We're glad they decided to hand these girls over since they were fending for themselves living outside under a porch :( Raven is now about 1yr and weighs about 50lbs.Raven's sister has found a home & now she waits... She has an independence/confidence about her. Her coloring is very unique since she has scattered brindle in her coat through her legs & on her face. Though her fur is not as long as her sister's was, it still has some \"depth\" to it. We also believe there may be some greyhound in her since she's got very muscular back thighs and a 15in long tail that hangs just like one. Raven has not destroyed a thing in fostercare yet so we're hoping that she keeps up with that behavior.After she was spayed, she went through a growth spurt and we found that her one front leg is longer than the other so she has a bit of a 'lurch' to her gait. At the moment, this doesn't slow her down a bit and she runs like the wind. We got her xrays and the vet believes it's simply a case of the bones not forming properly & the poor nutrition she had when she was young. In the future she may need to be a tripod, but for now she's not in any pain and keeps up with all the dogs she's met just fine. She has typical puppy energy and needs some basic manners with other dogs & people. Raven will need training but she will make it SO worth it! We've never had a dog in fostercare that loves a massage & snuggle as much as her!If you have the time and patience to train a puppy, please visit our site for details on how to adopt and an application at endingthesadness.org. We have a 2hr max adoption radius for our animals.S&L Animal Rescue is in need of foster homes!Please submit our foster application if you can help us save lives:https://form.jotform.com/82373733379163

This adorable lady is Anne Marie. She came all the way from a shelter in Kentucky to find her forever home! We don't know anything about Anne Marie's past but she can be a little nervous and shy when she is first approached. Once you start loving on her and giving her snuggles, she will start to relax and slowly cuddle up closer to you for more. She is a super sweet and loving girl that just needs to be shown all the love and care that she deserves! Once she is comfortable she should really start to come out of her shell and be a great companion and friend to someone that puts in the time and effort for her. You can tell she really wants that love and affection and just needs to learn to trust you. She should probably meet any potential \"dog siblings\" before going home with them. If you think sweet Anne Marie would be a great addition to your home, come on in, fill out an application, and spend some time with her!

This incredible lady is Blackbird! She came all the way from a shelter in Kentucky to find her forever home! Blackbird is a super sweet, loving, and amazing girl! Meet Daisy, a hound mix rescued from a Kentucky shelter along with her 3 day old pups. DOB estimate Feb 2017. She weighs 35 lbs. and absolutely loves to snuggle and be with her people. She's also a big fan of the great outdoors. Daisy is extremely food motivated, housebroken and walks well on a lead. She loves going for long walks. Still learning manners with other dogs but that could be because she was a mama and a little protective. She's spayed now along with updated vaccinations and microchipped. Daisy loves people and would be a good candidate for a second dog in the family. Daisy needs an adopter who has time to give her daily exercise and a fence is a must. 6' privacy fence best as she climbs chain link fences with great skill. Daisy is currently in foster care. I'm in a foster home, but if you are interested in adopting me, please fill out an online adoption application at http://colonycats.org/adoption_app.html to expedite the process.
