Glenny who is now Molly was brought to the NYACC (city municipal shelter) by the police on September 29, 2018.  She was a stray an not much was known about her.She then caught the dreaded Kennel Cough and was placed on the Euthanasia list.  An amazing family stepped up to save her life.  She was acclimated into their home and treated like their own.  She is now ready to spread her wings and find her forever home.This is what her foster mom has to say:Molly would do well in a home with adults and children over 12.   I think she would do fine with another dog but should be introduced slowly. She enjoys playing with my large male Pit Bull. She loves to go on walks and explore the city, but I don’t consider her a high energy dog. Quirks:  Molly loves getting her belly rubbed and will keep bringing your hand back for more.  She enjoys going on walks and meeting new people, and then coming home and lying in the sun. Issues:  IssuesI have not had any issues with Molly.  When walking if she sees another dog she pulls a little bit on the leash, not in an aggressive way but more of a nosy way.  I have been working on redirecting her attention. She will sit for treats and let the other dog walk by. When she is not crated Molly is allowed to roam freely and she has never had an accident or been destructive. She will go to her crate on her own to relax with the door open.   I have been working on extending her time with the door shut.  I will give her a Kong Toy filled with treats and a little peanut butter when I shut the door. In summary:  Molly is an absolute sweetheart who loves to be with people. Often there are multiple people at home and she makes sure that she visits with everyone.  She is very smart and wants to please.  I am super impressed at how well Molly has dealt with change. She had the house to herself for the first month, but for the past 2 weeks she has been living with my 3 other dogs (Chi-mix, Pomeranian and Pit Bull), who unexpectedly returned from their stay in Maine.   After a slow introduction period she warmed up to them and now happily tries to play with my large male Pit Bull.

Our stunning Wednesday enters the room like an arctic blast of cold on a hot summer night and grabs your attention! This magnificent one and a half year old, black Labrador Retriever mix came to us from a big city Animal Control facility, where she spent some time after a lackluster owners abandoned her. She was rail thin and gaunt when she entered the city shelter system, and took some time to adjust to her harsh surroundings. When Wednesday came to our Rescue, she was a wild child, a Black Beauty in need of some firm, loving leadership. It was painfully obvious that her owners had missed all of her social development cues, and woefully neglected her manners and leadership training. Wednesday was as precocious as her Addams Family namesake, and seemed to feel that her opinion was warranted on just about every subject.In no time, Wednesday has developed into a canine thoroughbred, brimming with potential. An energy and personality match is key to Wednesday's happiness. She is a high energy, athletic dog who needs alot of outdoor exercise. She would gleefully keep rigorous pace with an avid runner, hiker or powerwalker, and seems to thrive in the brisk country air. No doubt about it, Wednesday needs an active adopter, but, also one who is extremely proficient in leadership and obedience training. She is not a dog for the casual or inexperienced adopter.Wednesday largely appears to be Labrador Retriever, but we also suspect some Border Collie in her DNA. She is a lean, tall dog weighing 47 pounds, and is extremely graceful and athletic. She runs with great speed, and could be an agility champion. Wednesday has the energy and intelligence that we see in this high strung Herding breed, as well as the mischievious and impertinent tendency that sometimes occurs when Border Collies are under exercised and bored! As a double dose of working dog, Wednesday definitely needs a job, and she is a natural at obedience work. She knows all her basic commands, and has passed many of the Canine Good Citizenship tests. She handles beautifully on lead, and heels nicely. Wednesday still needs some polish on her stranger manners, since she may, on occasion, greet someone rudely, but motivated adopters should be able to work her through any issues by employing her well honed commands. In the right hands, Wednesday will become a fantastic, well behaved companion.Wednesday would fare best in an adult home, with adopters experienced in handling large, active breeds. She would overwhelm toddlers and seniors. She could easily join a multi-dog home, with another active, well trained dog, but sometimes, unruly and ill mannered dogs press her buttons. We have not had her around cats, but she would most likely chase them beyond their tolerance level.Wednesday has respectable house manners and is mostly housetrained. She will need some finetuning on her potty routine as she transitions to a new environment. Wednesday is in good health, and has been spayed. She has been vaccinated for rabies, bordatella, and DHLPPC (distemper, hepatitis, leptospirosis, parvo, parainfluenza and coronavirus). She has had the 4dx test, and is negative for heartworm, lyme, earlichia and anaplasmosis. She has been microchipped and dewormed, and is on monthly flea/tick and heartworm treatment.If you are interested in Wednesday, please write to Denise@eskiesonline.com or call Denise at 860-908-9738.Eskies Online is a 501(c)(3) Multibreed rescue group that serves unwanted American Eskimos and other dogs in need. Our group of volunteer foster homes spans the North East, and our adoption territory extends from Maine to eastern Pennsylvania, Delaware, and parts of northern Maryland. Once an adopter is approved, we arrange transportation. We do not adopt dogs beyond our territory. Please visit our website: www.eskiesonline.com for more information about our group and our adoption procedures.

Our magnificent Hero needs a hero of his own. This beautiful, robust boy is a victim of circumstances. His doting owner lost her home, and desperately tried to find housing to accommodate her beloved companion, whom she had raised from a pup. Hero's Mom took up temporary residence in a local motel, until she could get her bearings, but Hero was booted out by the motel manager. After a tearful goodbye, sad Hero was left in the care of a well-respected town shelter, who pled his case to us.Hero appears to be a handsome mix of black Labrador Retriever and Border Collie. He has the physique and color of a black Lab, and the white tuxedo markings and black speckled white socks that suggest Border Collie. At 50 pounds, Hero has a solid, muscular build, and yet is easy to handle on lead. As a combination herder and retriever, Hero loves the outdoors, and has a hardwired work ethic that needs to be channeled through exercise and obedience work. Hero sometimes seems unsure of his place in the world, and needs to join a home with a strong pack leader, willing to provide the structure that he needs to to thrive. Hero gives the impression of caution at first, as he sizes up strangers, but warms quickly to a gentle touch. Adopters will need to be comfortable putting boundaries between Hero and strangers: he can become overzealous in guarding his person. He would be the ideal watchdog.Hero seems subdued and intimidated at times, in the midst of our busy foster home, and we sense that a quiet, adult home would suit him best. He is not a big fan of change, and a steady, quiet routine will serve him beautifully.  Hero would be the ideal walking or running companion for an active single or couple. He loves the outdoors, can keep a brisk pace on a hike, and longs to make a one-to-one connection with a strong human personality. Hero could easily join a multi-dog home with another well-trained, calm dog, but cats are a definite no-go.Hero has progressed nicely in his basic obedience training. The obedience work serves him as a job he can take pride in, and he performs the commands beautifully, either for praise or treats. Obedience training is key to providing the working breeds with the purpose and focus that they need to live happily in a domestic lifestyle.Hero has good house manners and is house trained and crate trained. Adopters should have appropriate patience, and expect to troubleshoot the occasional accident that will inevitably occur during Hero's transition to a new home. He is in excellent health, and is at an ideal lean body weight. He has been neutered, and has been vaccinated for Rabies, DA2PP (distemper, adrenovirus, parvo and parainfluenza), and Canine Flu. He has been boostered as needed, and has had the 4dx test: negative for heartworm, lyme, earlichia and anaplasmosis. He has been dewormed, and microchipped. If you are interested in Hero, please write to Denise@eskiesonline.com or call Denise at 860-908-9738 for more info. Eskies Online is a 501(c)(3) Multibreed rescue group that serves unwanted American Eskimos and other dogs in need. Our group of volunteer foster homes spans the North East, and our adoption territory extends from Maine to eastern Pennsylvania, Delaware, and parts of northern Maryland. Once an adopter is approved, we arrange transportation. We do not adopt dogs beyond our territory. Please visit our website: www.eskiesonline.com for more information about our group and our adoption procedures.

PLEASE call the shelter for more information (see number below) as the e-mail address at this site is not monitored closely by the shelter.MISSY arrived with an intake weight of 42 lb. She also is listed as a female Cur mix dog about 2-3 years old and her coloring is brindle/white.  Go visit her during normal business hours and make her day!Adoption fees are $80 for dogs.  Cat adoption fees are $50.The shelter routinely vaccinates all healthy appearing animals upon their arrival at the shelter and deworms them.  Any animals not already spayed/neutered must have the procedure done through the veterinary clinic that contracts with the county before that animal can be released from the clinic to the new family. By state law, animals old enough to be given a rabies vaccine, must have that vaccine done, as well.  The vaccine is given by the veterinary clinic staff at a separate cost to the adoptive family. Hold periods for every incoming animal vary for several reasons including, but not limited to, whether the animal came in from the Cumberland County area, or from the City of Crossville, which contracts with the county for its animal shelter services.  Check with the staff to verify the availability date of every animal for which you have an interest.For more information on this pet, call the shelter at (931)484-8525. The shelter is open Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday, and Saturday from 10am to 2pm. Closed Wednesday and Sunday and county observed holidays.

Acquired: 6-20-12 Adopted: 11-24-12 Missing: 4.26.13 Found: 10.17.16 Alice's story: Alice is an about 6 years old (born approx 6.20.10), spayed female Akita. She is up to date on vaccines, microchipped, heartworm negative, on flea/heartworm prevention, house trained, crate trained, and leash trained. Alice has returned from Wonderland! Alice came to us after being picked up running stray here in Virginia Beach, VA in 2012. She was adopted later that same year, but it wasn't working out and the family wanted to return her in April of 2013. She went missing the day we were supposed to pick her up from the adopters. Days, weeks, months went by with no news. We presumed she was dead. Then, in October 2016 (nearly 3.5 years later!), we got a call from an animal control facility in Maryland saying they had caught a stray Akita in a trap and her microchip said she was Alice and belonged to us! We were floored and beyond excited to get her back! She's in great condition for being missing for so long, and we are grateful to whomever had been caring for her. At some point when she was gone, she tore both her ACLs and never received medical attention for it. She doesn't need surgery, but she has arthritis in both legs, so she'll need to be on a joint supplement. She's on supplement and back on her thyroid pills and feeling great. :-) This amazing girl with the incredible story is great with other dogs (she goes to daycare!) and very friendly with people. She would do well as an only dog or in a home with the right male dog.

***COURTESY POST***\"**Calling all Hound lovers!**Molly is a 9 year old Hound mix who came to us from MA. She weighs about 50 pounds. She is a sweet girl who loves people. She even \"smiles\" when she is happy to meet someone! Molly NEEDS:* POTTY TRAINING- she has never lived inside * someone to teach her the rules of a home * continued leash training/or invisible fence training.* Socialization- Molly is selective with her doggie companions, a little controlled, positive exposure could help her in her search for a forever home.Her new person needs to be:* Physically strong enough to walk her; she jumps fences, and can not be off leash, even in a fenced yard!* Someone willing to give her chances to sniff on walks, it is one of her favorite things! She gets very excited and does pull to try and continue on the trail.* Someone who is okay with cleaning up a few accidents. Molly has never experienced life inside the house, it’s going to take TIME for her to understand that her “business” needs to happen outside.* COMMITMENT!! Can you imagine feeling like the world is against you, that you don’t belong and you have no one to love?! How emotionally devastating! Molly really needs someone to commit to her, and give her the chance she deserves.Please give Molly a chance!If interested in Molly contactTall Tail Beagle Rescue at info@talltailsbeaglerescue.org

OUR APPLICATIONS AREN'T WORKING.  PLEASE TEXT CARLA AT 480-993-5238 AFTER 12 NOON MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY.  TO HELP, PLEASE EMAIL US WHY YOU THINK YOUR HOME WOULD BE TERRIFIC FOR THIS DOGGIE.  Email us at AdorableDogRescue@yahoo.com Blaze is a Distemper Survivor!!   As you probably know, when dogs survive distemper, they usually have neurological issues.  He head- bobs and occasionally doesn't quite make it to the doggie door - he tries!!  He really does!  And he feels really terrible when he doesn't make it,  so no yelling at him when he doesn't make it...  Blaze came from the streets of Tijuana, Mexico.   He was emaciated, had tick fever (treated and doing fine!), tested negative for Heartworm, had been begging for food and eating rocks.  Blaze had a dental on May 28, 2019 when he was neutered.  He feels great and has gained some weight.  Blaze loves watching the turtles that his foster family has, and does ok with other dogs, although he would prefer to be the only doggie.   He's up-to-date on his shots, and has his microchip.  Blaze weighs about 22 pounds and has a docked tail. His foster family loves him like crazy!  :-D   He loves to play with people and with soft small squeaky toys, and is a very very sweet doggie.  If you would like to meet or adopt Loving, sweet Blaze, please visit our website. Click on Adoption Application in the blue Line.  Once finished, please click on Submit button to submit an Adoption Application.  Blaze's adoption fee is $325.  We can't wait to find this wonderful, sweet boy a terrific furever home!  Thank you!  Blaze will go quickly.  We will take his profile down as soon as he's adopted.

Tifa is a 7 year old girl from the streets of Tijuana, Mexico emaciated.She is a big sweetheart and a cuddle bug. She loves meeting new people and pups and going on walks.Tifa is one chill senior girl that just goes with the flow. She knows a bit of basic training and is house broken.All animals adopted from us are fully vetted including spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, heartworm test and deworming. Please email us at HookedOnDobies@gmail.com, visit our Facebook page www.facebook.com/savingdobermankind or webpage https://www.savingdobermankind.org to request an application, inquire about an adoption fee, or to learn more! ALL Doberman meet and greets are conducted in a neutral meeting location made by appointment only.

*Estella is approximately 2-years old, 15-18 pound spayedfemale mix (maybe corgi/chi?) from Tijuana. She is beautifuland smiley, but nervous and shyin new situations.Estella is house-broken and enjoys her walks. She tends to becomeattached and possessive of her person and would do bestwith an experienced dog owneror foster- or someone willing to learn how to continue her confidence buildingtraining.Estella entertains herself with her toys and enjoys bully sticks for chew time. She will thrive with a structured, consistent routine of 80%: rules, boundaries, obedience work, structuredwalks + 20%: affection, to help her become her best balanced, stable, confident and happy self. She has boundless potential to be a devoted companion who loves kids and other dogs. Estella's person will need to have a crate before she arrives, as she loves to retreat to the zen zone of her own safe space and have some downtime and maybe take a nap or sleep the night away.Estella is up to date on shots, will be microchipped, and is spayed.Please contact us DIRECTLYusing the instructions belowif you are interested in fostering or adopting one of our Waggytails!Visit our website (www.waggytailrescue.org) for an adoption or foster application.It is important to fill out an application as soon as possible for consideration, andwe require a complete application for you to meet an animal. Attach your completed application to an email with the dog's name in the title, and send to:Adoptions:waggyadopt@gmail.comFosters:waggyvolunteer@gmail.comPLEASE NOTE: Dogs marked \"Adoption Pending\" have anapproved adoption applicationon file and are awaiting final approval. Check back in a few days to see if they are still available!We understand you may have questions, but the fastest way to get answers is to completethe application and the fosterparent can then answer questions!Waggytail Rescue CANNOT guarantee the exact age of any adoptable dog, or final size of any of our adoptable puppies. We rely on the information provided to us by veterinarians, shelters, owner surrenders and other circumstances bringing the dog into our rescue.

Hello, my name's Totopo and I was rescued from a very bad situation in Mexico. When my rescuer found me, I was tied on a chain so tight that I couldn't even lay down. My skin was in really bad shape and I had a bunch of different infections, but luckily I was saved! I'm on the mend, feeling MUCH better, and it looks like I should make a full recovery. Despite the horrible treatment I received from humans, I still love them! I'm just the sweetest boy and love to climb in your lap and give you kisses. I'm also comfortable around most small dogs. Meet me at Animal Haven!

Meet Sophie!  She is an 8-year-old Chow/Shepherd mix. Sophie came to Noah Project from a very nice lady that rescued her from the streets of Mexico five years ago. She is a fluffy bundle of joy that loves car rides, loves to be vacuumed, and loves to chew on her toys. She is great with children (preferably older kids) but she is not a fan of other animals. She would love to find a forever home with lots of room to run!

Meet Pedro!  He & his brother Pablo traveled from Mexico to find their new homes in MN.  And it was well worth the effort to get him here as he is so sweet....and handsome.  Pedro is relatively calm for a 13 week old puppy.  He gets along very well w all dogs (big & small).  Though he hasn't been around cats- I don't foresee an issue.  Pedro is not 100% housebroken but well on his way.  He is crate trained at night with no accidents.  He is very handsome & has beautiful sincere eyes w white lashes. He currently weighs 21.5 lbs so he will be medium to large when full grown.  Pedro has been neutered, microchipped & is current on vaxes.  His adoption fee is $450 & all money goes directly to the animals.  A home visit in required prior to adoption & we'd really like a fenced yard for this guy. If interested in meeting Pedro-Please EMAIL me at susan.dogscats@yahoo.com w PEDRO in subject line.  ****I do NOT get responses sent via petfinder link*** Please tell me about you, your home (own or rent), lifestyle, dog experience- that type of stuff.  Post will be updated when he has found his forever home.  Thanks for looking

Pablo & his brother Pedro travelled a long distance from Mexico to find a new life here in MN.  Pablo is about 13 weeks old & weighs 18.5 lbs.  He is so sweet & relatively calm for his age.  Though not 100% housebroken...he is smart & learning quickly.  Pablo has such beautiful soulful eyes that are light.  He is a really wonderful puppy who gets along very well with all dogs- big & small...he's not been around cats but I cant imagine an issue.  I'd like him to go to a home with a fenced yard.  If interested in meeting this handsome guy-  Please EMAIL me at susan.dogscats@yahoo.com with PABLO in the subject line   ****I do NOT get responses via petfinder ***  And PLEASE tell me about you, your life style, home (own or rent), yard, dog experience etc   that type of stuff.  Adoption fee is $450 & all $ goes directly to animals.  He is neutered, microchipped & up to date on vaxes.   Home visit required. Post will be updated when he has been adopted Thanks

Ivy is the sweetest little girl. She loves her person and is happiest when she is with you, preferably on your lap. She is a true lap baby. Ivy is about 2 years old. Her vetting is complete and now she wants to find her forever home. Ivy came to us from Mexico where a very nice lady saved her but the chances of ever finding her a home would be very very slim. We have promised her a very good future, a home where she will be loved and cherished for all of her life. She is holding us to it.If you would like to inquire about Ivy please send us an email.Adoptions@teamstinkykiss.com

I’m Pepper, and I recently came to the US from Juarez, Mexico. I love America. I’m a happy spunky girl and I love people. I get along well with other dogs although I can get a little tense when they sniff my butt. I’m quickly learning my way around the house, I’m nearly crate trained, and I haven’t had any recent accidents. I do well at the dog park but I haven’t mastered recall because I don’t really know my name. I think I would like hiking and camping and having a yard to play in, but I also like snuggling on the couch. I probably like children and I've never met a cat, but I have a good feeling about them. I'd love to find an active family who likes to play and snuggle. I also like food, any food will do. If you are interested in adopting a CAWS pet, please fill out an online application at http://caws.org/adoption-application

Hi! I’m Rosie, a 25-pound mixed breed all the way from Mexico! I don’t know my exact birthdate, but I’m somewhere between 1 and 2 years old. I’m a little bit shy, but I love my humans and will follow you around the house in search of a comfy spot to curl up. I was hit by a car in my early life, so sometimes I’m a little bit slow to get up, but once I’m up, I’m off! I’m looking for an active family that can take me on daily walks—and I’d love a fenced yard so I can run around. I don’t have a lot of experience with cats or kids, but I love to play with other dogs and would be really happy to have a canine sibling. I am good with my house training and don’t mind my crate—sometimes I chew on things if I’m left alone for too long. If you’re looking for a playful companion who also loves to cuddle, I’m your gal! All CAWS animals are fixed, microchipped, and vaccinated. Her adoption fee is $200.00. If you are interested in adopting a CAWS pet, please fill out an online application at http://caws.org/adoption-application*Dogs are not placed on a first come first serve basis. We strive to find the perfect home for each animal. Applications may take up to 48 hours to process. If you are interested in adopting a CAWS pet, please fill out an online application at http://caws.org/adoption-application

Meet Don Abraham! This amazing boy joined us from Mexico, where he befriended a tourist and became her holiday companion. When it was time for her to go home, she brought Abraham to a local rescue so that he would be safe and taken care of.Abraham is a one year old Shepherd mix. He is very friendly, outgoing, great with other dogs and ignores cats. He is energetic and fun! He'll be your loyal companion and will love going on hikes and adventures. He does need a fair amount of exercise, so if you are into that, he'll be perfect for you.Abraham is fixed, vaccinated and will be chipped. His adoption fee is $395.We cover the medical to prepare the pet for adoption and the adopt donations go directly to cover those costs and range from $295-$495. Thank you for stepping up to save a life!To expedite to meet with this dog, please go to our site at www.savinggreatanimals.org and fill out an application. We look at the first applications to arrive, so we hope to hear from you soon!

Name: YasminaApproximate Age: 4yrsBreed: BaladiSex: FemaleSpecial Needs: Requires frequent trips outside due to effects of previous injuryAdoption fee: $325Up to date on vaccinations/preventatives. Spayed. Microchipped.No one knows much of my past but I was born in Egypt and became a US citizen in 2014. When I first came to the states, we were all under the impression I was paralyzed- not knowing why or how, but I couldnt use my back end. Either way I was a happy girl, just thankful to be loved and cared for. My foster mom got me a wheelchair but she was convinced I could someday walk. With her dedication and both of our hard work guess who doesnt need a set of wheels anymore? Me! Yeah, I may have a few scars, walk with a wobble (which I may add everyone finds adorable) and have to go outside more than most but all in all, Im a walking machine! The only thing that I havent been able to master yet is a full set of stairs- I can handle up to 5 but I get nervous about doing more- Ill get there though! Because of my past, being able to hold needing to use the bathroom can be a bit of a struggle and Ill need to go out quite often- nothing crazy but more than your average dog. Right now my foster mom keeps me in a pen at night just in case an accident happens. Did I mention that I literally adore any living thing put in front of me? Dogs, Cats, People...I would be a great addition to any family!Transport to any approved home within the US can be provided at no additional fee. Currently Yasmini is located in Michigan. Please visit SNARRANIMALRESCUE.org to fill out an application! Our adoption requirements/process can also be found there.

NOTE: there are several videos of Stevie on our youTube page.  Link to one is below.Stevie is  our 8-9  month old lab mix puppy.  He weighs 55 lbs. now so we think he will grow a little more.  He is a gentle, sweet boy that would never hurt anyone.  He only wants to be loved.  Stevie was rescued from rural Mississippi when a farmer threatened to shoot Stevie & his sister.When we first got to the rescue, Stevie he was limping.  We had x-rays done and he had a broken pelvis.  He has since healed.  There is a video of him running & playing on our youtube page.Stevie gets along fabulously with the other dogs here at the rescue.  If you are looking for a new family member that is FUN then Stevie is your guy.  He loves to snuggle and just be with you, and LOVES to give kisses.  Oh, and simply one beautiful pup! His coat is a gorgeous very shiny black.  If you are interested in giving Stevie a wonderful home, go to our Facebook page and download the application from the notes section. While you are there, please Like our page to see our new available dogs and keep up with upcoming events.Here is the link: www.facebook.com/pages/MAR-Mercer-Animal-Rescue-501c3/374149832631589The application can also be downloaded from our website www.merceranimalrescue.org or email us at merceranimalrescue@gmail.com and we will email an application to you.Stevie's adoption donation is $525 which helps to cover his neutering,three rounds of puppy shots, bordetella (kennel cough), rabies, heart worm prevention, flea/tick prevention, vet examination, certificate of health and transport fee.ALL OUR DOGS START THEIR JOURNEY IN TENNESSEEStevie is currently fostered in Tennessee and will travel to his new family once he has been adopted.We use a weekly professional pet transport to take the dogs to their new homes in the Northeast.  Pick up locations are available in VA, MD, PA, NJ, NY, CT, VTFor the dogs adopted to the mid-west, there is a monthly trip to Tinley Park, IL where the dogs are picked up.  The next trip to Tinley Park is Sunday, June 30, 2019.Our primary source of funding comes from this adoption donation. The donation allows us to rescue other dogs in danger of being put to sleep, injured or sick dogs and dogs that have never known a home.

Meet Keziah. she is approx 8 weeks old and is a red heeler/austrialian cattle dog mix.  She was such a good girl on the transport all the way up here from Mississippi.  She had a lot of fans on transport, who gave her a lot of attention..She needs a furever home.  If that home is yours, please fill out an application, which can be found on our website www.careofdc.org

Sylvie is a five year old, sixty pound dreamboat of a pooch. She came from a shelter in rural Mississippi very pregnant and has spent the past two months in foster care where she gave birth to and has taken very good care of her ten, yes TEN, puppies. Her puppies have just been weaned and Sylvie is super ready to send them on their merry way so she can have a little bit of \"me time\" because she definitely deserves it. This sweet mamma has been a model house guest in foster care and is going to make an even better new best friend in her forever home. This dog is spayed, up to date on vaccinations and current on flea/tick and heartworm preventative. This dog has tested positive for heartworms and is being treated in our care. The adoption fee is $400 if your adoption is prepaid and final prior to your dog's arrival. An additional $50 will be charged on dogs that are picked up from our Southbury CT adoption center, adopted at an event or foster home in order to comply with CT HB 5368.If you are a MA resident, your new family member is required to go through a mandatory 48 hour quarantine period at the Woburn, MA isolation facility.  Your new family member will be dropped off by our transport on Thursday and will be ready for you to pick him/her up on Saturday between 10am-noon.  An additional $100 fee will be added for any dogs picked up from the Woburn, MA quarantine facility in order to comply with MA Order 405-CD-12 and Order 1-AHO-05.  TO APPLY PLEASE GO TO  www.cprdogs.com.  If your application was successfully submitted you will get a confirmation.  After receipt of your application an adoption counselor will then be in touch to answer your questions about this pup, discuss the adoption process and get the ball rolling!  If you have not heard from one of our volunteers within 5 days of submitting your application, please email mollibo@gmail.com.

Come spend some time with her at Animal Haven.

She will need a very patient, quiet and loving home that understands it'll take some time before she's ready to be a lapdog. Come meet her Animal Haven.

I have an Adoption Pending but hope you will consider one of our other great dogs.  Thank you!If you have ever watched Pit Bulls and Parolees, you have probably seen the type of situation that these sisters were rescued from.  Sugar and Spice came to our rescue from a rural area in Mississippi where they were kept on chains with several other dogs.  They received little care; only occasional water and food, had inadequate shelter, and no vet care that we know of.   It was not surprising they both tested positive for heartworm.  Sugar and Spice have been under treatment for this condition since early April and are getting ready to go to their forever homes.Sugar is described by our trainer as being \"treat motivated.  She loves to be petted and is the sweetest girl.  Sugar is a bit timid and is startled easily by sudden noises and quick movements.\"  We are working on socialization and we know that in time, Sugar will become comfortable living in a home as a cherished companion.   She is good with other dogs, but has no history with cats.  Sugar would do well with a canine sibling in her new home who can mentor her.If your specialty is TLC, Sugar is the girl for you.  She is very smart and eager to learn.  Sugar is about 2 years old and weighs about 45 lbs.  She is spayed, up-to-date on vaccinations, and micro-chipped.  She will be ready to travel north in mid-June to be directly adopted.   Rescued dogs come with a range of needs - from behavioral to emotional to medical.  When approved applicants adopt such dogs, they agree to continue the rehabilitation we have begun.  If you would like to be part of Sugar's rescue story, and you have already been approved for adoption through SGRR, please contact Donna Toncic at: SunshineGoldens@gmail.com     to be considered to adopt Sugar.           If not yet approved, please visit our website to learn more and to submit an online application:     http://sunshinegoldenrescue.com/adoption-info1.html  Please DO NOT use the ASK ABOUT button to contact us, about this dog, as that will delay our ability to respond to your inquiry.  Please direct any questions regarding your application status to:  ajpillinger@gmail.com   Thank you!About Our Rescue Before being approved to adopt, all potential adopters will be required to complete our online application and participate in our pre-adoption review process. The process includes the completion of an online application, a reference from the applicants' vet, a phone interview, and a visit to the applicants' home.  The application process helps us determine what type of Golden would be best suited for the applicants' life style.  In some cases, the specific dog you are interested in may have found a home before this process is complete or further assessment may indicate that this dog is not the right match for your family.  We are frequently getting new Goldens in need of a home, so we encourage you to apply and complete the application process so that when the right dog comes along you will be ready. The information provided on each dog is based on the observations of our vets, volunteers, fosters, and when available, trainers. While we do our best to report any and all issues, SGRR does not make any guarantees as to the health or temperament of any dog. Dogs evolve differently in different environments and we cannot predict with any certainty how the dog you adopt will behave and adapt in your home.SGRR Adoption Fees (subject to change)Puppies under 6 months   $650Young dogs 6 months - 6 years   $550Young dogs - Special Needs   $450Senior dogs 7 - 9  years   $450Seniors dogs 10 years and older   $350Senior dogs - Special Needs   $300Young Bonded Pairs   $850Senior Bonded Pairs   $750A contract is signed on the day of adoption.  Under the terms of the contract, all adopters are required to bring their SGRR dog to a vet within 7 business days.  All dogs receive basic veterinary care prior to adoption.  However, if an adopter's vet identifies an illness that an adopter is not willing to treat, then the dog may be returned and a full refund would be provided. Most of our dogs are fostered in private homes.  We do not have a facility to visit.  We are committed to our dogs before, during, and after adoption! To this end, the rescue retains an interest in each dog and our dogs can never be surrendered, re-homed, or sold. Should an adopter no longer be able to keep their SGRR dog, SGRR must be notified so that we can take the dog back into rescue and place it into another home. We reserve the right to remove a dog at any time should we find the adopter is no longer providing proper care.  Adopters agree to follow up visits as needed.  Please be a ray of light for this Sunshine dog and make a tax deductible donation toward medical care and other expenses.   Every cent of your generosity goes directly toward the care of a Sunshine dog.Please visit our website at: http://sunshinegoldenrescue.com  to learn more about our rescue and to make a Donation to support Sunshine Golden Retriever Rescue.  THANK YOU!

Age: 7 Months (as of 6/23/19)Weight: 35 lbs (as of 4/23/19)This dog has been spayed/neutered, is up to date on shots, on heartworm preventative and is microchipped.Honey Buns is a natural at fetch!And will bring the ball back AND leave it for you without even asking her to so you can throw it again - about 90% of the time. She has an exuberance for life that radiates in everything she does. We're thinking this little love is a sweet blend of Hound and Boxer born sometime around the end of November 2018. She's extremely smart, learns quickly and LOVES to learn! She was quite the \"problem child\" as a very young puppy, but with strong leadership from both humans and other dogs she's come amazingly far! She's smart and active, and will make a great companion for a person or family that'll make her a priority to ensure she gets the continued exercise, leadership and structure she needs to thrive. Just by the nature of demands and priorities, a household with children is not the best fit, even though she is good with children. She's house trained and crate trained (though she prefers to be loose), and is learning not to pull on leash. She's excited about the prospect of going to puppy training classes with her new human(s) - she already knows \"sit\" and \"down\" and almost has \"stay\" mastered! She'd love a fenced yard to play in, but daily leash walks for exercise, business and adventure will work, too. She finds kitties interesting, but with her prey drive she would either need a very slow introduction to a resident dog-savvy cat or no cats in the home at all.Honey Buns is a delightful cuddler and whoever gets her should enjoy this to get the most out of the love of this sweet girl! She LOVES car rides and baths and chasing (and stalking) a soccer ball around the yard! There's so much more we could tell you about this little love! Fill out an application today and Honey's people will get right back to you - and tell you all about her!Honey Bun's Story: She was rescued from a church in a rural area in Mississippi. A young adult went out and got all the puppies at only 4-weeks old and left the momma dog who was feral behind. Our rescue partners knew it was too soon to have the puppies pulled from their momma so one of their employees went out and trapped her and convinced the girl that took the puppies to surrender them to the shelter so that mother Ramona could finish weening them. Honey was a bit sassy as a sister with her siblings - with older and larger dogs she has learned her place.Adoption Fee: $585To apply for this dog, fill out an adoption application on our website: www.sosarl.org/aa/**Additional info you should know - For most of our dogs, we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We get to know each of our dogs as an individual and do our best to describe and place them based on personality not breed label. Some dogs may not yet be in New England, nor ready for immediate adoption. There may be additional vetting, quarantine, waiting periods and/or fees depending upon your state of residence. If you have questions or concerns on any of this, you can discuss this with your Adoption Counselor.

Frida is a momma from Mississippi who has a limp (she was found shot and pregnant), she doesn't let it slow her down.  She has been examined by a specialist and the recommendation is to do nothing with the leg.  It is not causing he pain, and she gets along just fine with it.  She is approx 2 yo and is a lab/terrier mix.She is very sweet, chill. If you are looking for a calm companion for a kid she would be perfect.  When she was at the senior center,, she was calm letting people pet her.She loves going out and playing in the snow. She has enough energy to keep up with the kids.Fill out an application at www.careofdc.org

**ADOPTION FEE IS SPONSORED**Mabel is a 2 yo pit mix. She is about 50 lbs. She loves to put her paws on you to give hugs. One of her favorite volunteers, AJ Pittore? said when you look in her eyes, you can FEEL her love.Poor Mabel was just another throw away Momma from Mississippi. Of course everyone wanted her babies and they were quickly adopted. Now it's Mabel's turn for a furever home.If you have existing dogs a meet and greet is required.If you would like to fill out an application, you can find out on our website www.careofdc.org

Age: 4-5 Years (as of 9/6/18)Weight: 62.7 (as of 9/6/18)This dog has been spayed/neutered, is up to date on shots, on heartworm preventative and is microchipped.Bizzie is loving and very sweet!She's one of those dogs who epitomizes canine forgiveness - you'll see this when you read her backstory. Fortunately for Bizzie, her future's looking ever so bright! We're thinking she's a blend of Chow Chow and Shepherd probably born sometime in 2014 or 2015. She has been fine with adult dogs and puppies; she has not been introduced to cats. She's been great with all adults, and though she has not lived with children, we think she would be okay with older, dog-respectful kids. House training and crate training are in the works, and she seems to do fine on leash. A dog who has lived on a chain for years, like Bizzie did, can have a tendency towards guard dog behaviors and though she has not shown any of these tendencies, her adopters will likely need to work with a professional trainer to help her accept strangers and work through any fears she might exhibit.Bizzie loves to run and play with other dogs, people and toys! She rides well in the car while crated, she's very calm. Though a fenced yard would be great to get in some running and playing, daily leash walks for business, exercise and fun will work just as well to keep her happy and healthy. And to keep that canine mind sharp, think puzzle toys and games. Bizzie really just wants to find a forever home where she'll be loved and cared for. Could that be your home? Fill out an application today and her people will get right back to you!Bizzie's Backstory: Bizzie truly deserves a wonderful life. Her first 3-4 years were very hard. She was from the south side of Jackson, Mississippi, and was tied out on a 6-foot chain to be used as a guard dog. Her shelter was limited to a carport, no matter what the temperature or weather was like. She often did not have food nor water, except when a neighbor was contacted for dog food. After that, the neighbor often checked on her and would feed her and give her water. We know that Bizzie had at least one litter of puppies that a rescue took, but Bizzie was left behind. However the rescue did provide a spay for her. Bizzie’s friend finally convinced her owner to relinquish her. When the vet checked Bizzie, she did have heartworm, which has been treated and she is now clear. At first, this pretty girl was scared when anyone approached her with a leash - maybe she was afraid she would be tied out again. Of course, we know that this will never again be the case!Medical Note: This dog has been treated for heartworm disease with melarsomine injections. Once treatment is completed and the dog tests negative for microfilaria, the dog will be cleared to resume normal activity and able to be adopted. Untreated heartworm disease can cause lasting damage to the heart, lungs and arteries, and can affect the dog’s health and quality of life even after the parasites are gone, possibly presenting as medical complications and/or new conditions in the future. This dog showed no symptoms of heartworm disease before or during treatment. A good resource for more information on heartworm disease is: https://www.heartwormsociety.org/pet-owner-resources/ heartworm-basics. Please check with your vet if you should have any questions or concerns about this condition, and discuss any concerns you may have with your SOS Adoption Counselor.Adoption Fee: $585To apply for this dog, fill out an adoption application on our website: www.sosarl.org/aa/**Additional info you should know - For most of our dogs, we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We get to know each of our dogs as an individual and do our best to describe and place them based on personality not breed label. Some dogs may not yet be in New England, nor ready for immediate adoption. There may be additional vetting, quarantine, waiting periods and/or fees depending upon your state of residence. If you have questions or concerns on any of this, you can discuss this with your Adoption Counselor.

This beautiful boy is 9 years young.  You would never guess that.  He loves toys, loves to play, and when he is feeling feisty, loves to bark at cars.  You wouldn’t believe he has a history of rejection and loss either: from Mississippi to Tennessee to Rocky Mount, VA.  There He found himself in a shelter after  his family learned  he had diabetes. It wasn’t his fault. But this boy has lots of life and lots of love in him -  he wants a chance - nothing more -  to be your forever Charlie B. Applications may be submitted at hbschnauzerrescue.comDogs will only be adopted to residents of the following: Delaware, Maryland, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Virginia, West Virginia and DC.  Adopters must agree to take the dog through obedience training within 3 months of adoption (unless the dog is over age 10).  Adopters must agree to keep the dog current on vaccinations and heart worm, flea, tick prevention on a year round basis.

\"Have you ever seen a dog as adorable as me?! Can you believe I’m homeless and am waiting for a wonderful person or family to adopt me? Great dogs like me end up in animal shelters every day- I know, it’s so hard to believe but it’s true!My name is Meatball and I just arrived to Providence Animal Center from Mississippi! I am all ready to move right into your heart & home today. I am estimated to be around 2 years old and 34 pounds. To learn more about me, stop by the Adoption Center or give the friendly staff a call.P.S. I am up-to-date on vaccines, neutered & microchipped\"Providence Animal Center relies on adoption fees and donations to save pets! Adoption fees vary per pet. To find out this pet’s adoption fee or for more information, please call the Adoption Center with this pet’s ID number.Can’t adopt? Consider fostering or donating! Visit ProvidenceAC.org for more information on how you can support the lifesaving mission!

In an effort to save more lives, HT is allowing expedited adoptions for certain animals if applicants bring required paperwork. You can bring your new family member home more quickly by bringing your current pets' vet records, a copy of your lease or landlord letter stating you are permitted to have pets, and photos of your home. Help us help you adopt more quickly!If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out our dog adoption questionnaire and e-mail it to rebeccag@homewardtrails.org.PLEASE VISIT THIS WEBSITE TO FIND THE ADOPTION QUESTIONNAIRE: http://www.homewardtrails.org/adopt-a-pet/adoption-forms/Bruce was surrendered by his owner, who couldn't afford to keep him. He was originally rescued from a hoarding raid in Mississippi. Bruce is a super affectionate dog -- his owner described him as the \"worst guard dog ever.\" He loves anyone and everyone. Bruce is a low-energy dog who is used to being crated for up to 10 hours a day. He's a cuddlebug who loves to sleep and is used to living with other dogs and cats. He also lived with a 2-year-old with no problems. However, he will try to eat anything so you have to keep him away from food you don't want him to consume. Can you give Bruce a loving home to spend his golden years?Adoption Coordinator: Rebecca GBreed Estimate: BulldogGender: MaleApproximate weight: 65 lbsApproximate age: 8 yearsLocation: Homeward Trails foster home Cratetrained: YesCoat Type: ShortPersonality: The adoption fee for this dog is $375. This fee INCLUDES spay/neuter and microchip. If the animal you are adopting is not already spayed/neutered, you will be required to sign a contract legally obligating you to have the animal altered. Please contact your HT rep to learn about exclusive low-cost spay/neuter options made available only to HT adopters!Every adopted Homeward Trails animal comes with 30 days of free pet health insurance. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals.Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter.We also provide a 30-minute phone consult with a professional dog trainer at Fur-Get Me Not within the first 30 days of adopting - just for HT adopters in the Arlington/Alexandria area. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE!You can save animals like this one by becoming a foster! Fosters are like way stations between high kill shelters and forever homes. We need fosters so that we can save dogs before they are euthanized at the shelters. If you are interested in becoming a foster, please check out our information about fostering by visiting http://www.homewardtrails.org/foster-a-pet/dog-and-cat-foster-program/

Meet Boudreaux! This friendly guy came to us all the way from Mississippi with the hopes of finding his forever home. He is a great dog that loves to play and gets along great with other dogs. He is neutered, micro-chipped and is up to date with all his shots, so come on down and let this guy show you why is perfect to be your newest family member.

The F pups came to Lost Dog as part of a multi-hundred-dog owner-surrender from Mississippi. Their lives have been turned upside down, but they are adjusting in foster care and are ready to start looking for their new homes here in the DC area.  Some look like Chihuahuas; others look like a mix between a Chihuahua and Dachshund.They are very shy and timid in addition to being a bit feral due to a lack of human touch. Each will require much patience and TLC to help them come out of their shell. They will do best in a quiet home with a patient owner who is willing to work with them as they figure out how best to navigate this new world they find themselves in. A fenced yard and another confident friendly dog in the home to help them overcome their fears is ideal, but is not required.Do you feel you could provide that kind of home for one of these special pups?DOB 3/30/15Weight 7 lbsFor more information about the F Pups, contact their foster at riguski@gmail.comPlease check our website at www.lostdogrescue.org to find out if I am still available.

Zora came to us in the fall from a neglect situation in Mississippi as part of our Operation New Beginnings. She is very sweet and is a big cuddle bug. She enjoys running around the backyard, but is happiest curled up beside her person on the couch. Zora will always be happy when you get home. She wiggles with excitement when she sees you, gives little licks, and is overall a very happy girl. Zora is great on hikes and does well on walks. She can be a little nervous at first, but warms up with time and patience. Zora is looking for a quiet, adults only home where she is the only dog and can soak up all of her family’s love and affection. Estimated DOB: 7/22/2008Weight 45 poundsFor more information about Zora, please email lflynn@outlook.comPlease check our website at www.lostdogrescue.org to find out if I am still available.

Meet Ellie.  She and her brother Teddy are from the streets of Mississippi.  They are thought to be around 2 years old. They are crate train and house broken.  They do not have to be adopted together.

Arlington is an awesome little 13 week old puppy who is searching for the perfect home.  He  currently weighs about 10 lbs, and we are guessing that she will be in the 35-45 lbs range when full grown.Arlington and his siblings (see Taps and Poppy) came to us around Memorial Day, hence their names. They were spotted running around loose right across the road from a suspected dog fighting ring in Jackson, MS. It's possible they were lined up to be bait dogs. Yikes! They were scooped up by good Samaritans and are now thriving in their foster home.Arlington is a shy but sweet and playful boy who loves romping with his siblings. He is good with other dogs, and would do fine with older children.  He's looking for a home where his person or family has the time, patience and energy that all pups need to help him grow up to be a great dog.  If you have that kind of a home for him, please apply at www.sohfga.com!Arlington is fully vetted -- spayed/neutered, microchipped, heartworm negative, and current on vaccinations and deworming.  The adoption fee is $250 (cash only, please). You can apply to adopt by submitting an application at www.sohfga.com. We hold adoptions at Petco in Snellville from 12-3 PM every Saturday. You must have an *approved* adoption application on file in order to be considered for this particular pet. Not every foster is present on every adoption day, so if you want to meet this one, be sure and contact us!

NOTE: there are several videos of Stevie on our youTube page.  Link to one is below.Stevie is  our 8-9  month old lab mix puppy.  He weighs 55 lbs. now so we think he will grow a little more.  He is a gentle, sweet boy that would never hurt anyone.  He only wants to be loved.  Stevie was rescued from rural Mississippi when a farmer threatened to shoot Stevie & his sister.When we first got to the rescue, Stevie he was limping.  We had x-rays done and he had a broken pelvis.  He has since healed.  There is a video of him running & playing on our youtube page.Stevie gets along fabulously with the other dogs here at the rescue.  If you are looking for a new family member that is FUN then Stevie is your guy.  He loves to snuggle and just be with you, and LOVES to give kisses.  Oh, and simply one beautiful pup! His coat is a gorgeous very shiny black.  If you are interested in giving Stevie a wonderful home, go to our Facebook page and download the application from the notes section. While you are there, please Like our page to see our new available dogs and keep up with upcoming events.Here is the link: www.facebook.com/pages/MAR-Mercer-Animal-Rescue-501c3/374149832631589The application can also be downloaded from our website www.merceranimalrescue.org or email us at merceranimalrescue@gmail.com and we will email an application to you.Stevie's adoption donation is $525 which helps to cover his neutering,three rounds of puppy shots, bordetella (kennel cough), rabies, heart worm prevention, flea/tick prevention, vet examination, certificate of health and transport fee.ALL OUR DOGS START THEIR JOURNEY IN TENNESSEEStevie is currently fostered in Tennessee and will travel to his new family once he has been adopted.We use a weekly professional pet transport to take the dogs to their new homes in the Northeast.  Pick up locations are available in VA, MD, PA, NJ, NY, CT, VTFor the dogs adopted to the mid-west, there is a monthly trip to Tinley Park, IL where the dogs are picked up.  The next trip to Tinley Park is Sunday, June 30, 2019.Our primary source of funding comes from this adoption donation. The donation allows us to rescue other dogs in danger of being put to sleep, injured or sick dogs and dogs that have never known a home.

Hello world! My name is Fancy and you might have heard about me before! I'm one of the Chihuahua's that came from Mississippi! I'm used to living outside with a couple hundred other dogs so this whole indoor dog thing is a lot for me to take in! I'm trying my best but I'm still not too sure about strangers and I definitely would prefer to live with another dog! If you have patience, love and a home with a social pup who needs a friend come adopt me today!

Jenna Lou is one of five Basset hound sisters that made their way from Mississippi to Maine. We know mom was mostly Basset hound, we're guessing there's some Beagle in them from dad, and the rest is a complete guess! Jenna and her sisters are low riders, but a purebred Basset ranges from 50-65 pounds, so there is the potential for her to be a solid medium-sized pup (no guarantees, though). These girls were intercepted by our southern rescue partner before being dropped off at a high-kill shelter. Honestly, we weren't sure what to expect when we committed to these girls but we LOVE their sweet and fun personalities. To meet Jenna Lou, please first submit an adoption contract on our website, after which our adoption coordinator will be in touch. As an all-volunteer rescue, the best way to reach Mainely Mutts is via email. https://www.mainelymuttsrescue.com/adoption-application

Speedy is a 5 year old male Chihuahua who is on his way to Maine from Mississippi, arriving on 6/21/19.  He will be ready to find a forever home a few days later.  Speedy is heart-worm negative, neutered and up to date on immunizations.  He has been fostered in a family home (not crated) with other dogs and is doing great.  Speedy will be a great addition to any family who is looking for a sweet little fella to join their family.   For more information, please contact Helping Paws Maine at helpingpawsme@gmail.org or you may check out our facebook page.   You can find our application at www.helpingpawsme.org.

Hi! My name’s Bailey and I’m a 2-year-old neutered male Chihuahua Mix. I came to Lucy Mackenzie with a bunch of my buddies from Mississippi earlier this summer. I was adopted soon after arriving, but things didn’t work out as well as we had hoped. The good news is that we all learned a lot about what I need in my new home. My continued obedience training is going to be very important. Some people think that smaller dogs can get away with things just because we’re small, but that’s not true. Boundaries and rules are really helpful and will go a long way towards my happiness. We also learned that young children confuse me quite a bit. I’ve met people of all ages here at the shelter, but in my home, it would be best if I lived with older, dog-savvy children only. I really like being around people, and will do pretty much anything to be near them. I’ve been known to climb up and over my kennel door here at the shelter, which is why I shouldn’t be trusted in a fenced in area left to my own devices. I will probably find a way out. The good news is that I love going for walks and playtime, especially with my favorite toy balls, so I promise you that we’ll always have a good time. If you’re looking for a new canine companion that will surely bring lots of love and joy to your life, stop in and meet me today!

Meet Ace! Ace is a beautiful4-month-old boy (as of June 2019) with similarities to a Labrador mix. Ace originally came from Mississippiand is now in PA while he waits for his forever home! Ace has a beautiful shiny black coat and a handsome face. Ace is a complete ham and loves to run around his foster mommy's yard and play with his other foster siblings! He is working on his house training, is up to date on shots, and will be neutered when old enough. Ace will need a home with an active family and a big yard to play in. If you are interested in adopting Ace, please go to our website at charliescrusaders.org and fill out our adoption application!

This is jolee she is just a luv bug, we saved her from a high kill shelter in Jackson tn. Good with other dogs and kids, Her adoption fee is $200 Go to www.lifehouse.petfinder.com fill out an application.

This is SAM  we saved him and his brother from a high kill shelter in Jackson tn.He is sweet and He has lots of energy . He is good with some dogs needs to be slowly introduced. Doesn’t like little dogs.  Walks pretty well on leash . When gets excited he will jump up .He is crate trained and a dry sweet boy. His adoption fee is $ 200 includes vaccines.microchipped and neutered, fill out an application at www.lifehouse.petfinder.com . He is about 2 yrs old andhe weighs 55lbs

Pit Bull Terrier Mix5 years oldNeutered MaleAdoption fee: $100Gumbo is a happy boy that came to the FVHA from Mississippi on the Bark Bus! He loves to play keep away with toys and enjoys spending his time chewing bones. Gumbo has been here since April and during that time we have found that being an only pet in the house is a good idea for him. Due to his handsome strong build and jumpiness, we recommend children 13+. He is a great boy who just wants to please his family. Could he be the perfect addition to your family?We always recommend crate training, exercise, playtime, and a regular schedule for potty breaks when bringing a new dog into your home. The shelter environment is much different than your home, so expect the unexpected. We do our best to help find the right pet for you, but your new dog may act differently on your turf than he/she did on ours.  Adjustment takes time for both you and your new family member, so remember to be patient and enjoy this new and exciting time!Included in the adoption fee are rabies & distemper vaccinations, heartworm testing, deworming, spay or neuter surgery.

This sweet girl is about 3 years old. She was originally a transfer in from St. Hubert\"s Shelter after coming from Missouri. She's very sweet and loving. An adopter will need to ensure that they have a fenced yard or leash walk her to ensure that she remains safe as she will check the perimeter for weaknesses to go on an adventure. She has traveled a great deal to get here and is looking for a quiet loving home that will give her time to adjust. Primary Color: Yellow Age: 3yrs 1mths 0wks Animal has been Spayed

We brought in 9 puppies from Missouri! They were not in the best shape when we got them but they are doing great now. Their $225 adoption fee covers his or her spay and neuter, vaccines, deworming medication, heartworm and flea/tick preventatives and microchip registration.

We brought in 9 puppies from Missouri! They were not in the best shape when we got them but they are doing great now. Their $225 adoption fee covers his or her spay and neuter, vaccines, deworming medication, heartworm and flea/tick preventatives and microchip registration.

Meet Gilly, one of the Irish crew from Missouri, who has been living life large in Iowa with Cheryl Collins and Skye her Irish not to mention a pack of wascally Wire Fox Terriers. Gilly was born on 24 December 2014. He is crate-trained and is making progress with house training.Gilly loves his gal-pal Skye. He is learning about treats and toys and the fine art of counter-surfing. He does that signature Irish spin when he is happy. Gilly gives the most awesome hugs! He wraps those big old paws around you and presses his head close. When he looks up with those big brown eyes, your heart goes pitter-pat. Gilly is sweet, smart, inquisitive, and adventuresome. All the things an Irish should be. And he loves car rides – he enjoys seeing where he is going and will peek his head between the seats and put his feet on the console. Gilly aims to please and loves to hear the words “good boy”. Cheryl reports that “he is probably the most loving guy yet”.Our lad is up to date on all his vaccines, heartworm-negative, and neutered – he is fit as a fiddle and ready to take on his new life in a forever home. Gilly needs a fenced backyard with an active family, a boy or girl to call his own, and a female canine companion. If you have fallen in love with Gilly, please complete our adoption application at http://www.irishterrierrescuenetwork.org/…/adoption-applic…/

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website. Who can resist a face like this! Pieta is a two year old who found her way to Last Hope from Missouri. Pieta is working hard learning her manners in hopes of finding her forever home. She loves spending time with her foster family and their 2 dogs. Once Pieta has met you, you're her friend! She does like to bark at you, but only for a minute or two. If you would like to meet Pieta please submit an adoption application at www.adopthope.org Adoption fee includes vaccinations, microchip, heartworm test, and spay. Last Hope requires all pets in the home be up to date with vaccinations, altered, and provided preventatives for heartworm and fleas/ticks year round. Free 6 week obedience class is also available with adoption.

Buddy is a really chill 7-year-old collie male. He was rescued from Missouri along with dogs from a puppy mill, and when he arrived in Virginia, we took him into Collie Rescue, Inc. Buddy is a sweet, well-mannered guy who loves to be around people. He is housebroken. We are currently treating him for heartworm. Buddy is currently shaved, but will grow his hair back long. Check back soon for more information about Buddy as we get to know him. If you are interested in rescuing a collie, please complete this short adoption questionnaire. Our standard adoption fee is $350. This fee helps us to cover the expense of providing each dog with a Health Exam, Rabies/DHPP vaccines, Heartworm Test, Heartworm Preventative, Flea & Tick Protection, Microchip, Neuter/Spay, and a Bath. Thank you for your consideration in adopting a collie in need!!!

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Heidi came from Missouri and shortly after arriving gave birth to nine beautiful puppies. Her pups have since grown and found their furever homes. Now, it’s time for Heidi to find her furever home. When Heidi first came into the rescue, she wouldn’t look anyone in the eye, and it took her two days before she looked up from the ground. She has made tremendous progress since but still has issues with trusting people and most likely always will. Today, she lives and gets along great with the other fosters and the house dog. Heidi has seldom been kenneled and does well being left free by herself. She also enjoys being outside and uses a doggy door to go out to the yard and bask in the sun. Walks on a leash are doable, but she gets anxious if pulled. It is unknown how she is with cats. Overall, she’s an affectionate but cautious dog that will do best with a gentle hand.Adoption fee includes: Full veterinary exam, spay, prepaid microchip, 4DX (heartworm/tick disease testing) dewormed, Rabies vaccine, DAPP vaccine, Bordetella vaccine, flea/tick and heartworm preventative while in rescue. Adoption fee: $295.00

Kitt is the happiest dog you will ever meet! He absolutely loves people and especially kids. When Kitt meets someone, he can hardly contain his excitement, but is working on a bit of self control. Kitt also loves his toys and playing with other dogs. He is house trained and crate trained and is great in the house. He is another of our island dogs, coming to us from the island of Nevis. He had a long journey to get here, but is glad to be in Kansas and cannot wait to find his perfect forever home. Kitt would like a home where he is the only dog. ...

COURTESY POST - FOR QUICKER RESPONSE PLEASE EMAIL MARY LOU AT:maryloumaria@yahoo.comFemale, spayed, 8 years old, 80 poundsHi! My name is Scarlet and I need a new home. I was adopted 4 years ago from a rescue, and have been living in Kingston, NH with my two humans ever since. I have a mom and an 11-year old sister. It’s been all about girl power until recently when the family dynamics changed. The mom says I’m a sweet, curious girl who craves attention. I like to be close and sit on her lap. I am convinced I’m a loveable lap dog, but I’m told I just don’t realize how big I am. I love my sister because sometimes we play and work on commands. I’m also house-trained and crate-trained. A doggie evaluator says I’m a friendly girl that just needs exercise and things to do. She feels I’m bored and need enrichment because when there’s excitement around me I tend to get jumpy and air snap. She says I don’t know what else to do because I was never taught any better. I do love chewing on things and hope my new home has some rugged chew toys and yummy marrow bones. Sometimes I get carrots to get my crunch on. Well guess what? Those carrots are part of a diet! I’m proud of my full figure but the mom says I need to get fit. I’m OK with that because I enjoy munching on frozen green beans with my kibble. So here’s the thing, I don’t do good with change and have become quite jumpy and nippy especially lately. Now, there’s a new baby on the way and the mom says I need a new home because I may accidentally hurt a little human. My nippy issues scare people so I need someone to help me follow the Golden Rule. I would love some mental and physical activities to keep me busy and gain confidence so I don’t act naughty. My ARK friends can tell you more.I would also like a quiet home since I get overexcited when there’s lots of commotion. If you could help me stay calm and focused, I know I’d be a lady to be proud of.  But when things get busy and noisy, you can place me in my crate in a quiet room. We’ll all be loving life if I’m not allowed to get super excited. The good news is any snippy snappy behavior can be redirected since I love treats and am willing to learn. This really works for me!I do need to be the only pet in your home. I am not a fan of cats and I just haven’t had the chance to make canine friends yet. So if you want a loyal friend and have a calm home, contact my buddy Mary Lou. Let’s meet! maryloumaria@yahoo.com

Sweet Dawson is an Australian Cattle Dog mix. He is a super laid back fellow who can be very shy in new environments, but once he gets acclimated he loves to play and give kisses. Dawson had a rough start and was found as a stray in GA. When he was pulled from the shelter He was emaciated and HW positive, but has since gained lots of weight and has undergone heartworm treatment. Dawson is also completely UTD on vaccinations, HW medication, and flea/tick prevention. He still needs to be neutered, but the vet requires 6 months prior to neuter after HW treatment, which will the end of June. Dawson is a special little fellow who will need a patient and loving forever home as he has some special needs. He is partially blind, but gets around quite well. He uses his sniffer to get around and once he gets used to his surroundings he maneuvers around without much trouble. Dawson loves to be outside and would love a home with a fenced in yard so that he could go outside and sniff all sniffs safely. Dawson walks well on a leash. He is still working on potty training, but with the use of belly bands he does pretty well in the house. Dawson also loves to be in his kennel. It is a safe space for him and he enjoys snuggling up in his kennel. Dawson would do best in a home with someone who works from home or someone who is able to come home at lunch time or arrange a dog walker to come and let him out midday. Anyone interested in adopting Dawson should understand his needs and be prepared to be patient when he first arrives at the home. He will take a little while to assimilate to any new environment, but once he feels comfortable he is a very sweet and loving dog who wants to be near his people. Please reach out if you are interested in sweet Dawson and his foster Mom will be happy to answer any questions. Dawson is located in New Hampshire.For questions, please contact Jclarkeacdra@gmail.com.COMPLETE AN APPLICATIONhttp://www.acdra.org/adoption-application

PLEASE FILL OUT OUR ONLINE APPLICATION BY COPYING THIS LINK INTO YOUR BROWSER: https://form.jotform.com/60475571571156. We adopt within a 30 minute drive of Glen Rock, NJ or Wayne, NJ. Other locations will be considered on a case-by-case basis depending on the availability of a home visit. Our little Arya is just like her Game of Thrones namesake and is beautiful, fearless, and smart!!! We can assure you that she will steal the heart of anyone she meets!  Her spots are adorable and we call her little Miss Maybelline with her \"eye shadow\".  Arya is an 12 wk old, Dalmation/Lab mix who is playful with other pups, loves to be around her humans and enjoys playing with her siblings. She is doing well on her house training and will make an excellent family pup.Arya is still a baby and she would need someone who is home more often than not (and who wouldn’t want to snuggle all day with a puppy!) who can teach her proper puppy behavior. Arya requires a fenced in yard, non-electric to keep her healthy and happy. She is spayed, up to date on vaccinations and microchipped. Our dogs have an adoption fee that ranges from $400-$475. To ensure our pets go to the best possible homes, we are only able to adopt within a 30 minute drive from Wayne, NJ or Glen Rock, NJ unless we have a representative in your area to complete the home inspection.

Please meet Saratoga. She is a 6 year old, 12 pound poodle mix. She's quiet, sweet, and loving.  She is shy at first but once she warms up, she'll love you forever. She's house trained and pad trained.Want to adopt Saratoga? Fill out our online adoption application by visiting our website: http://www.friendswithfourpaws.org/adoption-form.html** It would be a great help to us if you can pick up your dog from transport, which is centrally located from Northern NJ and NYC, or foster home. **PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR PHONE NUMBER IN YOUR INQUIRY** We put a lot of time and energy into processing our adoptions to find our babies the best fit home for them. Please do not submit an inquiry if you are not serious about adopting. We are so excited to work with you to find you a new forever friend, and appreciate you working with us. For immediate consideration, please attach your application to the initial inquiry to help us expedite the process.Our adoption fee is $475. This includes their spay/neuter surgery, full (age appropriate) vaccinations, microchip insertion and registration, deworming, heartworm testing and prevention, flea and tick prevention and travel expenses. All of our dogs are rescued from local municipal shelters and the general public. Each dog is then placed in a foster home where it is kept for a minimum of 2 weeks for quarantine, to ensure if the dog gets sick it can receive proper treatment. After the 2 week quarantine time they are spayed/neutered and fully vetted. They are then placed on the website. We have foster homes in the NJ/NY area waiting to receive their fosters. Once an animal has received an application or there's an adopter interested in it, we make arrangements to pick the animal up from the airport or ground-transport to then meet with the potential adopter. Thank you in advance for your patience with our process and for making adoption YOUR option!
