Hi my name is Sally! I was transferred here from another shelter in New Jersey. I enjoy meeting new people, and absolutely love to get petting! I did okay meeting some of my doggie neighbors in playgroup here at the shelter, and didn't seem to mind the kitties much either! If you want a new best friend that loves to go for sniffs instead of walks then I’m your gal!If you have children in the family, please bring them in for a visit --it's the best way see if the dog would be a good fit for your family. Adoption applications are only processed after you visit the shelter and meet the dog in person and speak with one of our adoption counselors. The shelter is open Wednesday thru Friday from 1 to 7pm and Saturday from noon to 5pm. Please visitwww.faithfulfriends.us/adoption-processfor more information. Email adoptadog@faithfulfriends.us with any questions.

Meet Jenny, a 13 year-old Parsons Russell Terrier who came to us from deplorable conditions on a New Jersey farm.  Thanks to a massive effort involving multiple animal welfare organizations, we were able to help Jenny and several of her canine siblings.  Age is just a number of Jenny!  She's full of zest, spunk, energy, and love.  While we know little about her history, we do know that she must be the only animal in the home.  Absolutely no dogs or cats for Miss Jenny!  Older kids with dog experience should be fine after an introduction, and of course Jenny has the final say on which family she chooses.   Come on and meet Jenny at the MSPCA-Cape Cod!

This little girl is an absolute delight! Parsippany is 8 years old and is ready for a new start in life. You may have read about the large number of dogs that were recently removed from a place in NJ. Well this peanut is one of them and the MSPCA is committed to helping her find a loving home and offering ongoing support while she adjusts to a normal home life. Parsippany will need a very patient adopter to help her as she transitions to their home, by slowly introducing her to new things as she gains confidence. She is learning to walk on leash and is enjoying the grass and exploring outside. Housebreaking will also require consistency and patience as she has never had an opportunity to learn appropriate potty breaks. Depending on introductions, she may be able to join a home with a dog. A slow introduction to a cat may be okay too. Older, gentle kids that are able to understand that Parsippany will need time to adjust will be considered. To see this gentle, sweet little dog start to wag her little nubby tail because she’s happy is quite a joy!! If you think you have the right home for this cutie, drop by and get acquainted.

5 Month Old. Male. Cattle Dog Mix. 21 lbs.I am as cute as can be!  I’m sweet and fun and I have lots of energy!  I’ll need lots of exercise and play time.  And, of course, I’m not house trained yet! I love to run and play and dig holes and do all of those fun puppy things!  I arrived at RCHS on June13 from a busy shelter in New Jersey and I’m happy to be in Vermont.  Stop by and say hi!

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Billie is a love bug, cuddle-bug, lap dog! He loves to ride in the car, although what could be greater than non-stop love, kisses, and cuddles with his human! He was a volunteer favorite at NYCACC.He is just an all and all happy go lucky guy. Staff is in love and from my two hours of being showered by Billie's love I know why, I am too! If you are interested in fostering or adopting Billie, please apply today! You have tons of cuddles and kisses awaiting you! Billie is located in Moorestown, NJ.

Thanks for visiting my page!My name is Rose and I am a Shih Tzu who was rescued from a puppy mill, with my new buddy, Iris, who is also available for adoption. I went from rags to riches overnight! Can you believe my luck?! I'm loving this new life in a clean home, inside with a roof, and in a cushion soft bed. I am not sure of my exact age but I'm a little older than 5. I am a little timid at first meet but once I learn to trust you, I become an instant cuddlemate! It's only because I'm still adapting to living life as a free dog. I need a companion pup to teach me the ropes around my new household so if you have a brother or sister for me, then you may just be THE ONE!! I also need a fully fenced yard because I would hate to wander off and get lost! I love falling asleep on my foster mom's lap because that's where I feel safe and secure. I was scared at first but learned that people really just want to love me and enjoy my sweet, soft-bodied nature. I'm still working on house-training and figuring out these things called toys but I'm doing great on my routine walks and I learn a little more every single day. If you think you want to adopt me, please fill out an application at www.anarchyanimalrescue.org. I am currently being fostered in eastern Pennsylvania, not too far from New Jersey.Please be advised, our adoption requirement is that you reside within 120 miles of NYC. Some exceptions can be made, please inquire with your location prior to submitting an application if you are outside our area.

Thanks for visiting my page!My name is Iris and I was rescued from a puppy mill with my new buddy, a 5 year-old Shih Tzu named, Rose, who is also available for adoption. I'm so glad those days are behind me, I spent many years in a cage and never knew how good life really was until I got out of there! The outside world is huge! I'm loving this new life in a clean home, indoors, and in a cuddly soft bed. I am 8 years young and love to kick back, relax and enjoy some good TV shows. I am shy at first meet but I warm up in no time. I'm also learning the ropes about being a free dog so I need a companion dog to keep me company. I also need a fully fenced-in backyard so I can't go wandering off and get lost. I love falling asleep next to my foster mom, where I feel warm and safe. I was scared at first but learned that people really just want to love me because I am gentle and calm. I'm still working on house-training and figuring out these things called toys but I'm doing great on my routine walks and I learn a little more every single day. If you think you may want to adopt me, please fill out an application at www.anarchyanimalrescue.org. I am currently being fostered in eastern Pennsylvania, not too far from New Jersey.Please be advised, our adoption area is within 120 miles of NYC. Some exceptions can be made, please inquire with your location prior to submitting an application if you are outside our area.

Dexter is looking for his furever home through Blue Ridge Bull Terrier Rescue! Dexter and his adorable floppy ear came into rescue from a New Jersey shelter. He was originally found as a stray and was adopted out from the shelter and, sadly, returned. He has now has been turned over to rescue so he can find his perfect furever home once and for all. Dexter is such a happy boy who is guaranteed to put a grin on your face! He has a very high energy level and is always on the move. He enjoys going for car rides, on long walks or running around a fenced yard, but most of all he LOVES to play with toys! He will play fetch or tug with his humans, but is perfectly happy entertaining himself by tossing the ball and chasing it down on his own. He lives for squeakers! Dexter is very smart and inquisitive. He knows how to sit and give his paw, and should pick up on new tricks quickly if someone were to spend the time with him; he loves cookies. Dexter also has a calm, sweet, and loving side, curling up on the couch for a good cuddle session. Due to his rambunctious energy level, kids in his home should be ages 10+. Dexter is reactive to other dogs and will need to be the only pet in his home. No dogs, cats, or critters. Dexter is a gentleman in the home; he is crate trained, housebroken, and nondestructive. He is a healthy boy who weighs in at 60lbs, is neutered, up to date on his vaccines, heartworm negative, and microchipped. He currently enjoys a grain-free diet. We have absolutely fallen in love with this guy. His floppy ear, paired with his soulful eyes will pull you in and melt your heart. If you are ready for the new love of your life to join your family, please apply here: https://www.brbtc.org/adoption-process/  Dexter is currently fostered in Hartsville, SC, but transport is available for the right home.

Hey everyone! My name is Lt. Dan and I am a year old mixed breed dog. We think I might be an Australian Cattle Dog mix or something, but one thing is for sure: I'm 100% handsome! I'm even more handsome with three legs! Your eyes do not deceive you: I am tripawed and a lucky boy. I am awesome with other dogs but my foster mom says I'm not that great with cats because oh boy do I like to chase them. I'm pretty food motivated and will take all of the snacks you'll give me... but I need a new family to help me watch my figure because of my disability.Truth be told, I did not have the best start in life. I was dumped on the side of a road where I searched for my family and had to fend for myself. While looking for my family I was hit by a car. I was scared and lonely and was hurt really bad. I was so scared of people and it took three big scary men to catch me. They brought me to a hospital where I met my foster mom. She gave me pain medication and advocated for me. This is where the amazing Mel said foster mom could bring me into the rescue and make me better. They amputated my leg and my foster mom slowly gained my trust as I healed. As you can imagine I am still very scared around new people and strangers. I need my new family to come meet me a few times before I can go home with them. It would also be great if my new family has worked with a fearful dog before. I am getting better with trusting my foster mom about strangers and ignoring them. I love playing with my foster brothers and sisters and can play all day. I have foster kitties in the house that I will chase if they run. I am going to go play with my foster siblings now and my foster mom will tell you more.Lt. Dan is up to date on vaccines, heartworm negative, and on flea, tick and heartworm prevention monthly. He LOVES playing with other dogs and gets along with dogs of all sizes. He can live with dog savvy cats. Lt. Dan is fearful of new people and his adopter with be required to come to New Jersey a few times to meet him and spend some time with him before he can go to his new home. His adopters will also need to have experience with fearful dogs and will need to work with a positive reinforcement trainer. Once he learns to trust you, Lt. Dan will cuddle with you all day if you let him. He is a medium energy dog who just wants to be with his person. He will gladly occupy you on a long walk or cuddle on the couch all day with you. Because he had his leg amputated his adopters will need to be vigilant about his diet, weight and keep him exercised. Lt. Dan has had a rough beginning but with love and dedication he can overcome his past and be a loving member of a family. Could that be you?SOHO is a 501c3 public charity focusing on rescuing herding dogs in crisis on the East Coast. Your pets will need to be up to date on vaccinations and heartworm preventative in order to be considered for adoption. Lt. Dan does have some additional adoption requirements: his foster mom would like a potential adopter to come and visit Lt. Dan a few times before taking him home in order to help him bond to his new family. Please note that Lt. Dan is located in HIGHLAND LAKES, NEW JERSEY.

Brownie is looking for his forever family! He is estimated to 3-5 years old, and is full of energy. He is fully vetted. He was a feral in Window Rock, Arizona, Navajo Nation, wandering the tribal office buildings for at least the past year and a half. He’s a super intelligent and crafty “Rez dog” so he needs a very secure yard with a large area where he can safely run free as he’s accustomed to. He is an outdoor dog, but under the right circumstances he may do well inside too. He is intimidated by cats, and may have had a bad experience with them in the past, so a home with no cats is best. However, he is not aggressive towards cats at all and does not chase, he cowers away and won’t go inside his current foster’s home because of the cats. He is also wary of men. He does, however, love other dogs and would probably be happiest with another dog buddy. Leash training was a breeze for him - he loves going for walks every day! He has made so much progress in the past 4 months. He went from being a dog that you could not even touch or get close to, to one that craves affection and praise. He rode in the car and a crate to the vet successfully. I think with more exposure he’ll do fine with both. We don’t know everything that Brownie has went through, but he’s a survivor and he deserves a loving family that is patient and willing to give him lots of time and attention. In return he will be your loyal, ridiculously smart, loving friend.Brownie is vaccinated and neutered, and currently located in Gallup, NM with transport possible to surrounding areas. For more information, submit an inquiry!

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Fred is a shy boy from NM in a rural area so he did not meet many new people or dogs. He had cherry eye which we lasered out so he now can see well and it opened up a whole new world for him. Fred did well in his foster in NM but tends to be more shy with men so he needs time to learn to warm up otherwise he will just avoid. Once he knows you he is a whole different dog he loves to play and just be by your side. He is a quiet dog and would be fine with kids that are quieter and respectful of animals. Older kids are best as younger toddlers screaming and crying kids would startle him. He is fine with small dogs and would do awesome with a confident female dog

My name is Lemon, I am available for adoption through Colorado Canine Rescue (CCR) - a nonprofit dog rescue located in the Denver area. My vet and foster mom have guessed that I am around 2 years old and an American Pit Bull Terrier or \"pit bull-type dog.\" I was rescued from an overcrowded shelter in New Mexico. I will be available to adopt/go home after July 5th. I am currently completing a board and train program through High Drive Dog Company in Longmont, Colorado. Part of my adoption requirements include follow up training with High Drive (sponsored by CCR for 3 months), no other animals in the home, no children under 12, and no cities with BSL (breed specific legislation). It is preferred I am adopted to a home with a 6 foot wooden fence. These requirements are non-negotiable. Lemon would do best living with someone who has bully breed experience. Lemon weighs around 60 pounds, is crate trained, and doing well with housetraining. She can be vocal when she needs something, and is not appropriate for apartment/condo living.Lemon had a rough start to life; being kenneled 24/7 for 2 months straight prior to arriving in Colorado was a lot of stress. Lemon has worked through a lot of reactivity issues. She actually plays well with a lot of dogs. She is NOT a candidate for dog parks. However, she is always welcome to attend supervised playgroups at High Drive (please see http://www.highdrivedogco.com/ for more details about the company). Lemon is not a coach potato. She is bold, eager to learn, and ready to take on the world. Lemon needs to be challenged physically and mentally. She is funny and affectionate. This pup may have started out as a lemon, but she is quite a peach.If you are interested in adopting Lemon, please submit an application located on our website, www.coloradocaninerescue.org. We are asking for a $200.00 adoption donation. Lemon is spayed, up to date on vaccinations, and micro-chipped. Please note, CCR cannot guarantee the breed composition or ages of our dogs as we usually have no history prior to them entering the shelter. In addition, most dogs listed as potty trained will experience an adjustment period as they learn the routines in their new home.

When Jake's rescuer walked down the aisle of the dismal New Mexico shelter, she was shocked to see the adorable (and extremely dirty and matted) Jake tucked tightly into a cage...his time was up for lack of space. Farfel's immediately got a call describing how incredibly cute and sweet this Spaniel mix is..and the need to save his life. We immediately agreed and Jake became a very treasured Farfel's dog. He earned a ticket to a wonderful new life in Colorado with his great temperament that held every possibility for a great future.At 3.6 years old and 11 lbs, this very adorable pup is a blank slate waiting for positive input and guidance to be the best dog he's capable of being. We'd love to match Jake to a family that will spend lots of time with this very portable guy. He's a perfect size to accompany his family just about anywhere...and would love it. Positive reinforcement group obedience class will not only provide socialization and great skills...but will cement the relationship between Jake and his family.  He's so smart that he's a natural to succeed in learning his skills...and would be so excited at his success!  Jake always gets lots of attention when he's out and about with his rescuer...he's engaging (while a bit shy at first) and as sweet as can be.  He's also extremely eye-catching with his stunning tri-colored coat and gorgeous dark eyes that speak of so much wisdom. Jake has been identified as a Cavalier/Spaniel mix.. but we would never swear to it. He's just an adorable and fun scruffy guy that's irresistible! When Jake turns that gentle look in your direction, you can't help but smile at his engaging ways.  You can see a bit of a sign that this young pup has had difficult times. But not for him to be negative..a smile and a wag is more Jake's style. It's clear that he is working on leaving any pain behind.Farfel's Rescue is searching for either active retirees for Jake (he would be overjoyed with being the center of a loving family and the amount of time spent together). Jake would also be great with a younger family with dog-crazy kids. Jake, once bonded, will be a loyal best friend who would love nothing more than time together or socializing with friends. Jake would also enjoy time with dogs of similar size who can be gentle playmates. When you're only 11 lbs, even a well-adjusted pup can be intimidated by large, rambunctious dogs.  Jake is so grateful being out of the shelter that there's almost a smile on his cuter than cute face.  He is a very happy guy once he's comfortable...a bit of patience, treats and belly rubs will truly get this guy's attention as he's had far too little of all in his life.  Jake's rescuer is very happy to report that Jake is coming out of his shell more each day...he's blossoming.  She's very clear that Jake will be a wonderful and bonded family member when he has love and nurturing as a part of his life.Jake is up to date on his vetting, but has yet to be neutered. We're hoping that he will be fixed when he arrives from New Mexico, however rescue dogs are often overlooked in this city with too many dogs and not enough vets. If this is the case, Farfel's is happy to cover all costs for Jake to be neutered and microchipped at one of our rescue vets to be in line with our commitment to be a part of the solution to pet overpopulation. Jake will be arriving on transport in Denver on Saturday 6/8 or Sunday 6/9/19 (we'll update when information is confirmed). Applications are currently being accepted for this very sweet, engaging and loving best friend. An application can be found at http://farfels.com/farfels-rescue/adoption-form/. If interested, please fill out completely and submit.**PLEASE NOTE** Farfel's Rescue makes huge efforts to place our dogs with families that are excellent matches. We do this through our 6-page Farfel's application found on farfels.com (never through rescue site apps as they don't provide enough information) followed by follow-up phone interviews, home photos and reference checks. If you're truly interested in adopting Jake, please be sure to fill out the Farfel's adoption application. It's the only initial tool that we have to determine a great match for this very deserving guy. We're sorry, but in most cases, we're unable to get back to those that don't submit our application. Thanks very much for choosing rescue.

Fergie is a loving adult dog, estimated to be4 to 5 years old, recently arrived to Colorado from Gallup, New Mexico. She is a devoted girl who would love to stay by her person's side (or under their desk) and guard their home (she barks if she hears or sees something outside she feels is noteworthy). Fergie has a shiny, soft, and deepblack coat with brown accents and is full-grown and medium-sized at about 43 pounds.Her personality is mellow overall but she is also playful; Fergie loves to play with squeaky dog toys and to retrieve them for people too. Of course, she loves going on walks or hikes or other outdoor adventures. Fergie likes to splash around in water... given the opportunity, she will probably like to swim! Watch this video:https://youtu.be/96i3kRkzWu4 She is being fostered in Longmont, CO, where she lives with four other dogs (from 20 lbs to 55 lbs) and gets along with all of them.Fergie is house trained, leash trained, crate trained, and doggie-door trained. She is spayed,up to date on shots, and ready to go to her forever home. She is calm on car rides (and she doesn't get car sick).Fergiewill make a wonderful fur buddy for some lucky family or person!If you're like to meet Miss Fergie and see if she's the right dog for your home or family, please submit an adoption application to RezDawg Rescue today!RezDawg's adoption fees cover rescue and transportation costs, spay/neuter, microchip, deworming and vaccinations to bring the animals up-to-date at their time of adoption. You save a bundle of money by adopting from a non-profit-and even more importantly, you allow RezDawg to save another animal from being euthanized. ALL funds are used to save and support the animals!

Meet Mocha, we saved Mocha from the shelter in Aztec, NM. She is approximately 2 years old and loves people and children. Right now she is scared around other dogs but her foster family is working with her to get her over that fear. Mocha is very curious of cats but she hasn't been taken off leash around them yet so not certain quiet yet if she will be good with cats or not. She loves attention though and always wants to be around people. Mocha is crate trained and knows basic commands, She is fully potty trained and knows how to use a dog door. From what little time we have had her it is clear her past humans weren't the best to her but that does not keep her from being a very sweet and she will be an awesome companion for someone who is ready to love her! All animals adopted from us are fully vetted including spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, heartworm test and deworming. Please email us at HookedOnDobies@gmail.com, visit our Facebook page www.facebook.com/savingdobermankind or webpage https://www.savingdobermankind.org to request an application, inquire about an adoption fee, or to learn more! We do require a completed adoption application to be submitted before discussing details of a specific Doberman. We DO NOT have a central location, out foster homes are located throughout our geographic region including CO, WY, NM and TX. We strive to PROTECT the privacy of out fosters. ALL Doberman meet and greets are conducted in a neutral meeting location made by appointment only.

Are you looking for a small, housetrained, crate-trained, and very loyal and playful pint-sized adult dog? Panda may be your new furever buddy! About four to fiveyears old and 21pounds, Panda is looking for a family or person who will include her in their daily lives, take her on walkies, andthrow the tennis ball for her.She is a lot of fun and very attentive. She's very fast, agile, and confident! And she'll gladly defend your yard against invading squirrels.Panda currently lives with four much-larger dogs at her foster home and gets along great with them; however, she does take some time to warm up to newdogs. Panda may not be appropriate for a home with cats(it depends on the cat... a confident, stand-its-ground cat that will not hesitate to swat a dog to show it who's in charge may be fine). IMPORTANT: Panda's forever home needs to have a yard for her to \"do her business\"... she's quite particular about this. But she is housetrained, doggy-door trained, and crate trained.Panda is a very fun and playful dog (yet is generally calm and quiet around the house); she really loves to chase and retrieve tennis balls, play with squeaky stuffed dog toys (she will also retrieve toys if you throw them for her), and she is young and active enough to easily go for many miles of walking or hiking. And as was mentioned earlier, she's very interested in squirrel watching and will sometimes attempt to climb trees to get a better look. Pandaloves going on adventures and is a great car rider (doesn't get car sick; enjoys popping her head out the window occasionally to sniff the air, as long as the car isn't going too fast, under 40 mph or so).Panda is very independent and is more of a \"people dog\" than \"dog dog,\" meaning she's not particularly interested in befriending or playing with other dogs. Her foster people think sheis best suited to being an only dog, although she would likely get along fine with another dog.She mainlyenjoysbeing with her people, but otherwisedoes her own thing. When her foster people are busy or at work, she spends a fair amount of time during the day looking out the front window of the house (there's a dog bed under it)... again, those darnsquirrels.Panda is spayed, microchipped, up to date on shots, andready to go home to her forever home. If you'd like to come meet Panda to see if she's the right fit for your home (she is being fostered in Longmont, CO), please submit an adoption application today!Here's a video of Panda happily retrieving a tennis ball,on hervery first day with her foster person after transport from NM!https://youtu.be/_d-wbAaG4gEAnd this is Pandarunning happily at an off-leash area, sprinting back after being called by name:https://youtu.be/HlCwJhMBNiQBe sure to follow RezDawg Rescue on Facebook and Instagram!Our adoption fees cover transport from a reservation or high-intake shelter, vaccinations, deworming, food, alteration, any needed treatments and microchipping for identification. We foster our animals in homes around Colorado instead of one central facility, so your adoption payment goes further toward helping more animals find safe homes filled with love.

MEET TOBY!Toby was rescued from a high kill shelter in Roswell, New Mexico. He is a 2 year old bundle of love. He adores people of all shapes and sizes (including children!) Toby is potty trained and knows basic commands. His favorite things to do: go on walks, cuddle, get belly rubs & act like a goof! You get the adorable big puppy, without all the nipping and accidents!Toby has been working on his introductions with dogs, but he is best suited as an only dog as he is dog selective. No kitties please also! He has enough love for the whole family!! Do Over Dogs- A Second Chance At Life would love to hook up an adopter with some training sessions for the transition as well. He is neutered, microchipped, & vaccinated.Toby is looking for his Second Chance. If interested, please apply for Toby at www.DoOverDogs.comHis adoption fee is $125.00.

Brit is a 1 year old terrier mix who came all the way from Los Cruces to find her loving home. She is a short haired blonde weighing in at about 12 pounds. She would be a wonderful companion for a retired person as she loves to sit on your lap and get lots of attention while you read or watch TV. She is very active, so a yard to play in and explore would be wonderful. She will be best as an only dog in the home, and no small children as she is very bouncy. She has what we think is a malformed jaw, but it doesn’t affect her ability to eat or smile! She loves attention!Brit is spayed, up to date on her vaccinations (rabies, distemper and kennel cough), vet checked, heartworm tested negative and on preventative while in rescue, and microchipped. If you would like to meet Brit, go to www.cominischnauzerrescue.com and complete the on-line adoption application. We suggest that you print a copy of the application before you hit the \"submit\" button, just in case! We will give you a call to set up a time to bring Brit for a visit.

Burrito came to us all the way from New Mexico! While we dont know too much about him yet, we know that he is good with other dogs, and is a sweet snuggle guy. He is looking for a loving forever home! If you are interested in adopting a CAWS pet, please fill out an online application at http://caws.org/adoption-application

Hi, my name is Leon. I am a 1 year old, 10lb, Rat Terrier. I am house trained and crate trained. I am working on my leash training. I am good with dogs and cats and would prefer a home with older kids. I love dogs so much, I MUST be adopted  in a home with another dog as a companion. I am very sweet, playful and happy.Want to adopt me? Fill out our online adoption application by visiting our website: http://www.friendswithfourpaws.org/adoption-form.html**Please note that our dogs may be located in foster homes around NJ and the NYC area. It would be a great help to us if you can pick up your dog from transport, (which is located in Astoria) or foster home.****PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR PHONE NUMBER IN YOUR INQUIRY** We put a lot of time and energy into processing our adoptions to find our babies the best fit home for them.  Please do not submit an inquiry if you are not serious about adopting.  We are so excited to work with you to find you a new forever friend, and appreciate you working with us.  For immediate consideration, please attach your application to the initial inquiry to help us expedite the process.Our adoption fee is $475. This includes their spay/neuter surgery, full (age appropriate) vaccinations, microchip insertion and registration, deworming, heartworm testing and prevention, flea and tick prevention and travel expenses.All of our dogs are rescued from local shelters and the general public. Each dog is then placed in a foster home where he/she is kept for a minimum of 2 weeks for quarantine, to ensure if the dog gets sick it can receive proper treatment. After the 2 week quarantine time they are spayed/neutered and fully vetted. They are then placed on the website. We have foster homes in the NJ/NY area waiting to receive their fosters. Once an animal has received an application or there's an adopter interested, we make arrangements with the waiting foster to pick the animal up from transport. If a dog is already in foster care in NYC/NJ, an adopter will be put in touch with the foster home once an application is being processed.Thank you in advance for your patience with our process and for making adoption YOUR option!

Age: 1 Year (as of 2/5/19)Weight: 61 lbs (as of 2/11/19)This dog has been spayed/neutered, is up to date on shots, on heartworm preventative and is microchipped.Xen Jen is a super sweet boy!At the shelter where he currently resides, he's pretty laid back for a pup his age. In the play yard he wanders around slowly taking in all of his surroundings and walks up to strangers like they're supposed to acknowledge how regal he is. We're thinking he's a Shepherd mix born sometime early February 2018, and we're also thinking that due to his suspected breed mix he will need an adopter who has the time and energy to make Xen a priority in terms of training and daily structure and exercise. He's the kind of dog who'll need a \"job\" to do. Once he's been to basic obedience classes, he'll most likely enjoy advanced training like agility or flyball - he likes playing fetch and flyball combines fetch and agility. He's very motivated by treats and toys! Though a fenced yard is an ideal place to burn off some excess energy, daily leash walks for exercise, business and fun - with trips for off-leash play at a dog park - will work, too. This handsome dude is good with other dogs, can be redirected away from kitties that don't care for doggies, and he's been tolerant of kids he's met. He's not a super barker, but will let you know when visitors arrive - he's more apt to alert bark when crated or inside, rather than outside in the yard. We don't know at this point if he's house trained. He does walk on leash, but needs to work on not pulling. He has mastered \"sit\" and is working on his crate training.Need a hiking and/or running partner? Xen's your boy! He also likes swimming so...summer beach trips! As active as he may be, he also likes to cuddle and chill out. Does he sound like the perfect fur-dition to your family? Fill out an application today for Xen Jen and his people will get right back to you!Xen's Backstory:He was picked up as a stray by a man who was visiting Mississippi's capital city from New York. He had two other pets that Xen did fine with when he found him, however he knew when he returned to New York he would not have space in his studio apartment for his new friend. He reached out to our Mississippi rescue partner for help. The finder neutered Xen Jen before he found us.Medical Note: This dog is being treated for heartworm disease with melarsomine injections. Once treatment is completed and the dog tests negative for microfilaria, the dog will be cleared to resume normal activity and able to be adopted. Untreated heartworm disease can cause lasting damage to the heart, lungs and arteries, and can affect the dog’s health and quality of life even after the parasites are gone, possibly presenting as medical complications and/or new conditions in the future. This dog showed no symptoms of heartworm disease before or during treatment. A good resource for more information on heartworm disease is: https://www.heartwormsociety.org/pet-owner-resources/ heartworm-basics. Please check with your vet if you should have any questions or concerns about this condition, and discuss any concerns you may have with your SOS Adoption Counselor.Adoption Fee: $585To apply for this dog, fill out an adoption application on our website: www.sosarl.org/aa/**Additional info you should know - For most of our dogs, we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We get to know each of our dogs as an individual and do our best to describe and place them based on personality not breed label. Some dogs may not yet be in New England, nor ready for immediate adoption. There may be additional vetting, quarantine, waiting periods and/or fees depending upon your state of residence. If you have questions or concerns on any of this, you can discuss this with your Adoption Counselor.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Fill out an Adoption ApplicationDrama is a sweet, super soft, silly old girl who will steal our heart and make you laugh at her playful antics. She is super easy to live with, very adaptable and well mannered and lives to please you. She does however snore like a chain saw. She loves nothing better than to sit and doze near you, hangout on the back porch or go for short walks. She’s a nine year’s young 83 pond Mastiff mix. She hails from Manhattan so loud noises don’t faze her and she is well trained and socialized. She is looking for a home where people will dote on her, play with her and make her golden years special.Likes: Chicken, scratches and being near her people. She loves to bring you a toy to play tug of war, but she can be quite enthusiastic and sometimes get a little over excited. She loves sticks and balls and likes to lay outside and chew on something.Dislikes: She hates to disappoint and worries if she thinks you are upset with her.Personality: Very sweet, easy going, silly and playful with great manners.Temperament: Very trusting and let you handle her just about everywhere but she has some arthritis in her back end and is cautious about being touched there. She will follow her people everywhere, but sits on the closest dog bed or rug rather than right on top of you. She is a sweet and adaptable girl who just wants lots of love.Energy level: low but she does like to play inside or out for very short periods.Favorite activity: Sleeping, getting attention, sitting outside, finding a good stick, rolling on a dog bed on her back, mouth opened making silly happy noises.Good with: Other dogs and people. She always has a tail wag for other dogs and will bark a few times when people come to the door but goes in for scratches as soon as you greet them. She likes cats a lot but can be overenthusiastic – she does take cues to back off from cats well.Housetrained – YesCrate trained – No She doesn’t seem to have ever been in a crate and not interested in going in, but is very good left alone in the house. She doesn’t chew or get into the trashMedical issues – She is nine and has some stiffness in her rear end but she is able to do stairs ok now, however a home with no more than a few stairs would be best as she gets older. She is little so does like to get up on a bed, but needs help. She does seem to be slightly cross eyed at times, but she can see fine other than perhaps having some depth perception issues occasionally.She deserves a home where people can make a fuss over her and play gently for very short periods between naps. Older children if any would therefore be best. She is happiest when she can doze on a bed near you as you go about your business. Few if any stairs would be best as she enters her golden years.Fostered in Norristown, PA.Application Fees, Adoption Donations and Rescue Policy: Please know that 100% of our funds are used for rescuing the dogs.Our rescue policy requires the following:Adopters must have their primary residence in one of the following states: Pennsylvania, Ohio, New Jersey, Delaware, Maryland, West Virginia, Virginia, and parts of North Carolina.Applications for giant breed dogs must be submitted by the property owner.Homes with children under 6 years of age will not be approved for adoption.Homes with children should have a fenced yard.Pets currently in the applicant's home must have a history of appropriate veterinary care. Veterinary records will be checked.All references must be checked before any visitation of the dog is permitted at the foster home.All family members must be present during the home visit to the applicant's home.Any dog(s) in the applicant's home must have an introductory meeting with the rescue dog being considered, before any adoption can be completed.For additional information please review our FAQs or contact: mastiffstomutts@gmail.com

Sweet Mocha is a 6 year old Pit Bull who has come to our rescue all the way from Long Island in New York City!! Due to overcrowded kennels in the city poor Mocha was on the list to be euthanized. She was a favorite among the volunteers at the municipal shelter and they fought hard to find safety. After reaching out to dozens of no-kill shelters they finally found The Canine Rescue of Central PA and we were happy to make room for her! She is appropriately named Mocha as she has a beautiful coat that looks like a cup of Mocha with some whipped cream swirled in! And she's about as sweet as a Mocha treat as well! She walks well on a leash and has a good bit of energy! But also likes to cuddle and adores being with people. She has a small prey drive and would do best in a home without children, cats or small dogs. She could likely live with medium to large sized dogs.Mocha is spayed, up-to-date on shots and housetrained. If you are interested in meeting Mocha or would like more information please leave a voicemail at the rescue 717-232-1644 or e-mail at adopt@crcpa.org.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Karmyn is a sweet girl that came from a NY kill shelter. Karmyn was diagnosed with Cushings shortly after arriving at PPR and we have started treatment. She was spayed, had her dental, and had a hernia repaired. She will be having a consult on May 10th to repair her patellas, but we aren't sure what the surgeon will say since her back legs are so bowed and the Cushings disease makes healing difficult. Since starting treatment, Karmyn is now house trained and really just loves being with her people. She cannot do steps well so she is carried wherever her foster pawrents go. Karmyn is leash trained, rides perfectly in the car, and just wants to soak up all the love she can get! We really want to see Karmyn in her forever home soon and she would really fit in anywhere.To adopt Karmyn, please complete an adoption application at PomPaws.org. The $250 adoption fee ($150 for senior citizens 65+) includes bloodwork, ACTH stim test, spay, dental, hernia repair, fecal, heartworm and Lyme test, core vaccines (Rabies, Distemper/Parvo, and bordatella), and all the love you can handle!

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Zahara came from a working-class family in NYC. This 2-3 yr old girl likes her surroundings tidy and will clean up spills upon request. She is not afraid of the vacume, nor does she want to attack it. She has offered to do pre-wash when loading the dish washer. She is willing to help clear the counter of anything unwanted and will collect laundry into a pile. Who couldn't want a house guest with perfect manners? Zahara prefers the company of calmer dogs and is in foster with two. She has perfect house manners and is happy to greet you when you come home from work. She is social with school aged kids and is very excited (maybe too much so, thinking they are rodents?) by small animals and probably should NOT live with them.Think Zahara is your girl? Apply today!Please visit our web site at 4theloveofdog.org for all adoption information6/27/19 7:47 PM

IN VERMONTMeet Mundo! Here is his video compilation:https://youtu.be/uWBNBKpJtPgMundo is 11 months old, male, 110 lbs, vetted, and will be neutered. Mundo is a purebred Saint Bernard from a breeder in New York that has since closed down. He will need an experienced home; he is an overgrown puppy that needs someone to understand the breed as well as dog language and the way he communicates. Yes he drools, sheds, and enjoys chewing on things but he is house trained! He is good with most other dogs but sometimes dogs do not like him (potentially due to him not being altered yet which will be done). He needs someone that will be soft with him but give him structure without intimidation or boldness that will put him on the defense. Mundo has been through a lot of changes which he did not take well. He does not like to be stared at nor have treats withheld from him; his past history is unclear. We do not know all of Mundo's background and what he has been through but it seems he has not gotten what he needs for a well balanced existence. He needs someone willing to continue working with him to teach him. Currently he would do best in a home without small children and strangers coming and going frequently. He would do best in a home without a dominant male dog; and another dog would be younger like him as older dogs seem to get annoyed with him. He will need someone who will be patient with him while he learns and someone that will keep him on the right path. He is a low energy dog that is content to take naps during the day and sleep through the night. He is not a pup to be taken lightly just because he is adorable; we do know in the right home and with the right input he will become a loyal behaved family member. He needs a very experience owner.If you are interested in adopting Mundo please fill out an Application at www.Passion-4-Paws.org (please make sure you have the Vermont site) thanks!Please note Fosters have 1st option of Adoption.Check out his Facebook page (please \"Like\" us while you are there): http://tinyurl.com/y4dnwpd3Disclosure:Breed labels are often incorrect: we rarely know the genetic lineage of the dogs we rescue. Many shelters and rescues specify breeds based on appearance; however, research has shown that less than 2% of a dog’s DNA determines appearance!Passion 4 Paws does not practice the use of labels pertaining to compatibility with others or dog breed. Labels such as “dog friendly” and “child friendly” should be used with caution as they often over-simplify the personalities and behavior of dogs.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Hi! My name is Ro, and I am an adorable pitbull mix. I am estimated to be 7-10 years old, but I certainly don't act like it! I love every person and dog I get to meet, but I chase kitties, so a cat free household would be best. I love to run and play; tug is my favorite game. I am working on my commands and know “sit” and “lay down.” My mom said “stay” is a work in progress, but I just love having fun with you! She also said I have the most ADORABLE FACE TILT when I’m being endearing! So more about me, inthe evening I love to grab a toy and cuddle up next to my foster mom and dad on the couch. I’m looking for my adoptive home. Awesome adoptive parents only please! I’m located in NY state in the Greater Albany region but can be transported for A LOVING FAMILY in the Northeast! And as my rescue and foster mom say, “only awesome applicants need apply!”Again I’m Ro and I’m taking applicants for an awesome forever!

ADOPTION FEE:$200Blaze comes from a shelter in New York.  He was an owner surrender, the shelter evaluation said he was good with other dogs, walks well on a leash and loves to play fetch with a tennis ball. Hello World, nice to meet you!My name is Parker. I am a Shepherds and lab mix with tons of cuteness! I am about 2 months old (as of 5/5/19).I love everything... dogs, cats, humans and most importantly, I already know I love you (and we haven't even meet).like all puppies, I am curious and have tons of energy. I am eager to learn everything (potty-training, leash-training, crate-training). Show me everything and I will repay you with tons of kisses!Want to adopt this cute puppy?  Fill out our online adoption application by visiting our website: http://www.friendswithfourpaws.org/adoption-form.htmlFind more adoptable pets, news and information on Instagram @friendswithfourpaws or our Facebook page Friends with Four Paws **Please note that our dogs may be located in foster homes around NJ and the NYC area. It would be a great help to us if you can pick up your dog from transport, (which is located in Astoria) or foster home.****PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR PHONE NUMBER IN YOUR INQUIRY** We put a lot of time and energy into processing our adoptions to find our babies the best fit home for them.  Please do not submit an inquiry if you are not serious about adopting.  We are so excited to work with you to find you a new forever friend, and appreciate you working with us.  For immediate consideration, please attach your application to the initial inquiry to help us expedite the process.Our adoption fee is $475. This includes their spay/neuter surgery, full (age appropriate) vaccinations, microchip insertion and registration, deworming, heartworm testing and prevention, flea and tick prevention and travel expenses.All of our dogs are rescued from local shelters and the general public. Each dog is then placed in a foster home where he/she is kept for a minimum of 2 weeks for quarantine, to ensure if the dog gets sick it can receive proper treatment. After the 2 week quarantine time they are spayed/neutered and fully vetted. They are then placed on the website. We have foster homes in the NJ/NY area waiting to receive their fosters. Once an animal has received an application or there's an adopter interested, we make arrangements with the waiting foster to pick the animal up from transport. If a dog is already in foster care in NYC/NJ, an adopter will be put in touch with the foster home once an application is being processed.Thank you in advance for your patience with our process and for making adoption YOUR option!

Make A Difference in your Community - Adopt a Shelter Dog!Would you like to foster a Shelter Survivor?Make A Difference in your Community - Adopt a Shelter Dog!Would you like to foster a Shelter Survivor?For more information, visit us atShelterSurvivors.com***DUE TO THE OVERWHELMING AMOUNT OF INTEREST IN ARCHIE, PLEASE FILL OUT AN APPLICATION. ARCHIE'S FOSTER FAMILY WILL GET BACK TO YOU ONCE YOU HAVE COMPLETED AN APPLICATION. THANK YOU!***This handsome gentleman came to us as a stray from Manhattan.  He is playful, engaging, and affectionate, and will make anyone laugh.We don’t know his history, but Archie seems to not have been socialized.  At home he is loving and affectionate.  He is very focused on people and has a deep desire to please.  He knows several commands, and is housebroken.When he does venture out, Archie is learning what this world is about.  In new situations outside, he is fearful and spunky.  We know what this hidden gem is capable of becoming, so we are looking for a kind heart adopter who can see past his fear.  We strongly recommend a solid behavioral training plan to ensure a thriving and successful bond with his new owner.  We know you won’t regret this time investment in the end.He weighs in at 12lbs, is microchipped, and up to date on all vaccines.  He gets along well with his canine housemates.  Cats  are unknown.   He is about a year old.If you are interested, we ask that you fill out an application.Check the events page on our website for more information and directions to meet our dogs.  To adopt Archie, fill out our online dog application , or download our Microsoft Word dog application and return it tosheltersurvivors@live.com It will help expedite the process. Adoption fee- $250.00

This beautiful 8 month old baby is Sonny.  He is a 40lbs Pit Bull and when full grown will probably be around 50lbs.  Sonny was surrendered to us after being bought from a backyard breeder in Brooklyn.  As he got older and more energetic, it became increasingly difficult to exercise him.  Since being in our care he is thriving in his foster home where he is learning basic manners and getting much needed exercise.  Sonny loves every dog he has met, big and small and would do great in a home with another energetic dog.  Sonny loves children but because of his energy level we would prefer that he goes into a home with kids over 10 years old.  Sonny loves long walks and chasing balls.  Sonny is crate trained and almost potty trained.  He will definitely benefit from puppy training classes so he can learn how to be the perfect dog.  His favorite toy is a kong full of peanut butter which he prefers after a long walk.If you are interested in Sonny, please go to bfdaaa.com to complete an application.

Digby is looking for a new home because his mom has severe allergies. He currently lives with his mom & dad as well as 3 children (14, 2 and 5 months) and a 14-year-old \"sibling\" named Pickle. As you can see in his photos, Digby \"digs\" children, even the littlest ones!From his Mom:Although he is 6 years old, Digby is still very much a young boy who has a lot of love and spunk left in him. He is a wonderful family dog and loves children, snacks, pets, and snuggles. He loves to eat and is very responsive to food as a reward for training. He does know several, tricks too!!Sadly, like many other Pit Bulls, Digby does come with some emotional baggage. Since he was a rescue he has fear aggression issues only towards other dogs – never humans EVER - so he definitely would do great in a one-dog house unless someone has the patience to slowly introduce him into a home with another dog. We did it for 4 days at my in-law's house in Boston and by day 4 Digby was off leash and everyone was playing happily and he's lived peacefully with our Pickle dog since we got him.Digby really is a wonderful family dog & we are hoping someone will give him a chance in a new family home. Digby is NOT with 11th Hour Rescue but we are helping his family with the rehoming process. If you would like to meet Digby or to get more info on him, please emailpalmares215@gmail.com or call Jennifer at 973 610 1201. Digby and his family are currently located in New York City.

Roo is a 3 year old Pit Bull mix, full of energy and love. She’s curious about everything and loves attention. She is very playful with her sister and absolutely loves giving kisses to any person or dog who wants them. I always joke around saying her ball is her pacifier because she has it with her the majority of the day and can be found sleeping with one in her mouth.Roo is always looking for love by strangers and dogs when we are walking around the city. Although she loves interacting with dogs outside of the dog park she has no interest in playing with them at the park because of her ball obsession. She also loves sleeping on the bed and loves to cuddle! She loves to curl up and be held at night and is a big fan of covers but she’s also okay if you leave her on the couch.Roo has lived with a small Chihuahua as I fostered one for a month and Roo seems to know her size with other dogs. She really wants to interact with cats as well when we pass them in the bodegas in NYC. She even knows which bodegas have them and stops and wags her tail watching and hoping they will one day come say hi. She’s good with every person she’s met and loves kids as well but does try to jump and give kisses when she’s overly excited.Roo is NOT with 11th Hour Rescue but we are helping her owner with the rehoming process. If you'd like to meet Roo, please contact Lauren by email at lauren.wise@compass.com or by phone at 917-699-2380 - Roo is currently located in New York City.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.My name is Kaya, I am approximately four years old I came to the rescue because my daddy passed away and someone was very nice and drove me here from Buffalo New York I am now trying to find myself a new home I am up to date on my vaccines I am on heartworm preventative I am crate trained and a super sweet girl I get along very well with other dogs I was very overweight when I came to the rescue and they put me on a diet and I am losing weight and I'm starting to get my shape back I love to go for long walks and that helps me to get my girlish figure back I like to go bye-bye and I love to meet new people I get along great with kids if I could just find my new forever home if you are interested in me please fill out an application my adoption fee is $150**To complete an application please go to http://www.arrfnc.com/info/adoptionFor more information and to submit an application, got to www.arrfnc.com. Thanks!

Thank you for your interest in dog who needs a new home. Adoption can be one of the most fulfilling experiences in your life and especially in the life of your new canine companion.A note to those looking at CPR. We have no perfect dogs - but many of our dogs have proven to be perfect for a certain someone. Our job is to find those someone's. Our most successful adopters come to CPR not because they want a dog. They come to us because they want to give a dog a home. We urge all of our potential adopters not to fall in love with a picture. While we like to know what you like in looks, a dog is more than a pretty face. Our goal is to match you with the best possible pet for you and your home. We want to create furever families.Our descriptions contain all that we know about this dog today. We'll update as more information is known.Are you looking to adopt within the next 30 days? If so please visit our webpage at www.carolinapoodlerescue.org and complete the application. You'll find it in the menu on the left hand side. You'll also find a total listing of all our dogs available.Just browsing but interested in poodles and poodle mixes? Please drop a note to applications@carolinapoodlerescue.org with your name, address and phone # and email. We'll add you to our mailing list.thanksthe CPR Adoption teamDate into Rescue: 06/03/2018Reason for being in rescue: Toby and his brother Caesar were pulled from a shelter in NY. This was their third time to the shelter when their owner was unable to care for them.Foster location: Dreamweaver Farms, Pacolet SCSpecial Needs? Yes, I need to go to a home with Ceasar.Weight: 19 lbsHeight: 11 inSpayed/Neutered: YesAdoption Fee: $200 for Toby and Ceasar together! We're a team!Fence needed? NoWhat kind of home would be best for me? Toby is an experienced boy who needs an experienced owner. He is generally well mannered, but can be headstrong. Toby needs an owner who will show him consistency and love and teach him some basic manners.What is my personality like? 3/29/19...update, we have a volunteer working at the farm this week and she took one look at Toby and said he is not a yorkshire terrier. He's a silky terrier. So we're changing his description and after reading the breed description, I agree with her. Toby, like most Yorkies, is full of confidence and spunk! He struts wherever he goes without a care in the world. Toby loves to play with toys but he can be a little stingy with them. He is fine with most dogs, but does not get along with other male dogs that are strong willed like him. His favorite things consist of going for walks, riding in a car, eating every treat he can and being loved on by humans! Toby is an awesome bed fellow who enjoys happily snuggling under the covers all night. He does need to learn basic commands and correcting his leash pulling. Toby can be a little temperamental and likes things on his terms. He has been known to growl and show his teeth if you try to make him do something he doesn't want to do. He needs a confident owner that will help redirect Toby and teach him appropriate manners for handling situations he may not like. With a confident owner who knows their way around dogs, he's a perfect angel. Toby and Ceasar are the perfect pair, you can have the best of both worlds!How do I act when I first meet new people? Friendly, does not meet a stranger.Other tips and tidbits: Estimated Birthdate: 2/2/2009. Toby is a loving boy but he's a terrier. He can be stubborn. No cats please. The pair gets along well with some cats and not with others.House trained? Dogs can be house trained if they are in the right environment and are allowed to follow a schedule as long as a physical reason doesn't keep them from being trained. A dog house trained in my home may not be in yours. We will help you teach your new dog this necessary skill and based on your schedule.Please note - we do not ship dogs. If you are interested in adopting, please take a look at the distance between the foster home location and your location and make sure you are willing to make that trip. Most of our dogs are at our farm in Pacolet, South Carolina.To apply, please visit our webpage at www.carolinapoodlerescue.org and visit the tab on the left that directions you to the online application.Please note that when screening applications, we look at the entire home and then make suggestions based on what would be a good fit for your home. You are not being screened for a specific dog although we are looking to see what type of dog interests you - poodles or non poodles, color, age, etc. Others here may be a better fit for you. It is very difficult to get to know a living animal from a picture and a short description. Since we are constantly getting in new dogs, this may be a dog not in our listings yet. We want you to be very happy with your new companion and will make suggestions based on what you tell us about you.Thank you for considering CPR.

It was their third visit to the shelter due to issues their owner was facing.Foster location: Dreamweaver Farms, Pacolet SCSpecial Needs? Yes, I need to go to a home with Toby!Weight: 50 lbsHeight: 24 inSpayed/Neutered: YesAdoption Fee: $200 for Toby and Ceasar together! We're a team!Fence needed? NoWhat kind of home would be best for me? Cesar is a pretty easy going boy. He attaches quickly and then wants to be near you always. Owner experience level needed: 6 - More than 10 years as a dog owner. Has worked with at least one behavior issues that did not require professional intervention. OR has worked with one serious medical issue that required professional care (diabetes, epilepsy, Cushing's, Addison's, etc) Toby can be stubborn. Cesar does not share food. It is not hard to work with at all and he will happily eat in the same room with Toby as long as they are separated by a good 10 feet.What is my personality like? Caesar is a big, goofy boy. He has long legs, even for a standard poodle, and his lanky - almost goofy - trot is reflective of his personality. Caesar has clearly been a beloved pet. He walks very well on a leash, seeks the attention of people, and is generally mild mannered. He picks his person and bonds to them very quickly. Caesar has been raised in a home with another dog, but is most interested in his person. He happily sleeps in the bed at night and loves nothing more than to snuggle when you sit down. Caesar has a lot of life and love left to give some family. If you are looking for a loyal companion that will give you his entire heart, this boy is for you! Ceasar and Toby are the perfect pair, you can have the best of both worlds!How do I act when I first meet new people? Friendly but reservedOther tips and tidbits: Estimated Birthdate: 2/2/2009. Cesar had elevated liver values when he visited the vet back in May. We're not sure if this is just him or indicative of problems to come. He is a senior. He's living in the moment.House trained? Dogs can be house trained if they are in the right environment and are allowed to follow a schedule as long as a physical reason doesn't keep them from being trained. It is very difficult to get to know a living animal from a picture and a short description. Since we are constantly getting in new dogs, this may be a dog not in our listings yet. We want you to be very happy with your new companion and will make suggestions based on what you tell us about you.Thank you for considering CPR.

Minnie is a goofy girl who has frequent personality changes! One day, she is sedate and even aloof to volunteers that visit, and other times she will playfully run in circles with her butt low to the ground. She really enjoys golf cart rides and loves to walk on a leash. She has been known to curl up in her oversized food bowl to take a nap. Minnie came to us from a New York rescue that usually only houses small dogs. They told us she had been adopted and lived in a home for 3-4 years, but was becoming aggressive towards smaller dogs when out on walks. She does guard resources from other dogs, so she would be best as an only dog. She has a thin mystery scar that runs across her chest and under her front leg. Our best guess is she was entangled in a thin wire that cut into her. She had entropion surgery on both eyes to correct the lids which were turning inward and causing irritation.

This is a courtesy post to help find Chloe a home. She is located in Huntington NY. Please share.She is up to date on all shots. Tested negative for heartworm. On Heartguard (heart worm preventative) and Bravecto (flea/tick preventative). Spayed. 85 pounds. Good with children and other dogs. Not good with cats.\"Chloe is one of the sweetest, friendliest dogs you will ever meet! She adores making new friends, and loves everyone and every dog she meets. She is 2 years old, house-trained, wonderful with children, walks beautifully on a leash, and knows a lot of commands... sit, down (lay down), touch (touches hand), let's go (heel), roll over, couch (lay on couch), go to bed (lay on bed), leave it, and more thanks to extensive obedience training. She would love a fenced yard and owners who are home a lot. She would be hitting the jackpot if she got a doggy brother or sister of her own, too! She plans to bring her own toys and bed to her new home! Her family's recent move has them commuting much further to work, they have a new human baby soaking up most of their free time at home, and their new home doesn't have a fenced yard. Chloe is living for the weekends and is lonely during the week as she is alone from 8am-7pm with a short midday walk courtesy of a dog walker. Chloe has some separation anxiety which is managed with meds, behavior modification when needed, and calm departures during which she is given a food treat. Chloe's vet is optimistic that in a home where she gets more attention and exercise the meds could be reduced or discontinued. Meet & greets available by appointment in Huntington, NY.\"The contact information if interested in Chloe is meetchloe.ny@gmail.com and the google voice phone number is: 631-403-7774.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Petal came to rescue from the Carolinas extremely emaciated at only 30 pounds, with ticks and fleas, and a couple of masses. She has been with our Carolina veterinary partner receiving treatment and is ready to journey north. Petal is about 9 years old and currently about 40 - 45 pounds. She is up to date on vaccines and is good with people and other dogs. If you would like to adopt this senior beauty, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Colton comes to rescue from a Carolina shelter at 5 years old. He is incredibly emaciated, weighing in at only 26 pounds! Colton also suffers with blisters and sores on the pads of his feet from possible urine scalding. Colton is currently with our veterinary partner in the south receiving a full assessment and treatment. He will be up to date on vaccines and neutered when medically appropriate to do so. Colton has been fine with people at the vet, and seems to be fine with other dogs. We would love to have an awesome adopter waiting for him when he is ready to come north! One who would give him lots of love and attention, and help him continue to heal from the extreme neglect he has suffered. Colton is absolutely darling, and deserves the best! If you would like to foster or adopt Colton when he is ready to come north, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

*Will be available 6-15-19*Please put your application in today! *Read ALL the information below, it will help you with the process!*If you see this listing, the puppy is still available. Please limit emails asking this.Meet George! This litter is from North Carolina where they were surrendered. They are in Connecticut foster homes, looking for their forever homes, and are the sweetest social babies. We are guessing they are chihuahua/terrier with possibly some beagle tossed in. They will be under 25lbs when full grown and are all 4-7lbs currently.Georgie-porgie. We love this little squirt! George loves to be with his people. He will make a wonderful companion dog for a family!!  He is in a foster home with other dogs and does great. All of our puppies are crate trained and learning basic puppy manners!When he is available he will be 9-10 weeks old, up to date on vaccines, dewormed, flea treated, examined and give a health certificate before traveling and then examined again by our CT veterinarian to ensure his health.  Adoption fee is $400.00  which includes all of the above, his transport, and a puppy pack including his medical records, copy of the adoption contract (which we would need you to sign for our records, as well) and a digital emailed copy of various puppy information (housetraining tips, vaccine information, socialization tips, pet insurance etc). We will have information on the food that he has been eating and that we highly recommend. The supportive store where we hold our meetings carries the food so you can purchase a bag if you wish! Since he is not neutered yet, this is the new owner's responsibility once he reaches 6 to 9 months of age. The benefit of our organization is that you get to meet the puppy before you commit to adopting! We want perfect matches and happy families! For more information on our process and to answer some commonly asked questions please visit our Frequently Asked Questions page: http://bnkrescue.com/faq.htmlWebsite: www.bnkrescue.comEmail: bootnkit@gmail.comThank you for choosing to rescue and save a life!For more pictures and update, please visit our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/bootnkit

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Calamity Jane (CJ) is a young lab mix puppy born in April 2019. She is one of the smallest of her siblings who came into rescue from North Carolina after their mom was hit by a car. CJ got sick a few days after arriving at her foster but she quickly bounced back and is easily the funniest pup of the bunch. She absolutely loves her people. She will postpone food, for a short window, to get that last ear scratch. Then she will barrel past her 5 siblings, knocking them over, to get to her food. She doesn't take any flack from them and will let them, and everyone else within 100ft, know that she isn't afraid. She is feisty, sweet, beautiful and an old soul dog who just wants love. Lots of it! She is up to date on vaccines (age appropriate) and will be spayed prior to placement in her forever home. Calamity Jane is great with people of all ages and with other dogs.
