Meet the gorgeous guy named Grand !  This super sweet and incredibly handsome boy  is looking for a forever family. He was rescued from a very crowded kill shelter in NC. Grand is currently located at our adoption center in Brewster NY and is awaiting a family to pick him !!! His foster family down south said that Grand is a sweetie pie and He loves people!!!  Grand loves getting  butt rubs lol and he is crate trained and is also house trained. He can be a little nervous when left alone and needs some leash manners, so a kind family who is willing to have some patience with grand learning the ropes would be ideal. He would also do best in a home with another dog.  Grand is fully vetted and is ready for foster or adoption ! His fee is $375 and applications can Be found at www.snarrnortheast.org

Meet Mike!! Look at those gorgeous eyes. This super sweet and incredibly handsome guy is looking for a forever family. He’s a really awesome dog overall- very friendly with people and other dogs. He love to wrestle and play with other pups when given the chance but is not overly hyper at all. Mike has gorgeous coloring and his coat almost looks ombré. Mike is definitely a big mutt but when we look at him we see rottie and pittie mix. Who knows what he truly is, but we are SURE he is wonderful. Mike was rescued from a very crowded kill shelter in NC. Mike is currently located at our adoption center in Brewster NY and is awaiting a family to pick him !!! His foster family down south said that Mike was a very good boy while he was staying with them .  He got along  well with their other dogs and was nothing but friendly.   He has beautiful eyes and his foster Mom loved the way he would hold his head perfectly still while watching with his eyes straight ahead.  They believe he must have come from a family or person who loved him because of his good behavior and preference for the good food and treats.  Mike is a Great boy and Will make a wonderful pet. Mike  is fully vetted and is ready for foster or adoption ! His fee is $375 and applications can Be found at www.snarrnortheast.org

Meet Tyson ! This super sweet and incredibly handsome guy is looking for a forever family. He was rescued from a very crowded kill shelter in NC. Tyson is currently located at our adoption center in Brewster NY and is awaiting a family to pick him !!! His foster family down south said that Tyson is super sweet and friendly!! He Loves attention, wants to play and would lick you all day if you let him.  Tyson Plays great with other dogs but isn’t a fan of cats so he will need a home without feline companions. Tyson is a Great boy and Will make a wonderful pet. Tyson is fully vetted and is ready for foster or adoption ! His fee is $375 and applications can Be found at www.snarrnortheast.org

Bailey is a 10-12 month old American Foxhound from out North Carolina shelter partner.Bailey's Foster Mom says the following about him \"Bailey is a young, large American Foxhound- and he really ain’t nothin’ but a hound dog! Always on the scent with boundless energy, he loves to roam and go wherever his nose leads him. When he’s at home he loves to be cozy and have a bone to chew on, and lots of play, too! Very energetic, affectionate, and social, Bailey is looking for a home where his experienced owner will provide training, structure, and a strong foundation for him to grow. He is already taking well to training and has learned to sit in just two days! He will likely do well in a home with other dogs to socialize with, as Foxhounds are a pack breed. Very gentle and sweet with other dogs, he would likely be great with children as well. Bailey is a big ball of love and will bring so much joy to his forever home!\"He's fully vaccinated, and will be microchipped/neutered by us shortly.  He can be adopted out before this time as long as the appointment is kept. If you are interested in adopting, PLEASE READ BELOW. Do not email through Petfinder because we won't be able to answer. Please email the email address below AFTER applying.If a dog is listed here on Petfinder, they are still available. Please don't email just to ask if they're available - they are! We get so many emails a day, we may not be able to respond and you could end up missing out on a dog. ALL POSTED DOGS ARE AVAILABLE!!! Also, none of our dogs have health or behavioral problems that we don't list on here. If its not in the profile, it doesn't exist!You may read our adoption policies and procedures on www.truenorthrescue.org. Please fill out a COMPLETE application if you would like to meet him - meet and greets are only scheduled with approved applicants and foster families. All our dogs are in private foster homes. Applications are processed in the order that they are received. You can email Jillian truenorthrescue@gmail.com for more information.Think you could be his family? Apply on www.truenorthrescue.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Ginny comes to rescue from the Carolinas as a senior 8 year old precious girl who weighs 30 pounds. Ginny is a darling, sweet with people and good with other dogs. She is up to date on vaccines and will be spayed prior to placement in her forever home. Ginny was limping from a broken front leg that has set and healed, and suffering from poor nutrition when brought to rescue, but she has been gaining weight and with more exercise and muscle mass her leg is doing wonderfully! She has barely any limp at all and it is expected that this will continue to improve. She does have somewhat of a sensitive tummy, so you may have to try a couple of different foods or bland diet before you find the one that works. Ginny is truly a fabulous girl who walks well on leash and just loves it when she goes for walks. If you would like to adopt Ginny, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

Blaze and Sadie came from North Carolina.  They are sweet aussie mix sisters that are in search of loving homes.  They are shy at first but warm up quickly when they feel secure.  With a bit of time and guidance they will gain the confidence they need to become amazing family companions.  Basic obedience training is a good way to build that trusting relationship.  They love to play and snuggle up.  A fenced in yard is a must for these busy girls.If you are interested in adopting a dog, please submit an application on our website:  thesimonfoundation.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Newt comes to rescue from the Carolinas. He is a 3 year old, 10 pound Chihuahua blend male with allergies. Newt is up to date on vaccines and will be neutered prior to placement in his forever home. He is good with people and other dogs. If you would like to make Newt a permanent member of your family with an adoption, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

Kiara is one of six puppies (all named after Lion Guard characters because that's what happens when the seven year old picks!) removed from a rural property in NC.  They were kept in cages and only Fed and watered once daily until animal control was alerted.  They are all gorgeous catahoula pups, and very sweet but will need continued socialization as they haven't been able to see much of the world!Kiara ruled the litter like the princess that she's named after.  She is gorgeous (so hard to capture in pics!) and has a darling half tail.  She is good with horses and cats, and very sweet with people!  Kiara is a little nervous around kids, as the kids that lived next door would come and jump on their kennels, but is warming up to the one year old and seven year old in her foster home.The pups love to give kisses, gallop around the yard, and wrestle with their foster siblings.  Please email barkingbackrescue@gmail.com for an app.

Fuli is one of six 6-8 month old puppies (all named after Lion Guard characters because that's what happens when the seven year old picks!) removed from a rural property in NC.  They were kept in cages and only Fed and watered once daily until animal control was alerted.  They are all gorgeous catahoula pups, and very sweet but will need continued socialization as they haven't been able to see much of the world!Fuli is as fast and lithe as the cheetah that she is named after.  She's almost cat like in her ability to climb!  She's the smallest of the litter, but not meek!  Her foster mom has dubbed her \"the barn manager\" as she loves doing chores and making sure everything is running smoothly.  Fuli is very sweet as well as smart, she watches and learns very quickly.  Fuli is very nervous around kids, as the ex-neighbor's kids apparently used to jump on their crates.  At this time, we would not recommend her for homes with young children, as their quick movements still make her nervous and barky.The pups love to give kisses, gallop around the yard, and wrestle with their foster siblings.  Please email barkingbackrescue@gmail.com for an app.

Bunga is one of six 6-8 month old puppies (all named after Lion Guard characters because that's what happens when the seven year old picks!) removed from a rural property in NC.  They were kept in cages and only Fed and watered once daily until animal control was alerted.  They are all gorgeous catahoula pups, and very sweet but will need continued socialization as they haven't been able to see much of the world!Bunga is the sweet and sensitive guy, and often gets picked on by his bigger brothers.  He loves to sit with his foster mom and rest his head on her shoulder.  Bunga is doing great in a foster home with other dogs of all shapes and sizes.  He is still nervous around kids, as the ex-neighbor's kids used to jump on their kennels.  We wouldn't recommend Bunga for homes with small children.The pups love to give kisses, gallop around the yard, and wrestle with their foster siblings.  Please email barkingbackrescue@gmail.com for an app.

Harvey is a tri-colored male beagle who was recently rescued from a high kill shelter in North Carolina. He was picked up as a stray and dropped off at the shelterby Animal Control. We estimate that Harvey is approx 8 years old. He has a grade three heart murmur and will need to be on medication for the rest of his life. Harvey is neutered, housebroken, up to date on vaccinations and medium in size. He will make a great addition to any family! Please come and meet Harvey and make his dreams come true!  Come visit me!Pet Supplies Plus391 Broadway Hillsdale New Jersey.Saturday and Sunday 2 p.m.-6 p.m.PLEASE NOTE THE FOLLOWING:*We encourage you to stop by for a meet & greet with all of your family members and any other dogs you may have.*We  DO NOT do same day adoptions. *If you complete an application online, please print a hard copy of it and bring it to the store with you.

Bobi came to us as an owner surrender with his brother Coyote. These brothers were purchased as puppies from a flea market in North Carolina. They were kept outside most of their lives, are very sweet, know some commands and are eager to please. Bobi likes other dogs and would do great with another sibling. Bobi deserves a loving home of his own, please don't make him wait another second. If you are interested in learning more: Please call the shelter at 516-785-5220, visit us at: 3320 Beltagh Avenue, Wantagh NY 11793 or email us at: adoption@tohmail.org

They thought he was safe, but the rescue did not come through and his time was up.  This worthy black shepherd mix is thought to be 2-3 years old and weighs around 49lbs.  Bono came to a kill shelter as a stray and was heart worm positive.  He has been treated and is ready for his home now.  We all love him!  His pictures don't do him justice, he is a gorgeous!!   He walks great on leash.  Very nice personality - calm and well mannered.  Here are some videos:    Loving being outside!   https://youtu.be/L-AlgRygO9Y    This was after being brought outside to potty - he was so happy.  Here is are some videos of Bono with our test dog Nora inside and outside.    https://youtu.be/okDjTV5BOFA        https://youtu.be/-Z0saFd7-ZgIf you're interested in adopting Bono, he would be transported to an approved adopter.   At this time he is located in NC while waiting for his family.  Our online application is located at:http://www.diamonddogsrescueinc.com/online-adoption-application.html(does not work with a mobile device)

8 April 2019:Mona has made her debut in NYC from NC! We are currently looking for a foster or an adopter for this wonderful beautiful girl. She's the full package of perfection. She is a great dog- good with others, sweet and exuberant. She is 2-3 years of age. Fully vetted and full of love. All she needs is a home! Did I mention she's sweet and beautiful?! Look at that smile!Please note: While some of our dogs have lived in a home environment, we cannot guarantee that they are housetrained.Interested in fostering or adopting? Need more info on this dog? Want to set up a meet and greet? The first step in the process is filling out an application on our website. Adoption application: www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/general-application/ Foster application:https://www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/dog-foster-application/ Adoption process & fees:www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/process/ Upcoming events:www.facebook.com/pg/SecondChanceRescueNycDogs/events States we adopt to:NY, NJ, CT, DE, PA, MD, NH, ME, VT, RI, MA

Meet Jewel! This beautiful pup had a rough start to life. We brought her to SASF from a high-kill shelter in North Carolina. She had been found extremely neglected and malnourished. She is now gaining weight and ready to start the next chapter of life. Shortly after Jewel arrived at SASF, we realized that she is deaf, but that doesn't stop her from being friendly and energetic. This pretty pup loves to run around and would love to live in an active household. She would love a fenced in yard or a promise of many adventurous walks and hikes. Jewel would do best with kids 12, but would prefer to be the only dog in the home. She needs a family who is committed to teaching her basic obedience and showing her wat a loving forever family looks like. If you're looking for an adorable, energetic pup, stop by to meet Jewel today!

Koko was allowed to become pregnant!  She is thought to be around 7-8 years old . Spaying her would have prevented that or, at the very least, keeping her safe during heat!Koko was a burden to this family.  They actually told the shelter that it was a lot of work to come home daily and have to take her food and water out to where she was tied....24/7.  And so, Koko was taken to a kill shelter in an open wired crate in the bed of a pick up truck in a downpour....so she was soaking wet when brought to the shelter.UNWANTED, VERY pregnant.  NEVER WANTED.  NEVER LOVED.The end of December we rescued her and on January 1st she gave birth to nine puppies. One puppy did not make it, All her puppies have been adopted and now it's her turn......BUT NOBODY WANTS HER and our hearts are broken for her!  She is THE SWEETEST MOST LOVING DOG WE HAVE RESCUED!  She thrives on attention, craves her humans love,  wants to please, seeks your approval, is smart, loving, kind, gentle  and truly a soulful grateful dog!She is fully vetted, spayed, current on all vaccines, microchipped and on heart worm and flea preventative.   There is also a written trainer evaluation A Facebook page is being created and you will find her trainer evaluation and if you'd like it emailed to you, just reach out to TKDiamond@aol.comCurrently Koko is located in North Carolina and our rescue will cover transporting her to an approved adopter as part of her adoption fee.   That fee is offered at a senior dog discount. We LOVE her and pray that someone will see the beauty of this easy going dog and make the latter part of her life more fulfilling that it's been so far...she would love to be a lap dog and at our vets office was happy to help at the front desk.

Lola is asweet dog from North Carolina. She came to us very pregnant, and had her 9 puppies a week later. She was a fantastic mom and now it is time for her to find her forever home. Lola is thought to be about 5 yrs old. She is shy at first, but once she decides that you are her person she is super affectionate. Lola is about 30 pounds, house broken, and walks well on a leash. She will pull a bit if she sees a squirrel or rabbit. She likes her walks almost as much as she likes a good cuddle. Lola has been good with the other dogs and cats in her foster home.

Mema came from North Carolina very pregnant.  She had nine beautiful puppies and was a great mom.  All the pups were adopted, and Mema began some much needed recovery time. She has gained weight and is now ready to find her forever family.  Mema is a shy young girl that needs loving patient handling.  A quiet home will provide security and confidence that she needs to flourish.If you are interested in adopting a dog, please submit an application on our website:  thesimonfoundation.org

The Simon Foundation rescued Pete from a death sentence when he was found as a stray with heartworm in North Carolina.  In spite of his physical condition, Pete was a sweet gentle giant that only wanted to be loved.  Pete has come through the difficult treatment to rid his body of heartworm.  He now has a chance to find a special family that is looking to share their home and life with this wonderful dog.  Pete is extra large, and will need a yard to romp in, daily exercise and plenty of attention.  Pete would prefer to be a single pet, does not like cats and children 10+ yrs. of age okay.  If you are interested in adopting a dog, please submit an application on our website:  thesimonfoundation.org.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.This beautiful girl is Gabrielle! Gabrielle comes to rescue underweight and with a litter of pups from a Carolina shelter. Beautiful momma Gabrielle is finished nursing her puppies and now that they have all gone to their forever homes she is left waiting and wondering when it will be time for a home of her very own! She is 39 pounds, loves a good long car ride, enjoys hikes, absolutely adores her people, and warms quickly to new folks. She is kissy as can be and sneaks kisses at every chance! She is also a smiler... as soon as she is touched, she 100% smiles... it is darling! Gabrielle is best friends with her male foster dog siblings but has not taken well to other females. She will do great with other dogs in her new home as long as they are males. She takes issue with loud noises, but is better with each experience. For this reason, small children who play with noisy toys would not be ideal for her. She has no separation anxiety issues and doesn’t bark unless there is a reason. Gabrielle is Loyal, Protective and as Loving as they come. She will quickly become your new favorite cuddle partner and love of your life! She has been waiting so patiently for her special someone to come along...could it be you?! She is up to date on shots and will be spayed prior to placement in her forever home. If you would like to be the lucky one that gets to give Gabrielle her happy ever after, please put your adoption application in here: http;//www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Looking for a sweet new addition to your home? Along came Polly! This beautiful two year old retriever mix is searching for a foster or forever home after being rescued from some troubling circumstances in the Carolinas. Polly has not wasted any time since and has been attending doggie school to perfect her already gentle demeanor. She is slowly learning the ins and outs of living in a home and has mastered basic commands, walks, and cuddling. She is not a city girl and would prefer to relax in a calmer environment where she can relax and enjoy her family quiet time at the end of the day. She is up to date on her shots and has been spayed. If you would like to adopt Polly, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org.

Reggi is a cute little hound mix pup that came from North Carolina.  He has a wonderful temperament.  He is eager to learn and already has a head start onhis basic obedience.  Children 12+ would be ideal, he is dog selective and does not like cats.  Reggi crates easily, He is high energy but will do great with positive reinforcement training.  He will make a wonderful family pet.If you are interested in adopting a puppy, please submit an application on our website:  thesimonfoundation.org

Scout is a male Chesapeake Bay Retriever and Lab mix. He is approx 1 year and 3 months old. Scout was rescued from a high kill shelter in North Carolina. Scout is neutered, up-to-date on vaccinations, housetrained and microchipped. He is large in size and yet very gentle. Scout is good with kids but skittish around new people. Scout walks well on a leash and thinks he’s a lap dog! He loves attention and loves to play with other dogs. Scout is really hoping to find his forever home real soon!! Come visit me!Pet Supplies Plus391 Broadway Hillsdale New Jersey.Saturday and Sunday 2 p.m.-6 p.m.**Scout will be at Pet Supplies Plus starting on Sunday, April 28**PLEASE NOTE THE FOLLOWING:*We encourage you to stop by for a meet & greet with all of your family members and any other dogs you may have.*We  DO NOT do same day adoptions. *If you complete an application online, please print a hard copy of it and bring it to the store with you.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Cloud, born in March 2017, is a Boxer mix who comes into rescue from North Carolina. She is a beautiful little petite pixie at 35 pounds. She found herself at a kill shelter and has obviously suffered a life of neglect until now. Cloud was emaciated and very thin when she came to us. She spent some time with our vet partner where she was able to get all the medical care she needed and she is now doing great! Cloud deserves so much more than the hand she has been dealt and we can’t wait to turn her life around and show her what it’s like to live the good life! Are you the special someone who can pamper this adorable girl for the rest of her days and show her the unconditional love that she has been missing out on for so long? Cloud is doing great in her foster home but can’t wait to have a home of her very own! Her foster family says that she is a sweetheart and a very quick learner. She rides great in the car, is doing awesome with her leash manners, and she loves running next to her foster dad on bike rides! She is extremely social and lovable with all people and very affectionate! High energy, this girl requires daily exercise and stimulation. She is very smart and eager to please. Cloud would really like to be your one and only...she wants a person to love and call her own! She will do best as the only pet in a home but could possibly do well with a large well mannered male (a meet and greet would be highly recommended). She isn’t the biggest fan of cats (who can blame her?!) so she will need to find a forever home with no feline friends around. Fenced in yard is a must for this playful and outgoing girl. Completely house trained and crate trained. She is wonderful and content in her crate for quiet time, is putting on some much needed weight, and steals the hearts of everyone she meets! She is just a total love bug! She will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in her forever home. If you would like to be the lucky one that gets to give Cloud her happy ever after, please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application

Say hello to Molly! Molly is very sweet! She is about 7 years old and 50 pounds. She is kid approved and is just a couch potato! She loves to give kisses and is a cuddle bug. Molly is house broken and will make a great addition to any family! Molly was saved from a high-kill shelter in NC and has since been fully vetted. Sadly, Molly has been in boarding for over a year. This poor girl deserves a home of her own. We just don't understand why no one has come for her. If you would like to adopt this sweet girl, please fill out an application on our website:www.NewEnglandHumaneSociety.com                 Adoption fee: $500.00

Annie came from a high-kill shelter in NC, where she was brought in as a stray. I have no idea why she was dumped, as she is well-behaved and very well trained. She has no issues with people, dogs or cats. She's about 2 years old, and weighs 85 lbs. While she's a big girl, she doesn't need much exercise, except for maybe one long walk a day. She's completely housebroken, sits, walks right at your side, and doesn't pull on leash. She is phenomenal with young children, and happy to meet people and new dog friends. She is a dream dog! If you are interested in Annie, please call Sindee. 914-299-3700.

Meet Parker!Parker came to us from North Carolina during the summer and we were so excited to find this awesome dog a his forever home. We quickly noticed how much fun he was and loved getting him together with a few other dogs and watch Parker run circles around them. He loves to play fetch and like a true cattle dog can easily keep up on a really nice hike or run!We quickly adopted him out to a fantastic family that opened up their home and hearts to this beautiful boy. Once he was settled in they noticed some behaviors they needed help with so we quickly stepped in to help train Parker. After a few months of training we had to come to the tough decision that Parker was just not the right fit for this great family. While he was great with them for most of their time together, Parker is socially dominant. We believe he would be a great dog for a family without young children and who are open to learning the training we offer to make sure Parker can live the happiest life possible.Parker is house broken, crate trained, and very dog friendly. We have prepared Parker with the training needed and now we are looking for a family to take the tools we offer to continue his journey into becoming a great doggie citizen!For more information visit our website at adoptadog.org or to submit an application please visit: goo.gl/VEjhLX

Cain is 9-10 years old. He is a rescue from NC.  He is not very fond currently with men as their owner killed their mother. Would not do well in a home with large dogs or kids. Please consider fostering or adopting.  Email haar13@aol.com for an application. The application can also be found at http://fs30.formsite.com/HAARescue/AdoptionApplication/index.html

We rescued Lil' Dill from a high kill shelter in NC.  He was owner surrendered after 10 years of living outside on a chain :( .  He is a super sweet little guy who has embraced living indoors.  He loves to snuggle and sleep in bed next to his foster mom and dad.  He's making up for 10 yrs of love and snuggles.  Lil' Dill hasn't had any toys growing up and he absolutely LOVES toys and gets protective of them.  For this reason we would like to place him in an all adult home or a home with older teens who understand not to take his toys from him.  Dill gets along well with other dogs.  He's fostered with two pitbulls and does just fine.  Dill is a spry little guy for his age, he loves to play with toys...he grabs them from the toy basket and hides them under the bed, it's super cute.  This little senior boy needs a loving home to make up for all the love he's missed.  He has the biggest heart.Please email Breshkie@dogworldrescue.com if you are interested in Dill.We have videos and more pictures of Dill on our fb page.  He's ~21 lbs.  https://www.facebook.com/Dog-World-Rescue-129693787057373/

Eddie is a very handsome male Black Lab/German Shepherd mix. Initially shy, he warms right up with friendly calm interactions... and treats!!  He is approximately 2 years old and 55 lbs.  Pulled from an overcrowded underfunded shelter in NC, Eddie is hoping to find a home with a nice soft bed, and someone to count on.  Rescue dogs are the most gentle and loyal because they are so grateful!!Please visit our webpage: http://www.masrescue.org/DogApplication.pdf to complete the adoption application online or go to http://www.masrescue.org/pnp.html for more details on adoption through MAS Rescue. Adoption fee is $300.00. We understand the desire to meet our \"cuties\" as soon as possible. But because we operate entirely out of foster homes, we need to limit visitation to approved applicants only. Once your application is completed by you and approved by MASR, we will be glad to schedule your visit. We do NOT guarantee “housebroken.”  If the animal is listed as housebroken it is because he/she has not had accidents for a period of time moving forward in the foster home.  Some animals may regress during the transition to a new home which is why we do not provide a guarantee.  Patience and consistency is always key. Please Note: 100% of all the adoption fees collected are used to care for the animals, and pay our ever increasing vet bill. This dog has been examined by our vet, spayed or neutered (if not previously done), vaccinations updated, heartworm negative, and has been microchipped. We appreciate your interest in adopting from a rescue organization.ATTENTION:  Beginning June 30th, 2017, MAS Rescue will charge a $10 non refundable administrative application processing fee.  100% of this fee will be for our rescued animals in need.  To be clear:  1.  No dog application will be processed until the $10 fee is paid via PayPal link on our website: http://www.masrescue.org/helpus.html.2.  The $10 is non refundable.  Should you be approved and adopt an animal through MAS Rescue, you will receive a $10 credit to your adoption fee.3.  Paying the application fee is in no way a guarantee that you will be approved to adopt an animal through MAS Rescue.  All of the same standards in processing applications still apply.  See our policies and procedures: http://www.masrescue.org/pnp.html4.  By submitting an application and paying the $10 application fee, you agree to the terms listed above.  If you do not adopt through MAS Rescue or your application is rejected, this serves as your notice of the application fee policy.Breed Selection is 'Best Efforts' given by shelter staff, veterinarians and rescue volunteers. NO guarantees are implied. Please note that small breeds are not well designed for families with young children as everything about them is more delicate and will require careful handling.Remember adoption is a commitment for the lifetime of your new furry friend; dogs could live 15 years or more!!

ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8146Pearl is a sweet, smart, playful and active puppy who love, love, loves people and other dogs. She is great with kids and loves to give puppy kissses. She loves to be petted, tickled, and held. She loves to have her tummy rubbed too. As of June 22, she can make it through the night then go outside to do her business. She is estimated to be a Plott hound mix puppy. Meet little Pearl up close by clicking here Watch her talk her older friend out of keeping Pearls favorite stick on June 27  hereAmber and her gemstone puppies came from Sampson County, North Carolina. They were flown up to Operation Paws for Homes on April 23rd when the pups were a week old. They have been in a foster home in Falls Church, VA, since then. Watch them June 2nd play soccer with a basketball by clicking here or play tug of war by clicking here. Watch them at 4 weeks playing on May 10th by clicking  here or playing outside on May 19 by clicking here.To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org Operation Paws for Homes, Inc. (OPH) rescues dogs of all breeds and ages from high-kill shelters in NC, VA, MD, and SC, reducing the numbers being euthanized. With limited resources, the shelters are forced to put down 50-90% of the animals that come in the front door. OPH provides pet adoption services to families located in VA, DC, MD, PA and neighboring states. OPH is a 501(c)(3) organization and is 100% donor funded. OPH does not operate a shelter or have a physical location. We rely on foster families who open their homes to give love and attention to each dog before finding a forever home.

6/26/2019Meet The Old Tyme Pups.  These tiny mixed breed pups from North Carolina are total sweethearts who crave attention of people.  They’ve never met a stranger and will beg to be held, cuddled, and kissed. Weighing only about 4-5 lbs, they will most likely be medium sized dogs.  Their mom was a small 40 lb mixed breed who belonged to a soldier who left for deployment to Afghanistan.  Born around the end of April, pups are approximately 8 weeks old.  They are working on crate training, but haven’t been introduced to the leash yet.  To adopt an  Old Tyme pup, visit www.wagsrescue.com and complete an application.  Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!

6/26/2019Meet The Old Tyme Pups.  These tiny mixed breed pups from North Carolina are total sweethearts who crave attention of people.  They’ve never met a stranger and will beg to be held, cuddled, and kissed. Weighing only about 4-5 lbs, they will most likely be medium sized dogs.  Their mom was a small 40 lb mixed breed who belonged to a soldier who left for deployment to Afghanistan.  Born around the end of April, pups are approximately 8 weeks old.  They are working on crate training, but haven’t been introduced to the leash yet.  To adopt an  Old Tyme pup, visit www.wagsrescue.com and complete an application.  Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!

Hi there!  My name is Aramis and I am an 8 ½ month old beagle-mix that just arrived in Rescue with my 2 sisters, Jaci and Phoebe.  We were rescued from a Field Trial Breeder in the Carolinas… when he didn’t want us anymore, Penny Angels agreed to help us find our new homes.  We went to a foster home for a week and then were spayed and vaccinated before traveling to New Jersey.  We used to live outside in a rabbit hutch, but once we went to our foster home, we found out what we had been missing!  Simple daily comforts are new to us.  We are even learning how to play with toys and chew on Nylabones.  We will need to be taught some basic training, though, and would do well with the help of patient owners.  We will be using a doggie door to go potty outside in Rescue, so I guess we will just follow the ‘pack’ and learn from them.  We were told that we will have to learn new rules in your home.  We have been around children (in our previous home) and have had positive interactions with them.  Okay- here are some more things for you to know about me:  I am a cute red and white beagle-mix with a cool ‘heart’ shape on my head.  I was born on October 3, 2018 and currently weigh 30 lbs.  I share the same father with my siblings but had a different mother.  (Dad must’ve been busy!)  My foster mom thinks that I am mixed with Basset Hound.  I am a little shy but making progress each day, especially when motivated with ‘treats’!  I walk (and sniff) well on a leash.  I get along well with other dogs and enjoy playing with them.  I love running in the backyard with my doggie friends, especially when they agree to chase me!  I have such a playful style when I am outside:  I like to ‘sniff, run, and hop’ when I am with the other dogs.  My ears flop around in the breeze and the smile on my face tells you how happy I am to be outside and playing with my friends!  Would you like to add me to your family?  I will be at Petsmart in Mays Landing, NJ on Saturday from 11-3 pm.  If you are ready to adopt me, please fill out an application and submit it to Penny Angels today.  My adoption fee is $250.  An adoption application can be obtained by visiting the PABR web site at www.pennyangelsbeaglerescue.com. If you have any questions, please contact beagler534@comcast.net or emnase@aol.com, or call Penny Angels Beagle Rescue at 609-965-9476. Thank you!

\"Have you ever seen a dog as adorable as me?! Can you believe I’m homeless and am waiting for a wonderful person or family to adopt me? Great dogs like me end up in animal shelters every day- I know, it’s so hard to believe but it’s true!My name is Cisco and I just arrived to Providence Animal Center from North Carolina. I am all ready to move right into your heart & home today. I am estimated to be around 7 years old and 35 pounds. My bags are packed and I am ready to go, I am spayed, microchipped and up-to-date on vaccines. To learn more about me, stop by the Adoption Center or give the friendly staff a call. XOXO Cisco\"Providence Animal Center relies on adoption fees and donations to save pets! Adoption fees vary per pet. To find out this pet’s adoption fee or for more information, please call the Adoption Center with this pet’s ID number.Can’t adopt? Consider fostering or donating! Visit ProvidenceAC.org for more information on how you can support the lifesaving mission!

RESCUED, from under a bridge in a rural farming community in western NC.HANDSOME purebred Beagles: BRISCOE(adopted), ANDY & BARNEY(adopted) had been seen/heard running in the woods, hunting and baying for well over a month. They had been taking shelter under a bridge and living off scraps the local folks were leaving out for them. Obviously, they had been abandoned/dumped by their past owner in the area. A bit skinny, skittish and tired, but otherwise in pretty good health. So, they must be decent 'pleasure hunters', but not good enough for past owner to want to keep feeding them. They are ALL very sweet and friendly, but hand-shy of humans, so this says a lot about their past owner/life. They want to trust, and are very happy to hang out with their person when they are certain that you/their human are trustworthy and mean them no harm/pain, ALL are outgoing, happy and have a sweet, gentle demeanor, & they LOVE to run & play!!!ANDY: dob 08/22/13-10\" tri-colored(tan and black with white), weighs 16lbsWill make excellent pet for any single person or early retirees, or small families with respectful children and a secured fenced-in backyard. This pup is in and will remain in foster care in Rutherfordton, NC until their fur-ever person(s)/family have been approved. At which time, we require the full adoption fee via paypal.com and will arrange for your new fur-child's transport via Happy Dogs OR Lifesavers Rescued Pet Transport service to points along the eastern seaboard as far as Manchester, NH(they deliver to: VA, DC, MD, DE, NJ=NJTnpk>Vince Lombardi svc plaza, Long Island, RyeNY, JohnstonRI, ManchesterNH and AlbanyNY, as well as AllentownPA and then down the I-81S corridor>WythevilleVA).Transport fees: $125 as far as NYC/Long Island & $140 to all points N of NYC/LI as far as ManchesterNH and AlbanyNY.Adoption fee: $150(includes neuter, micro-chip, Parvo/Distemper/Lepto, 1yr Rabies and Bordatella vax, current on heart worm & flea/tick prevention, parasite-free, all medical paperwork including vet's surgery notes and current health certificate, Martingale collar and 6' leash, beef knee cap, 3lb bag of current dry food(Tractor Supply Store's '4health' salmon & potato, 'RESCUED DOGS ROCK car magnet and 2 'pet alert' wallet cards.To apply to adopt one of these handsome little gentleman, please complete the application provided at: www.howlin4spirit.org/adoption-application/ and send to: howlin4spirit@gmail.com, at your most earliest convenience. Gets along GREAT with other dogs of all sizes, ages and gender and RESPECTFUL children...will test with cats upon request. We will be happy to send more videos/pix of this awesome little man, upon request.

Her NC foster mom would be happy to talk to a potential adopter about one of these awesome pups. Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!

Dill is a 1 1/2yr old black lab mix who was rescued from a shelter in North Carolina. He is neutered and up to date on his vaccines. We think his ideal weight will be 50-55 lbs.  He would make a great family dog. He is a little shy but is coming out of his shell more and more every day. He currently lives in a foster home with two other dogs and two young kids. He loves to play with the dogs and is very sweet and gentle with the kids. He is crate trained and is working on his house training. It seems like Dill has never been walked on a leash so he is quite scared to go outside of the yard but we are sure he will learn in time to love walks.  He loves to eat (as all Labs do) and is very food motivated which will make him easy to train. He would do well in an active household.  Dill would benefit from living in a home with another dog for confidence. As you can see in the 1st picture, he loves his sister Juno (black and white)His foster Mom is even taking him running with her.If you think Dill would be a good match for your family, please email:wjvolunteers@yahoo.com  and tell us about your family, home and other dogs.

Howdy Partner! My name is Earl and I’m a new arrival to Providence Animal Center from North Carolina. I now have the best possible chance of finding my perfect family and I can’t wait to move from here into my new forever home. I am approximately 2 years old and weigh around 50lbs. My friends here feel that I would love a home with kids of any age, especially ones who want to be a part of my daily care! Cats are okay, I prefer ones who also like dogs and just need some time to acclimate with them. I don't mind hanging around other dogs, but I really am not the playful kind. I prefer to be the observer of the doggy playgroups here and keep an eye on everyone! I am described my the staff and volunteers here as sweet, calm, and gentle and they feel I would be great for first time pet owners! I am already neutered, up to date on vaccinations, and micro-chipped which means I can go home with you today! I hope to see you soon! xoxo EarlProvidence Animal Center relies on adoption fees and donations to save pets! Adoption fees vary per pet. To find out this pet’s adoption fee or for more information, please call the Adoption Center with this pet’s ID number.Can’t adopt? Consider fostering or donating! Visit ProvidenceAC.org for more information on how you can support the lifesaving mission!

Meet Sergeant he is a sweet St. Bernard Boxer mix from North Carolina. Sergeant is a big boy full of love and affection, he should go to a family who is experienced with Big dogs and doesnt mind having a big dog around. Sergeant likes a big yard and enjoys getting exercise, he is currently only 4 years old and ready to go home!

Pickles is a 3-year-old female spayed Carolina Dog mix who weighs about 42lbs. She has big pointy ears and loves to go hiking, jogging, and chase squirrels. She can also be a total couch potato and just sleep next to her human for hours while the TV is on. Pickles loves peanut butter, pancakes, Swiss cheese, and popcorn. She dislikes vegetables, cats, and not being allowed to catch the squirrels. Pickles was originally adopted 2 years ago from North Carolina and has been extremely well cared for as her previous owner is a veterinarian. She is in excellent health and she is house-trained, crate-trained, and knows a lot of commands. Pickles can be a bit nervous around new people and new large dogs and takes a little while to come out of her shell, but when she does she is a total joy! Pickles does best with slow, low-energy introductions and sometimes barks nervously at new people who come on a bit too strong. She loves to play and loves small dogs, but can get a bit defensive around large high-energy dogs at first. However, her best friend is a 90lb Great Pyrenees so she definitely can build trust with any dog as long as the introductions go smoothly!This family is heartbroken that they must rehome Pickles, but due to health reasons of their 2 month child, they have no choice. We are looking for the right home for this special girl - probably one without cats or small children since we cannot vouch for Pickles in those environments since she hasn't had enough exposure. Dogs will be a case by case intro. Just remember she needs calm temperaments in k9 friends.The OS has generously offered to forward all of Pickles belongings too! We have 3 crates, about 6 months worth of dog food, heartworm/flea and tick preventatives for the year, and all other supplies she would need!

Who is IbbyLee you ask?Well, she is a beautiful 4 year old Bull terrier mix who’s got bundles of love to share! She traveled a long way from a shelter in NC and has taken up a temporary address in Delaware with her foster family. IbbyLee is looking for her a place to call home, where she will have a lap of her own to snuggle in and a few faces to give slobbery kisses to! She's an amazing dog who is house trained, crate trained (a few treats might help) and dog friendly with proper introduction (sorry no cats!). She loves a good walk, playing in the sunshine, and will settle down with a good doggie puzzle to solve for the night.IbbyLee is Heartworm positive, and currently receiving treatment covered by the rescue. If you think you could give IbbyLee the happily ever after she deserves please go to grrde.org and fill out an application today!

Background: Opie was transfered to our partners at Providence Animal Center through their TAILS program from North Carolina. He was originally found as a stray and suffering from mange - luckily our friends at Providence were able to treat him and help him find his way to us. Opie is a sweet young boy who loves attention and will curl right up in your lap - he will be a phenomenal pet once he completes his training with us. Check back for more updates as we get to know Opie!https://newleashonlife-usa.org/category/adopt/available-dogs/(click the large green button above the pet listings to apply!)

www.huskyrescueteam.orgIf you have additional questions please email info@huskyrescueteam.orgAre you ready to be entertained?!?!Then Von is your boy! Von, aka Mr. Von Troubles, has loads of Husky personality. He will keep you on your toes and keep you laughing!Von is a 3 year old Husky mix who weighs 65lbs. We saved Von from a kill shelter in NC. He had a very bad case of mange. Von grew even more sick in his foster's home and was diagnosed with Parvo a week after we saved him. Von was very ill and most dogs wouldn't have survived the combined illnesses. But our Von is an amazingly strong fighter! Not only did he survive being abandoned, mange, secondary skin infections and Parvo, but his Husky personality shines like no other!!!Von is full of life. He is an energetic, playful, submissive, and a truly affectionate Husky. He enjoys playing ball and tug of war. He is house broken and crate trained. He sleeps in his crate and will stay quiet all night long. He is a good eater, but will not over eat. He drinks a lot and needs to go outside frequently. Von needs about an hour of vigorous play each day. A fenced yard where he can run freely would be ideal. He has not demonstrated any tendencies towards trying to escape as some Huskies are known to do. He hasn't done very much digging either. He is excellent on a leash. He is vocal, but not a howler.Like most Huskies, Von is destructive to his toys and will chew other objects as well. When not crated he needs constant supervision to ensure he doesn't get into things he shouldn't. While submissive, he can be stubborn with following commands, but responds instantly to correction.Von is a very playful guy and loves to put toys in your lap. He will insist you play with him. He would do best in a home with older children. No cats or small animals! You must be willing to embrace the Husky life to adopt Von. Von is not your typical dog, but an extension of a family.Video: https://youtu.be/Q0FE_LjxGc8Von will be fostered in NC until adoption. We can transport him to MD or NJ for the right family!www.huskyrescueteam.org~~Husky Education And Rescue Team is a foster based rescue. Our dogs are in our foster homes all up and down the east coast. We do not have a facility in which you can visit. We find this a huge benefit because we learn our dogs and are able to educate our adopters on what it’s like to have them live in your home. Part of our process, once pre-approved, is to speak with the foster for the dog you’re interested in. If you’re still interested in adopting from our rescue the first step is to complete our adoption application online at www.huskyrescueteam.org/applyIf you have additional questions please email info@huskyrescueteam.org

dob: ~04/23/2016...weighs 19lbs-will weigh 20lbs as an adult.Rescued from a kill shelter in western NC.LOVELY personality! Sweet, friendly, out-going, fun personality, super-loving, 'social butterfly', happy, healthy and gentle. Crate trained, rides well, walks well on-leash, gets along well with all dogs, cats and older respectful & responsible children (must be 13y+). LOVES being with her people, but can allow her 'social butterfly' to emerge if not supervised OR if she becomes bored while outdoors unsupervised/person goes out gate...she wants to be with her person! Once outside, she will go exploring...not far, but ANY distance is too far, given this sometimes crazy world we live in.NOT a good match for older seniors, or homes with children under 13yo.We will be happy to send you more pix & videos, upon request.BEWARE! SKY is an 'escape artist'...she WILL climb chain-link & welded-wire fencing(anything she can get a foothold into). Therefore, we are seeking a stay/work-at-home person/walk on leash ONLY situation OR a home with a wooden/vinyl stockade fence with buried reinforcement wire(EXPERIENCED BEAGLE PEOPLE WILL UNDERSTAND!).MUST have a secured fenced-in backyard (NO ELECTRIC FENCES=these are NOT compatible for scent hounds!) OR past INSIDE beagle experience and a regular walking/running/hiking regime and be committed to an 'ON-LEASH ONLY' exercise regime. Homes with children are REQUIRED to have a vinyl/stockade fenced-in backyard...NO EXCEPTIONS!This pup is in & will remain in foster care in Rutherfordton, NC until her fur-ever home is approved.Transport is available via 3 Rescued Pet transport svcs and their fees are: $125 from western NC to as far N as Long Island and Vince Lombardi svc plaza/NJTnpk, and $140 to all points along the I-95 corridor as far as ManchesterNH/BurlingtonVT & Albany/RochesterNY. Stops include: DC, MD, DEL, NJTnpk, RyeNY, JohnstonRI and ManchesterNH/BurlingtonVT, Albany & RochesterNY, & Allentown and CarlislePA on I-81.Adoption fee: $195(includes spay, micro-chip, current health certificate, parasite-free, utd on 1st yr vax(Bordatella, Rabies, Parvo-Distemper & Lepto), all medical paperwork from day#1 at Howlin4Spirit(+ past shelter's records), beef knee cap bone, KONG or Nylabone chew toy, 1/2 gallon bag current dry food(Tractor Supply Store's '4health'-salmon & potato), 2 'pet alert' wallet cards, new Martingale collar and matching 6' leash, 'RESCUED DOGS ROCK' car magnet and 'SUPER PUPPY-The Best Dog You'll Ever Have' training booklet).To apply to adopt this lovely little sweetie, please copy and paste the application in to a new email, complete all questions(the more detailed, the better your chances of being approved), and email to: howlin4spirit@gmail.com. MAKE SURE you provide us with EMAIL ADDRESSES for your 3 personal references and let them know we will be sending them a short questionnaire within 1 business day. Also, you will need to give your vet's office permission to release your pet's medical history to us, when we call them within 1 business day.IF you rent, you will need to provide your property manager's contact info. We will be contacting them within 1 business day.Thank you, for reaching out to a rescued pup in need of love, respect and a warm, safe place to call 'home'. We look forward to helping you find the right pup for you, your family, environment and habits, for a life-time of snuggling, unconditional love and adventures.

This dog is a part of our Summer $25 Adoption Fee Promotion! In an effort to keep up with the high rescue demand this summer, we are discounting many dog adoption fees to $25! Note- standard adoption screening interview and reference checks still apply!COME MEET ADOPTABLE DOGS EVERY SATURDAY AND SUNDAY from 10AM - 4PM at the Homeward Trails Adoption Center- 11116 Fairfax Station Road, Fairfax Station VA 22039! **Note that puppies are in foster homes, not at the Adoption Center.In an effort to save more lives, HT is allowing expedited adoptions for certain animals if applicants bring required paperwork. You can bring your new family member home more quickly by bringing your current pets' vet records, a copy of your lease or landlord letter stating you are permitted to have pets, and photos of your home. Help us help you adopt more quickly!If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out our dog adoption questionnaire and e-mail it to adoptioncenter@homewardtrails.org.PLEASE VISIT THIS WEBSITE TO FIND THE ADOPTION QUESTIONNAIRE: http://www.homewardtrails.org/adopt-a-pet/adoption-forms/Kronos was rescued from Fayetteville, NC, where he was found with several other dogs. He's a majestic dog who is looking for his forever home!  Very playul, outgoing guy! He is smart and well-mannered. Kronos needs a home without cats but did well with another dog in the home.  Adoption Coordinator: Homeward Trails Adoption CenterBreed Estimate: Pitbull mixGender: MaleApproximate weight: 67 lbsApproximate age: 3 yearsLocation: Homeward Trails Adoption CenterCratetrained: Coat Type: ShortPersonality: The adoption fee for this dog is $25. This fee INCLUDES spay/neuter and microchip. Every adopted Homeward Trails animal comes with 30 days of free pet health insurance. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals.Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter.We also provide a 30-minute phone consult with a professional dog trainer at Fur-Get Me Not within the first 30 days of adopting - just for HT adopters in the Arlington/Alexandria area. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE!You can save animals like this one by becoming a foster! Fosters are like way stations between high kill shelters and forever homes. We need fosters so that we can save dogs before they are euthanized at the shelters. If you are interested in becoming a foster, please check out our information about fostering by visiting http://www.homewardtrails.org/foster-a-pet/dog-and-cat-foster-program/

Hi, I’m Lucy! Gee wiz, am I enjoying my new life since I arrived here in the area from North Carolina! I love people – well, the adult ones only – and I really want to please you. And boy, do I love being outside! There are so many smells, and I love the squirrels and those birds. When I am out walking, people say that I am beautiful. They probably think I’m strange for wagging my tail the entire walk, but I am so happy! I love to cuddle and roll over so you can rub my belly. I am 5 years old and 20 pounds of happiness.I am looking for an experienced adopter who will understand me. Like when I see people outside, or hear noises, I react by barking. My ideal forever home is as an only dog so I don’t have to share your love. I am crate and house trained. I would love a house with a fenced yard in the suburbs as I am not a city or condo girl!Check out a cute video of her here!If you live in the Washington, DC area and can open your home to adopt Lucy, please email her foster at the link below.

Meet our handsome Jack Wagon he is currently 5 years old and is looking for his forever home. Jack Wagon is from another rescue out of North Carolina and he traveled all the wy here to find his person. Jack Wagon enjoys going for walks and spending time at the park. Jack Wagon weighs 80 lbs. Jack Wagon would make the best new addition to any family, if you would like to visit with him come on in to meet him!

Tapestry, aka Tappie, is a beautiful Brindle that came to us from a shelter in North Carolina. We believe she is a Mountain Cur/Catahoula/Terrier mix. She weighs about 45 pounds and is believed to be about 3 years old. Tappie went to Ventosa Kennels in North Carolina to get some training and has earned her certificate. She is looking for a home with people that have energy like she does. She would make a great jogging or running partner. Tappie is crate trained, house trained and has learned “sit” and “down”.  She does well on a leash, though daily practice is a must.  Tappie loves her humans, big or small, though she is extremely picky on her dog playmates, this is why she would do best being the only dog in the house. Tapestry must have a fenced in yard because of all of her energy, so she needs a place to run to get out all of her energy.Tapestry is spayed, micro chipped and up to date on all of her vaccines.If you are interested in Tapestry please fill out our application which can be found on our web site www.itavar.com

dob: 2/17/2011..rescued from 'high-kill' Laurens Co, SC Animal Control after Mitzi was brought in as a 'stray'. We are convinced that she was owned by an older woman who just opened her door and let her out to go potty, and the woman may have gone into a nursing home or hospital and couldn't go looking for her Mitzi. Mitzi is a JackRussell/ChihuahuaX, with a bobbed tail and weighs just 10lbs. She is a devoted companion to her person. LOVES going for car rides, sleeping snuggled up against her person, walks well on-leash and is a great 'watch dog'. Protective of her food dish, so must be fed in separate corner from any other pets. Gets along with all size dogs, though seems a bit jealous of some older small females. Maybe had some competition, in her past life? Has the Jack personality, with short little legs.adoption fee: $125(includes spay, micro-chip, parasite-free, current on monthly heart worm and flea/tick prevention, health certificate issued within 3 days of transport, Martingale collar w/matching 6' leash, beef knee cap chew bone and all medical paperwork from day#1 with Howlin4Spirit).This pup is in and will remain in Rutherfordton,NC until her fur-ever family/home is approved. Transport from western NC to VA/DC/MD/DE/NJ/LongIsland=$100 & RyeNY/JohnstonRI/ManchesterNH/Allentown,Annville,HarrisburgPA or ChambersburgMD=$125 via Happy Dogs OR Lifesavers Rescued Pet Transport services with Saturday deliveries ONLY!To apply to adopt, please go to www.howlin4spirit.org/adoption-application/ and COPY & PASTE the application in to a new email, go to the end of each question and answer thoroughly, to help us understand your family, environment, habits and abilities so that we can match you with the right fit for a companion animal. Send your completed application(don't forget EMAIL ADDIES for your 3 UNrelated-to you and each other) to howlin4spirit@gmail.com.We will be happy to send you more pix & videos upon request.

This is our friend Tim he is a year old. he is an American Pit Bull Terrier and he is the most loving guy you will meet. Dont let his big face or tough exterior run you away. he is very lovable and enjoys human company. Tim is from a rescue out of North Carolina, along with a few others he was fleeing the hurricane and floods. Tim made it all the way to our facility to find his new home. if you are interested in meeting Tim ask a kennel tech to set up a meet and greet.

Hello! My name is Trapper, and I’m a 2-year-old brindle boy with a heart-of-gold (or so I’m told). I traveled all the way to Providence Animal Center from an overcrowded facility in North Carolina, and now I am just waiting patiently on my fur-ever family! I got to spend some time in foster care and my foster dad has been hanging out with me and teaching me what it’s like to be spoiled silly! He puts peanut butter in Kong toys to keep me busy, and boy do I LOVE peanut butter. My foster dad says his favorite thing about me is my “easygoing temperament” (aww, shucks). I walk really well on my leash, so I would be a great hiking buddy and get along well with just about everyone! My friends at Providence Animal Center say I could easily go home with kids aged 5+! I’ve met a few doggy friends during playtime at PAC, and based on those interactions, they also say I could go home with a furry friend! But not a feline - I’m just not a cat guy. At the end of the day, I love getting snuggles and attention from my people - that could be you! So I sure hope you want to meet soon because I’m so excited to settle into my fur-ever home. Well, what do you say? Are you ready to fall head over heels in love with a silly youngster like me? If so, come visit me today at Providence Animal Center! I hope to hear from you soon! My paws are crossed! Lots of Love, TrapperPS - Someone loves me so much that they already paid my adoption fee, which means I'm free to adopt!Providence Animal Center relies on adoption fees and donations to save pets! Adoption fees vary per pet. To find out this pet’s adoption fee or for more information, please call the Adoption Center with this pet’s ID number.Can’t adopt? Consider fostering or donating! Visit ProvidenceAC.org for more information on how you can support the lifesaving mission!

Rebecca came to us on a transport from North Carolina along with her mom and a sibling. This beautiful beagle mix has a chesnut brown and white coat. We anticipate she will stay a nice medium size as her mom (already adopted) was a medium size beagle. Rebecca is already learning good behavior by participating in our puppy class on a regular basis. Our volunteers report she is doing well learning basic commands, good manners and appropriate play with other puppies. She has also attended off site field trips, and is friendly and outgoing with everyone she meets. Nose to the ground, she loves to explore and It is obvious she enjoys the adventure! Rebecca would make a great family dog and do well in a home with other dogs, kids, cats, etc. She's had a good start learning the ropes here at MLAR. Continued training throughout her puppyhood will allow her to thrive as she grows into adulthood. Looking to add a new puppy to the family? Look no more, Rebecca is your girl! If you are interested in meeting any of our adoptable dogs, please fill out an application at http://www.mlar.org/adopt/adoption-processE-mails regarding adoption are not considered an application. Out-of-state applicants will not be considered, unless there are special circumstances. Main Line Animal Rescue does local adoptions to families with excellent vet references and an installed fenced yard. You must have a secure traditional fence OR a professionally installed underground electric fenced area in which a dog can safely play without getting out). The fence must be securely attached to your house, dog pens, dog runs and a tie outs are not approved. Please visit our web site for more detailed information on the animals in our care, our educational campaigns, and for helpful tips on adoption.  www.MLAR.org

Hello there my name is Angie and i am a 6 year old beagle girl. I am from a rescue out of North Carolina, i was brought here with hopes of a second chance of a forever home. I enjoy spending time out doors with my owner getting some fresh air and running free. I am a beagle girl so an owner who is knowledgeable about my specific breed would be a plus. I am fully vaccinated, microchipped and spayed. if I am the perfect fit for you please come on in and meet me!

Handsome 'people' boyHello! My name is Apollo Hound aka Apollo, and I am a 2 year old, 55 lb foxhound mix. I am a loving and loyal dog, but I need to let you know that I am insecure. I have gained confidence with a consistent routine, and with patience and reassurance from my past foster and the awesome human heroes that have saved me and are currently looking out for me. I came from North Carolina where I was wandering the streets, and the human that saved me did not know much about my past. However, a few things about me have been figured out:• I want to please and I will work hard to understand my new home and surroundings. • I love to be loved and give love right back.• I am insecure, but willing and wanting to trust.• I learn quickly, such as sit, down, stay/wait and I am ready to learn more.• New people worry me… so do new buildings. I do not like going into buildings/homes I’m not familiar with. I will follow when I trust, and especially if I have a dog buddy. • I tend to trust a woman more than a man. Men wearing hats scare me, but I will warm up to a man over time, especially if one of my dog buddies trusts him. • I realize I keep mentioning dog buddies. I love dogs. Dogs are my buddies!! They make me feel safe and I love to play with them. I am still learning that humans know how to play – that sometimes is so weird to me!• I SHOULD NEVER BE TRUSTED WITH CATS.• I like walks and am learning how to play fetch.• I am mostly housebroken, but I am still learning. I need a consistent routine.• I do OK in crates, but I don’t like crates and storms. I have been known to escape them. There is so much that I have to offer to your home and I can’t wait to be a part of your family.Apollo Hound should go into an adult only home.Apollo's adoption donation fee is $280, which includes spay/neuter, routine vetting and a microchip. Megan is a beautiful boxer mix. She is actually a mix of a bunch of breeds (we tested her said to be brother). Megan was rescued from a hoarding case of 87 dogs by a shelter in NC. We rescued her from there and now she’s ready to be adopted!She needs at least 1 other dog in the house and she must have a fenced in yard (4/5 ft or taller). Megan is skittish at first but will warm up pretty quickly. She follows the other dogs to start and LOVE to play once she warms up.  She’s a beautiful tan color! Megan is very food motivated and will make a great addition to any family! If interested in adopting Megan, please fill out an adoption application on our website at www.sweetsoulsanimalrescue.com/blank-1

Spirit came to us from a kill shelter in North Carolina. We think she is a staffy/ boston Terrier mix. She weighs about 43 pounds and is guessed to be between 2 to 3 years of age. Spirit is a very social dog and loves to play with other dogs and loves her people too. She has not yet met a dog or person she does not like. Spirit is house and crate trained and is learning to walk on a leash. She has been taught the commands “sit” “leave it” and “down” Spirit loves to chew on beef bones and is just one happy-go-lucky gal. She would do great with another dog in the house, but it is not a requirement.Spirit is Spayed, Micro chipped and up to date on all of her vaccines. If you are interested in Spirit, please fill out an application at www.itavar.com

Hi everyone, my name is Skinner! I am 10 years old and I may look huge but I'm a compact 50 pounds of love! I wasn't treated very well before so I'm enjoying taking my time getting to know people and being treated the way I deserve. Despite my past I am a very sweet boy who loves to go for walks and snuggle once I get to know you!Come to the sanctuary to meet me!
