If you are interested in adopting this dog, please download and complete an Adoption Questionnaire from our website and email Liz at elizabethg@k-9lifesavers.orgYou can learn about the adoption process and find a Word, PDF and ONLINE version of the questionnaire by visiting: http://www.k-9lifesavers.org/howtoadopt/.Dog's Name: UmaEstimated Breed : Lab MixApproximate Age: 2 yrsApproximate Weight: approx. 40 lbsCurrently Living at: Foster HomeAdoption Fee: $300DOG'S DESCRIPTIONThis beautiful girl is Uma! She is a southern belle from NC. Uma would love a new family to love her, play with her and give her lots of hug and kisses! Uma is hoping to find a home that is on the quieter side (she is a little scared of all the city noises), has a fenced in yard so she can run and play and has another dog-friend to keep her company.Your new pet will require a refresher in house-training. K-9 Lifesavers strongly recommends all new adopters enroll their new pet into obedience training. This provides for an easier transition into a new home, ensures the dog remains well socialized, and helps form a bond between the dog and the new family.Adoption fees cover basic vetting, spay/neuter surgery (for dogs over 6 months old), rabies, distemper/parvo vaccinations, treatment for worms, heartworm testing, monthly heartworm prevention and monthly flea/tick prevention (while the animal is in our care), and transport costs from high-kill shelter. Please note that on average, K-9 Lifesavers spend significantly more on each dog than their adoption fee. Adoption fee for HW positive dog also covers heartworm treatment at our partner vets.Foster Program: Foster homes provide for the temporary care of a rescue until the dog is placed into a loving, forever home. For more information on becoming a foster parent, and our Foster Program, visit http://www.k-9lifesavers.org/foster/ or email our Foster Coordinator at foster@k-9lifesavers.orgSponsor Me! Make a tax-deductible donation today by visiting us at http://www.k-9lifesavers.org/donate/ . Donations help us offset boarding costs and additional medical treatment for those dogs who need it. K-9 Lifesavers receives NO federal funding and survive with your generous support!For more information on K-9 Lifesavers, or to view a complete listing of all our Adoptable Dogs, visit our website at www.k-9lifesavers.org.Please “like” our Facebook Page for the most current events and new dogs.Thank you for considering a rescue dog!

5/20/19It’s been a while since I’ve given an update about how I’m doing, but it’s just because I keep a very busy social calendar. Sometimes I go to daycare and play with my friends, and I’m often very busy playing with my foster sister—we love to wrestle and chase each other around the house and yard. I’m close with my trusted group of human friends and am always happy to see them, but it still takes me a while to understand that new humans are ok. I may not make the ideal first impression because I will probably be skittish and scared, but once you get to know me you’ll see that I love snuggling up with my humans and always come over to get some lovin’. My foster dad says that he knows the perfect family is out there for me, and in the mean time I’m learning lots here in foster care and I have made such progress from when I was in North Carolina when humans couldn’t even LOOK at me without me being terrified. I’ve come a long way and I know that my ideal family will understand that it’s a process and be patient as I learn new things. All of my human friends can vouch for me and let you know that I’m worth it (#humblebrag).If you’re a low-key person or family who is looking for a loyal, sweet companion then have your people call my people! As always, you can keep up with my adventures at http://www.instagram.com/senny_wise_and_hound_foolish and my foster dad is happy to answer any questions for approved adopters!  PS: I promise I’m not angry all the time even though my eyebrows make me look grumpy! > Pupdate 3/14/19>> Hi, everyone! Senny here, just giving a brief update on how I’m doing. I’m still making a lot of progress in my foster home and am making more human friends. They key is letting me approach them on my own terms and after a few meetings I’m comfortable with them. In fact, there hasn’t been a human I haven’t liked once I got the chance to know them without being pressured. I’m getting more confident on my walks, even down city blocks. Things still scare me but I’m able to recover MUCH more quickly and don’t stay in panic mode. 2/12/19It’s been a while so I thought I would check in and remind you that I’m still in foster care doing great, and my foster dad tells me he absolutely knows the perfect family is out there! I’m continuing to build my confidence and start to do some slow exposure to situations that have really scared me before, like meeting new humans or being in unfamiliar places with lots of hustle and bustle. Things still make me nervous but I bounce back quickly (before if I got scared I would be totally derailed for the whole day) and I know that the humans I trust are there to keep me safe and I can go to them for reassurance if I need to. I still absolutely love socializing with my dog and human friends at doggie daycare. I seek out the humans there to get petted and give hugs and kisses and I’m really comfortable with them. I had to get to know them first, but do you blame me? Why should any of us trust strangers? Once I am your friend, you’ve got a friend for life! I’m incredibly friendly and loving and I adore hanging out with my family! I’ve learned that it’s actually ok to go out in the snow—I wasn’t so sure about that before, but now I’m all about snow zoomies. I’m still on my medications for anxiety and they are working well. My foster dad is starting to do a little work with me on my overall manners, especially since I love to jump up on my human friends because I’m excited for hugs, and, like lots of hounds, I like to put my paws up on the counters to see if there might be any tasty snacks for me up there.  Who doesn’t love snacks? I’m making a lot of awesome progress and showing great progress. I still get scared and take time to get comfortable, but I have been showing over and over that with time, patience, support and love that I’m capable of being a relaxed and loving family member. As always, my foster dad helps me update my Instagram so everyone can stay up to date on my adventures! You can find me on Instagram @senny_wise_and_hound_foolishPupdate for 1/8/19Senny here, just wanted to give you an update on how I’m doing in my foster home! A little over a month ago I started on two medications to help me with my severe fear and anxiety, and they do seem to be taking the edge off. I’ve been going to doggie daycare a few days a week and that has been SO MUCH FUN and I’ve even made friends with the humans who work there! I will even approach them on my own if I want attention or to give kisses. My foster dad thinks that daycare is really helping me meet and get to learn that humans are nice with the help of other dogs who can show me and he thinks I would benefit from ongoing social settings like that.  My best friend is my foster dog sister, who is my same age (18 months). Even though I am shy and scared at first with humans, I absolutely love running around and wrestling with my foster sister and we are very active! We like to wrestle, run zoomies and play with our toys. I’m hoping to find a home with another active dog who wants to play with me and can help me get more confident and burn off energy. I love walks but they can also be kind of scary with noises and people, but it’s a bit easier when I’m walking with a dog friend. I still have a hard time feeling safe enough to stop and go potty on our walks but I’m pretty good with using the yard and we are working to help me not have accidents inside. Overall everyone tells me that I’m making great progress! I am still looking for that special family who has dog experience and is willing to put the time and resources into training and helping me learn to trust. Not to brag, but I promise I’m worth it! I give the best hound hugs and kisses and once I get to know you I love to snuggle! Be sure to follow my adventures on instagram: @senny_wise_and_hound_foolish

Jake is a big hound who was rescued from North Carolina last year. He had been neglected and was gravely ill, but volunteers at HART nursed him back to health. He is very loving and has such a sweet soul. He gets along well with the other dogs in his foster home and is even fine with the cats. Jake has wonderful manners: completely housebroken, walks well on a leash, doesn't beg or jump, likes to sleep in, and keeps off the furniture. He is pretty calm and quiet and doesn't even bark at the neighbor's dogs! Jake doesn't ask for much - just someone who will give him plenty of love but also set firm boundaries for him in order to set him up for success. Give this poor hound, who has suffered so much, a chance at happiness! Visit www.hart90.org to contact a HART representative about Jake N and to submit an online application.HART adopts to the local DC/VA/MD metro area only. Visit our website for more information about our adoption process.

*MYRA MAKES ME SMILE* Myra is a super sweet, 65lb, 2-year-old Terrier mix who will put a smile on your face. Myra LOVES people and gives the best hugs. Myra is house and crate trained and quiet in her crate. Myra and her daughter Lucy came to One Love Animal Rescue from NC.This little family was on their own for quite some time and Myra did a great job taking care of her little Lucy. Lucy was adopted and now it is Myra's turn! If you would like to have a dog that will love you to the moon and back,and will put a smile on your face everyday then please fill out an application at oneloveanimalrescue.orgTo be considered as this pet's adopter, please go to www.oneloveanimalrescue.org/adopt.html to complete your application.

www.huskyrescueteam.orgIf you have additional questions please email info@huskyrescueteam.orgThis is Gweeny...she is white with a black circle around one eye. We saved her from a kill shelter in NC. She is about 3 years old and 60 lbs...fully vetted and healthy. Gweeny loves people and would be good as an only dog. Gweeny is a sweatheart! Her favorite past time is swimming. She loves the water and is in her foster Mom's pond a lot!!Gweeny has not lived with children but we think she'd be fine with respectful children in the home. She is a loyal girl. Gweeny is in foster care in NC. She can be transported to MD or NJ for an approved adopter. ~~Husky Education And Rescue Team is a foster based rescue. Our dogs are in our foster homes all up and down the east coast. We do not have a facility in which you can visit. We find this a huge benefit because we learn our dogs and are able to educate our adopters on what it’s like to have them live in your home. Part of our process, once pre-approved, is to speak with the foster for the dog you’re interested in. If you’re still interested in adopting from our rescue the first step is to complete our adoption application online at www.huskyrescueteam.org/applyIf you have additional questions please email info@huskyrescueteam.org

Farrah is a sweet girl with plenty of tail wags for everyone. She came to HART from North Carolina where she was surrendered by her owner, along with her puppies Alan and Walter, who have since been adopted. Farrah was an 'outdoor dog' who spent most of her time on a chain. When she first arrived in the NC shelter, she was very confused by her new surroundings, but once she adjusted, she was all tail wags and wiggles! Farrah loves people and other dogs. She can come on a bit strong because she is so happy to make new friends, but she settles well. Visit www.hart90.org to contact a HART representative about Farrah and to submit an online application.HART adopts to the local DC/VA/MD metro area only. Visit our website for more information about our adoption process.

Moose is such a cool guy. He's a sweet boy who has lived his entire life on a chain.  We rescued Moose from a high kill shelter in NC.  He was found on the side of the highway looking for food and still had his chain hanging off of him.  Moose is a sweet boy who is very food driven and easy to train.  We have transitioned him from being an outdoor dog to living indoors.  His favorite hobbies are to stare out the window watching squirrels, napping on his bed (he doesn't get on human furniture) and going for his leash walk.  He glows when he's on his leash walks.  Moose needs an all adult home.  Moose is housebroken, up to date on monthly preventatives and will be neutered as soon as he's done with his heart worm treatment.  His heart worm treatment will be complete on March 12th, 2018. If you are interested in this awesome boy, please email Breshkie@dogworldrescue.comOur adoption application is the first step in our adoption process.  Please check to make sure you are within our adoption area before applying.  We schedule meet and greets based on an initial match with our online application.  http://www.dogworldrescue.com/adopt/

Thank you, for caring enough to consider adopting a rescued pup in need of love, respect and a warm place to lay it's head fur-ever.This pup is in and will remain in foster care in Rutherfordton, NC until their adoptive person/family has been approved, and will then be ready for transport on the following Saturday(Saturday delivery ONLY).Upon request, we will be happy to send you more videos and pictures of this pup interacting with her H4S buddies, to help you get a better understandingof their personality and activity level, and how they interact with their people and other pups.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------CESAR(dob:10/26/2009 + weighs 45lbs)was originally rescued from Rutherford County, NC's high-kill Animal Control(on 12/28/2011)by a long-time animal advocate + volunteer, whom recently passed away leaving 14 dogs behind. Howlin4Spirit stepped up and took in 3 of her precious ones. CEASAR was outside in a fenced-in area withSnookie,a very sweet overweight female RottieX, whom he had the pleasure of keeping company and helped protect Miss Pat(single senior) from anyone trying to come onto her property while walking to shop at Walmart. While Sophie is rather BIG and can be a bit scary-looking to strangers. Cesar is neither scary nor aggressive, in any way. So, they made a good team. He gets along well with Howlin4Spirit's friendly and spirited 45+ dogs running freely on 5+ fenced-in acres, daily. He is a DEVOTED COMPANION. NOT to be mistaken for a 'yard ornament' nor laundry room occupant! He LOVES to be with his person, eat, sleep and follow his person around while doing all outdoor chores, laundry, cooking, taking walks in the woods, etc. He gets along well with other dogs and cats, but prefers being one of 1, 2 or 3, at most. He needs his person to take time to love on him, sit quietly with him in the woods on their morning walks and on the couch in the evenings. He will be by your side the entire way!EXTREMELY HAPPY disposition, DEVOTED to his person, and LOVES the outdoors!He would do well in an apartment BUT ONLY if the adopter is committed to a 3Xday=1mi walking regime,ORin home with a secured fenced-in yard. We will not be accepting any applications where there are children under the age of 10yo living in the home, unless they are respectful and experienced with Beagles.We are SEEKING to place Cesar, PREFERABLY, in a home with an active retiree OR work-from-home MAN OR WOMAN 45>65yo. CESAR is just 7+yo and deserves a devoted person who will be there for him, who is able to fill his life with love, respect and companionship, NOT just someone to come home to when the work day or when party is over. HE DESERVES MUCH MORE than the precarious situation he rescued from!Adoption fee: $95 includes neuter, micro-chip, Parvo-Distemper-Lepto & Bordatella and 1 yr Rabies vaccination, parasite-free, current on monthly heart worm and flea/tick prevention, Martingale collar and 6' leash & current health certificate (issued within 3 days prior to transport).Where there is a scent hound or guardian breed being considered for adoption, & in homes where older respectful children reside or will be visiting, a secured(not electric) fenced-in yard is required.All potential adopters are required to be at least 25 yrs old and complete the application below, at your earliest convenience, to help secure thepup of your choice.PLEASE, state 1st choice and 2nd choice pups in case someone else's prior application has been approved before yours!Upon receipt of your application, we will acknowledge your application in an email and immediately send out a questionnaire to your 3 personal references.To help your chances of adopting the pup of your 1st choice, be sure to contact/ask all references to reply at their most earliest convenience. Also, give your vet's office permission to release your information to Howlin4Spirit. We will be contacting everyone within 2 business days.Upon approval of this adoption, & to hold the dog/pup of your choice, we require the pup's adoption fee to be sent to our secure PayPal.com acct at: howlin4spirit@gmail.comUpon receipt of the adoption fee, we will send you the adoption contract and all pertinent information you will need to be ready for your pup's arrival, and reserve your pup's space on 'Save Them All' OR 'Happy Dogs' next available transport(SATURDAY delivery ONLY). Their transport fee is $125to all points as far N as NYC and LI,and $140 to all points N of NYC as far as Manchester, NH and Syracuse & Albany, NY, to be paid by the adopter to the transport svc who serves your area.6/27/19 10:52 PM

5/6/19- Daisy is still looking for her forever family. She doesnt attend all events but she is available and meet and greets can be arranged for pre-approved adopters. Applications can be found at www.wagsrescue.com2/11/19Daisy is still up for adoption. She says \"I may have ugly feet but I have a beautiful heart\". Daisy is kind, gentle, great w other dogs, fine w cats, good with kids. She is a great family pet and is looking for her forever home. Daisy does not attend every event but if you are interested, please ask for her foster contact info from your application processor to schedule a meet and greet or confirm event attendance. Thanks for checking Daisy out. 11/22/18. Daisy is still up for adoption. She has been in foster care (with the same foster) since Dec 2016. During that time she recieved care for her feet which have improved but are now at a standstill regarding healing. Daisy wants you to look past her feet and see what a wonderfully sweet and kind dog she is. She gets along with all dogs (large and small). Crate trained, housebroken, and very sweet. Doesnt mind kids as long as they arent jumping on her. She would prefer a quiet setting. She would be fine with mild exercise as she is very low key. Condo / townhome / apartment and smaller residential settings would be fine. She is estimated to be about 6-8 years old and is about 50 lbs. 5/4/18Daisy is still up for adoption. She is low key, sweet, kind, gentle with other dogs. She likes to lounge around the house. She is good with dogs, cats, kids, and is a gentle soul. her feet are looking much better and she has some fur regrowth on the feet now. She doesnt attend all event but if you are interested in her, please reach out to your app processor so a meet and greet can be scheduled. She is currently living with other dogs and is great w them. She is crate trained, housebroken in current foster home, and is quiet. She is a lovely dog. She would be fine w a renter / townhome / condo lifestyle and doesn't require much exercise. She is more outgoing than she used to be now that she is more comfortable. She is still shy at events. 8/4/17Daisy Em Society is still looking for her forever home. She is good w other dogs, good w cats, and fine around children. She has regained fur growth on most of her legs. Her foot is still weird. She will always have damage to the nail bed on the front and back affected foot. She is sweet, kind, and gentle. She is a little shy. She would do best in a home with other dogs. She likes to lounge around.2/22/17Daisy Em Society is a 5-7 year old treeing walker coonhound. She is 45 -50 lbs. She is good with other dogs, and is described as cat friendly as well. She was rescued from the woods of North Carolina by a caring animal lover but was found in very sad shape. She had wounds and scabs, was underweight, and two of her feet appeared to have a disfiguring infection of an unknown sorts (you can see this in the picture, it is her front right and back left foot). Daisy walks and runs on all four feet. Sometimes she picks her paw up when she stands (as pictured). This caring lady made sure Daisy saw the vet and was spayed but she couldn't do much more to help her and Daisy seemed very shy and nervous. She reached out to a rescue group that was able to take her and arranged for her transport to a foster home up north with Wags for her to get additional testing / care. Her foster home was known for taking shy and nervous hounds and was a great place for her to work on doggie socialization and trusting humans. Daisy has been in foster care for several months. She is more trusting with people (but is still a work in progress), she received wound care and skin testing, and she was treated for heartworms. Daisy is spayed. Daisy is currently being treated with an antifungal daily pill and has shown improvement on her affected feet. She has hair re-growth and improvement in her skin coloring. Daisy is now an appropriate weight and looks good. Her nails are still disfigured on the two affected feet and the damage is likely to be permanent. At this time, the vet is not recommending toenail removal. However, this may be a possibility or a need down the line. Daisy does NOT like her feet touched and is very uncomfortable with nail trimming. Her feet are probably still pretty sensitive. Amputation / foot removal is not recommended. The affected area has receded and is mostly concentrated on the paws now, instead of the leg. Daisy is good w other dogs and is becoming more social with people. Daisy walks well on a leash. Daisy doesn't like loud noises / street traffic. Daisy doesn't like to be startled. She would do best in a quiet home or a quieter environment. Daisy likes to be petted now and seeks attention on her terms. Her favorite thing to do it lounge around, whether it is in her crate or on the couch. She is very quiet and rarely barks. Occasionally she will snuggle on the couch. Mostly she just hangs out and you don't notice she is there. She is crate trained and housebroken in her current foster home.  Daisy likes to run and play outside but is very calm / quiet in the house. She has great house manners and doesn't get into anything. She is very quiet and mild mannered. Daisy is only impatient when it is dinner time. She has a good appetite and loves her meals. Daisy is low maintenance. Daisy would make a great pet for someone looking for a quiet dog. An apartment would be ok for Daisy as she is full grown and quiet. She would be great w a senior or elderly human as she is calm and low maintenance. She would be a great companion for an elderly dog. Daisy does not require a fence but if you are going to have her in a fence, it needs to be 4 foot plus as she can jump when off leash. Daisy is friendly / great w other dogs. Daisy crates very well and can be left alone for 8-9 hours. She has no signs or indications of separation anxiety (no crying / howling / barking) the way some other hounds and beagles are. Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!

Everybody wants young dogs and puppies, and poor Remy gets no attention. Remy still has lots of years ahead of him, and wants to live out his senior years in a home of his own. He was saved from a high kill shelter in North Carolina where he was completely out of time, then treated for heartworms, vetted, and neutered. He loves hiking and doesn't have any problems with his hips, as so many shepherds do. He is a perfect gentleman in the car. He is friendly and happy to greet anybody he meets. If you'd be interested in giving Remy the home he has wanted for so long, email us at bhtbpuppies@yahoo.com.

Karma was saved from North Carolina where she spent her life chained to a tree.  . She is a sweet girl that LOVES to play and be near you.  She’s house trained and knows basic commands.  . Karma, while perfect, needs to be an only dog.  She does not think the world is big enough for other animals.  She's very playful and silly.  Karma has a stage four heart murmur and is on custom allergy meds.  both of which are under control.    Karma is spayed, microchipped and current on her shots.

Meet Strudel!Strudel is approximately an 11 year old Jack Russell/Aussie mix. He was rescued from a high kill shelter in North Carolina and is currently in foster care in Orlando, FL.  Strudel is a gentle and sweet senior that is looking for his forever home. He is good with other dogs, cats, kid friendly, and an overall sweetheart! Although Strudel is blind, he is able to see lights/shadows really well and is still able to find himself around just fine!If you are interested in adopting Strudel, please head over to www.bfp.org and fill out an application for adoption or you if you have any questions about Strudel, you can email us at adopt@bfp.org

Joseph is almmost 2 years old and came from a shelter in North Carolina. He was going to be put to sleep because the shelter was full and he was heartworm positive. When I saw his picture, I fell in love so I called the shelter and we arranged transport to bring Joseph to GA. He is very sweet and gets along with all other dogs, from small to large and he's got a very sweet disposition although, when he first came when I would reach out to pet him, he would shy away but he's doing great now, wagging his tail and following me around the yard!  Joseph has been heartworm treated and is doing very well. If you are interested in Joseph, please email me at lizziz101@bellsouth.net. He would make someone a great companion especially if you like to run. Although it'll be a little while longer until he is fully recovered from his treatment.

Hello, fine people. Huey here. It’s been quite a six months for me. I arrived at rescue back in September 2018. I was at the county kill shelter during a time when the shelters in Atlanta were packed with dogs and cats from Hurricane Florence in the Carolinas. I was a senior and surrendered, and they knew that was very risky for me. Fortunately, GA JRT saw me and, having a big place in their hearts for sweet senior boys like me, they pulled me. Unfortunately, though, I was very sick.I was running a 103.6 fever, so they rushed me to the vet, where I almost collapsed. I was diagnosed with pneumonia, then ended up in and out of the hospital for several months with other respiratory issues. They tested me for various diseases because my liver enzymes were boosted, and I ended up on blood pressure meds … which worked wonders for me. Then I got sick again earlier this year. They took me to various vets; had multiple tests done. My bloodwork was “all kinda wonky,” but finally! They discovered what’s going on.I have Atypical Cushing’s Disease. It’s nothing really serious. I just kind of drink and pee a lot sometimes, but I’m on a couple of supplements (not even medication) now and I am back to being me! I’m at a healthy weight, my hair has grown back (except my tail; never gonna happen), and I am all Jack! I’m very focused, very smart, very frisky … and might I mention? Very handsome!So, if you’re looking for an older man who is laid-back but is still “all Jack” and loves to go for rides and walks, I’m your guy. Other dogs are fine with me, especially if they’re chill … and if they're girls. I tend to get along best with the girls. I’m around 7-8 years old (the gray beard is from a stressful former life) and a perfect pint-sized Jack about 15-16 lbs.For the very best response time, please visit http://bit.ly/2ML6d0TYou will need to copy and paste the link but it takes you directly to his information.Please note: We are a small volunteer run rescue. We will respond to your requests for information as soon as we can but it would REALLY help if you go to our webpage http://www.jackrusselladoptions.org/adopt-a-dog/and read our adoption policies and procedures before contacting us. That speeds up the process but forgive us if we are a bit slow sometimes; the dogs come first.Also, we do check veterinary references, so please let them know we will be calling. Thanks!

Nick came to us after being pulled from a North Carolina shelter the day before he was to be euthanized. He is full of life and energy, and he will require an experienced Akita owner who is willing to confidently and fairly lead Nick. Nick is a complete sweetheart but is also a clown and does require exercise and stimulation. We have listed Nick as special needs because he currently is on life long thyroid medication which is extremely affordable. Nick has completed Heartworm treatment, and is ready to find his forever home. Nick would do fine with the right female dog- no small children or cats due to his high energy.

RED came to Angel's Rest Animal Sanctuary from a North Carolina shelter with large open wounds on his hind end.  His wounds have healed and he is ready for his new home!  RED does not seem to like cats and can be picky about his doggy friends.  He has separation anxiety when he is away from people but we think this may be able to be remedied with a home that has another dog or someone that works from home.  If you would like more information about RED or to meet him, contact us at (513) 947-2727 or adoption@angelsrestanimalsanctuary.org.

Maci came to us from a shelter in North Carolina.  She is only about 6 months old.  Belgian Malinois are known for their energy level - and Maci is at the TOP of that.  Her energy is through the roof.  She will require some training to channel that.  Maci is super friendly and sweet, she is good with other dogs, too.  Maci will require a VERY active adopter - and would excel at training classes, agility, etc.  She is still a mouthy puppy and a true Mal through and through.  Because of her energy we will only place her in a home with children over 12.  Maci will need a home with breed or similar breed experience.

Hazel is a beautiful girl of under 1.5 years.  She was rescued from a kill shelter in North Carolina.  Hazel is very loving and sweet.  She craves attention.  She is on the smaller side (60-70 lbs).  She is fine with other dogs, and would be good with children.  Hazel probably lived out doors so she will need to learn some indoor manners, but she is a pretty gentle girl, and very smart.  She walks pretty well on a leash, and is eager to please.  We just love her.  She would like an active family.

Rookie is a beautiful dog under 1.5 years old.   He came to us from a shelter in North Carolina.  Rookie was in pretty rough shape when he was brought to the shelter, very underweight and missing some hair...but he has been quickly improving with us!  He is gaining weight, and his coat is coming back - the vet believes it was just allergies.  With a couple of medicated baths, and good food he is looking great.  This dog is absolutely stunning, and will be even handsomer when he gains another 15 lbs or so.  Rookie is super sweet with people, and craves attention.  He is a very active boy.  He has had little training and probably lived outdoors so will need to learn some manners, but he is very smart!  Rookie is good with other dogs upon proper introduction.

Friendly Florez is patiently awaiting to be your perfect four-legged family member. At only one year old he was transferred to our shelter from a shelter in North Carolina. Florez knows some basic commands but can sometimes be too excited to stay sitting still. Florez has done well with dogs at the shelter but we would need to do a meet and greet with any potential canine siblings. He has already been neutered, vaccinated and micro chipped and is ready to find a home of his very own.Antietam Humane Society8513 Lyons Road Waynesboro, PA 17268717-762-9091/ Fax 717-762-0996www.antietamhumanesociety.org

Smiley Chewy is four years old and was transferred to us from a shelter in North Carolina. Sweet as can be and always wagging this guy is quite a catch and we aren't sure why he hasn't been scooped up yet. He walks well on a leash and plays gently with toys. He has done well with other dogs,cats and children while in the shelter. Chewy has been neutered, vaccinated, and micro chipped. Now he is just waiting for his forever home. Antietam Humane Society8513 Lyons Road Waynesboro, PA 17268717-762-9091/ Fax 717-762-0996www.antietamhumanesociety.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.COURTESY LISTINGTHIS IS NOT A BULLY PAWS DOG. COURTESY LISTINGS ARE LISTED BY THEIR CURRENT OWNERS OR RESCUERS AND HAVE NOT BEEN EVALUATED BY BULLY PAWS.IF THIS DOG IS CURRENTLY IN A RESCUE OR FOSTER HOME, YOU WILL SEE THE CONTACT INFORMATION BELOW. IF THERE IS NO CONTACT INFORMATION LISTED, PLEASE CONTACT OUR REHOMING COORDINATOR AT STEPHANIE@BULLYPAWS.ORG. She is approximately 7 years old -pit mix (vet thinks with boxer). I adopted her from a shelter here in North Carolina. She is spayed, microchipped, up to date on all her shots and heartworm negative. She is special needs - blind completely in her right and very limited sight in her left from cataracts but that doesn't stop her from enjoying life. She loves apples, bananas, her toys and rides in the car. She has been thru training and is quite smart.

Midnight came from a NC shelter where they were in danger of flooding from the recent Hurricane.  She is young, @ 1-2 years old.  @ 20 lbs - very sweet and friendly but scared at first.  She is doing very well with training for walking nicely on leash.  She is very good with other dogs and very playful.   She is ok with cats too!  Wonderful family companion with just a little training.  Perfect smaller dog for an apartment or townhouse.

Molly came from a NC shelter where they were in danger of flooding from the recent Hurricane.  She is young, @ 10-12 months old @ 40 lbs - very sweet and friendly but scared at first.  Molly is being fostered in a family home now and doing very well with training for walking nicely on leash and socializing.  Molly would be great with children and other dogs.   Fenced yard is required for safe off-leash play and exercise.

Who can resist this face? Sweet Pete is one of the funniest dogs I’ve ever met. This guy was adopted from Georgia and dumped in North Carolina several days later. He loves life to the fullest from getting a bath, to riding in the car and singing along with the radio, to playing with his girlfriends. He walks well on a leash (rain or shine), is crate trained and ready to make you laugh and be entertained. Love Shack Dog RescueChantilly, VA 20152Call, Text, Sabrina at 703-505-3758 Email is sdroescher@yahoo.com These are all good loving dogs who need a forever home, Help us Save them

Meet Simba, named after the character in the Disney movie The Lion King.  Simba means powerful warrior, and his name certainly suits him.  Simba was pulled from a high kill shelter in North Carolina on his very last day.  Simba came to us emaciated and covered with horrible scars and bite wounds.  Everywhere on his poor, frail body had either scabs, open wounds or scars.  We estimate Simba to be around two years old and is a bully breed mix.  He is a big eater, but does not show any food aggression or guarding at all, which is amazing considering he was nearly starved to death.  Simba would benefit from some training, as he was never taught leash manners.  He has not shown any aggression toward other dogs or cats, although he will sometimes growl if he feels threatened by another dog so a very careful and proper introduction to any other dogs will be necessary.  Considering everything he has been through, we do not blame Simba one bit for his concerns.  Simba has a wonderful personality - he is very energetic and LOVES toys.  He loves to carry his blanket around and play with it.  He will play with basically anything he can find.  Simba loves people and will sit still and soak up all the love and attention you are willing to give him.  Simba is house and crate-trained, up to date on all shots, heartworm negative and on heartworm, flea and tick prevention.  Simba clearly had a really rough past and although his body will always likely bear the scars, he did not let his past form his personality.  \"Scars remind us of where we have been, but they do not have to dictate where we are going.”  And this is certainly true for Simba.  Please consider opening your heart and home to this sweet boy and finding out for yourself what an amazing boy he is – you won’t regret it!

Meet Maverick!  Maverick is a mixed breed puppy from North Carolina.  He is likely to mature to a medium/large size, and his breed mixture is a total mystery.  Mav is very friendly, outgoing, and playful!  He lives life to the fullest - playing, romping, and just being happy to see everything there is to see.    As a puppy, Maverick will need to learn all about everything a well behaved dog should know - house training, crate training, house manners, leash walking, socialization, and polite play.  If you've got the time to dedicate to helping Maverick grow up into a wonderful canine citizen, come meet him!    Maverick's adoption fee is $600, which includes his neuter surgery, vaccines, deworming and other medical care, collar, leash, tag, and the costs of transporting him up from the southern rescue group.

Meet Smokey!  Smokey is a mixed breed puppy from North Carolina.  He is an adorable little pint size man.  Smokey is friendly, but shy at first.  Go slow with him, and he will reveal his playful side!  Because of his young age, he will need someone home most of the day to be able to socialize, supervise, and house train him.    Smokey has an overbite (his upper jaw is longer than the lower jaw) which may require medical attention as he matures - it will be important that his family is financially able to care for whatever this little cutie needs!  As a puppy, Smokey will need to learn all about everything a well behaved dog should know - house training, crate training, house manners, leash walking, socialization, and polite play.  If you've got the time to dedicate to helping Smokey grow up into a wonderful canine citizen, come meet him!   Smokey's adoption fee is $600, which includes his neuter surgery, vaccines, deworming and other medical care, collar, leash, tag, and the costs of transporting him up from the southern rescue group.

Meet Katrina!  Katrina is a mixed breed puppy from North Carolina.  She is likely to mature to a medium/large size, and her breed mixture is a total mystery.  Katrina is friendly and active.  Because of her young age, she will need someone home most of the day to be able to socialize, supervise, and house train her.    As a puppy, Katrina will need to learn all about everything a well behaved dog should know - house training, crate training, house manners, leash walking, socialization, and polite play.  If you've got the time to dedicate to helping Katrina grow up into a wonderful canine citizen, come meet her!    Katrina's adoption fee is $600, which includes her spay surgery, vaccines, deworming and other medical care, collar, leash, tag, and the costs of transporting her up from the southern rescue group.

Meet Courage!  Courage is a mixed breed puppy from North Carolina.  She is likely to mature to a medium/large size, and her breed mixture is a total mystery.  Courage is friendly and active, and a bit of a spitfire who will need lots of positive handling.  Because of her young age, she will need someone home most of the day to be able to socialize, supervise, and house train her.    As a puppy, Courage will need to learn all about everything a well behaved dog should know - house training, crate training, house manners, leash walking, socialization, and polite play.  If you've got the time to dedicate to helping Courage grow up into a wonderful canine citizen, come meet her!    Courage's adoption fee is $600, which includes her spay surgery, vaccines, deworming and other medical care, collar, leash, tag, and the costs of transporting her up from the southern rescue group.

Melody was rescued from a high kill shelter in North Carolina along with her brother Maddie. They are both five months old and they are very bonded and love to play together. We would like to see them get adopted together but it is not a requirement. If you think Melody could be a match for you and he would like to visit her at our shelter please let us know, we are located on Martha’s Vineyard

Amos is a 10 year old rescue mix from NC. This sweet playful boy loves his tennis ball. Loves people and attention. Has met some cats and is curious but so far respectful of their space. He has been fine with some of the dogs he has met. Amos seems to prefer lower energy dogs and dogs close in his size but of course, he would prefer to meet them in person to see how they connect.  Amos LOVES to go for walks with his person. Feel free to shoot us an email to schedule a meet and greet.

Meet Shaggy!Shaggy is a sweet 10 month old Retriever/Hound mix. Shaggy came to us all the way from North Carolina! When he arrived he was shy as a mouse, but he has come a long way since then. Giving him all the socialization he needs to come out of his shell. That being said our special boy would do best in a home all to himself with no other dogs. Once he gets used to you he really starts to warm up and you get to see how sweet he is. He still needs help with his hygiene and walking on a leash but, he loves the yard! Zooming around wind in his face and grass under his paws! This sweet boy would love to find his forever home and maybe you could help. Come meet shaggy and some of our other furry friends too!

This gorgeous young lady is Ursula. She came to us from North Carolina very thin and sick. Now that she has been gaining weight and getting the care she needs, she is becoming a staff and volunteer favorite. Ursula is very sweet and loving but is nervous around other dogs, so no other dogs in the home would be the best for her. She loves to get belly rubs and just hang out in the yard. If you are searching for a lovable, young, beautiful lady, then look no further. Come on down and meet her today!

This Raven is anything but dark and weary. She loves to run around in the yard and dive into the pool! Dogs are not her first choice in friends but with a little training and more socialization, she may be able to have a few dog friends. This lovely lady came to us all the way from North Carolina. If you are looking for an energetic, young lady who is always up for an adventure, come on down and meet Raven today!

Do you love sweet, mushy, loving, mellow, chunky dogs? Then look no further! Pj came to us from North Carolina. He is always happy and ready to meet new people and dog friends. Fetch is one of his favorite games to play when in the yard. It may only take a short time for him to get tired out but once he sheds a few pounds and has his summer body, he will be ready fro anything! Come and fall in love with this handsome, hunk of dog today!

Meet Little Ann!Little Ann aka Lil Ann is an adorable 6 year old Coonhound mix. lil Ann is just about the sweetest and lovable girl with the cutest name. This southern girl came to us all the way from North Carolina! She has a wonderful looking coat with a unique tail that has some peppering at the end. She loves to go on walks and play in the yard and when she does, puts her sniffer to work! She's not a barker but on occasion she may give that deep hound bark, depending on the situation. Little Ann would love for you to come visit her and maybe give her the forever home she needs. Come meet Lil Ann and the rest of the furry friends we have at Father Johns animal house.

Bucky, Male, black lab/mix, 55 lbs, 1 yr old, still very much puppy. I rescued Bucky from a shelter in NC.  He's up to date on his shots, neutered, and heartworm neg and on prevention. He's a very friendly boy, very smart.  He rode pretty nicely with having a seat belt harness and tether on in the car.  He gives lots of kisses. I learned that Bucky has separation anxiety, I will try to use a crate to see how that goes, but he certainly can't be left alone at home, free to roam. This boy would make an AWESOME dog for someone who suffers from PTSD that needs a companion animal to take everywhere with them. He is smart, friendly, loves everyone and all dogs, he's just a great boy who needs some training, but I think he could pick things up quickly,  I'm asking $200.00 to adopt. His tail never stops wagging. Oh and he likes cats and kids too!!!!  If you'd like to adopt Bucky, please email me at ess4us@ptd.net or for more info call me at 570-773-3077. THANKS for looking!

Meet Morticia!FHDR rescued Morticia and her siblings from a high kills shelter in NC and they are now living in foster homes in NJ.  The puppies are about 12-14 weeks old and they were owner surrendered because of the owner’s poor health.  The owner told the shelter their mom is AKC Belgain Malinois and the guess is their dad is some type of a mix, maybe lab mix. Morticia has a shinny black coat with white under her chin, chest and her paws are white with spots of black.  She currently weighs 26-27 pounds.Morticia’s foster family says….”Morticia is friendly, sweet and playful!  Play, play play is what Morticia wants to do!  She loves running around and playing with my dogs, her sister and toys (especially balls). She will throw her ball around and chase it, it’s so cute!  Morticia enjoys going for walks and taking long nap afterwards. She is a outgoing puppy who loves meeting everyone. And, she is an affectionate puppy who likes to be with you and cuddle.  Morticia goes crazy for belly rubs and will walk over to you and roll over on her belly.  She is even good with my cats.  Morticia sleeps through the night without having accidents and she is 95% house trained.  We just adore her!”Morticia will win you over with her charm!p> THE BREED THIS PET IS LISTED AS IS OUR BEST GUESS AS WE HAVE NO BACKGROUND INFO ON WHO THE MOM OR DAD ARE. We do not have a shelter facility you can visit.  Our volunteers foster the dogs and pups in their private homes once they have been vetted and transported here. Please read our homepage to see how the adoption process works. If interested in adopting this pet, please e-mailFHDR@att.net and request an adoption application.Please note we do not adopt puppies/dogs to homes where they will be alone all day.

REECE is a loving, energetic 6 yo/15 lb female spayed MinPin who was rescued from a backyard breeder in Hickory North Carolina. She is house and crate trained. Loves to play with toys and talks to you when she wants something. She is looking for a family with older children and possibly another dog around her size. Won't you come meet her and possibly fall in love.There is an adoption process consisting of an application, home visit, contract and adoption fee. Wilma's Orphans is a 501c3 Not for Profit rescue organization. Any and all donations are tax deductible. If you are interested in this dog go towww.wilmasorphans.com for the link to the adoption application.

Meet Fred! Fred is a year old Hound mix from NC. Fred found himself as a stray and ended up at the county shelter. Eleventh Hour Rescue saw him and now he is restarting his life in NJ. He is a sweet boy who gets along with other dogs. Life on the streets was hard for Fred who had to fight for the resources to survive. As a result, he can guard his food from fear of losing it and for this reason should not be in a home with small children. But he is an absolutely wonderful dog who just needs some time and patience to learn that he's no longer living in a world where everything is at risk of being taken away from him.If you would like to meet with Fred, be sure to go to our website, EHRDOGS.ORG, and fill out an application. Don't forget to mention his name, FRED BLADEN!

Mommy Ginger and her 6 puppies were rescued from a high kill shelter in NC.These adorable Lab mix puppies will be coming to us the weekend of March 8th. They will.be ready for adoption soon after that. We need fosters and foster to adopt homes!Puppies are adorable and sweet. They will be 6 months old when arriving Please email us at pickyourpaw@gmail.com for more info on fostering or adopting these cutieswww.pickyourpaw.org for a foster/adoption application

Tina was rescued from NC just before Hurricane Florence hit - she actually made it out just one day before the storm.  She's a sweet, middle aged girl of about 4 or 5 who is slow to warm up and enjoys  human companionship.  She's medium sized and weighs about 50-55 lbs, is spayed and vaccinated,  housebroken and crate trained, although she doesn't need to be crated.   Tina's issue is that,  sometime in her past, another dog or dogs weren't so nice to her and she is fearful.  Her defense is showing aggression towards other dogs.  She could successfully be walked on a leash in a park or neighborhood where there are other dogs,  and she walks very well on a leash,  but she will do best not having to closely interact with other dogs.  She,  therefore,  needs to be an only dog. She is a low-key, low maintenance  dog and will make her person or family very happy.  She also loves belly rubs!! If you'd like to meet Tina and get an application to adopt her,  please send an email to jerseygirlsanimalrescue@gmail.com.

Bella and her siblings Belle, Buddy, Annabell, Thompson and Jake were rescued from a North Carolina kill shelter just before Hurricane Florence was about to hit.Since coming to NJ, Bella has been living with a foster family and is really doing great. She is wonderful with kids and other dogs. She gets along with cats too. She loves to cuddle and is especially snuggly at night, preferring to sleep on the bed with you.Bella needed and received FHO surgery on both hips but she's all healed up now, running around like a puppy and doing great.A very sweet pup, she loves to play and is eager to please, but is not happy away from her humans and so would do better in a home where she is not alone for very long during the day. She also thrives in the company of other dogs so we are looking to place Bella in a home with at least one (or more) other canine brother or sister.If you are interested in giving this sweet girl a home, please apply now and mention BELLA BLADEN!

A super sweet 5 yr old Black Lab Mix & 70 lbs of pure baby love.  This sweet boy has seen some tough times but has come through and is doing great.  He was found as a stray nearly starved and no hair on his back. He had raw sores on his neck, head and back. It was also evident by his raw neck that  he had been kept on a chain. With the gracious help of a rescue and foster family, Baxter has made a tremendous recovery over the past 2 months.  He is LOVING dog life~ he plays like a puppy & loves his bone and toys. He gets along with our other dogs (took slow introductions and a little time). He also gets along with cats. Mostly just curious but doesn’t chase.Baxter is still somewhat fearful of the outdoors at times. He still gets skittish and nervous when on walks but is getting better over time.  He is also nervous around unfamiliar people. He will need a patient and loving person / family to help continue with his rehab and recovery. Most of his fur has grown back and he is looking so beautiful.He would do well with a home where someone is home during the day and he would also do better with a home that has  another furry dog companion. He is not aggressive but loves to run, play and engage in dog play. *We wouldn’t recommend Baxter go to a home with small children. The foster family is willing to help with introductions and transition. They are located in Union County in the Charlotte area.

Cali regularly sees her vet and is up to date on all health requirements including rabies and heartworm testing. She receives heartworm and flea preventative every month. Cali does have hypothyroidism which is regulated by taking daily ThyroTabs. We have not had any other health issues with her. She does well with adults and other dogs. She is boarded regularly when we travel and she always receives good report cards. She does not do well with children. I have also included photos of her. 48 lbsMy name is Melanie Dreher and I am in a difficult situation with my dog Cali. Cali, is an 8 year old spayed shepherd/hound mix that we adopted from the humane society of Charlotte when she was 8 weeks old. When Cali was around 4 years old we started having behavioral issues with her starting with her nipping a friend that jumped down and scared her. Cali has always been slightly wary around bones/food. We immediately contacted Dog Wizard of Charlotte and enrolled Cali in a behavioral training program. She went with the trainer for 2 weeks and did really well. Cali has made great improvements and does well when we board her at pet paradise. She always receives positive report cards towards staff and other dogs.  Since then we have had a child. We have always been careful about their interactions together, constant supervision, no food or toys around her. We had a very scary incident last night where Cali growled at our 3 year old and tried to bite her after our daughter attempted to pet her back. We are heartbroken and don’t know what to do. I received this email from a rescue friend in hopes for some advice.  Thank you for the time to review this email.

This is Sadona.  She is a two year old (born 6/21/16) spayed female terrier mix, and she weighs 41.8 pounds.  Sadona was saved being euthanized the day she was pulled from a shelter in North Carolina.  She is a sweet girl, and she will make a great pet for a family.  Sadona's adoption fee is $250.  PLEASE CHOOSE SADONA TO BE YOUR NEW BEST FRIEND!

My name means north, but I’m actually just a sweet southern belle from down south! Hey y’all, I’m Kita.  I’m currently one of the residents here at the Animal Resource Center.  I’m a Labrador mix and I’m four years young.  I’m a pretty as a peach curvy brunette of 65lbs (more to love)!As I mentioned before, I’m just a good ol’ southern gal!  I am originally from North Carolina, but the shelter I was at there decided to transfer me up north.  So I find myself here now, but I am happy to hear that this place has a pretty good track record of finding good homes for bigger dogs like me so I’m fixin’ to find a forever home soon.  I’m also happy it’s almost summer because heavens to Betsy I sure do miss that warm and sunny weather! So let me tell you more about myself.  I am a nice gal and a lady on the leash.  I also know some basic commands such as sit and of course a southern girl like me knows how to shake as well.  It’s that polite southern hospitality in me. I enjoy treats and long strolls. I can get a little nippy when I’m being playful and excited.It’s been a long journey for me but I hope to find a permanent forever home soon where I will be loved and can rest my head peacefully every night.  If interested in making my acquaintance please contact Vicki at (570) 204-6355 or Vicki@nokillarc.org to set up an appointment.  Please don’t forget to tell Vicki a little about yourself, and I look forward to meeting you soon!***Kita is spayed, utd on vaccinations, microchipped and has had a blood parasite screening(If contacting Vicki by phone please leave a message and kindly allow 24 hours for response)

Karma was saved from North Carolina where she spent her life chained to a tree.  . She is a sweet girl that LOVES to play and be near you.  She’s house trained and knows basic commands.  . Karma, while perfect, needs to be an only dog.  She does not think the world is big enough for other animals.  She's very playful and silly.  Karma has a stage four heart murmur and is on custom allergy meds.  both of which are under control.    Karma is spayed, microchipped and current on her shots.

Snow is a real southern belle waiting for her forever family!  She was rescued from high kill gassing facility in North Carolina.  Snow is a super-sweet girl who loves to have a great time! She loves to play and run, she is high energy.   Snow loves other dogs and cats. She is attentive to her person, but also very aware of her surroundings. She is obedient and quick to learn, as well as eager to please.Snow is about a 18 months old, spayed, UTD on all vaccines and microchipped.  Snow will not do well on a farm or around large animals or livestock.  If you would like to meet Snow, please contact us!

PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COMMaya is a beautiful silky terrier who came to us in early 2019 from a NC kill shelter.  She had been picked up as a stray and sadly had mammary tumors.  We have been able to have these tumors surgically addressed and removed, and each was benign.  Maya has recovered from surgery and is now ready to find her forever home.  She is a young girl, 1-2 years old, and weighs just under 13 pounds.Maya is in good health.  She has been spayed, microchipped, given all vaccines and has had blood tests to rule out heartworms and tick borne illnesses.CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

Tripawd! This little lady only has 3 legs, but don’t tell her that! She never lets that get in her way. She can go on walks and her previous owner even took her on a few hikes – with plenty of breaks when that back leg got tired. However, Arcadia will happily entertain herself with squeaky toys or an antler bone. If toys are present, she never puts any inappropriate household items in her mouth.She is house trained and a quick study with tricks and training. She knows basic house manners, can sit, lay down, and will even go to her crate on cue! She also has a solid “go to bed” behavior and will stay there even when her dinner is being served until she is released with an “okay.”Most of all, this little lady is a lover. She loves to cuddle and be near her person. Pets are awesome, but belly rubs are just the bees knees. She is sweet with small children and babies – who she loves to sniff and give kisses to. Arcadia would do best in a home without dogs or cats.Will you give this beautiful lady the chance she deserves?Reason for re-homing? I am selling my house and moving in to an apartment. With Arcadia’s fear of other dogs, I know it would not be fair to move in to a dog friendly apartment complex where she could be faced with that fear on a daily basis. At the moment, I just don’t have the money or time to work with a trainer on this issue.Arcadia is located in Asheville, NC. For more info, reach out to Megan at 412-737-4011.ARCBCR courtesy lists dogs for individual owners, other rescues, and shelters wishing to place their Border Collies or Border Collie-mixes themselves.These dogs are not in the ARCBCR program.ARCBCR does not warranty any of the information provided about the following dogs. Should any issues arise, ARCBCR will not be held responsible. Fees requested and policies may differ from ARCBCR.

Jackie is a beautiful young Chocolate Lab mix in search of a family looking for a fun, affectionate, smart, strong girl! Jackie was just rescued from a rural shelter in NC on the day she was scheduled to be euthanized.  She had been forced to live outside all her life but she's very eager to learn and please her humans.   She is currently in boarding where she is doing well, she is friendly and sweet with the staff and enjoys the other dogs around her, She's been tested with some other dogs and did quite well--was social and polite. Jackie is approximately 50 lbs and is active and playful and would probably love to hike or run with you, as well as play couch potato in front of the TV.  She will make a wonderful pet for a fun-loving, active owner.  She has so much to offer her humans. A fenced yard is a must with this girl. She loves her outdoor time and to explore.  It would be the best of both worlds!She is UTD on vaccines, heartworm negative, and spayed.  Unknown if cat friendly, but she did meet some young children and enjoyed them.If you would be interested in fostering Jackie, please email Valerie at valeriebond@hotmail.com.
Scotch came to us from Mecklenburg animal control weight in 51 pounds and 7 years old.  heartworm positive almost done with treatment.
Baron came to us from Mecklenburg animal control weight in 52 pounds and 4 years old. Very friendly

Reesewas due to be put down within hours of being pulled from a shelter in NC in April 2012. She was heartworm positive and very sick. She is completely healthy now and microchipped, spayed, and up-to-date on vaccinations. She is around 5 years old and about 40 lbs. She is dog reactive and would benefit from training to help her overcome her fear of other dogs. She has not been around cats, so we're not sure how she would act. Reese has been around children ages 2-17 years and does fine with them. However, we probably would not recommend a home with small children because she does have a lot of energy. She tends to jump up on people, which we are working on. She is crate and house trained. Reese needs to go a home with a family who is active because she loves to run with her foster mom. She does well on a leash. She loves to play, but also loves to cuddle. Reese is a survivor and looking for her forever family.If you are that special, active family, please call Esther or Dallas at 757-583-8777 or e-mail rainbowanimalrescue@cox.net.6/24/19 5:49 PM

Rafe is a 7 month  old 22 pound hound mix and is neutered,  up to date on his vaccines, heart worm negative and micro chipped. You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Darci is available for adoption. This middle age girl is so SWEEEET. She came from a shelter in Ohio. She was a medical mess and needed some extra TLC. We got her spayed, and removed a few tumor/mass cells on her body. One of the mass cells that removed from her leg, came back as a stage 2, and we were not able to get clean margins on that tumor. (the other tumors we did get clean margins on them). So this particular spot on her leg, will need to have a watchful eye on it. There is a chance it may come back. But we don't know if, and when it will She can still live a very long life, with a quality life. Also, we have discovered she may some have allergies, as she does chew on her feet on occasions. We also treated her infected ears and got that infection cleared up.Darci is about 5 years old. She is a beautiful white girl with a very loving personality. She loves all people and always wants to be with you. Whoever adopts her, will simple fall in love with this girl. She would love to be someone's lap dog and will follow you around the house, just to say HI and be your shadow. Once she warms up to people, she does like playing with toys. She is great with kids and has not shown much interest in cats. Bonus !!! She is good with other dogs, but can be food aggressive, only with other dogs. Not humans. So if you are looking to adopt her, and you do have another dog, you will need to feed the dogs in a separate room to keep things nice and quiet. She is crate trained, can hear, is housebroken and knows all her basic commands.With the potential of her one mass returning on her leg, her adoption fee will only be $100. But like it was mentioned, we simple do not have a crystal ball, to say if and when it will return. We just know this doll of a girl, will make anyone happy who has the desire to welcome her into their home.

Dino is a very young energetic boy! Only about a year old and full of mischief! He is most liekly a min pin mix, and we are guessing he has some type of small terrier in him to give him the white patches. He is all legs and LOVES to play and run! A fenced yard is a must for this boy. He knows some basic commands, but is still in need of more lessons how to be a great family member. He is still very young! We would recommend some postive training classes to help him learn. He can get a bit sassy when he wants to do his own thing but responds well to redirection and positive reinforcement. He does love people and to settle down after playing to cuddle and snooze. Dino is potty trained and crate trained. Now for his \"special needs\" story. Dino does have megaesophagus. he needs to be fed multiple small meals a day in his elevated feeder and water stand. This will come with him. He has lots of life and love to give! He is definitely worth the little bit of extra care he needs to stay healthy. Dino is located in Holland Ohio and is available for adoption. To apply to adopt go to www.tinyurl.com/mpmrapp

Delia is an eight pound 3 yr old Havanese rescued from an Ohio Amish puppy mill.  She is shy and is still learning how great life can be outside a cage.  She made nice progress in her foster home and was adopted, but it was not the best fit.  We think Delia will do best in a home with another dog to help boost her confidence and show her the ropes.  While petite, she is speedy so good mobility in her owner will also be a priority for placement.She is back with her foster mom and will need ongoing time and patience building trust, house-training, and learning to leash walk.  She is very food motivated, so this should continue to move her forward.  She is great with dogs of all sizes and cats.Delia's adoption fee is $350.   She was spayed, microchipped, vaccinated, and had a dental.  To apply to adopt her, go to htpps://cvcaninerescue.org/applicationWe are an all volunteer rescue, 100% of your fee goes directly to the dogs.

This lovely lady meatball came to us from an overflowing shelter in Ohio where she was running out of time to find a home. She is 1 year old and 55lbs, loves people and other dogs, and is very outgoing and affectionate. If you want to be greeted every day with instant wiggle-butt and do not value your personal space on the couch, Coco is your girl. She is pretty laid back most of the time save for the occasional bout of zoomies, but she is very curious and loves to explore outside so would love a fenced yard to roam, regular walks, and the occasional hiking adventure.She loves playing with other dogs but she does tend to get jealous of other female dogs in her territory so should be the only dog in the home or placed with a compatible male. She will have to meet any resident dogs before adoption to make sure they get along. She has not been cat tested.Coco's new family should be committed to providing the structure she has been lacking in her life and be willing to train her to be her best. With love and training, Coco will be a wonderful companion for a very lucky family.If Coco sounds like a good match for you, please fill out the adoption application at k9orphans.org to meet her!

Bosco was born in the summer of 2010 and was pulled from the Athens dog pound. This handsome little fella would be a great lap dog for a retired couple or a quiet household without small children. He is very laid back, loves to sit in your lap and enjoys belly rubs above all. If you are looking for an easygoing companion please consider making Bosco a part of your life. For more information, please contact Peace Love and Animals :)

Age:   5yrApproximate Wgt:   70To RSQ by:  pet parent passed awayBIO:     We brought Lady here to WA from Ohio in 2016 as part of our ReLocate to ReHome Project.  Her adopter had been looking for a Siberian Husky blend companion sister for Buddy, her Siberian Husky blend.  Lady fit in well with Buddy and the 2 kitties.  Her parent Mom adored her and Lady adored her new Mom.  Fast forward 2 years and Lady and Buddy and the kitties were mourning the  loss of their Mom after a very brief terminal illness.   Their Mom asked that Buddy remain a resident of Canyon Pet Lodge and that we find new great homes for the kitties and Lady.  The kitties were rehomed through a wonderful cat rescue and are happy in their new homes.  Buddy will remain a resident of Canyon Pet Lodge  Lady has attended Camp Bark DayCamp daily since 2016.  She is excellent with all large breed dogs of all ages and both genders.  She is a \"test\" dog because of her great temperament.  We do not recommend small dogs as Lady has a bit of prey drive.  She could live with a small dog companion with a savvy parent only.  She can live with cats, but be warned, she may chase them until she gets used to them.  Dominant cat companions would be best.  She is excellent with humans of all ages.  Our wish is that Lady find a home in the Puyallup area and that she attend Camp Bark DayCamp at least a couple of days a week to be able to visit with Buddy, her 14 year old Husky blend sibling.  Please complete our online application to adopt this pet:  http://rescuealab.formstack.com/forms/application_to_adopt

Sweet Pea is a senior Chihuahua rescued from an Oklahoma kill-facility by Tiny Miracles Rescue, with her pal Thomas.   Sweet Pea is a super teensy itsy-bitsy 4.5 lbs! Sweet Pea is a total sweetheart; nicely socialized and ready for your lap! Sweet Pea has the softest fur and makes the cutest little chirps when she wants your attention.  Sweet Pea is great with other calm dogs and cats, rides nicely in the car, and doesn’t even mind taking baths in the kitchen sink! Sweet Pea is looking for a loving, calm child-free home in which to happily live out her sunset years.  Sweet Pea has a bestie named Thomas  (who is also available if you want a ready made family of littles)!  Let us know if you'd like to meet this sweet senior pair of pocket pups!  Foster mom has tons of pictures, just ask!  Sweet Pea is spayed,  heartworm negative and up to date on core vaccines. As with all rescue animals, breed determination cannot be validated without genetic testing. Visit www.tinymiraclesrescue.org  and click on the APPLY tab for an overview of Tiny Miracles adoption process. Thanks for adopting and saving a life -- you are Sweet Pea's hero!

Looking for a well behaved, gentle, trained companion dog that is good with young children? Meet Jack. He enjoys walks, snuggling, car rides, playing with toys, enjoys being close with his owner. Jack is a 10 year old, retired plantation hunting dog, approximately 55 pounds, heartworm negative on monthly preventative, and up to date on shots. He was neutered in August 2018 and microchipped. Originally from Oklahoma, currently living and a foster family in north western Pennsylvania, Jack has adjusted to the snow belt well. He can be tied out briefly to go potty and is not a barker. Jack knows the word no and promptly complies. He enjoys going on walks and sticks close to you in the yard. Jack is housebroken, crate trained, and very quiet. He is very quick to catch onto routines, follows them without any instructions, and goes right into his kennel knowing that he’s going to get a yummy treat. Jack should be in a cat free home. If you have another dog, the dog would just have to be chilled and very relaxed - not an Alfa type. A fenced yard would be best to keep Jack safe and give him the freedom to explore, but isn’t absolutely necessary.If you are loving, can supply joint supplements, good food, and an orthopedic bed , I will be forever yours. Fill out our adoption application!!http://www.pointerrescue.org/adopt.htmlTRANSPORT AVAILABLE TO APPROVED HOMES! Through no fault of his own, Larry's new family has had some serious setbacks and he is back in rescue.  He needs his own family! Sit. CHECK. Stay. Semi CHECK. I can’t help that I’m a puppy and want to play. I do like to learn though and my people think that I’ll be a great candidate for flyball or agility. I’m definitely one smart cookie and love to learn. I don’t remember a lot about my past. The folks at Hazeljane’s Blessings pulled me from a shelter in Oklahoma. I am currently being fostered in New Jersey and made a trip across part of the country thanks to an awesome group of volunteers. Since being here, I have been learning how to trust again. There is definitely some setbacks for me, but I’m very eager to overcome them with the right family standing next to me.if you think Larry is the dog you've been looking for, go to www.hazeljane.com/adopt and fill out an application!

Looking for your next snuggle buddy? Jackson is your man. Jackson is his next home after a natural disaster brought him from Tusla, Oklahoma to Charlottesville. Jackson has meet other dogs on leash and seems to be fan of the kiddos. Jackson calm and gentle dameanor would make him a great fit for almost any household.
