Let us start out by saying...WE CAN'T BELIEVE SID IS NOT ADOPTED YET!  He is just that wonderful...he turns heads wherever he goes, children flock to him and feed him snacks on the street, and he literally stops traffic (we are not exaggerating!).  He arrived in NYC from Oman in mid-April, and a full month later, we are still searching for his forever home.   Sid is athletic and energetic and would benefit from being a part of an active household.  He is easily trainable and highly intelligent, learning how to go off-leash in a matter of days after arriving in NYC.  He gets along very nicely with other dogs, and overcame a former fear of men, and gets along well with all humans.  Being from the desert, he never saw vegetation before and loves grass and flowers (and will also eat them with delight).  He is really the perfect dog--it pains us to give him up, but we must make room for other rescued dogs and give Sid a chance at a forever home.  Sid is the biggest of his litter, and at 5.5 months old as of mid- May 2019, he is already quite tall.  We anticipate that he will be around 52 -56 cm tall when he is full grown, so he's going to be a big boy.  Here are videos of him since arriving in NYC:https://www.amazon.com/photos/shared/58MGww4TRmq8GQ3l5FluFw.ZHFrv-jmW_IcPnlrnaWqJUHere are videos of him with his sisters at an adoption event in Union Square on 5/19/2019.  He caught a lot of people's attention that day...but he is still not adopted!https://www.amazon.com/photos/shared/PsfqsTqKSp-ST9LiTCHYaQ.zIT7s1JVY1ZKDZK5u1IVu1Pics of Sid's bath time (on the street--he remains calm and well behaved): https://www.amazon.com/photos/shared/ykUcsXXoRBqV4gnVaqQ1mw.j9Flh6bqckCQ5odIdmfI_SIf you are interested in fostering OR adopting this special puppy, please reach out to us at FurRealNYC@gmail.com.  About Treatment of Dogs in Oman:Police officers in Oman drive around and legally shoot dogs in packs as part of organized culling projects.  Those who are lucky enough to escape the firing squad are often killed when discovered, or killed by forced starvation by being brought to the middle of the desert and abandoned with no resources.  Dogs have zero rights there, and the kind humans who help them are few and far between. About the breed:The Omani Wadi dog is specific to Oman.  Originally descended from the Saluki, the breed eventually mixed with many other breeds, such as Canaan Dogs and other breeds of abandoned dogs, and is now its own unique type. This type of dog is extremely clever, loyal, and loving. The breed is also energetic, so they would do well with a family that has room for them to run and/or who will exercise them. Some of them can go on daily 6 mile runs and even further.  This is not to suggest that they are restless by default, but would probably do well with people who like to walk, run, or ride bikes. When socialized properly at an early age, they can get along with other dogs, cats and people, as well as animals like guinea pigs or even turtles.  The breed truly is limitless in its ability to adapt and learn new things.

Tad is a 6 month old Saluki mix. He traveled here from the country of Oman in search of safety and a loving home. Tad is a friendly, loving pup. He's utd on shots and neutered. He loves to run and play outside and enjoys all the belly rubs he can get. Tad is a medium energy dog. He needs continued socialization with other dogs as he grows. He likes toys and laying on a dog bed snoozing. He's crate and house trained. This is a special boy! Please fill out an application at doubledogdarerescue.org to meet Tad.

Snoopy is a very sweet and loving pup we rescued from Oman.  His entire family was shot by the police (that's how population control of dogs is done in Oman).  He was the only survivor.  He was rescued by a good samaritan and taken to the ER,  After some time in the ER he was well he was taken in by a volunteer rescue organization in Oman.  We partner with other rescues to help place dogs.  Snoopy is a very loving boy who unfortunately given the trauma he experienced at such a young age suffers from ptsd and some separation anxiety.  He gets along with most dogs, but gets overwhelmed in dog park situations or if there are too many dogs or people.  He would do best in a home (single family home) with a fully fenced in yard and a predictable routine.   He is a high energy pup who needs a spacious fenced in yard.  He loves to chase birds and squirrels for hours.  His favorite thing to do inside is to snuggle next to his human.   He is very affectionate.   Snoopy is around 30 lbs...he's 1.5 yrs old.  He is up to date on vaccines, preventatives, neutered and micro-chipped.  If you are interested in Snoopy,  please email Breshkie@dogworldrescue.com for more info.  We are an all volunteer rescue with a $350 adoption fee which is paid directly to our vet's office.

Name: LeroyApproximate Age: 4yrsBreed: Labrador retriever mixSex: MaleSpecial Needs: NoneAdoption fee: $325Up to date vaccinations/preventatives. Housebroken. Microchipped. Neutered.What I may be lacking in size (Im only 40lbs) I make up for in energy! Playing Frisbee & fetch are probably my favorite things ever- with the exception of people, I do love people! Im pretty sure Im one of my fosters favorites since I am so lovable & honestly the perfect size-not too big, not too small! I do get along with the majority of dogs, as long as theyre not too dominant but I do have a pretty high prey drive so no cats or any other small animals would be best because you can be sure Im going to chase them!Transport to any approved home within the US can be provided at no additional fee.Currently Leroy is located in Florence, Oregon Please visit SNARRANIMALRESCUE.org to fill out an application. Our adoption process/requirements can also be found there.

HARLEY (A sweet mellow gentleman)Gender: MaleAge: 8 years (DOB: 08-05-10)Size/Weight: 63 lbs, 24” at shouldersColor: TriBreed: English SetterSocialization/Training: Harley is good with all people. He is very much a people person. He is well trained especially off leash. He’s getting better but still needs work on his leash walking. Harley is a professionally trained hunting dog but hasn’t hunted in a couple years. He is very good and responsive at recall. According to his previous owner he has a very good nose but is a bit unreliable at retrieving. He was trained to an electronic collar. He is crate trained, and has a travel crate that will come with him if you like. We are working on “sit” for his dinner bowl. He’s not perfect yet but most of the time he remembers without being told. Harley is house broken, never an accident. When I first got him he alerted at the door when he needed to go out. Once he learned the dog door he uses it whenever he needs to go out. He holds himself when he is in his create.Harley is ok with other dogs. He’ll stand his ground if there is an issue. He’s not really interested in other dogs, doesn’t really like to share his person with them, or play with them. He lived for 8 years as an only dog and would be best as an only dog. He has strong prey drive and would be best in a home without cats.Activity Level: Harley is very mellow and not high energy. He does like to explore and roll in the grass/dirt/leaves. He likes to go for walks and car rides. He is reported to love water. Someone who has room for a bit of romping and or swimming would be nice, or someone that will take him for hikes, walks or swimming would be nice.Fence: Harley will wander and hunt if not confined so a fence would be best. Harley is not a fence jumper, so a high block wall probably won’t be necessary.Behavior: Harley loves his people and will run to the neighbors to say hi. He likes to be hugged: no tensing up or wiggling for this guy he melts right into you without leaning all his weight on you. He loves to be petted and will climb into your lap now and again. He will be your shadow. He likes to be on the couch but hasn’t been allowed on the bed. He is not one to gaze deeply into your eyes but he is definitely affectionate. For some reason people like to hug him, and I’ve seen him get more kisses on the top of his head than any other dog. Even from people that I’ve never seen kiss a dog before. Just something about this gentle, mellow boy.Like all pups he has a couple of things that need more work: He likes to get tissues out of the bathroom trash and shred them. Now and again he will try and jump on you (getting much better there); now and again out of the blue he will counter surf. And he likes to go outside and bark at nothing in particular especially when I’m gone. I have been crating him when I leave, and is he very good with crating, but he might be best in a home where there is someone home most of the time. He does really well at being bathed, and having his ears flushed. He is a work in progress with teeth brushing.Medical History: Harley came to me with a chronic open wound. The wound was cultured and he had surgery.  That seems to be doing very well.He was very stiff and had trouble getting into the truck when he came to me. I have put him on some joint supplements and he is doing so much better. He isn’t as stiff and he is building up his muscles again. The best home for him would be with someone willing and capable of keeping him on the supplements.He came from Oregon and I was told that he didn’t have allergies; however, here we are just starting the allergy season and I’ve noticed that he seems to be licking his feet a lot. So he might have environmental seasonal allergies depending on where he lives.Foster Comments: Harley is so sweet and such a people oriented, mellow, gentle dog. He is easy to love and wants to please. He is well trained and generally very obedient. He is such a sweet boy. For the most part he needs just a bit of attention to a couple of training issues.Adoption Fee: $275.00

Lina is a 7 yr old Cattle/Hound dog , fully vetted and absolutely gorgeous.  This lady came to the rescue all the way from Oregon!!!  She is super friendly and UBER Smart.  She needs to be the only dog in the home.  This precious girl has personality plus, would make an excellent companion, hiking partner, running mate, all around out door friend.

Action Jaxson here and let me tell you my story. I just came to BHS from a shelter in Allegheny County where I spent the last 5 years!!! Yep, that's right, 5 whole years hoping that some day I would get lucky and find a human of my own who will love me. I'm very active and playful and I bet I could be an agility star with how much I like to run and jump. Tennis balls are one of my favorite things along with getting attention from people I meet. I'm pretty smart and I know how to sit, go down and give paw. Comfy beds also make me happy but I would be the happiest if a human would stand in front of my kennel area and say...You're going home with me Jaxson!! Please visit me soon so I can know the feeling of a safe and loving home. Update: I was adopted recently but had to come back due to the other dog being pretty selective so...I'm back at the shelter hoping to find a home again. Can it be with you?

Robby came to us as a stray from the city of Philadelphia. It sadly appears this boy was kept mostly outdoors. Since coming to us at BEAR he has finally started to put on some much needed weight. So far Robby has been easy to handle and enjoys being pet and given attention. As we get to know this big boy we will post updates, so please check back soon. Are you interested in adopting this Akita? Please go to our website under available Akitas and fill out an online adoption application. Please be sure to completely fill out the form before submitting.

This handsome boy is Choco. We were able to rescue him from an over crowded Philadelphia shelter. Choco has a medium energy, loves people and is very content just to be with you. He loves his walks and will make a nice walking partner. After living in the city, Choco would love a nice fenced yard of his own. He is very housebroken and has good manners too. Shelter life in the city can be tough, and we are thrilled to be able to give Choco a fresh opportunity to find a family of his own to love. If you are looking for a chill, adult dog who is already trained and has a friendly demeanor, then Choco is here waiting to meet you.To fill out an adoption application, please go to our website, www.vaonj.org and click on  Adopt and then Adoption. Please complete the form and bring it with you when you visit our shelter, and don't forget to put the Orphan’s name on the form.  Thanks!  Our pets are spayed or neutered, microchipped and up-to-date on vaccines prior to going to their new homes. For more information on our adoption procedures, please visit, www.vaonj.org.NOT READY TO ADOPT, BUT WOULD LIKE TO HELP? Voorhees Animal Orphanage will continue to care for this pet until it is adopted. Help support this pet with a donation. Please go to www.vaonj.org, click on How to Help and then Donate.ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX-DEDUCTIBLE.On behalf of the animals, we thank you!

Hi it’s Cuddly Cece! I was rescued from a beach in Puerto Rico by the President of Paws4Survival. A whole bunch of us were living there as strays, now we’re so happy to be rescued! I am so, so grateful...I just love to give kisses and cuddle. I am 7 months old and just over 20 lbs. I’ll be a “mini-lab” when full grown — the perfect sato size. I think toys are THE BEST (well, second to cuddling) and I get along great with other dogs. I am very sweet, and I’m told everyone falls in love with me right away! I feel a little shy at busy events, but when I'm meeting people one-on-one, I am the friendliest little love. I am currently fostered in Wakefield, Massachusetts. I am fully vetted, vaccinated, spayed, and microchipped. If you’re interested in meeting me, please fill out our online app:www.Paws4Survival.com/dog-application

Experienced adopter needed for Leeloo.  Leeloo had a rough start.  She and her two sisters were rescued from a beach in Puerto Rico as babies.  They were fortunate enough  to be found by one of our volunteers.    Leeloo is 33-pounds and about 5-6 years old, spayed, healthy and UTD.  She is very sweet with her older canine sister Cleo and the young cat in the house.  She has never adapted to living in NYC and needs to be somewhere quieter. A home with a backyard would best.  Leeloo easily bonded to her mom but unfortunately she is no longer able to take care of her.  If you  live in a quiet area with a small family (children 12 and up only) and would if you can give Leeloo a chance, please let us know.  Email Beth at: beth.strayfromtheheart@gmail.com

COME MEET ADOPTABLE DOGS EVERY SATURDAY AND SUNDAY from 10AM - 4PM at the Homeward Trails Adoption Center- 11116 Fairfax Station Road, Fairfax Station VA 22039! **Note that puppies are in foster homes, not at the Adoption Center.In an effort to save more lives, HT is allowing expedited adoptions for certain animals if applicants bring required paperwork. You can bring your new family member home more quickly by bringing your current pets' vet records, a copy of your lease or landlord letter stating you are permitted to have pets, and photos of your home. Help us help you adopt more quickly!If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out our dog adoption questionnaire and e-mail it to AdoptionCenter@homewardtrails.org.PLEASE VISIT THIS WEBSITE TO FIND THE ADOPTION QUESTIONNAIRE: http://www.homewardtrails.org/adopt-a-pet/adoption-forms/Pandora was removed with her daughter Eve from a horrible home in Puerto Rico. The people had them tied up under their house and would feed them leftovers. A rescue group in Puerto Rico intervened and threatened them with dog abuse charges if they didn’t surrender them. Both are safe with now and looking for loving homes.Adoption Coordinator: Homeward Trails Adoption CenterBreed Estimate: Min pin mixGender: FemaleApproximate weight: 18 lbsApproximate age: 3 yearsLocation: Homeward Trails Adoption CenterCratetrained:Coat Type: ShortPersonality: The adoption fee for this dog is $375. This fee INCLUDES spay/neuter and microchip. Every adopted Homeward Trails animal comes with 30 days of free pet health insurance. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals.Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter.We also provide a 30-minute phone consult with a professional dog trainer at Fur-Get Me Not within the first 30 days of adopting - just for HT adopters in the Arlington/Alexandria area. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE!You can save animals like this one by becoming a foster! Fosters are like way stations between high kill shelters and forever homes. We need fosters so that we can save dogs before they are euthanized at the shelters. If you are interested in becoming a foster, please check out our information about fostering by visiting http://www.homewardtrails.org/foster-a-pet/dog-and-cat-foster-program/

Meet Cometa saved with mama Nova and his siblings. Covered in demodex mange they were rescued from the road side ditch they were born in all the way in Puerto Rico. Now they are treated recovered and ready for family life! Cometa can be a little fearful of new friends which may be from his rough start or just the \"fear period\" so many dogs go through. Being about 5/6 months now it's possible. But either way he needs a  home ready to help him through this. He is great with his main handlers at the rescue. Age appropriately House broken and crate trained. He phenomenal with other dogs. Fine around cats. No toddlers as he is barky with them but fine with older children. He needs a calmer lifestyle and a fenced yard would be a plus. Having been born out doors I swear hed still live outside if I let him! Very quiet in the yard unless giving an alarm bark when new people enter the yard. Come meet this perfect new best friend. He is my shadow and I know that he will be yours too!

Missy is a 6 month old sight hound mix puppy from Qatar. She is gentle, shy and sweet. Loves her people, long runs and walks and the company of other dogs who like to play and be her friend. She is in foster after having survived with her mom and others on an industrial site.  Missy was just a wee puppy when found and had a hairline fracture on her front leg. All has healed well, but she will still hold her paw up and sometimes favor her leg.  She will be available soon after spay.If interested in adopting please fill out our no obligation online application at www.puppypawsrescue.org Note: Our rescue requires that all adopter's current and prior animals are up-to-date on vaccinations (DHLPP & Rabies)  and preventatives (heartworm and flea and tick), unless there is a medical reason not allowing it. All animals in your household should be spayed or neutered unless medically indicated that they should not be or are currently still too young.

Spirit is an 8 month old smooth coated desert sight hound mix from Qatar. She is  a parvo survivor. She is a strong, intelligent, active and gorgeous girl. Wonderful disposition for someone who wants a very sporty dog. I was a stray brought in from Montreal. Primary Color: White Secondary Color: Brown Weight: 52.2lbs Age: 1yrs 0mths 2wks Animal has been Neutered

Hi, I'm Jack! I came to HRA all the way from Moscow, Russia, and boy has it been a journey! I'm quite shy when meeting new people, and will definitely take quite a while to warm up to new situations and places. I'm very lovable, and, as you can see from my photos, I'm very handsome (and very photogenic)! I have been making slow, but steady, progress with my confidence during my stay here, and the staff have been working really hard to make me feel comfortable and loved. I might not be asking for pets and attention right away, but with patience, treats, and a gentle hand, I will make the world's best companion! I'm looking for a quiet, gentle home where I can take it slow with my new human(s). I really like cheese and hotdogs, by the way, and that can really help me warm up to people! Loud noises and quick movements, on the other hand, are not my favorite. My sister, Snezkha, also helps me feel more confident. You should check her (or both of us!) out too! I'm living in a foster home right now, so if you'd like to meet me, you can email bgoldwyn@hotmail.com to get in touch with my foster dad! **As an added bonus, if you're over 50, my adoption fee is waived as part of the Boomer's Buddies program! Standard adoption procedures apply.**

I'm a lover! I love people. Getting and giving attention and affection is my specialty. I'm great with other dogs! I love the outdoors! I was born to sunbathe and play in the dirt. I have my own special way of walking since I have two legs. I can outrun you if i wanted to but I'd much rather have you love on me. Majestic, grace, resilience, affectionate, calm, happy, loving, survivor, and feisty are just some of my descriptors. I am paralyzed from the waist down so I have no control over my bladder or bowels and I dribble a bit when I walk. It's been a while since I tried a diaper, since I love being outside so much, it hasn't been necessary. I was rescued from Saudi Arabia where doctors believed I was hit by a car which left me paralyzed. I was left in the streets to fend for myself while dragging my legs until some kind people took me in and helped me heal. I am now ready to find my forever home where people will love me for how affectionate I am and not judge me based on how I look. I had a rough go of it but my resilience and will to live shine brighter than any diamond or star in the sky. Would you like to be greeted by my warm smile and affectionate gaze everyday when you come home? Email Mayday today!    *As someone who knows Tinkerbell and has witnessed her love in person, I get goosebumps just thinking about how amazing this girl is. Nothing would bring me more happiness than seeing her in a home of her own. She has traveled from across the globe, been through hell and back, and it still amazes me every day how sweet she is. No other creature on this planet gives love like that of a rescued dog.*If you, or someone you know, are interested in adopting or fostering, please visit our site at www.maydaypitbullrescue.org or send us an email at info@maydaypitbullrescue.org

My name is Buchanan, but you can come me Buck! I am a southern gentleman from South Carolina looking to start a new life in Arizona with my forever family! I'm a really good boy and love to cuddle! I am on medication for thyroid and epilepsy, but fear not, I am a happy boy! I am protective of my food, so I would be ideal for families with older (10 or older) kids! I'm working hard to lose some weight with my foster mom so I can feel better and okay better! I am awesome with other dogs and even cats as long as I am fed separately. My foster mommy has been working to train and socialize me and I'm learning a lot from my AZBR alumni foster sister! Do you have a place for a lap dog on your couch? I'll gladly oblige!Follow my adventure on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/gobuckgo/

This sweet 9 week old pup is as sweet as can be, and will make a wonderful addition to any loving family!Fantasia and her siblings were part of an unwanted litter from South Carolina. Now in CT she is in need of a loving home.Fantasia is so adorable and loving, and will bring lots of smile to everyone she meets!She is only 8 lbs.*If interested in adopting one of our wonderful dogs or puppies, please fill out an adoption application on our website. **** PLEASE NOTE****  IF YOU DO FILL OUT AN APPLICATION, WE WILL GET BACK TO YOU WITHIN 4 TO 5 DAYS AT THE MOST. IF YOU DO NOT HEAR FROM US AT THAT POINT, PLEASE CALL US DIRECTLY at 203-241-2351 (Loretta) PLEASE read our website's adoption process page as many questions you may have about our process will be answered here and will prepare you for the next steps in adopting. https://www.apupspizzazzrescue.com/adoption-process*It is extremely important to us that everyone is treated with respect, and that NO ONE IS LEFT HANGING! All of our dogs are located in Connecticut, and are spayed or neutered, up to date on vaccines, microchipped, dewormed, have had CT State health checks, and go home with a leash and collar.We are a smaller rescue focused on finding the right match for our dogs and for you. We offer private appointments  where you can spend as much time as you'd like with your dog of choice, meet several dogs, and take a dog or dogs for a walk. You will not be waiting in line with others or fighting a crowd. We believe we offer a unique and pleasant experience focused on finding the perfect match. We look forward to hearing from you and helping you find your new best friend.We like to provide a human touch, and we answer our phone whenever we can. So, feel free to call to talk to us to find out more about our dogs. If e-mail is your thing, that's fine too, and we'll always get back to you quickly.***Please understand, that many of the dogs we rescue are mixes of multiple breeds. Therefore, it is very hard to know the exact breeds that make up each dog. We do our best in trying to be somewhat accurate, when choosing breeds, but is nearly impossible to know.When adopting a puppy, this plays a big part of the uncertainty of the size the puppy will end up being. *Just know, when raised with boundaries, consistency, effort, excercise, and love, your puppy will grow to be a HUGE source of UNCONDITIONAL LOVE, TOTAL LOYALTY, HAPPINESS, COMFORT AND COMPANIONSHIP....... REGARDLESS OF SIZE, no matter what!SOME HOME/RENTER INSURANCE PROVIDERS HAVE VERY STRICT POLICIES REGARDING WHICH TYPE OF DOG BREEDS ARE ALLOWED UNDER THEIR COVERAGE. WE CAN RECOMMEND A BREED FRIENDLY INSURANCE COMPANY THAT DOES NOT PUNISH, DROP, NOR REFUSE YOU DUE TO DOG BREED SHOULD YOU RUN INTO ISSUES WITH YOUR CURRENT PROVIDER.

Tigerlily is a 3 month old Lab/Shepherd mix rescued from a high kill shelter in South Carolina.
Otter is a 3 month old Lab/Shepherd mix rescued from a high kill shelter in South Carolina.

Bobby is a super adorable 11 week old pup. He weighs only 10 lbs.This beautiful creature was rescued from South Carolina. This is a very typical pup for sure, playful, silly, excited, and super social! ******IMPORTANT - PLEASE READ ALL THE GREAT INFO BELOW******PLEASE read our website's ADOPTION PROCESS PAGE prior to submitting an adoption application. www.apupspizzazzrescue.com/adoption-process ADOPTION APPLICATION: www.apupspizzazzrescue.com/adoption-application ABOUT OUR RESCUE DOGS: All of our sweet fur babies are being socialized daily with other dogs, adults, & most importantly, children. They are ALL in homes being cared for by people who LOVE them! All of our dogs are located in Connecticut, are spayed or neutered, up to date on vaccines, microchipped, dewormed, have had CT State health checks, & go home with a leash, collar, & packet of medical paperwork. BREED IDENTIFICATION:Please understand that many rescue dogs are mixes of multiple breeds. Petfinder allows us to choose up to two breeds per dog. While the shelters and our rescue do our best in accurately identifying breeds, breed identification is not guaranteed. If there is a certain breed that you do not want, it is very important that you share this with our rescue when applying. When adopting a puppy, breed uncertainty plays a big part in the size/look of the dog as an adult. Please know that any puppy can be a wonderful dog, regardless of preconceived notions of certain breeds, but it is very important that the adopter has the dedication and patience to raise the puppy with boundaries, consistency, structure, & love. The more effort you give towards training & time you allow for exercise, your puppy will grow to be a HUGE source of UNCONDITIONAL LOVE, TOTAL LOYALTY, HAPPINESS, COMFORT & COMPANIONSHIP!ABOUT OUR RESCUE:We are a small rescue run by volunteers & focused on finding the right match for both our dogs & for you. If you are interested in adopting through our rescue, you first will need to complete an adoption application & be approved as a potential adopter before meeting any of our pups. No need to be intimidated by our application as it allows us to get to know you & your lifestyle. Of course, the more you can share the better! Please also note, while a fenced yard is fantastic, it is not required by our rescue, however, it may be required for a certain dog. Once adoption applicants are approved to become potential adopters, we offer private appointments where you can meet one or several dogs at the discretion of the rescue. We offer a unique & pleasant experience focused on finding the perfect match. It is extremely important to us that everyone is treated with respect & that NO ONE IS LEFT HANGING. WE WILL GET BACK TO YOU WITHIN 4 TO 5 DAYS of application submission. If there is a dog you are eager to meet, please email us before the 4-5 days! IF YOU DO NOT HEAR FROM US AT THAT POINT, PLEASE CALL US DIRECTLY at 203-241-2351 so that we can check the status of your application and move it forward immediately. We look forward to hearing from you and helping you find your new best friend!HOME/RENTER INSURANCE:SOME PROVIDERS HAVE VERY STRICT POLICIES REGARDING WHICH TYPE OF DOG BREEDS ARE ALLOWED UNDER THEIR COVERAGE. STATE FARM WAS SUGGESTED TO US AS THEY DO NOT PUNISH, DROP, NOR REFUSE YOU DUE TO DOG BREED SHOULD YOU RUN INTO ISSUES WITH YOUR CURRENT PROVIDER.

The more effort you give towards training & time you allow for exercise, your puppy will grow to be a HUGE source of UNCONDITIONAL LOVE, TOTAL LOYALTY, HAPPINESS, COMFORT & COMPANIONSHIP!ABOUT OUR RESCUE:We are a small rescue run by volunteers & focused on finding the right match for both our dogs & for you. If you are interested in adopting through our rescue, you first will need to complete an adoption application & be approved as a potential adopter before meeting any of our pups. No need to be intimidated by our application as it allows us to get to know you & your lifestyle. Of course, the more you can share the better! Please also note, while a fenced yard is fantastic, it is not required by our rescue, however, it may be required for a certain dog. Once adoption applicants are approved to become potential adopters, we offer private appointments where you can meet one or several dogs at the discretion of the rescue. We offer a unique & pleasant experience focused on finding the perfect match. It is extremely important to us that everyone is treated with respect & that NO ONE IS LEFT HANGING. WE WILL GET BACK TO YOU WITHIN 4 TO 5 DAYS of application submission. If there is a dog you are eager to meet, please email us before the 4-5 days! IF YOU DO NOT HEAR FROM US AT THAT POINT, PLEASE CALL US DIRECTLY at 203-241-2351 so that we can check the status of your application and move it forward immediately. We look forward to hearing from you and helping you find your new best friend!HOME/RENTER INSURANCE:SOME PROVIDERS HAVE VERY STRICT POLICIES REGARDING WHICH TYPE OF DOG BREEDS ARE ALLOWED UNDER THEIR COVERAGE. STATE FARM WAS SUGGESTED TO US AS THEY DO NOT PUNISH, DROP, NOR REFUSE YOU DUE TO DOG BREED SHOULD YOU RUN INTO ISSUES WITH YOUR CURRENT PROVIDER.

CAME TO ARF FROM:  Rescue from South Carolina WEIGHT:  44 lbs, fully grown DOGS:  YES CATS:  NO CHILDREN:  Adult only SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:  PERSONALITY:  Smokey Joe is a five year old Lab mix who is a very affectionate guy who loves to gives hugs to his caretakers in the kennel every day before he goes out. He is a graduate of our basic obedience class, loves toys and likes to play.  He is crate trained and likely housebroken. He bonds with his person and can be protective so an experienced owner in an adult only home would be best for this good boy.      IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN MEETING THIS ANIMAL, PLEASE CONTACT THE ADOPTION TEAM AT 631-537-0400 EXT. 203,  TO INQUIRE ABOUT AVAILABILITY AND LOCATION.  WE ARE FREQUENTLY AT OFFSITE MOBILE ADOPTION EVENTS IN NEW YORK CITY, NASSAU AND SUFFOLK COUNTY.  WE DO NOT HOLD OR SHIP ANIMALS.  ANIMALS ARE ADOPTED ON A FIRST COME FIRST SERVE BASIS TO APPROVED HOMES.
Meet Mitch! This playful little guy is looking for a home full of love and fun! He is our 2 year old, Terrier mix rescued from a high kill shelter in South Carolina! Come on down and meet Mitch!

Sweet baby Biscuit!! He is our 6 month old, beagle mix, rescued from a high kill shelter in South Carolina. Biscuit is in desperate need of some love to help break him out of his timid shell. Could that be you?!

Come on down and say hi to Calhoun! He's our 1 1/2 year old lab mix rescued from a high kill shelter in South Carolina! He can be a little shy but with the right person he'll come right out of his shell and be the best boy in the world!
This big guy is our Theodore! He is about a year old, retriever mix, rescued from a high shelter in South Carolina! He's a playful, sweet, boy just looking for the right home!

Who couldn't love this sweet little face! This is our boy Hayden. He is a 8 month old, hound mix, rescued from a high kill shelter in South Carolina! He is super friendly and such a love! Come on down and meet Hayden today!

Meet Roxie. She is a 9 year old Lab/Rhodesian Ridgeback mix rescued from being locked in a hunting box (think rabbit hutch) in South Carolina with 3 other canine companions, one of which died before they could be rescued. Despite this horrid experience, she is the sweetest dog and loves all people. She has been thriving in foster care in Massachusetts and is ready for a home of her own. She loves & needs the company of other dogs and is wonderful with children. She is good but strong on the leash & needs a harness to keep her focused. She currently lives with multiple dogs and cats & gets along with all. She would be great in a home with children of any age & definitely needs a home with at least one other dog with a comparable activity level. Please consider opening your home to this girl who has been through so much while remaining so sweet. To adopt Roxie, please visit our website www.snarrnortheast.org and fill out an application. Roxie’s adoption fee is $250I edited the bio. I kept alot of it the same.

Best dog award !!!Don’t overlook this amazing girl named Brenda! She is an Aussie healer mix, is about 4 years old and only weighs 44lbs. She was rescued along with several others from a hoarding case in South Carolina. She is our staff favorite and all of the other dog’s favorite as well! She is so gentle and so sweet and is the most social and outgoing of the pack. Brenda shares her food, attention and time openly with everyone. We believe she is the mom to many of the other dogs and puppies that were on the property, due to her being the oldest female and to how they all take to her. Brenda deserves a loving home where she can be spoiled and fired on. A home with another dog is ideal because of where she came from.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Lab lovers, meet Marcus, a beautiful chocolate lab who comes into rescue from South Carolina. Just look at Marcus' soulful eyes and you can see he's a sweat heart. Marcus is friendly, outgoing and loves to meet new people. He is 6 months old and weighs approximately 30 pounds. Marcus is up to date on vaccines and has been neutered, is great with people of all ages and with other dogs. He is a high energy puppy, and would do best in a home with a yard with an active family. If you would like to adopt Marcus, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

THE ANIMAL CAME TO ARF FROM:  Rescue from South Carolina WEIGHT:  17 lbs, fully grown DOGS:  NO CATS:  NO CHILDREN:  Must meet SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:  Medical release  PERSONALITY:  This little man is a six year old Chihuahua mix.  He is very friendly with people but he would prefer to be your one and only pet.  He can be a little timid with small children so we are recommending that he meet all the children in the home.  He does have some medical needs, so if you would like more information, please call our adoption team at 631-537-0400, ext. 203.      IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN MEETING THIS ANIMAL, PLEASE CONTACT THE ADOPTION TEAM AT 631-537-0400 EXT. 203,  TO INQUIRE ABOUT AVAILABILITY AND LOCATION.  WE ARE FREQUENTLY AT OFFSITE MOBILE ADOPTION EVENTS IN NEW YORK CITY, NASSAU AND SUFFOLK COUNTY.  WE DO NOT HOLD OR SHIP ANIMALS.  ANIMALS ARE ADOPTED ON A FIRST COME FIRST SERVE BASIS TO APPROVED HOMES.

TANGO is looking for his forever home.TANGO is a beautiful 4 month pup from South Carolina. He has some brindle markings here and there. The pictures do not do him justice. Tango is an absolute LOVE. He plays great with the Foster’s 3 adult pups. He is crate trained and working on house training and doing great.  This pup LOVES the water.  Tango gets along with other dogs and is good around people of all ages.If you’re interested in this sweet boy, contact us for an application via email at adopt@htdr.org or pm us.***Local adoptions on Long Island only please.***

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Riley comes to rescue from South Carolina with a huge, gaping and shredded wound under and around his left front side and arm. Riley is 10 months old and 48 pounds, and thought to be a Boxer/Lab blend. Sweet Riley is up to date on vaccines and he will be neutered prior to placement in his forever home. He is good with people and other dogs. If you would like to adopt Riley when he is ready, please get the process started and submit your application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

Ashley made the long transport up from South Carolina and is now ready to find a forever home with patience, love, and understanding towards her nerves. This beautiful girl is wiggly and social, but fearful in new surroundings with new experiences. If you have yummy cheese or chicken to give out, she's your girl! Ashley would do best in an adult home, preferably with shy dog experience. We think she may gain confidence and benefit from having another confident dog in the household pending a meet. She absolutely loves to run around with toys and is making incredible progress with walking on a leash. We're still learning as much as we can as she settles in so please call or come meet her today!

Meet our handsome boy Dillon! Dillon comes to us from a kill shelter in South Carolina and was almost out of time when we were contacted. This stunning boy could not be sweeter! He walks well on a leash and is your typical southern gentleman. We are assuming he is a boxer/bull-dog/lab mix.  We're not too sure about his past, but Dillon had a skin infection when he arrived at our shelter which improved with antibiotics and medicated baths.Dillon is estimated between 2-4 years old, and around 60 lbs. He is extremely friendly and would love an active, experienced home that can give him lots of love and exercise. Dillon is dog friendly when properly introduced and would do best in a home with older children.Follow the link below to fill out an adoption form, view all available dogs, sponsor a dog, donate or volunteer! GardenRescues.Org
If you are ready for your newest best friend, Truffles is the girl for you. She's a 1 year old Terrier mix who was rescued from South Carolina.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Sookie came to rescue from South Carolina. A good Samaritan had reported that they saw her lying in the grass on the side of her owners house, covered in fleas, and emaciated. Animal Control investigated and took her. Sookie is an 8 year old female Boxer blend. On intake, she was extremely underweight, and she has cataracts that make it difficult to see. It has been determined that she is also a diabetic, and a new family should know that she will require insulin as part of her daily care. In addition, Sookie had a small mass on her leg that was determined to be Mast Cell. She has had surgery with our vet to remove the mass and has healed wonderfully. She is now doing so great in her foster home but would really love a home to call her very own!Her foster Mom says she is the perfect mix of couch potatoe and playmate! Sookie is a vocal lady who definitely has her own hilarious personality to show you. When Sookie isn't curled up on your lap (Yes, ON your lap), in her bed, or on the floor next to you she is exploring her surroundings with her curious little nose or demanding your attention with her adorable little grumbles! To Sookie, there aren't too many things greater in life than cuddling with the nearest human or playing with a fun toy! Speaking of toys, Sookie loves a good game of tug-of-war or a round of squeaking her favorite squeaky toy. She also enjoys walks full of exploring and sniffing and is more than willing to accompany you on an easy hike with some more leash training.Sookie is very tolerant of all kinds of petting, even some attention that might annoy some dogs. She does occasionally play a little rough so, supervision around the little ones is never a bad idea. She reallyenjoys interacting with other dogs, especially those who want to play with her. Once introductions are done she is happy to play with her canine buddy or simply relax on the couch next to them.Sookie has what some consider a complicated relationship with cats. She desperately wants to play with them but in true Boxer form, she doesn't seem to understand that hissing and swatting isn't playing. A kitty that loves playtime as much as her would be a dream come true to Sookie.Sookie has made huge strides in her leash walking but, her cataracts do inhibither vision somewhat so unexpected objects in her path may trip her up.In other areas she is a lady. She waits patiently (with the exception of a few grumbles) for her food and allows you to take it away with nothing worse than a pout. She is a pro at receiving her insulin and acts as if she doesn't even know you're there when administering it.She really is the full package and any family would be VERY lucky to call her their own.Sookie is up to date on shots and will be spayed prior to placement in her forever home. If you would like to adopt Sookie, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

Meet Donald! He's a 1 year old Terrier/Brussels Griffon mix who was rescued from South Carolina. He's here for a second chance at finding his forever home. Donald is full of energy and would do best in an all adult home. Hurry down and meet him today! A big thank you to Linda and Wayne Rana for sponsoring Donald while he waits patiently for his forever home!

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Sweet Leo is a Pit mix who was born in late 2017 and comes into rescue from South Carolina. Clearly this poor boy is another pitbull who didn’t mean anything & wasn’t worth even the basic care. It’s so heartbreaking...he is just an innocent puppy and he almost lost his life because his “owners” dumped him at a high kill SC shelter. He was missing fur and his poor skin was raw and raging. He obviously suffered from a life of neglect for too long. This is so unnecessary & so unfair for any dog to have to endure such abuse. Leo has now received the medical treatment he desperately needed and is becoming the healthy and happy puppy he was meant to be. We can’t wait to show him what it’s like to live a life full of the unconditional love and happiness that he deserves! Are you the lucky one that can show Leo what it feels like to be loved and cared for?! Leo is an itty bitty Pitty that's a total love bug. This little guy weighs in at a mere 31 pounds! Leo is eager to please and loves his \"person\" dearly. He is quite good at snuggling and loves to be touching his person or another pup while napping. He can be a little hyper-reactive to stimuli, as most puppies are, but once he settles down he is the most mellow sweet and loving dog ever. He is wonderful with everyone including kids, other dogs, and even cats! He has made such a remarkable physical transformation and it seems that his terrible beginnings in life just made him the most grateful, appreciative and most loving dog he is today.Leo knows sit, down, come, leave it and walks well on a leash and is also crate trained.He will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. Leo has lots of cuddles and kisses to give to his new special someone. If you are looking for the most handsome young pup to add to your family, then look no further and fill out and adoption application for Leo here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application

THE ANIMAL CAME TO ARF FROM: Rescue from South Carolina WEIGHT: 45 lbs, fully grown DOGS: Yes CATS: NO, Will chase  CHILDREN: Yes, must meet SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:   PERSONALITY: At two years old, Buddy is a very active young Lab mix.  He gets along well with dogs, but will chase cats. He will be fine with kids but he is a bit of a jumper.  He loves to run and play so an active home will be best for this awesome boy. He is crate trained and likely housebroken. With a little bit of training, Buddy will excel in his new home.      IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN MEETING THIS ANIMAL, PLEASE CONTACT THE ADOPTION TEAM AT 631-537-0400 EXT. 203,  TO INQUIRE ABOUT AVAILABILITY AND LOCATION.  WE ARE FREQUENTLY AT OFFSITE MOBILE ADOPTION EVENTS IN NEW YORK CITY, NASSAU AND SUFFOLK COUNTY.  WE DO NOT HOLD OR SHIP ANIMALS.  ANIMALS ARE ADOPTED ON A FIRST COME FIRST SERVE BASIS TO APPROVED HOMES.

Birdie and her 4 young pups came to Simon last January from South Carolina.  She took good care of her litter but at 10 weeks the pups were vetted and quickly found adoptive homes.  Birdie has displayed aggression towards other animals and for that reason we require she go to a quiet adult home.  She will need daily exercise away from other dogs, a fenced in yard is a plus.  Adopters must have previous experience with challenging dogs.  Birdie absolutely loves her people so we looking for someone to love her and give her a great life, while helping her to make good choices.If you are interested in adopting a dog, please submit an application to adopt on our website:  thesimonfoundation.org

Hi, my name is Tyra. I’m a young, Labrador retriever mix. I was separated from my family in South Carolina during a Hurricane and found as a stray. I am a little feral and therefore I can be fearful of humans. When I am scared, I will hide in the back of my cage or in any dark space, I do not bite. When I gain your trust, I will give you kisses. I am very energetic and love to play with other dogs. I love to play with dog toys and will hoard them in my cage. I love to go for walks. While walking, I love to roll around in fresh cut grass. I would love a home that has at least one dog and a patient family willing to help me overcome my fears.If you are interested in meeting any of our adoptable dogs, please fill out an application at http://www.mlar.org/adopt/adoption-processE-mails regarding adoption are not considered an application. Out-of-state applicants will not be considered, unless there are special circumstances. Main Line Animal Rescue does local adoptions to families with excellent vet references and an installed fenced yard. You must have a secure traditional fence OR a professionally installed underground electric fenced area in which a dog can safely play without getting out). The fence must be securely attached to your house, dog pens, dog runs and a tie outs are not approved. Please visit our web site for more detailed information on the animals in our care, our educational campaigns, and for helpful tips on adoption.  www.MLAR.org

Bobby is a handsome catch who comes to our rescue from South Carolina.  When Bobby went into our care he was shut down and withdrawn.  Through time, patience and lots of love from his foster family, he has emerged a happy, friendly and playful guy.  His little nubbie tail wags, wags, wags when he greets you at the door.  Bobby’s breed is anyone’s guess.  He looks like he has some collie in him, and maybe a little lab.  We do not guarantee any breed mix/combo.   Bobby is approximately 5 years old, is 57 pounds and is housetrained. Bobby has transformed into a playful, cuddly, loving dog who is usually touching, leaning against, or curled up with you during downtime.  He loves, loves, loves the water.  He’ll play in hoses and irrigation systems, so he’s a lot of fun when you’re washing your car.  Bobby has been for a few boat rides and will get into the water freestyle when stopped at the favorite swimming hole.  He gets excited at just the sight of water and gives you no trouble when it’s bath time!  Bobby knows his basic manners and commands, and likes pleasing you and getting treats.  His favorite treat is Redi-Whip straight from the can!  He is a stuffed toy dog and will self-entertain by throwing around stuffed toys, which occasionally end up getting tossed onto countertops!  He likes to play tug-of-war and will do zoomies in the yard when he’s got a toy in his mouth.  Bobby enjoys walks, and is great in the car.  He’s just an all-around outdoor enthusiast, and we would love to see him adopted to people who will take him on outdoor adventures.  Bobby will need a little time readjusting to his forever home, so we are looking for a patient adopter who will commit time to training so he continues his transformation.  Bobby gets along great with other dogs and he is also great with cats.  He will actually snuggle up with his foster family’s cat from time to time.  He would do fine as the only dog in the home or with other animals.   Bobby has been fully vetted, is heartworm negative and is up to date on all vaccines.  He is neutered, microchipped, and on current heartworm prevention and flea prevention. Bobby does have a back leg that ever so slightly curves inwards.  The vet checked him out and said it’s fine.  It doesn’t bother him at all, and it certainly doesn’t hold him back from zoomies and swimming!  Interested adopters please email MJsAnimalSanctuary@gmail.com to request an adoption application. Adopters are subject to reference checks, vet reference, home visit(s), meet and greet(s). Adoption fee applies.

Hi there!  My name is Blanche and I am an adorable gal that is looking for my new family.  I was found as a stray and rescued from a shelter in South Carolina in February.  I spent 2 months in a foster home before coming to Penny Angels.  My foster mom gave me lots of love (and plenty of good food), and when I was ready to travel to New Jersey, she sent me on my way with many hugs and kisses.I am approx. 9 years old and weigh 24 lbs.  You might think of me as a ‘senior’ because of my age, but I’m not a big fan of ‘labels’.  If you feel the need to label me, though, I prefer to think of myself as ‘nicely seasoned’.  Ahh… nicely seasoned has a much nicer ring to it (and it sounds yummy, too)!  I am a very sweet & laid-back gal.  When you meet me, you will fall in love with me.  Do you see that smile on my face?  Happy girl- yep, that’s me!  I try not to let things bother me.  I spent time with the volunteers on Saturday at PetSmart and they all thought I was a special girl.Are you looking for a calm beagle?  We can cuddle together and watch tv, or I can keep you company while you prepare your home for the Summer months.  I like spending time outside soaking up the sunshine and fresh air.  I get along well with other dogs and love to play with them!  I will snuggle up to my doggie friends, too, and will sometimes use the warmth from their bodies to keep me comfortable.  How can you resist my cuteness?I will be at Petsmart in Mays Landing, NJ on Saturday from 11-3 pm.  Will you be waiting for me?  If you would like to add me to your family, please fill out an application and submit it to Penny Angels today.  An adoption application can be obtained by visiting the PABR web site at www.pennyangelsbeaglerescue.com. If you have any questions, please contact beagler534@comcast.net or emnase@aol.com, or call Penny Angels Beagle Rescue at 609-965-9476. Thank you!

Mayzie came to us from South Carolina where she was picked up by Animal Control due to her family neglecting her.  She is a very friendly girl.  The sending rescue said she was really sweet and good with other dogs.

ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8094Im Bowie! I am estimated to be a 6-year-old Catahoula Leopard Dog mix. Im a big boy, weighing about 75 lbs and I came to OPH from South Carolina, so Im a southern gentleman. Howdy-do!My foster mom thinks Im awesome! She says Im crate-trained, I havent had a single accident in my foster home, and I only bark when the other dogs in my foster home bark to welcome someone home. I sometimes talk and sing when my food is being prepared, because I love mealtime! I also get very excited about going out and I spring about 3 feet straight up off the ground when its time to go! I am a strong boy, so I get walked on an easy-walk harness, which works well for me. My foster mom says Im smart to avoid obstacles and not get my leash tangled around them. Yay, me!I am a people dog, so I love to be with my foster family and getting attention. I can get nervous and anxious around other dogs, so I would probably do best in a home as an only dog, but I think I would do well in almost any environment: apartment, townhouse, single-family home. As long as I can be part of the family and show my devotion, I will be a happy boy.Come meet me!To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org Operation Paws for Homes, Inc. (OPH) rescues dogs of all breeds and ages from high-kill shelters in NC, VA, MD, and SC, reducing the numbers being euthanized. With limited resources, the shelters are forced to put down 50-90% of the animals that come in the front door. OPH provides pet adoption services to families located in VA, DC, MD, PA and neighboring states. OPH is a 501(c)(3) organization and is 100% donor funded. OPH does not operate a shelter or have a physical location. We rely on foster families who open their homes to give love and attention to each dog before finding a forever home.

ANGEL is an adorable beagle mix. 6 months old. She is about 25 pounds, so should be about 30 pounds full grown. She is playful, good with other dogs, and has energy to play. She is still young, so needs some training, but has a great personality and would be fine with kids. She has age appropriate shots and is HW negative. She is also spayed. We just rescued her from a shelter in South Carolina, but she will be in the Phila. area around 3/2 or 3/3. Contact Patti at psquare828@comcast.net

NAME: PreciousBREED: ChihuahuaBIRTHDAY: 2006WEIGHT: 10lbsADOPTION FEE:Precious is a fun little piglet who has adjusted beautifully to life in her busy foster home. She doesn't see well but likes to explore and is happy to make new friends. Her owner seemed to be taking good care of her, as she came to the shelter with extensive veterinary records, but for some reason she wasn't wanted anymore and was left there to die. Precious is diabetic and takes insulin twice a day, which is a difficult condition for the shelter to handle- they did not plan on being able to keep her there long, but luckily we had space and she made the long trip up from South Carolina. ?We've never had a pet with diabetes before and were a little nervous about keeping up with Precious' meds, but she takes her injections with no problems and the insulin is very inexpensive. Precious is also on a prescription food for urinary issues, but she doesn't eat much so that's no big deal either. All in all she has been a sweet, loving, and easy addition to our foster family, and we are so happy we were able to get her out of the shelter safely!

Sweet Sal is looking for a forever family to love and cuddle.  He is a 3 year old Brindle Boxer mix that was rescued from a South Carolina shelter in August '17.  He has since successfully completed treatment for mange and heartworm.  He is a very chill dog that gets along with the foster families dog and LOVES children. Please email suew@boxertransfer.org if interested.

3.15.17Update from Foster Mom...Jackie Shearin2 1/2 year old Chi-Corgi mixSweet medium energy level girl seeks furever family. Recently sent her four puppies off to be with their furever families...it's now her turn. Would be happy in a home with or without dogs. Cats, she's just been observing but hasn't chased. Learning the fundamentals of crate training. Can sleep in it overnight without a problem. But if you're up and about, she'd prefer to be with you too. She seems to want to like everyone she meets but with a little caution, let her come to you first. If you give her food...you'll be her favorite. She likes food, she'll even do a dance for you if there's food! Walks ok, just cautious, on a leash. No accidents in current fosters home. Besides food, she likes belly rubs.2/15/17 Meet Jackie and her puppies !Note from South Carolina Foster:Oh they are doing great. Jackie is still a little timid  and will back away if directly approached but she loves snuggles and cuddles so she'll just need patience with her new forever family. She loves other dogs and is house trained and doggie door trained. The puppies are fattening up like little porkers haha.She's a great mom! They nurse just fine. Just so they know Jackie is a picky eater...I'm guessing she was fed table scraps. She won't eat just kibble...I have to mix in wet food and get the gravy all over the kibble and then she'll eat itJackie will be an awesome pet for someone though. She is very energetic and playful. She wants to sit with you and sleep with you. I just let her see me petting my dogs and she'll approach on her own and she has no problem with me scratching her neck while she nurses. She is sweet and gentle and doesn't bark, growl or nip even when scared. It's just if you bend over to pet her she goes into flight mode. She wants to trust and I'm sure she'll realize not all humans are bad in time.Jackie is 18# prior to giving birth. listed as a chi mix in paperPlease call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!

Buster White is BTN's longest resident.  Buster came to BTN from South Carolina where he was seized by AC as a welfare case.  Buster had no tibia and he needed his ankle fused.  We suspect he was hit by a car and left to heal on his own.  He was starving to death and heartworm positive.  We worked with VOSM and Buster is in good shape now..  Buster loves other dogs and may or may not be okay with cats.  He's gets along great with people.  Buster is BTN's poster child for happiness.  He loves life and is thrilled just to have a bed, food and somewhere warm to stay.  He's currently heartworm negative and his legs are repaired  If you can find a place for Buster White in your heart, please email me.  He's fully vetted and microchipped.

This is Miss Widget. She was rescued from a South Carolina shelter. She is about 1 1/2 years old 8 lb. She does get along with other dogs but we believe she would do best by herself or with one other dog in the home. She loves to play with her toys and has one favorite squeak ball. She is a sweet little girl. She likes to sing to you. She's very talkative. When she was rescued she had a heart problem. She has had that taken care of. She does have a follow up with a cardiologist. This has not slowed her down any. She is full of energy. She is all updated on vaccines. Once cleared from the cardiologist she will be getting spayed. She is potty trained. At night she will use a pee pad at times. She does not do well at all in a crate. She is fine to leave in the home. She can be temperamental at times with her toys and feeding times all things that are being worked on. She is being fostered in Penobscot County, Maine. For an adoption application and more information please go to www.underhoundrailroad.org

Sweet Sal is looking for a forever family to love and cuddle.  He is a 3 year old Brindle Boxer mix that was rescued from a South Carolina shelter in August '17.  He has since successfully completed treatment for mange and heartworm.  He is a very chill dog that gets along with the foster families dog and LOVES children. Please email suew@boxertransfer.org if interested.

Hi! Percy here! I traveled all the way here from South Carolina to meet my forever family. I am very smart and eager to learn! But I have been told that I can be a bit of a handful. When I get super excited I can get quite jumpy and mouthy. I don't quite realize how big and strong I am. The ladies tell me how quick of a learner I am and that I am pretty food motivated. I mean, who doesn't love a good treat?!The ladies here have been working on teaching me \"sit,\" \"stay,\" and \"here.\" As long as I stay busy, I am a pretty good boy! I would need to continue rigerous training with my new family to keep me on my best behavior.I would be a wonderful hiking or running partner. I have so much energy and like they say, a tired dog is always a good dog! Due to some of these behaviors, I would do best as the only pet in an adult only home. I do enjoy other dogs, but I have a rough play style, and not many dogs like that. I could potentially have some dog friends.

Tim, here. How are ya?! I have come to New Hampshire all the way from South Carolina in search of a home of my own! I was found in rough shape, but luckily for me, I found kind humans who took care of me! My human friends have learned a lot about me, like how sweet and gentle I am. And how I love to play with other dogs! I think I would be a great companion dog, and I would be open to living with kids, although really little kids might be a little scary for me.Unfortunately, I do have a heart condition that you should know about. My heart is not in great shape, and it will need to be managed for as long as I'm around. We are not sure if my heart will effect my lifespan, but I promise I will repay anyone who adopts me with a lifetime of whole-hearted love. If you have been looking for a dog to truly rescue, please consider me!

This is Pumpkin. Underhound pulled Pumpkin from a shelter in Greenville, SC. She is noted to be about 2 years old and 30 lbs. They note that she may be a Finnish Spitz mix. She is spayed, heartworm negative, and up to date with vaccines.Pumpkin is guarded with other animals and needs training for riding in the car though she is getting better at it. She loves people and is great with kids. She was to be an active girl she is really smart and easily trains with the correct methods for her. She can be stubborn so patience is needed. She loves her toys. She knows sit stay and lay down and walks well on a leash right beside you. This is something we work on everyday walking on the leash. She would be an excellent fun-loving frisbee dog for an active outdoor person(s).For an adoption application, please go to UnderhoundRailroad.org. She is being fostered in Auburn, Maine. No dogs or cats for this girl.

Walter is a 6 year old Rottweiler who came from a South Carolina shelter.  He came into the shelter incredibly emaciated, but has since put on weight and weighs a healthy 82 lbs.  We are also teaching him some manners. He tested well with dogs.  Cats are an unknown at this point.  Walter had an eye condition called entropion.  That is a genetic condition in which a portion of the eyelid is inverted or folds inward.  Walter just had surgery to correct this and is healing up nicely.  His foster mom said he had been great about it all.  If you are interested in fostering or adopting Walter, please fill out our online application:https://www.jotform.com/MapleLeafMutts/adoption-application

Hello future family. My name is Tessie. I am a 33lb three year-old female Pointer-mix. And, I am spayed, vaccinated and micro-chipped. I was rescued from a shelter in South Carolina. I was pregnant and I tested positive for heartworm. After my four puppies were born, I began heartworm treatment. I had to remain quiet and calm during my treatment. As you can imagine, it was BORING resting inside, day after day. Thankfully, my treatment is complete. I will need to take heartworm preventative monthly and be retested in 6-months. I am housetrained and trusted with free roam of the home. I am nearly crate trained and learning how to walk on leash wearing a slip-lead. I know “Sit,” best. I sit before meals and I sit to have my leash put on. I also come when my name is called. I am a Pointer, which is a type of a hound dog. Hounds were bred to help people with hunting. As a hound, I am very good at communicating. I will let my people know when visitors arrive or when I see a deer. When I see a bird or a deer outside, I point at them with my nose and tail aligned. I perk up when I hear wild geese. I love being outside, especially on warm sunny days. I love the smells, the sights and the sounds. I am happy in the fenced yard and I love to take walks. My foster family has several dogs and I am friendly with everyone. I even try to initiate play with some of them. I enjoy snuggling on the couch with my people and the rest of the dogs. They don’t have cats, but I met one when I was at the veterinary office, and I was told that I was good. Sometimes, their grandchildren visit. I like them. They are two and four years old, and I am three years old. I think it would be nice to live with children all the time. I am affectionate, eager-to-please, joyful and playful. Future family, I can hardly wait to meet you!To adopt, please submit an application at this link: http://form.jotform.com/form/11880935459 or visit www.pottersangelsrescue.org to view additional adoptable dogs and for more information. Adoption fees apply and vary by age:Puppies 12 months of age and younger: $350; 13 months to 6 years  $300; age 6+ $200. Thank you for choosing to adopt!

Sex: FemaleApproximate Age: 1 year, 3 monthsBreed Guesstimate: Mixed Breed, Medium (up to 44 lbs fully grown)/MixSize: Medium (25 pounds)Spayed: YesStatus: AvailableBitzy is an EXTREMELY shy dog, rescued from the stray life in South Carolina when she was pregnant. Her puppies have gone on to their new lives, and now it's Bitzy's turn to find a new loving home. Behaviorally, Bitzy is a somewhat of a Special Needs dog -- she'll need an owner willing to visit her in the shelter multiple times before taking her home, and someone who understands that Bitzy will never be the dog who has an active social life, with humans or other dogs. She does enjoy other dogs, and would probably do best if she could live with another dog, but she is not the kind of dog who would ever go to the dog park. Once she knows you, she's happy to snuggle and get belly rubs, but it takes a LONG time for her to feel that comfortable. Bitzy needs a home with a fenced-in yard; we have worked hard to desensitize her to the leash, but she's not there yet. She's fearful of the leash, even when it's not clipped on, and once she has it on, she wants to go the other way. We are able to get her from her kennel to our yard without a leash, so a home set up with that arrangement would be great. In the yard, she sniffs around, and even gets the zoomies, especially when playing with another dog. She likes toys, but mostly just to gather around herself -- she doesn't know how to play with toys yet.Bitzy's ideal adopter would be someone with extreme patience, a gentle, caring soul, and a willingness to learn how to help fearful dogs, plus has a fenced-in yard and another dog for her to play with. Her $350 adoption fee includes a consult with one of our trainers.

This is Olive (formerly Nana). Underhound pulled her from a shelter in Greenville, SC. She is about 4 years old, 34 lbs, dog-friendly, people-friendly. She is spayed and up to date with vaccines and she is heartworm negative.Olive is a very sweet, gentle, and quiet medium sized girl. She gets along well with her foster brother but she would prefer an older mature companion because she isn’t looking for a playmate. (No cats for Olive!) Olive is fully house trained and she would like free roam of the house 24/7. She promises to be well-behaved. She loves sleeping on the couch, chewing on toys and eating food. She loves peanut butter filled frozen Kongs! She is smart and sits, lays down, shakes, recalls, “no”, “up” and “down”. She is an okay car rider, stood perfectly still for a bath, and enjoys going for walks even though she pulls a little. She can’t wait to find her perfect family!She would make an excellent addition to anyone’s family.For an adoption application, please go to UnderhoundRailroad.org. She is being fostered in Androscoggin County, Maine.

This is Hank, formerly Blue Bunny. Underhound pulled him from a shelter in Greenville, SC. He is noted to be about 5 months old and 28 lbs. He is noted to be a lab retriever mix and dog and people friendly. When we know more about him, we will post more. For an adoption application, please go to UnderhoundRailroad.org. He is being fostered in Lincoln County, Maine.

IN NEED OF LOCAL FOSTER OR ADOPTER/ AVAILABLE FOR FOSTER TO ADOPT FOR LOCAL ADOPTERSMeet Ruby! Here is her video:https://youtu.be/7OYoDDt2YXIRuby is approx. 4 years old, female, 60 lbs., vetted, is or will be spayed, and micro-chipped. Per her SC caretaker Ruby good with other dogs and as you can see from the pics below she was BFFs with P4P Alumni Hazel in SC!! She likes to go for car rides, is potty trained, does not care for the crate, is a quieter girl, has medium energy, knows Sit & Stay, and walks well on a leash. She loves to fetch a tennis ball but then chews it; surely with some training lol? Stay tuned for more information as Ruby is a new rescue!If you are interested in fostering or adopting Ruby please fill out an Application atwww.Passion-4-Paws.org(please make sure you have the Vermont site) thanks!Check out her Facebook page (please \"Like\" us while you are there): https://tinyurl.com/yapl2mojPlease note Fosters have 1st option of Adoption.Disclosure:Breed labels are often incorrect: we rarely know the genetic lineage of the dogs we rescue. Many shelters and rescues specify breeds based on appearance; however, research has shown that less than 2% of a dog’s DNA determines appearance!Passion 4 Paws does not practice the use of labels pertaining to compatibility with others or dog breed. Labels such as “dog friendly” and “child friendly” should be used with caution as they often over-simplify the personalities and behavior of dogs.

Meet Tanner! He is a 6-month-old stunning Labrador Retriever mix. He currently weighs in at about 30 pounds and will likely be a large dog when fully grown. Tanner was saved from a high kill shelter in Marion County, South Carolina. Despite his past, this boy is a social butterfly who adores everyone he meets. He gets along great with kids, cats, and other dogs. Tanner is primarily housebroken, crate trained and doing great with his leash walking skills. He cannot wait to find his forever home!Tanner is neutered, up to date on vaccinations, and microchipped. Home for Good Dog Rescue (HFGDR) is a 100 percent foster-based rescue located in Summit with offices in Berkeley Heights, NJ. All of our dogs live in loving local foster homes until they find forever families of their own. Our fosters begin basic training, housebreaking, and leash walking skills to help pair you with the perfect pup for life! We update Petfinder and our website multiple times daily, so if a dog is available on Petfinder and our website they are still available for adoption. We process all our applications in the order we receive them, and for that reason sometimes the dog or dogs in whom you are interested in may be adopted before your own processing concludes. In order to apply for adoption and set up an individual meet and greet with one of our dogs, please visit us at www.HomeforGoodDogs.org. Find us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/HomeForGoodDogRescue.

Meet Turkey and Chicken! These 2 adorable pups are 5-month-old Miniature Pinscher mixes. They both currently weigh just 8 pounds and will remain small dogs when fully grown. Turkey and Chicken were saved from a high kill shelter in Marion County, South Carolina. They are sweet and gentle pups who love to be held and cuddle. They are working hard on their housebreaking and leash walking skills, and are crate trained. They each cannot wait to find a forever home of their very own!They are both neutered, up to date on vaccinations, and microchipped.Home for Good Dog Rescue (HFGDR) is a 100 percent foster-based rescue located in Summit with offices in Berkeley Heights, NJ. All of our dogs live in loving local foster homes until they find forever families of their own. Our fosters begin basic training, housebreaking, and leash walking skills to help pair you with the perfect pup for life! We update Petfinder and our website multiple times daily, so if a dog is available on Petfinder and our website they are still available for adoption. We process all our applications in the order we receive them, and for that reason sometimes the dog or dogs in whom you are interested in may be adopted before your own processing concludes.In order to apply for adoption and set up an individual meet and greet with one of our dogs, please visit us at www.HomeforGoodDogs.org. Find us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/HomeForGoodDogRescue.

Meet adorable Clover who was rescued from a rural kill shelter in South Carolina. She is a smooth coat Collie/Labrador mix and about 1.5-2 years old. She weighs about 50 lbs. The foster’s neighbors all think she is the “cutest” dog & her gentle nature and sweet demeanor match her adorable face.Though shy initially, Clover warms up quickly with gentle, loving pets & calming words. She often rests her head on your lap & waits for some gentle pets. Often she’ll thank you for the head pets with kind, sweet kisses.Clover is house and crate trained and likes her walks and play time with other dogs in the neighborhood. The foster thinks she’d do best with another dog in the house. Being young, she is learning what she is allowed to chew & what not to nosh on. She is crated when the family is out of the house & adores her stuffed marrow bones or Kongs & nylabones.Clover heads north in 2 weeks so please arrange a meet & greet to see her. She’d make a wonderful addition to any family with big hearts and room for a loving rescue doggie.

Meet Hinson! This adorable little guy is a 4-month-old Pomapoo (Miniature Poodle/Pomeranian), saved from a backyard breeder in South Carolina. He currently weighs just 8 pounds and will be a small dog when fully grown. Hinson is a sweet, lovable and easy going dog.  He has a perfect disposition for families with children of all ages and other pets including other dogs and cats.  Hinson loves to play outside and have fun.  He is working hard on crate training and being housebroken.  He sleeps well through the night and patiently waits to be taken out in the morning.  You cannot help but fall in love with Hinson.Here is what Hinson has to tell you about himself! `Please allow me to introduce myself; I am Hinson, a puppy with spunk and flair.  I am gentle, sweet and affectionate.  I love to be around people of all ages and play well with other pets.  I am working hard on my training and am a great nighttime sleeper.  I bring a smile to everyone`s face.  I cannot wait to meet my new family!`Hinson is neutered, up to date on vaccinations, and microchipped. This puppy is part of a litter of 9 who came to EHR from South Carolina to find loving forever homes. Rose and her siblings are super sweet, loving young dogs, but arrived just a bit under socialized and so can be very shy and nervous in new situations. They need people who will give them time & attention to grow into wonderful family dogs!If you'd like to meet this pup, please fill out an adoption application and be sure to ask for her by name!

Looking for a handsome guy to hang by your side? Meet Dude! This happy boy is a 2-year-old Labrador Retriever/Shepherd mix, fully grown at 55 pounds. Dude also does well with cats. He is a total pleaser who wants to be by his people. Dude is working on learning his basic commands and already knows sit. He is completely housebroken, crate trained, and is working on perfecting his leash walking skills.
