Hi guys! My name is Maxine and I'm a loving and energetic 2 year old boxer mix from South Carolina; I have energy for miles and some of my best volunteer friends have said I have a million dollar smile! I would be a perfect playmate for someone with an active lifestyle. Some of my hobbies include playing fetch and catching a Frisbee; my favorite activity is having long snuggle sessions and giving out a lot of kisses. I love being the center of attention so I'd prefer to be your one and only. I also heard that I'm a staff and volunteer favorite! Come visit with me and be prepared to fall head over heels in love with my pretty face, beautiful smile and loving personality!Call or visit SAVE with any questions about me! Primary Color: Tan Secondary Color: White Weight: 45lbs Age: 1yrs 6mths 2wks Animal has been Spayed

ADOPTION FEE:$100Damon is a special dog who came from South Carolina to make room for Florence dogs.  He is a sweet large 65 pound dog with a fused rear leg.  We had our vet check it out.  He said he thinks that maybe as a young puppy Damon had a broken leg set for too long a time and his muscles and soft tissue atrophied so his leg is fused.  He did not recommend amputating it as Damon does use it for some support, and if removed, it might put too much strain on the other leg leading to more health issues.  If you want to rescue a super sweet special needs dog, Damon would be perfect.THIS IS THE LINK TO THE APPLICATION WORD DOCUMENT OR PDF THAT CAN BE EMAILED TO RAWHIDERESCUE@HOTMAIL.COM: http://members.petfinder.com/~NJ235/Forms/RawhideDogApplication.doc http://rawhiderescue.com/RawhideDogApplication.pdfOUR HOME PAGE: http://www.rawhiderescue.org

This Southern Belle has traveled all the way from South Carolina to find her forever home here in New Jersey. When you meet Lady it is obvious that she did at one time have a home where someone taught her the commands that she knows and how to play her favorite game of “fetch”.Lady has been in foster since 1/7/18. She has been a perfect houseguest, is completely house and crate trained. She goes right into her crate every morning when I leave for work and is sleeping when I get home. Lady loves her person, loves cuddling and to be pet. She is a calm dog that loves her toys and a good nap on the couch. On walks she doesn't pay attention to other dogs and walks calmly next to them when on pack walks. We do not know much about Lady’s past, but she does scare easily, so she would do best in a calm household with older, respectful children, and not much traffic in and out of the house. She takes a while to warm up to new people but once she does she loves you. Lady is a very special girl that deserves a loving home of her own. She is silly, full of personality and one the sweetest dogs I've ever had the pleasure of fostering. She is so easy to love and will make a wonderful addition to the right household.If you want to meet Lady go to EHRDOGS.ORG and submit an application. Don't forget to ask for LADY BEAUFORT - she is waiting so patiently at the kennel for someone to fall in love with her and bring her home. Could that someone be you?

Aidan came to us as a badly neglected stray from South Carolina. He has since been groomed (his professional photo is pre-grooming) and is on medication to treat his health issues. Aidan looks to be a Yorkie mix and is around 7-8 years old. He would make a wonderful companion to some one who has a quiet house hold.

Buster White is BTN's longest resident.  Buster came to BTN from South Carolina where he was seized by AC as a welfare case.  Buster had no tibia and he needed his ankle fused.  We suspect he was hit by a car and left to heal on his own.  He was starving to death and heartworm positive.  We worked with VOSM and Buster is in good shape now..  Buster loves other dogs and may or may not be okay with cats.  He's gets along great with people.  Buster is BTN's poster child for happiness.  He loves life and is thrilled just to have a bed, food and somewhere warm to stay.  He's currently heartworm negative and his legs are repaired  If you can find a place for Buster White in your heart, please email me.  He's fully vetted and microchipped.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Hi my name is Reba, and I am a fun, loving, and outgoing pup! I love belly rubs and spending time with my foster family. I was rescued from the reservation in South Dakota. When I was first rescued I wasn't sure what to think about humans and they made me nervous, but right away I knew that I loved to be loved on. I have since come out of my shell and I love and I mean love to spend time with my foster family. My foster family tells me all of the time that I am beautiful and have the most piercing eyes. I love to play with my foster family! I am learning how to play fetch. My favorite thing is to be outside. I would LOVE a family that likes to spend time outdoors hiking and walking as I have a lot of energy. Though I really want a family that is active I also want to be able to spend time cuddling and having belly rubs. Since I spent so much time outside I think that little animals like squirrels are food so no critters for me. Like a lot of dogs sometimes I get mouthy when I play but if you tell me no I will stop. I am hoping to find my forever family soon! If you think you can give me lots of love submit an application today! I can't wait to meet you!For more information on Reba or to fill out an adoption application today at www.RescueCrew.org.Good with dogsGood with peopleLoves the outdoorsPotty trainedCrate trainedLeash trainedLoves Cuddles

NYC Area -- Jasmine is a female Yorkie/Terrier mix at 2 years old and weighs about 15 pounds. She was from the Yongin, Korea shelter and now she is looking for a forever home. Jasmine is sweet, friendly, easy-going, gets along great with other dogs, and she’s the perfect apartment-sized dog. Apply to adopt Jasmine!Come meet Jasmine at our adoption event:Saturday, June 29thLazy Suzy Cafe & Shop703 Hart StBrooklyn, NY 1122112pm - 4pm———KK9R Adoption Procedures:1. Complete an online application at koreank9rescue.org2. Come to the event with a printed copy of your application so you can meet the actual dog(s)3. Bring all of your human household residents4. After meeting the dog or dog(s) you are interested in, get interviewed by one of our team members by handing in your application the day of the event. For dogs 1 year and under: 2:45pm is the cut-off time to physically submit your application and be interviewed for dogs under 1 year old, after 2:45 pm we will not accept applications or interviews for dogs under 1 year old (that includes puppies). For dogs 1 year and over: 4pm is the cut-off time to physcially submit your application and be interviewed. 5. We do not adopt dogs first come, first serve. We accept all applications for review and at approximately 3pm, make the placement decision based on who is the best match for the dog, not the human. You will be contacted ONLY if you are selected to adopt. 6. You must have the proper supplies before you can leave with the dog. Our dogs are a flight risk and must be fitted onsite. See our supplies list at koreank9rescue.org/resources for the exact items needed. We believe adoption is a privilege, not a right.NO OUTSIDE DOGS ALLOWED INTO OUR EVENTS UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCESBE ADVISED: Korean K9 Rescue does local adoptions within a 30-mile radius of Brooklyn, New York. Beyond this distance, adoptions are rare and handled on a case-by-case basis. Please contact us in advance to confirm if you are eligible/if the specific dog can be adopted outside of radius. Most adoptions are done THE SAME DAY of the event. Please plan accordingly!Adoption Fee: Puppies $675.00 / Adults $600.00You must be 24 years and older to adopt from us(all dogs are spay/neutered, fully vaccinated & microchipped)Questions? Email info@koreank9rescue.orgHAVE FUN AND BRING A POSITIVE ATTITUDE AND ENERGY FOR OUR PUPS IN NEED OF FOREVER HOMES!———Fill out an online application here: http://bit.ly/2D6f5ZyYou must be 24 years of age or older to adopt.**If this dog is listed here that means s/he is STILL available**We believe people adopt rescue animals because even though there can be challenges, it is an extremely rewarding experience. As an adopter of a rescue animal, you are willing to accept the imperfections and baggage of an animal’s past and will work with them, train them, and love them for all that they are. Our adopted dogs who have gone to patient, loving families have had some incredible transformations, and we hope to provide each and every one of our rescues with this opportunity for a new life. We absolutely love seeing photos of our alums relaxed and smiling in their new adoptive homes, and we hope that you will consider adopting one of our pups and give them the opportunity to grow and find happiness with you.Follow us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/KoreanK9Rescue/Instagram: @koreank9rescueFor more information, please visit http://www.koreank9rescue.org

NYC Area -- Eunji is a female Jindo mix at 10 months old and weighs about 12 pounds. She was pulled from the Gangneung, Korea shelter and now she is looking for a wonderful forever home. She is sweet, curious, and shy. She would do best with a dedicated adopter who will enroll in training to help her become more comfortable and confident. Apply to adopt Eunji!Come meet Eunji at our adoption event:Saturday, June 29thLazy Suzy Cafe & Shop703 Hart StBrooklyn, NY 1122112pm - 4pm———KK9R Adoption Procedures:1. Complete an online application at koreank9rescue.org2. Come to the event with a printed copy of your application so you can meet the actual dog(s)3. Bring all of your human household residents4. After meeting the dog or dog(s) you are interested in, get interviewed by one of our team members by handing in your application the day of the event. For dogs 1 year and under: 2:45pm is the cut-off time to physically submit your application and be interviewed for dogs under 1 year old, after 2:45 pm we will not accept applications or interviews for dogs under 1 year old (that includes puppies). For dogs 1 year and over: 4pm is the cut-off time to physcially submit your application and be interviewed. 5. We do not adopt dogs first come, first serve. We accept all applications for review and at approximately 3pm, make the placement decision based on who is the best match for the dog, not the human. You will be contacted ONLY if you are selected to adopt. 6. You must have the proper supplies before you can leave with the dog. Our dogs are a flight risk and must be fitted onsite. See our supplies list at koreank9rescue.org/resources for the exact items needed. We believe adoption is a privilege, not a right.NO OUTSIDE DOGS ALLOWED INTO OUR EVENTS UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCESBE ADVISED: Korean K9 Rescue does local adoptions within a 30-mile radius of Brooklyn, New York. Beyond this distance, adoptions are rare and handled on a case-by-case basis. Please contact us in advance to confirm if you are eligible/if the specific dog can be adopted outside of radius. Most adoptions are done THE SAME DAY of the event. Please plan accordingly!Adoption Fee: Puppies $675.00 / Adults $600.00You must be 24 years and older to adopt from us(all dogs are spay/neutered, fully vaccinated & microchipped)Questions? Email info@koreank9rescue.orgHAVE FUN AND BRING A POSITIVE ATTITUDE AND ENERGY FOR OUR PUPS IN NEED OF FOREVER HOMES!———Fill out an online application here: http://bit.ly/2D6f5ZyYou must be 24 years of age or older to adopt.**If this dog is listed here that means s/he is STILL available**We believe people adopt rescue animals because even though there can be challenges, it is an extremely rewarding experience. As an adopter of a rescue animal, you are willing to accept the imperfections and baggage of an animal’s past and will work with them, train them, and love them for all that they are. Our adopted dogs who have gone to patient, loving families have had some incredible transformations, and we hope to provide each and every one of our rescues with this opportunity for a new life. We absolutely love seeing photos of our alums relaxed and smiling in their new adoptive homes, and we hope that you will consider adopting one of our pups and give them the opportunity to grow and find happiness with you.Follow us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/KoreanK9Rescue/Instagram: @koreank9rescueFor more information, please visit http://www.koreank9rescue.org

Calling all Poodle lovers!  Teddy is a very handsome and sweet approximately 2 1/2 year old, 12 lb. poodle who recently arrived on his freedom flight from S Korea, where he was going to be surrendered to a kill shelter.  Teddy absolutely loves his humans and follows his foster family all over the house.  Teddy is working on his housebreaking and loves to be outdoors.  He gets along with other dogs, but would prefer to be your one and only furry companion.  Teddy's ideal home is with experienced adopters, a yard to explore (no apartment living for him), older children and someone who will be home with him often.

NYC Area -- Rescued from a high kill shelter in South Korea, Miro is a sweet and friendly Maltese mix. At 5 years old and weighing approximately 9 pounds, Miro is currently being fostered in NYC and is looking for his forever home! Miro easily gets attached to one person and will develop possession aggression to protect that person or toys, treats etc. Miro's adopter needs to be willing to work with one of our rehab trainers to help him work through this aggression and set up structure and firm boundaries for him and a loving stable home. Miro has alot to offer - he is smart, very trainable and loyal. He loves belly rubs and looks so handsome every time we take pics of him! Audrey is 3 years old and 36 lbs. F.The rescue story of Audrey is one of pure sadness yet again, sweet Audrey was homeless & living on the streets of Korea her whole sweet little life & how she stayed alive on the streets of Korea is a pure miracle in itself. She was picked up & dropped off at a high kill shelter in Korea & when she was about to lose her lovely little life the Korean rescue stepped in & rescued her & as always we are beyond grateful to the Korean rescue & we are so extremely grateful for what they do.She is so very sweet & affectionate with people, but will be shy at first until she knows & trusts you. She enjoys being cuddled & playing & being hugged by humans. She absolutely adores her foster dad & he absolutely adores her so a home where her new dad could give her lots of love & cuddles would be perfect.Audrey is UTD on her shots and is spayed. Her adoption fee is $400.*Audrey is currently at a foster in Korea. We transport our dogs after an adopter has been secured, so unfortunately, we do not provide meet and greets. Instead, we do our best to provide as much description, pictures and videos as possible. *** We typically do not adopt to homes with children under 8 years old. A home check is mandatory before adoption. We adopt to residents of Northern VA and Washington DC suburbs only. Applicants must be at least 24 years old. ***If you would like to adopt her, please fill out our online application at https://sites.google.com/view/donghaepaws/. An HDP volunteer will reach out for more information after a careful review of your application. Please understand this may take few days. Thank you! Prior to rescue, many of our dogs have experienced minimal socialization and it takes time for them to learn about life as a family pet. Common skills such as house training and leash walking may often take a little extra time. Patience, understanding and a gentle hand are a must. The great news is, most of these dogs come around rather quickly and being a part of their rehabilitation is an extremely rewarding experience.We typically do not adopt to homes with children under 8 years old. A home check is mandatory before adoption. *** About us *** Hope For Donghae Paws(HDP) is a non-profit 501(c)(3) public charity dedicated to bringing rescue dogs from Korea to the US and finding permanent homes for them. It is true there are many animal lovers in Korea, but still many dogs suffer and are killed for food. Our mission is to find US homes for mixed-breed dogs whose chances of being adopted in their native Korea are very low. Find more about us on Facebook and Instagram! https://www.facebook.com/donghaepaws/ https://www.instagram.com/donghaepaws/

Walnut is estimated to be two years old, spayed female who weighs about 20 lbs.  Walnut and her puppies were rescued from a high kill shelter in South Korea. We are so excited to share about Walnut because Walnut’s son Alvin came to US and found his forever loving home and is just loving his new life. We would like to provide a loving home for Walnut as well that she so deserves. **Foster Update: Walnut is loving her life in the states. Foster mom says she is adjusting really well. She is very quiet, affectionate and fully potty trained! Now, things could change with new environment, but we are told she is all around an awesome gal. Walnut does get a bit afraid of other furry ones and would be best at a home as an only dog. Walnut was born with Microphthalmia, under developed right eye but does not require any other medical attention for it. We are told Walnut is a is a very sweet dog, but just because she is a mixed breed and slightly different, noone welcomed her as a family in Korea.  She still needs lots of human touch and interaction with people until she feels more comfortable with her human companion, but other than that, she received a clean bill of health from the vet, and she is ready to be adopted!We believe people who adopt rescue animals because they are willing to accept a bit of imperfection, and willing to embrace, work/ train and love them no matter what baggage the animal had in the past. It can be challenging, but extremely rewarding. We have seen amazing transformation in our adopted dogs who have been with loving families, and it is our goal to provide all of them with the opportunity. We are at our happiest when we see photos of our adopted animals smile with the new adoptive family, and we hope to find Walnut a loving family who would do the same.  Please consider adopting Walnut and making her part of your family! If you would like to apply to adopt Walnut you can download an application here:  https://forms.gle/kBVSZ1kkmTgkhpBC6   You can MEET Walnut upon request or at one of our adoption event in the near future.  We will post the exact date once we finalize the plan.  Please refer to our facebook page for more info:https://www.facebook.com/Band4Animal/ *NOTE* We have a 30-mile radius limit from Fairfax, VA for adoption.  We require a completed application & home check to adopt. An adoption fee of $500 applies. All dogs are spay/neutered and have all shots prior to adoption. Thank you!

Bella is 1.5 years old and 49 lbs. FBella was found on the streets of South Korea, possibly attached by another dog. While we were rescuing her, we found five of her puppies(Jinu, Sean, Hyori, Yoojin, and Yuri) as well! We believe that she most fought with another dog to protect her puppies but was hurt in the process. Because of her injuries, she underwent surgery twice and now completely healthy.Due to her past, we are looking for a home that is very patient and an only dog home with no young children. Bella is a little hesitant of new places and people, but she will definitely open up over time. She will most likely require training, so we recommend training classes for her. If you have previous Chow Chow experience, that is preferred. She is doing very well with her foster home and is very sweet and cute! A home check is mandatory before adoption. *** About us *** Hope For Donghae Paws(HDP) is a non-profit 501(c)(3) public charity dedicated to bringing rescue dogs from Korea to the US and finding permanent homes for them. It is true there are many animal lovers in Korea, but still many dogs suffer and are killed for food. Our mission is to find US homes for mixed-breed dogs whose chances of being adopted in their native Korea are very low. Find more about us on Facebook and Instagram! https://www.facebook.com/donghaepaws/ https://www.instagram.com/donghaepaws/

Ray is 6 years old and 40 lbs, MRay's story starts being abandoned in an unoccupied building waiting for his owner for 4 years. Being on the street, he was abused by the people there and struggled to find food. He was rescued by another organization and adopted, but the adopted family lived in the countryside and left Ray tied up outside. Our  team in Korea stepped back in and took Ray back. Unfortunately, Ray was very hurt and was unfit to be readopted. He stays in our training center with other dogs to rehabilitate where he learned to be happy again. Right now, Ray is doing amazing and has many friends at the training facility! He loves the people there and enjoys sun bathing with the other puppies. He is great with people and loves other dogs.  Unfortunately, he does have some trauma to men so it will take time for him to adjust to male figures. The trainers at the facility are mostly men and he enjoys their company; it did take time though. Since Ray has had a very difficult life, we are looking for an understanding, patient, and loving forever home. Ray would do best in a sole home or with another dog that is calmer and/or a senior dog. Ray was heart worm positive, but he received treatment and is completely healthy. Ray is UTD on his shots and will be neutered. His adoption fee is $350.*Ray is currently at a foster in Korea. Faith was rescued from a dog meat farm in South Korea, thanks to Humane Society International. (Fortunately, this dog meat farm has since closed and been converted into a vegetable and chili farm!) Faith is loving life in Virginia! While she is still learning to trust, she is slowly blossoming into a smart playful pup with the help of her behavior trainer friends and the staff and volunteers who love her. She would likely do best in a quiet home with another dog to be her best buddy and show her the way. Faith still has a long road ahead as she learns to trust people, but we think she will be a wonderful fit for a calm family who is willing to go on this special journey with her.*I'M AVAILABLE FROM A FOSTER HOME!* Please call 703-746-4774 or email adoptions@alexandriaanimals.org for more information or to schedule a time to visit me!

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Name: VogueDOB: 315/201Weight: 44#Adoption Fee: $350My name is Vogue, and I am a Jindo from Korea. I am very smart and learned to be house trained in 3 days and to sit in 2. I am not a huge fan of my kennel, but I am learning it’s not so scary and I settle in after a while. I’m pretty young and I need a human who wants to play with me. I love to play with balls! I like how theybounceand roll and I chase them all over and sometimes I give them back to my foster mom and she throws them again! I like people, if they are not wearing hats. I like to play with submissive dogs, but I prefer to be humans. No kitties for me though. I kind of act tough, but sometimes like to push my head lightly into your chest for comfort. Does anyone want to play with me?An adoption application is the best way to show your interest in an animal.Please check out our website, www.ruffstartrescue.org for more details and additional pictures on any of our animals!All Ruff Start dogs and cats are spayed/neutered, up to date on age appropriate vaccines, microchipped, dewormed, and on monthly flea/tick and heartworm prevention (dogs) as well as heartworm tested (dogs).Ruff Start Rescue is a foster based rescue. Animals are located in homes throughout Minnesota. We do not have a facility where animals are kept.Ruff Start Rescue Adoption Policies: http://www.ruffstartrescue.org/info/display?PageID=11744

I love to run outside, eat snow and play chase with resident dogs.I am potty trained and crate trained. If you give me snacks i take them gently and slowly eat them, i like to taste my food not woof it down.I do not get up on furniture i prefer the floor, i don't get cold from laying on the floor because i wear my sweatshirt.I am looking for a family to have my first with and that only want to give love. If your that family, lets meet and sniff each other out.An adoption application is the best way to show your interest in an animal. Pomi is 2 yrs old. She and her son, Rori , were rescued from the meat trade in Korea. She is very sweet and friendly. She would love to be adopted with her son.

My name is Lilo from Korea and I am a beautiful 2 yr old Female Golden Retriever I am 55 lbs and would love an active family to love and care for me. I am a very happy, affectionate loving girl. I am a high energy dog who was saved from the Korean Dog Meat Trade. Many of my friends were not as lucky.Korea kills an estimated 2.5 million dogs a year to be eaten. We are tortured and suffer unimaginable pain .I am so lucky to get a one way ticket to come to Seattle to find a new forever home! Take me on car rides, walks in the park and I will become your very best friend. I get along well with people of all ages, gentle kids and other dogs. I need a home with a fenced in yard and will do best with a loving family that can give me lots of exercise, love and affection! On all overseas adoptions our pet rescue dog trainer will be required to come to your home and help train with your new puppy for only $75. My adoption fee of $2450 Will cover my Neuter DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordetella, Deworm, Heart Worm Test, Grooming, Microchip, Boarding Fees, Health Certificate, and AIRLINE TRANSPORT COST from KOREA to SEATTLE. The adoption fee is firm and helps save many more dogs just like me. It helps cover medical expenses of other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, urgent vet care, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals and more. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501 C 3.

On all overseas adoptions our pet rescue dog trainer will be required to come to your home and help train with your new puppy for only $75. My adoption fee of $1350. Will cover my Spay, DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordetella, Deworm, Heart Worm Test, Grooming, Microchip, Boarding Fees, Health Certificate, and AIRLINE TRANSPORT COST from KOREA to SEATTLE. The adoption fee is firm and helps cover the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, urgent vet care, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals and more. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a non profit 501 C 3 organization

My name is Hershey from Korea and I am a wonderful 2 year old male Chocolate Poodle and I am 12 lbs. and so excited to find my forever home soon. I am a very happy, affectionate and friendly dog who was just saved from a Slaughter House Farm being SOLD to the Dog Meat Dealer to be butchered up for food. I was fed garbage and rotten food and I was supposed to be made into soju elixir. Sadly my mom went to the meat market and it was too late to save her. My name is Loki from Korea and I am a wonderful 18 month old very Handsome Male Malumute and I am 65 lbs. and so excited to find my forever home soon. I am a very happy, affectionate and friendly dog who was just saved from the slaughter farm being SOLD to the Dog Meat Dealer to be butchered up for food. I was fed garbage and rotten food and I was supposed to be made into soju elixer. Sadly my mom went to the meat market and it was too late to save her. Korea is so overloaded with dogs roaming all over the streets with no food, love or care and many have been tied up since birth. I am so lucky to get a one way ticket to come to Seattle to find a new forever home! Take me on car rides, walks in the park and I will become your very best friend. I get along well with people of all ages, gentle kids and other dogs. I am trained and extremely smart and I need a home with a fenced in yard. I need a home with a loving family that can give me lots of exercise, love and affection! Nelson is a 2? year old Spanish Greyhound (galgo espanol) from Spain. Nelson's adoption fee is $650, which covers their flight to the US, paperwork, air crate, neuter and other veterinary care. While we prefer that adopters pick up their dogs from their foster homes, we adopt to families across the US and Canada. If you need assistance transporting your dog home, we will help make the arrangements but you will be responsible for the actual costs, which are usually $300-600. If you're interested in adding this dog to your pack, the first step is to fill out an application at http://sighthoundunderground.com.NOTE: Please do not click the ADOPT ME button on this page. If you are interested in adopting a dog from SHUG you must go to our website and fill out our application at http://sighthoundunderground.com. We will not reply to your email until you have taken the time to fill out our application. We apologize for the inconvenience but we are an all volunteer organization with limited resources. This is the best way we have found to make the best use of our time. There are a lot of people who just want to ask questions but will never adopt and unfortunately we just don't have time to chat.

Oreo and his sister Sunny have come to us from the Island of St Maarten. This little guy is 10 weeks old and weighs 9 lbs. Oreo is a little shy and cautious but very sweet and affectionate, once he warms up to his surroundings.

Sunny and her brother Oreo have come to us from the Island of St Maarten. This little girl is 10 weeks old and weighs 8 lbs. Sunny is outgoing, curious, and playful. She warms up quickly and likes to snuggle.

Ella is a 3-year-old Pointer and Formosan Mountain Dog Mix from the country of Taiwan.  She currently weighs 44 pounds (as of 5/4/2019) and is fully-grown.  Ella’s rescued story:When Ella was few weeks old, she and the other two black puppies were brought into a sugar factory by the labors to watch the site.  A year later, the factory was shut down, Ella and the other two dogs were abandoned and became strays.   Luckily, some of city farmers in that area were very friendly to them and fed them regularly except for the owner of the farm threatened to take Ella and other dogs to the shelter.Since being raised by the people, Ella likes to hang out with those farmers; especially there was a farmer who brought treats for Ella every time when she visited.  Surprisingly, Ella always carried a “gift” for this farmer when she saw her; the gift could be a piece of banana tree bark, coconut tree bark, a small fragrant magnolia flower or a dry leaf.  The farmer said even those gifts were not valuable in many people’s eyes, they were the most special gifts to her; she has kept every piece of them.  One day, Ella’s left front leg was brutally broken by the farm owner with a thick stick when she was begging for the food, but none of those farmer could afford to take Ella for a surgery.  Although Ella’s broken leg had healed afterwards but she started to lame heavily.  Ella’s tough life did not end after this injury.  Few weeks later in a cold winter, Ella gave birth to seven puppies, but in a week, two of puppies were stolen by some foreign labors living in that area for meat.  Farmers immediately relocated and adopted out the rest of five puppies, but they could not protect Ella from being abused by some other farmers who did not like dogs.  Every time they found new cuts or open wounds on Ella’s body; they saw some farmers hit Ella with stones or broom sticks several times.  The place where Ella had grown became dangerous to her, the farmers worried that Ella would be the next dog meat to those foreign labors soon.  The farmer who received the gifts from Ella posted Ella’s story on her face book for help that has touched and shared by thousands of people and was reported by a television station.  Ella became an internet celebrity in Taiwan overnight and many people wanted to adopt her but nobody wanted to spend money fixing her injured leg; they only fancied her fame.  Ella’s completed medical information:When our organization decided to rescue Ella, we already understood that it would cost a fortune to get her broken leg fixed.  In last July in 2018, Ella had received a closing wedge osteotomy for her deformity broken leg from the best orthopedic doctor in Taiwan; it is one of the most complicated and expensive surgeries that dogs can have.  Fortunately, Ella’s leg has been healing very well after surgery.  She does not need special cares and is able to do all activities as other dogs can do and is pain-free for these activities.  She can run and play with other dogs but should be avoided fetching.  Ella should not be the candidate for daily running or jogging either; hiking, swimming and walking are all good exercises for her. Ella has passed the following medical tests: distemper test, 4 Idexx (Heartworm, Lyme, Ehrlichia, Anaplasma Phagocytophilum), CBC, Biochemistry blood work and a PCR test.  She had teeth cleaned and also had x-rays on her hips; she does not have hip dysplasia. Ella is spayed, de-wormed, up to date on all vaccinations including rabies shot.  She is heartworm negative and on preventative treatment and is micro chipped.  All Ella's medical documents including the x-rays films on her hips and both pre- and post- surgeries will be given to her adopter when she is adopted. Ella’s temperaments and personality:Ella has been living with a foster family with many other dogs together.  Her foster parents run a dog training school, Ella gets chances to meet different dogs and dog owners; she gets along with the dogs and is friendly to the visitors.  Ella is especially gentle to the puppies; she has developed a special bond with a blind black puppy there.  Those puppies might remind Ella of the puppies she had once.  Ella had lived with the other family for three months with some dogs and a dog-friendly but dominant cat “Professor”.  Ella was very curious about the cats in the beginning; she tried to chase Professor and stray cats whenever she saw them.  Until one day, Professor hissed at Ella and scared her, Ella started to stay away from the cats.  The foster mom said that she believes Ella can live with cats as long as her new parents introduce her to the cat properly. Like other Pointers, Ella still carries the instinct of hunting.  Her current foster mom also a dog trainer said that when Ella spots birds, she would point by stopping and aiming its muzzle towards the birds and spend a lot of time waiting for a good chance to catch them, but she has not successfully caught anything yet.Ella’s both foster parents agreed that Ella is a very smart dog and sometimes is stubborn; she would try to test her owner’s limit.  She needs experienced dog owners who can give her commands firmly and make sure that she follows through; otherwise, she would think that she could get away with it.  She will be good for moderately active family with older children above 12 years old who are also familiar with dogs.   Ella is not passionate nor shy towards the strangers.  When she arrives a new environment, she needs 10-20 minutes to warm up.  Ella is more friendly when she meets strangers outside the house and then slowly introduce the strangers into the house.  Ella is very sweet and submissive to her care takers.  Ella LOVES food and does not waste any food at all; she usually cleans up the food dropped by other dogs on the floor.  Ella is not food or toys aggression or possession toward people.Ella does not like to get wet, so she does not like to go out in the rain.  She is not afraid of thunder or fireworks and does not have separation anxiety either.   She does not chew furniture and enjoys playing toys by herself if no any other dogs play with her, her favorite toys are stuffed animals. Ella is house broken and likes to do her business on the grass but she prefers to use the bathroom off leash; otherwise, she would need a long walk before doing her business.  Ella will do better with a house with fully enclosed fenced in yard; an apartment setting or people sharing living space with roommates will not work for her.Ella loves car rides and does well in the car.  She is not energetic but likes to run with other dogs.  We hope Ella’s parents can include her in your daily activities to take her for outings, short trips or visiting friends except for daily neighbors walk or playing in the yard.  We really want Ella to have the opportunities to experience different parts of her life that she had missed before.  Where is Ella and how to meet her?Ella is still in Taiwan.  If you are seriously thinking of giving Ella a loving permanent home, please contact us to ask for an adoption application.  Because we do not have a shelter to show people our rescues and all of our dogs are living with our foster family, we do not accept stop-by visits if you are interested in seeing our dogs.  Before meeting Ella, the prospective adopter needs to fill out the application and be approved. More videos of Ella are as follow: 1. Benson is a 17-month-old Scottish Terrier, Corgi and Formosan Mountain Dog Mix from the country of Taiwan.  He currently weighs 58 pounds (as of 4/28/2018) and is fully grown. Benson’s rescued story and completed medical information:In last March, Benson and his other three brothers at age 4 months old were rescued together from a huge cemetery area in the Central Taiwan where many people dump their unwanted dogs that became strays.  Benson’s three brothers all look like Corgi or Scottish Terrier Mix, and Benson is the only one has short hair and long legs, but he has the best temperament than his brothers.Luckily, Benson was a healthy puppy except for underweight.  He has received the following medical tests and an x-ray on his hips and joints as a routine exam: Distemper test, 4 Idexx (Heartworm, Lyme, Ehrlichia, Anaplasma Phagocytophilum), CBC, Biochemistry blood work, and a PCR test for diseases and infections transmitted by fleas or ticks.  Benson was negative on all diseases and infections and does not have hip dysplasia either.  He will have his teeth cleaned before coming to the US for adoption.Benson is neutered, de-wormed, up to date on all vaccinations including rabies shot. He is heartworm negative and on preventative treatment and is micro chipped.  All Benson's medical documents including x-rays films on his hips will be given to his adopter when he is adopted. Benson’s temperaments and personality:Benson has been living with a foster family with their three dog-friendly cats and some other dogs of different sizes together.  He gets along very well with both dogs and cats, and he is a Gentle Giant in their eyes.  Benson is the target of being chased by a group of dogs while playing; when they are sleeping, Benson becomes their pillow.Benson loves people and is very submissive to his caregivers, but he is quite shy to the strangers.  The foster mom said that Benson usually hides when people come visit her; she leashes Benson out to introduce people to him and then Benson would be fine and want to be pet after a few minutes of meeting them.  Therefore, Benson would appreciate patient and experienced owners who are familiar and understand his shyness and give him 2-3 days to warm up.  After Benson feels comfortable with the new environment, he is a calm and affectionate dog that often wants to cuddle.  His foster mom said Benson is a very quiet but sweet companion; he is her shadow and quietly follows her wherever she goes.  Every time when she turns around, Benson is always next to her and wants to be pet and hugged.The foster mom has two older children at age 9 and 10.  They have never been scared by Benson’s large size, but Benson to them is more easygoing than many of other their foster dogs are.  They walk Benson on leash very often and Benson is always gentle and well behaved while being out with them.  Benson is not food or toys aggression or possession toward people and dogs; he does not mind that his food or toys being taken away.  His foster mom said that if any dogs want his toy, he would drop it and let them take it.Benson is young but is not energetic nor needs some heavy outdoor activities; he is laid back.  He will be good for moderately active family that has children older than 7 years old.  We do not think that Benson will do well with retired senior citizens since he still needs various activities than daily walks.  A house with physical fence will be great for Benson; we do not prefer to place him to an apartment/condo setting or sharing living space with roommates.Benson is house broken and rarely barks.  Although he is big, but he is very mellow and is not the candidate for watching the house because he may hide when he sees somebody breaking into the house.  Benson loves car rides and does well in the car; he also walks very well on leash.  We are looking for the family that like to include Benson in your daily activities to take him for outings, one-day trips or vacations except for daily neighborhood walks or playing in the backyard.Where is Benson?Benson is currently in Taiwan and will be scheduled to the US after we find a promised family for him, and he will be staying in North Wilmington in Delaware after his arrival.  If you are seriously thinking of giving Benson a loving permanent home, please email us for an application.  Because we do not have a shelter to show people our dogs and all our rescues live with our foster family, we do not accept stop-by visits if you are interested in seeing our dogs.  Before meeting Benson, the prospective adopter needs to fill out the application and gets approved.More videos of Benson are as below:1. Burger is a 11-month-old Basenji and Formosan Mountain Dog Mix from the country of Taiwan.  He currently weighs 41 pounds (as of 4/9/2019) and is estimated to be under 45 pounds when is fully grown.  Burger’s rescued story:Burger was rescued at a fishing port in Southern Taiwan in last August.  His rescuer took her 7-year-old daughter to visit the fishing port where a puppy happily ran to them from the distance, he was very passionate and wanted to play.  The rescuer did not rescue Burger right away because her hands were full at that time; she has many rescued dogs that were still waiting for homes.  But after returning home, she could not stop worrying about Burger's safety as he was so friendly to strangers.  That fishing port was one of dangerous places for strays in Taiwan, every year many strays disappeared overnight from being illegally caught and eaten by some foreign workers living in that area.  Two days after seeing Burger, the rescuer decided to re-visit the fishing port to rescue Burger.   Luckily, Burger was still there and still ran to them passionately when he saw them as he just saw his old friends.   Burger’s completed medical information:Burger is a healthy young dog, he has done the following medical tests after being rescued:  Distemper test, 4 Idexx (Heartworm, Lyme, Ehrlichia, Anaplasma Phagocytophilum), CBC, Biochemistry blood work, and a PCR test for diseases and infections transmitted by fleas or ticks.  He was negative on all diseases and infections and does not have hip dysplasia. Burger is neutered, de-wormed, up to date on all vaccinations including a rabies shot.  He is heartworm negative and on preventative treatment and is micro chipped.  All of Burger's medical documents including X-rays films on his hips will be given to his adopter when he is adopted. Burger's temperaments and personality:Burger is house broken, gets along very well with dogs, cats and children; one of his good friends in his foster home is a cat.  Burger is a gentle young dog with a very mellow disposition and is not hyperactive.  He is not shy but quite affectionate and super friendly to the strangers.  Burger likes children.  His foster mom in Taiwan has two children at the age of 10 and 11, Burger gets along very well with them and is their good friend; they usually leash Burger for night walks and watch television together.  Burger does not have separation anxiety and is not food or toy aggressive or possessive toward both people and dogs.   Burger loves food; sometimes he is a counter-surfer and steals his foster mom's breakfast from the table.  He also loves water.  The foster mom said that every time after heavily rain, Burger loves to go to the yard and never missed playing in the puddles to get himself wet.  He loves playing toys as well and especially likes stuffed animals, rope and tug toys and big dental bones.  If nobody plays with Burger, he would carry a toy or dental bone to his bed and quietly chew it by himself.  He also likes to play with toys for a while before sleeping.Burger has a very funny personality; his foster mom jokingly said that Burger should compete in the Academy Awards for best actor.  One day Burger bumped into a tree trunk while running and chasing with other dogs, he cried entire day and lift his paw several times to show his foster mom that he was hurt.  But the following morning, Burger already started to play with a group of dogs in the yard and did not seem to be bothered by the paw hurt from yesterday; however, when he saw the foster mom giving the treats, he suddenly went to lie on the couch and lift his paw again while quietly whimpering to get attention.    Burger loves to go for rides; he is well-behaved and quiet in the car.  He walks very well on leash.  He rarely barks except for playing and exciting so he would not be a good guard dog because he does not bark at strangers.Burger loves to run with other dogs in the yard; we do not think that he will do well in apartment.  We prefer the family that has a fully enclosed fenced in yard and do not prefer apartment setting or people sharing living space with roommates.Burger will be great for moderately active family with older children at 7-year-old and up.  We hope Burger’s parents can include him in your daily activities; for example, taking him for outings, short trips or visiting friends except for daily neighborhood walks or playing in the yard.  We really like Burger to have the opportunities to experience different parts of his life that he can enjoy.  Where is Burger and how to meet him?Burger has arrived in the USA on April 9 in 2019, and is currently staying with our foster family in North Wilmington in Delaware.  If you are seriously thinking of giving Burger a loving permanent home, please contact us to ask for an adoption application.  Because we do not have a shelter to show people our rescues and all our dogs are living with our foster family, we do not accept stop-by visits if you are interested in seeing our dogs.  Before meeting Burger, the prospective adopter needs to fill out the application and be approved. More videos of Burger are as follow: 1. Gordon is a happy, sweet, and gentle pup. He is just 6 months old, 20 lbs but will grow to medium plus in size. He is a Formosan mix (or Taiwanese Mountain Dog), a breed that is not found commonly in our area (The Formosan breed is not listed in our database so we had to list her as a lab mix type).Gordon is Godiva's brother, who we also have rescued. Gordon is so friendly with people, gentle with children, and good with dogs of all sizes. He even likes cats!He has so much love to give and in her foster home is learning quickly things like leash walking, crate training, etc. He loves to ride in cars.He will make a great family dog. Formosans tend to be on the skittish side and can be timid in loud and chaotic places. Gordon will need gentle socialization to get used to busy streets, cars zooming by etc. He will do best in a home with another dog, as this will help him feel less timid.He has been rescued from Taiwan. He and his seven siblings were found abandoned in a ditch left to die, freezing and starving to death. So glad their future will be in loving homes with warmth, fun, exercise and yummy food.Gordon is updated on all shots, neutered and chipped. His adoption fee is $495, a small part of which helps us slightly absorb some of his transport.You can watch Gordon and his siblings on video here:https://youtu.be/xM3hO2Wz3Qw - G pupshttps://youtu.be/DZPuwPrHOBA - G pups looking for homeshttps://youtu.be/14Wk-zxPGW4 - G puppies - March 2019 – Dog ParkWe cover the medical to prepare the pet for adoption and the adopt donations go directly to cover those costs and range from $295-$495. Thank you for stepping up to save a life!To expedite to meet with this dog, please go to our site at www.savinggreatanimals.org and fill out an application. We look at the first applications to arrive, so we hope to hear from you soon!

My name is Akio from Taiwan and I am a wonderful 6 month old Male Taiwan Mountain Dog and Labrador Retriever Mix. I am only 12 lbs., super sweet and very friendly and I am so excited to come to America to find my forever home soon. I will grow to a medium size dogand I love to play with other dogs.I get along great with people of all ages, older kids, other dogs but have not been around cats before. Gingers Pet Rescue has teamed up with Maggie Chan of ARF Rescue Team from Taiwan to give us a pass port to come to America on EVA AIRLINES! We are SO lucky and SO excited to embark on our long journey over here. Overseas adoption is our ONLY hope to have a great forever life. We are all spayed, neutered, have all our shots, rabies, heart worm tested, microchip, bordetella, dewormed, groomed and ready for adoption.On all overseas adoptions our pet rescue dog trainer will be required to come to your home and help train with your new dog for only $75.Our adoption fee is $995.00 and so please email us for an application if you are interested.Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501 C 3 Organization.

Instead of \"Bye Felicia\" say \"Hi Felicia!\"  Sweet, sweet, adorable Felicia.  She is a happy, goofy, playful and affectionate little girl despite horrendously cruel treatment she was subjected to in her past.  She may take a little time getting to trust you as humans were not very kind to her previously.  She has had extensive professional obedience training and is very good on a leash.  She does need to be an only dog  in a home with NO children.Being her owner will have some challenges, but they will be well worth the effort of gaining her love and trust!  Once you have earned her trust she becomes an affectionate goofball extraordinaire!  She is so deserving of a normal pain free life.  Please help us make that a reality.Why she is the way she is:  Felicia was rescued from a dog fighting operation in Tennessee.  She was extremely malnourished and emaciated and lived at the end of a massive, heavy chain for years.  She had a very serious tick borne blood disease called babesia at the time but she has been treated for that and is now clear of it.  Her teeth had been filed down to the roots because she was used for breeding and this prevented her from injuring the other dog.  Our vet removed the ones that were badly damaged and infected, so sometimes her tongue hangs out.  We think it just adds to her charm.If you, or someone you know, are interested in adopting or fostering, please visit our site at www.maydaypitbullrescue.org or send us an email at info@maydaypitbullrescue.org

Meet our beloved blonde bombshell Laurie. Laurie is a two month old gorgeous puppy who comes from a municipal shelter in Tennessee with her siblings Hyde, Jackie, Donna, Fez and Kelso. Laurie loves to play and cuddle, and she's friendly towards new people and other pups. She's happy to sit in your lap and get lots of pets, or chase around a squeaky toy while you take a bunch of photos. Laurie has lofty goals of chasing squirrels and carrying large sticks and we support her fully. If you'd like to meet Laurie, or her siblings, come to Bideawee Manhattan today!

This bouncy boy is named Hyde! Hyde is a two month old gorgeous puppy who comes from a municipal shelter all the way in Tennessee with his siblings Laurie, Jackie, Donna, Fez and Kelso. Hyde is a sweet, playful, and loving puppy, who wants nothing more than to gently play with his toys or to be held and coddled. Hyde is looking for a home where he can be the star of your Instagram, the light of your life, and lay in the center of your bed. If you're looking for a cute and well-mannered puppy, then come meet Hyde and his siblings at Bideawee!

Fez is two months old and comes from a municipal shelter in Tennessee with his siblings Laurie, Hyde, Jackie, Donna and Kelso. Fez is a super playful and lovable little boy. He loves people and instead of opting to play with his doggy friends, or some squeaky toys, Fez would rather pounce on your lap, give you kisses and get plenty of attention. When hes not busy eating, napping or wrestling with other pups, hes anxious to meet anyone and everyone he can. Hes and energetic, playful, and loving little pupper and will make a great addition to almost any household. Come meet Fez and his siblings at Bideawee Manhattan today!

This bouncy boy is named Kelso! Kelso is a two month old gorgeous puppy who comes from a municipal shelter all the way in Tennessee with his siblings Laurie, Hyde, Jackie, Donna and Fez. Kelso is a sweet, playful, and loving puppy, who wants nothing more than to gently play with his toys or to be held and coddled. Kelso is looking for a home where he can be the star of your Instagram, the light of your life, and lay in the center of your bed. If you're looking for a cute and well-mannered puppy, then come meet Kelso and his siblings at Bideawee Manhattan today!

How adorable is this little guy ??? Gaston is about 8 weeks old and weighs about 5lbs. We think he is possibly a beagle hound mix and will most likely be medium in size when fully grown. Gaston arrives on 6/29 into NY from Tennessee and is ready to find his forever family. He has been vetted, neutered and microchipped. His adoption fee is $495. Applications can be found at www.snarrnortheast.org

This sweet speckled girl is Joi! Boasting large brown eyes and a stunning ivory coat, dappled with brown, she is simply gorgeous! This precious pooch has traveled all the way from Tennessee to find her forever family! Though this girl can be bashful at first, once she is comfortable she would be happy to spend her days snuggled with her people! She also needs a home that feels comfortable helping her heal and recover. Sadly, she came into Bideawee positive for heartworm, and needs a family that will continue her treatments. Bideawee is willing to pay for the cost of her treatment, as long as it is done at our Animal Hospital here. If Joi sounds like the perfect pooch for you, please call the Westhampton adoption center today!

This little beauty is named Christy. She is a fantastic girl, who is impossible not to adore! Bashful, and gently engaging, it means quite a bit to have her grace you with her love! However, once you're in her circle of friends, she is ever so loving, and loyal to the end. She is a doll, and she deserves (and sometimes demands) only the best. Christy is seeking an equally exquisite and exclusive home to call her own. This precious pooch has traveled all the way from Tennessee to find her forever home! If you're interested in learning more about her, please call the Bideawee Adoption Center in Westhampton, and ask about Christy today!

This handsome hunk is named Jed! Sporting the silkiest ears and a tri-colored coat, he is simply stunning! Jed has traveled all the way from Tennessee to find his forever home. This precious boy would love nothing more than a long walk, while cherishing your company as he enjoys the sweet scents along the way! He is seeking an active family that shares in his love of adventure, hiking, and making friends. If this happy fellow sounds like the one for you, then please call the Bideawee Adoption Center in Westhampton and ask for Jed today!

Meet Ette! This adorable lab puppy was surrendered to the local city shelter with her four siblings when she was only 8-9 weeks old. After a few days at the shelter, one of the staff members thought they looked sick, so she did a parvo test, and they all came back positive! The shelter sent a plea out, begging for rescues to save these puppies and take them through the very expensive parvo treatment. We rescued all five, took them to the emergency vet, and after 3 days there, discovered the test was a false positive and that none of them actually had parvo! What a relief!Ette and her sister Linda went into a foster home together and are adorable, playful, typical lab girls. They are shy around new people, and they love being outside, but after a few minutes, they warm right up and are ready to play! We think Ette would do fine in a home as an only dog, but of course would prefer that she have a canine companion to keep her company and be her best friend. Ette loves dogs of all sizes, would probably not mind cats, even though she hasn't been in a home with them, and she adores kids!Ette is spayed, up to date on her shots, and house broken. She sleeps in a kennel with her sister when her foster family is at work, and loves toys and bones to entertain herself with! Ette is good on a leash, great in the car, and has a happy, typical, goofy lab personality. We dont think she is a pure bred lab, since she was from inner city Memphis, but this 4 month old, 17 pound girl, is as close to purebred as youll find! If you want to give her a forever home, please apply, whether you live in Memphis, or in NJ or surrounding states!

Five month old Tracie has come to us from an overcrowded shelter in Tennessee and we are already so grateful to have her. Tracie is loving and sweet, and she literally smiles when you give her affection. Tracie is new to the big city, but she's warming up to all of the new people and pups she's meeting and is doing great. She loves the company of people and enjoys kisses and scratches, admiration, and baby talk. Tracie loves treats and toys, and when the two of them are combined they may or may not result in an episode of the zoommies. Tracie has all the makings of best friend material, so if you think this girl may be your match, then come meet her at Bideawee today!

I am Elvis, yes you heard right because I am from Memphis. I love people, big and small but I am still a puppy and like to jump, so a little older kids would be great. I love to play with my fosters 9 year old nephew.A perfect day for me would be a trip to the park, playing with my ball, chewing on my bone, playing with some doggy friends and when I am tired snuggling up to my humans.I am house trained and walk good on the leash. I sleep all night in my crate without a peep and learned how to use a doggy door in one day.My foster mom loves me but I really would like a home of my own. If you think I am the right match for you, please hurry to apply.Name: Elvis Pupsley Sex: MaleBreed: Hound mixAge: 8 months as of 5/20/19, DOB 9/21/18Weight: 38 pounds as of 5/20/19 Spayed/Neutered: YesVaccinations: Up to date as of May 2019 Heartworm: Negative 5/29/19Microchipped: yesBASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:Dogs: Yes- He loves other dogs! Very playful puppy. Cats: UntestedKids: Yes- he loves children! Adoption Donation: 450.00IMPORTANT INFORMATION:Interested in a specific dog, please fill out an application if you are interested in a dog. The number of individual inquiries is overwhelming and we are finding it difficult to respond to each one. We cannot guarantee you will receive a timely response.Paws New England is a rescue, not a shelter, and as such we do not have our dogs housed in one location - they are in foster homes both in New England and in our southern foster homes.   If you're interested in a specific dog, please complete a short online application and you will receive a reply within 48 hours so you can ask questions.At present, if a dog is listed on our website, the dog is considered still available HOWEVER, may have applications that have come in before yours but it's still too early to know if any are a good match; therefore we encourage you to apply.NOTICE WITH REGARD TO LOCATION OF DOGS:  Please note: Paws New England is a foster-based rescue. We do not have a brick and mortar building to house the dogs we rescue. We have found that dogs in foster homes are much more adoptable because they have been observed in a home setting. Dogs listed with Paws New England typically reside in various locations throughout the south (primarily Tennessee, Texas, and Arkansas) and New England (not necessarily in the state of Rhode Island). You will be notified by the adoption coordinator of the location of the dog you are interested in so you have the ability to decide whether to pursue adoption or not.Dogs transported to New England are done so at a fee of $150.00 paid directly to the transporting company by Paws New England; no additional transport costs are responsibility of adopter. This fee is included in the adoption donation.Adoption donations cover pre-adoption vet costs (including vaccinations, spay/neuter when age appropriate, and heartworm testing/treatment when necessary), a microchip, and transportation to New England if necessary.Donations for our young, healthy puppies and dogs support their fellow canines of advanced age or suffering from injuries and abuse whose donations are reduced but whose veterinary costs are typically much higher. We appreciate your understanding that your dog will help others in need.All known information about the animal is listed above. We do our best to give accurate information, but most of our dogs are rescues and do not come with a known history.Paws New England abides by the dog importation regulations set forth in the states of MA, CT, NH and RI.

Are you looking for a soft fawn colored coat with grey accents and striking white markings on the softest fur coat? And eyes that can melt the coldest night?Camilla and her three siblings were surrendered to our rescue from Tennessee. She was born with a defect to one of her vertebrae called hemi vertebrae. With her daily doses of CBD oil twice a day (we have determined Hempworx Pet works best for her), you can't tell she has anything wrong until she gets tired and starts to drop her back end a bit.Camilla is housebroken and crate trained. She likes having a crate as it is her comfort zone. She walks very well on a leash, loves long walks and loves to snuggle whenever possible. She is excellent with other dogs, playful and loves toys and treats of all kinds. She is extremely smart and willing to learn anything you want to teach her. She absolutely loves rides in the car and just getting to spend time with you.How can you resist this beautiful face? If you can’t, than send an app and she will pack her bags and catch the next bus. Gia is a big girl with an even bigger heart. This Anatolian Shepherd was rescued from Tennessee, but is looking to find her perfect match right here at your Port Washington, N.Y. campus. She would do best with experienced pet parents who can help her adjust to her new surroundings. Children 18 years and over would pair best with her. She could do well with another dog, but we'd love for them to meet first. She's not a fan of cats though, so dog-only households please. If you are interested in meeting Gia, visit our adoption center.

Meet Lady! Lady is a stunning, healthy, spirited, super sweet mid-size 2 year old female . She is very affectionate and loves giving kisses. Her tail wags constantly! Lady loves everyone she meets, and may bark initionally upon meeting someone, but then realizes she is safe and becomes their best friend!Lady gets along with all dogs. She would do best with mid size or large dogs since she is a high energy dog, who likes to get her energy out by walking, or playing with other dogs in the back yard or dog park.Lady is completely potty trained and has never had an accident in the house! Lady enjoys car rides and spending time outside running and playing with her family. Lady is a smart girl who knows sit and stay. She will respond well to additional training because she loves to please and learns very quickly. Lady has endless amazing qualities and will be a loyal, devoted companion to her family for many years to come. Her foster Mom says that Lady is a precious girl who will make a great family pet, and is in fact the BEST foster dog she has ever fostered.If you are looking for a trainable dog to mold into the perfect pet for your family, then look no farhter than Lady. She loves kids of all ages and sizes, and is smart enough to know not to jump up on them or knock them down. This stunning brindle boston terrier/bulldog mix will do anything to please her person, and learns things so quickly. She is microchipped, spayed, up to date on her shots, and heartworm negative. She loves children and dogs of all ages and sizes but hasn't been around cats. She is currently in Memphis TN but we have weekly transport from Memphis to PA/NJ/CT every weekend! So if you want to make this little girl a part of your family, then apply!

Meet Chloe! This sharpei mix is such a wrinkly and loveable cuddle bug! She is 50 pounds of cuddles, kisses, and cuteness. Hermom says she's an amazing foster pup who is low energy, easy to maintain, and a loving soul. When we had Chloe in our rescue initially her name was Astoria, but she was adopted in the early Fall to a great family that has really fallen into bad times, and unfortunately they reached out to us to rehome her.Chloe was found at a high kill shelter where she was saved literally as they were walking her to the euthanasia room. The head of the shelter called us and said she couldn't bring herself to put down such an amazing dog, who even after four weeks at the shetler was still happy, wagging her tail, and greeting people with such energy and enthusiasm. We agreed this angel needed to be spared so we rushed to the shelter and rescued her. She went to a foster home for a month before we found her family, and she was transported from Memphis to NJ at the end of September.In her home Chloehas flourished. She is calm, gentle, loving, and mellow. She wasin a home with other dogs AND cats and she plays like a puppy with them, but is the only animal in her current home. But she goes on doggie play dates and still loves other animals. She is wonderful on a leash and loves going on long walks, she is crate trained and completely house broken and hermom says she doesn't shed! Chloealso doesn't bark, but she does whine when she needs to go outside or when she wants attention. She is spayed, up to date on her shots, healthy, chipped and looking for her final forever home.

***PLEASE READ DESCRIPTIONS IN FULL***Meet Darling! This beautiful girl is a 2 year old, Female, Pit Mix. She weighs approximately 46 lbs.  Darling has been a great mama to her puppies and she is now ready to find a home of her own! Darling is Heartworm positive and will be going thru treatment in TN before she comes up north. She is fully vetted and looking for an adopter or foster for her arrival from Tennessee in to NYC on July 19th. Apply to adopt or foster sweet Darling today!All of our puppies and dogs come up to date on vaccinations, microchipped, spayed/neutered and dewormed.We are looking for adopters and fosters for Darling's arrival 5/18/2019 from Tennessee. If you are interested in adopting any of the puppies, our adoption fee is $495 ( puppies) $375 ( adults ) which includes transportation from the South and we do suggest putting a 1st, 2nd and 3rd choice on your application if applying for a puppy with several littermates.**PLEASE READ ALL BEFORE EMAILING**If you are interested in adopting any of our dogs, our adoption fee is $495 (puppies) $375 (adults) which includes transportation from the South to NYC and we do suggest putting a 1st, 2nd and 3rd choice on your application if applying for a puppy with several littermates.**Please understand that we are a volunteer based organization. While our volunteers try to answer all emails/questions as quickly as possible, below please find answers to some of our most frequently asked questions. We ask that you please read these FAQ's to see if your question has already been answered before emailing additional questions:- If a dog or puppy is listed on Petfinder, they are still available. Please do not email asking if they are still available. If a dog or puppy is still listed, then we are still accepting applications :-) We do not go on a first come first serve basis, but on best fit for the family and most importantly, the puppy or dog.- We are taking our best guess on breed and size when fully-grown (or already an adult), based on the puppy's/dog’s physical appearance and what we might have learned about one or both parents depending on the situation. We rarely are able to tell the true or full breed mix of dogs as our information is limited most of the time. - The way to start the process for any dog or puppy is by filling out an application. Applications for foster or adoption can be found at www.snarrnortheast.org and by clicking either adopt or foster from the main menu. If you fill out an application, please make sure you answer all the questions in as much detail as possible and that you receive a confirmation email, otherwise we did NOT receive it.

Meet Kara! Kara is an adorable Am Staff/Boxer mix puppy that was initially rescued from an awful location outside of Memphis TN where she was tied outside 24/7. 6/27/19ZELDA -> answers to Georgia.. Cat Friendly - YesKid Friendly - YesDog Friendly - Yes House Broken - YesCrate Trained - YesPretty Much Perfect - YesHello, my name is as you know is Georgia and as you can see from my picture, I am a Hound - Great Dane dog mixed, but mostly, I am all Hound Dog and my temperament is that of a hound dog. I am a very energetic dog with lots of energy and please  know that  I  get along  with my fellow dogs here and I am also \"Very Cat Friendly!\" If you don't mind, I would like to  tell  you a few things about myself so that you aren't having to worry about what has been going on within my past history because always is there a history with us to which needs to be known and understood to which are things that have molded and shaped our lives and behavior.  I  was not a dog that was running around on the streets, but actually, I was living within  a nice home  with a very loving owner; but I am sorry to say that I had some bad  habits to  which she couldn't  deal with and it pained it her to have to surrender me to this Wags org. but for what were or are the problems that I was having, wasn't something that she could deal and put with.Before I talk about what all is good with me, let me talk about the  problems in  which  I  was having, so that you will know as to what all it is that I  am  working  on here  at \"Camp Chester\" The problem that I was having was that  I  was relieving  myself  within my  kennel, but in and  to my defense, I wasn't being let out enough time and when people keep you locked  within  your kennel all day, its hard holding in  what is trying  to come  out. I know that this  was wrong, but  I am only a dog and after a while, I got so use to doing my business  within my  crate that  I had gotten use to going in there. I am also a dog  that has a nose and  I love to  explore things around the house and that at times, had gotten  me  into trouble  a little bit because  my  nose  often  lead me to the trash can. @Now those two things  were the  only things really wrong  with me.  I mean,  you cannot  fault me or hold it against me if I am a dog that is loving too hard or too much now can you? If  you can and do, then I guess that you can add that to the list of  things that  I need  to  work on. But if loving people is a crime, then I am guilty and you can throw away the key. But know that I amnow at \"Camp Chester\" and I am working with a very good trainer and he has promised me that by the time that I graduate from here, I will be a dog with valuable obedient skills and ever problem that I had within my past, will be just that, left in the past. One thing that he told me, that for every dog that he has ever worked with, was dogs in which people loved and had gotten adopted and he says, that he sees something very special within me that others will as well.Please know that I have no aggressive issues whatsoever and  I am a very  people's  friendly dog that loves to be with my owner spending time with them sitting and watching television or just chilling out on the porch.  I  am not a dog  that loves to bark, I am a very quiet dog  who is laid back, until you are taking me out to the park, pool or wherever. I am learning how to play catch  and return with a Frisbee and let me  tell  you that this is a whole lot of  fun  for me  and  my trainer. I got a lot to work on, but I am hoping that by the  time that  I leave  from  here, my skills will be that of other dogs within this sport. Hey, did I mentioned that I will be able to read  your hand sign language signals? My trainer is and has been teaching with nothing but nonverbal commands and using all hand signals. I am doing very well with this. So if you are up for a lifetime companion that will love you, then pick me! Visit www.wagsresuce.com and submit an application!
