Update june 2019. Look at me now my coat is filling in as with meat on my bones I continue to get great care at Taps and I'm looking for a forever home I am just a big Love Bug come meet me today Update I am healing nicely at Taps so fortunate that I found my way here, in my updated picture I'm going for ice cream yep the people here are real nice but I'm looking for my forever home, get your application in, come and meet me and be ready when I am to go home. I was saved from a Memphis, Tennessee, kill shelter by wonderful people that drove me all the way to TAPS. I was a well-behaved boy the whole car ride! I will be in recovery for a few months and then I will be all ready for my forever home. I'm getting special baths and lots of yummy special food to make me feel better and gain weight. So far the shelter people, employees, and volunteers say I am a huge cuddlebug and that I am a near-perfect walker on a leash. Can't wait to see me bloom into the beautiful boy I know I'll be!

Submit an adoption application or receive more information on the adoption process by going to our web site at www.kentuckydachshundrescue.com , call us at 502-863-5447 or email at kydoxierescue@aol.comCoco came from a Tennessee animal shelter. He was a owner surrender the grandkids was being to rough with him so the owners surrendered him. He is a sweetheart and as you can see loves to snuggle. Adjust well to other small dogs and seems to be potty trained.

ZEKE came to the rescue back in September 2016 from an abuse case in Tennessee. He had some health issues to battle but he had no problem overcoming them and healing completelyHe was then adopted in January 2017 to a family with younger kids. We thought it was a good match but we discovered that Zeke needs a stronger owner to keep him in line. He needs to be in a home with a schedule, that includes his walking and exercise time. Zeke loves to walk and needs to be walked to burn off a lot of his puppy energy. You have to watch him otherwise he will become the alpha of the house, and you. He is fine in his foster home because he knows Mom is the alpha and she won't let the little stinker dominate the house. Besides loving walks, he loves to sit on the couch with you, riding in the car, going and meeting new people. He is about 20lbs and 3 yrs old. He is very affectionate.

Update 12/9/2017.  Meet Tango, an adorable, adoptable cuddle bug! Tango is approximately 6-7 years old and weighs 28 lb, and he is one of 25 terriers rescued from a hoarding case in Tennessee. He recently completed his journey through the Hounds of Prison Education (HOPE) program, where he made great strides in gaining confidence and skills that will benefit him in his furever home.Tango will thrive in a home without a ton of commotion, and he would absolutely love someone to snuggle up with on these cold winter days! Tango enjoys the company of other dogs, but cats are an unknown at this point. He has reacted positively to children who are patient with him (peanut butter treats will surely do the trick!). Tango walks very nicely on a leash and enjoys going on daily excursions, which allow him to gain trust and understanding of the world around him that at one time was so scary. He has a lot of time to make up for, but he has his eye on the prize – humans who will love him unconditionally for the amazing dog he is!Adoption application, home visit and adoption fee required. If you would like to apply for adoption, please complete the online application at www.furryfriendsnetwork.com. Look under ADOPT tab. Please also read Our Expectations prior to applying.Foster Homes are desperately needed in order to help more animals like this one. Please consider opening your heart and home to a homeless animal. To find out more about becoming a Foster Parent, see our website at www.furryfriendsnetwork.com. Look under VOLUNTEER tab.Pet ID: Lois

**Please read Sprinkle's entire profile, which includes a link to the adoption application. Thank you!** Sprinkles is a 9-month-old, 50-pound Shar-pei mix gal.Hello! Some people call me Coco, but I like my nickname “Sprinkles” better. Let me tell you a little about myself. I am from a southern Tennessee county, where there is no animal control and strays and unwanted animals are in abundance. My mom had me and my siblings last fall at a nice ladies house. One by one my siblings were given away until only I was left. I don’t know why no one wanted me, I was just as playful and loving as the others. So, day after day I waited for my turn. Then, suddenly one day a strange lady drove up the driveway and I was put into the back of her car. I was really nervous because I did not know what to expect. She took me to her house where I met lots of dogs and cats who made me feel at ease. The kind lady told me that I was her new foster pup and that I would never have to live outside again and that she loved me. She LOVED me! It was so nice to hear! I am currently working on becoming the perfect family member such as crate and house training. It’s tough, but I’m learning something new everyday! I am looking for a fur-ever family where I can continue to learn and grow! Could you be my fur-ever family?Sprinkles will be UTD on vaccinations and spayed or neutered at the time of adoption. Due to the young age of this puppy, he/she is not housebroken or trained. All puppies require professional training to become the best family member they can be.To adopt or learn more about Sprinkles, you must fill out an adoption application. To find the application, copy and paste this URL into your browser: WWW.GDRNE.COM/ADOPTION-APPLICATION [Adoption Fee: $425]  **  PLEASE READ: If a dog is listed, then s/he is currently available for adoption. Their information is correct to the best of our abilities and the information we have been given as of the day of posting. Please note, GDRNE does not guarantee the breed of any dog or puppy unless stated that we have run DNA. All breeds listed are educated estimates. Our dogs are rescued from various situations. It is most likely that both their parents were strays and even if not, mixes of some sort and that their grandparents were mixes as well. The dog may have some genetic material of an American Staffordshire Terrier (pit bull). The dogs are usually mixes of many breeds, making them a breed all their own - a True and adorable American MUTT. If you are interested in this dog, you must submit an application. Great Dog is not a shelter so there is no building you can visit. Our dogs live in private foster homes until adopted. To learn more about our *shelterless* rescue, adoption fees, and procedures, review the list of Frequently Asked Questions on our website at WWW.GDRNE.COM.

Mikey is a super sweet & handsome 55lb, 2 year old husky mix from Tennessee. He spent the majority of his life tied up outside and was eventually surrendered his owners. He is currently in a loving foster home in Pelham, NH where he is being showered with love. He gets along wonderfully with other dogs. He has not been cat tested. Mikey is neutered, vaccinated, heartworm negative and microchipped. He is looking for a forever home where she will be shown kindness and love and treated like a member of the family. To apply to adopt Mikey, please fill out an application on our website: www.arnne.org. For questions, please email: adoption@arnne.orgARNNE supports the rescue/critical care/boarding expenses of local town/city animal control officers that otherwise only have authorization to vaccinate or euthanize. Every life is precious but it takes funds to save lives.Adoption fees rarely cover the expenses of rescuing, boarding and providing exemplary medical care to the animals in our program. All animals have had a thorough exam, are treated for any parasites or infections, spay/neutered, current on vaccines and micro-chipped.For more information, please fill out an adoption request form at  www.arnne.org. Email or call the shelter at  603-233-4801 and a volunteer will return your call.See our adoptable pets at our Pet Adoption Day.  Visit www.arnne.org and select Pet Adoption Day.

Name: RingoSex: MaleAge: 4 yearsBreed: Shepherd MixGood with: People and dogs. Not tested with kids or catsRingo is a 4 year old Shepherd mix from McNairy County, TN. This little cutie has Epilepsy which is currently controlled without medications. He only has a seizure once every 1-2 months but in the future may require medications. Dogs with medical issues can often be hard to find a home and we are hoping to find him the best home so he can break free of the kennel life in TN! He is great with people and dogs but hasn't been tested with kids or cats yet. Please help us share this cutie (as well as his Epileptic brother George!) so we can find him a home as he is at risk of euthanasia :If you are interested in adopting, please fill out an application at survivortails.org or email adoptions@survivortails.org with any questions. Please note: We can only adopt in the states of MA and NH

Hi, I'm Chris!If you are looking for a sweet little dog that loves to be held during the day and snuggled with at night, Chris is the Shih Tzu for you! He is 6 years old and came to our family from Memphis, TN as an owner-surrender due to the owner’s illness. Chris does well with children (mine are aged 3 and 5) and other dogs. We are currently working with Chris on his exercise tolerance as he is a few pounds overweight and gets out of breath easily. Also, he needs manual assistance in getting up onto couches and beds. We’ve taken Chris on several car rides and he rests very comfortably on the center console. He is house trained and doesn’t require a fenced-in yard. Chris takes a pill every other day to manage his allergies and also requires daily eye ointment application. Both of these meds can be purchased online for about $121 per month.He tolerates both of these well.Despite having gone through the huge life change that he has, Chris has managed to adapt and thrive in his new environment. Everyone he meets just falls in love with him and his mellow vibe!My adoption fee, including MN state taxes, is $321.83. I'm available to adopt within a 50 mile radius of the Twin Cities of Minneapolis/Saint Paul.To submit an adoption application, please clickhereto fill out an online application.

URGENT! These 2 dogs are in Tennessee but are in desperate need of rehoming separately! The owner must leave her home on July 1st and these dogs still need places to go - a number of other animals in the home have already found placement but no one will give these dogs a chance. The owner does not want to drop them off at a shelter in Tennessee, if she can avoid it.Sami is a senior Black Lab mix who is extremely skittish but lovable. He gets along with most dogs. Over the years he has gotten along with all the animals on my parents' farm except for Spanky.We're not sure what Spanky is mixed with. He is about 5-7 years old. He is playful and lovable. He has gotten along with his playmate Si but does not like Sami. He loves to carry his blanket with him. He is a really good farm dog - he always knows when coyotes are on the property and is great at chasing them away from their goats. He is a drooler especially when he is happy.These dogs do NOT belong to 11th Hour Rescue but we have been asked to help network them for separate adopters. If you can help at all, please contact Jesse directly at jess85_19@hotmail.com - the animals are currently located in Tennessee. These dogs should go to separate homes as they prefer the company of other dogs to each other.There are also 5 cats in need of placement - they are siblings, male and neutered, about 3.5 years old. There are 2 beige, 2 with grey/white stripes and one all grey stripe. All are friendly although the all grey is still a little cranky but he is coming around. They are all indoor cats, they have never been outside. They are listed on EHR's web site under XP 5 Cats in Tennessee.

Zara is estimated to be between 1.5 to 2 years old and is a petite pittie girl at 42 lbs! If you are looking for personality, she is your gal! She loves to run and play with her jolly ball, then snuggle up with you on the couch in typical pittie fashion. Good with most dogs with proper introductions, she does like to jump when playing with other dogs outside so would do well with another fur sibling who doesn't mind. She LOVES to be with people and will be your baby and buddy for life. She was saved from the euthanasia room in Memphis, TN at the last minute and has been waiting for her very own home ever since. Will you be the lucky ones to love Zara? Her adoption donation is $300, apply today at www.hubbardshounds.com!

Hi, my name is Peppa, Peppa Pig & I’m a 4 month old Pitbul mix, all the way from Tennessee!   My foster mom named me that because I cruise the yard and house sniffing everything and snorting as I go!I love my foster family so much. I get to play with my foster fur-siblings (cats and dogs) everyday and we have so much fun. When my foster mommy takes me in the car I’m super good, and I love it. I’m also really good at meeting new people, I love everyone! My foster mom says I should remember to tell you to tell my furever family I’m the happiest of happy puppies! I love everyone, and everything, and life! Humans, human kids, cats, dogs, clouds, sunshine, chewy toys... everything! My foster mommy says it’s because I’m deaf so I don’t hear anything bad ever and I only have happy thoughts!I am happiest with my humans and my foster dogo sister Khalie, so my foster mom thinks I need to go to a new home that has at least one other dog.  But, I’m super independent when I play or we are just hanging out too! Can’t wait to meet you!!To apply, visit www.speakfortheunspoken.com/apply.
Jerry is a 3 year old, 60 pound, Boxer mix from a kill shelter in Memphis.He is choosy about the dogs he likes and is not fond of cats.  Adores children!

In honor of Flag Day, now through July 15th, our Red, White and Woo Hoo Adoption Promotion has returned! My adoption fee will be waived with a donation of 50# or more of Purina Puppy Chow.Hi, my name is Simon! I am a Rottweiler mix that came up to Wisconsin from Tennessee! I was born around 7/3/2016 and weigh 61 pounds. I am a very smart boy who does know a few tricks already! 'Sit' and 'shake' are two of my favorite commands, and I may even know 'speak' (the humans at the shelter aren't sure if I actually know this command yet, or if I just get so excited when I see a treat that I bark). I may know a lot of things, but I would love if you could teach me about having a forever home! It would be best that I go to a home without small children as I can be mouthy at times.  I have a lot of energy and find ways to get in trouble when I do not have an outlet for that energy.  Please be aware that my breed and age listing are estimates. The staff at both shelters do the best they can with that. Obedience classes for adult dogs and puppies can be incredibly helpful for both animals and humans. It helps you understand what makes me tick and will give me a better idea of what you want me to do. It’s a win/win and it will also strengthen the bond between us! If I’m not ready to go home right now, I will be soon, so apply for me today!My adoption fee is $60.00. Adoption applications can be filled out at CCHS or online through our website, www.cchs-petshelter.org. Applications are not first come, first served. All applications will be reviewed by the adoption committee and the home chosen will be the one considered to be the best match. All dogs and puppies have been vaccinated for Distemper and Bordetella, dewormed and microchipped. If old enough, they will be vaccinated for Rabies and blood tested for Heartworm, Lymes, Anaplasmosis and Erlichiosis. Dogs and puppies will be spayed or neutered before adoption.CCHS is proud to be a No-Kill Humane Society. As a private, non-profit charity, our work depends on donations and volunteers to keep going. We are committed to helping the animals that enter our doors and finding each the best possible forever home. CCHS has been inspected and licensed by the Department of Animal Health - DATCP. Our license is #268235-DS

Hello there, my name is Dona Marie! I am a spunky 7 year old Dachshund/ Jack Russel Terrier mix looking for a new best friend. Though I have just recently seen the vet and they estimated I am possibly between 3-5 years old. I weigh 21lbs and I am full grown -- perfect size as I am not too big and not too small! I have done well in a foster home with calm small dogs only (under 15 pounds). Don't let my age fool you or the silver highlights, I just had those done before my trip to Arizona in October last year! I am originally from Texas where everything is bigger which means my hunger for activity is the size of a marathon runner! I was found as a stray where they took me into the Palm Valley Animal Center, then I got picked to ride on a transport here to AZSDR. I am a volunteer favorite, my fosters have said I am the most affectionate and loving dog you ever did meet. If you are afraid of kisses and cuddles, I can help you over come your fears instantly! I love people of all shapes, sizes and ages! People are my favorite, which is why I am so excited to find my best friend! I am very well behaved, I am house broken, kennel trained, I walk great on the leash and I also love car rides! I would do best in a home with a yard, no apartments please. I am the perfect gal to take along for hikes and long walks around the neighborhood. With me as your best friend you won't ever have to spend a holiday alone or night without a cuddle buddy. Contact my foster and put in your application to be my forever best friend! Dona Marie is spayed, up to date on vaccines, microchipped, and vet checked. Her adoption fee is $180 and comes with 30 days of free pet insurance, and comes with a free vet visit. To meet her, contact her foster mom Veronica at 602-703-4866Open TUES-SUN 11am to 6pm / 1102 W. Hatcher Rd, Phoenix AZ 85021 / 602-944-2440WEEKEND ADOPTION EVENT LOCATIONS - Many animals available for adoption!Saturdays 10:30am to 3pm at Petco at Tatum & Bell Rd4727 East Bell Road, Phoenix, AZ 85032 (Near Walmart)Saturdays 11am to 3pm at Petco at Tatum & Shea Rd10825 N Tatum Blvd, Phoenix, AZ 85028Sundays from 11am to 3pm at Petsmart in Glendale7290 W Bell Rd, Glendale, AZ 85308 (shopping center, north side of Bell Rd)***Visit our website or facebook page for special events schedules!***Website: www.azsmalldog.orgFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/arizonasmalldogrescue/

Gypsy is a 2-year-old Dalmatian that is looking for her forever home through Cool Cats Rescue.Gypsy came to us from Texas and is looking for a family to call her own where she can enjoy life as an only pet. She is an absolute joy and loves her humans (adults and children) but has shown aggression to other dogs and cats in the past — so needs to be an only pet. Dalmatians have specific feeding and care needs, so she will also need a family that understands and is willing to meet those needs with special food and special care when she’s out in the sun.Gypsy loves going on walks, is fully potty trained, and wants to be an active member of her family. She comes spayed, UTD on shots, microchipped, and knows basic obedience. She would make a great fit with an active family and will definitely not be a match for couch potatoes.Do you want to meet Gypsy? Reach out to us!

Hellloooo new pup parents! My name is Lockevelt!!! My foster mom said I needed a unique name for the unique pup that I am. I am a big eared, squeaky boy from Texas that just wants to go exploring or be sleeping on the couch with you. If you want a doggo to greet you at the door with kisses and come flying onto the couch to snuggle with you, then I am perfect for you. I love toys especially stuffed animals. My dream home would have lots of toys, lots of exercise and lots of snuggles. I do love to learn, so my foster mom thinks it would be important for me to continue my education in training classes. I might even like a pup sibling, but I would have to meet them before really knowing if we could be friends. Are you interested in being my new family? Please contact my foster mom at mhiggins@aawl.org

My name is Niko and if you’re looking for a feisty fireball, I am your guy!  I am three or four years young and around 60 pounds so perfect for someone w a small home or who loves Akitas but wants a smaller one.  What I lack in size, I make up for in personality.  I am happy and playful and ready to love.  A running buddy would be awesome too!  Since I am active, I would be best in a home without super young two legged kids, older kids who I can’t accidentally knock over would be ok.  I do NOT like other animals and must be an only pet so that I can have all of your attention!  I came from Comanche Animal Control in Texas.  I was with LSAR a while but there are too many dogs in Texas so I didn’t find a forever home but am told Arizona is the best place to find one so look out desert, here I come!  Our application is available at:  https://goo.gl/forms/KiGEPIzBGkBNuYCB2 Our process includes a meeting with you, your family including other pets and/or roommates, reference check, home visit, and adoption fee. Hartley is a sweet lovable girl, who is great in a house with other dogs and children. This pup came from a shelter in San Antonio, where she was pulled from a high kill shelter’s euthanasia room. Hartley has been amazing in a foster home, knows basic commands, and is house trained. Hartley's breed is known to be a more excitable dog, who needs to get their energy out. She is very playful and needs to be taken on walks and will love to have fun with her new family! Go to our website (redfernanimalrescue.org) and fill out an application if you are interested or contact us on our website if you have any questions! Please give us 24-48 hours to respond to you!

Shasta is available for adoption through Colorado Canine Rescue, a nonprofit rescue in the Denver area. He came from a crowded shelter in Texas where she was turned in as a stray. Since we have little history on him, we are estimating his age to be around five years old and guessing his breeds to be a Husky/Samoyed mix.Shasta is a sweet, loving boy with beautiful blue eyes. He has had a rough life. He was picked up as a stray in Texas where he was likely hit by a car. His injuries were untreated and his pelvis healed on its own, so he struggles a bit on stairs. He is currently in a foster home where he is finally able to give and receive lost of love and attention. He is incredibly sweet with all humans.While he is usually dog-friendly, he doesn't love all dogs and takes longer to warm up to some dog personalities. Given that, he would do best as a single dog. Due to his old injury, he has some minor urinary incontinence when he sleeps which has greatly improved with medicine. He is house-trained, and loves sleeping on hard-wood floors which makes his occasional incontinence easier to clean up! When Shasta came to CCR, he tested positive for heartworm. He's since completed the heartworm treatment and needs to be retested in October. If positive, CCR can cover cost of next treatment (antibiotics most likely) through our approved vets. He also had surgery to correct entropion and is healed from that. This sweet fellow is gentle, smart, and knows basic commands (sit, down, wait, etc). He has had a rough start to life and just wants someone to love him and smother him with cuddles.If you are interested in adopting Shasta, please submit an adoption application located on our website, coloradocaninerescue.org. We are asking for a $100 adoption donation. Shasta is neutered, up to date on vaccinations and microchipped.CCR cannot hold dogs, arrange meet and greets or adopt out any dogs without a completed adoption application.CCR cannot guarantee the breed composition or ages of our dogs as we usually have no history prior to them entering the shelter.Dogs listed as potty trained may experience an adjustment period as they learn the routines in their new home.

Hi my name is Lil Gem. I am an 11 week old Blue Lacy/Redbone Coonhound. I was brought up from Texas with my sister and 4 brothers to find the perfect forever family. I am the biggest of my siblings. I am the perfect combo of a snuggle buddy and playmate. I love to sit in your lab and get loved on before going out to play with my siblings. I will check back with often for some more loves and then go back to playing with my brothers and sister. I also got to play with a big puppy at my foster mom's house. He let me crawl all over him and chase him around the yard. I am working on potty training. I understand that I need to potty when I go outside on the grass. I am still using puppy pads inside, but I am a fast learner and should pick it up quickly with consistent trips outside. I sleep in a crate at night with my siblings without any issues. I do wake up once in the night to go potty, but then I go back to my crate for some more sleep. My foster mom says I am a sweet little love bug that likes to relax by your side after some playtime. I can offer my snuggling services to the right forever family.Estimated DOB: 3/31/2019*BSL restrictions may apply.*Adoption fee includes the following: Spay/Neuter Rabies Vaccination Distemper / Parvo Vaccines (includes series of 3 for puppies) Bordetella Microchip with prepaid lifetime registration Deworming

Hi my name is Lil Chik. I am an 11 week old Blue Lacy/Redbone Coonhound. I was brought up from Texas with my 5 brothers to find the perfect forever family. I am the only girl in my litter. I also got to play with a big puppy at my foster mom's house. He let me crawl all over him and chase him around the yard. I am working on potty training. I understand that I need to potty when I go outside on the grass. I am still using puppy pads inside, but I am a fast learner and should pick it up quickly with consistent trips outside. I sleep in a crate at night with my siblings without any issues. I do wake up once in the night to go potty, but then I go back to my crate for some more sleep. My foster mom says I am a fun loving girl that likes to play. I have a lot of energy and love to give the perfect family.Estimated DOB: 3/31/2019*BSL restrictions may apply.*Adoption fee includes the following: Spay/Neuter Rabies Vaccination Distemper / Parvo Vaccines (includes series of 3 for puppies) Bordetella Microchip with prepaid lifetime registration Deworming

Sid is a sweet lovable boy, who is great in a house with other dogs and children. He's a little shy at first, but once he gets to know you, you become his best friend. This pup came from a shelter in San Antonio, where he was pulled from a high kill shelter’s euthanasia room. Sid has been amazing in a foster home, knows basic commands, and is house trained. Silver is a handsome Lacy/Labrador mix.  He is a 9 month old, neutered male dog who came to us from Texas.  Silver loves people but is a bit shy when he first meets you.  He will need a patient home where he can gain confidence and learn that life is worth living!  Silver is still learning how to play and act like a dog so we are not sure if he will do well in a home with any dog and will need to do an introduction at the shelter. As Silver tells us more about himself, we will update you!

Hi y'all. The name's Shadow. I recently read that I have a better chance of gettin' hit by lightning than winnin' the lottery, but I have won the lottery twice!! About two months ago, I won the shelter dog lottery! Hero dog savers named Susie's Senior Dogs found out about me and posted my picture on the world wide web. My foster mama says I was overnight famous! The next day I won the rescue dog lottery and was deemed an Underdog! I'll just say this...I'm now scared to death of lightning. But wouldn't you be if you knew the statistics and had already won two lotteries?! Anywho, the next couple of weeks were a whirlwind but after moving from Texas to ColoradoI got myself a place to kick up my paws and I'm seein' a doc about my ticker-worms. My doc says I'm in great health, even for my age, so we gave those worms their first eviction notice a month ago. Doc says they usually need a couple reminders to git outta dodge but then I'll be all set to find me a forever family.I'm glad to have some time to get to know myself now that I have the freedom to do so. You see, I spent my life on a chain hiding in the dark (hence why I call myself Shadow). My meals were sporadic and I didn't even know there were beds just for dogs...oh, and have y'all heard about this thing called a couch?!! Maybe lightenin' did strike cause I'm in heaven! Well, here in heaven I've been workin' hard to be everything I know I can be. I'm pretty sure I'm an introvert but my foster mama says not to be too quick to label since I've changed so much. I started out too scared to move and had to be coaxed into eating, drinking, and eliminatin'. But ya know what, turns out some humans ain't all that bad and I'm startin' to learn I have choices and a voice. I'm no longer scared to enjoy my freedom, I obviously don't have a chain anymore so why act like it? I've learned to run around with my foster brothers and I even tried out this thing called a play bow that they taught me. It's pretty cool and everyone gets real excited when I do it. Oh, and I learned about time...meal time to be more precise. And I'm pretty much superior when it comes to reminding my foster parents about it. All ya gotta do is start whoopin' and hollerin' and if it's close enough to meal time, they'll fill the bowl. Like I said, I'm an introvert so while I love myself a good belly rub, hugs are still a little too much. Unless you're a toddler. I have a soft spot for the littles so they get a little extra leeway when it comes to my personal bubble and she's teaching me that (appropriate) hugging is okay. My foster brother is trying to teach me about hunting and keeps getting annoyed that I let the neighbor rabbits and cats hang out around me. But I just have too much love for this second chance to not include everyone in it. Do you want to be in it too? If you're interested in adopting Shadow, please fill out an adoption application here:https://underdogsrescue.org/adopt-form/Underdogs is a small volunteer-based animal rescue and we unfortunately do not have the resources to respond to phone and email inquires about our adoptable animals at this time. If you're interested in learning more or setting up a meeting with one of our animals, please complete an adoption application first. It may take up to two weeks for application review and one of our coordinators will reach out to you as soon as we are through the intitial review process. We appreciate your patience and understanding! Thank you!Our Underdogs adult dog adoption fee is $300, which includes spay/neuter, microchip, and up-to-date vaccinations.Our Underdogs puppy adoption fee is $350, which includes spay/neuter, microchip, and up-to-date vaccinations.Our Underdogs senior dog adoption fee is $175 which includes spay/neuter, microchip, and up-to-date vaccinations.

Minnie came all the way from Texas to find a great home in Colorado. She is a tiny owner surrendered terrier mix weighing in at about 8 pounds. We think that she is about 10 years old, but she's quite frisky and nimble. When she came into rescue her skin was in terrible shape. We don't know whether it was the result of a bad diet, a serious flea allergy, or a bacterial infection. She lost a lot of the hair on her body. While her skin is clear now, we don’t know if her fur will grow back or if she will stay nekked!  She really doesn't seem to care, and she is not scratchy. She enjoys being with her foster siblings in their fenced-in backyard, and would probably prefer a home with a canine companion.Minnie is spayed, she is up to date on her vaccinations (rabies, distemper and kennel cough), vet checked, heartworm tested negative and on preventative while in rescue, and microchipped. She also had a dental while in rescue. If you would like to meet Minnie, go to www.cominischnauzerrescue.com and complete the on-line adoption application. We suggest that you print a copy of the application before you hit the \"submit\" button, just in case! We will give you a call to set up a time to bring little Minnie for a visit.

Do you like to snuggle while binge watching your favorite show ? How about hiking or going for long walks ? Can you throw a ball ? Yes, Yes & YES !!! Wow I am excited cause these are my favorite things.My name is Jacky& I am originally from Texas, so I love the sun. They say I am a Beagle/Puggle mix but some people think I have some boxer mixed in there too. But I don't care what you are as long as you treat me well & love me.Sometimes I make mistakes & I am learning. It is best if you leave an old slipper/shoe out when you leave for a few hours & don't crate me. I just like to have something that smells like you. If you take the time to teach me right from wrong I will love you more than words can express, my kisses might tell you how much I LOVE YOU !!I did spend some time wondering on the streets before coming to 2BABR so when it's feeding time I get really excited, I'll even do a dance for you. My foster got me a maze bowl which helps me slow down when eating so I don't get indigestion. Do they make those bowls for humans ? if so you humans may need it too. But I am not judging.I am with another dog right now & we get along. If I had my say I'd like to be with a younger dog... she is 16 yrs old & doesn't want to play with me. Luckily I get to play with my foster & do well independently.Thank you for taking the time to read about me. Maybe if you'd like to meet for a walk someone could help us arrange that ;)Adoption fee includes the following: Spay/Neuter Rabies Vaccination Distemper / Parvo Vaccines (includes series of 3 for puppies) Bordetella Microchip with prepaid lifetime registration Deworming

This Boots is made for adoptingAnd that's just what you'll doOne of these days this BootsIs gonna walk on home with youMeet Boots, a gorgeous and sweet 7-year-old lab mix just arrived from Texas and ready to find his forever family here in beautiful Colorado! Boots has very soulful eyes like he has something to say to you. If he could talk, he'd probably ask you where you were going and what you were doing because he genuinely wants to be by your side participating in whatever you are doing. He is very chill and relaxed and as such would make for the perfect family dog. Boots has a warm personality, which will come in handy while snuggling on the couch during those chilly Colorado evenings. Boots is good with smaller dogs, but gets nervous around larger dogs, so we wouldn't recommend a home with dogs of larger size. Heloves all people, including children. Boots is preparing to complete heartworm treatment at the full expense of the rescue, and he will require monthly heartworm preventative for the remainder of his life (nominal cost)but don't let this dissuade you from meeting this rescue treasure. Please complete a brief online application to meet this wonderful guy and Boots can get to walkinon out of here and into his forever home with you.Adoption fee includes the following: Spay/Neuter Rabies Vaccination Distemper / Parvo Vaccines (includes series of 3 for puppies) Bordetella Microchip with prepaid lifetime registration Deworming

Meet Toby! Toby has been with our rescue for over a year now. Toby is originally from Texas and has been through so much. Toby likes going on walks and hikes and loves playing fetch. He is a smart, loving boy who has had a hard past. We are hoping that someone will see the light in his eyes and give him a chance.A few months ago Toby went through a board and train program to overcome/learn new ways to manage his fear. He has learned so much and we are so grateful for their knowledge and time. Toby can be fearful of new people and is selective of the dogs he likes. It is possible that he could live in house with another dog but it would have to be the right personality match. Because we have invested so much into Toby's growth it is imperative that his foster or adopter be on board with continuing this work, or he might need to redo the board and train program. Toby's adopters will have the support of these trainers for the rest of his life. His adopters will also be required to meet with his trainers to ensure success of adoption. We will never give up on Toby but truly hope that he finds a home soon. While Toby is getting continued training, care, play time & love a boarding facility is not the forever situation we want for him or that he deserves. Can't adopt or foster Toby? Would you consider liking, sharing this or even donating to his care? Toby's weekly bill is around $150. Thank you!

This angel is around 4 years old. She was taken from her new puppies and put in a shelter in Texas. Her owners decided not to get her out, so we pulled her and want to give her a new life in Colorado. She's spayed, up to date on vaccines, microchipped, and unfortunately, but notsurprising, is heartworm positive. She is light, so she just needs some exercise restriction and heartworm prevention every month. She can be retested in a fewmonths and begin normal exercise. She loves to play fetch!! She currently lives with 2 small, older dogs. She seems to have some prey drive for kitties, so no cats in the home. She has been around dogs her size, sometimes she's selective. She's very athletic and energetic, but also very snuggly and can be a couch potato with you when it's time to relax.She is good with other dogs, even small. She likes to play with them. She walks great on the leash and rides well in the car. She's doing good with kennel training and house training. She's good with kids and is very affectionate.Over all she is a wonderful dog inside and out. She's calm, but can be energetic and playful, smart, responsive, friendly and loving. Her adoption fee is $200.

Squishy here! They call me that because, well? I’m squishy! I’m a 4 year old boxer/bulldog mix. I’ve got a big, squishy head, full of adorable bulldog wrinkles situated atop a sleek and lean boxer body. I’m pretty good looking, if I do say so myself! I came to Ho-Bo Care from Texas, but after only a short while, I know Colorado is the place for me. I LOVE (like really love) snow! I’ll roll in it and smoosh my face into big piles of snow to see what smells lurk beneath. When I lift my face up, I’m covered in it! My people think it’s so funny! I’m very affectionate with all the people I meet and really, there’s no one I consider a stranger! Without hesitation I will shower you with my love – including some big slobbery kisses! I know my basic commands and walk well on a leash… but watch out….SQUIRREL! I can occasionally get distracted and need to be reminded to walk nice ? If you’re interested in meeting me and going on all sorts of Colorado adventures, please fill out an application! PLEASE READ BELOW PRIOR TO EMAILING IN!If you are interested in adopting this dog or any others, please go to www.hobocare.org to review our home requirements and fill out an application. Please do not email and ask for more information on how to adopt, all the information is already available online. The information you see here is all that is currently available about this dog. No boxers are adopted without a completed application and home check. Our adoption fee is a minimum of $250.00.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Ava! Ava is a gorgeous pit mix puppy who was born in April 2019 and comes to rescue from Texas. Poor Ava has only known a life of suffering and neglect so far and when we got to her she was in terrible shape. Her hair was almost completely gone and her skin raw, scabby, and infected. We got her immediately to our vet partner and she will now get all the medical care she needs. She is already looking and feeling so much better and soon she will be back to healthy, happy, and ready to join an amazing forever home! Ava deserves so much more than the hand she’s been dealt so far and we can’t wait to see her thriving and loved unconditionally in her new home. She is going to be an absolutely stunning girl once all her hair fills back in. Even now you can see what a beautiful brindle coat is just waiting to grow and shine through as she continues to heal! She is the sweetest girl and is full of puppy kisses and cuddles. She is wonderful with of all ages, other dogs, and will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement. If you are looking to add an adorable, playful, loving pup to your family, look no further and fill out an adoption application for Ava here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Beautiful Tasha is a 3 year old Boxer mix who weighs 35 pounds and comes to rescue from Texas. This poor girl was living outside with another chained dog in hazardous conditions and was severely injured with no one in sight that had any regard for her well being. Thank goodness we were alerted to this situation and were able to get Tasha to safety. We took her immediately to our vet partner where it was determined that she had a broken pelvis and needs FHO surgery on her leg/hip. This girl is in the best hands now and we will have her feeling so much better very soon! What she really needs now is someone special waiting to give her the home of her Dreams when she’s ready! She is an absolute sweetheart and even in her injured state was so friendly and it was easy to see the appreciation she had for her rescuers. Tasha is undoubtedly going to make such a loyal and loving companion. She is wonderful with people of all ages, other dogs, and will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in her forever home. Age: 2-4 YearsWeight: 54 lbsLocation: RIThis dog has been spayed/neutered, is up to date on shots, on heartworm preventative and is microchipped.Meet Lucy!She's the mama of the Kleur litter and sweet as can be. Lucy appears to be a lab mix, probably born sometime in January 2015. She's a laid-back dog who loves playing with her squeaky chew toys, going for walks, and cuddling. She's happy to go for a ride in the car or relax at home. She's very friendly and just so happy to see you! She's super affectionate and loves people, kids, and other dogs, but she hasn't met any cats yet. She's house trained and is quiet and clean in her crate (where she now sleeps at night), but she does pull when walking on a leash a bit. With some obedience training, she could surely master some essential doggy skills. She's very smart and treat-motivated - a perfect combination for training a new furry friend! Plus, dog training classes are a great opportunity for the pup to bond with her new human(s) and socialize with classmates. Lucy can be food aggressive with other dogs, but has not been with people, so she would need to be fed separately from a fur sibling - she shares a water bowel with no issues. She doesn't go after her foster siblings when they come near her toys, but she will defend them.After being rescued from animal control in Rosenberg, Texas, with her eight new puppies, it's time for Lucy to find her forever home! This beautiful girl understands where her foster feeds her and goes there to eat; she also knows where she gets her treats and goes there, too. She's a real jewel! Have you fallen in love with her sweet face? Fill out an application for Lucy today!Medical Note: This dog has been treated for heartworm disease with melarsomine injections. Once treatment is completed and the dog tests negative for microfilaria, the dog will be cleared to resume normal activity and able to be adopted, which we anticipate to be sometime in December. Untreated heartworm disease can cause lasting damage to the heart, lungs and arteries, and can affect the dog’s health and quality of life even after the parasites are gone, possibly presenting as medical complications and/or new conditions in the future. This dog showed no symptoms of heartworm disease before or during treatment. A good resource for more information on heartworm disease is:https://www.heartwormsociety.org/pet-owner-resources/heartworm-basics. Please check with your vet if you should have any questions or concerns about this condition, and discuss any concerns you may have with your SOS Adoption Counselor.Adoption Fee: $585To apply for this dog, fill out an adoption application on our website: www.sosarl.org/aa/**Additional info you should know - For most of our dogs, we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We get to know each of our dogs as an individual and do our best to describe and place them based on personality not breed label. Some dogs may not yet be in New England, nor ready for immediate adoption. There may be additional vetting, quarantine, waiting periods and/or fees depending upon your state of residence. If you have questions or concerns on any of this, you can discuss this with your Adoption Counselor.

Hi! My name is Tess! Please read my bio below!Weight and Age: I am a whopping 48 pounds and am approximately 1.5 years old.Background: I was pulled from euthanasia from a small shelter in Sealy, TX. A rescue volunteer had gone out there to help out and met her and fell in love. She was so sweet and friendly she couldn't help but try her best to help. Luckily the rescue had a spot in boarding available and I went and quickly became a favorite of the employees. I made a bunch of doggy friends and loved to run and play with them! I was put on a list to go into the next available foster home where I now have made my foster mom's home my home. I love her dogs and it's always nice when I'm done playing to take a break and cuddle with mom for a bit!Medical Status: I am  now spayed, micro-chipped, up to date on shots,  and current on heartworm and flea preventatives. I have no other health issues and am heart worm negative. YAY!Activity level: I am moderately active since I'm still young and love to play with my friends (human and dog alike)!  Potty Training/Crate Training: I am both thanks to my foster mom! I never have an accident in my kennel and as long as my foster mom keeps an eye on me I haven't had an accident in the house either.Other Animals: Loves any and all!Special Needs: NoneDog Park friendly:  May get used to it but have not been tested at one!Good off leash: Yes if in a safe placeLocation: Houston, TX but I'm available for out of state adoptions!If you have any questions please email my foster mom at nicole.whar94@yahoo.com

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Handsome little Casper is a 6-8 year old Shih Tzu Mix who weighs 8 pounds. He comes to rescue from Texas where he was found in horrific shape. His once long gorgeous coat was filthy, matted, and hiding wounds inflicted from a dog attack. His poor little body was riddled with puncture wounds and his face had been attacked so badly that poor Casper had suffered a broken jaw and unfortunately lost both his eyes. He got all the medical care he needed with our vet partner and now this cutie patootie is doing wonderful! He is healing well and has the happiest temperament! He doesn’t let his vision impairment slow him down and works hard to navigate in his foster home on his own. He absolutely adores being near his people and is a professional snuggler! You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Rambo! Rambo is just about the cutest mixed breed pup in the world! He was born in March 2019 and comes to rescue from Texas. When we got to this sweet boy he was in horrific shape. His head was very swollen as a result of his skull being fractured. We can’t imagine how this little baby got in this condition but after some touch and go our little warrior is doing great! He is getting extra special love and care with an amazing medical foster but he would really love to have a home to call his very own! The vet deemed Rambo a Rottweiler Mix but at his age and weight we think he is mixed with something smaller and will most likely be a more petite version of this guess. Whatever he may be mixed with we think it was the perfect combination! Rambo seems to have some vision and hearing impairment which we will keep assessing to see if this is permanent damage or may continue to get better with time. He doesn’t let this stop him and has blossomed into a happy, feisty, playful guy! He loves romping about with his foster fur siblings and is a professional snuggle partner. He will he neutered and up to date on vaccines (age appropriate) prior to placement in his forever home. Meet Roxie!This sweet girl was found out in a field with large open wounds on her body by a client of our rescue vet.    They brought Roxie into the vet in November 2018.   She was the sweetest girl despite her condition.   I met her in November when I went to pick up my foster who had a back leg amputated.   My foster and Roxie met and she gave him lots of kisses on his nose!  She is so loving!Roxie receives so much love from everyone at the vets office.  She LOVES all people, dogs and cats!   She is a happy girl with a wiggly body!    She is affectionate and loves to be in your lap and would be a great cuddle buddy! There is not a mean bone in her body!     She would love a home of her own to run and play with a loving person or family!Roxie went through months of therapy to heal her wounds, which you can see in some of her pictures.   The doctors think this started as a puncture wound and them spread when it was not treated.    The doctors found her right femur had been fractures and was healing on its own.   The doctors felt it was best to keep the leg as is and she was in no pain so they could focus on treating the wounds on her body.   She does have a peg leg as a result of her old injury.   However Roxie does not know this and is active and gets around fine just like any other dog!   She was an excellent patient as well!   This girl is a fantastic dog!Roxie is 2 years old, weighs 39 lbs and is a pit bull/lab mix.   She is located in Houston, TX and would come to her new home on professional transport.   For an app, please email rhondabarron@earthlink.net

Since this injury had gone untreated for so long, his leg was necrotic and atrophied. We rushed him immediately to our vet partner where it was determined that the only course of action was to amputate his leg. Gavin also suffers from a seizure disorder and was placed on medication that he will need to continue life long. Helios is a precious 3-4 year old standard dachshund mix, weighing 21 pounds.  This sweet little guy has one thing on his mind - cuddling!  His goal in life is to be a canine teddy bear!  He loves to cuddle on the couch and in bed with his human.  He does fine with other dogs but would also be happy as long as he had a human to sit with (see the theme?).  We believe Helios would be happiest as an only dog in the home, but he does well in social situations such as day care or dog parks.  He is not good with cats.   He is smart and very food motivated.  Does well with pottying outside as long as he is kept on a good schedule.  He would be fine with older kids.  He has made the long trip from Texas to New England and he is looking for his forever home - could it be yours?If you'd like to apply for Helios or any of our other dogs, please fill out our application online here:http://www.yellowroserescue.org/adoption-applicationAdoption fee is $450, which includes spay/neuter, microchip, USDA transport, vaccines, health certificate and Massachusetts mandatory animal quarantine.If you have any questions about fostering or adopting a dog please contact Yellow Rose Animal Rescue directly at info@yellowroseanimalrescue.org.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Iggy! Iggy is a 6 year old Chihuahua who weighs 10 pounds and comes to rescue from Texas. This poor boy was attacked by another dog and suffered extensive injuries as a result. He was non weight bearing on his hind end when we got to him and it was determined that he had perforated lungs and multiple rib and spinal fractures. He has gotten all the expert medical care he needs with our vet partner and now he is doing great! He is absolutely the cutest little boy around and is such a sweet and friendly guy. He is an amazingly valiant little man. He has healed so well and has adapted to his limitations with grace. He will scamper his way into your heart. Although he will never walk normal again, he gets around just fine and is able to mobilize on his own. He is doing well with potty training and has adapted to defecting without being able to round his back. He is incredibly happy and loving but likes to be the leader of his pack so a home where his canine friends are non dominant would be the perfect fit for him! He absolutely adores his humans, and will make a devoted companion and snuggle buddy. He has been neutered and is up to date on vaccines. If you would like to add Iggy to your heart and home, please fill out an adoption application for him here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

TWICE as nice!Bailey (5ish and 52#) and her Weim Momma, Heidi (10 and 68#),  are officially accepting adoption applications.  Saved from a Texas shelter, they are now fostered in Connecticut and have discovered that snow can be fun.  They are house-trained, know basic commands and would be a great pair for almost anyone.  Both walk are leash trained and are fine with other dogs and cats.  Heidi is a silver Weim who is being tight-lipped about just who/what fathered Bailey.  A girl’s gotta have her secrets.These two girls are very bonded, playful (they even drop what they are fetching so you can throw it again!), love car rides and people.  Bailey especially loves the human boy at her foster home.  She has had a blast catching snowballs and sledding with “her\" boy since her move north.  She also sleeps in his bed at night.  Heidi likes to hang out on the back of the couch and is a stealthy counter-surfer.  They are both happy-go-lucky, sweet and friendly. Unlike typical Weims, they are not needy, needy, needy for humans, but they must have each other.  Bailey lacks confidence and can be nervous about meeting new people, but quickly quiets if humans remain calm. Both girls are up-to-date on vetting, heart worm negative and microchipped.  Heidi had her spleen removed while in rescue, but is fine now.  We can arrange transport within a day’s drive of their CT foster home if distance is an issue.If your home could use a double dose of sweetness, please contact us.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.This precious boy is Valerian. Valerian is a 5 year old Terrier mix who weighs 33 pounds and comes into rescue from Texas. We have learned that for weeks Valerian was running the streets of South Texas with a heavy chain around his neck and no one helped him. Finally a Good Samaritan saw him, took him to her house, called us and of course we immediately agreed to help. Valerian was in horrific medical condition but he got all the medical care he needed with our vet partner. He had a bad case of mange which is clearing nicely and he needed Entropion surgery for his eyes which he is recovering well from. He tested positive for multiple tick borne diseases and his teeth are non existent and worn down to the gums from having to survive outside on his own for so long. This is beyond upsetting and heartbreaking because Valerian is the sweetest and kindest soul. He is now doing great in his foster home but We can’t wait for him to find the special someone who can fill his life with so much unconditional love that he forgets all about the horrors of his past. He is a super friendly boy who is wonderful with people of all ages (including kids), and other dogs! He would however prefer a home without feline friends. He is very social and loves to cuddle! He enjoys car rides and walks perfect on leash. This handsome guy will make such a loyal and loving companion. He will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you would like to be the lucky one that gets to make Valerian the newest member of your home and heart, please fill out an adoption application for him here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

Emaciated and his skin was so raw and infected. He will now get all the medical care he needs with our vet partner and very soon this handsome boy will be ready for a home to call his very own! Armeno is a sweetypie saved from a very high kill shelter in Texas .Owner surrender ... first one to be killed . There was no second to loose , luckily we had him in time .Armeno is almost 1.5 year old . He is not aggressive towards other dogs but just don't like to be around them . This can chance overtime. He does not like cats .He is an absolute teddybear with our volunteers and with the staff at our boarding centerArmeno was betrayed by his entitled owner who did not care if they would kill him .We are looking for a serious adopter who can give this baby a loving him, where he gets spoiled and get the activities he needs . Somebody who will love and cherish him foreverArmeno is located in Middle Island NYDo you want to become his new family then please apply today by filling in the adoption application to find on our website www.a-teameliterescuedogs.com or email us and we send you one

Antero was saved from San Antonio's highest kill shelter . They told us that he is 3.5 years what could not be correct . He was a puppy and is now double the size since we pulled him . So we guess he is max 2 years old .Antero was clearly abused and fears people . In his kennel he will bark everybody away but then tries to hide in his doghouse .If you approach him slow and and with sweet words he will come to you . He just doesn't trust people after what happened to him .This sweet teddybear is looking for a forever home . Where he will be loved , where they will have patience and where he can find peace on his mind .Trust us , we have seen already miracles happen right after adoption.Antero is dog friendly but not good with cats .He is located in Middle Island NY .(Please , only serious adopters)To become his new family please apply today by filling in the adoption application to find on our website www.a-teameliterescuedogs.com or email us and we send you one

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Brix! Brix is a 1-1.5 year old Pit mix who comes into rescue from Texas. We got a plea from a shelter to help this poor boy. He came in with a severe skin infection..so bad that it presented like his whole body had been burned. He must have been suffering like this for so long and we are very happy that he is a Rescue Dogs Rock boy now and will get all the medical care he needs. He is being treated for his skin and is continuing to recover in a medical foster home but even after just a few weeks he is looking and feeling so much better! After all the neglect Brix has endured, we can’t wait to find him An amazing forever family that can fill his life with so much love and light that he forgets all about his horrific past. Could that be you?! His foster says that he is the absolute sweetest boy. He is friendly to all he meets...people of all ages, other dogs, and even feline friends! We are amazed at his capacity to forgive and move on from his past and are excited to see him thriving in a home where he will be loved, respected, and adored forever. He will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you would like to be the lucky one that gets to finally give Brix his happy ever after, please fill out an adoption application for him here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

Navy is a loving, well behaved, playful, but shy dog. He's potty trained, crate trained and loves to go for walks, although he is still learning not to pull. He’s quiet around the house, and keeps himself occupied playing with his toys. He loves his toys, and loves to chew them up. He’s still has puppy energy and inquisitiveness left in him. He gets along well with other dogs (both large and small). He’s scared of new people and new places, but has never shown any sign of aggression even when scared. Once he gets comfortable, he really opens up and is a big love-bug. He travels well in the car, but is hesitant to get in to start. Navy was saved from a small rural Texas shelter in August in the nick of time. Unfortunately shortly after his rescue he escaped from his foster home and had to be trapped. He has slowly learned to trust people and is blossoming in his current foster home. Name: NavyBreed: Catahoula/Lab MixSex: MaleAge: approx. 18 months years old Weight: 60 lbsSpayed/Neutered: YesVaccinations: current as of January 2019Heartworm: negativeMicrochipped: YesBASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:Good with Dogs: Yes, he is currently fostered with another large male and a smaller male and gets along fine.Good with Cats: Yes. He is currently not living with cats, but prior home had an indoor cat and he was fine.Good with Kids: No. Due to his shyness we do not think he would do well with children.Adoption Donation: 450.00IMPORTANT INFORMATION:Interested in a specific dog, please fill out an application if you are interested in a dog. The number of individual inquiries is overwhelming and we are finding it difficult to respond to each one. We cannot guarantee you will receive a timely response.Paws New England is a rescue, not a shelter, and as such we do not have our dogs housed in one location - they are in foster homes both in New England and in our southern foster homes.   If you're interested in a specific dog, please complete a short online application and you will receive a reply within 48 hours so you can ask questions.At present, if a dog is listed on our website, the dog is considered still available HOWEVER, may have applications that have come in before yours but it's still too early to know if any are a good match; therefore we encourage you to apply.NOTICE WITH REGARD TO LOCATION OF DOGS:  Please note: Paws New England is a foster-based rescue. We do not have a brick and mortar building to house the dogs we rescue. We have found that dogs in foster homes are much more adoptable because they have been observed in a home setting. Dogs listed with Paws New England typically reside in various locations throughout the south (primarily Tennessee, Texas, and Arkansas) and New England (not necessarily in the state of Rhode Island). You will be notified by the adoption coordinator of the location of the dog you are interested in so you have the ability to decide whether to pursue adoption or not.Dogs transported to New England are done so at a fee of $150.00 paid directly to the transporting company by Paws New England; no additional transport costs are responsibility of adopter. This fee is included in the adoption donation.Adoption donations cover pre-adoption vet costs (including vaccinations, spay/neuter when age appropriate, and heartworm testing/treatment when necessary), a microchip, and transportation to New England if necessary.Donations for our young, healthy puppies and dogs support their fellow canines of advanced age or suffering from injuries and abuse whose donations are reduced but whose veterinary costs are typically much higher. We appreciate your understanding that your dog will help others in need.All known information about the animal is listed above. We do our best to give accurate information, but most of our dogs are rescues and do not come with a known history.Paws New England abides by the dog importation regulations set forth in the states of MA, CT, NH and RI.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Calvin! Calvin is a 2 year old Chihuahua mix who weighs 10 pounds and comes into rescue from Texas. Poor Calvin was most likely hit by a car as he was found on the side of the road struggling to move. We were alerted to his situation and immediately stepped in to get him to our vet partner. Calvin has a broken pelvis in 3 places and will need several weeks of crate rest so his broken body can start to heal. Soon this sweet boy will be feeling so much better and we would really love to have a forever family waiting for him when he’s ready! He is absolutely precious and despite the suffering he has endured is friendly to all he meets..people of all ages and other dogs. He will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you are looking for an adorable love bug to add to your family, look no further and fill out an adoption application for Calvin here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Sweet Renny is a Pointer Mix puppy who was born in October 2018 and comes into rescue from Texas. This poor baby was Found on the side of the road left for dead after being hit by a car. She was picked up after many hours on the road writhing in pain and we were asked to help her...of course we said yes! Renny had been severely injured with multiple fractures of the pelvis and femur. She had her first femur surgery yesterday which went very well and she is being kept comfortable and pain free while recovering. She will need at least one more additional pelvic surgery and very soon we will have this precious girl all fixed up and feeling so much better. We would love to have a loving forever family waiting for her when she’s ready! She is an absolute angel and despite all she has endured remains kind, gentle, and loving with people of all ages and other dogs. She will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in her forever home. If you would like to be the lucky one that gets to give Renny her happy ever after, please fill out an adoption application for her here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.This stunning boy is Justus. Justus is a 4 year old Pit mix who currently weighs 35 pounds and comes into rescue from Texas. This poor boy was foundchained, unable to use his back legs, and left on a blanket to die. Preliminary veterinarian examinations describe Justus in extremely poor condition from neglect and abuse; his attending physician was surprised he was still alive. He had no fur, his eyes filled with mucous, his skin raging with infection, and he could not walk on his own. We were not going to give up on Justus...for us that was not an option. We did an MRI where it was determined that he had suffered some kind of blunt force trauma causing a fracture to his spine that was never treated. He has been undergoing intensive physical therapy and his progress has been remarkable! Justus is our fighter, our strong willed warrior, and he deserves only the best from here on out! His coat is now gorgeous and he has been with a terrific foster who has been working on strengthening his legs. He is now running, playing, and ready for a home of his very own! Are you the special someone that can finally show Justus what it’s like to be loved unconditionally?! We can’t wait to see him spoiled and doted on with the person that will promise to never abandon or mistreat him ever again. Justus absolutely Adores kids and his humans but would prefer to be the only doggie in his new home. He will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement. If you would like to be the lucky one that gets to give this miracle boy his happy ever after, please fill out an adoption application for Justus here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

Marlin is a very cuddly, sweet, active and a smart terrier mix. He is about 5-years-old and was rescued from a high kill shelter in Texas. He is housetrained and crate trained but came to PAWS without any socialization or basic manners. Marlin is currently attending obedience class where he is doing quite well. He is food motivated and likes to keep busy and is responding nicely to new commands – sit, down, wait, stay, come, leave-it. He also likes puzzle games and playing with toys. This adorable little rascal has a lot of anxiety that requires confidence building and supervised exposure to dogs, people and situations. With more practice, Marlin will become a master in no time. After very slow introductions, Marlin is feeling at home with the other two dogs in his foster home. He is a little pushy which doesn’t seem to bother the alpha male but intimidates the submissive female. He has also begun playing with the male dog. Since Marlin has some separation anxiety, a household with other dogs may be helpful as long as he is acclimated properly. Marlin is looking for a forever home where his masters will provide structure, stability, and continue positive reinforcement training and socialization. Marlin is a diamond in the rough awaiting someone who has time to devote to him. He was in such terrible shape when we got to him...his skin was so raw and infected from a bad case of mange, his eyes full of infection. He weighed in at 65 pounds on intake but is very emaciated and needs to gain some healthy weight. Jeffrey is safe and being treated with our vet partner who will get him looking and feeling better in no time! Soon he will be ready to experience what it’s like to have an amazing new family that will show him all the love in the world! He is so sweet and friendly to people of all ages and other dogs. You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.This adorable little prince is Peanut. Peanut is a 2 year old Chihuahua mix who weighs 6 pounds and comes into rescue from Texas. He was hit by a car and found on the side of the road by someone who saw him get hit. For one week Peanut laid suffering and in pain with the finder who did not find it necessary to seek immediate medical care for him. After a week when Peanut was only getting worse, they then decided to drop him off at a high kill shelter. We then were able to step in for poor Peanut and transferred him to our medical partner. Sadly, his wounds were so severe and left untreated for too long and now our sweet Peanut will be left paralyzed. He has a compression fracture in his spine, and his legs are terribly injured as well. The great news for Peanut is that he is safe and on his way to a happy new life. We will get him fitted for some wheels so he can get around and he will be recovering with a great medical foster who specializes in paralyzed dogs. Peanut is a tiny bundle of joy despite what he has been through and will make an amazing addition to any home! He is friendly with people of all ages and other dogs and will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. We would love to have a special adopter waiting for Peanut when he is ready so if that could be you please fill out an application for Peanut here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

Welcome Preston, an American Bull Dog/hound mix, who we rescued from a Texas high kill shelter.  Preston is a friendly and energetic 1-3 year old who had no training before coming to us. Preston has recently completed a two week obedience/leash training course and has accomplished so much in a short time! Preston is such a sweet boy who loves cuddles and belly rubs.  He will need active and experienced dog owners who can continue with his training (3 sessions with are included post-adoption).  While teenagers would be a good fit for him, due to his need for structure we don't recommend children under 12. Although Preston loves to play with other dogs, he would do best in a home with a sister sibling! Preston is eager to please and an absolute love who will make a great companion.  Would you please consider giving this deserving pup his forever home?!Follow the link below to fill out an adoption form, view all available dogs, sponsor a dog, donate or volunteer! GardenRescues.Org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Are you looking for the most handsome, sweetest northern breed dog around? Then Valiance is your boy! This gorgeous guy is 1.5 years old, weighs 45 pounds, and comes into rescue from Texas. He hasn’t had the greatest life so far and now we need to find him the most amazing new forever home. He was used as a breeding stud in his previous home and had an unfortunate accident when he jumped out of his owners car window. He was severely injured and his owners were not able to pursue medical care for him. Of course we stepped in immediately and got him to our vet partner where he is now on the mend and getting better every day. His front leg took the brunt of the damage and he suffered elbow ligament damage. He is being kept comfortable and undergoing daily bandage changes and wound treatments to help his leg heal and stabilize. Soon this stunning Husky will be ready to greet his special someone with lots of kisses and husky woo’s! The vet staff said that in true husky fashion he is quite the talker, and he is very friendly with people of all ages and other dogs. He is neutered and will be up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you would like to make Valiance the newest member of your pack, please fill out an adoption application for him here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet cutie pie Daisy! She is an adorable 4 month old Australian Cattle/Blue Heeler mix. She came into rescue from Texas. Daisy is an energetic young lady who loves to run, play fetch and especially cuddle! Daisy is potty-trained; she will go outside as well as using \"puddle pads\" in the home. Daisy knows \"sit\" \"down\" \"kennel\" and \"back\" - she is smart! Daisy is confident and outgoing in familiar surrounds. She can be hesitant with new situations and people, so a home where she can build her confidence and feel safe is a must. She is looking for the special someone who can surround her with unconditional love and happiness for the rest of her life....could that be you?! She will be spayed and up to date on vaccines (age appropriate) prior to placement in her forever home. If you are looking for a new puppy princess to add to your family, look no further and fill out an adoption application for Daisy (TX) here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Beautiful Donna is a one year old Black Mouth Cur mix who comes into rescue from Texas. Donna was found as a stray on the harsh Texas streets critically injured and trying to keep not only herself but her newborn puppies alive. We do not know exactly what happened to this poor girl, but one of her front legs was badly mangled. We rushed this precious family to our vet partner for immediate medical care. Unfortunately only one of Donnas pups survived. It was also determined that there was nothing that could be done to save her leg, and amputation was the only option. This sweet, innocent girl who is practically a pup herself has had to suffer and endure so much already. Now it is her turn to finally know what unconditional love feels like and we vow to find the best new forever family for her! Could it be you?! She is doing wonderfully as a tripod and her spirit is as strong and vibrant as ever. She is a great mom to her one surviving puppy and remains as sweet as can be to all she meets...kids and other dogs alike! One look into those beautiful golden eyes and it’s hard to resist Donnas charm! She will make such a loyal and loving companion and any home would be lucky to get to add her as a permanent member. She will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement. If you would like to give Donna the happy ever after that she is so deserving of, please fill out an adoption application for her here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

Prue is a Great Dane/Pittie mix, she is around 2 years old. She loves to play, run, get in the water, and eat! She is slinder and tall and her energy level makes it hard to keep good weight on her. Prue is learning basic obedience currently, she is crate and house trained. Prue loves kids, she is very easy going and calm around them but loves playing with them! Prue is currently being fostered in Houston TX but is available for transport to the North through our transport partner!Adopting from A Chance To Bloom:We are a rescue based in Houston, Texas that is currently expanding adoptions into other states. We encourage you to take a look into our rescue on Facebook! You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet our precious little Lulu girl! Lulu was born in May 2018 and comes into rescue from Texas. This poor girl has already endured so much suffering and neglect in her young life. Lulu has something wrong with her heart and had a very bad case of demodex (non-contagious) mange causing hair loss and her skin to be very raw and infected. She is in good hands now and will get all the medical care she needs but what she really needs is a home to call her very own! Lulus skin is all fixed up now and we are managing the several congenital heart defects that we discovered she has. She is taking medications to help her heart and just recently had a surgery to prolong her life. Despite our best efforts this sweet girl still has a guarded prognosis. She needs someone very special who can fill the rest of her time here with boundless amounts of love and happiness. Lulu is an absolutely adorable little angel. All it takes is one look into those beautiful eyes and you can see the love and sweetness that she is made of. Her special someone will need to be on board with taking her for frequent check ups to make sure that she continues to thrive for as long as possible but this shouldn’t be a big deal because this miracle girl is totally worth it! She is strong willed with a heart of gold and is great with people of all ages and other dogs. She is the total package and we can’t wait to see her spoiled in her forever home! She will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement. If you would like to be the lucky one that gets to give Lulu the happy ever after that she is so very deserving of, please fill out an adoption application for her here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

Orion came to us from a high-kill shelter in Texas in the summer of 2018. He is about 2 1/2 years old, and weighs about 75 lbs. If you like larger dogs, that have a lot of love to give, Orion is your dog. Please call Sindee at 914-299-3700.
