You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Prince Argon is the most handsome 7-8 year old Pit mix that you will ever lay your eyes on! This poor boy was moments from euthanasia at a high kill shelter in Texas when one of our southern fosters got a plea and just couldn’t let him face that fate. Argon has never known the perks of the “good life” and is finally starting to enjoy the simplest of things. You should see him rolling around in a soft blanket like he’s never had such comforts and a nice cozy dog bed is just about heaven to this sweet, sweet boy. Argon will get all the medical care he needs and soon will be ready for a home to call his own. His ears were very infected when we got to him and it seems to be effecting his hearing so we will be treating and monitoring this issue. He is a miracle dog, a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day, the apple in the eye of anyone that beholds him. Yes, he really is that special. He is so forgiving of all the neglect and suffering that he has endured and he has stayed strong and resilient just long enough for us to find him and start offering him some relief from his torturous past. Argon is wonderful, amazing, and deserves a forever home with the same attributes. He needs someone that can show him the finer things in doggie life and just spoil, adore, and love him unconditionally for the rest of his days. He is friendly with people of all ages and other dogs and will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. A home with older children would be best for Argon as even though he is an adult he has some puppy play mannerisms and is still learning how to be a dog. Cats are new for Argon as well and although he has not shown a hint of aggression he is a little too curious (who can blame him!) so a cat free home would be ideal. Are you looking for the most handsome boy to add to your family with a huge heart of gold?! Then look no further and fill out an adoption application for Argon here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

Bonnie came from a high-kill shelter in Texas. She was a little timid, and understandably so. You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Gorgeous Hallie is a one year old Pit mix who weighs 30 pounds. She comes into rescue from Texas. Hallie hasn’t had the amazing life that every dog dreams of yet but now that she is safe with us we will make sure this girl finally has her fairy tale ending. She presented with some neurological symptoms. Hallie spent a few weeks at our San Antonio vet Partner and it was discovered that she was partially blind and deaf. She stumbled a lot and needed further diagnostic testing with a specialty hosp in NY. The specialist has determined that Hallie suffered from some type of trauma to the skull which is what is causing her issues. Sadly we think that she suffered this injury at the hands of humans or possibly suffered some type of brain infection that was never treated. Now we are dealing with her issues head on and she seems to be doing better. She has vision in one eye, and she stumbles less. She so wants to be a normal pup...running and playing with kids, cats, and dogs. Hallie is looking for that special someone who will care for her and her needs. Hallie is an absolutely beautiful girl who is very sweet and friendly. She will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in her forever home. If you can give Hallie the happy ever after that she is so deserving of, please fill out an adoption application for her here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

Hi! My name is Pickles and I am adorable, amazing, and awesome! I am about 4 years old and my closest breed guess is a boxer, but I am just a Hinze57 mixed breed which makes me even more spectacular! I love, love, love, and I mean loooove to run and be active! I like to be outside in the grass exploring nature  and running zoomies around the yard. I really like to chase tennis balls or freesbies, but they always want me to bring it back and sometimes it's more fun to just play with them. I would love to be someone's exercise buddy, hiking partner, or go to the park to play a lot. I do awesome with cats and dogs smaller than me, but dogs my size and bigger scare me so, I would love a home without scary big dogs! I do like kids! but sometimes my running can knock little bitty kids down so, they say 5 years old and older are my speed of kiddos! I love people and I love to be active! Will you be my running buddy?***LUCKY PENNY ROX RESCUE IS A TEXAS BASED RESCUE******THIS DOG IS CURRENTLY IN A FOSTER HOME IN TEXAS***LPRR is a 501(c)(3) non-profit rescue organization in Fort Bend County, Texas (suburb of Houston, Tx). Due to the overpopulation of pets in Texas from the lack of spay and neuter laws and proper pet care, it is extremely difficult to adopt out animals in the state. It is common for rescue organizations to adopt out animals to northern states where there is not a high population of dogs and cats. We have successfully adopted out over 300 animals to out of state families. Our prefered mode of transport from Texas to adoptive families is ground transport such as Rescue Road Trips, PETS LLC, and Your Tx Rescue Connection. We also use air transport in some cases and that varies depending on airline and adoption location. Our adoption fees vary as we typically request for the adopting family to only cover transport and health certificate costs. Please feel free to email us and ask us any questions you may have!

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Jack M and his family come to rescue from Texas. He is a pup to Bailey, and is thought to be a Heeler/Pointer mix. He was born in June 2018. Jack M did have an unfortunate incident during birth - his toes were torn off. We are unsure at this time what the long term impact will be since he is so very little and not yet fully mobile. He has been getting around just fine and it seems at this point that he may need a booty later to protect the foot but not necessarily a prosthetic. He does not let his deformity slow him down and loves to race around with his siblings! He is a sweet and playful boy! He can sometimes be a little nervous around strangers and because it may take some time for him to adjust and warm up we feel a home with older, respectful children would be best suited for Jack. Jack will be up to date on shots (age appropriate) and neutered prior to placement in his forever home. He is great with other dogs. If you would like to adopt Jack M, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website. Meet Levi! Levi is a 2 year old Chocolate Lab who weighs 52 pounds. He comes into rescue from Texas. Poor Levi has only known a life of suffering so far. When we got to him he was in bad shape. He is now doing amazing in his foster home and is ready to meet the amazing person who can show him what it means to be truly loved and cared for. Could that person be you?! Levi has blossomed into the most handsome boy with the sweetest, most trusting soul. He’s not afraid of loud noises like the vacuum and he’s very inquisitive and curious.He's definitely a high energy boy, loves to play with all dogs, but, for safety sake, should be his size or bigger. He is a rough and tumble kind of guy. Loves kids,and even thought the little boy in his foster home (who has autism) was in trouble in the pool and jumped in to save him! You won’t find a more loyal boy! We feel that older children would be best for Levi,due to his exuberant play. He is house trained, no accidents in the home. Does not need a crate when left alone, actually does not like the crate. No separation anxiety. Needs an active family, fenced in yard where he can expend his energy. Good on the leash on walks, and he absolutely loves going on car rides.Levi is neutered and up to date on vaccines. If you would like to be the one that gets to give Levi his happy ever after, please fill out an adoption application for him here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application

Hi, my name is MISSY and I am a TWO YEAR OLD old female LABRADOR MIX weighing 50 pounds.  Not to brag, but I’m a real stunner with my slim figure and lush black coat  and white chest that you won’t be able to resist caressing. I am originally from Texas and . I moved to New York, to  became a Posh Pet and have acclimated well to NY ,  I have been in a foster home with  other DOGS  I would do better in a calmer home as I am still shy of men until I get to know them. I am never aggressive, just hesitant, so please be patient with me. I love other dogs  and am very submissive with them. It’s important that I am given the chance to frequently socialize with other dogs. Please take me for play dates or have dog friends come  to the house.I’m a sweet girl and I’ll make you smile when I play in the water, which is something I love to do!I happily share my human, gently take treats, and I like to follow my foster mom around the home. I am inquisitive and  eager to learn new things, how about you teach me new tricks?!Once I know you, you’ll see how much I love spending time with you and letting you love me. You’ll be so glad you welcomed me into your family. As they say, “to know me is to love me.” I’m spayed, up to date on vaccinations, and microchipped.  Please fill out application on this link https://poshpetsrescueny.org/dog-application/
We are in need of foster homes for dogs.  If you would like to be put on our foster list please email us at:  animalrescuekingdom@gmail.comOur dogs come from Texas and sometimes need temporary homes.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Handsome Simba is a 3 year old Chow mix who weighs 50 pounds. He comes into rescue from Texas. This sweet boy has only known a life of suffering and neglect until now and we are so happy that we have the opportunity to give him the amazing new life that he deserves! He really is a stunning boy with his fluffy coat and that cute black tongue that gives away the Chow in him! He spent some time with our vet partner getting all the medical care he needed and now he’s healthy, happy, and ready for a home to call his own. He can be shy and nervous when first getting to know him and requires a slow and patient approach while he’s trying to adjust to his surroundings. Since he has been in his foster home, he has warmed up quickly and is becoming less nervous with people but because he has a “warm up” period, Simba would do best in a home without small kids (under 10) at this time. After he feels comfortable he is an absolute joy to be around and gets along well with other dogs large and small! He is so smart and equally as sweet.He is house trained, potty trained, and loves to be outside.He loves to chew on bones, play with rope ball, run, take long walks, and does very well with all of them. Simba is an active boy so needs a yard to run and play in and someone who can give him the attention he deserves! He is eager to learn and walks very well on leash and has been working on learning basic commands such as sit and fetch! He eats well and is very active, but does sleep well through the night. He really enjoys a nice belly/butt scratch session and is so appreciative to get some good loving! He will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you are looking for a loving and loyal companion to add to your family, then Simba is the one for you! If you would like to be the lucky one that gets to give Simba his happy ever after, please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application

He will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you would like to make Jake the newest member of your family, please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.This handsome boy is Salvatore, a Terrier mix who was born in mid-2013 and weighs about 41 pounds. He comes into Rescue from Texas. This poor baby was hit by a car and left alone and scared to fend for himself on the Texas streets. Lucky for this boy he is safe with us now and is currently in a loving foster home. Salvatore has been diagnosed with idiopathic epilepsy brought on by the trauma. He is on anti-seizure medication for epilepsy and has been seizure free for a while. He is not a fan of city traffic or noise and does not like car rides. He would do well in a quiet neighborhood. Are you the lucky family that can give Salvatore all the unconditional love that he is so deserving of? Despite the neglect he has endured and the pain he suffered, Salvatore is a very sweet boy. He is wonderful with people of all ages, other small dogs as long as they are more on the mellow side, and he even loves cats! He is a very chill and low key guy, is not destructive at all, is house trained, and will make the best new snuggle partner! He will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you would like to make Salvatore the newest member of your family and love of your life, please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet precious Sylvie. Sylvie comes into Rescue from Texas. She is a 2 year old Hound mix who weighs 45 pounds. The first year of this girls life was tragic. When she came into rescue she was suffering from a severe skin condition and an old break on one of her back legs. Her leg is doing well and she has recovered nicely, although it can still be sore at this time so a home with respectful kids is a must. Sylvie loves giving hugs and kisses to those she loves. Sylvie loves to play fetch and run around in the backyard, so a nice fenced yard would be a must for her. She is very friendly with other dogs and cats too! What a good girl! She loves treats and playing with toys. She has completed level 1 adult training at Petco and her instructor said she's such a bright student. She is house and crate trained. She would do best with another mild mannered doggie friend as it seems to give her more confidence. She is spayed and up to date on vaccines. If you would like to make Sylvie the newest member of your family and love of your life, please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application

Meet Andrae, he's a 2 year old male Shepherd mix rescued from a high kill shelter in Texas. This big boy is just looking for a home that he can finally call his own. He's super friendly and just can't wait to meet you, so hurry down and see him today! Thank you to star sponsors George & Delores Nerlino and Ann & William Cowin for sponsoring Andrae while he waits to find his forever home!

Hi my name is Ronald! I am a Chi mix from Texas. I was in the shelter as a stray. I was brought up to NJ to make room for the flood victims so hopefully they can get reunited with their families. I wish I had a family! I am 8 years old, up to date on shots and neutered. I like other dogs and I am crate trained. I like to hang out in the sun or cuddle in a bed. I like other dogs, but I’m also good on my own. I'm a calm little guy, affectionate and just happy to have a second chance up here!THE FIRST STEP IN OUR ADOPTION PROCESS IS TO GO TO PETRESQINC.ORG TO FILL OUT AN ADOPTION APPLICATION

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.This GORGEOUS boy is Marcos! Marcos is a 3.5 year old Great Pyrenees who was brought into rescue from Texas. He was in bad shape when we first got to him...he had been hit by a car and his pelvis was shattered. On top of that this sweet boy was so very emaciated and it was clear that he had endured so much neglect and suffering. We got Marcos immediately to our vet partner where he received all the medical care that he needed. He had surgery to correct his pelvis and is doing great! He will always need some pain management for his hips because of the severity of his injuries and the intensive surgery he underwent. He is doing wonderful in his foster home but would really love a home to call his very own! He's packed on some good weight is currently up to 100 pounds! He can become scared around loud noises and would do best in rural/surburban setting with a fenced yard. Due to his old injuries, his ideal forever home would be one with older kids who understand his space and won't jump all over him. He does great with other dogs, doesn't mind them at all but is not overly eager to be playful. Puppies or younger very active canine friends may be a little overwhelming for him. He's a very loving, sweet, gentle giant but is a guardian breed so needs a family that understands these traits. Marcos is lower energy and would make a great cuddle buddy and lounge around companion! He is up to date on shots and neutered. If you would like to adopt this handsome boy, please put your application in for Marcos here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application

Name: SkyyApproximate Age: Approx. 2yrs oldBreed: Pit mixSex: FemaleSpecial Needs: AllergiesAdoption fee: $300.00Up to date on vaccinations/preventatives, spayed, house/crate trained, microchippedI came to the rescue back in 2016 from a high kill shelter in Texas. The conditions werent the best to say the least and oh yeah, I was SUPER pregnant. Not a good place for a expecting mom. Thankfully, I was taken from there just in time and was able to have my puppies in a foster home. I was even thrown a huge baby shower by a ton of people who follow SNARR! I was so happy to finally have had my babies and be out of the shelter but my excitement quickly became tragedy. Not long after giving birth, almost half of my babies passed away- only 4 survived. Now that my remaining pups have gone to live their own liveshere I sit and wait. While I adore my foster mom, I want a home to call my own. Im confused on why I dont have my own home yet Im incredibly adorable and Im hands down the most wiggly tushed pocket pittie youll ever meet! I have never met a person I didnt like, however dogs.not too fond of dogs or any other furry little creatures. I blame that on my high prey drive and Im very smart when it comes down to it- I can be a pro stalker and Im lightning fast so its best that the temptation isnt there in forever home. Give me any kind of human though and its nothing but hugs (literally, I give hugs) and kisses! Due to having allergies, I take Benedryl and cannot eat chicken.Transport to any approved home within the US can be provided at no additional feeCurrently Skyy is located in Lawrenceville, Georgia.Please visit SNARRANIMALRESCUE.org to fill out an adoption application and our adoption requirements/process can also be found there!

Queenie is a spectacular pet in need of a home experienced with German Shepherds.   She is a protective girl who is not very stranger tolerant, so the meet-and-greet procedure with her must be more drawn out and she belongs only in a home comfortable with not allowing strangers to make direct contact with their dog.  Other than that, she is pretty close to perfect.  She can be in public settings where strangers are respectfully hands off.  Approximately four years old, she was pulled from a high kill shelter in Texas heavily pregnant and successfully raised a litter of puppies while being a wonderful mom.  She is now ready to move onto a forever ending of her own :)  She is purebred, although her ears did fail to stand, and a real deal GSD.   She is GREAT company - very playful, joyful and extremely affectionate.  If a German Shepherd can be merry, that would be her.  She is highly intelligent (both the good and the bad....she is an escape artist who can range from smart to daring), very responsible, forms a strong bond, and is an energetic girl with an extremely playful and fun personality.   For the breed, she is not a noisy dog, does great with other dogs, and is ok around cats. Older children only, please, as toddlers make her nervous.  THE RIGHT HOME for Queenie needs to have breed experience.  Queenie is territorial and protective by her nature.  When displaced, she forms a strong bond, but meet-and-greets will require patience and understanding as she is not receptive to strangers.  This is a higher energy girl who belongs with someone active.  She crates well and is overall a good housedog, but if bored and under stimulated will be destructive.  She will do fine in a home with another  dog and has learned not to bother cats, but she should not be around smaller children - they are very foreign to her and she finds their movements unsettling.  If you need a dog who can thrive in social settings, she is not the dog for you as while she can be socialized better with strangers, her social circle being an elite group of knowns is inherent to both her and the breed itself.  If, however, you seek a adventurous companion, up for anything, who bonds strongly and is extremely loyal, she could be the dog for you.Applications are available on the southpawsexpress.org website or by contacting Lucy at maramuser@gmail.com.  Her adoption fee is $450.

Let Freedom Ring!!! In honor of Independence day being just around the corner, our June 29th transport theme is all about celebrating America. Please welcome our FREEDOM PUPS as they take their freedom ride from Texas to New Jersey!!The United States would not be the place it is today without the influence of some remarkable women. Harriet Tubman, Sally Ride, Katherine Johnson, and Helen Keller are just to name a few. We are honoured to name this litter of 4 beautiful 11 week old female Lab Terrier blends after these amazing icons.Meet Harriet, Sally, Katherine and Amelia. Being Lab Terrier blends they will be small to medium sized dogs. Generally this blend of pup has lots of energy, a wonderful temperament and are super loyal so they are a great addition to any family. They are crate-trained and being puppies they are working on their house manners.Harriet is a crowd pleaser! The spots on her ears are over the top cute and she has the most endearing personality to match! She is 5.4 pounds of love and affection.Just as these women helped mould America and inspire future generations. You can do the same! Inspire a generation to rescue and adopt dogs from high kill shelters. Fill out your application today for one of these pups and give them a place to call home!If you think you are a perfect match for Harriet, please complete an application fully:https://www.petstablished.com/adoption_form/11415/genericHarriet has been fully vetted, is up to date on all vaccinations and on preventatives for heartworm, flea and tick. We cannot guarantee breed information. You will find the price guidelines for adoption at matchdogrescue.org and can read about the whole adoption process and what MatchDog Rescue provides with each dog.This gorgeous MatchDog is not yet in the state of N.J. and currently in our MatchPad in the great state of Texas. This dog will be going on a three-day road trip arriving to us here in N.J. on Sat, June 29th at Marlton PetSmart. For the very best chance of securing a meet for this dog on arrival in N.J you must be available all day on this date.If you see a pending notification on this dog and the picture changed to black and white, it means we have informed the lucky family selected as the best match for this particular dog and they have agreed to come to the transport event as the dog arrives. Eventually go to their forever home. If for any reason this plan falls through, we will change the picture back to color and revisit other applications.

Let Freedom Ring!!! In honor of Independence day being just around the corner, our June 29th transport theme is all about celebrating America. Please welcome our FREEDOM PUPS as they take their freedom ride from Texas to New Jersey!!Lewis and Clark the intrepid explorers made their way across the United states over a two year period. Tasked by the president many, many years ago. They showed bravery grit.The same can we said for these two travelers, along with their mum, Sacagewea.Each had the worst start imaginable. There mum was surrendered to a high killshelter. She had given birth to both of these pups two days previously and was still in labor, unable to get the pups out and given no medical care or meds. When she arrived we had a foster meet her family in a car in the car park and swoop up mom and pups and take them immediately for surgery. A c-section was performed and there were three other pups. Twohad already passed inside mom and the third survived but sadly died that day. Mum her self almost died too. It was touch and go for a few days after but then with much strength like their forefather's they made it through.Mum, Sacagewea, is a young dachsund blend weighing 35 pounds. She is doing well now and can't wait to meet her forever family to give her the life she deserves. Sacagewea is crate trained and about 90% potty trained. She would do well in any kind of household.This group of pups will make a long, arduous journeyacross the U.S., just like their namesakes, to get to us here in N.J real soon. Hopefully you will be there to swoop them up for a second time and show them why it was worth all that they have already been through. Let show them what a dogs life should really look like.If you think you are a perfect match for Sacagewea, please complete an application fully:https://www.petstablished.com/adoption_form/11415/genericSacagewea has been fully vetted, is up to date on all vaccinations and on preventatives for heartworm, flea and tick. It was touch and go for a few days after but then with much strength like their forefather's they made it through.Clark and his brother, Lewisare4 month old lab/doby blends. Both boys currently weighabout 19 pounds. They are crate trained and about 80% house trained. These playful, sweet boys would do well in any kind of household and can't wait to meet their forever families!This group of pups will make a long, arduous journeyacross the U.S., just like their namesakes, to get to us here in N.J real soon. Hopefully you will be there to swoop them up for a second time and show them why it was worth all that they have already been through. Fresca is a sweet yet shy senior lady that came to us on a transport from Texas. Fresca seems to want to be with people but she can be very nervous of any sort of physical contact. She's a little unsure about being touched but doesn't want to leave your side either. She needs a quiet home with people who are home more often than not. Fresca needs a person who is very patient and who will let her set the pace of the relationship, no matter how slow. Fresca has been around other dogs in previous shelter and when she was with a doggie friend here she seemed to open up more. Give a senior dog a home and you will be the happiest ever, we guarantee it.

Chief is a 3 year old 60lb Labrador mix who joined us from Texas. He is heartworm positive and would love a quiet foster home to recuperate in during treatment.Chief loves other dogs but no kitties please. He has a high ball drive and likes to carry around his big kong toy. He is also a bit of an escape artist but has never had an accident in the house. He can also jump a 5 foot fence and will need to be leash walked or a yard with a secure 6 foot fence.Our adoption fee is $300 and we adopt to a 2.5 hour radius of zip code 21034. For more information about any of our wonderful dogs please visit our website at www.blackdogsancompanyrescue.org or email us at rescueblackdogs@yahoo.com

Noelle's babies were all adopted months ago....now it's her turn!! Noelle is looking for a home to call her own! She was rescued from Texas in December of 2017. Noelle had been hit by a car and was taken to the local Animal Control, she was terrified and in danger of euthanasia. We committed to her and had her seen by a local vet. Noelle was found to be pregnant, we were told she was “just barely pregnant”. We decided to allow her to have her puppies, within a week of arrival Noelle went into labor (turns out she was far more than “just barely pregnant”!). She delivered 10 puppies, 3 naturally and 7 by emergency C-Section. Sadly two puppies did not survive. The 8 surviving puppies thrived thanks to a wonderful and doting momma. Noelle has come so very far, she has warmed up to people. She is a very sweet girl who now that her role as momma has concluded has seen the Orthopedic Surgeon to determine what can be done to help her hind legs. Sadly the injuries are old and healed therefore nothing can be done. Noelle’s story had a very sad beginning but we hope the second half will be nothing short of a Fairytale in a forever home. Noelle is current on vaccines and preventatives, she has been spayed and is microchipped.Her adoption fee is $300. we adopt to a 2.5 hour radius of zip code 21034. For more information about any of our wonderful dogs please visit our website atwww.blackdogsandcompanyrescue.orgor email us at rescueblackdogs@yahoo.com 5/19/19 11:34 PM

NANCY is a beautiful little 2 year old female Chihuahua mix with a heart of gold.  NANCY was one of hundreds of shelter dogs from Texas who were sent to different shelters out of state to make room for animals that were displaced during Hurricane Harvey back in August.  NANCY arrived to Animal Alliance pregnant, and gave birth to 6 wonderful little pups who have all gone on to their forever homes.  Now it is this sweet girl's turn.This pet is spayed or neutered in accordance with our strict policy wherein all animals are altered prior to adoption.  This pet is dewormed, current on vaccines, and started on monthly flea/tick and preventatives.Animal Alliance's policy is that we will adopt dogs younger than 1 year old to families with children under 9 years old. We do not adopt dogs 1 year or older to families with children under 9 years old due to the unknown history of adult dogs. Prior to submitting an application, please see the Animal Alliance Adoption Process for adoption details.Animal Alliance is not a shelter where all the animals are housed in one location. Animal Alliance is a foster care network and animals are housed in many different locations. If you are interested in adopting a pet, please apply using the online application; applicants who call our phone line will hear a recorded voicemail with this identical message. We adopt many animals each week and meet prospective adopters at various locations so they can meet the animals they are interested in.To fill out an adoption application, go to:https://www.animalalliancenj.org/fosteradoption-application/

Little tiny Xena.... She was rescued by BTN from a very high kill shelter in Texas.  An awful place... She was VERY pregnant.  BTN was on their way to get her and she ended up delivering her babies at the shelter.  A supporter of BTN snatched Xena and her babies right up and fostered them until we could arrive to bring her back to PA for fostering.  Xena is a complete joy.  Grateful for everything she has been given.. Loves kids.  Has not been cat tested yet.  She is a bit guarding around other dogs but she has her 6 babies and is protective of them - understandable.  Completely fine with people around the babies though.  Her foster mom says she is a dream and is extremely sweet.  Xena has a bit of energy as you can see in her video.  Their larger baby gate had broken and this was what Xena thought of the temporary replacement.  For more info please email suew@boxertransfer.org

Harvey Blue, Lab mix about 4 years old. He was rescued from a shelter in Texas, Hurricane Harvey. He has never had a forever home. Lots of energy,  loves to play, so another dog (female) would be fine.  Would make a great jogging partner. If interested  please contact Jane,765-720-5671 text or call. Must have application filled  out in order to adopt.  Go to www.sacredsycamoreanimalrescue.org click at top of page on adoption,  scroll down find application link, follow instructions.  DO NOT MAIL, please email per instructions.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Molly is a highly energetic young dog who is eager to learn and play, and has become a favorite dog of several volunteers. She came to us from a Texas shelter that was needing to move some dogs out because of their high-kill rate (to make room for others). Her foster from Texas said she had gotten along with a few other dogs and children, but since arriving at Safe Haven, we have actually not been able to find any dog friends that she gets along with. Molly has a very dominant personality with other dogs, so this makes living in a shelter setting pretty stressful for Molly.Unfortunately we have tried to introduce Molly to several other dogs during her time at Safe Haven, and have even taken her on a few day trips to meet other dogs - and so far Molly has not been able to get along with any other dogs, so we feel she will do best as an only dog in her forever home. Her foster in Texas also told us that she really is much too interested in 'playing' with chickens and she would suggest her not going to a home where there are chickens. This behavior also transfers over to cats unfortunately - and Molly will need a home with no cats. So if you have a home without any other pets, you may just have the perfect home for our Molly! After watching her in action when she was left to wander about in the room with us during a meeting or two, I have to think she has a wicked sense of humor and such a silly-dog streak in her personality. More than once she stole items individuals had laying by their chairs and would strut around with the item waiting for us to realize what she had done! Molly would certainly be an awesome dog for someone that is active and looking for a devoted companion.Like all of our dogs she is up to date on parasite preventatives, vaccinations and is microchipped and spayed (neutered).Interested in adopting? Please click here for more information. www.wesavepets.com/info/adoptionAnd then click on the blue ' Safe Haven of Iowa County Online Application' link at the bottom.

Meet Allison! Allison was rescued from an animal cruelty case in Texas. Despite her not so great start to life, it only takes a few hours and she's happy to give you her whole heart. Allison loves to snuggle and take walks. She gets along well with the resident dogs in her foster home but would be fine as an only dog as well. Allison is a great eater, kennels well, and is house broken. She is sensitive to loud noises, so would not be a good candidate for off leash training, as she spooks fairly easily. Allison is estimated to be 2-3 years old and weighs about 50 pounds. She would be super easy to train as a support animal if that's something you need, too -- she LOVES to snuggle and be with her person. If you're looking for a sweet, affectionate pup to join your family, Allison is the girl for you! Apply at www.foreverhomedogs.org to meet her!All adoptions are $200 per dog which include spay/neuter, micro-chipped and up-to-date on required shots. Senior dogs, at our discretion, are adopted out at $100 per dog because we know they will have less time with your family and may eventually have more needs as they get older. But we feel these dogs deserve to live out the rest of their lives as part of a loving family.

Why hello there! This spunky guy is Bullwinkle. He is new to the area, as he came to us all the way from Texas, but he has made quite the impression during his short time here. At 9 months old he weighs about 56 pounds and is full of love! Bullwinkle has so much personality and loves everyone he meets. He is fostered with his brother, Rocky, and two small dogs. Since he has such a love for his furfriends, he would also love to have one in his forever home or at least friends that he can play with on a regular basis. Bullwinkle is already crate trained and house trained! He is still a pup and needs to work on his manners, but is eager to please. If you are interested in adding a pup with a zest for life to your family, fill out an adoption application! Bullwinkle's adoption fee is $400.To adopt this pet, please visit https://www.louieslegacy.org/adoptAll of our dogs come spayed or neutered, fully up to date on vaccinations, including rabies (if age appropriate) and bordetella, are microchipped, heartworm negative, current on flea/tick and heartworm prevention, dewormed, and treated for any ailments found upon veterinary examination. The adoption fee covers a portion of these services, and makes it possible for us to continue rescuing animals.  For more information on the adoption fees and the adoption process, please complete our adoption application here: https://www.louieslegacy.org/adopt - an application allows us to get to know your family better so we can assess whether the animal you are interested in is a good match for your home. An application does not obligate you to adopt. Please understand that due to the volume of applications some animals receive, we are unable to contact all applicants. If your application is considered a good fit for the dog you are interested in, or even a different pet, a volunteer will give you a call as soon as possible.  We are a foster based rescue and do not have a shelter location where dogs can be seen during the week. Please see our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/LouiesLegacy for our weekly adoption album if you are interested in meeting a dog in person. Not all animals attend every adoption event, please check our Facebook page for animal event times and locations before you make a trip to meet a specific animal.Thanks so much for caring about a needy animal!

Why hello there! This handsome boy is Rocky. Rocky recently moved to the Cincinnati area all the way from Texas! Even though a big move can be stressful, he has been nothing but sweet since his arrival. At 9 months old he weighs about 42 pounds. Rocky loves to play and loves to be loved! He can be a little reserved at first, but quickly comes out of his shell once he gets to know you. He is fostered with his brother, Bullwinkle, and two small dogs. He has been extremely friendly to every dog he has met and would love a fur-sibling in his forever home or at least a friend he could play with from time to time. Meet Mater, a 1 year old Lab/Pit Bull mix! This handsome boy, weighing in around 50 pounds, came to Ohio all the way from Texas! Mater is instant best friends with all of the dogs he meets, but takes a few minutes to warm up to new people. He lacks confidence, but no matter how shy he is, he's never aggressive. Mater gains confidence from other dogs, so he's looking for another dog in his forever home. This happy boy enjoys running with his dog friends and playing with toys. When he's not playing, he likes to chew on a bone or take a nap. Mater would do best in a home with older kids who will understand how to take things slowly with him as he adjusts to a new home. He is one for adventure, preferring an active family ready to take him for walks or a backyard with a tall fence. If you want to make Mater a part of your family, apply online today!My adoption fee is $250.

Hi! My name is Lady.I’m a black lab mix. We think I am about 3, I am definitely young. I have a lot of pep in my step. I get along well with other dogs of all sizes and love to play. I am a very sweet girl! I have learned how to use a dog door and am working very hard on potty training. I am a good listener and show a willingness to learn. I think I would be a fantastic family pet!I made the long trip here from Texas and can’t wait to finally get settled in my forever home!Lady is HW + but will be treated by the resxue

Please contact Jenny Cope (giveadogahome@live.com) for more information about this pet.MANNY was saved from a high kill shelter in Texas where dogs have just 3 dogs to be saved and transported to the rescue in Sebec, Maine. MANNY is neutered, core vaccines, rabies, de-wormed, monthly preventatives and micro-chipped. He has an estimated date of birth of 21 March 2019 and at the time of rescue in the middle of June 2019, weighed around 8.00 pounds. He is listed as a Australian Cattle Dog Mix. We have no way of knowing the exact breed, it is up to individuals to decide what breed they think is most likely.MANNY was saved with his two siblings, Moe & Jack.MANNY will be arriving at the rescue on Monday, 24th June and we will update when he has been here and settled so we can give a more accurate description of his personality and mannerisms. As time permits, we will take more pictures. You are welcome to complete and submit the adoption application if you are interested in giving him a forever home.WE ARE NOT ABLE TO COMMENT HOW SHE WILL BE AROUND CATS OR LIVESTOCK.MANNY is available for adoption for an adoption fee of US $550.Canadian adopters need to know that customs charge 15% taxes when entering into Canada. This fee is not negotiable and is used to cover the rescue costs of pulling, vetting, health certificate, transport from Texas to Maine, monthly preventatives, supplements, food and anything else that is needed.If you feel that you have the heart and home to give this precious soul a wonderful life, please go to our website, under the APPLICATION tab, complete, then submit the APPLICATION. Our process takes around 2-4 days, and ensuring your references are aware that we will be calling, could speed up the process. Once you have been approved, we discuss any questions in regards to the dog you are wanting to adopt, then you complete and submit the contract, make payment and then we can work out the pick up / transport arrangements.Please do NOT submit an application if you are not looking to take home a new best friend within the next few weeks.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.orgALL Dogs are LOCATED AT THE RESCUE IN SEBEC, MAINE. We post in various states along the east coast and Canada where we have had lots of successful adoptions to enable more exposure for these beautiful saved souls. Families will need to be prepared to travel to the rescue to meet and take home their new best friend. Sebec is located just outside the towns of Dover-Foxcroft and Milo (approx 8 miles) and approx 45 miles from Bangor. There are also lots of hotels, motels, pet friendly accommodations and wonderful camp-sites for the more adventurous families and what a great way to get to know your new best friend. If there are options to arrange transport, we will work with you to make it happen.Give a Dog a Home, German Shepherd Dog Rescue187 Downs Road, Sebec, Maine, 04481giveadogahome@live.comAll pets adopted will be spay/neutered, micro-chipped, de-wormed,heartworm tested, rabies and relevant vaccinations.NO DOG WILL BE ADOPTED TO BE AN OUTSIDE DOG!If you would like to start the adoption our process is below:Submit Application with two personal references and a vet reference.If you have never had pets and do not have a vet, we will need THREE personal references.Ensure references are people who know you and your lifestyle well.Applicant MUST inform vet and references that someone from GaDaH will be calling.As long as we are able to contact your vet and references, it takes just 1-3 days to process and hopefully approve applications.If you rent we will need an approval letter for the breed of dog you are wanting to adopt from your landlord on official letterhead paper or email.Rescue processes and hopefully approves applications.Once approved, rescue invites applicant to come to the rescue to meet your chosen dog/s, spend time with him/herand then hopefully take him/her home.We do NOT hold dogs so if you are unable to come within a week or so of submitting your application the dog will still be available for adoption to other families.For Canadian adopters, all that is needed to get them across the border into Canada is a current rabies certificate and proof of adoption, which is the adoption contract. Both of which are included in the medical file you will get when you adopt. (https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/pet-travel/by-country/pettravel-canada)Ensure ALL Fields are filled in, if something is relevant, then put n/a or something in so it recognizes an entry.We do not recommend using a phone or ipad since these applications for some reason don't tend to come through and you will have spent a lot of time on the application for nothing as it will need to be re-done.Once we have you approved we can schedule an appointment for you to come to meethim/her at the rescue in Sebec, Mane and then hopefully take them home to start your new life.I just have to work on an appointment basis as I run a boarding/day care business and the rescue and so am really busy, but by planning ahead of time I can be pretty flexible.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.org/adoption-application.htmlSubmit Application with two personal references and a vet reference.If you have never had pets and do not have a vet, we will need THREE personal references.Ensure references are people who know you and your lifestyle well.Applicant MUST inform vet and references that someone from GaDaH will be calling.As long as we are able to contact your vet and references, it takes just 1-3 days to process and hopefully approve applications.If you rent we will need an approval letter for the breed of dog you are wanting to adopt from your landlord on official letterhead paper or email.Rescue processes and hopefully approves applications.Once approved, rescue invites applicant to come to the rescue to meet your chosen dog/s, spend time with him/herand then hopefully take him/her home.We do NOT hold dogs so if you are unable to come within a week or so of submitting your application the dog will still be available for adoption to other families.For Canadian adopters, all that is needed to get them across the border into Canada is a current rabies certificate and proof of adoption, which is the adoption contract. Both of which are included in the medical file you will get when you adopt. (https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/pet-travel/by-country/pettravel-canada)Ensure ALL Fields are filled in, if something is relevant, then put n/a or something in so it recognizes an entry.We do not recommend using a phone or ipad since these applications for some reason don't tend to come through and you will have spent a lot of time on the application for nothing as it will need to be re-done.Once we have you approved we can schedule an appointment for you to come to meethim/her at the rescue in Sebec, Mane and then hopefully take them home to start your new life.I just have to work on an appointment basis as I run a boarding/day care business and the rescue and so am really busy, but by planning ahead of time I can be pretty flexible.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.org/adoption-application.html

There are also lots of hotels, motels, pet friendly accommodations and wonderful camp-sites for the more adventurous families and what a great way to get to know your new best friend. If there are options to arrange transport, we will work with you to make it happen.Give a Dog a Home, German Shepherd Dog Rescue187 Downs Road, Sebec, Maine, 04481giveadogahome@live.comAll pets adopted will be spay/neutered, micro-chipped, de-wormed,heartworm tested, rabies and relevant vaccinations.NO DOG WILL BE ADOPTED TO BE AN OUTSIDE DOG!If you would like to start the adoption our process is below:Submit Application with two personal references and a vet reference.If you have never had pets and do not have a vet, we will need THREE personal references.Ensure references are people who know you and your lifestyle well.Applicant MUST inform vet and references that someone from GaDaH will be calling.As long as we are able to contact your vet and references, it takes just 1-3 days to process and hopefully approve applications.If you rent we will need an approval letter for the breed of dog you are wanting to adopt from your landlord on official letterhead paper or email.Rescue processes and hopefully approves applications.Once approved, rescue invites applicant to come to the rescue to meet your chosen dog/s, spend time with him/herand then hopefully take him/her home.We do NOT hold dogs so if you are unable to come within a week or so of submitting your application the dog will still be available for adoption to other families.For Canadian adopters, all that is needed to get them across the border into Canada is a current rabies certificate and proof of adoption, which is the adoption contract. Both of which are included in the medical file you will get when you adopt. (https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/pet-travel/by-country/pettravel-canada)Ensure ALL Fields are filled in, if something is relevant, then put n/a or something in so it recognizes an entry.We do not recommend using a phone or ipad since these applications for some reason don't tend to come through and you will have spent a lot of time on the application for nothing as it will need to be re-done.Once we have you approved we can schedule an appointment for you to come to meethim/her at the rescue in Sebec, Mane and then hopefully take them home to start your new life.I just have to work on an appointment basis as I run a boarding/day care business and the rescue and so am really busy, but by planning ahead of time I can be pretty flexible.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.org/adoption-application.htmlSubmit Application with two personal references and a vet reference.If you have never had pets and do not have a vet, we will need THREE personal references.Ensure references are people who know you and your lifestyle well.Applicant MUST inform vet and references that someone from GaDaH will be calling.As long as we are able to contact your vet and references, it takes just 1-3 days to process and hopefully approve applications.If you rent we will need an approval letter for the breed of dog you are wanting to adopt from your landlord on official letterhead paper or email.Rescue processes and hopefully approves applications.Once approved, rescue invites applicant to come to the rescue to meet your chosen dog/s, spend time with him/herand then hopefully take him/her home.We do NOT hold dogs so if you are unable to come within a week or so of submitting your application the dog will still be available for adoption to other families.For Canadian adopters, all that is needed to get them across the border into Canada is a current rabies certificate and proof of adoption, which is the adoption contract. Both of which are included in the medical file you will get when you adopt. (https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/pet-travel/by-country/pettravel-canada)Ensure ALL Fields are filled in, if something is relevant, then put n/a or something in so it recognizes an entry.We do not recommend using a phone or ipad since these applications for some reason don't tend to come through and you will have spent a lot of time on the application for nothing as it will need to be re-done.Once we have you approved we can schedule an appointment for you to come to meethim/her at the rescue in Sebec, Mane and then hopefully take them home to start your new life.I just have to work on an appointment basis as I run a boarding/day care business and the rescue and so am really busy, but by planning ahead of time I can be pretty flexible.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.org/adoption-application.html

You are welcome to complete and submit the adoption application if you are interested in giving him a forever home.WE ARE NOT ABLE TO COMMENT HOW SHE WILL BE AROUND CATS OR LIVESTOCK.JACK-4 is available for adoption for an adoption fee of US $550.Canadian adopters need to know that customs charge 15% taxes when entering into Canada. Our process takes around 2-4 days, and ensuring your references are aware that we will be calling, could speed up the process. Once you have been approved, we discuss any questions in regards to the dog you are wanting to adopt, then you complete and submit the contract, make payment and then we can work out the pick up / transport arrangements.Please do NOT submit an application if you are not looking to take home a new best friend within the next few weeks.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.orgALL Dogs are LOCATED AT THE RESCUE IN SEBEC, MAINE. This fee is not negotiable and is used to cover the rescue costs of pulling, vetting, health certificate, transport from Texas to Maine, monthly preventatives, supplements, food and anything else that is needed.If you feel that you have the heart and home to give this precious soul a wonderful life, please go to our website, under the APPLICATION tab, complete, then submit the APPLICATION. Our process takes around 2-4 days, and ensuring your references are aware that we will be calling, could speed up the process. Once you have been approved, we discuss any questions in regards to the dog you are wanting to adopt, then you complete and submit the contract, make payment and then we can work out the pick up / transport arrangements.Please do NOT submit an application if you are not looking to take home a new best friend within the next few weeks.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.orgALL Dogs are LOCATED AT THE RESCUE IN SEBEC, MAINE. We post in various states along the east coast and Canada where we have had lots of successful adoptions to enable more exposure for these beautiful saved souls. Families will need to be prepared to travel to the rescue to meet and take home their new best friend. Sebec is located just outside the towns of Dover-Foxcroft and Milo (approx 8 miles) and approx 45 miles from Bangor. There are also lots of hotels, motels, pet friendly accommodations and wonderful camp-sites for the more adventurous families and what a great way to get to know your new best friend. If there are options to arrange transport, we will work with you to make it happen.Give a Dog a Home, German Shepherd Dog Rescue187 Downs Road, Sebec, Maine, 04481giveadogahome@live.comAll pets adopted will be spay/neutered, micro-chipped, de-wormed,heartworm tested, rabies and relevant vaccinations.NO DOG WILL BE ADOPTED TO BE AN OUTSIDE DOG!If you would like to start the adoption our process is below:Submit Application with two personal references and a vet reference.If you have never had pets and do not have a vet, we will need THREE personal references.Ensure references are people who know you and your lifestyle well.Applicant MUST inform vet and references that someone from GaDaH will be calling.As long as we are able to contact your vet and references, it takes just 1-3 days to process and hopefully approve applications.If you rent we will need an approval letter for the breed of dog you are wanting to adopt from your landlord on official letterhead paper or email.Rescue processes and hopefully approves applications.Once approved, rescue invites applicant to come to the rescue to meet your chosen dog/s, spend time with him/herand then hopefully take him/her home.We do NOT hold dogs so if you are unable to come within a week or so of submitting your application the dog will still be available for adoption to other families.For Canadian adopters, all that is needed to get them across the border into Canada is a current rabies certificate and proof of adoption, which is the adoption contract. Both of which are included in the medical file you will get when you adopt. (https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/pet-travel/by-country/pettravel-canada)Ensure ALL Fields are filled in, if something is relevant, then put n/a or something in so it recognizes an entry.We do not recommend using a phone or ipad since these applications for some reason don't tend to come through and you will have spent a lot of time on the application for nothing as it will need to be re-done.Once we have you approved we can schedule an appointment for you to come to meethim/her at the rescue in Sebec, Mane and then hopefully take them home to start your new life.I just have to work on an appointment basis as I run a boarding/day care business and the rescue and so am really busy, but by planning ahead of time I can be pretty flexible.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.org/adoption-application.htmlSubmit Application with two personal references and a vet reference.If you have never had pets and do not have a vet, we will need THREE personal references.Ensure references are people who know you and your lifestyle well.Applicant MUST inform vet and references that someone from GaDaH will be calling.As long as we are able to contact your vet and references, it takes just 1-3 days to process and hopefully approve applications.If you rent we will need an approval letter for the breed of dog you are wanting to adopt from your landlord on official letterhead paper or email.Rescue processes and hopefully approves applications.Once approved, rescue invites applicant to come to the rescue to meet your chosen dog/s, spend time with him/herand then hopefully take him/her home.We do NOT hold dogs so if you are unable to come within a week or so of submitting your application the dog will still be available for adoption to other families.For Canadian adopters, all that is needed to get them across the border into Canada is a current rabies certificate and proof of adoption, which is the adoption contract. Both of which are included in the medical file you will get when you adopt. (https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/pet-travel/by-country/pettravel-canada)Ensure ALL Fields are filled in, if something is relevant, then put n/a or something in so it recognizes an entry.We do not recommend using a phone or ipad since these applications for some reason don't tend to come through and you will have spent a lot of time on the application for nothing as it will need to be re-done.Once we have you approved we can schedule an appointment for you to come to meethim/her at the rescue in Sebec, Mane and then hopefully take them home to start your new life.I just have to work on an appointment basis as I run a boarding/day care business and the rescue and so am really busy, but by planning ahead of time I can be pretty flexible.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.org/adoption-application.html

This fee is not negotiable and is used to cover the rescue costs of pulling, vetting, health certificate, transport from Texas to Maine, monthly preventatives, supplements, food and anything else that is needed.If you feel that you have the heart and home to give this precious soul a wonderful life, please go to our website, under the APPLICATION tab, complete, then submit the APPLICATION. (https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/pet-travel/by-country/pettravel-canada)Ensure ALL Fields are filled in, if something is relevant, then put n/a or something in so it recognizes an entry.We do not recommend using a phone or ipad since these applications for some reason don't tend to come through and you will have spent a lot of time on the application for nothing as it will need to be re-done.Once we have you approved we can schedule an appointment for you to come to meethim/her at the rescue in Sebec, Mane and then hopefully take them home to start your new life.I just have to work on an appointment basis as I run a boarding/day care business and the rescue and so am really busy, but by planning ahead of time I can be pretty flexible.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.org/adoption-application.htmlSubmit Application with two personal references and a vet reference.If you have never had pets and do not have a vet, we will need THREE personal references.Ensure references are people who know you and your lifestyle well.Applicant MUST inform vet and references that someone from GaDaH will be calling.As long as we are able to contact your vet and references, it takes just 1-3 days to process and hopefully approve applications.If you rent we will need an approval letter for the breed of dog you are wanting to adopt from your landlord on official letterhead paper or email.Rescue processes and hopefully approves applications.Once approved, rescue invites applicant to come to the rescue to meet your chosen dog/s, spend time with him/herand then hopefully take him/her home.We do NOT hold dogs so if you are unable to come within a week or so of submitting your application the dog will still be available for adoption to other families.For Canadian adopters, all that is needed to get them across the border into Canada is a current rabies certificate and proof of adoption, which is the adoption contract. Both of which are included in the medical file you will get when you adopt. (https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/pet-travel/by-country/pettravel-canada)Ensure ALL Fields are filled in, if something is relevant, then put n/a or something in so it recognizes an entry.We do not recommend using a phone or ipad since these applications for some reason don't tend to come through and you will have spent a lot of time on the application for nothing as it will need to be re-done.Once we have you approved we can schedule an appointment for you to come to meethim/her at the rescue in Sebec, Mane and then hopefully take them home to start your new life.I just have to work on an appointment basis as I run a boarding/day care business and the rescue and so am really busy, but by planning ahead of time I can be pretty flexible.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.org/adoption-application.html

Please contact Jenny Cope (giveadogahome@live.com) for more information about this pet.COLT was saved from a high kill shelter in Texas where dogs have just 3 dogs to be saved and transported to the rescue in Sebec, Maine. COLT is neutered, core vaccines, rabies, de-wormed, monthly preventatives and micro-chipped. He has an estimated date of birth of 4 February 2019 and at the time of rescue in the middle of June 2019, weighed around 20.00 pounds. He is listed as a Pit Bull / Retriever Mix. We have no way of knowing the exact breed, it is up to individuals to decide what breed they think is most likely.He was saved with his sister CLARA.COLT will be arriving at the rescue on Monday, 24th June and we will update when he has been here and settled so we can give a more accurate description of his personality and mannerisms. As time permits, we will take more pictures. You are welcome to complete and submit the adoption application if you are interested in giving him a forever home.WE ARE NOT ABLE TO COMMENT HOW SHE WILL BE AROUND CATS OR LIVESTOCK.COLT is available for adoption for an adoption fee of US $550.Canadian adopters need to know that customs charge 15% taxes when entering into Canada. This fee is not negotiable and is used to cover the rescue costs of pulling, vetting, health certificate, transport from Texas to Maine, monthly preventatives, supplements, food and anything else that is needed.If you feel that you have the heart and home to give this precious soul a wonderful life, please go to our website, under the APPLICATION tab, complete, then submit the APPLICATION. Our process takes around 2-4 days, and ensuring your references are aware that we will be calling, could speed up the process. Once you have been approved, we discuss any questions in regards to the dog you are wanting to adopt, then you complete and submit the contract, make payment and then we can work out the pick up / transport arrangements.Please do NOT submit an application if you are not looking to take home a new best friend within the next few weeks.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.orgALL Dogs are LOCATED AT THE RESCUE IN SEBEC, MAINE. We post in various states along the east coast and Canada where we have had lots of successful adoptions to enable more exposure for these beautiful saved souls. Families will need to be prepared to travel to the rescue to meet and take home their new best friend. Sebec is located just outside the towns of Dover-Foxcroft and Milo (approx 8 miles) and approx 45 miles from Bangor. There are also lots of hotels, motels, pet friendly accommodations and wonderful camp-sites for the more adventurous families and what a great way to get to know your new best friend. Once you have been approved, we discuss any questions in regards to the dog you are wanting to adopt, then you complete and submit the contract, make payment and then we can work out the pick up / transport arrangements.Please do NOT submit an application if you are not looking to take home a new best friend within the next few weeks.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.orgALL Dogs are LOCATED AT THE RESCUE IN SEBEC, MAINE. We post in various states along the east coast and Canada where we have had lots of successful adoptions to enable more exposure for these beautiful saved souls. Families will need to be prepared to travel to the rescue to meet and take home their new best friend. Sebec is located just outside the towns of Dover-Foxcroft and Milo (approx 8 miles) and approx 45 miles from Bangor. There are also lots of hotels, motels, pet friendly accommodations and wonderful camp-sites for the more adventurous families and what a great way to get to know your new best friend. If there are options to arrange transport, we will work with you to make it happen.Give a Dog a Home, German Shepherd Dog Rescue187 Downs Road, Sebec, Maine, 04481giveadogahome@live.comAll pets adopted will be spay/neutered, micro-chipped, de-wormed,heartworm tested, rabies and relevant vaccinations.NO DOG WILL BE ADOPTED TO BE AN OUTSIDE DOG!If you would like to start the adoption our process is below:Submit Application with two personal references and a vet reference.If you have never had pets and do not have a vet, we will need THREE personal references.Ensure references are people who know you and your lifestyle well.Applicant MUST inform vet and references that someone from GaDaH will be calling.As long as we are able to contact your vet and references, it takes just 1-3 days to process and hopefully approve applications.If you rent we will need an approval letter for the breed of dog you are wanting to adopt from your landlord on official letterhead paper or email.Rescue processes and hopefully approves applications.Once approved, rescue invites applicant to come to the rescue to meet your chosen dog/s, spend time with him/herand then hopefully take him/her home.We do NOT hold dogs so if you are unable to come within a week or so of submitting your application the dog will still be available for adoption to other families.For Canadian adopters, all that is needed to get them across the border into Canada is a current rabies certificate and proof of adoption, which is the adoption contract. Both of which are included in the medical file you will get when you adopt. (https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/pet-travel/by-country/pettravel-canada)Ensure ALL Fields are filled in, if something is relevant, then put n/a or something in so it recognizes an entry.We do not recommend using a phone or ipad since these applications for some reason don't tend to come through and you will have spent a lot of time on the application for nothing as it will need to be re-done.Once we have you approved we can schedule an appointment for you to come to meethim/her at the rescue in Sebec, Mane and then hopefully take them home to start your new life.I just have to work on an appointment basis as I run a boarding/day care business and the rescue and so am really busy, but by planning ahead of time I can be pretty flexible.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.org/adoption-application.htmlSubmit Application with two personal references and a vet reference.If you have never had pets and do not have a vet, we will need THREE personal references.Ensure references are people who know you and your lifestyle well.Applicant MUST inform vet and references that someone from GaDaH will be calling.As long as we are able to contact your vet and references, it takes just 1-3 days to process and hopefully approve applications.If you rent we will need an approval letter for the breed of dog you are wanting to adopt from your landlord on official letterhead paper or email.Rescue processes and hopefully approves applications.Once approved, rescue invites applicant to come to the rescue to meet your chosen dog/s, spend time with him/herand then hopefully take him/her home.We do NOT hold dogs so if you are unable to come within a week or so of submitting your application the dog will still be available for adoption to other families.For Canadian adopters, all that is needed to get them across the border into Canada is a current rabies certificate and proof of adoption, which is the adoption contract. Both of which are included in the medical file you will get when you adopt. (https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/pet-travel/by-country/pettravel-canada)Ensure ALL Fields are filled in, if something is relevant, then put n/a or something in so it recognizes an entry.We do not recommend using a phone or ipad since these applications for some reason don't tend to come through and you will have spent a lot of time on the application for nothing as it will need to be re-done.Once we have you approved we can schedule an appointment for you to come to meethim/her at the rescue in Sebec, Mane and then hopefully take them home to start your new life.I just have to work on an appointment basis as I run a boarding/day care business and the rescue and so am really busy, but by planning ahead of time I can be pretty flexible.http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.org/adoption-application.html

We have no way of knowing the exact breed, it is up to individuals to decide what breed they think is most likely.BRIAN will be arriving at the rescue on Monday, 24th June and we will update when he has been here and settled so we can give a more accurate description of his personality and mannerisms. As time permits, we will take more pictures. You are welcome to complete and submit the adoption application if you are interested in giving him a forever home.WE ARE NOT ABLE TO COMMENT HOW SHE WILL BE AROUND CATS OR LIVESTOCK.BRIAN is available for adoption for an adoption fee of US $550.Canadian adopters need to know that customs charge 15% taxes when entering into Canada. This fee is not negotiable and is used to cover the rescue costs of pulling, vetting, health certificate, transport from Texas to Maine, monthly preventatives, supplements, food and anything else that is needed.If you feel that you have the heart and home to give this precious soul a wonderful life, please go to our website, under the APPLICATION tab, complete, then submit the APPLICATION. Our process takes around 2-4 days, and ensuring your references are aware that we will be calling, could speed up the process.
