Duke was rescued from euthanasia in a Texas shelter. Duke's foster mom describes him as \"100% GSD\" in his traits--he loves to work, he's extremely intelligent, and he's very affectionate with his people. Duke is in foster care with other dogs. He has a friendly, yet aloof personality. His foster mom says this about him: \"He is super sweet. He likes to cuddle on his terms, but when he is ready he will lay right next to you on the couch. He knows the commands \"sit\" and \"easy\" (when I give him a treat, that means to take it gently).\" He LOVES toys and playing fetch...he has very high ball drive. Duke absolutely needs a stash of plush toys in his forever home--he loves to carry them in his mouth, and they are like a security blanket for him. Duke is house and crate trained. Duke's new family MUST have experience with the German Shepherd breed. Duke will be available for adoption in June.Apply to adopt DUKE the GSD DAVIS LONESTAR at www.EHRDOGS.org!

Bandit is a very sweet 6 month old puppy who was saved from  a high killer shelter in Texas. Bandit is lovely, fun, loving and playful. He loves people, other dog and children. Bandit walks well on a leash, crates well and has a ton of personality. If you are interested in meeting Bandit please email brendasnmeadows@yahoo.com for an application.

Beauty is a friendly, playful dog who gets along with other dogs and children. Beauty's best doggie friend is Brad Lonestar! Beauty was rescued from euthanasia in a south Texas shelter. She will do best in a home with another dog and a fenced yard.Update from foster mom: Beauty is a sweet affectionate dog. She makes a wonderful companion. She plays well with other dogs but is just as happy lounging around. She is housebroken and crate trained.Apply to adopt BEAUTY LONESTAR at www.EHRDOGS.org!

Alice is a friendly, playful dog who gets along well with other dogs. She is good with children. Alice was rescued from euthanasia at a south Texas shelter. Alice will probably do best in a home with another dog and a fenced yard. Apply to adopt ALICE LONESTAR at www.EHRDOGS.org!
Lady and her puppies were rescued from a Texas shelter. Lady is a precious dog. She gets along well with other dogs. More info coming soon!Apply to adopt LADY DAVIS LONESTAR at www.EHRDOGS.org!

Patsy Cline was rescued from life on the streets in Texas. Patsy instantly blended with her foster family and gets along great with all dogs. Patsy particularly loves puppies! Patsy Cline lives with cats, but has become a bit too interested in chasing them. A home without cats will be best. Patsy Cline is house trained and uses a pet door. She loves attention and is a quiet, easy going, beautiful young lady. Patsy will blossom with the love and attention of her very own family in a forever home! Patsy will probably do best with another canine in the home and a fenced yard.Apply to adopte PATSY CLINE DAVIS LONESTAR at WWW.EHRDOGS.ORG!

Cynder was rescued from euthanasia at a crowded Texas shelter, along with her puppy Cynder's Dakota. Cynder gets along great with other dogs! She's very playful and goes belly up in submission to other dogs. She enjoys meeting new people too, and she often rolls over for belly rubs. Cynder is working on leash manners in her foster home. She is crate trained and seems to be house trained. Cynder has lots of puppy energy and will do great in an active family. She enjoys being able to run at the dog park, and she would do great in a home with a fenced yard. Cynder is a fun, happy dog who will make some human VERY happy! Apply to adopt CYNDER LONESTAR at www.EHRDOGS.org!

Blue is NOT with 11th Hour Rescue but they are helping his owner with the rehoming process. If you are interested in Blue, please contact Lisa by email at lfountain6929@gmail.com - although Blue is currently located in Texas, transport to the NJ/NY area can be arranged for the right adopter.From Blue's \"mom\": I'd like you to meet my boy Blue, a 45 lb. neutered male Lab mix who is about 6-7 years old. He is a country dog rescued off the streets of Deep East Texas.In the home, Blue is a dream. He has never had an accident, never chewed any furniture or walls, never got into the trash and he will sit quietly while someone eats. He is incredibly loyal and loving with lots of tail wags and kisses. He loves to run in the woods and will return when called. He is a very smart dog and he knows how to Sit and Stay. He walks well on a lead. He cannot tolerate cats. He's never been around young children so that is an unknown. He is scared of loud noises, like fireworks or thunder, and will hide under my bed until the noise is gone.I live in Nacogdoches, Texas, which is a small town and I have a farm in Hemphill, Texas, that he loves. A new job requires that I move to Manhattan and I do not believe Blue will acclimate to a noisy, busy, unpredictable environment. That is why I am looking for a good home for him.Blue has anxiety from living on the streets and from whatever abuse he suffered in prior homes. He is not an angry dog - he is a fearful dog. As a result, he is defensive around strangers. I am continuing to work on his training in this regard. Recently a nurse unexpectedly walked into my mother's room and I had to restrain Blue by his collar. He nipped her leg which, while a small puncture wound, constitutes the first time he actually bit someone. She did not seek or need medical treatment.I put him in an strange environment where I knew he would be anxious - so it is my fault. If Blue was on his lead I do not believe this incident would have occurred but I took it off so he could lie next to me on the floor. Blue has never bitten anyone in the four years he has been me. I entertain in my home, walk him on a lead around town and he behaves well.Blue is a very good boy. His owner needs to be his leader and friend. He needs someone who understands a rescue with anxiety and will continue the training I began when he appeared on my porch. The best environment for Blue is probably being the only dog in the household.Please help me find a safe place for Blue to live. This sweet country boy would not do well in a city environment so I am hoping that someone with a suitable situation will open their heart & their home to him. As stated above, Blue is currently located in Texas but transport can be arranged elsewhere if someone is willing to adopt him. Thank you for your consideration.

Violet Beauregarde Lonestar was saved from a Texas shelter with minutes to spare! She has a bunch of energy so would benefit from an active owner. Violet is good with similar sized dogs but prefers if the other pooch knows some manners! She does great in the car and is an excellent walker, even likes to go running.Although this beautiful girl is sweet and cuddly, she can tend to get over excited at times - so, we are suggesting no children. She needs an owner who will provide her with rules and has some dog experience. If you would like to meet this pretty girl, fill out a canine application and don’t forget to mention VIOLET BEAUREGARDE LONESTAR!!

Marmie came from a rescue in Houston TX where there are an abundance of Chihuahuas. Wanting to give Marmie a better chance at finding her forever home, they turned her over to CRT.Marmie was born 10/1/17 so she is 1 yr 6 most old. She weighs 12 lbs. She is a special needs Chi.Marmie has microophthalmia of her left eye (eye is smaller and under developed). An Ophthalmologist in TX believes that Marmie can see out of this eye but her eyes also do not align so Marmie acts like she is always off balance.If she gets anxious, she will circle. When you pick her up, you need to immediately place her front end on your right shoulder or else she will fight you and become upset. She loves to play and she does go outside. She gets along great with the other dogs at her foster home but doesn’t seem to interact with them.She is spayed, UTD on shots and on HW preventative.She is a little special and a wonderful, loving little girl that is looking for a family of her own.Her adoption donation is $250.00If you are interested in the above dog, please do not email us and tell us that you are interested, but submit an adoption application.  The link for the application is below.To submit an application go here......chihuahua-rescue.com/adoption-application/An application must be submitted and approved before a meet-n-greet can be scheduled.Your current dogs/cats must be spayed or neutered unless a veterinarian has determined that your current pet(s) should not be fixed due to medical reasons.  They must also be up-to-date on shots and on HW preventative.Reference checks and a home visit are required so SE dogs can only be adopted in NC/SC, VA MD and GA.

Perfect is a 1 1/2 year old German Shepherd Mix. He is up to date on shots and neutered. He is located in Houston Texas. He has a wonderful temperament, loves everyone he meets. His adoption fee is $200. Contact us for application to meet him

Heath is a sweet, sensitive 1 year-old, stray German Shepherd-mix boy, who ran out of time and was on death row, through no fault of his own, at animal control. He has a wonderful temperament. Please contact us for an adoption application, if you would like to meet him. Adoption fee is $200.He is currently located in Houston, Texas, but happy and willing to relocate!

Melle is a Rat Terrier. She is 9 yrs old and weighs 8.4 lbs. She came from a rescue down in Texas.She was an owner surrender and is house trained, if you let her out enough and watch to make sure that she goes. If you don’t watch her, she will sit by the door. She is not good with cats. She is very attentive and sits on command. She is always close by but never under foot.Melle accepts dogs of all size as long as they understand that she ranks above them. She is an enthusiastic eater, avid insect hunter and skilled crumb catcher. She barks at neighbor dogs, the doorbell and when guest come in but she doesn’t bark just to be barking.She is UTD on shots, on HW preventative, spayed and she’s had a dental. She’s a pretty cool little dog!!!Her adoption donation is $250.00If you are interested in the above dog, please do not email us and tell us that you are interested, but submit an adoption application.  The link for the application is below.To submit an application go here......chihuahua-rescue.com/adoption-application/An application must be submitted and approved before a meet-n-greet can be scheduled.Your current dogs/cats must be spayed or neutered unless a veterinarian has determined that your current pet(s) should not be fixed due to medical reasons.  They must also be up-to-date on shots and on HW preventative.Reference checks and a home visit are required so SE dogs can only be adopted in NC/SC, VA MD and GA.

Chip is a Male Jack Russell Terrier mix who came to us from a Texas kill shelter  He is heartworm positive and had treatment for three months. Treatment is completed and another test  given to give Chip a cleared bill of health.  Then a monthly heartworm preventative can be given.Adoption fee is $150 +tax with an approved application. Medical work is completed including spay/neuter shots worming flea treatment kennel cough rabies shot micro chip and vet exam Adoption application is available on the website www.prairiepawsrescue.com and go to ADOPT link to download the application fill it out and submit  to make sure he is clear.All medical work is completed prior to adoption including neutering shots worming flea treatment kennel cough rabies shot micro chip heartworm re-check and vet exam.

Jedi is a very sweet, very shy, little boy we rescued from the euthanasia list from ACS San Antonio. He had little chance because of his fear in the shelter setting. HE wasn't our typical senior or hospice rescue but because he had zero interest, and was at serious risk, we just couldn't see this little guy not have another chance of a good life.He is a small mix, probably beagle/pug or something along those lines. Perfect lap dog. His age is estimated between 5 and 6. He is very healthy, fully vetted, heart worm negative, and the perfect house pet. Ideal home for him is a calm, quiet older single or couple owners. He is very shy until he gets to know you. Zero aggression. Does fine with other low key dogs. Jedi is located in San Antonio Texas with the only foster and home he's known for the last couple years. He can be transported anywhere in the US, for an approved adopter, at cost to the adopter. Ideally we can find his forever home in San Antonio or a nearby location.This one would be absolutely perfect for a mature person or couple looking for devoted love.Interested applicants can email us about him.

**Courtesy Post**Gracie in Granbury, Texas:Gracie is a Jack Russell Terrier who is 9 years old.  She's spayed and has all her shots.  Very loving and sweet.  She would be a good dog for someone who is home a lot as she doesn't like to be alone for very long.  Unfortunately, I can no longer keep her.  Can you help me?  I love my dog and can't imagine her going to someone who doesn't understand JTR's.  Rehoming fee is $100.  She's super cute!  If you are interested in adopting this precious girl, contact: aprilpomeroy@gmail.com  Gracie is located in Granbury, Texas which is about an hour from Ft. Worth.  Russell Rescue, Inc. is not responsible and/or liable for the outcome of any adoption made through this listing as we are only providing information. RRI is also not responsible and is held harmless for the accuracy and reliability of the information provided within this listing. Owners and adopters bear the full responsibility and liability for any dog listed.

Bella is an energetic girl looking for an active home. She will a loyal forever companion to which ever sweet soul that adopts her. Bella came up from a high kill shelter in Texas as she was set to be euthanized, we wanted to give this special girl  second chance. She is dog friendly but shouldn't be around cats, she thinks they are toys.

PUPDATE:  Guinness met 2 well behaved kids today about 4-5 years old and was extremely scared of them.  We feel he would do best in a home without kids or much older, calmer children.Guinness is a transfer from Fort Worth, Texas.  Guinness is a quiet guy that loves affection but is also a bit unsure about new things.  He overcomes quickly and could really use a patient new home to show him the world is full of fun!  Pupdate - Guinness met the trainer today and scored high points on the gentle, calm, well-behaved dog section!  He is not a foodie, so right now it isn't a huge motivator to him, but there have been lots of changes lately which may explain the lack of interest.  He is underweight, and when the trainer mixed in some yummy canned food with his kibble, he happily ate it all.  Notice in his photos that he stands with a front paw raise?  That is a behavior that conveys submission, and definitely shows he wants no trouble.   He did well for his temperament testing and was disinterested in the shelter cats and the rabbit in the office.  He gently approached a stranger and allowed petting, and he has displayed nice quiet manners in his kennel.  He may not have had any basic training yet, but he has lovely indoor manners and waited until he was outside to potty.  Guinness met a family with young kids, and quite, frankly, he was afraid of them.  He went and hid and tried to stay away from wherever they were. No kitties in his new house, please. He is way too focused on making them run.Guinness's adoption fee is $200.00 and includes neuter, current vaccines, microchip, free vet visit, 30 days of pet health insurance, and engraved ID tag. WE DO NOT SHIP DOGS.

Rogue came to us from an overcrowded Texas shelter.  She is about 1.5 years old and she is super friendly to all and very playful and affectionate.  She is great with other dogs, she was kind of afraid of the office cat, and she knows her basic cues.  Shes a big girl, and she does pull on the leash, and she does jump up, but its because she is so friendly and loves affection.  She did great for her temperament testing and does not guard her food although she is an eager eater!Pupdate - Rogue was adopted, but returned through no fault of her own (except maybe her size with a young pup) and we learned she was great in the house and was reliably housetrained.  She was great with the pup, just too playful size-wise.  Rogue's adoption fee is $200 and includes spay, current vaccines, microchip, free vet visit, 30 days free pet health insurance, and custom engraved ID tag.

Little tiny Xena.... She was rescued by BTN from a very high kill shelter in Texas.  An awful place... She was VERY pregnant.  BTN was on their way to get her and she ended up delivering her babies at the shelter.  A supporter of BTN snatched Xena and her babies right up and fostered them until we could arrive to bring her back to PA for fostering.  Xena is a complete joy.  Grateful for everything she has been given.. Loves kids.  Has not been cat tested yet.  She is a bit guarding around other dogs but she has her 6 babies and is protective of them - understandable.  Completely fine with people around the babies though.  Her foster mom says she is a dream and is extremely sweet.  Xena has a bit of energy as you can see in her video.  Their larger baby gate had broken and this was what Xena thought of the temporary replacement.  For more info please email suew@boxertransfer.org

sweet, funny, and loving female terrierKiki is a sweet, funny, and loving female terrier. Since she loves to play, jump, skip and run, she’d be great in the dog agility training. She’s approximately 3 years old, 18 pounds, fully vetted and microchipped. She loves going on walks and loves everyone – adults, kids, other dogs (hasn’t been around cats but probably would be fine due to her sweet personality). She loves to roll in the grass and skips as she goes on walks. She’ll make a wonderful addition to a family, couple or single individual. She was saved from a Texas animal control facility by 501(c)3 Russell Rescue Tennessee and is enjoying her foster home in Nashville. But she is looking forward to being adopted into a loving forever home. For more info and to schedule a time to meet Kiki in Nashville, please email melissarescuesdogs@gmail.com.Please complete our application at:http://www.russellrescuetn.com/application-for-adoption/

\"Demi-God of The Sea, at your service!\" Percy has been commanding the seas and is ready to move on to something a little more rewarding, like winning over your heart.Percy arrived at SVASC as stray and according to his microchip, he's here all the way from Texas! Not only is he great with water, but he can hot a mean barbecue. He's got some serious travel under his belt at only a year old! Percy is very devoted; he'll be by your side through thick and thin. His hobbies include lounging by the pool, playing with his buddies, and giving the worlds best kisses.If you've got other dogs Percy would love to meet them! He loves making new friends and is very loyal to his pals. He is also good with older kids. He's got lots of energy and might accidentally knock someone very young over while he's got the zoomies. Percy hasn't met any cats here at the shelter yet, so contact an adoption counselor if you've got kitties at home. This sweet boy is waiting for you at SVASC. Percy's adoption fee is $35 to an approved adopter. For more information on Percy, please give us a call at (540) 943-5142. If you'd like to meet him, feel free to stop by during open hours. We're located at 1001 Mt. Torrey Rd., Lyndhurst, VA

Profile: Sassy is a 3-4 year old spayed female 45 lb Plott hound mix who is just a love and does well with all people and other dogs. She is crate trained, sleeping in her crate at night and during the day when needed. She is active but not bouncing off the walls with energy, loves to play ball and gives good eye contact. She will be arriving from Seattle on Thursday June 27 and we will share more information as we get to know her.Adoption Info:Adoption fee is $500, which includes spay/neuter, current core vaccinations - Rabies, DAPPV, Bordetella, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: This dog was rescued from euthanasia at a high-kill shelter in Texas and joined us from our Saving our Strays rescue partner. This dog will be available for adoption in Seattle once evaluated.

Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly via bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt. Dogs will be transported from Texas upon approved match.Our adoption fee includes age appropriate vaccinations, deworming, microchipping and transport expenses.Puppies need someone with the time, energy and patience for house-training and basic obedience. Puppies under 6 months of age are adopted out on a spay/neuter contract. The adopter is responsible for the expense of alteration and must provide records to BDRP that their adopted pet has been altered. We recommend alteration at 6 months of age. Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses. Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly with bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt.Dogs will be transported from Texas upon approved match.Elton – 2-3 year old male, (fully vetted HW negative) Elton is an active guy who loves playing with his tennis and soccer balls. He is a bit of a vocal little dude, but is a cuddle bug with humans.Elton will need a dog savvy owner, as he can be a bit territorial of his kennel/space from passing dogs. Elton currently has a best bud named Allie, but he does not do well with male dogs. He would do well as an only dog or with a friendly female large dog. Our adoption fee include alteration, current vaccinations, heartworm testing, microchipping and transport expenses. Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses. Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

Animal Profile:Ethan is an 4-month-old male Great Pyrenees Doberman mix (current weight 35 lbs) with a great temperament! Mom was a Great Pyrenees, dad was a Doberman, and the \"oopsy\" litter was dropped at a high-kill shelter in Texas. These dogs will be large (we estimate over 90 lbs) when full grown and already show their wonderful breed traits -- they are intelligent, confident, well-balanced and in tune with humans.Please note we will be looking for a home with a secure fenced yard for these puppies given the Pyrenees breed traits.We will continue to add more information about Ethan so stay tuned!* Neuter included with adoptionAdoption Info: Adoption fee is $500, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: This dog was rescued from euthanasia at a high-kill shelter in Texas and joined us from Saving Our Strays rescue partner. This dog will be available for adoption in Seattle once evaluated.

Profile: Georgie is an adorable 5 month old Shepherd Pitty mix who joined us from Texas 6/28. He is a happy, wiggly boy who plays well with other dogs. We will continue to add more to his profile once he arrives and we can get to know him!Adoption Info:Adoption fee is $500, which includes spay/neuter, current core vaccinations - Rabies, DAPPV, Bordetella, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. You provide the love and structure, and we take care of everything else! We cover all vet care, and drive the adoption process. Average length of foster is 2-3 weeks. Fosters do get first consideration for adoption, if desired.Apply to foster online at www.doggoneseattle.org/foster-application

Meet Chimichanga, a stunning tricolor American Bully. He is just under 2 years old, 40lbs and was born completely blind.Chimi's story is a sad one. He was born to a backyard breeder with a birth defect that left him blind. He could not be sold due to this defect and was given away to a family member. After barely a year, his owner died while his wife was pregnant, so Chimi was given away again. He was passed through several homes, until he finally found his way into rescue.Their loss is our gain. This dog is absolutely incredible! He has been with a foster decompressing for the last few weeks and is set to get neutered tomorrow. He is a very easy boy and would make a great companion to the right home.He's a total dream dog! Chimi is leash trained and friendly with both dogs and cats. He has been a breeze to train and now knows his name and basic commands. He does well in a crate, is completely housebroken and potty trained. He is a little tank, but walks very well on leash with minimal pulling.Chimi is also extremely food motivated, responds well to correction and is eager to please when a smelly treat is passed in front of his nose. He is learning to take treats gently and is easily corrected verbally when he’s eating too fast, but is not mouthy at all.We would love to get him into a home experienced with blind dogs, or one that would learn how to properly care for him and keep up with his training. As a blind dog, Chimi relies heavily on his other senses of sound and smell to figure things out, but is very aware of his surroundings once he settles in. Don't let his disability deter you- Chimi is a total gem!Adopting from A Chance To Bloom:We are a rescue based in Houston, Texas that is currently expanding adoptions into other states. We encourage you to take a look into our rescue on Facebook! Our adopters become part of our Bloomer Family, and we would love to get to know you and receive updates on your Bloomer!Check out A Chance To Bloom on Facebook!https://www.facebook.com/achancetobloomrescueSound great? To be considered for adoption, please fill out an adoption application at the link below!www.achancetobloom.org/application.html

This sweet little nugget is Toby, a 6 month old dachshund/terrier mix.  Toby is one of those little dogs who will steal your heart.  He has little floppy ears that only half perk up and it just makes him cuter than he already is.  Toby is a gentle soul and loves to be in your lap being loved on.  Toby also enjoys a great squeaky toy to play with when he explores the yard.  He loves to explore and can be quite inquisitive.Toby was rescued from a Texas shelter and is looking for an adoptive family in the Pacific Northwest. Our $400 adoption fee includes all core vaccinations (DHPP, rabies, spay/neuter, microchip, health certificate, and transport to the Pacific Northwest on our next transport).  If you are interested in beginning the adoption screening, you can find our adoption application at www.projectoutbound.org (as well as a complete listing of all the dogs available for adoption).  Please email the completed application to projectoutbound18@gmail.com (and indicate which pup you are interested in by providing their name in the subject line).Please be advised that our dogs are adopted to their forever families prior to being transported in most cases (some dogs are transported to our foster families space permitting). Unfortunately at this time, we cannot bring dogs for a typical meet and greet situation due to the extensiveness of the transport distance and it being unfair for the dogs who are not adopted to have to make the trip back. Currently, we have a transport scheduled for July 7th departing Texas and arriving in the Pacific Northwest by July 11th. It will be the adoptive family's responsibility to meet our transport team to pick up your new family member. If interested in learning more about our adoptable dogs, please email us at projectoutbound18@gmail.com.Due to the number of requests that we receive on our puppies and dogs, please be advised that all adoption applications are processed in the order received. Once we send you an application, your place in line does not get reserved until your application is returned to us.

This is Honey.Honey is a older (estimated to be 8- 10 years old) dapple doxie/chi mix girl. She is good with all people (but being an older gal, she would prefer that kids not hang on her or pick at her ears and tail etc), dogs, and cats. She is a very healthy and happy girl, but can be shy at first. The chi in her makes her fiercely loyal and she definitely attaches to 1 or 2 people and prefers them over anyone else. She won’t deny herself pets and scritches from others though!She is vaccinated, spayed, and microchipped. House broken and doggy door trained. She DOES NOT like being in a crate due to her history with them. {She and her brother were found abandoned in a home, inside a crate where they had been for god only knows how long}Honey’s adoption fee is $175, which includes her vaccinations, spay, and microchip. We are located in Houston, TX, but do transport to approved adopters in WA for an additional fee. If you are interested in adding Honey to your family, you can find our adoption application here https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScTouH1tnoNnaBVOjm4r2-fjzowN2hFGcHBkfHPOjpvRh7JJQ/viewform and follow up with us at PETronusRescue@hotmail.com

Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly with bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt.Dogs will be transported from Texas upon approved match.Grover Good with: large, female dogsNot good with: kids and catsThis boy had a rough start and has come a long way with the help of BDRP volunteers! Grover was spotted abandoned by the side of the road chained to his dog house. He sat there for days before good Samaritans were finally able to get him to safety!Grover is a sweet boy who can be a little shy at first but loves people and just really wants to be loved and to be in a home. He plays well with female dogs, but is selective with male dogs. Grover would benefit from the nurturing of his adopter to gain confidence with his new environment, other dog friends and walking on a leash. This dog so desperately deserves a home to call his own after all he has endured!Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses. Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly with bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt.Dogs will be transported from Texas upon approved match.Age: 3-5 years oldWeight: 73 lbsEnergy: low-mediumGood with: other large dogsNot good with: small children, small dogs/animalsMeet Mya! This sweet hound mix lady is a real love bug with people and big dogs. Mya is a fun-loving adult girl who is ready to start the search for her perfect forever home!She was found abandoned on a country road. Some kind dog lovers took her in but she was a little too rough with their chihuahua and their chickens. Mya would do well with kids over the age of 8 in her home. Mya has requested that her perfect home include lots of belly rubs!Our adoption fee includes age appropriate vaccinations, deworming, microchipping and transport expenses.Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses. Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly with bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt.Hi! My name is Murphy and I'm a 52 pound Catahoula mix. I was picked up as a stray with neck and ear wounds in the panhandle of Texas, but after a few stitches, I'm good as new and as adorable as ever! My hobbies include taking all my plush toys out of the basket, putting all my toys on my foster moms bed, and generally anything else that has to do with plush toys. I'm really good with them though, and there hasn't been any stuffing incidents yet!The nice vet told me I'm still a baby, and am definitely under 2 years old. I'm almost 100% potty trained, and have only had a few accidents right before bed. I'm practicing my crate skills everyday, it's still a little scary, so I whine for a few minutes, but then my foster mom says I settle right down.As much as I love my foster brother, he is VERY tolerant of my puppy antics, so any potential siblings I have should be dog-savvy and just as tolerant of my lack of personal space. As for potential human siblings, I would do best around older children who I can't knock over easily (and who won't steal my plush toys). I haven't met any cats yet. My brother and I eat at the same time and I always finish first, but I know not to try and steal his food and just wait to play with him until he's done eating.Loud noises are still scary since I grew up in the sleepy town of Amarillo, but I'm getting used to the big city noises and am braver each day.I love going for long walks, but I also love snuggling with any warm body. The couch is my new favorite place, and I sleep soundly through the night on my foster mom's bed.Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses. Dogs will be transported from Texas upon approved match.Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly with bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt.Our adoption fee includes age appropriate vaccinations, deworming, microchipping and transport expenses.Bernie is about 5 years old and weighs 90 lbs. He is up to date on vaccines, heart worm negative, is neutered and aside from skin allergies is a happy, healthy boy. Very people friendly. He is  generally well behaved and calm. Does well on leash and okay in a crate. House and potty trained. Will do some typical Pyr barking. Can be pretty rambunctious when he's happy to see you so no small children recommended. He can be dog selective and does not do well with other large males. He likes and is playful with most female dogs. Doesn't care much for rain and is not fond of mud at all. He is food aggressive and needs to be fed separately. Puppies need someone with the time, energy and patience for house-training and basic obedience. Puppies under 6 months of age are adopted out on a spay/neuter contract. The adopter is responsible for the expense of alteration and must provide records to BDRP that their adopted pet has been altered. We recommend alteration at 6 months of age. Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses. Dogs will be transported from Texas upon approved match.Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

This is Jax.Jax came to us after being put on “the list” at one of our local mandatory intake shelters that is constantly overcrowded. He is estimated to be about 4 years old, currently weighs 65 lbs, and is quite tall for his breed. He must be mixed with a dog that is traditionally taller than a staffy  for sure!Jax does well on a leash and accepts redirection like a champ, he is good with all people and dogs, with a proper introduction or course and a bit of redirection if he gets over excited. Sometimes he gets so excited about meeting a new friend that he barks and sounds mean, but he’s not! He can be a little shy and weary with new dogs at first, but lord knows what his life was before he came into our rescue, so who could blame him for being cautious?! Jax is super cuddly and loving; he loves nothing more than to be near his human. He does have storm anxiety but we can guide you on making him comfortable and keeping him safe during storms. I hear WA doesn’t have thunderstorms like we do down here in TX, so that may be a perfect fit for him! ;)We are located in Houston, TX, but transport to WA to Approved adopters for an additional transport fee. Jax’s adoption fee is $175, which includes his vaccinations, neuter, and a microchip.If you are interested in adding this handsome hunk to your family, you can complete our adoption application here https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScTouH1tnoNnaBVOjm4r2-fjzowN2hFGcHBkfHPOjpvRh7JJQ/viewform and follow up with us at PETronusRescue@hotmail.com

Profile: Rudy is a 10-week-old Texas Brown Dog (we think he will be medium sized, approximately 40 lbs, when fill grown) weighing 8-10 lbs. He just arrived from Texas and is settling into his foster home. He is doing great with crate and potty training, and is very sweet, affectionate and eager to learn! Stay tuned for updates.Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $500, which includes spay/neuter, current core vaccinations - Rabies, DAPPV, Bordetella, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: This dog was rescued from euthanasia at a high-kill shelter in Texas and joined us from Saving Our Strays rescue partner. This dog will be available for adoption in Seattle once evaluated.About Foster to Adopt Program:Fosters provide a safe landing spot for dogs transitioning from the shelter environment and help prepare the dogs for adoption. You provide the love and structure, and we take care of everything else! We cover all vet care, and drive the adoption process. Average length of foster is 2-3 weeks. Fosters do get first consideration for adoption, if desired.Apply to foster online at www.doggoneseattle.org/foster-application

Boo is an American Bulldog/pit mix who was dumped in a rural area in Houston.   He was rescued from the streets hungry and he had heartworms.  He completed treatment for heartworms and is ready for a new forever home!If you are looking for a super affectionate boy, look no further!   He is so sweet and friendly to everyone!    He even wants to cuddle with everyone he meets!      He will be a loyal companion to his new family/owner!    He plays well with other dogs!  He walks well on the leash and is crate trained.   He does all his business outside!Boo is 2 years old and weighs 65 lbs.   He is neutered, micro-chipped and up to date on vaccines.    He is located in Houston, TX and would come to his new home on professional transport.    For an app, please email rhondabarron@earthlink.net

Hi! My name is Tess! Please read my bio below!Weight and Age: I am a whopping 48 pounds and am approximately 1.5 years old.Background: I was pulled from euthanasia from a small shelter in Sealy, TX. A rescue volunteer had gone out there to help out and met her and fell in love. She was so sweet and friendly she couldn't help but try her best to help. Luckily the rescue had a spot in boarding available and I went and quickly became a favorite of the employees. I made a bunch of doggy friends and loved to run and play with them! I was put on a list to go into the next available foster home where I now have made my foster mom's home my home. I love her dogs and it's always nice when I'm done playing to take a break and cuddle with mom for a bit!Medical Status: I am  now spayed, micro-chipped, up to date on shots,  and current on heartworm and flea preventatives. I have no other health issues and am heart worm negative. YAY!Activity level: I am moderately active since I'm still young and love to play with my friends (human and dog alike)!  Potty Training/Crate Training: I am both thanks to my foster mom! I never have an accident in my kennel and as long as my foster mom keeps an eye on me I haven't had an accident in the house either.Other Animals: Loves any and all!Special Needs: NoneDog Park friendly:  May get used to it but have not been tested at one!Good off leash: Yes if in a safe placeLocation: Houston, TX but I'm available for out of state adoptions!If you have any questions please email my foster mom at nicole.whar94@yahoo.com

Meet Ginger.Ginger was adopted from a local high kill shelter and returned because she is not good with small dogs and they had a small dog. NO small dogs or cats for this girl, however, she gets along great with male and female dogs her size with proper introductions.Ginger is working on her leash and house manners, and loves to play outside with older kids and doggy friends! She can be a bit too much for small kids. She loves people, and will cuddle up on the couch after an afternoon of playing in the yard or hiking.Her adoption fee is $175, which includes her vaccinations, spay surgery, and microchip. We are located in Houston, TX, but she can also be transported to an approved adopter in WA for an additional  transport fee of $175.If you would like to add Ginger to your family, you can fill out our adoption application here https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScTouH1tnoNnaBVOjm4r2-fjzowN2hFGcHBkfHPOjpvRh7JJQ/viewform and follow up by sending us an email at PETronusRescue@hotmail.com

Animal Profile: Noel is a beautiful 2-year-old, 35 lb spayed female \"Texas Muttley\" (listed on vet records as a Basenji mix) who joined us from Texas. She is such a sweet girl and gets along well with people and dogs. She is smart, eager to please and a quick study. She hasn't had any accidents in the house, does well in the crate and has already learned to come when called. Keep reading to see what her foster has to say about her.Seattle Foster Update: Noel is doing great! She loves to play with our resident female dog. She sleeps in a crate at night without whining, and eats/drinks regularly. She is not destructive as long as she has a bone or toy to chew on. She's very good on leash and doesn't pull. She will do really well in a house with other pets or children. She does need obedience training as she doesn't know basic commands. She loves to play but also has an off (cuddle) setting. We are loving having her!Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $500, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: This dog was rescued from euthanasia at a high-kill shelter in Texas and joined us through our rescue partner, 3 Little Pitties. This dog will be available for adoption in Seattle once evaluated.

We will continue to update her profile once she arrives.Seattle Foster Update: Lulu is doing great after just one day! She is curious and exploring on her leash. She is friendly with new people and wants to nuzzle and get pets. Has met the resident mastiff and after an initial 10 minutes or so is great with him. Has also met the resident cat with noissue at all. Lulu has had zero accidents in the house, slept well in her crate all night, and is a gem in the car. She did great with her bath this morning, and she LOVES being brushed. I mean on her back belly up, legs in the air and eyes closed! Such a cutie. This sweetie is a complete cuddle muffin. Looking forward to getting to know her more!Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $500, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly with bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt. Dogs will be transported from Texas upon approved match.Personal Ad: Single Male Seeking Forever Family ? My name is Bluebell. (and yes I’m just a sweet as the ice cream). I’m a 8 year old neutered, gentle giant. I am up to date on all vaccines and tested HW negative in September. I need a bath, annnnnnnnnd I’m a little camera shy but I am so willing to love and be loved. Through no fault of my own I’ve found myself needing a new home. My current owner loves me dearly but isn’t in a situation where he can care for me much longer. I seem to be super gentle and have not shown any signs of aggression toward people or animals. I weigh probably around 80 lbs but I might could stand to lose a few pounds ... who doesn’t like a stocked feeder right??  Just gives you more to love ?I’ve been inside from time to time but have spent most of my life in the backyard. I’m sure I could get the hang of a doggy door if a sweet family wanted me inside more often. I’m a little timid right now but will warm up for the right family. Even if you don’t have room for me could you pleeeeeease share my photos in case someone you know is looking for a big ole handsome fella like me ? ? Our adoption fee include alteration, current vaccinations, heartworm testing, microchipping and transport expenses. Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses. Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly with bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt.Cooper is fostered in Texas and will be transported from Texas once he has a committed adopter.Name: CooperWeight: 80 LbsAge: 4-5 y/oGender: MaleBreed: Walker HoundColor: White with Brown and Black spotsHello world! My name is Cooper and my human friends say that I am one of the goodest boys ever! I was running free for a long time until some nice people said that I deserve to be loved and cared for. They got me vetted, took super good care of me, and taught me how to be a good human companion! Now I'm ready to find my forever family where I can go on adventures like hiking and camping and stuff.I need a good, strong fence and no access to the backyard when none of my humans are home. I'm a hound so sometimes I get excited by a smell and might want to go on a solo adventure. My human friends said that is a bad idea, so I need someone who can help me stay safe at my house!Even though I really love meeting human puppies, my friends think that maybe I should only have humans older than 10 years old in my home because sometimes I don't know my own size and strength!Here's some more stuff about me that my humans wanted to tell you!Good with adults: LOVES EVERYONEGood with kids: LOVES KIDS just very big and strong and could knock a small child downGood with other dogs: LOVES DOGSGood with cats: He has been good with the cats in the current foster homeHouse trained: yesCrate trained: yes, but crate might need to be reinforcedEnergy level: High energy, very strong, needs exercise and activity, but can also chill and lay around with proper exerciseBarker: noFlight risk: We think that Cooper has run free for most of his life before coming to rescue. He can easily clear a 6ft fence even with an old femur fracture!Food reactivity: none observedWalks on leash: yes, but very strong and will need someone that has strength and can handle him on a leash, children would not be recommend to walk Cooper.MEDICAL INFO: •Up to date on all vaccinations • completed Heartworm treatment Feb 18, 2019•Neutered•microchippedCooper has an old injury to his leg. He is very active but the repetitive motion of long runs may aggravate his old injury.Our adoption fee includes age appropriate vaccinations, deworming, microchipping and transport expenses. Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses.Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

Likes the water (our kiddie pool), moderate to high energy (plays and runs with the dogs but very calm in the kennel), and is potty trained. Animal Profile:Eden is an almost 4-month-old female Great Pyrenees Doberman mix (current weight 35 lbs) with a great temperament! Mom was a Great Pyrenees, dad was a Doberman, and her \"oopsy\" litter was dropped off at a high-kill shelter in Texas. These dogs will be large (we estimate 100 lbs) when full grown and already show their wonderful breed traits -- they are intelligent, confident, well-balanced and in tune with humans. We will not be considering apartment dwellers for these (to be) extra large dogs, especially since Pyrenees do not tend to do well in apartment settings. We will continue to add more information about her so stay tuned!Foster Update: Eden is a great dog - very loving and super sweet. She is good with all people and incredibly patient with our toddler as well. She has improved greatly with her leash walking (still a little nervous with bikes) but we just keep moving and she's able to enjoy the walks! We are working on having her sit and be calm and wait before eating, though she still acts like every time is the first time she's ever eaten! Still you can take her food (or toy or bone) away without a problem. Her crate training is coming along -- she will whine a bit at first but then settles down; she is great sleeping through the night. Eden loves to be right by your side and wants all the hugs and pets she can get. She would do well with a family with kids to love on her and I'm sure she'd love another dog to run and play with as well, as she really got on with our foster dog who has since been adopted. We are still working on chewing and potty training -- even with all the bones, toys and exercise she still finds stuff to chew on. This is puppy behavior and she should outgrow it, but something to be aware of. Also, she's almost potty training but will still require ongoing diligence and potty breaks every 2-3 hours to prevent accidents.Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $500, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.* Spay included with adoptionApply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: This dog was rescued from euthanasia at a high-kill shelter in Texas and joined us from Saving Our Strays rescue partner. This dog will be available for adoption in Seattle once evaluated.

Tabari is a 2 year old lab cross who just adores being with people.  As you can see, he loves going on excursions to the pet stores and exploring all that life has to offer.  Tabari would make a great dog for hiking and exploring the mountains of the Pacific Northwest.  Tabari is very loving and sweet and would make a great family dog.  He enjoys being outdoors either playing in the yard or off exploring nature.  Tabari would be great with a family with older kids (above 7) as he can get excited and unknowingly knock little ones down.  Tabari adores people and kids, as well as other dogs.Tabari was rescued from a Texas shelter and is looking for an adoptive family in the Pacific Northwest. Our $400 adoption fee includes all core vaccinations (DHPP, rabies, spay/neuter, microchip, health certificate, and transport to the Pacific Northwest on our next transport).  If you are interested in beginning the adoption screening, you can find our adoption application at www.projectoutbound.org (as well as a complete listing of all the dogs available for adoption).  Please email the completed application to projectoutbound18@gmail.com (and indicate which pup you are interested in by providing their name in the subject line).Please be advised that our dogs are adopted to their forever families prior to being transported in most cases (some dogs are transported to our foster families space permitting). Unfortunately at this time, we cannot bring dogs for a typical meet and greet situation due to the extensiveness of the transport distance and it being unfair for the dogs who are not adopted to have to make the trip back. Currently, we have a transport scheduled for June 2nd departing Texas and arriving in the Pacific Northwest by June 7th. It will be the adoptive family's responsibility to meet our transport team to pick up your new family member. If interested in learning more about our adoptable dogs, please email us at projectoutbound18@gmail.com.Due to the number of requests that we receive on our puppies and dogs, please be advised that all adoption applications are processed in the order received. Once we send you an application, your place in line does not get reserved until your application is returned to us.

Remy is a tall and lanky weimaraner mix.  He was rescued by my daughter from Harris county Animal Control in June of 2017.  He was a hairless mangy puppy.  I rehabilitated him and did some basic training.  My daughter did not take him as planned. Remy is a little over 2 years old, weighs 52 pounds and is neutered, chipped and current on all vaccines and is on heartworm preventative. He loves people and kids and ignores dogs but has trouble with dogs that are very hypper. He lives with my golden and coolie. Remy walks better on leash than my obedience trained golden. Remy is also very food motivated. He is a very handsome dog and I believe that he is easily adopted. He likes to be inside and does well on a crate. Remy is located in Houston but transportation can be arrange. The transport fee is $160 on top of his rehoming fee. If interested in Remy please email Curtis at curtj.ranch@sbcglobal.net

Please meet Libby!Libby is a gorgeous 6 year old brown American Bulldog mix with beautiful white markings. She is very sweet, calm and well mannered. She is crate trained, potty trained, housebroken, she takes treats gently and is great on leash. She is a lady when taking a bath although she is not too fond of them, she tolerates them really well. She is very laid back and enjoys naps but also loves being outside and going on walks. She is good with other dogs and kids but she likes to chase cats so a home with no cats will be preferred. She makes the cutest half sigh/half snore sound that makes her foster smile every single time. Everest is a handsome 2-year-old Husky/Border Collie mix who was rescued from a high-kill shelter in Houston. He is now in a Seattle area foster home waiting for his forever family!Everest is highly intelligent, bored easily, hasveryhigh exercise demands, and has a strong need for a pack companion. When Everest is well exercised he is delightful and so lovable. He is trusting, snugly, sweet, easy to train, eager to please, and all around a beautiful dog. He is fully house-trained and has no desire to escape - he will quietly stay in the backyard when needed.Everest has a lot of youthful energy and needs a highly active lifestyle - he is a dream of a running partner! He thrives with frequent running of at least 5 miles every other day, and/or play with other high energy dogs. While he lives very well with other dogs (he is fostered with two mediums-sized dogs), he is fussy when seeing/meeting unknown dogs. With more time and exposure, this behavior will subside. Without proper exercise, he will act out via undesirable behaviors such as mouthiness and jumping. He is best suited for a home that will have the time and resources to dedicate to his lifestyle and training needs!Adoption Fee: $595 - Includes spay/neuter, DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordetella, Deworm, heart worm test, grooming, microchip, boarding, health certificate transport cost from Texas to Seattle, and any other unforeseen costs/treatment. This adoption fee not only contributes to this dog's rescue and care, but of hundreds of other high-risk dogs every year.If you are interested in Everest, please email info@gingerspetrescue.org

Luna is affectionate, quiet and trustworthy in the home, her favorite hangout being her dog bed. Luna is a wonderful girl who will adapt well to a variety of home situations, as long she feels secure and loved. Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly with bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt. Dogs will be transported from Texas upon approved match.Buddy is about 2 years old and is a total sweet boy. He is a typical happy-go-lucky lab who has done well with the other dogs in his foster home. It takes him a little time to get over his shyness and then he is happy as a clam!He met a cat at the vet office and had no problems. Buddy has not met many kids at this time!When Buddy went in for his neuter, his pre-op blood work showed that he is in kidney failure. This was obviously unexpected news, particularly given the fact that he is such a young boy. He has since started on Benazepril, which will promote healthy kidney function, and a kibble recommended for dogs with kidney issues. Benazepril is an inexpensive medication - our vet has quoted us $8 per month. While we are currently working on a plan for his future care, it is impossible to say what to expect long-term. Some dogs do not live a full life, and others do. Buddy will need to have his blood work monitored once or twice a year and at some point could need subcutaneous fluids to flush his kidneys. As long as he is eating and drinking well, with normal activity, he is considered to be stable for a dog with his condition.Currently, Buddy is doing really well. He does consume a lot of water which is actually a good thing, per our vet. Drinking plenty of water will help him stay hydrated and keep his kidneys flushed. Because he drinks more than the average dog, he needs more frequent potty breaks but other than that, he is a normal pup. His appetite is great, he is a happy guy and he really enjoys playing with the other dogs in his foster home.Our adoption fee include alteration, current vaccinations, heartworm testing, microchipping and transport expenses. Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses. Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

Animal Profile: Nellie is a 2-year-old Chihuahua/Min pin/Xoloitzcuintle (we're guessing) mix who is a very sweet and loving little dog! She was a street dog in Texas who was picked up by the city, starving and hairless. She was diagnosed with demodex mange due to poor nutrition and lack of care. Nellie has been treated and is slowly getting her hair back (although we think she may have some hairless breed in her!) thanks to good nutrition and lots of TLC. She is dog friendly, cat friendly and kid friendly. Nellie LOVES her people, and wants nothing more than to cuddle up in your lap and shower you with kisses. She is playful with other dogs -- she likes to play chase! Once she is worn out, she grabs her favorite toy, curls up on the couch, and gently chews on her toy until bedtime. Nellie is food motivated, walks well on leash, and does well in her crate ... she fusses for a few minutes, then settles down and can sleep in her crate at night. Nellie would love a home where she can either have a canine companion to play with, or be able to have frequent play and social time. A fenced in yard is a plus! Nellie does well around kids, but would do best with older children who she can shower with kisses and affection. More info to come as she continues to settle in.Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $500, which includes spay/neuter, current core vaccinations - Rabies, DAPPV, Bordetella, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. Stare deep into those baby blues, and tell us it's not love at first sight!Baby Jade is an absolutely stunning American Staffordshire Terrier puppy that had a rough start to life in the streets of Houston, Texas. Baby Jade is currently in Houston, Texas and available for transport through our rescue partners. This little girl has been in foster care for about 3 months and has  trained quickly. She is smart, learns quickly and has grown to become confident dog with a playful nature. She has learned to walk on a leash, crate train and house train quickly. She is very food motivated and will require a home that will work with her on basic obedience and gives her guidance. Baby Jade can be a little stubborn and her favorite activities include stealing peaches off the trees and searching for pecans in the grass. She can be a little stubborn at times and tends to run off and explore on her own, while the other dogs play. She plays in a group daily with other dogs, both male and female, ranging from young pups to adults, and does great with all of them. She loves to wrestle and roughhouse, if the other dog will allow. When another dog sets boundaries with Baby Jade by barking, growling or correcting her with a bite to the neck, she will back down and go into puppy mode by running away. Baby Jade is dog friendly and great with kids.She is about 50lbs now and still growing. She recently had a growth spurt and is in that awkward puppy stage where she has skinny body and long, lanky legs. Baby Jade will be a large dog when fully grown, from 80-90lbs, and has an incredibly sweet temperament. She is medium to high activity, and would be an amazing companion for runs, hikes or just a nice casual stroll around the park.Baby Jade is at an age where she needs guidance and would thrive in an environment with another assertive and more confident dog. She does well with dominant female dogs and takes correction well, however may persist in roughhousing until her human steps in to correct her as she is all about playing. This girl is a tomboy and lives for mud puddles and water- don't let her good looks fool you into thinking she is a girly girl! She is also extremely vocal and \"sings\" when she is hungry, displeased or bored, so be prepared to always have someone talking to you and letting you know how she feels! Baby Jade has a high prey drive towards rodents, such as squirrels, rats and possum outdoors. We have not tested Baby Jade with cats, but she is very calm and submissive. She could likely be trained to accept cats, with strict reinforcement.Background: Baby Jade had a rough start to life in the streets of Houston, Texas. She was found with a broken tail and infected, butchered ears from an amateur crop job at only 6 months old. She came to us as a stray, found by a Good Samaritan who saved her life after seeing a man beat and kick her on the street for approaching his dog while on a walk. He said she was vicious and tried to throw her into oncoming traffic. Vetting: Baby Jade has received the standard DHLPP vaccine, rabies vaccine and Bordatella vaccine. She is spayed, microchipped and heartworm negative. We recommend that all rescue dogs coming from Texas remain on heartworm preventative for 6 months after arriving in Washington, as a precaution.Adopting from A Chance To Bloom:We are a rescue based in Houston, Texas that is currently expanding adoptions into other states. We encourage you to take a look into our rescue on Facebook! Our adopters become part of our Bloomer Family, and we would love to get to know you and receive updates on your Bloomer!Check out A Chance To Bloom on Facebook!https://www.facebook.com/achancetobloomrescueSound great? To be considered for adoption, please fill out an adoption application at the link below!www.achancetobloom.org/application.html

This beautiful girl found herself at a high kill shelter and like many others she was on the list to be euthanize because of the lack of space. DOB: 8/1/2018. Cattle Dog mix. Diana came to us from a shelter in Texas along with her siblings. They were all adopted and she was held back due to a few medical issues that were being discovered. Turns out, Diana has a bit of a sight problem due to a neurological issue. It is not yet known if the problem is a brain stem or mild hydrocephalus problem at this point. She is growing and developing fine but does have some mental development issues. She is unaware of where her feet are sometimes and doesn't recognize her own size and strength. She can see, but only out of the bottom half of her eyes, so down low. She plays rough like most cattle dogs but also thinks nothing of pouncing with all her weight! She has proven to be harder to housebreak, because of her delayed mental development. She is doing great with dogs that like to rough house but proves to be too much for little dogs. She loves people she knows and loves to snuggle but struggles with new experiences, places and strangers. She is a bit of a special girl and will always need special accommodations for her mental development. A fully fenced yard and possibly another dog that has her play style would be required.Adoption contract and fee applies. All adoptable dogs can be met at adoption events hosted every weekend. For a list of scheduled events go to: https://www.facebook.com/SmidgetRescue/events . Smidget Rescue is not a shelter, and dogs cannot be seen at the Rescue location. All dogs are fostered throughout the Puget Sound area and are brought to the events where they can be met by prospective adopters. Additional pictures of adoptable dogs can be seen at: https://www.facebook.com/SmidgetRescue/photos_stream?tab=photos_albums. All adoptable dogs are spayed or neutered at 6 months of age or older, and always before being placed in their new homes. APPLICATIONS CAN BE OBTAINED BY EMAIL ONLY. Adoption process includes application, meet & greet, home visit and reference check. Email Jamie at smidgetrescue@hotmail.com or click on the CONTACT link on this page. Notice: We do not ship dogs out of state. If you live within a five-hour radius of Seattle, WA, (such as Portland, Vancouver B.C., etc.), we can arrange for a home visit. If your home seems like a great fit for the dog you would like to adopt, you must then drive to meet the dog at one of our weekend events or at the fosters home.

Please meet Mika!!If you like kisses and shaking hands, this is the pup for you! This beautiful girl is one happy and very affectionate pup! She is quiet and always ready to play! She's house/crate trained and attention motivated with lots of energy. She will do best with a very active family that is looking for a jogging/running buddy!Mika also loves to lounge around and sit at your feet while you watch TV and get brushed or petted and will sometimes put her head on your lap just to let you know she's there. She is a complete sweetheart! She's  a heavy chewer, so appropriate chew toys are necessary otherwise she'll turn to her bedding as a chew toy! :)She does well with small children and is not aggressive towards other dogs. Hi my name is Bruce.  My first name was \"Ducky\" because my feet are webbed. I was left at a shelter when my first daddy came to get me. We loved being together. Soon his appointment managers found out I had \"pit\" in my mix. They kicked me out and now I live with my 2nd daddy and family. They love me and i love them. I love to eat rawhide bones with my 2nd daddy holding it for me. That's my favorite time of the day.Only daddy and the girl take me for walks. The mommy is not safe on her feet. I kinda push my way through everything because i just walk and things move. She says \"he just doesn't know his own strength.\"I'm fun, silly, play full and i love friends. I love, love, love the dog park. More friends!! My sister (in the picture) is sassy. She eats from my food bowl with me. I dont mind. I can share.So now I'm waiting for my next home. I will miss my 2nd daddy and family but I know it's for the best. He is sick and she is hurt. They need a small dog not a bull like me.If interested in me please email Mark at grifdent@att.net or Brave Bully Rescue at info@bravebullyrescue.org Note: I am located in Houston, but transport can be arrange. The transport fee is between $160 and $175 on top of the adoption fee.

He knows several commands and is easy to train. He's easy to motivate with food and treats!  He loves playing with toys and would love a fenced yard to romp in. We believe that he would benefit from a home with time, structure, and engagement to help this boy put his best paw forward! He has dominant, protective tendencies and is high energy, and in tense situations he will escalate if left unchecked. He needs a firm hand and good leadership.
