Animal Profile: Benny is an 18-month-old male, 56 lb Staffy mix who was saved in Texas and is now in a foster home in the Seattle area. This boy LOVES his ball! Fetch, play, or just gnawing on his tennis ball are among his favorite activities. And while he loves to jog and hike, he also has an OFF setting and recently has learned the art of snuggling. In his foster home he is proving to be so smart and trainable -- he has already learned sit, down, place, shake, up, as well as house training and crate training! He is great on leash, not reactive to other dogs, and learns new commands quickly. Benny will thrive in a home with a fenced yard and no cats. While he has played well with dogs (in Texas) we think he will do best as the only dog in the home. We can't wait to find this gorgeous boy his forever home!Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $400, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.orgAnimal History: This dog was rescued from euthanasia at a high-kill shelter in Texas and joined us from 3 Little Pitties rescue partner. This dog will be available for adoption in Seattle once evaluated.

My name is Clarissa, and I am super lucky to be alive. I am about 8 years old and my life just hasn't been the best. Many believe I will never find a forever home because of my age, but they are wrong and that soon someone will give me the chance to show them how amazing I am. I was used for breeding and no one ever truly loved me and cared for me. I was picked up by animal control and even though I was on the euthanasia list, ending up at the shelter was the best that has ever happen to me. You see, a great lady saw me and offered to foster me to save my life and show me what is like to be loved and cared for. I was super skinny, but now I gain some pounds :-). I love playing with my foster brother and sister. If you give me a soft bed to curl up on, and a pat on the head I’ll be in heaven! I’m house broken, and spayed. I prefer to be left out while my people are home, but don’t mind spending quiet time sunbathing in the yard. I’m even learning stairs! I have met several kids, and honestly I love getting attention from them. I would be perfect for a family who appreciates a lower energy furry friend. Please consider adding me to your family, I am truly amazing and you will not regret adopting me. Note: she is located in Houston Texas, but transport can be arrange. Transportation will be $160

Skye is a friendly and outgoing one year old Hound-Pointer mix that can't wait to meet you! She came to Homeward all the way from Texas and sure has some stories to tell! Skye would like to be the only pet in the home, she doesn't want to share her people with any other cats or dogs! She loves meeting new people but can be a bit exuberant and will likely do best with teens and adults that are comfortable managing an active dog. She is still working on her manners and will benefit from a dog savvy home that can provide her with daily exercise and training. She is not a fit for apartments or condos due to her energy level and breed. Come fall in love with Skye today!Adoption hours: Wednesday – Sunday, Noon – 6pm. We begin accepting applications at 9am each adoption day, and will help people in the order of their arrival (beginning at Noon). We ask that all household members - including any resident dog(s) -  be here to meet an animal prior to adoption. We are unable to place animals on hold or take deposits for animals. For more information about our adoption process and guidelines, visit www.homewardpet.org.

Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly via bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt. Dogs will be transported from Texas upon approved match.Prince is a 6-month-old leggy dude! He loves to run around the yard with his sister. He would be a great fit for a family or young couple looking for a fun puppy to visit dog parks and hang out at local breweries and restaurants. He is continuing to work on his house training and leash skills. He weighs a bit over 20 pounds. Our adoption fee includes age appropriate vaccinations, deworming, microchipping and transport expenses.Puppies need someone with the time, energy and patience for house-training and basic obedience. Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses. Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly with bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt.“Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi. You’re my only hope.” Are you Princess Leia's Obi-Wan Kenobi? She needs someone to help her enjoy her golden years.Adult, Female, 6-7 years oldActivity level: low-mediumWeight: 76 poundsLooking for a dog but want to skip all the puppy angst? Well Leia is your girl! This mature dog is well behaved but has lots of spunk and would love nothing better than to be with her human in the car, on a hike or jog or in your lap!  Leia has been a long time resident at BDRP and is really looking for a home to call her own. She came to us when her long term owner couldn’t take care of a dog any more. Leia is looking for home where she can play with her toys, get lots of belly rubs or just lay in her fluffy bed (which she loves!). This active, older girl deserves the happiness of her own home after being without for so long. Leia is house trained and good on a leash. She has ignored the cats and small dog she has met at the vet office. Given her size, we would recommend large dog-savvy small dogs and cats.Princess Leia is a favorite with our volunteers! Can you add her to your home?Our adoption fee includes age appropriate vaccinations, deworming, microchipping and transport expenses.Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses. Dogs will be transported from Texas upon approved match.Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly with bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt. Dogs will be transported from Texas upon approved match.Grace is a 1-2 year old lab mix weighing around 40 pounds. She showed up on her foster's property severely underweight. She is very small for a lab and while she has been putting on weight, we don't think she will ever reach 50 pounds. Grace gets along well with other dogs and is moderate to high energy especially when playing. She is crate trained, walks well on a leash, has a very sweet disposition, and likes a lot of attention. We think she would do well with older children. We have no knowledge of how she would be around cats or livestock. She is spayed and fully vetted.Our adoption fee include alteration, current vaccinations, heartworm testing, microchipping and transport expenses. Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses. Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

Clyde is a happy lab mix guy.  He was saved from a high kill shelter in Texas.  He prefers to hang with female doggies.  He is neutered and heartworm negative.  He is approx 5 years old. Adoption fee at the event will be $550 which includes spay/neutered, transport to the north, microchip, shots up to date and rabies certificate

Pippy was found as a stray while living with her mother on the streets of Houston. They were taking shelter under a bush trying to get away from the Texas heat. Foster mom says this:Hi my name is Pippy, I’m a puppy so I have lots of energy and I just want to have fun.  I am very inquisitive and I love my squeaky toys.  I always want my belly rubbed while lying in your lap. I have so many kisses to give you! I’m just learning how to walk on a leash and want to share my love with everyone. I’m good with kids.

My name is Sammy from Texas and I am a wonderful 4 year old Male Pointer and Labrador Mix. I am 60 pounds and so excited to find my forever home soon. I love car rides, will take treats from you and I am a loving and friendly dog. Take me on car rides and doggy parks and I will become your very best friend. I get along great with people of all ages, loves gentle kids and other dogs with proper introduction but I have not been around cats before. I just got saved out of a nerve-wracking stint at a local high kill shelter in Houston, Texas. My personality is blossoming and I am so lucky to embark on a new and exciting adventure finding my own wonderful forever home in Seattle thanks to Ginger's Pet Rescue. My adoption fee of $695. covers my Neuter, DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordetella, Deworm, Heart worm Test, Grooming, Microchip, Boarding Fees, Health Certificate and transport cost from TEXAS to SEATTLE. This adoption fee will also go towards helping many of our rescued dogs who are in desperate need of orthopedic surgery, dental and teeth extractions, hernias, cherry eye removals and boarding fees. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our huge vet bills at Greenwood Vet. This adoption fee is firm as the pet rescue needs to recoup the money they spent in order to save the next dog in need. We are a nonprofit 501 C 3 Organization. Please e-mail for an adoption application.
We are in need of foster homes for dogs.  If you would like to be put on our foster list please email us at:  animalrescuekingdom@gmail.comOur dogs come from Texas and sometimes need temporary homes.

Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly with bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt. Dogs will be transported from Texas upon approved match.Crispin or \"Crispy\" is 1-2 years old and about 80 pounds. He is a big active guy who would be an awesome hiking or running buddy. Crispin absolutely loves playing with the 12-year-old girl in his foster home. We recommend him only for homes with older children though (none younger than 10 years old).This handsome boy is strong and will need a dog-savvy home that can help him learn his manners! He was brought to the shelter as an owner surrender when they could no longer handle his high energy.Our adoption fee include alteration, current vaccinations, heartworm testing, microchipping and transport expenses. Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses. Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly with bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt. Dog is fostered in TX and will be transported to WA once an adopter has committed.Allie is a 5 or 6-year-old chocolate lab mix. She weighs about 45 pounds but is gaining a little weight in her foster home. Allie is a shy girl at first. It has taken her some time to settle in after the hectic shelter and transport to her foster home. She is friendly but a little aloof until she gets to know you. Her foster says that Allie is now starting to give tail wags and \"smiles.\"She has done okay with the other large dogs in her foster home. She understands how to walk on a leash and will be a great leash-walker with some direction from her new family. Allie does not do well with cat in her foster. Allie would be happiest as an only dog or with a calm, friendly other dog in the home.Allie is HW+ and will require treatment. She has begun treatment, and BDRP is committed to helping with her treatment in her foster or in her new home.Our adoption fee includes age appropriate vaccinations, deworming, microchipping and transport expenses.Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses. Dogs will be transported from Texas upon approved match.Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly with bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt. Dogs will be transported from Texas upon approved match.Tennessee is a Beautiful Cream Lab mix.  He weighs about 55 lbs.  He is  1.5 years old. His previous owners had a baby lived in an apartment.  They had to give Tennessee up because the baby couldn’t be around animals. He loves MEN!  He loves to play ball and seems to love being around older children.  His foster's grandson is 12 and he and Tennessee are best buddies!  He gets along with other dogs, but since he’s a very young Lab, he is full of energy.  He could knock you down by accident!  If he does that, he will give you sweet kisses to apologize.  He would love a home where he can go for walks or go fishing with his family.  He needs attention and affection.  He is crate trained and house trained.  He know some of the basic dog commands.  He will sit for treats and hold his paw up to shake hands.  Tennessee would definitely benefit from a family with dog experience and plans to do obedience training with their new dog!Tennessee has never met a cat, so we'd prefer that he go to a home without cats at this time to help him put his best paw forward!Our adoption fee include alteration, current vaccinations, heartworm testing, microchipping and transport expenses. Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses. Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

Please do not inquire or apply through Petfinder. Please apply directly with bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt. Dogs will be transport from TX upon an approved adoption match.Got ball? Like to throw a frisbee? If so, Chance is the dog for you. He can run like the wind, and will jump and fly through the air to make a catch - all day long if he had his way! Chance is a 1.5-year-old, smooth, tri-color, Saluki mix, who is part athlete, part lap dog, and so super sweet. He wants to give everyone he meets a hug.He is crate trained, and potty trained and knows basic obedience commands. He would love a home with a large yard and a tall fence. He needs someone committed to several throw sessions daily. Because of his speed and enthusiasm, children in the home should be 10 years old or older. Chance is more comfortable with and prefers to be around smaller dogs. He loves to chase anything that moves, so no cats. He loves to snuggle up anywhere with you and doesn't think he is too big for your lap. He is a sensitive boy, a free spirit, and he can be rather a goof ball.Chance is most comfortable when crated when left alone. He is still building his confidence with other dogs, so we are looking for a dog-experienced home that continue to work with him.Our adoption fee include alteration, current vaccinations, heartworm testing, microchipping and transport expenses. Adoption fee is $425 to help offset travel and medical expenses. Dogs will be transported from Texas upon approved match.Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

L Bonnie is a mature lady that ended up in rescue. She is 8 years old and has unfortunately lost her family. She does great on a leash, loves to go for rides, loves everyone she meets and is a perfectly house mannered girl. Bonnie has been going to work with me since rescue and we all forget she is there - she just snoozes and hangs out. She has done well with the dogs in rescue she has met. She doesn't always care for smaller dogs so no small dogs please. Because she is a little older I would suggest no small children - she is past babysitting age. She has met a horse, steer and goats with no interest. I do not know about cats. Bonnie really needs a home of her own to finish out her retirement years. Please apply at www.krrtx.org/forms. Please note all dogs are located in San Antonio, TX. We advertise out of state due to the critical pet overpopulation problem here in the south. We use Rescue Road Trips to transport the dogs to your area. They are all up to date and come with a health certificate. The fee is $170 adoption and $185 transportation = $355. Thank you for considering adopting a southern dog.

Hey there!My name is Mahoney, and I'm making a move from Texas to Wisconsin this weekend! I'm told I'll be temporarily crashing in a place called \"Sheboygan\" while I wait for my new family to come and get me. I'm a really nice guy, I promise! I like to try new things, and I love everyone!!! I'll be arriving up to date on my shots, microchipped, and neutered, too. So why don't you head on over to http://www.lastpawrescue.org and fill out an application? I can't wait to meet you!501(c)3 approved WI Agriculture license number 285589-DS

One thing we can tell you about Elvis....his pictures don't do him justice!We can't blame Elvis for being a little anxious yesterday for his \"photo shoot\". Elvis had just made the long trip up from Texas with Lola's Lucky Day rescue and now is in a strange new place. Elvis is a gorgeous 3 year old, 78 lb, Black Labrador mix. We don't know what he's mixed with, but he has a beautiful black coat with a mix of Brindle. Elvis is a friendly, very strong boy. He does not seem to know any commands, so a patient adopter willing to take Elvis to training classes would be a plus for this big boy.Elvis was found abandoned in Texas. He lived with two other large dogs in his foster home and did well with both of them. He is mostly house trained, but still working on it. He has not been around cats. The foster family said he's an active dog who'd love an active family to takes him on long walks.Stop in to meet Elvis this week. You'll see what we mean right away...he's so handsome!The Dodge County Humane Society is open Tuesdays and Thursdays 12-7 pm and Saturdays 12-4 pm. You can contact us at (920) 386-0000 or through our Facebook page to learn more. Adoption fee includes: Microchipping, spay/neuter, distemper vaccination, and rabies vaccination (if age allows). Are you interested in sponsoring this shelter pet?  Your sponsorship will help pay for their stay at the shelter. Contact the shelter for more information.

I may look like a lion now, but I'm actually a very handsome 4 year old, 70 lb Shepherd mix boy!Meet Timon (formerly known as Flash). Timon made his way up from Texas to Wisconsin with Lola's Lucky Day rescue. He and his brother Simba were surrendered to a local Texas shelter as the owner said they did not do well with other dogs and cats. Timon did well at shelter with other dogs, and also met 6 puppies in his foster home. He did well with the puppies, but did correct them for biting at his \"mane\".Timon was severely matted when he arrived at the shelter and needed to be shaved. When Lola's picked him up from the shelter, he had lots of razor burns and bruising. He was very sensitive to the touch. He also, they thought, had eaten something and was having a hard time passing it through his system. But the foster said he's all better now and back to his normal self.Timon's foster family said he is very vocal. He barks at everything and when he wants attention. The foster family said he gets excited very easily. The foster family thought he may do well as an only dog, or in a home with another low key dog that lets Timon be boss. The foster said Timon is not good with cats.The foster family said that with his arrival as being very sensitive, they thought a family with older children may be best.Stop in this week and see for yourself what a handsome, good boy Timon is! As you can see, he does know \"sit\" very well and he would love to show you!The Dodge County Humane Society is open Tuesdays and Thursdays 12-7 pm and Saturdays 12-4 pm. You can contact us at (920) 386-0000 or through our Facebook page to learn more. Adoption fee includes: Microchipping, spay/neuter, distemper vaccination, and rabies vaccination (if age allows). Are you interested in sponsoring this shelter pet?  Your sponsorship will help pay for their stay at the shelter. Contact the shelter for more information.

Attention Large Breed Lovers! We 5 girls are heading our way up from the southernmost part of Texas.  We were found abandoned in the sweltering heat and left to fend for ourselves. The wonderful rescuers that have been helping us have said we are the sweetest bunch of girls you’ll ever meet.  Our breeding is most likely a Pyrenees mix and we all will be 90+ lbs, so if you are looking for petite and dainty, we definitely aren’t for you. We are growing up to be big, beautiful, confident and attentive and would provide you with the most love any human could every want or need.  Our breed belongs to the working class and as the shepherds of sheep we guard our flocks, so we would make a great protector of your home and family. We are gentle, patient and tolerant around children, but you need to work with us and provide us the proper training. Currently we are just 8 weeks old, have a ton of growing to do and are anxious to learn everything! If you are interested we will be arriving in Wisconsin on June 30th and will be fostered in Sparta, WI.  Complete an application at www.lastpawrescue.org and indicate that you are interested in a large breed (Pyr mix) if you want to get on the waiting list for one of these gorgeous girls. All vaccinations are up to date and puppies have been vet checked and microchipped. The adoption fee will be $300 plus a $100 spay deposit which will be refunded once the spay contract has been completed and returned with proof of spay.501 (c)(3) approved WI agriculture license number 285589-DS

Hi, my name is Caroline! I am a Pit Bull/Cattle Dog mix that came up to Wisconsin from Texas. I was born around 4/22/2019 and weigh 8 #. Obedience classes for adult dogs and puppies can be incredibly helpful for both animals and humans. It helps you understand what makes me tick and will give me a better idea of what you want me to do. It’s a win/win and it will also strengthen the bond between us! Apply for me today!My adoption fee is $350.00. Adoption applications can be filled out at CCHS or online through our website, www.cchs-petshelter.org. Applications are not first come, first served. All applications will be reviewed by the adoption committee and the home chosen will be the one considered to be the best match. All dogs and puppies have been vaccinated for Distemper and Bordetella, dewormed and microchipped. If old enough, they will be vaccinated for Rabies and blood tested for Heartworm, Lymes, Anaplasmosis and Erlichiosis. Dogs and puppies will be spayed or neutered before adoption.CCHS is proud to be a No-Kill Humane Society. As a private, non-profit charity, our work depends on donations and volunteers to keep going. We are committed to helping the animals that enter our doors and finding each the best possible forever home. CCHS has been inspected and licensed by the Department of Animal Health - DATCP. Our license is #268235-DS

Sneak Peek:Helllllo Wisconsin! I’m Lilo and I am bringing my gorgeous smile all the way up from Texas on June 30th! I am a very, VERY good girl who gets along great with kiddos and other dogs! I am two years old and a perfect medium size at 40 pounds. I am spayed, microchipped, fully vetted and up to date on all of my vaccines! All I need now is a home and a family to call my own??? Could that be you?! Please apply to meet me at www.lastpawrescue.org and give me a chance to steal your heart. ?? My adoption fee is $250 and I will be fostered in Eau Claire, WI. Everyone please welcome Sam! ?This big, handsome boy made a long trip up from Texas and is ready to leave his past behind him. Sam found himself in an over crowded shelter, pretty beat up, and in rough shape. Yet his spirit remained strong! Our friends at Pet Tribe met him, saw his potential to be an amazing companion, and gave him a chance at life!Now this four year old lab/ridgeback mix is unstoppable, all fixed up, and smarter than ever! Sam is a big boy and has a lot of energy, but he listens to his humans and commands great! He is trained in basic obedience and fully potty trained. He enjoys long walks anywhere, visiting the dog park, and soaking up some sun rays! He’s a very good boy if you’ve got the space for him, and he deserves the perfect companion!If you like what you’re hearing, Sam would definitely like to meet you! Fill out an adoption application at www.misfitmuttsdogrescue.com and let’s give Sam a happy ending! Any questions or concerns can be emailed to misfitmuttsdogrescue@gmail.com.

Hello everyone Van Gogh here! I came up from a rescue in Texas with Shiloh's Road to Hope. Not a lot is known about my past and I'd like to leave it that way, a fresh start! I'm 6 years old and a little overweight, but my friends at SWCHS are great at sticking to my diet and getting my steps in. People weren't very kind to me in my younger years, but I don't let those people slow me down! I love people of all ages and hanging outside in the sun watching the world go by with my dog friends at my side. There are a lot of us right now, so I get to play with all ages from puppies to the older ladies. If you're interested in meeting me or have any questions please call or stop by the shelter, thank you. Love Van GoghPerks of adoption:Spay/NeuterCurrent Vaccines 30 Days of Pet Insurance Microchipped$10 BowWow Meow Gift CertificatePetco Discount Book Unconditional LoveIf you are interested in an animal, please visit www.swchs.com to fill out an online adoption questionnaire or submit a contact form.

Bailey is a young, female, large Shepherd mix dog. She made the trip up from Texas with Lola's Lucky Day to find her forever home in Wisconsin. We did not get any information on her personality, but she is a very friendly, happy girl. She had lots of fun exploring our dog yard! Stop in to meet Bailey this week!The Dodge County Humane Society is open Tuesdays and Thursdays 12-7 pm and Saturdays 12-4 pm. Fostered in Sheboygan county area Penny, is a 1yr old sweet female spayed Yellow Lab/mix from Texas. She loves hanging out with her foster friends, running, playing tag, chasing the ball, chewy toys, or just a quiet moment of rest. She is crate trained, and doing great on home training! She weighs about 53lbs. She is utd on her shots including microchipped, and spayed. Her fee is $250.00 She is living in the Sheboygan county area. She loves people, gets along with dogs, and just tries playing with the cat. If your looking for a great young companion she would be the one! If you'd love to meet her, then go to www.lastpawrescue.org and fill out an application and ask for Penny. She's watching her friends go, and wondering when it'll be her turn to go to her forever home. Please help us find Penny, her forever home!!501(c) Approved Wisconsin agriculture license # 285589-DS

In honor of Flag Day, now through July 15th, our Red, White and Woo Hoo Adoption Promotion has returned! My adoption fee will be waived with a donation of 50# or more of Purina Puppy Chow.Hi, my name is Gypsy! I am a Red Heeler/Corgi that came up to Wisconsin from Texas! I was born around 5/4/2017 and weigh 19 #. I can be a little hesitant in new situations but bond quickly to my person.  I was adopted for a while but didn't want to share my new person with their other dog.  I'll be happiest as a lap dog in a quiet home with one on one attention.  I'm afraid of car rides so while I get used to moving around more, it will be best to crate me in the car.  In the home, I liked sleeping on the couch, dog bed or in my crate.  I like to roll on my back for belly rubs and am always up for cuddling. I will sit for a Beggin Strip but otherwise do not care much for treats. A good chew bone is appreciated though!  A lot of noise and commotion scare me, so no small children please.  But, if you have a quiet life and want a lap dog for a companion, I'm your girl!  Apply for me today!My adoption fee is $75.00. Adoption applications can be filled out at CCHS or online through our website, www.cchs-petshelter.org. Applications are not first come, first served. All applications will be reviewed by the adoption committee and the home chosen will be the one considered to be the best match. All dogs and puppies have been vaccinated for Distemper and Bordetella, dewormed and microchipped. If old enough, they will be vaccinated for Rabies and blood tested for Heartworm, Lymes, Anaplasmosis and Erlichiosis. Dogs and puppies will be spayed or neutered before adoption.CCHS is proud to be a No-Kill Humane Society. As a private, non-profit charity, our work depends on donations and volunteers to keep going. We are committed to helping the animals that enter our doors and finding each the best possible forever home. CCHS has been inspected and licensed by the Department of Animal Health - DATCP. Our license is #268235-DS

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.REDUCED ADOPTION FEE- $175Meet Nala. Nala was saved from a kill shelter in south Texas, the shelter has a less than 50% survival rate. Once saved we found out she had been pregnant the whole time, she has since given birth to 11 beautiful puppies, who are all now big enough to be on their own and weened. Nala is a laid back easy going dog, she LOVES kids and is very sweet. She takes a little bit to warm up to new adults but once she trusts you she is an amazing dog. Nala needs a home with someone willing to work with her, as she is very scared of new ppl and protective of her home. She loves people once she has a chance to warm up, and will become very loyal to her new family. She needs consistency and some training to learn that strangers are okay. Her current foster is working with her and training her to learn that she can trust new people, but it will be an ongoing journey when she gets adopted. Please share Nala and help her find her forever, she deserves it.Breed: Heeler mix.Age: 2-3Size: mediumWeight: 40-44 lbsUp to date on vaccines: yesDewormed: yesHeart worm tested: NegativeFixed: booked for June 6-7Health Certificate: YesMicrochip: yesLocation: Wausau/ Antigo, WiGood with Kids: yesAdults: yesHousebroken: yesCrate trained: yesGood with dogs: yesGood with cats: yesAdoption fee: $175ADOPTION APPLICATION!https://www.holsterrescue.com/forms/form?formid=4882Application info:When you fill out an application, please e-mail us this additional information to us at holsterrescue@hotmail.com with the name of the person on the application:photo IDproperty tax statement: if you own your homepictures of where the pet will be: sleeping, eating and playing.How it Works:(1)If you are interested in a one of pets, then go tohttps://holsterrescue.rescuegroups.org/forms/form?formid=4882 and fill out an application.(2) Send pictures to holsterrescue@hotmail.com with the name that is on the application, of where the puppy/dog Cat / Kitten is going to be sleeping, eating and playing.(3)If you own your home you are also going to have to provide proof of home ownership like a property tax bill.(4)If your application is approved, we will be in contact with you to set up a time for you to come, meet the pet, and go home with the him/her if you want.If you're interesting in filling out an application, you can find them on our website at http://www.holsterrescue.comContact us:To contact us please e-mail: holsterrescue@hotmail.com we reply as soon as we can. Hi ya all,I am from Texas and I am loving this Wisconsin weather!! My foster mom says I am awesome. My favorite thing to do is sit in her lap and show her my beautiful loving eyes. My second favorite thing to do is romp around with my foster sister. I was a bit of a slow starter as I was pretty scared and not feeling so well when I arrived here. Howerver, after a week I am doing soooo much better. My foster mom says I have to work on my first impressions, because I don't do too well at that and they definatley don't tell you who I am. I love to snuggle and give little kisses. When I am scared I might not be the perfect southern gentleman, but trust me I will get there. In just 7 days my foster mom said I made an amazing transformation!! Oh and I am potty trained too!! I also am crate trained, I cry when I am in there, but i keep it clean. Come on, what are you waiting for, come and down and check me out!!

Meet Xena. ??Xena was saved from one of the highest kill shelters in south Texas. The shelter she came from had a only 32% survival rate on canines last year. Xena has a severe case of luxating patella in one of her back legs so she cannot use the leg. She has been evaluated by a vet and surgery is not an option on her leg due to age. Her leg is not causing her pain and amputating the leg is the absolute last resort and would only be done if the leg was causing her pain- which it is not. Her leg makes her special needs, as she cannot walk up steps, walk distances, and will need special help getting outside to potty, or will need to use puppy pads. Sammi(Samet) came to us from Thailand where she lived at en elephant sanctuary until being flown here in late 2016. She's been fostering with the same Underdogs foster ever since and they think she's just a sweet, sweet doll! When she first arrived in the U.S., she would hide under the couch or bed all day and only come out at night, but she's improved about 1000%. She really likes familiar situations, places, dogs, and people. (For instance, she LOVES her dog friends.) Walks and car rides are still a bit spooky, but she makes strides every day. She loves cuddling in bed at night, and does NOT like being crated. In short, Sammi is a sweet, gentle, timid lovebug who is searching for her very patient and understanding forever home.Underdogs Rescue has partnered up with the Elephant Nature Park in Chiang Mai, Thailand to help save some of the 400+ dogs they have living on the sanctuary. While most of these dogs have come to the park following natural disasters or from situations some of us couldn't even fathom, these dogs are full of heart and ready to begin a new life in the US with a family to love them!! More information about ENP can be found on their website here: http://www.elephantnaturepark.org/ Help us help them by fostering or adopting one or more of these sweet babies looking for a new life!Sammi is spayed, up-to-date on basic vaccinations and microchipped.Our Underdogs adult dog adoption fee is $300, which includes spay/neuter, microchip, and up-to-date vaccinations.If you're interested in adopting Sammi, please fill out an adoption application here:https://underdogsrescue.org/adopt-form/Underdogs is a small volunteer-based animal rescue and we unfortunately do not have the resources to respond to phone and email inquires about our adoptable animals at this time. If you're interested in learning more or setting up a meeting with one of our animals, please complete an adoption application first. It may take up to two weeks for application review and one of our coordinators will reach out to you as soon as we are through the intitial review process. We appreciate your patience and understanding! Thank you!

Opie is a two year old, male, neutered Cattle Dog type mix rescued from the streets of Thailand by the Soi Dog Foundation. Many of the Thailand street dogs end up in the horrific dog meat trade in China. He is a sweet and gently guy that is good with other dogs and kids. He is a bit shy in new and scary situations but with some good confidence boosting, he will be a proud boy.

Norky is a one year old, male, neutered Cattle Dog type mix rescued from the streets of Thailand by the Soi Dog Foundation. Many of the street dog are rounded up and brought into China for the barbaric dog meat trade. He was rescued when he was seen running the streets with a snare embedded in his foot. The locals use snares to control the street dog population. Lucky for Norky he was picked up in time that he didn't lose his foot,. He has some permanent damage to his foot but it doesn't stop him. He is a happy, outgoing and social boy that is good with other dogs and kids.

Cedric was rescued from the streets of Thailand by the Soi Dog Foundation. Cedric is a five year old, male, neutered Thai street dog. Most street dogs end up in the disgusting dog meat trade in China. Cedric was one of the lucky ones! He is a great boy, social and outgoing, good with kids and dogs. As with all streets dog, they may need some time to adjust to being family pets. They are very eager and quick to pick it up!

Barney is a 6 year old, male, neutered Husky type mix rescued from the Soi Dog Rescue in Thailand from the streets. He is a gentle, well mannered boy that is low key, good with other dogs, cats and kids.

Hi My Name is EMMA and i am 5 years old elegant  FEMALE LAB/SHIBA INU MIX with a gorgeous tan colored coat weighing a medium weihgt of 43 pounds full grown I am extremely gentle and love to be with my person and give hugs and non aggressive with humans or calm animals I originally came from Thailand where I was rescued from the Illegal Dog Meat Trade so my rescuers cant believe how sweet I am after all I have been thru, and I do not hold a grudge against humans  In fact I will give you sweet kisses. ..I am house trained completelySpayed with all my shots and even have a microchip Please copy and paste this this link and fill out and hit SUBMIThttps://poshpetsrescueny.org/dog-application/

Hello, my name's Jamai, and I was rescued from the dog meat trade in Thailand. Because they were raising me to be a meal, and not a pet, I didn't have much socialization in my early life. As a result, I'm pretty nervous when I meet new people but I have been working with the training staff here and have learned that people feed me cheese! YUM! I also love to play with other dogs and really come out of my shell when I'm with another dog. I'd do best in a home with another dog who is confident and can show me around. I'd love to go home with you if you've got the patience to continue the training I've been getting and to from the humans in my life, as I learn to love people and have lots of good experiences. Meet me at Animal Haven!

Hello there, I'm Ping! I came to Animal Haven all the way from Thailand where I was rescued. I didn't have the best start to life there and I'm pretty shy when I meet new people. I've had a lot of training here at Animal Haven and I'm learning that new people are good and give me cheese! YUM! I'm just the sweetest boy and I really like other dogs. I would do best in an adult only household that is pretty quiet and has another confident dog to help show me around. Come meet me at Animal Haven!

Jomo was rescued from the dog meat trade in Thailand. Due to the lack of early socialization, he can be a little shy when meeting new people. He's warmed up quiet a bit since arriving at Animal Haven, but will need a home that is quiet and patient and willing to continue working on the training he's started at Animal Haven. Jomo also gets along well with most other dogs and would do best in a home with a confident, friendly dog.
Ophelia is a 3 year old beauty rescued from the meat trade in Thailand.

Sweet little Erin is an 8 year old female, spayed, Thai Ridgeback mix rescued from the streets of Thailand. You can tell she hasn't had an easy life but she's the sweetest little girl. Very petite and gentle

Hi my name is Jessica (aka Jessie) and I am a sweet 8-year-old female Border Collie/Cocker spaniel  mix weighing 28 pounds with an awesome black fur coat that doesn’t shed.After being rescued from the illegal dog meat trade in Thailand in 2016 I was brought to Posh Pets. The people here are great and I have adjusted pretty well, however I would love to find that forever couch I can call my own.At the first meet I may be a bit scared and defensive with you and I may show an ugly side that I am not proud of, but once we get to know each other you will see that I am really a sweetheart. I need that special someone that can give me their time to help me overcome my fears.My foster mom understood me, and I loved it when she rubbed my belly till I fell asleep on her bed (did I mention I don’t shed). She also took me in the car when she was running errands around town ( I do love a good car ride). I never beg for food and when it’s time for walks I do one wicked happy dance!Another way I like to pass my time is playing with my chew toy and chasing balls. I also have a BFF Boxer Pittie mix who is an alumnus of Posh Pets and lives nearby, when I was at the foster home we would take long walks together and play in his backyard.I am housetrained, easy on a leash, hardly ever bark and spayed with all my shots. I hope you can find a place in your home and your heart for me, you won’t regret it!Please fill out this application by copying and pasting link into your browserhttps://poshpetsrescueny.org/dog-application/

Hi My Name is BELLA and I am a gentle, sweet 5 year old FEMALE SHIBA INU MIX with a gorgeous White and Cream colored coat. I am full grown and petite, weighing just 38 pounds.I was lucky to be rescued from the Illegal Dog Meat Trade in Thailand and am grateful for a second chance.  Despite my less than ideal start to life, I hold no grudges against humans and in fact am NON-AGGRESSIVE and love to give hugs. My foster mom says I’m very low maintenance as I am completely HOUSE-TRAINED and can entertain myself for hours playing and throwing my squeaky toy up in the air.  I also think car rides are fun.I would love to be part of a family that understands that I am cautious when it comes to unexpected noises, big cities, and young children. I can be a bit shy when meeting new people, so I might hide behind my foster mom when you first come visit. But please give me a chance, and come visit me a few times; I promise to be your most loyal buddy once I get comfortable (just ask my foster mom!).I am living in a foster with another DOG and CAT and I get along with the dog and ignore the cat, so will be okay in a home with either or both types of fur siblings (but not with young humans).Please fill out this application by copying and pasting link into your browserhttps://poshpetsrescueny.org/dog-application/

This dog is a part of our Summer $25 Adoption Fee Promotion! In an effort to keep up with the high rescue demand this summer, we are discounting many dog adoption fees to $25! Note- standard adoption screening interview and reference checks still apply!COME MEET ADOPTABLE DOGS EVERY SATURDAY AND SUNDAY from 10AM - 4PM at the Homeward Trails Adoption Center- 11116 Fairfax Station Road, Fairfax Station VA 22039! **Note that puppies are in foster homes, not at the Adoption Center.In an effort to save more lives, HT is allowing expedited adoptions for certain animals if applicants bring required paperwork. You can bring your new family member home more quickly by bringing your current pets' vet records, a copy of your lease or landlord letter stating you are permitted to have pets, and photos of your home. Help us help you adopt more quickly!If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out our dog adoption questionnaire and e-mail it to adoptioncenter@homewardtrails.org.PLEASE VISIT THIS WEBSITE TO FIND THE ADOPTION QUESTIONNAIRE: http://www.homewardtrails.org/adopt-a-pet/adoption-forms/Jayla was rescued from the meat trade in Thailand. Jayla is super loving and loyal. She is housetrained and sleeps nicely in her crate at night. She loves to go for walks, and really likes hanging out on decks and watching squirrels. She would be happiest as the only dog in the home, but may be able to live with another super laid back dog. She will bark at visitors coming into the house. She bonds super strongly to her person and will follow them around the house and lay by their feet. She is calm in the home and really just wants to be near you.Adoption Coordinator: Homeward Trails Adoption CenterBreed Estimate: Terrier MixGender: FemaleApproximate weight: 33 lbsApproximate age: 4 years Location: Homeward Trails Adoption CenterCratetrained: UnknownCoat Type: MediumPersonality: Sweet and friendlyThe adoption fee for this dog is $25. This fee INCLUDES spay/neuter and microchip. If the animal you are adopting is not already spayed/neutered, you will be required to sign a contract legally obligating you to have the animal altered. Please contact your HT rep to learn about exclusive low-cost spay/neuter options made available only to HT adopters!Every adopted Homeward Trails animal comes with 30 days of free pet health insurance. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals.Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter.We also provide a 30-minute phone consult with a professional dog trainer at Fur-Get Me Not within the first 30 days of adopting - just for HT adopters in the Arlington/Alexandria area. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE!You can save animals like this one by becoming a foster! Fosters are like way stations between high kill shelters and forever homes. We need fosters so that we can save dogs before they are euthanized at the shelters. If you are interested in becoming a foster, please check out our information about fostering by visiting http://www.homewardtrails.org/foster-a-pet/dog-and-cat-foster-program/

***Chemelea is a courtesy posting for Willow's Wings Animal Sanctuary in Endicott NY, and they will make all decisions about Chamelea's placement.  To apply for Chamelea, fill out an online application at http://cayugadogrescue.org/wp/adoption-process/ and the rescue folks will forward it to Willow's Wings!  My name is Chamelea and I was rescued from Thailand!  Quick factsBreed:   Shepherd mix (with JRT or Beagle?) Gender: Female, spayedAge: 4 years oldSize:  Medium (50-55lbs)Good with…..Dogs:  Yes, most dogs! Cats: Nope, sorry!Kids: 13+HistoryI have been through quite a bit in my 4 years!  I landed in a very crowded shelter in Thailand, knowing there was something not right with my back legs.  I struggled to get around and I was in a lot of pain.  Thankfully some kind people stepped in and rescued me!  They were wonderful to me!  They gave a nice place to rest, and plenty of food and water but they realized that I needed more help with my injuries, so they contacted Willow from Willow’s Wings Animal Sanctuary and she agreed to take me into her adoption sanctuary!  I was put on a plane and flew half way around the world.    Who knew that a shelter dog would end up as a world traveler!!!  I landed in snowy New York where Willow and her fur friends welcomed me with open arms!  They took me right away to the Cornell University Vet Hospital where a team of veterinarians discovered that my kneecaps were displaced.  Ack!  Big problem, but they promised me that they would make me good as new., which as you can imagine, was quite a relief to hear!  It meant I would be able to do things I’ve always dreamt of doing, like running and playing, and not being in pain all the time!  I had two surgeries which meant an awful lot of recuperating time resting in my crate, but  I didn’t really mind, I knew it would be all worth it.  My legs are all healed up now and I am as good as new!  I can finally enjoy life to its fullest and no pain!  There is only one thing missing…….a home of my very own.  But everyone promises me that they will find me a fabulous forever home sometime soon!!PersonalityHere are some fun facts about me:I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE belly rubs!  I will happily roll on my back and enjoy belly rubs for as long as you would like to give them!!I really enjoy a good squeaky toy!  I will also happily play with balls!  I like to “talk.”  Some may misunderstand and think I am talking in Wookie or mistake it for grumbling or growling, but I promise you, that is how I talk, and I love communicating with you!  When I want attention, I like to use my feet to get you to pet me. Haha!  I am gentle about it, it’s kind of adorable and hilarious I am told, it’s my way of asking “please pet me, scratch me, love me!”I have some random moments of silly playfulness, but in general I am pretty laid back and I am perfectly happy lounging around the house chilling!Currently, some say I am a bit on the “fluffy” side (aka, a teensy bit overweight), but that’s how it goes when you are recovering from major surgery and are forced to be in a crate for long periods of time ( I may or may not have watched a lot of Price Is Right and enjoyed some snack foods during my recovery time!!).   I have overheard some people talk about a diet and exercise plan.  I’m in, let’s go! I love to go for walks!I enjoy going for leashed walks.  I walk nicely with a martingale collar.  My people tell me that I am secure wearing one of those.  And I like the thought of being safe and secure.  We won’t be able to go for long walks due to my knee limitations, but I like short walks!  I prefer to take walk in calm, peaceful places.  Busy streets or parks are not really my thing, that would make me uncomfortalbe.  And dog parks….oh my..no thank you, way too busy and too much going on!Let me tell you one very important thing about me.  While I am very (very!) loving and affectionate to those whom I love and trust, I am still quite cautious and nervous when meeting new people and when in unfamiliar situations.  And I very much prefer when things are calm and quiet.  I would love to meet calm, patient, and understanding people that will allow me to shine at my own pace.  It takes me time to become comfortable with new things.  The very best thing you could do for me when meeting me would be to sit on the floor, and kind of ignore me (staring at me would make me nervous), and just give me time.  Wait for me to come to you.  Perhaps toss some yummy treats in my direction, but then just sit there and read a magazine and give me some time.  When I do approach, move slowly, speak softly, and don’t reach out toward me, just let me come to you while you stay where you are. And  if I back away, please don’t get discouraged, I’m simply not ready yet.  This may take some time, but please be patient with me… I promise you I am well worth it, and once I get to know you, I am the most lovely wonderful girl you could ever hope to find.  My rescue folks says I need a home with a securely fenced in yard and I would have to agree.  I do like feeling safe and secure.  I could play and explore with you in yard, that would be fun!  Another fantastic way for us to bond!I should also mention… I am a bit of a celebrity!  “The Dodo” did a story on me.  It’s a lovely story about my journey up to this point.  It has over 64,000 views on youtube!!  You should really take the time to check out my story, you can find it at:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=orsMz-fTR1wCohabitationI need a very special adopter.  I am seeking calm, caring, understanding, positive, and patient people.  Someone who is gentle and nurturing and patient and sweet.  Experience with shy and cautious dogs would be a huge bonus.  I would not do well with inexperienced people.  Ideally I would love to find a home with a person or persons that have a calm, quiet, laid back lifestyle.I might enjoy sharing a home with a quiet, well-mannered dog friend.  I have done best with male dogs--sometimes I like to be in charge, and sometimes other dogs (especially other females) do not appreciate that type of lady.  If you do have another dog, I would for sure be willing to meet up.  Perhaps we could go for a nice walk and get to know one another!  Hopefully we would hit it off great.I have never been around children.  I hear they can be quite active and sometimes make lots of loud sounds and zip around, which isn’t a fit for me.  I like things calm and on the quieter side, so I feel that the best fit for me is home without children or high activity.  Cats you ask?  Very sorry, I seem to like to chase, so probably would not work for me to live with cats.  MedicalI have had two major surgeries on my hind legs to repair my displaced kneecaps.  My rescue mom and Cornell have all of my paperwork.  They will be happy to share that with you.  I get around like a champ now!  I love short walks but should not do long walks/hikes and should not go jogging or do things that require jumping (like agility).These are a few of my favorite things...Squeaky toys!        Balls!        Belly rubs!         Ear scratches!Waving!     Talking!      Short walks!      Napping in a cozy place!    Basking in the sunshine!SummaryI am such a very special girl and I have so much to offer.  All I need is a little patience because I can be shy with new people and new situations, but once we have a chance to get to know each other, I will be the most loving, sweet, and loyal dog you have ever had. I’ve been waiting so long for the right person.  Come and meet me please!***Chemelea is a courtesy posting for Willow's Wings Animal Sanctuary in Endicott NY, and they will make all decisions about Chamelea's placement.  To apply for Chamelea, fill out an online application at http://cayugadogrescue.org/wp/adoption-process/ and the rescue folks will forward it to Willow's Wings!

NAME: ABIGAIL SPENCERAGE/GENDER: 5 YEAR OLD MALEBREED: THAI STREET DOGWEIGHT: 40-50 lbsTEMPERAMENT: SWEET, FRIENDLY, AFFECTIONATEHOUSE TRAINING: LIVED OUTSIDE SO NEEDS MORE TRAININGCRATE TRAINING: NOT CRATE TRAINEDOTHER DOGS: GETS ALONG WITH OTHER DOGSCATS: UNKNOWNCHILDREN: Dog-respectful children, 8 and olderADOPTION DONATION: $400HEALTH: ABIGAIL is spay/neutered, microchipped, flea treated, dewormed, and is current on vaccines. Your adoption donation goes toward the cost of this vet care as well as other incidental costs of care. In addition, all pets adopted from Motley Zoo come with a free 30 day trial of free pet insurance provided by 24PetWatch.HISTORY: Motley Zoo Animal Rescue was asked by our friends Soi Dog Foundation to find ABIGAIL a great forever family and that is exactly what we plan to do!NOTES FROM FOSTER HOME: ABIGAIL SPENCER is a Thai street dog who comes from a shelter in northern Thailand. She is brand new in our care so we are still getting to know her! More information coming soon!All dogs adopted from Motley Zoo come with a leash and Martingale collar (or a harness, if necessary), depending on each dog's particular needs. We also send home additional flea treatment and deworming medication for your future use.ABOUT MOTLEY ZOO:Motley Zoo Animal Rescue is a volunteer run, foster based, 501(c)(3) non-profit animal rescue organization based in Redmond, WA. Motley Zoo does not have a traditional shelter location, but instead, utilizes private foster homes which care for the animals individually, in a home environment, until a \"furever\" home is found.Motley Zoo also runs \"Rock Star Treatment\" Dog Daycare & Training Studio in Redmond, WA which is a day-use facility and does not hold kennels of adoptable animals. The dogs there are owned animals who come to the facility while their families are at work and school so they can play and socialize in a safe environment. We dub this service our \"Year-round\" fundraising program which helps us support our rescue animals and the $15,000/ month vet bills we incur. This Studio location does have an Adoptable Cat Lounge, where cats may live until adoption, which is the exception to any aforementioned rules.Please email adopt@motleyzoo.org and request an adoption application so we can get you started on the journey to finding a new, furry friend! Once you have been approved to adopt, then we can set up a meeting with the animal you have been matched with.For more information, please visit www.motleyzoo.org.Thank you for considering adopting a dog in need!Woof,The Motley Zoo Crew

Dandy is a Thai Mixed breed, approx. 45 lbs,and around 4 years old in Thailand.  He is neutered,  UTD vaccines, and  microchipped.  Dandy is a very friendly, handsome and loyal boy.  He is good with other dogs but tends to prefer the females.  Dandy came from a temple in Thailand where he used to live with other dogs, cats and people.  He loves kids but has not been tested with cats in a home environment.  This boy is pretty relaxed at home and just adores cuddles,  Adoption requirements: home owner with a secure fenced yard, and you must be in a position to offer a lifetime home.  Tell us about your family, current and past pets, and the environment in which he would live.  Include a home phone number

NAME: Olivia HusseyAGE/GENDER: 4 yearsBREED: Terrier Mix (Thai street dog)WEIGHT: 45 lbs lbsTEMPERAMENT: Sweet, quiet, inquisitiveHOUSE TRAINING: Good.CRATE TRAINING: Thai dogs are from the streets are not used to crates. They prefer access to the home or being in a room behind a baby gate.OTHER DOGS: While she lived in Thailand with other dogs, she does prefer to be on her own. She tends to avoid other dogs and will grumble when they get in her face. If they keep their distance, she will ignore them. She would do best in a home without other dogs and get more confidence training.CATS: She's a little too friendly and curious. No cats in the home would be best.CHILDREN: Dog-respectful children, 8 and older. Olivia is wonderful with people.ADOPTION DONATION: $400HEALTH:Olivia is spayed, microchipped, flea treated, dewormed, and is current on vaccines.She is a tripod (3 legs). Her leg was amputated due to a dog fight and a severe wound to her leg. This certainly does NOT slow her down- please check out her videos, which show exactly how nimble she is!She does have a luxating patella in her hind limb, which would mean she should forgo strenuous hikes; however, is amenable to leisurely neighborhood walks.Your adoption donation goes toward offsetting the cost of her vet care as well as other incidental costs of care.HISTORY: Olivia came to us from Phuket, Thailand from Soi Dog Foundation.NOTES FROM FOSTER HOME:Olivia is the sweetest happiest dog and is quick to greet you with a tail wag and likes to follow you around the home or lay next to you on the bed or couch. While she does prefer to be in your presence she's not an intrusive dog, nor overly needy and in your face. In all, Olivia is pretty quiet and inquisitive as well as respectful.She looooooves watching tv and especially nature shows! If she hears David Attenborough's voice she comes running. She follows all the action and gets really invested. Sometimes it's like being in a live version of Mystery Science Theatre ;) She also likes watching animated movies with dogs and pretty much anything else that's on.She likes toys to chew on and is happy to share them with you- as well, she's treat motivated. She also knows to go to the \"right\" part of the yard to do her business reliably.While she does tolerate environments where there are other dogs in close proximity, she would probably prefer to have a home and family of her own- especially as the loss of her leg was due to a dog attack. Understandably, there is a certain proximity that she is comfortable with and if dogs persist in invading her space, she will grumble and may snap as a warning. She has done nothing beyond this, but we also don't want her pushed- and while she is who she is in many ways, she would still benefit from more confidence building and socialization where she has many positive experiences to help her overcome the negative ones she remembers.Olivia is a fabulously friendly, sweet dog with all people, she just needs some space form other dogs- and is a little too interested in cats...we know there are plenty families looking for an easy going, sweet, adult dog to welcome into their home!Here's another video to check out:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ViheZv3MtC4&feature=youtu.beAll dogs adopted from Motley Zoo come with a leash and Martingale collar (or a harness, if necessary), depending on each dog's particular needs. We also send home additional flea treatment and deworming medication for your future use.ABOUT MOTLEY ZOO:Motley Zoo Animal Rescue is a volunteer run, foster based, 501(c)(3) non-profit animal rescue organization based in Redmond, WA. Motley Zoo does not have a traditional shelter location, but instead, utilizes private foster homes which care for the animals individually, in a home environment, until a \"furever\" home is found.Motley Zoo also runs \"Rock Star Treatment\" Dog Daycare & Training Studio in Redmond, WA which is a day-use facility and does not hold kennels of adoptable animals. The dogs there are owned animals who come to the facility while their families are at work and school so they can play and socialize in a safe environment. We dub this service our \"Year-round\" fundraising program which helps us support our rescue animals and the $15,000/ month vet bills we incur. Once you have been approved to adopt, then we can set up a meeting with the animal you have been matched with.For more information, please visit www.motleyzoo.org.Thank you for considering adopting a dog in need!Woof,The Motley Zoo Crew

Meet Jonas from Thailand who is joining us all the way from a non-profit in Thailand called Soi Dog Foundation. They rescue dogs from the dog meat trade and other deplorable places that have terrible conditions. Jonas is a wonderful Male 9 month old Shepard Mix at 26 lbs. He is smart, sweet and affectionate, happy go lucky and he likes to play. He is very friendly and loves people of all ages, gentle kids and other dogs, but has not been around cats before. His adoption fee is $ 795. and it covers her spay/neuter, shots, rabies, bordetella, deworm, vet bill and airline transport from THAILAND to SEATTLE. Soi Foundation requires a GPS Tracker for every dog that comes to the USA for $ 65 including one year of wireless service you can monitor on your cell phone. On all overseas adoptions our pet rescue dog trainer will be required to come to your home and help train with your new dog for only $65.which is half price.The adoption fee is firm and helps cover the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals and more. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501 C 3 Organization.

Meet Charlie!  This beauty was rescued from the streets of Tunisia where her life was nothing but torture and abuse.  (The picture of her in the wooden box is when her rescuers first got her off the streets).  Even though her life before now was horrible, u would never know it. Charlie remains loving, sweet, loyal, and happy.  She adores children and loves to jump on her hind legs to dance :) She is great with other dogs and totally ignores cats.Adoption fee is $500 and includes health exam, deworming, up to date vaccine, microchip, spay, bloodwork, 4DX test, and 30 days of free pet health insurance.Applications can be found on our website www.RDRanimalrescue.org!

Mia and her sister, Mitzi, were relinquished to The Chance Foundation as their mommy is dealing with some serious health issues. The family is devastated as they love these dogs very much. We promised them that we would do all that we could to make sure their dogs find wonderful, loving homes. Mia is from Tunisia. She resembles a retriever mix. She is very sweet but also very timid. We are working with her to help build her confidence. Mitzi is a 9 year old Dachshund that lived with Mia. She is an outgoing, friendly, comical, social girl. We will be providing updates as Mia begins to come out of her shell. Their whole world has been turned upside down but we are hoping that eventually we will find a very special person to take them into their hearts and home.

Meet Hale from Turkey. He is set to fly to the U.S. in June. He is a neutered Anatolian Shepherd mix tripod. He was hit by a car when running from some kids that were throwing rocks at him and lost his back left leg as a result. Despite having three legs he runs just as fast as his four legged friends. He does not let it slow him down at all. Hale is kid, dog and cat friendly. He is a little shy at first but warms up quickly. Please message us if you can foster/foster to adopt this handsome boy!All dogs receive vet care before adoption, including spay/neuter, age appropriate vaccinations, Heartworm/Lyme/Ehrlichia 4DX snap test, deworming, flea/tick/heartworm prevention, and microchip.  Indoor homes only and we expect all dogs to be family members.  Adoption fee applies and adoption application required.

Meet friendly, happy, and our most playful girl-Sumaya! This awesome and affectionate greyhound mixed with border collie (?) is as sweet as can be.  Sumaya is small at only 45lbs, but she is sturdy and will make a great adventure buddy.  We can see her next to you on the trail or at the park, she wants to go anywhere you go! She is so smart and is working on perfecting her leash skills and basic commands. She is crate trained and house trained and is quiet and calm in the house.  Sumaya has been tested with other greyhounds and does great- but we’ve not had her around other breeds or kids. Sumaya will need a home without cats and is not suitable for an apartment/condo/townhome.  She will need a home with a six-foot fence.  This awesome babe was rescued from a shelter in the United Arab Emirates and we are so glad we did!  Sumaya is spayed, vaccinated and micro-chipped. Just wait until you see those gorgeous brown eyes!  Her adoption fee is $350. To meet this energetic and tons of fun 3 year old, email Kathy at kkreyling@yahoo.com.  She’ll be waiting for you at Greyhound Pets, Inc. with her fairy godmothers in Woodinville.

Meet the cutest little greyhound mix, Salma!   Two-year-old Salma weighs only 40 pounds and has the coolest and most affectionate personality.  She just LOVES people! Salma is sweet, playful and so loving.  Salma is vocal and is all about the conversation with dogs and people-she loves to talk! She always wants to know what is happening next!  Salma loves adventure and will make a terrific exercise buddy. She will need an active home and loves being out and about.  She does ok with other dogs, but she prefers to be around humans and adores all people. Salma needs a no-cats household too as she is a greyhound! She loves attention and Salma wants the focus on her! She is all about Salma and is such a fun and friendly girl.  Plus she is way too cute, with her curly fluffy tail!!!  She is spayed, micro-chipped and completely vaccinated. Salma is not suitable for an apartment/condo/townhome.  She wants and needs a fenced yard over 6’ please! Salma was rescued by Greyhound Pets in Woodinville all the way from the United Arab Emirates.  She is available to meet at Greyhound Pets, Inc in Woodinville. Her adoption fee is $350.  Please contact Kathy at  kkreyling@yahoo.com.  Adorable and so deserving Miss Salma knows that her long trip to the northwest was worth it when she meets her truly wonderful forever family!

Rita is a gorgeous hound/something mix (maybe Mastiff), 82 lbs., who needs someone to help her overcome her shyness, which is why she is labeled as \"Special Needs\". She has a lovely temperament and will follow you from room to room, but she is insecure, so she needs a patient person to allow her to trust again. Rita does very well with other dogs of all kinds- she is submissive around other dogs. Not tested with cats yet. She is quiet and gentle in all circumstances that we've seen and should blossom into a really nice dog with a little time and patience. Can you be that person for her? If you are interested in giving Rita a home of her own, please submit an application at our site at www.PeisandStrays.com and click on \"Adoption Application\". PLEASE NOTE: Rita is located in a foster home in Vermont. Rita is spayed, current on basic vaccines, and microchipped.

Joe is a young foxhound mix from Virginia. He is 3 - 4 yrs old and weighs about 40 lbs. Joe came into the shelter with two female foxhounds.  He is friendly and gets along well with other dogs.  He is a typical happy hound. He is playful and active and walks well on a leash. Joe is being fostered in NH and is available for visits.About our rescueWe are a foster based rescue. Our dogs are in foster homes throughout the area or in some cases in the south waiting to be transported north. We do not have a physical shelter. However, meet and greets are set up for approved applicants.Our Adoption ProcessVisit our website www.necoonhoundrescue.org for information about the Coonhound and Beagle breeds. Read ‘Is a Coonhound Right for You’. Send an email to iwantahounddog@gmail.com with the answers to the questions on the adoption application tab.One of our Adoption Counselors will be in touch to review your application. Once the phone interview is completed, we will check your vet reference as well as a personal reference and conduct a home visit.

Buster is a sweet senior who doesn't hear as well as he used to. He was pulled from a shelter in Virginia where he was found as a stray, but was never claimed. He is very friendly with people and dogs. He loves attention and tends to bulldoze his way through the other dogs to get to his human. Not at all in an aggressive way. He just wants to soak up alll the attention now that he knows how great it is! He's very loving and pretty mellow.  He doesn't have a big prey drive. He came across a ground hog and just sniffed him and walked away. He walks well on a leash and is about 9 years old. Buster will arrive in Massachusetts at the beginning of July.About our rescueWe are a foster based rescue. Bilbo is a senior beagle from rural Virginia. He is estimated to be about 8-10 years old and weighs about 22 lbs. Bilbo is shy, but is making strides coming out of his shell. He is very sweet and pretty mellow. He is quiet and loving. Bilbo would do fine living in a condo or apartment, with some walks during the day, but would love a fenced in yard where he can run around. He is friendly and does well other dogs and cats. From his foster mom, Bilbo has that look that just melts your heart. He is a timid little guy who just want someone to love him forever. Bilbo is so sweet & doesn't have a mean bone in his body, loud noises scare him so he would love to be with someone who is home a lot & maybe another dog around his age and size would be great. He slowly warms up & comes out of his shell with a little time and patience. He is a joy to have around & he is very easy to take care of. He's mellow and loves to lie around. Bilbo is here and available for visits.About our rescueWe are a foster based rescue. Our dogs are in foster homes throughout the area or in some cases in the south waiting to be transported north. Ricky is a sweet, friendly beagle from Virginia.  He is about 5 years old and weighs about 35 lbs. Ricky is very loving and enjoys attention. He is great with other dogs and cats. He has beautiful Bluetick markings. Ricky is a mellow guy. He enjoys walks and walks very well on a leash.  He is working on house training and will need an adopter who can be patient and help him master it. Ricky is here and available for visits.About our rescueWe are a foster based rescue. Bruce is a handsome 1 yr old redtick coonhound from Virginia.  He's friendly with new people and loves to play with other dogs.  His foster in Virginia describes him as a sweet, goofy, lovable hound who bonds quickly to people. Bruce crates well.  He weighs about 45 lbs.  Bruce is being fostered in the Boston area and is ready for visits.About our rescueWe are a foster based rescue. Tinker is a pretty redtick coonhound from Virginia. She's 2 - 3 yrs old and weighs about 45 lbs. Tinker is very sweet. She can be a little tentative at first and is not a real high energy coonhound. She is still getting used to all the sights and sounds of a household. She gets along well with other dogs and would probably be okay with cats. Tinker is doing her business outside at her foster home. She is here and is ready for visits.About our rescueWe are a foster based rescue.
