Big boy, big heart, big Barry! Barry is a gorgeous Saint Bernard mix that transferred to us from a shelter in West Virginia.  We are still getting to know this kid but one thing is very clear, he's a love! This boy has no idea how big he is and wants nothing more than to suggle up and give you his big ol' paw!

This gorgeous girl is Charlotte, a 5 year old, mature, Tree Walker Coonhound.  After retiring from her demanding hunting job in rural West Virginia, Charlotte is happy to kick back and relax in the Virginia Country side.  She has learned to appreciate the finer things in life like a warm fluffy bed, a full belly, and lots of fun walks.  Since her arrival, Charlotte has learned to walk beautifully on a leash.  She enjoys going on walks so much that we would prefer to adopt her to a family that would enjoy taking her for frequent, long walks. Charlotte is still new to indoor life and may need some guidance when she first goes to a new home. However, with time, patience and love we know Charlotte would make a wonderful companion for any family.

JaLynn and her 5 puppies were pulled from a shelter in WV - they are all very healthy, friendly, social and playful!  Pups should mature @ 15-20 lbs. The mother appears to be a Miniature Pinscher \"Min Pin\" mix, the father is unknown but puppies should stay smaller size.   They are up to date on vaccinations and worming for their age.  They are @ 7 weeks old now and will be available when they are 8 weeks old.  They are required to be spayed/neutered when they are old enough (6-8 months old).   Perfect smaller companion dogs for a person, couple or family!

One year old Lucy was recently transferred to our shelter from a shelter in West Virginia. Fun- loving Lucy loves toys and going for walks. This high energy girl needs an active home where she can run and play. Since coming to the shelter she has been spayed, micro chipped and vaccinated. Lucy loves meeting new people won't you stop by and meet this lovely lady today?Antietam Humane Society8513 Lyons Road Waynesboro, PA 17268717-762-9091/ Fax 717-762-0996www.antietamhumanesociety.org

Three year old Lexi was transferred to our shelter from a shelter in West Virginia. Lexi does good with other dogs and cats and is very treat motivated. She may need some basic training but has a warm disposition and really just wants to play and give kisses. Since coming to the shelter she has been spayed, micro chipped and vaccinated. She went out into a home for a short while but it did not work out. It seems that Lexi may have difficulty hearing and may be deaf. She would be better in a home without young children. Lexi is ready to lead a fun filled life and is looking for her forever family. Might that be with you?Antietam Humane Society8513 Lyons Road Waynesboro, PA 17268717-762-9091/ Fax 717-762-0996www.antietamhumanesociety.org

Hey y'all I'm a beautiful young lady looking for a furever home. I came all the way from West Virginia and am pretty nervous about life. I am a mama to 3 pups. They recently sent my babies off to their new lives, Now it is my turn to start anew. I would love someone to work with me and continue to grow me out of my shell. I  have come a long way from terrified and crying to even the slightest touch to almost full pets on the couch. My foster mama caught me playing with some toys which I have become to really enjoy. Meal times makes me the happiest! I will sing with joy and hop around. Because I'm so nervous about human contact and leashes freak me out I haven't been able to start potty training but I figured out the potty pad deal pretty well.Adoption donations are $250 for an adult, $350 for puppies (a dog under one year of age), and $125 for a senior dog (based on the age of the dog). All dogs are spay/neutered, have rabies, distemper vaccine, microchip, heartworm test if age appropriate, and are current on heartworm preventative. Adoption donations are accepted via cash or debit/credit card. There is a $5 fee to run a card.Please remember to bring a collar and leash with you the day of the adoption. Fill out an application online prior to arriving to our adoption event. This greatly speeds up the adoption process and will ensure that the animal you are interested in will be at the event. Not all adoptable dogs can make it to all events, because they are cared for in foster homes. Our adoption events are normally held from noon until 4 PM on Saturdays at 3602 Lafayette Blvd, Suite 102, Fredericksburg, VA 22408. There are circumstances that we will not have an adoption event, so please email or check our Facebook prior to coming to ensure we will be open. We do receive HUNDREDS of emails daily. The fastest way to get a response is to fill out an application on our website, NOT by submitting an inquiry. Online applications get priority over applications filled out in person.Visit our website for an application to adopt.  olddominionhumanesociety.orgPlease be patient. Old Dominion Humane Society is a volunteer based organization. We are run completely by volunteers, who also have full time jobs and families.Like us on Facebookwww.facebook.com/OldDominionHumaneSociety and follow this dog's journey in finding a forever family.Old Dominion Humane Society adopts to Virginia and the immediate surrounding states. There is a $50, out of state fee.

Looking for low key? Looking for mellow? Looking for a walking, hiking partner? How about a 4-legged friend to hang out with while binge watching your favorite show on rainy days?Meet Sarge (aka Ranger). He’s a beautiful, 6 years young coonhound, Adoptable Sarge has been waiting some time to find his forever human and we don’t know why!Sarge is: •Happy•Housebroken •Calm•Great in the house•Playful •Affectionate•Handsome (he’s a purebred walker coonhound)•Great with medium to large dogs and kids age 10 and up•Not a destructive chewer•Quiet •Loves walkies•is neutered and fully vetted•Has a good amount of energy, great jogging partner, great hiker, outside he’s very energetic•Will bark if someone is at the door•Will follow you room to room when you’re homeWhat’s not to love?Sarge does require a fenced in yard where he can do his sniffing. No cats please.Sarge came from rural West Virginia where he was chained outdoors 24-7 on a thin wire to a cinder block inside a small chain-link run with a makeshift doghouse full of frozen dirty towels (that he couldn’t even reach). Sarge is looking for a strong minded, dog-savvy owner who will enjoy him for the good ole hound companion he is. A home with medium to large dogs or no dogs only. He’s housebroken, good in crate, getting better on leash with a front clip harness, knows sit, down, shake. He’s a good dog, great with medium to large dogs and happy to be with or without them. Older kids only and no cats please.Sarge is neutered, UTD  on vaccinations/preventatives, dewormed and microchipped. Meet him in person at Save the Tails' weekly adoption events Sundays at DogGone Natural Leesburg VA 1-4pm, and the second and last Saturday of each month at DogGone Natural in Ashburn VA 12-3pm. Email adopt@savethetails.org for questions/enquiries, or visit our website at savethetails.org.

ARTBAR dogs are fostered in WV.We only adopt to these states: southern/eastern PA, MD, northern NJ, and CTDonate ONLY at http://www.artbar-wv.org/donateVOLUNTEER!http://www.artbar-wv.org/volunteer/1Now available for direct adoption to residents of these areas:OUR ADOPTION COVERAGE AREA:Southern or eastern PA, NJ north of I-78, MD, and CT.Adoption Application: http://form.jotform.us/form/52365486683164AJ & Alley are not bonded. They have been in paid boarding since last year when Doc passed away. They deserve better than to live out their lives in boarding! Rescue needed!Currently located in boarding in WV but can be transported to our partner rescues in northeastern states or to adopters who live in the areas above.They are good with each other but not so good with other dogs. That's what they told us at Doc's but the guy who runs the boarding facility has said he hasn't had any problems with them and other dogs. We can do a dog test video upon request.12/11/17: Owners chained up and moved away. Local resident unchained. At some point someone notified Jessica and they were caught and brought to Doc’s. They were emaciated and starving but are fat and happy now. Good with each other but allegedly questionable around other dogs. The dogs they had issues with at Doc’s, some of them aren’t friendly, so we’d have to eval in detail if you’re interested. Currently living in boarding. Young, 1-2 years and about 55 lb each. Not bonded. Do not need to go together. Greeted Trish during her visit as happy wigglebutts.AJ & Alley are fine with each other but can be questionable around other dogs, so it's best that they be fostered or adopted as single pets or together with each other. They are not bonded and can go separately. They weigh about 50-55 lb each and are about 1-2 years old. Solid fenced yard required.8/20 - Gained weight nicely. Still stuck in boarding due to no foster or kennelspace available, so unsure if good with other dogs. Foster or rescue needed!7/15/17: Left on an abandoned property to starve. Currently at vet's office.A Reason To Believe Animal Rescue, Inc.http://www.artbar-wv.org

Still stuck in boarding due to no foster or kennel space available, so unsure if good with other dogs. Foster or rescue needed!7/15/17: Left on an abandoned property to starve. Currently at vet's office.A Reason To Believe Animal Rescue, Inc.http://www.artbar-wv.org

Ruger is a 1 yr old mixed breed that weighs 70lbs. He came to us as an owner surrender from West Virginia. With his large head and goofy personality, we suspect he may have some sort of bully breed in him.Ruger is a happy-go-lucky dog who gets along with other dogs, cats and loves kids. Ruger is house and crate trained and enjoys lounging around in the backyard with his foster dad. He gets very excited to meet new people but settles down quick. He seems scared on walks and of new things so needs someone willing to work with him as he gets familiar with new situations.Ruger's adoption fee is $300. Meet and greets can be arranged for approved adopters.

Booten is a fun boy! He is happy to meet new people and very eager to please. He is about five years old, and 54 pounds. Booten was pulled from a pound in West Virginia and brought to us via another rescue. He is happy, healthy, and couldn't be any cuter! Booten is treat motivated, so he is easy to train and already knows some basic commands. Please come see this sweet boy and fall in love just like we did! Booten is at One of a Kind Pet Rescue 1929 W. Market St., Akron, OH 44313.

Fancee, also known as Fannie D (for fancy dog) came from a shelter in West Virginia.  We think she's about four.  She is a quiet, petite girl.  She has not been cat tested.  She’s great with people.  She loves to make a nest out of her bed.  She listens very well and is a people pleaser.  She literally does nothing wrongFor more information on Fancee please email suew@boxertransfer.org

PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COMRiley is a darling male chihuahua who recently came to us from rural WV with two others.  He is a nice dog who loves people but who is not really interested in other dogs.  Perhaps another nice dog would help him to gain dog-social skills.  He appears to a younger aged guy, maybe 4-5 years old.  We believe he is housebroken though we cannot guarantee that.Riley is in good health.  He has been thoroughly examined, given his vaccines and blood tests, been neutered and microchipped.  Riley would make a great addition to families who have no other dogs or who may have another dog that is of very even temperament.CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

Meet Kal, a 1 and a half year old Red Merle Australian Shepherd male who weighs areound 35 pounds. Kal is up to date on all his shots and is neutered and HW Negative. Kal is housebroken as well.Kal is a bit of a project as he arrived as a timid and semi reactive fellow to strangers and stress situations. We felt his age was in his favor to rehabilitate. He currently spends his days on a farm around horse and visitors. He has improved greatly, having bonded with the farms main employee. Kal has also taken to the resident Border Collie and looks to her for his clues next.Kal is taking obedience classes and has won awards for most improved, he knows basic commands and is working mostly on social skills and realizing the world is not a bad place to fear.If you feel that Kal is an Aussie you can help continue his traning and social skills we encourage you to complete an application today and we can begin the discussion on Kal.Kal is located in Wisconsin.

God bless America.  She was relinquished to our shelter on April 1 by a couple that really didn't know much about their dog so trying to find her a forever home, let alone writing this bio, was tough.  They stated she was hyper.  They also stated she came from Wisconsin and the couples parents recently returned her to them in Shelbyville.  She lived with children ages two months, twins that are ten, a twelve and thirteen year old.  When in our meet and greet room she acted like she had never seen or played with a toy before and that is when she would really turn on the charm.  Since she hadn't been vetted since ???? she was a great candidate for Vet Tech Institute.  We thought America found her forever home, but she's a bit of an odd duck and was unpredictable with the woman's boyfriend.  From  quick adoption from Vet Tech we learned a bit more about America.  Fans of Bull Terriers we rarely get them at our shelter, although her coloring we feel she is a mix.  She is spayed, microchipped through AVID, current on rabies and all vaccinations, wormed and tested negative for heartworm.  We think America would do best in a home without other pets and her fee has been waived.  Questions about America, the beautiful, email me anytime at cbrowder@cityofshelbyvillein.com or call your compassionate shelter team at 317-392-5127.  Thank you for your support of us and what we do, save lives.  God bless, chris b

\"Hi, I'm Teddy!Teddy is a mature (almost 10) Shih Tzu released from a commercial breeder in Wisconsin. He loves other dogs, a perfect lap dog who loves to snuggle. Teddy is good with children although still a little shy. Teddy is learning to be a dog. He is learning to walk on a leash. Currently he is not housebroken but we're working on it and he is catching on. He doesn't mind wearing belly bands.Teddy would make a great companion dog for a quiet home, and also appreciates stretching out on the lawn , soaking in sunshine.My adoption fee, including MN state taxes, is $214.55. I'm available to adopt within a 50 mile radius of the Twin Cities of Minneapolis/Saint Paul.To submit an adoption application, please clickhereto fill out an online application.

Alphie Jo was my best friend’s dog (my aunt). Her wishes before she passed away was for him to live with her closest friend Linda in Pennsylvania. Our family made the arrangements for Alphie Jo to fly out from Wisconsin to PA 3 years ago. Linda was also my aunt’s best friend, a dog lover like you’ve never met, and she owns a rescue as well.Unfortunately Alphie Jo did not do so well living with her male dogs so she decided it was time to put him up for adoption through her rescue. He went in and out of two homes and was back at her rescue. I spent a lot of time in Wisconsin...taking care of my aunt and Alphie Jo. I formed a bond with him through a difficult time. As a dog lover, I couldn’t bear another moment of hearing him “being returned”. Last December I made the decision to take him to my home in Lafayette, NJ. He is still with me, and I wish it could always remain that way. But I have learned he cannot be around other pets no matter the size, species, or gender. He needs a home that fits him.Alphie Jo is a 6-year-old English Coonhound - he is up to date on his shots. Here is more information about him:-He cannot live with any other pets. He is unpredictable in that sense.-He has been around children of all ages however we would feel more comfortable with him being with older, experienced children, if children at all.-He is better suited in a country setting.-He howls when he wants food, water, needs to go “potty”, greets new friends, sees a stray cat outside, sees deer or bears (amazing protector for you when it comes to bears!)-He is NOT a hunting dog although his nose says otherwise.-He hates the rain and snowfall. I have a special coat for him on those days but doesn’t always work!-He loves to cuddle as close as possible to you. He’s a sleeper and definitely enjoys his sleep!-He loves to sleep under blankets-He needs an experienced dog owner-He is better with a fenced-in yard however, I don’t have one. It takes a lot more work to handle not having a fenced in yard but it can be done.Alphie Jo is NOT with Eleventh Hour Rescue but we are helping his owner with the rehoming process. If you have a situation where Alphie Jo would thrive and be safe & you'd like to meet him, please contact Stacey at samiller76@me.com or at 973 271 0856.
